Palate: Sherry soaked, aged fruit cake, with warm baking spices, creamy vanilla, and a dusting of dark chocolate.
Finish: The spices build, with dried prunes lingering.
Nose: Sticky dried vine fruits and figs, with dark caramel, oaky vanilla, and a touch of liquorice.

Name: Glengoyne 10 Year Old
Palate: Barley rich, more bourbon influence. Clean and dry.
Finish: Long, barley rich, touch of hoi sin.
Nose: Slightly herbal, big bourbon influence which has brought a wonderful "high note". White milk bottle sweets, more creamy than fruity.

Name: Glen Grant 12 Year Old
Palate: More rich, sweet red apple notes. Golden barley in the background.
Finish: Touches of almonds last on the finish.
Nose: Orchard fruits open it up, with orange and apple. A touch of pastry and a dusting of icing sugar.

Name: Deanston 15 Year Old Tequila Cask Finish
Palate: An array of toasted nuts, hints of marzipan, and vanilla are joined by cooked apple, while sweet notes of caramel and agave drift throughout.
Finish: Drying baking spice and burnt sugar join zesty candied orange, cinnamon, and biscuity malt.
Nose: Vibrant notes of tropical fruit, vanilla cream, and caramelised nuts.

Name: Scallywag 10 Year Old
Palate: Soft oak arrives on the palate, shortly followed by maple syrup, blueberry muffin and chocolate cake.
Finish: Prune, hazelnut cream and clove.
Nose: Coffee bean, raspberries, buttered scones.

Name: Dalmore King Alexander III
Palate: Medium, rounded. Winter berries, spice, zesty orange. Liqueurs emerge; Grand Marnier, kirsch and Frangelico.
Finish: Peppery with well-integrated oak and the claret makes a last minute appearance.
Nose: Malty and utterly Dalmore. Seville orange zest, Parfait Amour, malty cereal, barley and chocolate. Creamy vanilla fudge, tropical fruit with a vaguely vinous quality.

Name: King's Inch
Palate: Vibrant fruit notes remain at the fore, with pineapple and orange joining the mix. Subtly chocolatey at points.
Finish: Buttery vanilla, cinnamon, a smidge of clove, and caramel.
Nose: Crisp green apple and pear notes, wrapped up in layers of vanilla and subtly toasty oak.

Name: Benriach The Smoky Ten
Palate: Cinnamon, ginger and dry smoke, shortly followed by maple syrup and peach.
Finish: Waves of fresh vanilla, salted butter and toasted barley.
Nose: Toasted coconut, aromatic smoke and a touch of greengage.

Name: Teaninich 19 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Floral at first - almost vegetal at points. Soon enough, the sweet baking notes from the nose return in full force.
Finish: Honey, pear and hints of fresh barley.
Nose: Hazelnut spread on rye bread, buttery croissants and fizzy oak spices.

Name: Speyside 29 Year Old 1992 (cask 1408830) - Tenet (Heroes & Heretics)
Palate: Sponge cake with strawberry jam, savoury malt, toasted oak, and orchard fruit.
Finish: A long finish, with creamy vanilla and oak spice.
Nose: Blackcurrant jam, sweet coffee, hazelnuts, and ginger.

Name: Michter's US*1 Straight Rye
Palate: Dried orange peel and stem ginger, followed by brown sugar, cherry, hickory, cumin and buttered corn.
Finish: New leather, caramel, cinnamon, peppercorn, apple.
Nose: Werther's Original, dry wood, plenty of spicy rye notes, a hint of blackcurrant.

Name: Commando Spirit Whisky
Palate: Fresh apricot and raisin, with a drizzle of toffee and a slow build of smoke.
Finish: Orange peel, vanilla fudge, and a little almond
Nose: Grassy smoke, dried fruit, golden barley, and vanilla.

Name: Glenmorangie The Accord 12 Year Old
Palate: Raisins, dates, hazelnuts, milk chocolate, butterscotch, a pinch of cassia, espresso, marmalade on toast.
Finish: Drying and malty, with sultana sweetness remaining.
Nose: Vanilla fudge, strong coffee with hints of cherry underneath, apricot and liquorice.

Name: Jack Daniel's Single Barrel (cask 21-07906) (Master of Malt Exclusive)
Palate: Cinder toffee, cedar, buttered toast, cracked black pepper, dried cherry.
Finish: Brandy snaps and custard creams, with some fruity esters lingering.
Nose: Treacle tart and runny caramel, with balancing hints of cinnamon and nutmeg, plus a solid core of oak.

Name: RyeLaw Fife Single Grain Scotch Whisky
Palate: Black pepper, allspice, ginger, and some star anise, with sweet hay, and apple crumble.
Finish: Rye spices linger, with sweet shortbread.
Nose: Layers of vanilla caramel and warm oak are joined by heaps of spice, and some earthy herbs.

Name: Waterford The CuvÃ©e
Palate: More citrus, now slightly sweeter with grapefruit and orange. Honeyed cereals, caraway, and a subtle savoury hint of olive.
Finish: Oily barley lingers on the finish.
Nose: Earthy barley with hint of freshly baked bread and melting butter. Cooked orchard fruit, vanilla blossom, and lemon zest.

Name: Oban Distillers Edition - 2022 Collection
Palate: Subtle sweetness, with creamy grain, more fruit, drizzles of salted caramel, and some peppery spice.
Finish: Peppery spice builds, with green oak.
Nose: Light sea spray, with some gooseberry and white peach, along with toasty oak spice.

Name: Jameson Black Barrel
Palate: Thick and full on the palate, with an intense, unctuous creaminess, alongside dates, walnuts and peels. Good peach and coconut notes, and a little cinnamon.
Finish: Long finish, and very fruity with notes of cinnamon and nutmeg and hints of potpourri.
Nose: Rich and fruity with notes of tropical fruits, coconut, nectarines in yoghurt, guava and a thick core of sweet cereals.

Name: Mortlach 16 Year Old
Palate: Mature oak from the outset, joined by prune, clove, macadamia nut and a slight touch of baked earth.
Finish: Lingering oily walnut and chewy raisin notes. More ginger appears later on.
Nose: Gingersnaps and orange peel, with hints of roast chestnut, apple and blackcurrant pie and quince.

Name: Mac-Talla Red Wine Barriques
Palate: Dark cherry chocolate and hefty peat smoke lead, with clove spice and dense, sweet oak.
Finish: Zesty orange peels and flamed fruit creep in, with coastal embers, damp peat, and salted almonds.
Nose: Wild strawberries, tangy raspberries, smoked herbs, and bonfire ash.

Name: Bowmore 25 Year Old
Palate: Characteristic  peat smoke, cocoa and dry, creamy nuttiness.
Finish: Gentle smoke, oak, mocha, hints of prunes.
Nose: Dark fruits and coastal smokiness. Slightly herbal.

Name: Jack Danielâs Bonded
Palate: Muscovado sugar, cooked apple, vanilla fudge, and ginger.
Finish: Woodsmoke, marmalade, and cinnamon swirls.
Nose: Orange peel, luscious vanilla, toasted oak, and plenty of rich caramel.

Name: Jameson Crested
Palate: Through creamy vanilla and a malty element, there are helpings of gentle sherried fruit, coconut and honey-toffee sweetness. Apricot and peach melba emerge with a touch of milk chocolate among spiced nuts, peppery mint and prickles of pot still spices.
Finish: In a long finish, thereâs warming honeyed sweetness, mild drying oak spice and a hint of sherry-scorched wood.
Nose: A luscious sweet aroma of maple butter leads with plenty of chalky vanilla and caramelized sugars. Complex Irish pot still fruitiness is present too, with bitter citrus, apple skins and marmalade. Ginger and clove add spice and warmth underneath with a touch of roasted nuts.

Name: Tomintoul 16 Year Old
Palate: Notes of boiled sweets, espresso, mochaccino, ground almonds and granary toast with melted butter. Vanilla fudge and thick cream.
Finish: The finish is of good length with notes almond and barley sugar.
Nose: Medium-bodied and punchy. There are notes of stemmy cut hay and dried grasses, a leafy green note and a touch of rooty earth and fudge.

Name: Smoky Scot
Palate: Maritime notes of iodine, seaweed and tar, with smoke swirling on the palate. These notes fade into floral layers, alongside toasted seeds and malt.
Finish: Alongside smoky peat, a hint of menthol on the finish with a slight maltiness remaining.
Nose: Woody, distinctly salty and of course oodles of smoke.

Name: Aberfeldy 12 Year Old with Gold Bar Tin
Palate: Sweet, malty, a gentle peat but nonetheless the mouth feel is very clean. Vanilla, peaches in cream and subtle oak.
Finish: Ginger, malt, nutty nougat and maybe a little grapefruit zest.
Nose: Creamy. Some sherried fruit with a trailing hint of smoke. Prune, custard and espresso bean.

Name: Masthouse Single Malt (Double Pot Distilled)
Palate: Creamy, with a full cereal texture, some peppery alcohol, you can feel the ABV. Smooth and round with porridge, chocolate digestive biscuits and that citrus peel note again.
Finish: Vanilla comes through strongly with oatcakes and custard.
Nose: Apple and peachy fruit with cereal notes like malt and oats, with vanilla, cinnamon, marzipan, and a lift of lemon peel.

Name: Mackmyra Limousin
Palate: Milk chocolate, almond, crisp pear, subtle ginger and peppercorn spiciness.
Finish: White grape, lemon cheesecake, toffee.
Nose: Vanilla and honey, with red berry and prune slowly building.

Name: Cask Islay (A.D. Rattray)
Palate: Fresh orange and honeyed barley notes, surrounded by peat smoke. Quite oily. A hint of crumbly sea-side fudge glows in the centre.
Finish: Sweet apple and light smoke lasts on the long finish.
Nose: Rich peat, candied orange peels and a light breeze of coastal air.

Name: Mortlach 20 Year Old
Palate: Clove and brandy butter arrive first, before chewy dates, orange peel, mature oak and Hobnob biscuits.
Finish: Lasting Christmas spice and a touch of cooked summer berries.
Nose: Roast chestnuts and tobacco, swiftly joined by dense chocolate and red berry richness. Just a whisper of meaty malt underneath.

Name: Port Askaig 100Â° Proof
Palate: Zesty lemon and lime, paired with ground cumin, Smiths Bacon Fries and a touch of apple juice.
Finish: Rather long and enjoyably soot-y.
Nose: Earthy smoke rises first, shortly followed by smoked meats, citrus peels and a heaped spoonful of brown sugar.

Name: Ledaig 9 Year Old  Bordeaux Red Wine Cask Matured
Palate: Full and spicy with black pepper, ginger and black cherries, with lingering smoke and cured meats.
Finish: Long salty finish with sweet fruits lingering.
Nose: Sweet tawny Port-like notes on the nose with sea breeze and bonfires.

Name: Glenfarclas Heritage
Palate: Apple pie filling, buttered bread, green melon and butterscotch sweeties.
Finish: Warming and peppery.
Nose: Mint leaf, polished oak, malty vanilla and a pinch of cinnamon.

Name: Auchroisk 12 Year Old 2009 - Storm (Fable Whisky)
Palate: White chocolate, peppercorn, sherbet lemon sweeties, still subtly grassy.
Finish: Drying spiciness, with a smidge of oak.
Nose: Cut grass and subtle floral heather hints, with creamy fragrant vanilla over the top.

Name: Jack Daniel's Single Barrel - Barrel Strength
Palate: Dried fruit (raisins and apple slices), cigar box, cinnamon and cedar.
Finish: Peppery, though with enough caramel to balance the heat.
Nose: Oak spices, honey, a whiff of smoke, walnut.

Name: Millstone 25 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: The palate is a powerhouse, with more aromatic spice as well as flavours of marmalade, nectarines, and bramble fruit. Thereâs hints of creamy vanilla, Manuka honey, and sherry-drenched dates here too.
Finish: It's graciously long, as well as drier, earthier, and darker than the palate.
Nose: Rich and intense with black fruits, leather-bound books, orange rind, and all manner of sherried spice. Thereâs a hint of vintage port in here too.

Name: Robert Burns Single Malt
Palate: Fruity and rich, vanilla, pannacotta, apple and lime peel.
Finish: Apple strudel and cinnamon on the finish.
Nose: Apple peels, a little pear juice, hints of coconut and apple blossom. Develops with custard and cinnamon.

Name: Chivas Regal 18 Year Old
Palate: Winter spices and malt on the palate with barley, Seville orange marmalade and oak.
Finish: The finish is spiced and warming with oak and cinnamon.
Nose: The nose offers marmalade and malt, a hint of custard, coconut ice and nutmeg.

Name: Port Charlotte 9 Year Old 2011 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Hearty helpings of peat smoke and herbaceous iodine lead, followed by the nutty, fruity sweetness of Bakewell Tart. Floral malt and oaken vanilla murmur in the distance.
Finish: The vanilla comes to the fore with sticky treacle, though coastal bonfire smoke remains centre stage.
Nose: Cinnamon swirls and caramelised biscuits, hazelnut chocolate, with mellow leather in tow and pipe tobacco in tow.

Name: Burnt Oak 24 Year Old Blended Whiskey
Palate: Drying wood smoke and charred herbs, chewy peat, and the burnt edges of dark chocolate cake. A touch of tart yellow plum arrives, joined by honey-soaked figs, before prickles of pepper and sweet, milky coffee develop.
Finish: Roasted coffee beans, meaty malt, and nutty oak char bring warming, savoury spice, with lingering earthen bonfire ash.
Nose: Sweet robust peat makes a pungent first appearance before the earthy notes give way to vanilla butterscotch and crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e. Fresh apricot leads to creamy fromage frais and gristy rice pudding, with bitter orange in tow.

Name: Smokehead Rum Rebel
Palate: Enjoyably savoury and briny at first, but once again, tropical fruit and cola cube sweetness attempts to wrestle control.
Finish: Waxy orange and vanilla, with the final smoky embers of a beach bonfire.
Nose: Clear Islay smoke arrives first, with a touch of seaweed in there, before hints of BBQ pineapple and fresh mango develop.

Name: Jack Daniel's Tennessee Travelers - Bold & Spicy
Palate: Plenty of rye spice coming through, tamed by creamy corn, sweet barley, and vanilla, layered with pepper, allspice, and stewed orchard fruits.
Finish: The rye spice lingers alongside oak char and yet more vanilla.
Nose: Drizzles of caramel with warm, oaky vanilla, and spicy gingerbread.

Name: Deanston Virgin Oak
Palate: Toffee sweets pop up first, followed by a dollop of cream and oak notes.
Finish: Oak spices on the finish.
Nose: Fresh citrus, honeyed barley and a subtle hint of smoke.

Name: Starward Projects - Ginger Beer Cask #7
Palate: Warming fresh ginger alongside more mellow, candied ginger, drizzles of vanilla syrup, and tropical fruit.
Finish: Baking spice, with sticky gingerbread.
Nose: Yep, plenty of citrussy ginger, with waxy orange peel, and cocoa nibs.

Name: Caisteal Chamuis 12 Year Old
Palate: Still has a coastal edge to it, though mellowed by vanilla and plump sultana notes.
Finish: Lasting earthy, peaty notes on the finish.
Nose: Roast chestnuts, chocolate digestives, dried cherry, savoury smoke.

Name: Springbank 15 Year Old - Rum Wood
Palate: Tangy at first with tropical fruit juice, before savoury waves of smoke bring balance to the palate.
Finish: Lasting peppery oak and a touch of honeycomb.
Nose: Grassy peat followed by fried banana and stem ginger.

Name: GlenAllachie 11 Year Old 2011 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Bold spice welcomes the way with prickles of clove, anise, and green peppercorns, soon softened by all the creamy, buttery caramel from the nose, along with milky coffee.
Finish: A hearty warmth remains, vanilla buttercream and barley sugar bring mellow sweetness, while fiery chilli flakes and ginger build beside butterscotch and oak char.
Nose: Creamy dulce de leche, vanilla ice cream, and wafers, with a spicy touch of oak followed by a touch of sawdust and toffee popcorn. A savoury note of sourdough is also apparent.

Name: Glen Grant 15 Year Old Batch Strength
Palate: More citrus, now paired with banana chips and dried apricots. Subtly nutty, soft Christmas spice notes developing.
Finish: Milky tea, ginger, green apples, and peach.
Nose: Lemon meringue, biscuits, bread dough, dry oak, and brown sugar.

Name: Edradour Ballechin 10 Year Old
Palate: Chewy dates and oak, with smouldering peat bringing spicy heat to the palate.
Finish: A hint of ash sticks around on the finish.
Nose: Oily malt, whiffs of burnt ends and BBQ char, a few touches of apple and fig.

Name: Jack Daniel's 100 Proof Bottled-in-Bond Tennessee Whiskey
Palate: Green apple and fried banana, paired with maple syrup and punchy black pepper.
Finish: Oak and toffee stick around on the finish.
Nose: Cooked fruit dusted with cinnamon, toasted brown sugar and almond.

Name: Wolfburn Morven Single Malt
Palate: Nutty malt pairs well with soft smoke, joined by peppered oak and caramelised fruit developing later on.
Finish: Sweet hints of shortbread and ginger stick around on the finish.
Nose: Fresh notes of juicy apple and white grape are deliciously juxtaposed with earthy, mineral-y peat.

Name: Paul John Mithuna
Palate: Oily texture with rich, dried stone fruits and soaked sultanas, wafts of creamy coconut cross with cardamom and oak spice.
Finish: Rich figs and sweet dates with dark cocoa, more vanilla, and lingering oak tannins.
Nose: Floral and fruity with bold toasted oak, baking spices, and bourbon barrel vanilla.

Name: Kavalan Solist Vinho Barrique
Palate: Kiwi and a delicate blend of citrus fruits burst. Pepper is also present in the background waiting to be noticed.
Finish: Clean and complex hints of chocolate and ripe fruit.
Nose: Vanilla and caramelised sugars with dark chocolate on top. Ripe melon and mango.

Name: Tomintoul Seiridh
Palate: Christmas cake richness, supported by toasted pecan, toffee and a just hint of spicy clove.
Finish: Red liquorice, coffee, butterscotch and flamed orange remain.
Nose: Nutty barley and soft red berries, with a touch of mocha underneath.

Name: Jura & Dailuaine 12 Year Old - Double Barrel (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Fruity at first, with white grapes and fresh peach, before richer notes of toffee and a touch of cigar box.
Finish: Dry kitchen herbs and some vanilla custard sweetness.
Nose: Toasted nuts, caramel and a little hint of heather honey.

Name: Benromach 21 Year Old
Palate: Notes of stewed orchard fruit, chocolate-covered raisins and Seville orange marmalade are followed by hints of set honey, praline, red berries and gingerbread. In the backdrop, thereâs cracked black pepper, tangy oak and smoke from a smouldering bonfire.
Finish: Sherry tones lead the finish, with a hint of buttery toffee apples, oak spice and fruitcake.
Nose: Deep Oloroso sherry comes through, with stewed plums, raspberry jam and juicy sultanas initially followed by hints of Pinot Noir, orange peel and dried apricots. Vanilla, toasted brown sugar, milk chocolate and aromatic ginger spice appear underneath with sweet peat warmth throughout.

Name: Oban 10 Year Old (Special Release 2022)
Palate: Lively, very spicy, liquorice, cardamom, cloves, and orchard fruit. Highly aromatic.
Finish: Long with tobacco and mint.
Nose: Sweet-smelling, vanilla and toffee, with red cherry and cardamom.

Name: Talisker Storm
Palate: Thick and mouth-coating with wood smoke, brine, some tin and chilli heat too.
Finish: Red chilli peppers and oak dryness with a hint of embers.
Nose: Initial brine, but not as abrupt as the 10 Year Old, quite creamy by comparison. Banana. Banana angel delight? Window putty, hint of sticking plasters and barbecues, citrus. White pepper develops towards the bottom of the glass.

Name: Glencadam Reserva AndalucÃ­a
Palate: Some creamy influence alongside stewed apple, treacle toffee and plump raisin.
Finish: More brown sugar returns, with green oak and maple syrup in support.
Nose: Baklava, honeyed orchard fruit and vanilla pod, with melted brown sugar and cinnamon.

Name: Four Roses Small Batch Bourbon
Palate: The palate is much fuller with a lovely balance. There are notes of manuka honey, winter spice, toasty oak, a little crÃ¨me anglaise and thick fruit.
Finish: The finish is of good length with a resurgence from the crÃ¨me anglaise.
Nose: The nose is quite subtle and smooth, there are notes of winter spice and buttered granary toast with thick honey. There are hints of cut flowers and dry hay.

Name: Knob Creek Straight Rye
Palate: Traditional rye spiciness, rich and mouth-coating, but not as overpowering as some other rye whiskey. Instead, there's more development of the vanilla, brown sugar and soft butter notes.
Finish: Drying oak, white pepper and rye spice last on the finish.
Nose: Rich caramel, bright ginger and lingering menthol hints, with more herbaceous touches developing with the robust rye notes. A good core of oak spice, too.

Name: Widow Jane 10 Year Old
Palate: Earthy vanilla pod, salted caramel, dried cherry, sandalwood.
Finish: An enjoyably oiliness lingers, balanced by brown sugar.
Nose: Buttered rye bread, cigar box, butterscotch and mince pie filling.

Name: CÃ¹ BÃ²can Signature
Palate: BBQ char, cooking spices and Conference pear initially, followed by orange peel and hints of leather and espresso.
Finish: Muscat grapes, light smoke and a little nuttiness.
Nose: Dry and fragrant, with woodsmoke, dried lemon peel and a little vanilla, then orchard fruit and heather honey, with a touch of liquorice.

Name: Knockando 12 Year Old
Palate: Cadbury Fingers, brown bread with butter, sultanas and honeydew melon.
Finish: A slow build-up of cinnamon and black pepper.
Nose: Banana chips, honey'd barley and a few fleeting floral flourishes.

Name: Glen Moray Elgin Classic
Palate: Oak, gentle. Well balanced, walnut, grist. Citrus, lemon sponge.
Finish: Tangy citrus, spicy fruitcake.
Nose: Light, fresh. Grist. Nutty, floral. Dried grass. Slightly fruity.

Name: Timorous Beastie
Palate: Dried fruits, green apples and anise. Sweet grist and malt loaf. Pebble beaches and more heather on the mid palate.
Finish: Long. Drying with hot cinnamon sweeties and fresh bread.
Nose: Acacia honey, creamy boiled sweeties (the strawberry flavour), dried apricots and white grapes. There's a good whack of Sherry influence in here too! A whiff of coastal air and classic Highland heather, too.

Name: The One Colheita Cask Finished
Palate: Soft peaches, ripe plums, and grilled stone fruits lead to dollops of vanilla cream and a touch of clove.
Finish: Cinnamon and aromatic spices bring a warming finish, while the soft fruits and buttery vanilla stick around for balance.
Nose: Sweet notes of apricot pastries and fruit crumble, with sprinkles of ginger and distant wood smoke.

Name: Glencadam 20 Year Old 1999 (cask 1) - Pedro XimÃ©nez Sherry Butt Matured
Palate: More dried fruit, now with a little crystallised ginger bringing some heat. Crumbly fudge and liquorice, too.
Finish: Juicy red grapes, buttered toast and gingerbread.
Nose: Buttered malt loaf, brown sugar and sultanas.

Name: Penderyn Rich Oak
Palate: Spiced apple cider, generous vanilla, toasted barley and waxy peels.
Finish: Banana fritters, more honey, subtly floral as it dissipates.
Nose: Honeyed cereal and tangy tropical fruits (think mango and papaya). A whiff of old oak furniture hangs around in the background.

Name: Black Bottle Island Smoke - Alchemy Series
Palate: Oatcakes, seaweed, salted caramel, cardamom, red chilli flake.
Finish: Lingering salty sea breeze.
Nose: Toasted cedar, earthy peat, subtle toffee and cinnamon hints.

Name: Ben Nevis 1998 (bottled 2021) (cask 1367) - Berry Bros. & Rudd (Master of Malt Exclusive)
Palate: Macadamia nut, gingerbread, marmalade, a slow build of peppery malt and toasted bread.
Finish: Fragrant oak and a dollop of treacle.
Nose: Blueberry muffin, Ryvita with salted butter, a little hint of dried strawberry.

Name: Jack Daniel's Tennessee Whiskey Legacy Edition 3
Palate: Orange zest, cereal sweetness and toasty oak, with a little spice and toffee.
Finish: Smooth and soft, with a hint of banana milkshake.
Nose: Butterscotch, vanilla and fresh apples.

Name: Lagavulin 12 Year Old (Special Release 2022)
Palate: Positively crackles with black pepper, sweet toffee, and smoky wood.
Finish: Big chilli peppers balanced with caramel.
Nose: Bonfire, bacon, and popcorn with some seaweed coastal notes, really strong saline influence.

Name: Three Ships 12 Year Old
Palate: The smoky notes at a bit more upfront on the palate, though fragrant vanilla and honey remain in charge.
Finish: Apple, coffee and walnut cake, a touch of forest floor.
Nose: Sponge cake with cream and jam, with some apricot thrown in for good measure. A smidge of smoke wafts in later on.

Name: The Glenrothes 18 Year Old
Palate: Still packing plenty of dried fruit notes, alongside crisp pear and a spicy touch of stem ginger.
Finish: Lasting sweetness of vanilla and pear, with peppery flourishes.
Nose: Decadent vanilla and orange, with hints of cherry and almond developing.

Name: Bruichladdich Islay Barley 2013
Palate: Honeyed cereal, almond, nutmeg, peach, vanilla pod earthiness.
Finish: A late hint of citrus oil develops.
Nose: Melted butter, sea shores, nectarine, a smidge of floral sweetness.

Name: The Lakes Infinity - The Whiskymaker's Editions
Palate: Black Forest gÃ¢teau is joined by oily nuts, butterscotch, thick bitter marmalade, and black pepper.
Finish: A drying, rich finish.
Nose: Sea salt dark chocolate, ginger snaps, and caramel with toasted spices and polished oak.

Name: Tullibardine 15 Year Old
Palate: Lots of honeyed malt, with creamy porridge and berry jam along with fresh sponge cake.
Finish: Caramelised nuts, spicy oak and mango curd.
Nose: Barley sugar and delicate florals, with apple crumble and custard.

Name: Kinahanâs The Kasc Project
Palate: Somewhat syrups, with prominent charred oak, barbecued mango and more caramelised tropical fruit with a scattering of vanilla pod. Creamy fruit and nut chocolate drizzled with runny caramel.
Finish: Aromatic, Christmassy notes of nutmeg and clove, orange oil and brown sugar, with caramelised pineapple.
Nose: Juicy autumnal fruit, namely plum, alongside pear and apple crumble. Sweeter aromas of rich caramel and pineapple peek through, supported by a spicy undertone.

Name: Cardhu 14 Year Old (Special Release 2021)
Palate: Floral, orange blossom, peaches, cinnamon and honey with black pepper. Very elegant and harmonious.
Finish: Sweet vanilla, and stone fruit. Long.
Nose: There are floral grassy notes, apples, honey, and sweet barley. A drop of water brings out the creaminess.

Name: Kilchoman Small Batch - Batch No.5
Palate: Distinctly fruity, you can't ignore that sweet apple pie note mingled with caramel and a subtle smokiness.
Finish: Sweet and smoky.
Nose: Citrus, baked apple and honey, with wood smoke, and maritime wafts.

Name: Milk & Honey Elements Series - Red Wine Cask
Palate: Very slightly floral with citrus blossom, before redcurrant and raisin develop, with a pile of cinnamon sticks off to the side.
Finish: Plum, oak, and poached pear.
Nose: Strawberry, dry barley, a hint of waxy orange peel and crunchy brown sugar.

Name: Glenfiddich Perpetual Collection - Vat 02 Rich & Dark (1L)
Palate: Silky, sweet, and spicy, with peppery fresh oak, cigar box, and well-toasted bread.
Finish: Candied peels, treacle, and a good whack of cinnamon.
Nose: Polished leather, freshly-baked fruitcake, bittersweet marmalade, and toasted oak.

Name: Mackmyra Svensk RÃ¶k (Swedish Smoke)
Palate: There's that bright juniper note! Sweet soot, and just a little more vanilla to give it a subtle sweet centre.
Finish: Plenty of oak and smoke last on the finish.
Nose: Earthy peat, warm smoke, vanilla fudge and a whisper of citrus.

Name: Bain's Cape Mountain Whisky
Palate: Soft and well-rounded with continued vanilla cream. Fresh pear, banana and  hints of cardamom and oak.
Finish: The sweet citrus peels return, along with a little bit of meadowsweet.
Nose: Grapefruit peels, custard creams and icing sugar. Soon followed by nutmeg and vanilla sugar. Lightness throughout.

Name: Port Dundas 25 Year Old 1996 (casks 128330 & 128331) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: A touch of floral orchard honey arrives alongside wood polish and fluffy pancakes with maple syrup.
Finish: A prickle of root ginger creeps in, mellowed by soft vanilla, flaked coconut, and zesty berries.
Nose: Soft summer fruits and fresh vanilla pod, with crushed almonds and buttered scones.

Name: Glen Moray Peated - Elgin Classic
Palate: Smoke never gets too intense, but plays a central role alongside vanilla and orchard fruit.
Finish: A little bit peppery, though still enjoyably sweet.
Nose: Familiar peat smoke off the bat, with characteristic butteriness developing.

Name: Johnnie Walker Black Label 12 Year Old Speyside Origin
Palate: Vibrant and fruity on the palate, more orchard fruit, with some toffee and cloves.
Finish: Warm spices, cinnamon, cloves and lingering apples.
Nose: The smell is all about fresh fruit, apples and pears, with a spiced apple pie quality.

Name: Bunnahabhain 1998 Manzanilla Cask Finish - FÃ¨is Ãle 2023
Palate: Peppery and spicy, very dry, salty and rasping, like an old amontillado. Then you get sweeter dried fruit and date notes. Beautifully balanced.
Finish: Long, sweet and spicy with salted caramel.
Nose: Strong maritime smell, saline, toasted almonds, apples and toffee - really smells like sherry. Plus woody spices.

Name: Auchroisk 10 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
Palate: Quite sweet with a pleasant softness.
Finish: Soft, dry green cereal notes.
Nose: Light, with a playful zestiness. CrÃ¨me anglaise, cut grass and delectable nuttiness creep in.

Name: Rabbit Hole Heigold Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
Palate: Thick vanilla pods, dry oak, peppercorn and more cinnamon bringing spiciness.
Finish: A smidge of citrus appears through the toffee and toasted spices.
Nose: Warming cinnamon and caramel, with a hint of Jamaican Ginger Cake underneath.

Name: Wolfburn Northland Single Malt
Palate: Honey Nut Clusters breakfast cereal, sweet spices, chocolate croissant, more honey towards the end, and a subtle earthy peatiness.
Finish: Long and fresh, with even more rich honey notes
Nose: Orchard fruits, apple pie, a fresh maltiness, almonds, magnolia and a suggestion of smoke

Name: Deanston 10 Year Old Bordeaux Red Wine Cask Finish
Palate: Boozy berry sweetness and toasty oak, plus some dark chocolate mousse later on. A little red chilli heat.
Finish: Peppery on the finish, though its still got strawberry and orange oil for balance.
Nose: Toffee apple, raspberries, waxy peels, a touch of grist.

Name: Jura 12 Year Old
Palate: Chocolate fudge, pear, a portion of peppery malt tucked away.
Finish: Sherbet lemons and sultanas.
Nose: Nutty barley, white wine, cinnamon, melon.

Name: Lismore 18 Year Old Special Reserve
Palate: Cinnamon and more sultanas, now joined by toffee and chocolate.
Finish: Hint of coffee bean and Oloroso.
Nose: Toasted oak, sultanas and a pinch of clove.

Name: Wolfburn Latitude
Palate: New leather, peppercorn, heather, Golden Delicious apples, Toffee Crisp bars.
Finish: A subtle touch of smoked paprika, balanced by butterscotch and barley.
Nose: Honey, apricot, sultana and floral smoke wafts.

Name: Talisker 11 Year Old (Special Release 2022)
Palate: Peppery and sweet, a touch of tannin, lingering bonfire, sweet oak, dried fruit, and apricot.
Finish: Long, peppery with a toffee sweetness.
Nose: Wood fires, furniture polish, vanilla, lemon peel, and lemon juice.

Name: Rampur Asava
Palate: Bold raspberry and redcurrant, followed by cinnamon and nutmeg.
Finish: A touch of cigar box develops on the finish.
Nose: Clove, blackcurrant, juicy plum, honeyed barley.

Name: Benromach Contrasts Organic
Palate: Banana fritters, pancakes with salted butter, peppercorn, cinnamon gum.
Finish: Well-rounded malt, with a vanilla-rich, biscuity hint lingering.
Nose: Fudge, coconut husks, a touch of singed barley leading into nutty oak and warming spices.

Name: The Glenturret 10 Year Old Peat Smoked (2022 Release)
Palate: Warming layers of baking spice and peat smoke, charred oak, and candied oranges.
Finish: Oily malt and bonfire ashes tie things up, with more sweet, zesty spice and hints of chocolate salted pretzels.
Nose: Nutty malt and smoked almonds open the way, with zesty citrus oils and sea breeze.

Name: Nc'nean Quiet Rebels - Lorna
Palate: Sweet, sticky banana bread and buttered malt loaf, with oaky vanilla, peach pie, and warming spice.
Finish: Ripe stone fruits linger alongside gentle spice
Nose: Fresh peaches and apricot compote, with drizzles of caramel, and oily citrus.

Name: Cutty Sark 12 Year Old
Palate: Gentle, vanilla, touch of tropical fruit, perfume note, citrus.
Finish: Good length, dried seaweed, sweetness, oak.
Nose: Light, balanced. Salty character, buttery. Seville marmalade. Cut hay, pear drops.

Name: Haig Club Whisky
Palate: Toffee and vanilla with pleasant supporting oak notes. Fresh banana (neither overpowering nor artificial), a hint of nougat and honeycomb pieces.
Finish: Praline, cinnamon and a little ginger with perhaps a hint of cardamom returning right at the death.
Nose: It doesn't jump out at you, granted, but there's more here than meets the eye (/nose). Apple crumble, expressed lemon peel and a touch of mango. Millionaire's shortbread, banoffee pie, coconut milk, dried grass, orange Turkish delight and cardamom.

Name: Deanston 12 Year Old 2008 PX Cask Finish
Palate: Dense vanilla and burnt sugar, sticky toffee pudding, woody spice, candied oranges, and roasted coffee beans.
Finish: A fruity finish, with delicate summer berries balancing whispers of cinnamon and anise.
Nose: Bold layers of roasted nuts, toasted oak, caramel, and cacao lead to sweet dried fruits and earthy oak.

Name: Glen Grant 10 Year Old
Palate: Firm. Sweetness, fruity, vanilla. Gentle peat, malty.
Finish: Dry, supple peat, toffee.
Nose: Medium. Vanilla, toffee apple. Herbal, hint of smoke.

Name: Tomintoul 14 Year Old
Palate: Vanilla, creamy, more blossom, barley.
Finish: Good length, spices.
Nose: Gentle, very subtle. Warm pastries, apple blossom, hints of toffee, citrus, gentle fruit.

Name: Finlaggan Old Reserve
Palate: Sweet cereals, barley malt, a little peat smoke, TCP, nutmeg and ginger.
Finish: A long, sweet finish with toasty oak and peppermint.
Nose: Slightly medicinal nose with hints of peanut, sticking plasters, manuka honey and digestive biscuits.

Name: The Glenturret 10 Year Old Peat Smoked (2020 Maiden Release)
Palate: Toasted malt and more lemon, with singed heather shrouded by bonfire embers and oily smoke.
Finish: Burnt oak and salted caramel.
Nose: Nougat and peat smoke, with flamed lemon peel and bittersweet chocolate.

Name: Caol Ila 2010 (bottled 2022) (cask 311758) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: A good helping of fruit balances the hearty peat smoke with spiced fruit cake and notes of candied pineapple. Salted chocolate joins in time, with dates and dried orange beneath.
Finish: Layers of seaside smoke and bonfire embers mingle with juicy dried fruits, sweet and zesty, with warming spice on the tail.
Nose: The sweet wine cask brings notes of tropical fruits, and baking spice, intertwining with plenty of coastal smoke.

Name: Rampur Double Cask Single Malt Whisky
Palate: Barley sugar, earthy vanilla pod, dark berries and a symphony of baking spices.
Finish: A lengthy, sherried finish of dry spice and chocolate.
Nose: Hints of cooked banana, with peppery oak, plump raisin and honey.

Name: Benriach 25 Year Old
Palate: Lots of fruit, particularly luscious stone fruit. Almonds and cocoa, spice.
Finish: Dry, rich complexity.
Nose: Well-aged, aromatic, floral. Peppery, vanilla. Interesting touch of salinity.

Name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label - Cities Of The Future City X Mars 2220
Palate: Supple and balanced. Good toffee and hints of very wistful smoke. Chocolate, hints of grass, and a good hit of malt.
Finish: Floral, oaky, good length, urged on by a plume of very well-kept, highland-style smoke. Dried fruit, spice, honey.
Nose: Fragrant with good body. Notes of oak, crisp spice, dried fruit, pastries. Berry fruits, aniseed, hints of cedar, a touch of spice, and citrus.

Name: Benrinnes 12 Year Old 2010 (casks 107 & 110) - Un-Chilfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Floral, with apples, grapes, toasted almonds, and some cinnamon spice.
Finish: Berries linger, along with some milk chocolate.
Nose: Orchard fruit and creamy grain, with some redcurrant, and sweet honey.

Name: Peg Leg Porker Tennessee Bourbon 8 Year Old
Palate: Sweet, toasted nuts and buttered popcorn, wafts of vanilla pod counter peppery oak, and a touch of sesame.
Finish: Peppery heat builds with sweetness still underlying, along with plenty of spicy oak.
Nose: Big and bold, plenty of oak char, with sweet caramel and subtle hints of pickle brine.

Name: Christmas Cake & Dark Chocolate & Medjool Dates & Cinnamon & Sherry Casks & Cask Strength 12 Year Old (Batch 01)
Distillery/Brand: Christmas Cake & Dark Chocolate & Medjool Dates & Cinnamon
Bottler: Christmas Cake & Dark Chocolate & Medjool Dates & Cinnamon
Palate: Big and bold with dense, tannic, leathery oak and tobacco, drying spice, and sticky dried fruits. Fiery cinnamon is tamed by layers of maple syrup and chocolate fondant.
Finish: A warming finish with notes of spiced biscuits and caramelised sugar, bolstered by that hearty cask strength.
Nose: Yep, it smells like a homemade Christmas cake that's been fed sherry for the past six months. Sweet layers of treacle and sticky toffee pudding are supported by wintery spice and meaty malt.

Name: Jura 14 Year Old American Rye Cask
Palate: Floral notes continue, with more fresh herbs. Sweet caramelised nuts, juicy tropical fruits, buttery vanilla, crisp spiced apple with fragrant cinnamon and oak char.
Finish: Still fruity, the woody spice picks up with prickles of warming pepper, balanced by sweet, nutty caramel.
Nose: Zesty wafts of fresh lemon peel and candied orange open things up followed by mint leaves and blossom.

Name: Mackmyra Intelligens - AI:02
Palate: Vanilla sponge cake with hints of pine, cider, and caraway underneath.
Finish: Quite long with hints of white chocolate and lemon.
Nose: Sugared peels and a hint of raspberry, soft smoke, toasted cedar.

Name: Lagavulin 12 Year Old (Special Release 2020)
Palate: A medium-weight dram, on the palate the expression is sweeter than you'd expect from the nose, and the smoke is more pronounced, too. The pear becomes fresher and the orange more zesty, along with a gentle earthiness.
Finish: Medium-long and drying, with waft after waft of that seaside smoke.
Nose: A gently ashy Lagavulin expression, bolstered by pear drop boiled sweets, an iodine brine, orange oil and and a grassiness. Wafts of smoke become more prominent with time in the glass and a drop of water.

Name: Glen Moray 15 Year Old - Elgin Heritage
Palate: Crumbly fudge with a few sea salt flakes, shortly joined by banana fritters and chocolate raisins.
Finish: Cinnamon and ground ginger.
Nose: Sweet as it opens with white chocolate and caramel. A hint of charred oak smokiness develops.

Name: Penderyn Yma O Hyd (Icons of Wales)
Palate: Warming gingerbread, with sticky dried prunes, brown sugar, oaky vanilla and gentle peppery spice.
Finish: Sweetness and spice balance towards the end.
Nose: Tarte Tatin, with drizzles of vanilla custard, warm spices and honey.

Name: Mars Kasei
Palate: Fresh green apple intertwined with light smoky notes, a drizzle of fragrant honey alongside waffles with caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream.
Finish: Vanilla and citrus on the finish, think lemon tart.
Nose: White flowers and ripe white stone fruit, with just a whisper of smoke.

Name: Inchgower 10 Year Old 2011 - Labyrinth (Fable Whisky)
Palate: Gingerbread, green apple, mineral hints lingering.
Finish: Quite nutty on the finish, with the final touches of citrus zest.
Nose: Enjoyably floral, with zesty fruity notes developing later on.

Name: Cameronbridge 27 Year Old 1991 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Elegantly sweet with soft spices drifting between layers of toasted coconut and vanilla fudge. Candied tropical fruits and zesty malt are backed up by a touch of peppery oak.
Finish: A hint of marmalade arrives toward the finish, joined by creamy notes of Caramac and distant drying spice.
Nose: Creamy vanilla custard, fresh mango, and apple candies, backed up by a touch of liquorice and cinnamon. Milk bottle sweeties and white chocolate buttons add to the creaminess.

Name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label - Year of The Ox Limited Edition
Palate: Supple and balanced. Good toffee and hints of very wistful smoke. Chocolate, hints of grass and a good hit of malt.
Finish: Floral, oaky, good length, urged on by a plume of very well-kept, highland style smoke. Dried fruit, spice, honey.
Nose: Fragrant with good body. Notes of oak, crisp spice, dried fruit, pastries. Berry fruits, aniseed, hints of cedar, a touch of spice and citrus.

Name: Spirit of Hven Tycho's Star
Palate: Cardamom, leafy coriander and sweet cinnamon. Peat warmth not quite as pronounced as it was on the nose. Candied peels bring a subtle touch of sweetness to the mix.
Finish: Quite long. Hints of cracked black pepper and orange chocolate.
Nose: Caramelised apple and poached pear. Generous notes of wood smoke with a very slight touch of coastal air. Richly herbaceous nettle tea. Fresh ginger root.

Name: Bladnoch 19 Year Old (2022 Release)
Palate: Dark liquorice sticks, red berries, peppery oak, and Manuka honey combine in a rich, thick palate.
Finish: Very long and a little drying.
Nose: Dried apricots, blackcurrant jam, and warming nutmeg emerge from delicate floral notes.

Name: Teaninich 13 Year Old 2008 - Fairies (Fable Whisky)
Palate: Vanilla sticks around on the palate, with the apples notes replaced by oranges and lemons.
Finish: Crunchy brown sugar and spicy peppercorn.
Nose: Dry wood, fresh green apples with a hint of caramel, a touch of hoppy bitterness.

Name: Starward Fortis
Palate: Figs, dates, peanut brittle, a hint of toasty oak, more jammy red berries.
Finish: Vanilla pod earthiness lingers underneath blackberry and Seville orange.
Nose: Strawberry, blackcurrant jam, a bit chocolatey at points, hazelnut, gingerbread.

Name: Rowan's Creek Straight Kentucky Bourbon 70cl
Palate: Citrus on the palate, with crÃ¨me caramel, vanilla fudge and toasty oak. Good body, with an oily mouth-feel.
Finish: Long finish. Caramel again, with barrel char on the tail.
Nose: Hints of fruit and oak. Allspice and zest.

Name: The Glenturret Breabach 15 Year Old
Palate: Sweet and spicy, with buttery caramel leading into warming oak, with touches of plum and brown sugar.
Finish: Cedar lingers alongside fresh blueberry.
Nose: Lemon curd and toasty oak, with freshly brewed black tea, touches of sharp berries and honeycomb.

Name: Distillery 291 3 Year Old - Batch 2 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Toasted, seeded granary bread and plenty of spice, accompanied by roasted coffee beans and cracked pepper.
Finish: Balanced notes of cacao and chilli flakes bring a tickle of warmth to the finish.
Nose: Vibrant, herbaceous spice leads the way, with toasted pumpernickel and a touch of damp hay. Sweet notes of ginger snaps and liquorice follow on.

Name: Bushmills Black Bush
Palate: Vanilla and milk bottle sweeties. Dried peels, chamomile tea and cinnamon sticks.
Finish: Digestive biscuit, cooked plum and orange oil.
Nose: Over-ripe grape and light citrus on the nose. A touch of toffee and peanut.

Name: Powers John's Lane Release 12 Year Old Single Pot Still
Palate: Very smooth with vanilla, dry spice, chocolate and coffee. There is dark fruit here too, raisins and blackcurrants.
Finish: More vanilla and drying copper notes.
Nose: Barley, copper, fresh oak, leather, and juicy fruit.

Name: Smokehead High Voltage
Palate: Oily barley and intense campfire smoke, with a hint of brown sugar underneath.
Finish: Sea salt, oat cakes and smoked paprika.
Nose: Burnt biscuits, dried earth and a kick of black pepper.

Name: Three Ships 6 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Punchy wood spice, treacle sponge, some brown bread and damson compÃ´te at first. Pinot Noir, bitter salted chocolate and earthy herbal qualities blend underneath.
Finish: Long and a little leathery, with some spearmint hints and soft earth.
Nose: Raisins and syrupy plums notes quickly blend into dark muscovado sugar, milky latte and toasty vanilla. Charred oak, mulch and husky malt maintain the dark, earthy profile.

Name: Jack Daniel's Single Barrel
Palate: Full and mouth-filling. There are notes of cereal sweetness, the rye is in evidence with a touch of cigar box and nut oils, a little spice and an aniseed character.
Finish: Good length with a hint of citrus and plenty of cereal sweetness.
Nose: Good body with plenty of toasty oak, there are notes of corn and lovely cereal sweetness, there is a good smoke note, a little spice and toffee.

Name: Glencadam 15 Year Old 2007 Reserva de Jerez
Palate: Sticky toffee pudding, toasted pecans, flamed orange peel, and cooked apple.
Finish: Long and sweetly spiced.
Nose: Freshly grated nutmeg, milky coffee, marmalade, and red berries.

Name: Caol Ila 10 Year Old 2012 (casks 318324, 318326, 318329 & 318343) Un-Chilfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: An oily palate carries notes of ginger, camphor, a little sage butter, and lemon peel.
Finish: A long, smoky finish.
Nose: Chocolate malt, burning heather roots, seaweed, and vanilla alongside plenty of rich smoke.

Name: Nc'nean Huntress 2022
Palate: Honeyed malt, zesty pineapple, caramelised banana, and a hint of minerality.
Finish: Lasting green apple dipped in honey.
Nose: Tropical fruit, toffee pennies, a hint of buttered toast.

Name: Benriach The Sixteen
Palate: Silky layers of creamy barley, peach, and apricot lead to sweet notes of apple crumble and cooked plums.
Finish: Honeyed nuts arrive towards the finish, with more soft, creamy malt, a touch of oak char, and warming, woody spice.
Nose: Apple turnover with dustings of brown sugar, biscuity malt, a hint of apricot, and richly toasted oak.

Name: Dalwhinnie Winter's Gold
Palate: Very honeyed with warming peppery spices, Big Red cinnamon. From the freezer the honey is kept in check much more, as are the spices. Plenty of apple flesh and orange peel.
Finish: Allspice, nutmeg and smoky malt. From the freezer the finish is more about the spicy cinnamon and peppercorn heat that's found on the palate at room temperature.
Nose: Oak spice, pear skins, golden syrup and gristy malt. A touch of peach polish and chewy, sticky toffee. From the freezer it's fruitier, more green apple, apple sauce, toffee apple, sultana, even redcurrant.

Name: Whisky Works Glaswegian 29 Year Old
Palate: Through ancient oak furniture and damp malt come thick helpings of melted toffee, faintly sharp green apple and cooking chocolate. Black cherries and marmalade add a tart sweetness.
Finish: A final lick of caramel and a touch of minerality.
Nose: Strawberry cheesecake, tangy fruit salad and a little candy floss initially. Creme brÃ»lÃ©e, milky coffee and a dollop of vanilla buttercream follow, then ginger snaps and supple woody tannins.

Name: Glenmorangie Barrel Select Release 13 Year Old Cognac Cask Finish
Palate: Orange oils, buttery biscuits, clove, flaked almonds atop warm pastries, caramelised fruit.
Finish: Lingering oaky spices and a touch of red fruit sweetness.
Nose: Spiced apple, soft cedar, and a smidge of earthy forest floor. Hints of yellow plum and leather.

Name: Kilchoman Machir Bay Gift Pack with 2x Glasses
Palate: A generous burst of tropical fruit and dried raisin opens the palate. Warming smoke continues to waft playfully.
Finish: Sherried fruits and sprinkle of cracked black pepper.
Nose: Citrus zests, crumbly vanilla biscuits and layers of elegant peat smoke.

Name: Aerolite Lyndsay 10 Year Old - The Character of Islay Whisky Company
Distillery/Brand: The Character of Islay Whisky Company
Bottler: The Character of Islay Whisky Company
Palate: Smoke returns alongside mint dark chocolate, espresso and new leather, with honey and soy sauce mixed together.
Finish: Boiled mint sweeties, liquorice allsorts, bonfire smoke and toffee penny, with a pinch of salt.
Nose: Lots of maritime peat, with notes of iodine intertwined with honey sweetness, paprika, salted caramel and old bookshelves.

Name: Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve
Palate: Smooth and succulent with a honeyed sweetness that's typical of Johnnie Walker. There's more to this though, the floral elements are quite prominent and there's a spiced sweet vanilla note too.
Finish: Long, sweet and toffee-like.
Nose: Honey and heather with thick caramel notes and a subtle nutmeg spice. Dried meadow flowers and a hint of fresh banana.

Name: Famous Grouse Ruby Cask
Palate: Roasted malt and raisins bring notes of tea loaf, with clove and cinnamon, toffee apples, and a touch of ginger.
Finish: Mellow oak, forest fruits, and caramelised spiced biscuits finish things off.
Nose: Malted Milk biscuits, vanilla wafers, dried, woody baking spice.

Name: Redbreast 21 Year Old
Palate: Mouth-filling and reassuring. A little menthol alongside the expected spiciness and some leather. On the tail thereâs a touch of nectarine.
Finish: A little tangy fruit gives way to sweet and savoury barley notes.
Nose: Tropical pineapple (!) and crushed peanuts specifically, a bit like the combo you get on the outside of those soft cheese rings. Rich, rounded, spicy â prunes, quinces, a little deeply caramelised apple.

Name: Royal Lochnagar 12 Year Old
Palate: Soft smoke and gingerbread, oodles of toasty spices, Demerara sugar and boiled sweets.
Finish: The finish is all about grass and honey.
Nose: Creamy, aromatic nose with hints of hay, malted barley, oak and mixed peels.

Name: Loch Lomond The Open 2023 Special Edition Gift Set with 2x Glasses
Palate: Red berry and orchard fruit. Raspberry and peach, creamy vanilla, and dark chocolate.
Finish: Medium length, a touch of smoke gives way to lasting fruit notes.
Nose: Floral notes of rose, soft fruits, peach, and pear.

Name: Green Isle
Palate: Vanilla pod earthiness builds on the palate, paired with coastal peat, pear drops and crushed peppercorns.
Finish: Lingering wafts of dry smoke and buttery biscuits.
Nose: Softly toasted barley, warming oak, honey glazed apples and cut grass.

Name: Scapegrace Revenant Single Malt Whisky - Limited Release III
Palate: Toasted wattleseed, with gentle smoke, and shavings of dark chocolate, with a twist of dried citrus peel.
Finish: Smouldering embers linger, with toasted spices.
Nose: Aromatic smoke, with drizzles of floral honey.

Name: Arran 24 Year Old 1997 (Vintage Bottlers)
Palate: Bright tropical fruit and rich chocolatey notes, with layers of cinnamon and black pepper.
Finish: Malty, dried fruit, and dense festive spice.
Nose: Seville orange marmalade, chocolate, vanilla, and pineapple.

Name: Port Charlotte Islay Barley 2014
Palate: Pink grapefruit, ripe stone fruit, and sea-washed pebble, alongside barbecued tropical fruit and savoury peat smoke.
Finish: Oak spice, apricot jam, and drying wood smoke linger.
Nose: Smouldering embers, vanilla cream, flamed lemon peel, and a pinch of sea salt among woody baking spices.

Name: Maker's Mark Cask Strength
Palate: Brown sugar, rum-soaked raisin, caramelised walnuts, spun sugar, Christmas spices and whiffs of smoke.
Finish: More winter spices mellowed by waves of vanilla.
Nose: Loads of vanilla, softly toasted sugar and cask char to enjoy here, plus a touch of cherry.

Name: Nikka Days
Palate: Smooth and creamy, roasted nuts, toffee apple, toasty malted cereal and vanilla fudge alongside a hint of barrel char, freshened up by juicy apples.
Finish: Buttery lemon shortbread sprinkled with sugar and vanilla pod.
Nose: Fresh and fruity apples, pears, honeydew melon and strawberry, orange oil, malt sweetness and lemon cheesecake.

Name: Loch Lomond Peated Single Grain
Palate: Sweet and peaty, with lemon blossom, singed heather, and liquorice alongside ripe orchard fruit.
Finish: Crisp malt, and lingering smoke.
Nose: Berry jam, oaky vanilla, and a dusting of baking spices, with a layer of fragrant smoke underneath it all.

Name: Blanton's Special Reserve
Palate: Light, balanced, gentle spices, toffee. Dried peels.
Finish: Spices, medium-length.
Nose: Spiced. Grainy sweetness. Buttery, fruity tang.

Name: Seagram's V.O.
Palate: Spicy and creamy, medium-bodied with honey, caramel and coffee. A touch of orange marmalade and pannacotta.
Finish: Medium length, spicy and sweet.
Nose: Juicy, spicy rye grains, dried apricot, lemon curd, oak and gristy sweetness.

Name: Bladnoch Samsara
Palate: A sweet winey start, then drying slightly before more plums and vanilla flavours, some citrus and a malty core. Nicely structured.
Finish: Mellow and winey with a spicy, lingering tail.
Nose: Quite concentrated, fruit compote, with plums, vanilla and orange blossom.

Name: The English - Original
Palate: Nuttier than the nose, with notes of almond and hazelnut. Milk chocolate, more orange.
Finish: Rich barley and a handful of spices.
Nose: Zesty orange, vanilla custard, grassy malt.

Name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label - Year of the Tiger Limited Edition
Palate: Supple and balanced. Good toffee and hints of very wistful smoke. Chocolate, hints of grass and a good hit of malt.
Finish: Floral, oaky, good length, urged on by a plume of very well-kept, highland style smoke. Dried fruit, spice, honey.
Nose: Fragrant with good body. Notes of oak, crisp spice, dried fruit, pastries. Berry fruits, aniseed, hints of cedar, a touch of spice and citrus.

Name: Tullibardine Sovereign
Palate: A little mixed peel with notes of pear cider, allspice and creamy chocolate. A core of rich malt with hints of maple syrup.
Finish: Spiced, creamy finish. Plenty of vanilla and cinnamon.
Nose: Soft vanilla and cocoa butter on the nose. White chocolate, allspice and charred oak.

Name: Ardlair 13 Year Old 2009 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: A stunning balance of sweet apricot, creamy barley, and peppery oak sweeps the palate. Chilli flakes nestle in the depths, kept well in check by deliciously crisp toasted oak, vanilla pod, and milky coffee.
Finish: Superbly soft and buttery, with freshly baked goods, lingering vanilla, and stewed stone fruits cushioning fiery prickles of ginger.
Nose: Beautifully creamy, with butterscotch, vanilla custard, soft sponge cake, and cookie dough. Buttery barley joins, with notes of popcorn, and peach pastries.

Name: Caol Ila 13 Year Old 2009 - Connoisseurs Choice (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Summer berries, hedgerow fruits, spiced ginger cake, summer barbecues, and a touch of candied citrus.
Finish: Peppery spices build, with grilled cherries, and waves of Islay peat.
Nose: Meaty smoke, spiced biltong, gorse flower, and sundried raisins.

Name: Willett 4 Year Old Family Estate Bottled Rye
Palate: Wonderfully chewy with a big hit of rye spice, burnt vanilla custard and velvety, melted dark chocolate.
Finish: More tart cherry returns alongside a touch of banana, rounded off by a wave of oak spice.
Nose: Aromas of Bakewell tart and cherry jam, with toasty oak, cinnamon and salted caramel.

Name: Macduff 13 Year Old 2009 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Doughy bread with yeasty grist and buttery barley. Toffee popcorn follows, joined by vanilla wafers.
Finish: Buttermilk pancakes and maple syrup arrive at the end to accompany shavings of ginger and a smidge of warming green pepper.
Nose: Rice cakes and zesty, herbacous oak, fresh apple peels, and drying hay. Buttered corn and damsons rest alongside nutty notes of truffle oil.

Name: Singleton of Dufftown 12 Year Old
Palate: Orange zest spiciness perks up a malty core of nuts, oak and toffee, hints of cut grass.
Finish: Oaky, rich with good length, some fruit lingers.
Nose: Malty with cereal/barley sweetness, buttery toast, wood shavings, hay and walnut.

Name: The Nikka Tailored
Palate: Initially sweet and buttery, with baked custard tarts balanced by orange marmalade and bitter dark chocolate.
Finish: Roasted coffee bean, fresh apple and vanilla pod linger.
Nose: Fresh stone fruit, with nectarine and dried apricot supported by waxy peels, touches of pithy citrus and a dusting of cocoa.

Name: Lismore 8 Year Old
Palate: Biscuit dough, white chocolate, a dollop of treacle.
Finish: Quite short, with a flash of vanilla and cashew.
Nose: Apple fritters, caramel and a hint of floral malt.

Name: Burnt Bridges Blended Whiskey
Palate: Toasted sugar and vanilla, moving into spicy cassia and oak, honey roast peanuts, meaty notes developing throughout (brisket, ham, and sausages), then more demerara sugar.
Finish: A long, smoky finish with a touch of ash, and barbeque sauce sweetness lingering.
Nose: Barrel char, smoky bacon, a little maple syrup, savoury malt, tobacco, leading into a hint of brown butter.

Name: Inchmurrin 22 Year Old 1996 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Creamy vanilla and toasted coconut rest beneath bold spice and burnt caramel while toffee apple sweetness and smoked herbs develop beneath.
Finish: Allspice and smoked paprika linger, coupled with plenty of sticky toffee, and more fragrant vanilla pod.
Nose: Zesty lemon and lime peels balance smoked chilli flakes and peppery oak, with a touch of vanilla fudge joining in time.

Name: Bushmills Causeway Collection 2000 Port Cask Finish
Palate: Fizzy strawberry laces, cocoa, Seville orange marmalade and a smidge of lemon peel, cigar box once again.
Finish: A long finish, with malty hints wrapped up in red fruit sweetness.
Nose: Raspberries, caramel, apricot jam, a hint of cigar box.

Name: Glenkinchie 2008 (bottled 2020) Amontillado Cask - Distillers Edition
Palate: Apricot yogurt, sugared almonds, caramel, toasted oak, and savoury spice.
Finish: Nutty, chocolatey, and with hints of milky coffee.
Nose: Lots of creamy nuttiness, acacia honey, dried grass, and white fruits.

Name: Maple Syrup & Toasted Oats & Orange Zest & Vanilla 8 Year Old
Distillery/Brand: Maple Syrup & Toasted Oats & Orange Zest & Vanilla
Palate: Orange zest with Florentines full of biscuity, nutty, candied cherry, dark chocolate, honeyed goodness. Black tea and vanilla.
Finish: Juicy Fruit, sweet tea, and rolled oats. Mmm. Moreish.
Nose: Buttery toffee popcorn and chocolate cornflake cakes, plantain, toasted oats and maple syrup with a rancio-like edge. Bonkers stuff!

Name: Auchroisk 13 Year Old 2009 - Connoisseurs Choice (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Fresh herbs, liqourice, clementine, and toffee.
Finish: Brown sugar lingers with coffee and marzipan.
Nose: Vanilla fudge, raspberries, and cinnamon.

Name: Jura Journey
Palate: Honeyed-drenched pear, toffee and pencil shavings.
Finish: Oily walnut and light apricot sweetness.
Nose: Melted butter, sugared almond, a very light hint of smoke.

Name: Auchentoshan 18 Year Old
Palate: Toasty vanilla, dark nuttiness, chestnut perhaps and something zesty, softening slightly after a time.
Finish: A malty finish, with a little custard and fresh flowers.
Nose: Rife with toasty oak and vanilla spice. Chocolate cake and a lovely grassiness, damp, yet drying. Crystallised ginger.

Name: Tomatin 14 Year Old Port Wood Finish
Palate: Dark chocolate dipped in strawberries. Crushed almonds, walnuts, Victoria sponge (with plenty of the prerequisite jam and cream in the middle) and a centre of oak.
Finish: Fruity on the finish.
Nose: Quite a powerful nose. Big bunches of red berries and grapes. Vanilla, oak and hints of white pepper.

Name: Bunnahabhain 10 Year Old 2008 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Superbly soft with notes of grilled peach, vanilla cream, and crumbly fudge. A dusting of cocoa and cinnamon sugar joins biscuity barley.
Finish: Festive biscuits bring aromatic spice, with candied nuts, baked apples, and a crackle of pepper.
Nose: Toasty notes of flaked almond and coconut, buttery pastry, and cooked orchard fruits. Roasted malt and a touch of old leather nestle in the depths.

Name: Laphroaig Four Oak 1L
Palate: An intense waft of smoke as it opens, with earthy vanilla pod and subtle cookie dough following it up.
Finish: Drying, quite spicy and long.
Nose: Roasted coffee beans, almond pastries, sawdust and medicinal peat.

Name: Girvan 14 Year Old 2006 (cask CG003) - The Golden Cask (House of MacDuff)
Palate: Honeyed oats with flakes of coconut and a dusting of vanilla, soft oak spices creep alongside sweet dried citrus.
Finish: Buttered shortbread, yet more vanilla, with a burst of barley spice and black pepper.
Nose: Flakes of fresh, buttery pastry, delicate notes of orange oil and custard cream biscuits.

Name: Culper Bros 355 Straight Bourbon Whiskey
Palate: A good balance of sweet, toffee popcorn, toasted almonds, and charred oak, with silky layers of cream balancing delicate spice.
Finish: Caramel lingers, accompanied by oaken vanilla and butterscotch, while a dash of pepper and candied ginger dwell in the depths.
Nose: Fresh apples, buttered corn, and a hint of sawdust, with creamy vanilla custard in tow.

Name: Talisker 2011 (bottled 2021) Amoroso Cask Finish â Distillers Edition
Palate: Dates and honeycomb, with underlying salinity and creamy malt.
Finish: Rum-soaked raisins, smoky oak, cinnamon.
Nose: BBQ charred pineapple, salted peanuts, sea shells, mint chocolate.

Name: Glasgow 1770 - Peated
Palate: Toasty oak and burnt sugar, with dried fruit richness building.
Finish: Slightly nutty on the finish, though earthy peat continues on and on.
Nose: Zesty orange and a hint of quince, juxtaposed by wafts of floral smoke.

Name: The Ardmore Legacy
Palate: More charred, smoky notes, joined by drying oak, pear drops and subtle grassy touches. Give it a minute for citrus zest and expressive heather to appear.
Finish: A lasting peat smoke finish, with a little bit of honey'd barley for good measure.
Nose: It leans more on the savoury than the sweet side of things, with light barbecue char and earthy notes up-front. Sweet cinnamon, fresh honey and vanilla toffee waft up at points.

Name: Tullamore D.E.W. XO Caribbean Rum Cask Finish
Palate: Lemon curd, caramelised pineapple and brown sugar, with oak spice and lots of dried fruit.
Finish: Chewy orange sweeties, ripe banana drizzled with runny caramel, with a prickle of aromatic spice appearing on the finish.
Nose: Cherry pie, lots of tropical mango and banana alongside buttery caramel, with sweet malt and rum spice.

Name: Chivas Regal XV Balmain Limited Edition
Palate: Butterscotch, red apple and caraway. A touch of grain sweetness in the background.
Finish: Heavy vanilla and pear on the finish.
Nose: Powerful orange and peach notes, backed up by juicy barley.

Name: Jim Beam Devil's Cut
Palate: The American oak vanilla remains powerful with a rich woodiness joining it.
Finish: Yep still oaky, the finish is reasonably long with a pinch of spice scattered on top of that persistent vanilla flavour.
Nose: Immensely woody, fresh cut oak and a whole heap of vanilla and wood spice.

Name: Singleton of Glendullan 19 Year Old (Special Release 2021)
Palate: Spicy, black pepper and cinnamon, and aromatic with a gorgeous texture. Super creamy and waxy.
Finish: Very long with a lift of orange peel and a little dark chocolate.
Nose: Youâd think sherry cask because of the dried fruits, then toffee, pastry, and a waxy, almost cheese rind note.

Name: Glenmorangie The Cadboll
Palate: Thyme honey, melted butter, green apple boiled sweeties, aromatic barley.
Finish: Red fruit sweetness balanced by rounded malt.
Nose: Cookie dough with plenty of raisins, dried orange peel and chocolate chips. Hints of lemon verbena grassiness, too.

Name: Slane Irish Whiskey - Special Edition
Palate: Sweet notes of nougat, dark plums and berries, silky butterscotch with hearty helpings of toasted oak.
Finish: Buttered popcorn, vanilla richness with orchard fruits, toffee, hints of sawdust, and a prickle of pepper.
Nose: Vibrant oak char, fresh apple, and creamy vanilla lead the way, cushioning gentle gingery spice.

Name: The Macallan Harmony Collection Rich Cacao
Palate: Dark chocolate, honey, dates, vanilla and cinnamon.
Finish: Long with rich chocolate.
Nose: Chocolate fondant, honey, oak, zesty lime and ginger.

Name: Filey Bay Moscatel Cask Finish
Palate: Candied orange and muscovado sugar, with baking spices, dusty cocoa and crisp apple, with a kick of ginger.
Finish: Dried banana and cooked pineapple, with toasty oak spice.
Nose: Brown sugar and ripe tropical fruit, with tinned pineapple and nectarine, followed by white pepper and orange peel.

Name: Starward Solera
Palate: A rich, but well-balanced palate begins with toasted oak and more jammy fruit compote â damsons, black currants and dried figs â before creme brulee, milky coffee and winter spice notes emerge.
Finish: Thereâs a little sawdust and milk chocolate as the dram concludes.
Nose: Prune juice and seedless raisins provide a thick, sherry-forward sweetness that is complemented by rich caramel and toasted almonds. A little marzipan lingers underneath.

Name: Waterford Single Farm Origin - Ballymorgan 1.2
Palate: More orange and lemon, now paired with touches of fresh malt, Christmas spices and cookie dough.
Finish: Green apple sweeties, black pepper, resinous oak.
Nose: Citrus and mango, with a hint of treacle underneath.

Name: Proclamation Blended Irish Whiskey
Palate: Brioche and pastry, a full bodied and smooth sipper with coffee bitterness and a touch of sweetness lifting it slightly giving it a smoothness and many layers of complexity from both its oak and its fruity slippery texture.
Finish: Rounded with toasty with a long indulgent finish with fig, dates and vanilla.
Nose: Buttered brioche, crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e, stoned fruits and freshly brewed coffee.

Name: Kingsbarns Balcomie Gift Set with 2x Glasses
Palate: Pineapple upside down cake, marmalade, and more cinnamon, with a touch of cocoa.
Finish: Apricot jam, and chocolate-coated nuts.
Nose: Cinnamon scrolls and hot cross buns, with a drizzle of maple syrup, and dried cherry.

Name: The Kurayoshi Tottori
Palate: Quite bread-y, backed up by black pepper and almond.
Finish: A touch of smoke sticks around.
Nose: Fresh cream, lemon sponge cake, a hint of pine resin.

Name: Loch Lomond Coffey Still Single Grain - Cooper's Collection
Palate: Baked apples and pears, dusted with cinnamon are followed by roasted almonds, and a touch of cedar.
Finish: Drying notes of stewed tea and oaken spice, with caramelised biscuits and cakey spice.
Nose: Sweet notes of nougat and floral honey, forest fruits, and rich oak char.

Name: Glenfiddich Perpetual Collection - Vat 01 Smooth & Mellow
Palate: Peach, apple, and honeyed pastry counter tingles of peppery spice before giving way to zesty grapefruit, vanilla sugar, and grape skins.
Finish: Soft pears and gently tannic oak, with redcurrants followed by pangs of peppery spice and roasted nuts.
Nose: Sweet, vinous fruits and orchard blossom are joined by notes of peach and dried mango. More floral notes of malt and honey are joined by cider apples.

Name: Jameson Caskmates Stout Edition
Palate: Orchard fruits, great mouthfeel but the vanilla cream is less prominent, it's more fragrant (hoppy?) and floral on the palate with a touch of bitterness.
Finish: Again familiar, but different, that different complexion of spice with  chocolate from the nose lingers briefly.
Nose: There's still cut grass and some fruit alongside delicious oily pot still character, but things are different here too. Is it sweeter? A different sweetness perhaps, more wood spice plus chocolate liqueur. A shift of emphasis.

Name: Whisky Row Rich & Spicy
Palate: Chocolate appears alongside more baking spices, leading into oaky vanilla and espressio.
Finish: A dry, spicy finish full of oak.
Nose: Rather oaky, with caramelised nuts, cigar box and cinnamon stick.

Name: Seaweed & Maple Syrup & Butterscotch & Christmas Cake
Palate: Salted Scottish tablet, sherry-soaked raisins, shavings of chocolate, and subtle smoke.
Finish: Peppery spice, with lingering earthy peat.
Nose: Raisin-studded fruitcake, syrupy flapjacks, milk chocolate, and damp embers.

Name: Connemara 12 Year Old Peated
Palate: Sweet, fizzy almost, with rustic, earthy peat, atop rhubarb and custard sweets, cream, malt and granary toast with melted butter. Smoky too, like a driftwood on fire.
Finish: Light finish, medium length, some vanilla and tangy fruit with traces of oily smoke and spice.
Nose: Lemony and fresh. Quite light, oily peat which melds with a deft touch of light apple and pear, a hint of custard, and creamy malt.

Name: Dalwhinnie 2006 (bottled 2021) Oloroso Cask Finish - Distillers Edition
Palate: Sultana, caramel, nutmeg, orange oil and a subtle waxiness.
Finish: Honeyed barley, cinnamon and ginger, stewed berries.
Nose: Hot cross buns, a smidge of polish oak furniture, Cadbury's Fruit & Nut.

Name: Benriach The Original Ten
Palate: More baked goods - now croissants dipped in milky coffee and cinnamon rolls. Still packs plenty of creamy orchard fruits notes, plus a waft of earthy peat.
Finish: Nutty malt, vanilla pod and apricot remains.
Nose: Nectarine, honeydew melon, vanilla sponge with cream and jam and a touch of cedar.

Name: Bourbon Whiskey #2 3 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Sumptuous layers of oaken vanilla and silky butterscotch support a warming sprinkle of baking spice. Buttery popcorn rides throughout, while hints of After Eights creep beneath.
Finish: Toasted oak and sweet spices linger.
Nose: Aromatic layers of cloves, cinnamon, and nutmeg, joined by sticky ginger cake and coffee grounds. Buttery fudge and a whisper of menthol rest in the distance.

Name: Caol Ila 16 Year Old 2007 (cask 203) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Sherry sweetness, more barbecue smoke, with some toasted coconut, and more winter spices.
Finish: Lingering smoke, and peppery spices.
Nose: Meaty smoke, with toasted nuts, raisins, and winter spices.

Name: The One Fine Blended Whisky
Palate: Apple, greengage, almond and cherry sweetness, toasted cinnamon, cedar.
Finish: Dried fruit and walnut, with honey lingering.
Nose: Peanut brittle, peaches, nectarines, hay leading into a hint of grassy peat.

Name: Benriach Quarter Cask (1L)
Palate: Apricot jam, cooked pear, brown sugar, and creamy barley.
Finish: Cinnamon butter on a sweet and spicy finish.
Nose: Dried apple, candied lemon, creamy vanilla, and peppy oak.

Name: Fettercairn Warehouse 14
Palate: More tropical fruit, crÃ¨me caramel, dried apricot, and ginger are supported by a rich, chocolatey backdrop.
Finish: Long and rewarding with more chocolate, nutty goodness, and a bright flicker of refreshing mango.
Nose: Toasty maltiness, charred pineapple, woody spice, and some creamy nutty elements.

Name: Redbreast 12 Year Old with Project Wingman Bird Feeder
Palate: Spicy with great body. Nuts and citrus (peel and juice) with hints of marzipan, dried fruits and a hint of Sherry. You turn it over in your mouth forever.
Finish: Long and creamy with custard and spice.
Nose: Nutty, rich and oily. There are notes of dried peels, ginger, linseed and cut fruits including a touch of melon.

Name: Jack Daniel's Sinatra Select
Palate: Yummy butterscotch notes which turn into yummier caramel notes, rich and warm. Hints of orange zest and a subtle smokiness.
Finish: Packed with vanilla and smooth as Sinatra's voice.
Nose: Soft honey, fresh apples and a bold oak note at the centre.

Name: Stauning Rye
Palate: More forest berries, oaky vanilla and cocoa lead into oily citrus and more spicy oak.
Finish: Caramel wafers, ripe stone fruit and chocolate-coated nuts.
Nose: Rye bread fresh out of the oven is indeed there, with touches of blackberry, peppery oak and menthol.

Name: Braes of Glenlivet 30 Year Old - Secret Speyside Collection
Palate: Intense fruit flavours with juicy orange, blackberry jam and marzipan.
Finish: Long-lasting and sweet.
Nose: Tropical notes with aroma of mango and root ginger.

Name: GlenDronach Traditionally Peated
Palate: Flamed orange peel and maple syrup, with Scottish tablet, clove-studded orange and cooked plum.
Finish: Smoked barley lingers alongside juicy forest fruits.
Nose: Treacle, orange sweeties, set honey, liquorice and smoky oak.

Name: Crabbie's Yardhead Gift Pack with 1x Tumbler
Palate: Mint leaf, toffee apple, white grape, slightly toasty.
Finish: Rye heat and soft cinnamon.
Nose: Custard Cream biscuits, lemon peel, a touch of savoury wood.

Name: Strathmill 22 Year Old 1996 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Triple chocolate cookies, crÃ¨me caramel, and more fruity honey deliver a deliciously sweet and creamy profile.
Finish: Chocolate Brazil nuts and macadamia finish things up, with creamy mocha taming a touch of cracked peppercorn and tobacco.
Nose: Fresh peaches with generous pourings of honey. Prunes and dates join later, with some leathery oak resting in the depths.

Name: Black Bull 12 Year Old (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Thick and rounded. Nutty and soft with orchard fruits and cream.
Finish: Thick and fruity, hint of under-ripe fruits now, creamy.
Nose: Sweetness, cereals, berry fruits, nutty, tangy, spices, cocoa.

Name: Starward Nova
Palate: Honey, cinnamon and more red fruit on the palate, creamy nutty texture, luxurious mouthfeel with a touch of tannin.
Finish: Toffee with walnuts.
Nose: Positively bursting with red fruit, strawberries with a Port-like mixture of fruit and nuts.

Name: The Oxford Artisan Distillery Rye Whisky Batch 7 - Easy Ryder
Palate: Creamy custard, with rich pastries, cocoa nibs, and toasted oak.
Finish: Peppery spice and meadow herbs, and subtle, smouldering gorse.
Nose: Warm apple cider, dried tropical fruits, drizzles of dark caramel, and fresh cut hay.

Name: Speyburn 15 Year Old
Palate: Honey'd barley and Tunnock's Caramel Wafers. A flash of flamed orange peel, shortly joined by lemon meringue.
Finish: Brown sugar, honeycomb and dried banana chips.
Nose: Marmalade, sawdust, cacao nibs and stroopwafel dipped in coffee.

Name: Green Spot ChÃ¢teau Montelena
Palate: Brown sugar and creamy vanilla, mixed with a few touches of fried dough. Cinnamon and white pepper in the background.
Finish: Continued festive spices. Slightly nutty.
Nose: Vibrant notes of fresh summer berries and pineapple, balanced by underlying heat of cedar.

Name: Teaninich 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 15437) - Old Particular Fanatical About Flavour (Douglas Laing) (Master of Malt Exclusive)
Palate: Biscuity malt and earthy wafts of smoky black tea. Fruit cake spice builds, with creamy fudge balancing faint murmurs of peat.
Finish: Candied fruits and clove-studded linger alongside subtle peat smoke and crunchy ginger biscuits.
Nose: Nutty barley, fresh bread, and toasted woodchips with zesty wafts of lemon peel. Grassy hay rests beneath, though burnt caramel keeps things sweet.

Name: Millstone 4 Year Old 2014 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Creamy toffee, stewed stone fruits, and banana chips mingle with drying smoke. Buttered malt loaf and liquorice develop in time.
Finish: Vibrant, herbaceous spice joins the sweet grilled fruit, with cardamom, fennel, and flamed oranges, while campfire smoke lingers in the depths.
Nose: Polished oak and nutty malt lead the way, with whispers of earthy smoke cushioned by sweet layers of charred peach and apricot.

Name: Amrut Single Malt Whisky
Palate: Barley, honey develops with allspice, apricot, rum.
Finish: Apples, apricot, greengages, malt, fruit.
Nose: Intense barley and grain, nutty, citrus, apricot.

Name: Speyburn Bradan Orach
Palate: Fruity and balanced. Lots of creamy vanilla, hints of spice. Oak.
Finish: Quite long, oak, spice.
Nose: Fruity, malty. Orchard fruits, blossom, hints of light citrus, creamy.

Name: GlenAllachie 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 900859) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Mature oak richness with waxy orange peel, dark chocolate shavings, and toasted almonds.
Finish: Spiced malt and coffee-soaked nuts linger.
Nose: Lemon drizzle cake, buttery brioche, chewy dates, and grassy barley.

Name: Glenmorangie The Elementa 14 Year Old
Palate: Generous helpings of runny honey, alongside home made berry jam, citrus curd, and spicy fudge.
Finish: A touch of oaky bitterness is balanced by yet more honey.
Nose: Nectarine, caramelised nuts, and spiced dark chocolate, with a good dollop of almond butter.

Name: Perpetuity Blended Scotch Whisky - Batch 1
Palate: Toffee popcorn, stone fruits, lemon, and a drying aromatic touch of ginger.
Finish: Creamy and sharp with some citrus.
Nose: Caramel and vanilla sweetness are joined by red apple skins and a little waxy orange peel.

Name: Morris Australian Single Malt Whisky Signature
Palate: Biscuity malt with mounds of dark cherries and berries, bitter dark chocolate, and zingy orange zest.
Finish: Rich and unctuous, the boozy soaked fruits continue with fruit cake sweetness and spice.
Nose: Fruity from the start with crisp apples and pears balancing the rich depth of dried fruits and dark chocolate.

Name: Milk & Honey 2017 (bottled 2022) Ex-Islay Single Cask
Palate: Plenty of citrus and ripe orchard fruits blend with vanilla, cocoa, nectarine, and earthy smoke.
Finish: Barrel char, salty peat, and honey flapjacks.
Nose: Tinned peaches, digestive biscuits, floral honey, and smoked oak.

Name: Inchgower 15 Year Old 2008 (cask 806198) - Infrequent Flyers (Alistair Walker)
Palate: Dark caramel, fig rolls, cinnamon and clove, and caramelised almonds.
Finish: Drizzles of treacle, and warming spice.
Nose: Sweet spices, toasted coconut, and fruity cacao nibs.

Name: Jericho - Classic Selection (The Lost Distillery Company)
Palate: Peat sits in the background on the palate, letting vanilla and burnt sugar take centre stage.
Finish: A lingering hint of poached pear.
Nose: Cinnamon rolls, smokey peanut shells, a touch of cherry liqueur.

Name: Glengoyne 25 Year Old
Palate: Vanilla and dark chocolate open up the palate. Sherry comes through yet again, but this time in the shape of rich, well spiced fruit cake. Hints of orange and oak round it off.
Finish: The finish lasts with notes of red fruits and cracked black pepper.
Nose: Big notes of sherry-soaked fruit up front - raisins, figs and oranges. This is followed by wafts of toasted almonds and classic notes of old leather.

Name: The Matsui Mizunara Cask
Palate: A velvety mouthfeel with rich oak, cinnamon, ginger and a touch of chilli spice, balanced by toffee sweetness.
Finish: Smooth and silky caramel lingers alongside floral oak, tobacco and vanilla pod.
Nose: A fresh, floral aroma followed by sweet vanilla and baking spice, with a touch of creamy coconut.

Name: Jura French Oak
Palate: Caramel and vanilla combine with smoked oak and a pinch of lime zest, followed by tingly baking spices.
Finish: Warming spice, delicate smoke, dried apricots, honey, and pepper.
Nose: Gently floral with fresh apples, pears, and plums.

Name: Jack Danielâs Triple Mash
Palate: Honey on granary toast, dried fruit, and baking spice join the party.
Finish: Rye spice tingles away for a while.
Nose: Warming oak, petrichor, vanilla, and toffee apples.

Name: The Cheshire English Single Malt - Second Release
Palate: Milky tea and biscuits lead on to dried apricots, with woody spice.
Finish: Fruity and sweet.
Nose: Fresh cut hay, apple skins, floral honey, and some cinnamon spice.

Name: Glenmorangie 12 Year Old Barrel Select Release - Palo Cortado Finish
Palate: Silky layers of milk chocolate and caramel lead to darker notes of sticky treacle, earthy nuts, and woody spice, while plum jam and spiced currants support bittersweet citrus.
Finish: Salted almonds and fragrant tobacco, with a touch of liquorice and crackles of pepper.
Nose: A welcoming array of vanilla fudge, runny honey, praline, chocolate-coated nuts, and seasonal spice.

Name: The Quiet Man Blend
Palate: Creamy vanilla, toasted cereals, more honey, marmalade.
Finish: Faint spiciness of cinnamon and peppery oak.
Nose: Icing sugar, fresh tropical fruit, green banana and honey.

Name: The Dead Rabbit Irish Whiskey
Palate: Caramel and vanilla sit up front, with notes of nutmeg, milky coffee and macadamia developing in the background.
Finish: Lingering waxy fruit and a tickle of black pepper.
