Nose: Cedar, toasted brown sugar, apricot-filled pastries.

Name: Knockando 15 Year Old 2005
Palate: Grilled peach, caramel chocolate buttons, spicy, nutty malt, and a solid oaken backbone.
Finish: Shortbread leads to cinnamon, some prickly pepper, and rich cakey spice with fruity hints of poached pear and grape.
Nose: A medley of baked and dried fruits with sweet apple, raisins, and wafts of buttery banana balance peppery barley.

Name: Cardhu Amber Rock
Palate: Lemons, sticky caramel, vanilla essence and oak spice, lovingly drizzled with honey.
Finish: Subtle bitter orange and oak-y on the finish.
Nose: Cinnamon-dusted apple slices, a good drizzle of honey and a hint of orange zest. Then there's the vanilla biscuits. Oh, so many vanilla biscuits!

Name: Bourbon Whiskey #1 24 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: The vanilla notes continue on the palate, now with jammy red berries, maple syrup and freshly made pancakes.
Finish: A good kick of baking spices appear on the finish. Still enjoyably buttery.
Nose: Rich, earthy vanilla pod and coffee bean notes arrive first, supported by vibrant notes of orange oil, brandy-soaked raisins and dark chocolate.

Name: Oak & Palomino & Oxidation & Sitting 8 Year Old
Palate: Marmalade on granary toast, cherries and almonds, malty chocolate, a very light whiff of baked earth and a drop of maple syrup.
Finish: Sherry-soaked fruit, gingerbread and woody spices.
Nose: Chocolate chip cookies, honeyed barley, raisins and dried apricot, hickory, pecan and peppercorn.

Name: Teeling Dark Porter
Palate: Burnt caramel and earthen coffee tangle with sweet baking spices and distant, floral berries.
Finish: Hoppy, herbal notes develop in the depths, with crackles of woody spice and zingy orange peels. Hearty malt, sweet toffee, and cocoa linger.
Nose: Rich dark chocolate, treacle, whispers of vanilla, and hoppy malt.

Name: 8 Year Old Whisky - Chestnut Cask Finish (Defilement)
Palate: Dried fruit notes begin to take shape on the palate, with sultana and raisin at the fore. A clean, vegetal hint of eucalyptus develops, with continued woody hints.
Finish: Freshly cut timber and a touch of brown sugar sweetness.
Nose: Petrichor richness blends with drying woody notes, alongside a touch of fragrant lavender.

Name: Loch Lomond Original
Palate: Digestive biscuits and ginger snaps. Subtle vegetal notes develop later on.
Finish: Diced almond, coffee bean, toasted malt.
Nose: Caramel, oily walnut, a touch of dusty oak smokiness.

Name: Amrut Peated Single Malt Whisky
Palate: Soooo fruity! Peat doesn't even get a look-in. Lots of malt, tart.
Finish: Medium, peat emerges as the end, fruit teas.
Nose: Sweet cure bacon, smoke, malt, sweet peat, touch of caramel.

Name: Miltonduff 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 701804, 701805,701806 & 701807) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Sweet hay, with some shortbread, vanilla, allspice, and a touch of orange peel.
Finish: Sweet and lingering, with toasted oak.
Nose: Delicate orchard fruits, with floral honey, and malty, cereal notes.

Name: Aberfeldy 18 Year Old - Red Wine Cask Collection
Palate: Cocoa nibs, soft vanilla, peppery oak spice, and juicy blackberries, with hints of toasted coconut.
Finish: Silky oak, and baking spices.
Nose: Layers of cherry, with syrupy morellos, and juicy fresh cherries, along with oaky vanilla, and toasted marzipan.

Name: The Gauldrons
Palate: It's slightly coastal, with smooth peat and gentle wood spice. A touch of salted caramel is there, as is a little brown sugar and smokey barley.
Finish: Medium finish, with notes of vanilla, robust peat and sea salt.
Nose: Sweet cereals, with a note of iodine and sweet spices.

Name: Mackinlay's Shackleton Blended Malt
Palate: Juicy apple and orange, with contained honey richness.
Finish: Lingering butterscotch and waxy orange.
Nose: Golden Grahams and crunchy brown sugar. A hint of cinnamon-dusted malt.

Name: Dailuaine 7 Year Old 2015 Bourbon Barrel Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Silky soft butter leads the way for a coating of juicy, oily malt, slick caramel, and vanilla fudge. A snap of pepper edges in with hints of pork crackling, though the creaminess keeps it in check with superb balance.
Finish: Flaked, toasted almonds, sweet oak char, Custard Cream biscuits. A final wash of buttery barley gives way to a tingle of fresh green peppercorns.
Nose: Citrus blossom and delicate lemon custard pudding, vibrant, fresh notes of vanilla pod lead to buttered tea loaf and cushions of soft sponge cake.

Name: Bunnahabhain Abhainn Araig - FÃ¨is Ãle 2022
Palate: Dried fruit still sitting up front, supported by a touch of zesty citrus and subtly savoury oak.
Finish: Cinnamon spiciness, and mocha.
Nose: Dates, walnuts, milk chocolate, and cigar box.

Name: Glenglassaugh Peated Port Wood Finish
Palate: Creamy and sweet, with a prickle of cinnamon leading towards more smoke. Poached pears and blackberry compote.
Finish: Sweetness wins out in the end, with jammy cherry and a hint of Sherried citrus peel.
Nose: Brown sugar, damson and a hearty waft of peaty embers.

Name: White Heather 15 Year Old
Palate: Soft coastal smoke, dotted with fresh florals and tangy citrus peels.
Finish: A slow build of coffee and toffee notes on the finish.
Nose: Clementine, caramel, peanut brittle, and peat.

Name: Dingle LÃ¡ le BrÃ­de
Palate: Creamy fudge and speculoos biscuits, with some fresh garden herbs and allspice.
Finish: Spicy and fruity.
Nose: Syrupy flapjacks, with dried cranberries, and allspice.

Name: North Star Blend 10 Year Old 2012 - North Star Spirits
Palate: Biscuity malt and toffee are joined by hints of zingy red fruit and cinnamon, with a touch of fennel and oaken spice beneath.
Finish: Lemon peel, barley sugar sweeties, syrupy flapjack, and a sprinkle of pepper.
Nose: Creamy notes of porridge and coffee, with soft stone fruits and vanilla in tow.

Name: The Kurayoshi Tottori Bourbon Barrel (50cl)
Palate: Plenty of malt up front, bringing continued smoky warmth and caramelised fruit with it.
Finish: White grape and icing sugar.
Nose: Peaches in syrup, lemon peel, a hint of earthy smoke.

Name: Aquila 12 Year Old Whisky
Palate: Floral honey and greengages open the way for dry roasted peanuts and earthy layers of roasted red chilli, with a hint of five spice in tow.
Finish: Drying oak and a touch of charcoal nestle beneath, while underripe green apple, runny honey and those chilli notes linger.
Nose: Distant wood polish, stone fruits, and orchard fruits are backed by a subtle hint of capsicum skin. Chilli chocolate and a touch of cassis add depth.

Name: Legent Kentucky Straight Bourbon
Palate: An initially deliciously silky delivery leads with rich caramel, floral notes and a suggestion of marmalade before chewy rye spice initially makes things more complex among savoury notes of roasted peanuts and a slightly bitter quality from charred wood, coffee beans and unsweetened dark chocolate. Dark cherry jam and stewed plums then burst through adding vibrant fruitiness alongside the sweetness of vanilla, cake batter, muscovado sugar and a hint of cola. Warmth from freshly-ground black pepper is present in the backdrop.
Finish: Chocolate-covered cherries, black fruits, sugary cereals (Sugar Puffs, mostly) and a hint of liquorice fade ever so gradually; while the nutmeg and oak spices play about for longer.
Nose: Plenty of classic bourbon character is at the forefront of the nose but the cask influence adds balance and depth. Brown sugar, toasted almonds, jammy fruits, butterscotch, vanilla and orange peel combine initially, with delicate warmth and spice provided from ginger root underneath. A hint of Pinot Noir and stewed black cherry emerge as the nose develops, with milk chocolate, sandalwood and hints of leather.

Name: Islay Storm
Palate: Sweet rush initially, then onto medicinal peat and seaweed, some bourbon notes, spices, custard.
Finish: Smoke, long and spiced.
Nose: Peat smoke, oily, briny, some malt.

Name: Ichiro's Malt & Grain
Palate: Toffee first and foremost, with notes of barley malt, gingerbread, tropical fruits, honeyed pipe tobacco lveas, black pepper, roasted chestnut and freshly cut hay.
Finish: Medium length with vanilla and dried tropical fruit.
Nose: Peach and dried apricot, sweet butterscotch, vanilla cream, citrus zest, synthetic bananas and gooey malt.

Name: Powers Gold Label Distillerâs Cut
Palate: Peach, nectarine, spiced oak, toffee and apple pie.
Finish: Vanilla, melted butter on crumpets, cinnamon and white chocolate.
Nose: Orange peel, fresh honey, biscuit dough, cinnamon and mixed nuts.

Name: Bulleit Bourbon 10 Year Old
Palate: Lots of dried fruits (especially apricot) and more vanilla, but this time in spicy pod form.
Finish: Long and rich, with a whisper of smoke.
Nose: Toasty and oaky with creamy vanilla.

Name: Kavalan Triple Sherry Cask
Palate: Dried mango, baking spices, candied nuts, and chocolate-coated cherry.
Finish: Candied ginger, sweet balsamic, and apricot jam.
Nose: Tart berries, dates, orange chocolate, milky coffee, and caramel digestives.

Name: Bowsaw American Whiskey
Palate: More sweet popcorn, with chocolate peanut praline, maple syrup and fresh pancakes.
Finish: Cinnamon butter and vanilla sponge cake.
Nose: Buttered popcorn, milk chocolate-dipped banana and chai latte.

Name: Glasgow 1770 â Red Wine & Ruby Port Cask Finish
Palate: Poached stone fruits, a touch of ginger, and toasted marzipan lead to bold, peppery spice and stewed tea.
Finish: Dense tannic oak, tobacco, and red fruits linger, with crackles of toasted pepper and nutmeg lingering.
Nose: Boozy cherries and berries, notes of Bakewell Tart with waves of vanilla and almond, with peat smoke and charred oak developing in time.

Name: The Glenlee Blended
Palate: Aromatic and creamy, a touch of orange zest with mellow vanilla and toffee.
Finish: A warming, barley-forward finish.
Nose: Malty, soft spices with light honeyed notes and a touch of spiced oak.

Name: Old Pulteney Pineau des Charentes - Coastal Series
Palate: Hazelnut whip, nutmeg, oak char, salted caramel, and red apples.
Finish: Coastal elements linger with baking spice and toffee sweetness.
Nose: Acacia honey, white pepper, and creamy vanilla with orange peel and dried fruit in support.

Name: anCnoc Peat
Palate: Seedless raisins, cinder toffee, mocha and winter spices combine initially. Orchard fruits and floral honey lifts the darker notes.
Finish: Tannic oak, citrus peels and earthy peat.
Nose: Toasted almonds, buttery shortbread and black fruits emerge through refined wood smoke and a hint of gamey meat.

Name: James Eadie's Trade Mark "X"
Palate: Mexican chocolate, ripe red berries, brown sugar, another waft of soft peat smoke.
Finish: Juicy apricot and pear notes last on the finish.
Nose: Raisins drizzled with spiced rum and Sherry, a hint of grassy peat, oily walnut.

Name: Dingle Samhain Single Malt
Palate: Winter fruit compote, with figs, raisins and cinnamon, along with crÃ¨me caramel.
Finish: Warm cinnamon and ginger.
Nose: Crumbly shortbread, with candied orange, heather honey, and a touch of toasted almonds.

Name: Craigellachie 10 Year Old 2008 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Generous helpings of charred tropical fruit, caramelised pineapple, and banana chips with an oily minerality and subtle notes of spiced beer sticks.
Finish: Waxed peels, mixed spices, and more overripe fruit, with a pinch of dried chilli to finish.
Nose: Heaps to explore here, with layers of vanilla caramel, pineapple fritters, walnut oil, and fresh vanilla pod. Nutty malt develops beneath, with notes of cardamom in tow.

Name: Glen Scotia 18 Year Old
Palate: Citrus peels (both orange and lemon) lead into more dried fruit sweetness. Salted caramel, mature oak and some black tea richness.
Finish: Ginger, milk chocolate, oatcakes and raisin.
Nose: Honey, vanilla, sultanas drizzled with old rum, wafts of sea breeze and a touch of cherry.

Name: Octomore 13.3 5 Year Old
Palate: Sweet, delicate smoke, with caramelised honey, shortbread, Ovaltine, and hints of waxy lemon peel.
Finish: Peat builds, with savoury oats, and fruit compote.
Nose: Elegant peat smoke, with alpine herbs, soft gingerbread, and crisp apples.

Name: WhistlePig 10 Year Old
Palate: Warm baking spices, nutmeg, cinnamon and allspice burst to life and are tempered by sweet muscovado sugar, bright oak and dark chocolate. Vanilla cola and caramel shortbread linger.
Finish: Medium-length, with warm rye spices, sweet malt and sour cherries.
Nose: Fresh peppermint and herbal thyme initially, with sweet vanilla and marzipan developing. Creamy butterscotch, raspberry jam and orange rind round it off.

Name: Green Spot 10 Year Old 2010 (cask 363130) Vinsanto Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Sticky malt loaf, with oily cereal, vanilla custard, honey, plenty of gentle baking spices, and sweet, raisin-studded chutney.
Finish: Silky vanilla lingers alongside dark fruits and spices.
Nose: Caramelised sugar and baking spices lead the way, with oily cereal, dried prunes and raisins, and oaty apple crumble.

Name: Glenfiddich 40 Year Old Cumulative Time - Time Reimagined
Palate: A luxuriously full and silky smooth taste, with memories of past releases in every nuanced note. Evolving from deep dried fruit notes to rich fruitcake, dates, raisins, and stewed apples, before giving way to dry oaky notes, with subtle hints of bitter chocolate and peat.
Finish: Complex, memorable, and exquisitely long-lasting.
Nose: A deeply layered expression of dried fruits, dark chocolate, roasted coffee and ripe black cherries. Completed with subtle waves of gentle wood smoke, polished leather, and cloves.

Name: World Whisky Blend (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Warming and spicy, with more of that floral honey and baked crumble topping, alongside crunchy, underripe apple and pear.
Finish: A prickle of spice, toffee and vanilla pod linger alongside a slightly mineral note.
Nose: Notes of freshly baked bread, lots of honey and a smidge of orange marmalade, supported by slightly tart stewed apple with a sprinkle of brown sugar.

Name: Johnnie Walker Black Label 12 Year Old
Palate: Rich and full with notes of wood smoke and dry spice, hints of barley and cereal with creamy toffee and a distinct herbal note.
Finish: Quite fruity and long with a note of sultanas and mixed peels.
Nose: Winter spice and treacle, hints of white pepper and a little citrus.

Name: Teeling Single Malt (cask 14972) Calvados Cask - Master of Malt Exclusive
Palate: More peppery spice joins the party alongside toffee apple, charred pineapple, maple syrup, and rich malt.
Finish: A good length with dried fruits and honey.
Nose: An array of tropical and orchard fruits are drenched in honey and joined by sprinkles of nutmeg and a little chocolate.

Name: Knockando 10 Year Old 2011 (casks 306236 & 306238 & 306243 & 306245 & 306246) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Still floral with honeyed orchard fruit dusted in sweet spice. Crumbly shortbread and oily walnuts balance subtly grassy malt beneath.
Finish: Roasted marzipan and oaken vanilla build towards the finish, vegetal barley remains, with a touch of liquorice and spice.
Nose: Buttered tea cakes, a dollop of vanilla cream, floral citrus oils, and waxed peels.

Name: The Gospel 3 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: More rye bread notes, with caramel vanilla, sweet allspice, clove, pepper, and rich red fruit.
Finish: Dry and lingering. Dried red fruit and crÃ¨me caramel, with woody spices.
Nose: It's really rather lovely. Buttery dark rye bread, with hints of spice and light toffee, all with an underlying cherry compote note.

Name: Glenlivet 16 Year Old 2006 (cask 900800) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Plum skin, stewed apple, milk chocolate, and sultanas.
Finish: Ripe nectarine, figs, and dusty cocoa.
Nose: Toasted teacake with honey, frangipane, and digestive biscuits.

Name: Sheep Dip
Palate: Rich, warming, malty, young and spirity.
Finish: Punchy, tangy.
Nose: Fragrant with notes of the coast, tangy, malty, honey, toffee. Youthful.

Name: Slipknot No.9 Red Cask
Palate: Creamy vanilla, dark chocolate, sweet cinnamon, and dried cherries.
Finish: Toffee apples, oak char, and clove.
Nose: Oak spice, red berries, musty leather, and a good helping of caramel.

Name: Ailsa Bay Release 1.2 Sweet Smoke Gift Pack with Glass
Palate: Vanilla pod, toasted cinnamon, soft orange sweetness and waves of dried peat.
Finish: Subtly peppery on the finish, though a hint of green apple persists.
Nose: Earthy smoke with a hint of campfire ember, sugary shortbread and soft apricot.

Name: Egan's 18 Year Old Legacy Reserve IV
Palate: More stone fruits, with some poached apple, milk chocolate, warm sponge pudding, and oaky spice.
Finish: Sweet and fruity, with a touch of clove.
Nose: Green grape and apricot amongst creamy grain, vanilla, and warming winter spices.

Name: Speyburn 18 Year Old
Palate: Luxurious melted dark chocolate, balanced by a hint of citrus and a touch of oak spiciness.
Finish: Very smoky, long and slightly bittersweet.
Nose: Rich toffee, sugar coated almonds and sweet, fresh tropical fruits alongside toffee apples and whispers of smoke.

Name: Paul John Brilliance
Palate: Chomp Bars - lots of chewy caramel and chocolate here. Picks up from lively spice along the way, with a little bit of waxy orange peel on the mid palate.
Finish: Orange lingers. Surprisingly long, with the rye notes from the nose coming back in full force.
Nose: Good core of juicy barley. Ryvita with salted butter. Cinnamon-dusted-red berries, with a little green apple skin following it up.

Name: Writers Tears Copper Pot Irish Whiskey
Palate: Honey develops on the palate. Mellow notes of vanilla and golden malt. Green apple skin, caramel and a hint of oak.
Finish: Warming, sweet and long.
Nose: Soft and sweet with thick honey spread on granary toast. Hints of citrus peels.

Name: Old Pulteney 16 Year Old
Palate: Melted butter and cooked apple, with wafts of sea air. Cinnamon rolls and sponge cake.
Finish: Peppery oak and lingering baking spice, with just a touch more toffee.
Nose: Rock pool salinity mixed with rum-soaked raisins and drying peppery malt.

Name: Wolfburn Batch No. 155
Palate: Floral barley with a touch of vanilla blossom, shortly followed by strawberries and cream with a touch of brown sugar on top.
Finish: Subtly chocolatey, with a touch of cinnamon.
Nose: Softly boozy red grape richness, followed by honeyed barley and flaked almonds.

Name: Noble Rebel Smoke Symphony
Palate: Waves of earthy peat, with chipotle pepper spice, and jammy cherries and blackberries.
Finish: Fruity spice, and lingering smoke.
Nose: Bonfire smoke, with wine-soaked berries, and oaky spice.

Name: The Glenrothes Whisky Maker's Cut
Palate: Juicy sherry, crunchy brown sugar, a touch of boozy red wine, macadamia nuts.
Finish: Sweet with chocolate and dried fruit.
Nose: Orange oil and blackberry jam, with drying oak in the background.

Name: Benriach 8 Year Old 2013 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: A warm flow of melted chocolate leads the way with oily hints of cocoa butter and creamy toffee. Beautiful layers of vanilla fudge and shortbread develop, while a pinch of pepper creeps beneath.
Finish: Prickles of heat and notes of caramelised ginger, with toasted marzipan and more vanilla keeping things sweet and creamy.
Nose: Warm custard, milk chocolate buttons, butter biscuits, and sweet grist. A good dose of vanilla and toasted oak follow, with gooey chocolate brownie and distant apple sauce.

Name: Linkwood 10 Year Old 2012 (casks 201 & 203) - Un-Chilfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Buttery shortbread, dark fruits, cocoa, and some waxy orange peel.
Finish: Earthy spices linger, with some tart berries.
Nose: Stewed plums and apricots, with some sticky toffee, and peppery spice.

Name: Tomatin Legacy
Palate: Cracked pepper and sweet barley with pineapple cube sweets. Waves of warming oak beneath.
Finish: Sweet but peppered.
Nose: Lemon, panatella and pine forest. Slightly green with vanilla.

Name: Glasgow 1770 - Cognac Cask Finished
Palate: Crystalised ginger and hearty peat smoke welcome the way for generous helpings of earthen clove and cinnamon. Fragrant malt brings notes of prunes, chocolate, and a touch of fruity zest.
Finish: Lingering whispers of peat smoke and bittersweet cocoa, roasted coffee beans, dates, and caramel biscuits.
Nose: Barbecued fruits, leathery oak, and autumn berries, with smoked tea leading to notes of woody spice.

Name: Adnams Single Malt (40%)
Palate: Pepper and more bubblegum, white orchard fruit notes and blueberry, hint of cookie dough.
Finish: More sweeties, a little spicy caramel and the cracked outsides of Smarties (but not the chocolate bit - that's to be found in the Triple Grain!), fruitiness lingers too.
Nose: Oak, bubblegum, apricot, moving onto vanilla, butterscotch, still quite fruity. After adding a drop of water thereâs kirsch and, yep, runny honey. Red and black cherries develop alongside a hint of red chilli and, increasingly, red rope liquorice.

Name: Ben Nevis 8 Year Old 2013 (casks 316 & 322 & 323) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Creamy vanilla fudge, Sesame Snaps, candied orange, juicy stone fruits.
Finish: Burnt sugar, toasted coconut, savoury oak, and spiced citrus.
Nose: Waxy lemons, creamy chai, honeycomb, butterscotch.

Name: Glenfiddich 14 Year Old - Bourbon Barrel Reserve
Palate: Sweet caramel, toffee apples, and creamy vanilla tangle with spicy, toasted oak, cinnamon, and candied oranges.
Finish: Warming woody spice, sweet butterscotch, toffee popcorn, and silky sweet malt.
Nose: A big noseful of oaky vanilla with wafts of candied lemon and orange, apple tart, burnt sugar, and cask char.

Name: Lindores Abbey The Casks of Lindores - Bourbon Barrel
Palate: Sweet and tangy cooked apples, like a good crumble with a nice tart edge to balance sweet vanilla ice cream. Fiery ginger and prickles of green peppercorn poke through bringing some heat.
Finish: Mellow vanilla continues, with more sweet apple and pear, but a bittersweet woody spice creeps in, backing up lingering peppery warmth.
Nose: Laid-back wafts of vanilla welcome the way for buttery barley, whilst heaps of fresh orchard fruits balance gently zesty, peppery oak.

Name: Caol Ila 13 Year Old 2009 (cask 321156) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Oily malt and lemon zest, creamy vanilla fudge, and coastal, herbaceous peat smoke.
Finish: Baked apples join burnt sugar, crystalised ginger, charred herbs, and more tarry smoke.
Nose: Briny sea salt and tar combine with layers of creamy vanilla custard and buttered popcorn.

Name: Macduff 21 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Chewy and mouth-filling, with dark fruits, a little citrus and toasted, integrated wood. A herbal note is retained among rich oak spice.
Finish: A little fresh orange element lingers alongside nutty oak and more black fruit.
Nose: Dried fruit, dark chocolate and walnut whip with some waxiness and sweet floral notes of lavender. Thereâs hints of herbal tea and black olives underneath.

Name: The Legendary Dark Silkie Irish Whiskey
Palate: Salted dark chocolate, with oaky vanilla, fresh tobacco and waves of more drying smoke.
Finish: Toasted nuts and sweet malt, with gentle smoke in the background.
Nose: Orchard fruit sweetness veiled by dry smoke, cigar box and spicy oak.

Name: Compass Box Orchard House
Palate: Sweet and bright. Tart apple is balanced by pineapple, golden syrup, buttery pastry, with that subtle peat smoke appearing underneath.
Finish: Creamier on the finish, with vanilla buttercream and fresh fruit lingering.
Nose: Fresh green and red apples almost hit you in the face, living up to its name. Underneath thereâs notes of grainy pear skin, bright lychee, and a faint hint of aromatic smoke.

Name: Dewar's White Label
Palate: Medium, vanilla fudge, smoke, toffee, heather honey, oak.
Finish: Good length, cut herbs, honeyed sweetness.
Nose: Honey, peach, apple and wood. Cut hay.

Name: Seaweed & Aeons & Butterscotch & Vanilla
Palate: Silky salted caramel, gentle peat, oaky spice, and barley sugar.
Finish: Earthy peat hangs around. Deliciously sweet and savoury.
Nose: Gentle, meaty smoke, with toasted marshmallow, heather honey, and a touch of cinnamon.

Name: Naked Malt Blended Malt Scotch Whisky
Palate: Sherried and thick with notes of sultanas, sticky toffee pudding, raspberry jam, Victoria sponge, custard and crÃ¨me caramel.
Finish: Medium, with notes of cocoa, oak and just a soupcon of smoke on the very tail.
Nose: Smooth and oily with notes of cherry compote, buttered granary toast, malt, custard and peach.

Name: Old Pulteney 18 Year Old
Palate: Dark chocolate and green apple make for a great juxtaposition of bitterness and sweetness, while waves of vanilla and rye bread sit in the background.
Finish: Citrus, sea salt and wet grass.
Nose: Cinnamon-spiced cookie dough, mature oak, a very light touch of charcoal.

Name: Talisker Skye Whisky
Palate: Honeyed toasted oak, sappy wood, only a little pepper and smoke, apple turnovers and hints of lemon and lime Opal Fruits. Fennel seeds.
Finish: Drying and slightly less sweet, hints of spice and smoke.
Nose: Sweet stuff, toffees and vanilla ice cream up front, almost grain-like. Becomes increasingly honeyed. There's a little coastal influence here too, just hints of a sweet Caol Ila perhaps, with very restrained smoke.

Name: Glenmorangie Lasanta 12 Year Old (Pre 2022)
Palate: A dash of tart raspberry coulis leads into a generous helping of sherried dried fruit, with orange marmalade, toasted nuts and berry jam. Sweeter notes of brown sugar and cereal notes appear.
Finish: Silky and long, with oily orange peel, cinnamon and hazelnut praline, rounded off by bitter dark chocolate.
Nose: Plum and baking spice supported by milk chocolate raisin, caramel and toasty oak.

Name: Kavalan Sherry Oak
Palate: Mixed dark spices, vanilla and plum.
Finish: Dried fruit and cocoa.
Nose: Familiar rich dark fruit, marzipan and spice notes.

Name: Henstone Single Malt Whisky
Palate: More oily nuts, with chocolate praline in tow, and a zip of pink grapefruit.
Finish: A rich, malty finish.
Nose: Underripe apricot, chocolate-coated nuts, and orange loaf cake slathered in vanilla buttercream.

Name: Filey Bay Moscatel Finish (Batch 3)
Palate: Gingerbread and a little pepper are joined by tinned peaches, marmalade, and vanilla.
Finish: Banana bread and oaky spice.
Nose: Stone fruit, caramelised sugar, orange peel, and white chocolate.

Name: MacNair's Lum Reek 12 Year Old
Palate: Roast chestnuts, salted butter, more caramel, a hint of poached pear underneath it all.
Finish: Barley, peat and touches of menthol.
Nose: Roasted coffee, rich caramel, waves of coastal smoke.

Name: Milk & Honey Apex - Pomegranate Wine Cask Finish
Palate: Honeyed raisins and clear pomegranate influence, joined by whispers of oaky spice and vanilla sponge cake.
Finish: Raspberry jam sweetness lingers.
Nose: Red grapes, orange peel, dark chocolate, and a smidge of earthy malt.

Name: Girvan 27 Year Old (cask 702817) - DrÃ m MÃ²r
Palate: Honeyed granola, orange zest, a whiff of coconut, and milk bottle sweeties.
Finish: Soft oak spice and buttery pastries.
Nose: Vanilla ice cream, toffee apples, dried sultanas, and toasted oak.

Name: Catoctin Creek Roundstone Rye
Palate: Banana and walnut loaf leads into more vanilla, followed by cinnamon and peppery spices.
Finish: A spicy finish full of oak and buttery caramel.
Nose: Vanilla pod and mocha, with notes of Angel Delight, young oak and tobacco.

Name: Enso Japanese Whisky
Palate: Toasted oak and woody vanilla, alongside fresh apple, cinnamon and more delicate florals.
Finish: Crisp pear and toasted cereals linger.
Nose: Lemon blossom, a suggestion of smoke and bright citrus, underpinned by vanilla and caramel.

Name: The Glenrothes 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 170) - Infrequent Flyers (Alistair Walker)
Palate: Dusty cocoa, with a touch of dark caramel, toasted almonds, and spiced apple chutney.
Finish: Spices build, with a touch of praline.
Nose: Jammy red fruits, blackberries, leather, and toasted oak.

Name: Bunnahabhain 11 Year Old 2009 - North Star Spirits
Palate: Waves of caramel, melted chocolate and good sherry.
Finish: Ground cinnamon, orange peels, espresso and chocolate once again.
Nose: Rum-soaked dried fruit, toasted almonds, crystallised ginger.

Name: Bushmills 10 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish 1L
Palate: Sherry sweetness, with sun dried raisins, warm clove, and a touch of toasted marzipan.
Finish: Baking spices, with the fruitcake lingering.
Nose: Oaky vanilla, alongside sticky apricot compote, and spicy fruit cake.

Name: Jura Rum Cask Finish - Cask Edition
Palate: Buttery shortbread and lemon zest lead to layers of tropical fruit salad and spiced banana bread, with gentle warmth building beneath.
Finish: Cinnamon builds towards the end, accompanied by poached fruits, burnt sugar, and rich oak char.
Nose: Toasted oak, coconut flakes, and candied nuts open the way for peaches, and sweet clementine.

Name: Glenfiddich 12 Year Old Triple Oak
Palate: Creamy barley with more fresh orchard fruit, vanilla fudge, and delicate oak spice follow softly toasted almonds and hints of gingerbread.
Finish: Rich, sweet malt with yet more fresh, delicate fruit, vanilla cream, and woody spice.
Nose: Heaps of fruit with fresh pear, sugared plums, and zesty orange with wafts of sweet vanilla crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e.

Name: Glenburgie 10 Year Old - Derestricted
Palate: Still packed with vanilla and grassy barley, now joined by butterscotch, honeydew melon, and a touch of spicy liquorice.
Finish: Lingering sweetness of panna cotta and eucalyptus.
Nose: Spring blossom and grassy meadows, a whole mess of strawberry laces, vanilla essence, digestive biscuits, salted popcorn.

Name: Inchgower 14 Year Old 2008 (casks 801504, 801505 & 801506) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: More stone fruits, gingerbread, a touch of anise, and fragrant, leathery oak.
Finish: Marmalade and honey join towards the finish, backed up by buttery vanilla and a touch of mocha.
Nose: Plum and peach, a hint of almond, and a whiff of Wine Gums, with an earthen hint of dried garden herbs.

Name: Bunnahabhain 25 Year Old
Palate: Fruit compote doused in cream and caster sugar, this develops into roasted malt, chestnuts and stewed raisins.
Finish: Demerara sugar, mixed spice, nutmeg and caramel lingering for long after the final sip.
Nose: Sherried; sweetÂ toffee and polished leather followed by cinnamon and the faintest hint of cardamon.

Name: Filey Bay Port Finish Batch #1
Palate: Oaky vanilla, with Black Forest gateaux, redcurrants, and warm cinnamon.
Finish: Some jammy red fruit lingers, with spices building.
Nose: Raspberry liquorice, fresh cherries, and oaky spice.

Name: Jura Seven Wood
Palate: Lemon peel, sawdust, apricot and cooked peach.
Finish: Heavy vanilla. A hint of smoke develops.
Nose: Nutmeg, strawberry jam on toast, Brazil nuts.

Name: Caperdonich 21 Year Old - Secret Speyside Collection
Palate: Poached pear and vanilla with a delightful background of floral herbs.
Finish: Long, sweet and smooth.
Nose: Aromas of zesty orange and barley sugar followed by notes of lemon curd.

Name: Compass Box Great King Street - Artist's Blend 70cl
Palate: A gentle, creamy whisky, which develops a great deal of richness. Notes of Christmas spices, lemon, buttery apple crumble, Bakewell tart, rose petals and raisins.
Finish: Rich and sweet, with a long finish which tails off with notes of quince jelly, shortbread and spices.
Nose: Sweet and creamy, with lots of cereal notes, some vanilla, dried fruits, citrus and apple crumble.

Name: Milk & Honey Single Cask (cask 2018-0553) - Fortified Red Wine Cask
Palate: Fresh garden herbs plus a little red chilli earthiness are complemented by cherries, maple syrup, and a hint of smoke.
Finish: Sweet tobacco and dark chocolate.
Nose: Lots of red berries and waxy orange peel are joined by caramelised sugar, black tea, and cinnamon.

Name: The Gauldrons Cask Strength Limited Edition
Palate: Toasted oaky vanilla, with layers of floral honey amongst gentle peat and iodine. Warming heat builds.
Finish: The peat lingers, with a sprinkle of sea salt.
Nose: Bonfires somewhere in the distance, creamy grain, and a touch of dried seaweed.

Name: Wolfburn Batch No.270
Palate: Layers of apricot jam and brown sugar, with a touch of new leather coming through later on.
Finish: Subtly earthy once again, now with a hint of new oak spiciness.
Nose: Freshly-made doughnuts, earthy vanilla, coconut and buttered bread.

Name: Daddy Rack 4 Year Old Cask Strength (barrel 01)
Palate: Vanilla fudge, toasted oak with a touch of redcurrant and cocoa.
Finish: Richly charred oak, more vanilla and berries followed by a prickle of pepper and nutmeg.
Nose: Green apple, soft apricot, candied orange, vanilla.

Name: Auchentoshan 10 Year Old 2007 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Sweet lemon drizzle cake is followed by notes of yeasty sourdough and tickles of warming ginger. Buttery oak and bold barley bring warming spice beneath.
Finish: Drying oak and a distant touch of cardamom arrive toward the finish bringing a comforting edge of spice. Freshly baked madeleines cushion a touch of bitter almond.
Nose: Sweet plum, soft nectarine, and rhubarb and custard sweeties, joined by doughy iced fingers, Rich Tea biscuits, and oaken vanilla.

Name: Glen Moray Chardonnay Cask Finish - Elgin Classic
Palate: More vanilla, now with biscuity notes in support. Still has a lot of fresh fruit vibrancy.
Finish: A soft hint of woody spice.
Nose: Lemon, honey, pineapple, vanilla ice cream, buttered bread.

Name: SPEY Trutina
Palate: Almonds, buttered bread, orchard blossoms. Crisp and refreshing.
Finish: Medium length with notes of sugared peels.
Nose: Chocolate cheesecake, candied orange and fresh barley.

Name: Samuel Gulliver & Co. England's No.6
Palate: A burst of juicy pineapple and citrus, backed up by hints of savoury oak and a crackle of peppercorn heat.
Finish: Enjoyably spicy on the finish, mellowed by brown sugar and honey.
Nose: Warming malt and cakey vanilla, with a slow build of cinnamon and honeyed apple.

Name: Edradour Ballechin 18 Year Old Batch 1 - Cask Strength Edition
Palate: Mouthfilling layers of fruit salad and woody spice, juicy barley, and generous smoke.
Finish: A touch of tobacco, dried berries, and cough drops, with ginger, and pepper in tow.
Nose: Dried fruit drizzled with honey, roasted nuts, and smoky, gently medicinal peat.

Name: Filey Bay Double Oak #2
Palate: Soft and creamy layers of oaken vanilla and buttery barley support sweet, tropical dried fruits while cinnamon and toasted oak develop beneath.
Finish: A mellow finish with more vanilla cream, cough drops, and juicy stone fruits.
Nose: Floral malt, buttered tea cakes, and clotted cream, with banana fritters and drizzles of toffee.

Name: Ezra Brooks 99 Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
Palate: Milk chocolate, buttery at points, more cinnamon, brown sugar.
Finish: A solid kick of rye on the finish.
Nose: Cinnamon gum, vanilla pod, flamed orange peel.

Name: Michel Couvreur Blossoming Auld Sherried Single Malt Whisky
Palate: A warm, velvety and opulent mouthfeel with notes of Christmas cake, raisin, cinnamon stick and dried orange peel.
Finish: Long, rich and intense - the Christmas cake continues, with vanilla custard bringing a lighter sweetness in at the very end.
Nose: Opens with the aroma of maple syrup pancakes, giving way to rich black cherries, cloves, bread-and-butter pudding and treacle. Apple blossom and roast pork hints sneak in, too.

Name: High West Campfire Whiskey (70cl)
Palate: A big hit of rye, cinnamon and sultanas, before we're back in honeyed toffee territory. Peat completes the tail of the palate.
Finish: Sultanas, toffee and lingering peat smoke.
Nose: Golden syrup, peach, honey, a little rye spice and just a wisp of peat smoke.

Name: Hibiki 17 Year Old
Palate: Sweet and rich. There are crisp notes of mixed peels, raisin and custard with a little zest and plenty of oak.
Finish: Long with notes of oak and cocoa and sherried peels.
Nose: Quite full. There are notes of honey and wax, resin and oak. There are notes of gentle smoke and cacao, hints of cooked fruit and a nutty note.

Name: Wild Turkey 12 Year Old Distiller's Reserve
Palate: Brown sugar, fresh baked cookies, vanilla fudge, dark chocolate chips, and some candied orange peel.
Finish: Sweet spice, and warm, toasted oak.
Nose: Plenty of caramel and spice, with some clove, ginger, and black pepper.

Name: Speyside #2 25 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: A silken palate begins with praline, hazelnut and vanilla essence. Through subtle cedar, honey, dried apricot and maybe even a hint of rancio comes prickles of gingerbread, dark caramel and warming oak.
Finish: Long, rich and slightly peppered, with a hint of salted toffee below.
Nose: Through estery malt, candied fruit and nutty almond oil thereâs barley sugars and a hint of Turkish delight. A rich drying sensation from ginger and cinnamon develops as touches of lemon citrus and white oak influence emerge.

Name: Bulleit Rye
Palate: Rather hot at first, the spices coming to the forefront. This is followed by peaches, more cherries and a little bit of orange zest.
Finish: A smoky finish, carried by cinnamon, allspice and a hint of sweeties.
Nose: Big heaps of cherries and vanilla, with subtle notes of leather and tobacco.

Name: Glen Spey 21 Year Old 1997 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Summer berries and robust oak open the way for indulgent notes of Rolos and creamy milk chocolate.
Finish: A touch of salted caramel joins buttery oak toward the finish, while drying cinnamon and nutmeg nestle beneath.
Nose: Herbaceous layers of barley are balanced by soft poached stone fruits. Creamy layers of vanilla and oak join in time, with cooked apple and drizzles of honey.

Name: Texas Legation - Batch No.2
Palate: Fruitier than the nose, with notes of roasted apple and apricot. More BBQ char.
Finish: Cayenne pepper and brown sugar.
Nose: Cinnamon gum, corn-on-the-cob with lots of butter, a bit vegetal.

Name: Fettercairn 22 Year Old
Palate: Cherry, gingerbread, orange peels, pineapple and mango juiciness, soft earthy spices, another helping of cedar.
Finish: Lingering fruity coffee and honey notes.
Nose: Dried fruit and fresh green apples, buttered teacakes, cedar, a hint of hay.

Name: Super Nikka
Palate: Rich and malty. This is a simple blend, but one of great quality and balance. Notes of orange zest, toffee and oak, with hints of peanut butter and cocoa.
Finish: Decent length with stewed fruits, cloves, a hint of cinnamon and digestive biscuits.
Nose: Malty, notes of cooked apples, porridge oats, pear, beeswax and honey.

Name: Jatt Life Blended Irish Whiskey
Palate: Toffee, apple, oak spiciness with rounded sultana to mellow the warmth.
Finish: Apricot, peach and runny honey.
Nose: Peanut brittle, white pepper, raisins and a touch of spiced hot chocolate.

Name: Black Bottle 10 Year Old
Palate: Gingersnap biscuits and milk chocolate digestives, apple cake and pear drops alongside fragrant peat smoke.
Finish: Golden syrup and spiced banana bread, with cinnamon and a lingering smokiness.
Nose: Hints of smoke surround polished oak, aromatic spices and melted brown sugar, with apple sweeties and heather honey.

Name: Tomatin  15 Year Old 2006 Moscatel Cask - The Portuguese Collection
Palate: Chewy dates and candied orange peel, with twists of black pepper, and cinnamon.
Finish: Sticky fruitcake, with drizzles of caramel.
Nose: Treacle toffee, sweet orange peel, and oaky vanilla.

Name: Blair Athol 15 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: Oily walnuts, flamed orange peel, tangy red fruit, and marzipan.
Finish: Coffee, Turkish delight and just a hint of flaky sea salt.
Nose: Oak char, banoffee pie, and raisins with spicy hints of cardamom and cinnamon.

Name: Tomatin 15 Year Old 2006 Port Cask - The Portuguese Collection
Palate: Fruit compote, with sticky treacle tart, dark chocolate, and a touch of liquorice.
Finish: Oaky spice builds, along with sun-dried vine fruits.
Nose: Big helpings of dark berries, jammy cherries, and cacao nibs.

Name: Bowsaw Small Batch Bourbon
Palate: Crumbly fudge, black pepper, liquorice and lemon.
Finish: Biscuity, with caramel and more vanilla.
Nose: Toasted oak stave, fresh vanilla and a hint of toffee.

Name: Yamazaki 10 Year Old
Palate: The palate is of medium-body with notes of rich peels and winter spice, aniseed and a herbal note. A bitter oak develops.
Finish: The finish is dry and of good length with acacia honey.
Nose: The nose is fruity and rich. Plenty of barley malt and caramel, cereal sweetness and winter spice. Vanilla cream and mixed peels with a hint of nuts.

Name: The Temple Bar Signature Blend
Palate: Apples and vanilla lead into biscuity malt and candied ginger.
Finish: Spiced orchard fruit lingers.
Nose: Plum and pear fruitiness, with honeyed malt, touches of baking spice and vanilla.

Name: Singleton of Dufftown 12 Year Old Gift Pack with 2x Glasses
Palate: Orange zest spiciness perks up a malty core of nuts, oak and toffee, hints of cut grass.
Finish: Oaky, rich with good length, some fruit lingers.
Nose: Malty with cereal/barley sweetness, buttery toast, wood shavings, hay and walnut.

Name: The Glenlivet Caribbean Reserve
Palate: Ripe tropical fruit and brown sugar, along with cinnamon pastries.
Finish: Pineapple upside down cake.
Nose: Honeyed orchard fruit, tinned pear and fried banana.

Name: Berry Bros. & Rudd Islay - The Classic Range
Palate: Full-bodied malt notes blend with hints of citrus blossom and white grapes. Cut grass, earthy vanilla pod and oily barley are present in the backdrop.
Finish: Coastal smoke and a hint of brown sugar linger.
Nose: Faint charcoal and iodine aromas blend with orchard fruit, custard and toasted oak.

Name: Akashi Blue Label
Palate: Ginger, cinnamon, and pepper spice, with toasted oak, and dried apricots.
Finish: Spicy and sweet.
Nose: Marmalade, warm oak, woody spices, and vanilla.

Name: Benromach Contrasts Triple Distilled
Palate: Spiced banana bread, more fresh vanilla, and exotic fruit rest among fresh apple and floral malt.
Finish: Elegant smoke builds towards the finish, backed by creamy custard and sugar dusted fruit salad.
Nose: Delicate notes of rusk biscuits, vanilla pod, and sweet grist, with hints of grilled pineapple developing.

Name: Lismore 21 Year Old
Palate: Custard, cinnamon and Sherried fruit. Blood orange and sultanas.
Finish: Vanilla-y fudge and dried fruit.
Nose: Chelsea buns, brown sugar and some light wafts of peppery oak.

Name: Kingsbarns Balcomie
Palate: Pineapple upside down cake, marmalade and more cinnamon, with a touch of cocoa.
Finish: Apricot jam and chocolate-coated nuts.
Nose: Cinnamon scrolls and hot cross buns, with a drizzle of maple syrup and dried cherry.

Name: James Cree's Single Malt Scotch Whisky
Palate: Ginger and peppercorn, mellowed by a subtle chocolatey hint and caramelised nuts.
Finish: Orange peel, anise, more pepper, malt.
Nose: Raisin, vanilla, marzipan, a hint of grassy barley.

Name: Lindores Abbey The Exclusive Cask (cask 2018/0386)
Palate: Creamy and delicate, with tarte Tatin, floral honey, gently spicy oak, green malt, and more of that pear in tow.
Finish: Floral summer meadow, and peaches and cream linger.
Nose: Apple blossom, crunchy pear, and marshmallow sweetness, with creamy vanilla, and freshly baked croissant.

Name: Karuizawa 19 Year Old 1998 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: A salty manzanilla aspect, a deep resinous earthy quality and various matured game meats emerge through biting tannins and ginger root. As the palate develops thereâs a litany of flavours including aged Pinot Noir, soy sauce, bitter chocolate, dried herbs, blackberry and apple crumble and Sherry-rich notes of Christmas cake, blood orange and Maraschino cherries.
Finish: The finish is superbly long, dry, meaty and spice-rich.
Nose: A quilt of pure, earthy, salty, dark and warm notes coexist in masterful harmony here, from the supple fruitiness of Medjool dates, sultanas and preserved cherries to the thick richness of ancient polished oak furniture, menthol tobacco, rancio and worn leather. Caramelised muscovado sugar, almond syrup and wood spice form in the backdrop among lighter elements of green apple and banana as well as black truffle acacia honey.

Name: Black Bottle Andean Oak - Alchemy Series
Palate: Layers of vanilla, honey, and smoked toffee are joined by nutmeg and cinnamon.
Finish: Delicate smoke drifts through the sweet notes like nutty chocolate.
Nose: Through iodine and smoke comes hazelnut whip, figs, and fudge as well as baking spice.

Name: Whisky Works Speyside 20 Year Old
Palate: Raspberry and white chocolate muffin, balanced by cut herbs and Turkish delight, supported by milk chocolate and a hint of treacle.
Finish: Syrup sponge with vanilla cream lingers.
Nose: Sweet notes of freshly cut grass, with lemon drizzle and parma violets.

Name: Dalwhinnie 30 Year Old (Special Release 2020)
Palate: There's a peppery wood spice that comes through, alongside greener, herbal notes. The florals become increasingly drier, but the texture is lifted by some juicy orchard fruit notes. The library books become more leathery when water is added.
Finish: Long and lively, with lashings of warming sweet spices.
Nose: Like a dusty old library book next to an old-school loose tobacco jar, plus boiled sweets, herbal florals and wood shavings. There's a very subtle influence of struck match, too - but it adds colour and dimension rather than overpowering.

Name: Proper No. Twelve
Palate: Orchard fruit and honey notes arrive first, backed up by a kick of white pepper.
Finish: Drying oak heat and a drizzle of caramel.
Nose: Vanilla pod, floral barley and a touch of sandalwood.

Name: Corowa 4 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: The palate delivers on everything from the nose, with rich layers of citrus oil and course marmalade, bittersweet cacao, and flapjack studded with cranberries.
Finish: Spiced red fruits linger, with sweet charred oak, and a pinch of cracked black pepper.
Nose: Candied orange wheels, dipped in dark chocolate, roasted nuts, and a touch of honeyed granola, followed by a smidge of dried chilli flake spice.

Name: Glengoyne 17 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Plenty of dark fruits, blackberry compote mostly, with Armagnac-like pruniness and a little orange marmalade in support. Christmas cake, a little creamy nuttiness and some supple tannins build in the backdrop.
Finish: Dry, with roasted spices and a little caramel.
Nose: Full-bodied and filled with buttery goodness, the nose begins with lots of resinous sherried funk and thick, runny toffee. Then comes fruit: dates, sultana and red apples, with polished wood floors and ripe barley. Star anise and charred red pepper provide some intriguing notes underneath.

Name: Tamnavulin Tempranillo Cask
Palate: Chocolate raisins, dates, floral honey and dried apple with roasted cocoa notes, apricot and nectarine.
Finish: Oak spice, vanilla pod and forest fruit.
Nose: Blackberry jam and lots of cherry notes, with Christmas spices, malt loaf and vanilla custard.

Name: The Norfolk 9 Year Old Rye Whisky
Palate: Rich and oily with sweet and spicy notes of cocoa, orange zest and cinnamon.
Finish: Long and dry.
Nose: Lemon zest with a light herbal aroma of thyme.

Name: Blended Whisky #3 26 Year Old - Batch 2 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Silky layers of caramel join the chocolate notes from the nose, along with candied orange and honeyed prunes. Coffee and walnut cake develops in time, backed up by elegant wood smoke.
Finish: The flavours linger long after the last mouthful, with rounded layers of baked fruit, cakey spice, and smoked liquorice.
Nose: Stewed plums, figs, and dates are joined by spiced toffee apples, fruitcake, cherry chocolate, and a whisper of bonfire smoke.

Name: Bushmills Black Bush 80/20 PX Sherry Cask (1L)
Palate: Sherry sweetness, with warm oak, raisins, allspice, and almond praline.
Finish: The spice lingers, with hints of citrus.
Nose: Spicy fruitcake, candied orange peel, and syrupy flapjacks.

Name: Two Stacks Smoke & Mirrors
Palate: Chocolate peanuts, dry smoke once again, a slow build of orchard fruit and fragrant vanilla.
Finish: A prickle of smoky tea and hints of dark cocoa.
Nose: Chocolate mousse, barley, earthy smoke.

Name: Glen Elgin 15 Year Old 2008 (cask 800179) - Lady of the Glen (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Spicy, black pepper and ginger, with a creamy texture.
Finish: Honey and vanilla.
Nose: Honey, apples, vanilla and some cherry fruit.

Name: Kentucky Vintage
Palate: Bonfire toffee and rich spice on the palate. Cooked fruit and linseed oil. Buttery cereal grains.
Finish: Thick, creamy finish with zinging spices.
Nose: Hints of candied peel and creamy caramel. A little herbal note, with sultanas, butterscotch and just a faint whisper of smoke.

Name: Benromach Peat Smoke Sherry Cask Matured 2014 (bottled 2023)
Palate: Creamy vanilla, bramble berries, peat smoke, and nutmeg.
Finish: Long and spicy with woodsmoke underneath.
Nose: Blackcurrant compote, orange peel, toasted heather, and ginger.

Name: Mackmyra 3 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Warm, sweet, spicy and drying all at once, homemade apple juice bursts to the fore, while melting salted caramel and fresh-from-the-oven-cherry Bakewell tart relax amongst aromatic cinnamon and hot cumin.
Finish: Long and interesting, fizzy apple cables line the edge, while rich oak and a teasing whiff of smoke fade.
Nose: An interesting opening reveals sour apple sweets, lightly charred oak and warm butterscotch. Marzipan icing, vanilla custard, sweet pastry, cream cheese danish and barley twists all emerge and linger. A faint hint of fizzy cherry is there too, perhaps.

Name: Berry Bros. & Rudd Sherry Cask Matured - The Classic Range
Palate: Black fruit compote, herbal tea and a little bitter dark chocolate. Seville orange marmalade and fiery cinnamon add depth.
Finish: Christmas cake notes remain.
Nose: Blood orange juice, brown sugar and dried fruit lead with a hint of charred pineapple and perhaps some rancio.

Name: Templeton Rye 4 Year Old Signature Reserve
Palate: Black pepper, butterscotch, still slightly fruity with citrus and apple.
Finish: A touch of cask char works well with the lasting peppery warmth.
Nose: Rye bread, Nutella, orange oil and a touch of clove.

Name: The Pogues Whiskey
Palate: Smooth and creamy, toffee, vanilla, touch of dark chocolate, with some peachy fruit.
Finish: Dark chocolate, fudge, vanilla.
Nose: Sweet-smelling malt with waves of toffee to follow.

Name: Morris Australian Single Malt Whisky Muscat Barrel Finish
Palate: Dried fruits continue with prunes, sultanas, and more figgy notes bringing sweetness to the rich malty character. Soft vanilla and spice build alongside rich oak.
Finish: Sweet, rich oak, with creamy vanilla and lingering spice.
Nose: Rich, dark sugar, boozy dates, and figs with a medley of aromatic baking spice.

Name: SPEY TennÃ© Cask Strength - Batch 4
Palate: Black Forest gÃ¢teau, almonds, and oak spice with some silky caramel throughout.
Finish: Long and full of rich spice and jammy fruits.
Nose: Through woody tannins comes dried fruit, toffee apples, cinnamon, and vanilla.

Name: Roe & Co Irish Whiskey
Palate: The quality and perfect balance of the blend is immediately apparent on the palate through its velvety texture and sweet flavours including spiced pears and vanilla.
Finish: Lingering and gentle, ending with a light creaminess.
Nose: Creamy, delightfully fragrant and remarkably rounded with notes of soft spice and mellow spun sugar along with warm hints of woody vanilla.

Name: Benromach Cask Strength Vintage 2013 (bottled 2023) - Batch 01
Palate: Orange peel, nutmeg, dates, toffee apple, and smoky oak char.
Finish: Dry, rich, and full of dark fruit.
Nose: Stewed plums, toasted oak, cinnamon, and dark chocolate.

Name: Rebel Bourbon Tawny Port Barrel Finish
Palate: Cherry and chocolate come to the fore, with corn and caramel in the background.
Finish: Dried fruit lasts, with a dusting of nutmeg.
Nose: Melted butter, raisin, flakes almonds, savoury pepper notes.

Name: Connacht Batch One
Palate: Lots of toffee and creamy vanilla soothe the excitable spices that jump to the fore before a complement of dried fruits and rich malt adds depth.
Finish: An oily nutty quality lingers.
Nose: Seedless raisins drizzled with a little floral honey are joined by butterscotch and some ripe pears.

Name: SÃ¤ntis Malt Edition Sigel
Palate: More vanilla, lots of apple, and a wash of hops. There's a creaminess too, with a suggestion of milk chocoalate.
Finish: Medium, hoppy and gently spiced. Tasty.
Nose: Toasty and warming with oodles of cereal notes. Throw in vanilla and bundles of orchard fruits, and you've got Edition Sigel.

Name: Bad na h-Achlaise - Tuscan Oak
Palate: A slow build of peat on the palate, with continued apple, pear and blackberry offering a sweet balance.
Finish: Subtly peppery on the finish, plus a smidge of toasted bread.
Nose: Cut grass, stewed fruit, barley and a hint of brandy snap.

Name: Master of Malt Blended Scotch Whisky
Palate: Bright and fresh on the palate, with more honeyed notes shining through. Subtly grassy at points, leading to a gentle waft of coastal peat.
Finish: Lingering notes of rounded barley stick around on the finish.
Nose: Honeyed grains and green fruit freshness, with rich vanilla building underneath. A hint of meaty malt tucked away, too.

Name: Collectivum XXVIII (Special Release 2017)
Palate: Aniseed stands out with caramel. Pleasant creamy mouthfeel. Hints of allspice and clove but the spice never threatens to overpower.
Finish: Spicy and nutty with a hint of smoke.
Nose: Waxy with some ginger off that bat - Clynelish appears to play a meaningful role here. Perfumed with a touch of tonic before a little water reveals stewed fruits and Turkish delight.

Name: Compass Box The Story of the Spaniard
Palate: Sponge cake, chocolate chip and raisin cookies, almond.
Finish: Dried cherry, cinnamon and menthol.
Nose: Ripe blood orange and toasted vanilla pod. A few hints of fresh malt in the background.

Name: Blair Athol 14 Year Old 2008 (cask 807413) - Infrequent Flyers (Alistair Walker)
Palate: Sticky dates, with cinder toffee, Black Forest gateaux, and a touch of liquorice.
Finish: Peppery spice builds along with treacle notes.
Nose: Christmas pudding, with dried vine fruits, and a touch of hot chocolate.

Name: Compass Box Juveniles
Palate: Rich, creamy vanilla, barley sugar and pear drop, alongside layers of underlying herbal character.
Finish: Smooth, contrasting sweet and herbal notes.
Nose: Zesty and crisp, sugary notes.

Name: Port Dundas 29 Year Old 1988 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Initial cacao and tablet with rich dark honey and maple syrup goodness before juicy tropical fruits join the party.
Finish: Soft and creamy butterscotch dessert with a touch of oak.
Nose: Creamy ginger snaps and Biscoff, dried coconut, treacle tart and on into an array of baking spices and fruitcake territory.

Name: Teaninich 10 Year Old 2008 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Still bready, with fresh brown bread, slathered with creamy butter and set honey. Roasted almonds and citrus oil compliment a festive touch of spice.
Finish: Those crumbly notes from the nose return, with cooked apples, pears, and plums, joined by sweet, cakey spice.
Nose: Warm apple crumble, dusted with roasted nuts and spices lead to more savoury layers of grist and toasted seeded bread.

Name: Jura 29 Year Old 1992 â The Scalasaig
Palate: Sweet muscovado sugared apples, old oak and sea salt spray.
Finish: Warming toasted oak and lingering sweet spice.
Nose: Earthy, biscuity and with a touch of vanilla cream.

Name: Ardmore 12 Year Old  Fatherâs Day Edition â Premier Barrel (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Maple syrup, cinnamon sticks leading into toasty cereals, and layers of dry smoke.
Finish: Crunchy brown sugar and peanut brittle.
Nose: Softly smoky with touches of earthy peat sneaking out behind vanilla and biscuit dough.

Name: Filey Bay Sherry Cask Reserve #3
Palate: Fruit cake, barley sugar, Crunchie bars, and warm oaky spice.
Finish: Peppery spice and a touch of vanilla.
Nose: Runny honey, poached apples and pears, sweet cinnamon.

Name: Allt-Ã¡-Bhainne 22 Year Old 2000 (cask 9) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Walnuts, raspberry, coffee, and vanilla.
Finish: Long and rich.
Nose: Dark chocolate, dried fruit, digestive biscuit, and cinnamon.

Name: Never Say Die Barrel Strength Whiskey (Barrel No. 4)
Palate: Black pepper, nutmeg, allspice, with a good helping of caramel.
Finish: Peppery spice lingers along with honeycomb.
Nose: Lemon curd, with oak char, and warm baking spices.

Name: WhistlePig 12 Year Old - Old World
Palate: Red berry sweetness jumps out right away - raspberry, raisin and cherry notes. Drying cinnamon and nutmeg, joined by a hint of anise.
Finish: Honeyed cereal, white wine, mint leaf, dark chocolate.
Nose: Sponge cake topped with buttercream icing, chocolate chip cookies, a whiff of savoury oak.

Name: Jura The Sound
Palate: Orange syrup, rose petal, cherry and a touch of five-spice.
Finish: Chocolatey on the finish, joined by buttered brown bread.
Nose: Soft caramel and sultana notes. Burnt oak balanced by floral malt.

Name: Ardbeg 12 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish(Darkness)
Palate: Red fruit, bonfire embers, honey-roasted nuts, marmalade, and meaty malt.
Finish: Smoke, sea, and sherry mingle together for a while.
Nose: Dried fruit and rich smoke blend with coffee and juicy red apple sweetness.

Name: Waterford Peated - Ballybannon 1.1
Palate: Shortbread and toasted grain mingle with the peat, along with cinder toffee, oaky vanilla, and peppery spice.
Finish: Damp ashes and milk chocolate.
Nose: Earthy smoke, with creamy grain, and a touch of lemon zest.

Name: Dalmore 18 Year Old (2023 Edition)
Palate: Dark chocolate, candied citrus fruits, rich coffee, nutmeg, and soft liquorice.
Finish: Citrus fruits and rich molasses.
Nose: Vanilla, dark chocolate, orange, and cinnamon.

Name: CÃ¹ BÃ²can Creation #3
Palate: Rounded notes of treacle and peach, with some citrus acidity growing. A smidge of salinity offers a welcome balance.
Finish: Peppery, with a hint of paprika too. Still has brown sugar and warm fruit sweetness lingering.
Nose: Baked apple and cooked strawberry, cumin powder, anise, cedar and a smidge of cask char.

Name: The Hive Batch Strength 002 (Wemyss Malts)
Palate: Floral orange blossom bursts open, alongside orange oil and beeswax with honeyed oats. Mouthcoating indeed.
Finish: Oodles of honeycomb which eventually dissipate for a clean and refreshing finish.
Nose: Runny honey on hot buttered toast with a sprinkle of cinnamon, with juicy oranges and stone fruit. Bread and butter pudding with a dollop of custard.

Name: Heaven Hill 11 Year Old 2009 (cask 152735) - Stateside (Heroes & Heretics) - Master of Malt Exclusive
Palate: Maple syrup drizzled over chocolate chip waffles, nutmeg, crÃ¨me caramel, spiced walnut loaf, and cask char.
Finish: Clementine, liquorice, butterscotch, diced almond, plus a hint of stem ginger lingering.
Nose: Toasted coconut flakes, banana fritters, melted butter on crumpets, cinnamon buns, and strong coffee.

Name: Cotswolds Reserve Single Malt Whisky
Palate: Custard cream biscuits, lemon cheesecake, more chocolatey hints, with some nutmeg heat.
Finish: Vanilla pod hints last.
Nose: Richly packed with vanilla and honey, plus a smidge of dark chocolate mousse.

Name: Glencadam 11 Year Old (Parcel No.10) - Reserve Casks (The Single Malts of Scotland)
Palate: Creamy cereal notes, with black pepper and allspice, and some sticky malt loaf.
Finish: Stone fruits and zesty spices.
Nose: Shortbread, with gorse flowers, and dollops of lemon curd.

Name: Penderyn Ex Rye Casks Small Batch
Palate: Apple peel and spiced apple compote are joined by a green and black peppercorns, and some lemon curd.
Finish: Creamy porridge, and more peppery spice.
Nose: Apple strudel, cinnamon, oaky vanilla, and drizzles of caramel.

Name: Ardbeg Scorch
Palate: Soot, salty liquorice, a hint of toasted brown sugar adds welcome sweetness.
Finish: A long, richly smoky finish.
Nose: Roasted barley and bonfire smoke, with a hint of clove to it later on.

Name: Miltonduff 10 Year Old - Discovery (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Chocolate and butterscotch bring sweetness, while a touch of clove gives it some well-needed warmth.
Finish: Blackberry jam and cinnamon.
Nose: Toffee apples, rum-soaked raisins and fresh malt.

Name: Glen Spey 10 Year Old 2011 â The Half Moon (James Eadie)
Palate: Fresh vanilla and more barley, followed by a splash of juicy pear.
Finish: Dried peels and stem ginger.
Nose: Honeydew melon, nutty malt, and a touch of sawdust.

Name: Old Pulteney 2006 Vintage (1L)
Palate: Somewhat oily, with a vibrant burst of citrus, with tangy grapefruit and lemon, leading into honeyed malt cereal, brioche and coconut cream balanced by maritime salinity, with a sea breeze running throughout.
Finish: Vanilla, oak spice, sweet malt and oak char.
Nose: Sharp green apple skin, with lemon drizzle cake, desiccated coconut, salted caramel and buttery croissant.

Name: Compass Box Hedonism
Palate: Very sensual, disarmingly sleek and creamy. Black cherry and sweet spices, some cereal notes.
Finish: Very warm and spiced, toasty, some oak and milk chocolate.
Nose: From the first delectable introduction, Hedonism is all ripe fruit, fraises des bois and sponge cake. Some red pepper provides an interesting point to mull.

Name: Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve Gift Pack with 2x Glasses
Palate: Smooth and succulent with a honeyed sweetness that's typical of Johnnie Walker. There's more to this though, the floral elements are quite prominent and there's a spiced sweet vanilla note too.
Finish: Long, sweet and toffee-like.
Nose: Honey and heather with thick caramel notes and a subtle nutmeg spice. Dried meadow flowers and a hint of fresh banana.

Name: Teeling 21 Year Old - Rising Reserve No.1
Palate: Dark chocolate, oaky spice, honey, pear, and candyfloss.
Finish: Long, sweet, and rich.
Nose: Heaps of orchard fruit and citrus are joined by baking spice and caramel.

Name: Single Malt Irish Whiskey 8 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: More honey! More apricot! A little hint of cracked black pepper at the core.
Finish: Buttered toast and Seville orange marmalade.
Nose: Apricot, whipped cream, honey and barley.

Name: Strathisla 9 Year Old 2013 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Aromatic baking spice with milk chocolate, fizzy cherry, and toffee apples in support as well as a hint of crystallised ginger.
Finish: Caramel and oak char linger.
Nose: An aroma of Rosey Apples is joined by lemon shortbread, oily orange, honeyed toast, chocolate-covered ginger, and vanilla.

Name: Glen Elgin 12 Year Old
Palate: A soft, malty palate with hints of salty butter, Corinth raisins, walnut loaf and coffee ice-cream.
Finish: A long, malt-driven finish with hints of sugary porridge on the tail.
Nose: Cereal sweetness on the nose, with hints of rum spice, a little espresso coffee, toffee apples and ginger.

Name: Auchentoshan Dark Oak (1L)
Palate: Intense wafts of raisin and dark chocolate bitterness, followed by soft whiffs of fresh barley.
Finish: Fruitcake, coffee bean, lemon and a hint of dried oak.
Nose: Heather honey, chocolate ice cream and spice fruit compote.

Name: Macduff 13 Year Old 2009 (cask 4093) - Lady of the Glen (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Poached apricot and more honey sweetness with winter spices and candied nuts. Oaken vanilla and baked apples follow.
Finish: Still nutty with notes of maple and marzipan, followed by a touch of root ginger and green peppercorn heat.
Nose: Creamy grist, a hint of sawdust, peanut brittle, and dried oranges, with melted butter and honeyed fruit.

Name: Strathmill 13 Year Old 2009 (cask 367345 & 367346) - James Eadie
Palate: Sweet and nutty, with raisins, and toasted walnuts.
Finish: Dark chocolate and fragrant spices.
Nose: Rich and fruity, with hazelnut milk chocolate, and leather.

Name: Jura 12 Year Old The Bay
Palate: Stem ginger, stewed berries, a hint of hickory, crumbly fudge.
Finish: A smidge of liquorice pokes out on the finish, along with more toffee sweetness.
Nose: Caramelised nut and toffee apples, with a dusting of cinnamon and nutmeg.

Name: The XXX Blend - Batch 1
Palate: Nutty baklava, lemon curd, toffee popcorn again, spicy caraway, mature oak. Enjoyably buttery on the mid-palate, leading to frangipane and Ricicles in milk notes.
Finish: Apples from the nose return, dotted with pear drops and plump raisins, with soft anise and clove carrying on and on.
Nose: Warm apple turnovers with a dollop of vanilla ice cream, strawberry jam sandwiches, slowly developing aromatic cedar, with a touch of perfumed malt, too. New leather, brioche, and toffee popcorn.

Name: Islay #1 - Batch 1 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: A drop of water helps open this fruity, toasty whisky with tangy peaty complementing the fruit.
Finish: Tasty toasted cornflakes and aromatic spices.
Nose: Nutty oak and subtle (coal-like, in fact) peat. Slightly meaty pine nuts with caraway, cereal and yellow fruit.

Name: Linkwood 12 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
Palate: Medium, oily. Honey, pine oil. Malt, almond.
Finish: Quite long, dry, touch of anise.
Nose: Quite green, thick. Herbal, nutty, oily. Almond.

Name: Jack Daniel's Tennessee Whiskey Legacy Edition 2
Palate: Orange zest, cereal sweetness and toasty oak, with a little spice and toffee.
Finish: Smooth and soft, with a hint of banana milkshake.
Nose: Butterscotch, vanilla and fresh apples.

Name: Hakushu 18 Year Old
Palate: Patisserie sweet, baked goods and baked goodness!
Finish: Long and fruity with Manuka honey with subtle smokiness.
Nose: Orange, pear and a dry smokiness. Fruit salad.

Name: The Glenrothes 11 Year Old - Discovery (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Forest fruit jam on fresh toast, perhaps slightly burnt, with stewed orchard fruit and more cinnamon.
Finish: Orange peel, a hint of raisin and melted dark chocolate.
Nose: Cinnamon butter, chocolate covered toffee and toasted malt, with sherried dried fruit and more baking spices.

Name: Macaloneyâs Caledonian (cask 66) - Invermallie Ex-Bourbon Cask
Palate: Honeycomb, apple compote, crumbly fudge, vanilla custard, and clove.
Finish: Warm spices linger along with gently toasted oak.
Nose: Oaky vanilla, set honey, some dried apricot, and peppery spices.

Name: The Scalasaig Island Hopper
Palate: Still coastal with a touch of flint, balanced by rum-soaked fruit and some floral barley notes.
Finish: Vanilla pods, milk chocolate and peppery malt.
Nose: Rock pools and toasted oak, followed by sponge cake and gingerbread.

Name: Aultmore 13 Year Old 2006 (Master of Malt)
Palate: The creaminess continues, superbly soft with elegant layers of butterscotch and lemon shortbread.
Finish: Juicy tropical fruits and hints of porridge oats keep things magnificently silky, with freshly baked sponge cake, a touch of honeyed almond, and subtle oak char.
Nose: Rich tea biscuits, a hint of guava, warm custard, and creamy rice pudding.

Name: Milk & Honey Apex - Dead Sea
Palate: Toffee and toasted sugar, with cassia, liquorice, fragrant black tea, and chocolate in support.
Finish: A subtle salinity develops on the finish.
Nose: Milky coffee, cinnamon sticks with a few oaky notes to it, tobacco.

Name: Glencadam 13 Year Old - The Reawakening
Palate: Juicy pear and grapefruit. A touch of rye bread and marmalade. Peppery at points.
Finish: Lingering cinnamon and poached fruit warmth.
Nose: Grassy malt leading into vanilla-rich fudge and lemon oil.

Name: Caol Ila 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 15555) - Old Particular Fanatical About Flavour (Douglas Laing) (Master of Malt Exclusive)
Palate: Mouth-coating, oily malt leads the way for a hefty hit of spice. Medicinal peat smoke with smouldering embers and earthy ash are lifted by a touch of seaweed and lemon zest.
Finish: Drying charcoal, yet more seaside bonfire character with sooty salinity and wood smoke. Dried fruits, cinnamon, and mixed spice bring zesty, peppery warmth.
Nose: Classicly coastal with chalky grist, salty spray, peat, and tar.

Name: Kingsbarns Balcomie Cask Strength
Palate: Some tropical fruit, along with dried apricots, tawny marmalade, cinnamon, clove, and some dark chocolate.
Finish: Sweet and spicy, with some toasted walnuts.
Nose: Warm, woody spices, with candied orange peel, dried currants, and brown sugar.

Name: Lot 40 Dark Oak
Palate: Burnt brown sugar, red chilli earthiness, and a touch of menthol herbs.
Finish: Spicy and medium-length.
Nose: Nutmeg and cinnamon prickle through charred oak, vanilla custard, and sour cherries.

Name: Rock Island Sherry Edition
Palate: Soft peat smoke and salted crackers, juxtaposed by strawberry jam and stem ginger.
Finish: Lasting salted caramel and cinnamon.
Nose: Raisins, toasted brown sugar, sea spray and cured meats.

Name: Glenfiddich 15 Year Old - Perpetual Collection Vat 03
Palate: Bourbon and sherry character mingle, with toasted nuts alongside oaky sweetness, and warm spices.
Finish: Sweet fruitcake lingers.
Nose: Plenty of sherry coming through, with dried vine fruits, soft brown sugar, and oaky vanilla.

Name: The Quiet Man 12 Year Old Oloroso Sherry Cask Finish
Palate: Grassy at first, with a crisp hint of apple. Soon enough, you'll find hints of milk chocolate and spiced rum sweetness.
Finish: Lasting BBQ pineapple and chocolate-coated peanut notes.
Nose: Melon, raisin and vanilla ice cream. A hint of sawdust underneath.

Name: Lismore 18 Year Old
Palate: Honey-roasted peanuts, old oak and chewy caramels.
Finish: Fruity sweetness develops on the finish.
Nose: Lightly floral at first, followed by thick notes of chocolate and toffee.

Name: Glen Grant 27 Year Old 1995 (casks 88229 & 88235) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Rich and robust with sticky toffee pudding, orange peel, and damson jam.
Finish: Long and spicy.
Nose: Toasted almonds, citrus, raisins, and aniseed.

Name: Black Bottle Smoke & Dagger - Alchemy Series
Palate: Lots more of that peaty power is tempered by honeyed barley, oaky vanilla, old-school boiled sweets, and toffee.
Finish: Smoke and salted caramel remain.
Nose: Initial notes of TCP, coastal peat, burnt rubber, smoked herbs, and seaweed. Itâs a big, seaside-smoke-fest, supported by notes of salted caramel and toasted barley.

Name: Scallywag Three Peaks Edition
Palate: Through more aromatic layers of baking spices there's caramel, red fruit, orange zest, and liquorice.
Finish: Long lasting with waves of ginger and chocolate.
Nose: Dried fruit and nutmeg are joined by sweet vanilla and dark chocolate.

Name: Bunnahabhain 16 Year Old - Founder's Collection (The Whisky Baron)
Palate: Victoria vanilla sponge with vanilla cream, with even more prominent floral honey, creamy caramel and peach.
Finish: Juicy apricot bursts onto the finish with very gentle oak spices lingering.
Nose: Delicate, sweet and creamy, with lots of vanilla and floral honey, developing into dried apricot and iced buns.

Name: J.G. Thomson Rich Blended Malt
Palate: A tangy hint of orange peel as it opens, followed by treacle and blackberry.
Finish: More ginger, now with nutmeg and a hint of red chilli flake, rounded by dried fruit and honey.
Nose: Almonds, cherries, fig, ginger, and brandy snaps.

Name: The Deveron 12 Year Old
Palate: A core of butterscotch with waxy malt and apple pie.
Finish: Wood spice, vanilla and soft oakiness.
Nose: Sweet baking spice, toffee apples and ginger.

Name: Connemara Peated
Palate: Full and smooth with notes of malt and peat, honeyed smoke and barley sweetness.
Finish: Long and pungent with honey and peat smoke.
Nose: Well-smoked and peated, heather freshness and floral notes with a honeyed sweetness and a little wood.

Name: High Coast Timmer - Peat Smoke
Palate: A generous burst of warming smoke opens the palate, then smoked bacon, dried apricot, milky coffee and buttery fudge follow. Crystallised ginger adds bite, with boiled sweets and oak char emerging underneath.
Finish: Burnt buttered toast and sweet toffee linger, with a little drying oak.
Nose: Through grassy, creamy malt thereâs tropical fruit, citrus zest, crumbly vanilla biscuits and layers of elegant peat smoke.

Name: Glen Moray 30 Year Old 1992 - Edition No.65B (Whisky Sponge & Decadent Drinks)
Palate: Stewed dates, dark muscovado sugar, earthy coffee, toasted almonds, a touch of menthol, and cocoa.
Finish: Spiced fruit loaf with sweet cinnamon.
Nose: Jammy dark fruits, rancio, and dark chocolate with heaps of aromatic spice.

Name: Tamnavulin Sherry Cask Edition
Palate: Cadbury's Fruit & Nut, more pastry notes, honeycomb and Christmas cake.
Finish: Dried apricot, citrus peels and vanilla pod.
Nose: Brown sugar, gingersnaps and cinnamon rolls, raspberry jam and a hint of toasted malt.

Name: The Cardrona Otago Pinot Cask - Cardrona Day Special Release
Palate: Sweet layers of toffee, grilled peach, and berry coulis are joined by spiced fruit cake and honey-roasted nuts.
Finish: Lasting notes of jammy fruit, almond butter, a hint of anise, and charred oak.
Nose: Plum jam, fresh apricots, and a touch of vanilla fudge.

Name: Pig's Nose
Palate: Creamy and sweet. Soft, gentle, quite gristy, rather oily and slightly coastal. Hints of salt.
Finish: Medium length, salty butters and caramel.
Nose: Gristy and youthful, some fruit, barley malt, porridge. Young but very sweet.

Name: Tullamore D.E.W. 18 Year Old Single Malt
Palate: Soft fruit as it opens, leading into bourbon-cask vanilla and toasted bread.
Finish: Caramel and chocolate, with a zesty spark of orange and fruitcake.
Nose: Spicy malt with developing hints of sherry-soaked raisin and cinnamon.

Name: Deanston 17 Year Old 2002 Organic Pedro XimÃ©nez Cask Finish
Palate: Malted milk biscuits dipped in coffee, crunchy brown sugar, a whisper of dried peels and bright sultanas.
Finish: Ginger, clove and honey.
Nose: Rum-soaked fruit, enjoyably malty with a good whack of milk chocolate.

Name: Bellevoye Blanc
Palate: More biscuit notes here (now it's Hobnobs and chocolate-chip cookies), with refreshing nectarine and honeydew melon developing.
Finish: Soft oak peppery hints shoot out from behind white grape and toffee.
Nose: Fig, lemon, vanilla ice cream and chocolate digestives.

Name: Bunnahabhain 19 Year Old 2001 (Release No.11822) - The Stories of Wind & Wave (The Character of Islay Whisky Company)
Bottler: The Character of Islay Whisky Company
Palate: Lots of dried fruits here - redcurrants, prunes, sultanas. Quite chocolatey, too.
Finish: Runny caramel, and a generous handful of festive spices.
Nose: Fudge, raisin, crunchy brown sugar, a touch of new leather richness.

Name: Port Askaig 28 Year Old
Palate: Salinity dominates the palate, with mature oak and smoke in equal measure. Develops a floral hint of heather later on, alongside some dried apple sweetness.
Finish: Spicy cedar, sea salt, lemon peel and peach.
Nose: Tarry ropes, smoked almonds and buttered crumpets.

Name: Caol Ila 12 Year Old (Parcel No.10) - Reserve Casks (The Single Malts of Scotland)
Palate: Very moreish, with smoked, cured meats, and redcurrant jelly.
Finish: Lingering peat, with smoked almonds, and some sea spray.
Nose: Savoury, meaty smoke, with red fruits giving it a barbecue sauce quality.

Name: Balblair 9 Year Old 2009 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Creamy notes of foam bananas and vanilla custard, with vibrant malt leading to powerful chilli and black pepper spice.
Finish: Things remain crisp on the finish, with a hint of brine and a sprinkle of cocoa.
Nose: Ground almonds, cinnamon swirls, and hazelnut cream horns.

Name: Both Barrels Blended Malt Scotch Whisky
Palate: Gingerbread and honeyed pastry lead to red berries and creamy malt, with gentle oak char and butterscotch joining along the way.
Finish: Lingering baking spices and stewed fruits, with biscuity barley and warming prickles of ginger.
Nose: Candied oranges, dipped in chocolate with buttery oak, and vanilla.

Name: Pure Scot
Palate: Full-bodied and mellow. Beautifully balanced rich smokiness with ginger marmalade, sweet honeyed fruit and slightly peppery.
Finish: Spicy and smoky, long lasting and satisfying.
Nose: Rich and fragrant. Old leather, toffee and fruit cake, malty with a hint of smoke.

Name: Compass Box Flaming Heart (2022 Edition)
Palate: Meaty smoke, sizzling bacon, caramelised maple, with rich baking spices.
Finish: Savoury smoke lingers, with peppery spice building.
Nose: Rich, smouldering embers, with toasted oak, gingerbread, and twists of waxy lemon.

Name: Peat Bomb 8 Year Old
Palate: Brown sugar, nutmeg, roast chestnuts, cask char, loads of phenolic notes drifting in.
Finish: Savoury oak with singed barley and sea salt crisps.
Nose: Oatcakes, smoky bacon crisps, baked earth, cracked black pepper, with a whisper of caramelised nuts underneath.

Name: Longmorn 10 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Baking spice, toffee and dark fruits, with some minty herbal notes, orange zest and drying oak.
Finish: Black pepper heat develops alongside white grapes and shortbread.
Nose: Sponge cake with honey and strawberry jam initially, then a bit of floral barley and toasted oats. A hint of orchard fruit and wood spice underneath.

Name: Wire Works Caduro
Palate: Layers of honeyed stone fruit and caramelised nuts are joined by hot cross buns, a touch of anise, and chocolate-dipped orange wheels. Creamy malt rests in the depths, with generous charred oak.
Finish: Subtle peat smoke wraps things up, while sweet, creamy notes of vanilla custard counter hints of gingery warmth.
Nose: Orchard fruit leads with crisp apple and candied citrus zest. Sweet Pear Drops and buttery fudge follow, joined by crushed almonds, vanilla cream, and roasted barley.

Name: Highland Park Triskelion
Palate: Chunky orange marmalade and honeyed toast, with waves of floral peat smoke alongside plump dried fruit.
Finish: Dried apricot and flamed orange peel.
Nose: Smoked heather, fragrant lemon citrus and orange pith, with a hint of peach.

Name: Caol Ila 12 Year Old 2010 Tulip Edition - DS Tayman
Palate: Red berry sweetness and a whisper of grenadine balance smouldering peat smoke and robust roasted malt.
Finish: Beach bonfire lingers with soft salinity while candied citrus and fruit crumble balance prickles of spice.
Nose: Rich wafts of oak char, salted lemons, and fresh plums with wisps of coastal peat.

Name: Pike Creek 10 Year Old
Palate: Old-fashioned cola cubes, cardamom heat, caramel and a clear suggestion of good rum.
Finish: Lasting notes of brown sugar and dried oak.
Nose: Honey'd raisins and pecans, with a spicy little kick of herbaceous rye hiding in there.

Name: Tullamore D.E.W. 14 Year Old Single Malt
Palate: Big, creamy malt with loads of vanilla tannins. Ripe, sweet red grapes and a hint of poached apple.
Finish: Sherried sweetness carries on.
Nose: Zesty citrus, grilled pineapple and slowly building bourbon-y vanilla.

Name: Auchentoshan Blood Oak
Palate: Some classic red-wine spiciness starts to ramp up on the palate, with a little bit of Christmas-y clove. Citrus sits in the background.
Finish: Spicy and drying on the finish.
Nose: Juicy and rich with elegant wine notes, joined by a touch of golden barley.

Name: Mannochmore 14 Year Old 2007 (Mossburn) (Drinks by the Dram)
