Palate: Caramelised nuts, zesty marmalade, drying clove, and stewed stone fruits join the party among cooked apple, and dark chocolate.
Finish: Long, spicy, and with a hint of complex black tea tannins.
Nose: Sparkling fruit freshness typical of Mannachmore joined by darker, sticker raisins and dates as well as salted caramel, and a little ginger.

Name: The Glenlivet Founder's Reserve
Palate: Fruity, then sweet, more toffee, a touch of anise, then into milk chocolate Flakes, banoffee pie and apple turnovers.
Finish: Creamy toffee to the fore now, a little oak and sweet barley sugar warmth too. Milk chocolate raisins linger.
Nose: Some dates then what at first appears to be a touch of salinity, but is better described as a slightly sharp plum and apricot wine note. There's orange zest, toffee, hints of struck match and chocolate raisins, but before this starts to sound 'Sherried' there's also pear drops, a dusting of sweet cinnamon, honeysuckle and sweet pea.

Name: Nikka Days Gift Pack with 2x Glasses
Palate: Smooth and creamy, roasted nuts, toffee apple, toasty malted cereal and vanilla fudge alongside a hint of barrel char, freshened up by juicy apples.
Finish: Buttery lemon shortbread sprinkled with sugar and vanilla pod.
Nose: Fresh and fruity apples, pears, honeydew melon and strawberry, orange oil, malt sweetness and lemon cheesecake.

Name: Teeling Virgin Portuguese Oak - Wonders of Wood Second Edition
Palate: Warming with cloves, nutmeg, and toasted oak joined by malty vanilla, orchard fruit, and tobacco.
Finish: More citrus, spice, and oaky warmth.
Nose: Rich marmalade, oaky spice, old leather, and orange peel.

Name: Never Say Die Barrel Strength Whiskey (Barrel No.5) - Master of Malt Exclusive
Palate: Chewy rye spice, cardamom, thick toffee, and wood char.
Finish: Something like salted caramel, with drying tobacco and cinnamon.
Nose: Black pepper, buttery vanilla, marmalade, and baking spices.

Name: Balcones Baby Blue Corn
Palate: Rich, thick, palate entry. A touch of dark caramel and baked apple. Baking spices, salted butter.
Finish: Spiced, medium finish. Quite sweet.
Nose: Soft vanilla and notes of candied peel. Caramelised bananas, toasted oak and a little creamy cereal sweetness.

Name: Woodford Reserve Kentucky Bourbon â Father's Day Edition
Palate: Thick and full. There are notes of espresso beans, winter spice, cereal sweetness, plenty of rye, ground ginger, almond oil, toasty oak and a little rum.
Finish: Long and mature with notes of cereals and toasty oaken spice.
Nose: Quite thick and creamy. There are notes of honey and spice, leather, a touch of cocoa, a little smoke, toasty oak and vanilla cream with a hint of butterscotch.

Name: Bushmills Red Bush
Palate: Butterscotch, nutmeg and vanilla, with hot buttered toast and a good helping of floral honey, and earthy oak makes an appearance.
Finish: A short and dry finish, full of tannic spicy oak.
Nose: A floral bouquet with lovely biscuity malt and apple crumble alongside lots of cinnamon and vanilla custard, with a touch of honeydew melon fruitiness.

Name: Loch Lomond Single Grain
Palate: Pineapple starts to develop on the palate, with a touch or two of oak spice keeping it from becoming overly sweet.
Finish: Continued fruity freshness.
Nose: Plenty of sweet, fruity grain character here. Citrus peels, icing sugar, a little bit of grassiness.

Name: Glen Elgin Smoke & Citrus Peated Finish - Cask Craft (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Fresh blueberry, sweet malt, and smouldering bonfire smoke.
Finish: Charred lemon peel, runny honey, and sweet smoke on the tail end.
Nose: Juicy citrus, candied ginger, and coastal smoke, with wood char in tow.

Name: Wolfburn Kylver Series - Release 3
Palate: Crunchy brown sugar followed by banana fritters (with a hint of smoke carrying on) and oily walnut.
Finish: Quite long and spicy, with cinnamon and nutmeg lingering on the finish.
Nose: Soft waves of fresh vanilla pod and angelica give it plenty of vanilla notes early on. These are soon joined by waxy fruit and a hint of charred oak cutting through the sweetness.

Name: Braeval 21 Year Old 2000 (cask 6392) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Sweet, sticky toffee notes open up, alongside sherried fruitcake and baking spice, dark cherry, oily oak with hints of warming clove.
Finish: Sweet orange zest kicks in, with more nuttiness and roasted malt, and heaps of cakey spice.
Nose: Sweet apricot and figs, toasted nuts, a whiff of dark ginger cake.

Name: Starward Vitalis
Palate: Cocoa nibs, dried cherries and currants, drizzles of treacle, and toasted macadamia nut.
Finish: Warm oaky spice builds alongside the fruit.
Nose: Cinder toffee, with malt loaf, chocolate shavings, a touch of tropical fruit and woody spice.

Name: Copperworks 3 Year Old - Batch 2 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Hearty helpings of chewy malt, toasted granary bread, and oaken spice are joined by candied oranges and chocolate coffee beans.
Finish: Bittersweet zest, hints of tobacco, and lingering oaken spice.
Nose: Big layers of roasted barley and buttered malt loaf, backed by leathery oak and cigar box spice.

Name: J.P. Wiser's 18 Year Old
Palate: Juicy orchard fruits come to the fore on the palate - think pear, apple and nectarine. Hints of black pepper and spicy cedar sit in the background.
Finish: Slightly nutty, with more hot oak and a generous dollop of caramel.
Nose: Milky coffee, fresh citrus, layers of butterscotch and honey.

Name: Writers Tears Ulysses
Palate: Honey develops on the palate. Mellow notes of vanilla and golden malt. Green apple skin, caramel and a hint of oak.
Finish: Warming, sweet and long.
Nose: Soft and sweet with thick honey spread on granary toast. Hints of citrus peels.

Name: Glengoyne 15 Year Old
Palate: Oily, rich palate entry with notes of toffee popcorn, salted butter and hints of ground walnuts. Allspice and lemon rinds, and baked apple.
Finish: Oaky, malty finish.
Nose: Hints of candied lemon and a touch of butterscotch. Creamy cereal sweetness and dried fruits, with Demerara sugar.

Name: Deanston 12 Year Old 2007 Calvados Cask Finish
Palate: Creamy barley and sweet caramel lead to sharp apple, bringing a crisp, zesty character. Silky honeyed fruits follow alongside gentle woody spice.
Finish: Sweet citrus zest and fresh, crunchy apples tangle with lasting notes of biscuity malt and runny caramel.
Nose: Layers of butterscotch mingle with green apple peels, sweet oak, and rich orchard honey.

Name: Cambridge Circus 32 Year Old - Single & Single
Palate: Roast chestnuts, nectarines, chewy dates, barley sugar sweeties, earthy oak.
Finish: Clove, savoury smoke, a final touch of espresso.
Nose: Chocolate orange, cinnamon sticks, a hint of heather honey and coastal peat.

Name: Cameronbridge 27 Year Old - Batch 3 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Extra-thick double cream dolloped upon a pile of strawberries. Butterscotch and sugary shortbread hide underneath.
Finish: Peanut brittle and salted caramel.
Nose: Hazelnut, chocolate and ice-cream cones. A soft hint of cinnamon gives it a warming, festive style.

Name: Whisky Works King of Trees 10 Year Old
Palate: Dark fruit compote, dried citrus peels and a helping of barley sugar at first, with a little vanilla, a hint of balancing wood spice and a touch of creamy nuttiness.
Finish: Slightly drying, a little spicy and a lingering syrupy sweet.
Nose: White grapes, green apples and butterscotch, then sherbet lemons, golden barley and a flicker of nutmeg. Thereâs a note of Victoria sponge cake with fresh raspberries present too before dried fruit and woody tannins emerge.

Name: Dailuaine Bourbon Quarter Cask - Cask Craft (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Banana ice cream, cinnamon butter, and vanilla, with zingy green apple bringing balance.
Finish: A drizzle of caramel over crisp stone fruit.
Nose: Apple crumble and custard, fresh thyme, and underripe pear.

Name: Glenmorangie The Tribute 16 Year Old
Palate: Easygoing vanilla and creamy lemon posset, salted almonds and tobacco. Subtle peat smoke murmurs throughout, carried by sweet, light and zesty fruit.
Finish: Sweet, crumbly fudge and lemon drizzle balance suggestions of peat smoke and tangy oak.
Nose: Floral, spring meadows and freshly mowed grass, gentle wafts of peat and charred oak, fruity citrus, crÃ¨me caramel.

Name: Helsinki Distilling Company 6 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Pine, apricot, liquorice, honey, and just a smidge of smoke.
Finish: Caramelised nuts and another crackle of pepper.
Nose: Linseed oil, peppercorn, a hint of freshly ground coffee.

Name: Ballantine's Barrel Smooth (1L)
Palate: Biscuity malt and toasted oats, drizzled with honey, backed up by creamy vanilla and a pinch of anise.
Finish: Oaken vanilla lingers, with butterscotch, and a touch of citrus in tow.
Nose: Soft caramel, buttered toast, crisp orchard fruits, and toasted oak.

Name: Jura 12 Year Old Gift Pack with 2x Glasses
Palate: Chocolate fudge, pear, a portion of peppery malt tucked away.
Finish: Sherbet lemons and sultanas.
Nose: Nutty barley, white wine, cinnamon, melon.

Name: Annandale Man OâWords Vintage 2017 - S.T.R. Cask (cask 343)
Palate: Dark berries, creamy malt, oak char, and apple tart with cinnamon.
Finish: Soft winter spices and buttery pastries.
Nose: Buttered shortbread, prunes, apples, and oaky vanilla.

Name: The Deveron 10 Year Old
Palate: Sponge cake, runny honey, plump apricot, slightly buttery.
Finish: Caramel, peanuts, more zesty apple notes.
Nose: Green apple, orange boiled sweeties, a hint of oily malt.

Name: Ballantine's 12 Year Old
Palate: Rather creamy. Mochaccino and buttery pastry, spice.
Finish: Gentle, spice and fruitcake.
Nose: Fruit salad and sherry, mixed nuts.

Name: Blair Athol 8 Year Old (Release 1) - Concept 8
Palate: Apricot pastries, honeycomb, and citrus blossom balance prickly barley spice.
Finish: Creamy vanilla fudge, baking spice, jam tarts, and peppery oak.
Nose: Sweet syrup flapjacks and peach with a touch of zesty minerality.

Name: Chivas Regal Mizunara
Palate: Floral and sweet, though hints of baking spices bring balance and body.
Finish: Still packed with fruit, with a hint of aniseed hiding within.
Nose: White peach, toffee-coated pears and vanilla-rich cream. Subtly nutty.

Name: Mannochmore Rich & Fruity Port Finish - Cask Craft (Murray McDavid)
Palate: A dusting of cocoa, runny honey, juicy sultana, and peppery oak.
Finish: Hints of new leather alongside more chocolate and jammy red fruits.
Nose: Forest fruits, maple syrup, fragrant tobacco, and melted dark chocolate.

Name: Sherry Cask - Elements of Islay
Palate: Chewy dates and raisins, crystalised ginger, and dark chocolate almonds. Syrupy plums and zesty dried orange lead to sweet smoke and cakey spice.
Finish: Burnt sugar and earthen oak, fragrant peat, and tobacco linger, with prickles of pepper to see things off.
Nose: Woody notes of cedar and aromatic pipe tobacco lead to smoked herbs, waxed lemons, and earthy tea.

Name: Tamdhu 28 Year Old 1989 (cask 4126) - Mackillop's Choice
Palate: Opening with fresh orchard fruits, crisp barley and sugary cereal, notes of golden syrup cake, almond croissants and lemon zest, with a kick of cinnamon, help form an interesting palate.
Finish: Subtly grassy, there's some melted butter and a touch of caramel.
Nose: Over pineapple chunks is apple butter, polished oak and vanilla custard, before waxy orange and a pinch of nutmeg reveal.

Name: Glen Moray 2014 Oloroso Matured - Warehouse 1
Palate: Sticky dried fruits, prunes, spicy gingerbread, and toasted fruit loaf spread with butter.
Finish: Peppery spice, with roasted almonds.
Nose: Plenty of sherry influence, figs in spiced syrup, and toasted hazelnuts.

Name: Caisteal Chamuis Blended Malt Whisky
Palate: Caramelised nuts and flaked almonds, charred oak staves, a hint of medicinal smoke.
Finish: Singed barley, crunchy brown sugar, banana fritters.
Nose: Sea breeze, toasted teacake with salted butter, honeyed apple, and a pinch of pepper.

Name: Kentucky Owl The Wiseman
Palate: Gingerbread, summer berry tart, sandalwood, toffee.
Finish: Soft cinnamon, milk chocolate, banana chips.
Nose: Apple and orange, with hints of Bounty bars, cut grass, and salted popcorn.

Name: Wire Works Small Batch 2
Palate: A rich nutty malt element leads with orange peel, custard, cinder toffee, and a wisp of bonfire smoke.
Finish: Hints of butterscotch, sandalwood, and coffee.
Nose: Sharp green apple, vanilla ice cream, and toffee popcorn are joined by a dusting of cinnamon and some black pepper.

Name: Glentauchers 21 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Marmalade on brown toast with a little melted butter and dried fruit. Burnt sugar, citrus and a little garden herb emerge, with plenty of oak spice prickling away throughout.
Finish: Bread and butter pudding and a hint of struck match.
Nose: Salted caramel, chocolate digestive and red apples, then morello cherry jam, nutty barley and a helping of fresh vanilla beans and oak chips.

Name: Glengoyne 9 Year Old - Batch 4 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Cloudy lemonade, perfumed malt, almond and yellow plum.
Finish: White pepper and cinnamon slowly develop on the finish.
Nose: Brown sugar, scones with jam and cream, a touch of heather honey.

Name: Famous Grouse Blended Scotch Whisky 1l
Palate: Light and balanced. Spice, barley. Caramel, touch of smoke.
Finish: Touch of sweetness, caramel.
Nose: Light, crisp. Cut flowers. Barley. Toffee sweetness.

Name: Famous Grouse Smoky Black
Palate: Medium, balanced. Peat smoke, caramel, spice.
Finish: Long, slightly peaty.
Nose: Medium, quite smoky. Solid peat note, rummy sweetness, touch of dry wood.

Name: Adnams 7 Year Old 2013 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: A balance of drying old oak and apricot, with almond butter and elegant barley spice. Crumbly fudge develops alongside bringing balance to a sprinkling of cooking spice.
Finish: Milky tea and a touch of chai spice, sweet burnt sugar, and a pinch of drying pepper.
Nose: Delicate oak opens the way with warm caramelised nuts and hints of poached pear. Biscuity malt comes through in time with a creaminess and touch of vanilla.

Name: Sherry Bomb 8 Year Old
Palate: Chocolate-chip brioche, zesty Seville orange marmalade, cinnamon sticks, maple syrup, yet more dried fruit by the bucket load.
Finish: Once again we're treated to raisin, milk chocolate, cassia, and a smidge of old sherry.
Nose: Dates, sultanas, and a good helping of honey, with a kick of ginger appearing later on. Some sweet coffee notes appear after a few moments.

Name: Croftengea 14 Year Old - Paladin
Palate: Orchard fruits drenched in honey, petrichor, singed hay, orange peel.
Finish: Hints of cooked apple last on the finish, with a smidge of oatcake.
Nose: Nutty brown bread with a touch of char, balanced by chocolate and sultana.

Name: Tenjaku Whisky
Palate: Tinned pears on the palate, with banana bread and thick custard.
Finish: Creamy oak spice and a floral elderflower finish.
Nose: A faint suggestion of smoke with pear blossom and plump sultana.

Name: Balblair 25 Year Old
Palate: Full-bodied with oily citrus, chocolate praline and a faint note of fresh tobacco leaf.
Finish: Warming with smooth chocolate and blood oranges.
Nose: Indulgent overripe apricots and dark liquorice stand out against polished oak and a touch of saddle wax.

Name: Jack Daniel's Gentleman Jack Gift Set with Wash Bag
Palate: Liquorice-led palate with oak and cinnamon, a touch of banana too.
Finish: Roasty and toasty finish, plenty of spice and citrus too.
Nose: Spicy nose with caramel, charred oak and a little aniseed.

Name: Balcones Brimstone
Palate: Peppery and sweet in equal quantities with some herbal undertones and BBQ sauce overtones.
Finish: The finish is like a pepper-rubbed steak with a little charcoal too!
Nose: Barbecue, steaks, brown sugar, raisins, honey roast pork. It's all there, a Texan aroma for a Texan whisky.

Name: Lochlea Sowing Edition Second Crop
Palate: Caramel apples, with oaky vanilla, woody spices, some toasted hazelnuts, and orange zest.
Finish: Sweet and lingering, with some allspice.
Nose: Creamy cereal notes, with ripe orchard fruit, and some delicate peach.

Name: Caol Ila 14 year Old 2007 (cask 317310) - Woodrow's of Edinburgh
Palate: Stewed plums, toffee, oily malt, and smoky notes of beachfront barbecues.
Finish: The smoke lingers alongside poached stone fruits, zesty peels, and candied salted nuts.
Nose: Sweet cinnamon and dried fruit join zesty marmalade, with coastal, earthy peat in tow.

Name: SÃ¤ntis 10 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Dried fruit, sweet earthiness and winter spice combine. Fruitcake, hazelnut and macaroons and slabs of milk chocolate bring depth among a touch of dried rose petal.
Finish: Ginger and nutmeg spice emerge from the backdrop to dry things slightly.
Nose: Through toasted brown sugar and sticky treacle comes Bramley apple, cacao and brandy snaps. Thereâs a little drying barley and oak polish underneath.

Name: Glen Spey 12 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
Palate: Soft, smooth, dried grass, fruity, calvados. Malty and nutty.
Finish: Gentle, medium  length, oaky warmth, nutty.
Nose: Light, fragrant, Fresh, green, dried grass. Resinous, beeswax, honey sweetness.

Name: Tomatin 10 Year Old 2010 (cask 14397) - Provenance (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Strudel, vanilla latte, more barley, grist, black pepper, and ginger.
Finish: Brown sugar, winter spices and dried fruit.
Nose: Toffee, barley, raisins and dried apple chips.

Name: Signal Hill
Palate: Rich with a creamy mouthfeel, and sweet notes of raisins and plums and a drizzle of honey.
Finish: Long and warming.
Nose: Sweet honey and vanilla, jammy fruit and warm oak spice.

Name: Westport Blended Malt 21 Year Old 1997 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Mega fruity with dried orange wheels, stewed orchard fruits, and sweet, tropical notes.
Finish: Layers of toffee tangle with woody spice, finishing up with a touch of cinnamon, and earthen vanilla.
Nose: Tarte Tatin with buttery pastry and elegant spice is followed by waxed peels and orange zest.

Name: Blended Malt #3 21 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Yet more ginger, spicy and vibrant. A wave of vanilla and caramel.
Finish: Hints of clove and black pepper give it a long-lasting warmth.
Nose: Honey-dipped apricots, buttery muffins, a good helping of fresh ginger.

Name: Paul John Christmas Edition 2020
Palate: Dried fruit and spices appear, with peppery oak, barley sugar and more smoke, balanced by date sweetness.
Finish: Crystallised ginger and earthy peat linger.
Nose: Candied orange peel, set honey and plum jam on fresh toast, with delicate peat smoke running through.

Name: Mars Maltage Cosmo
Palate: Orange oil and chocolate, fresh barley and toasty oak.
Finish: Fresh plum and white grape. Cereals and chocolate biscuits.
Nose: Soft vanilla notes up front, joined by sweet red fruit (think cherry and sugary raspberry).

Name: Armorik Classic
Palate: Cloudy lemonade, vanilla sponge, milky coffee and spiced fruit compote.
Finish: A touch of roasted barley warmth.
Nose: Buttered brown bread, marmalade and a touch of passion fruit.

Name: Blackland Bourbon
Palate: More notes of sweet toffee and warm popcorn, with a touch of bitter oak nestling beneath.
Finish: Drizzles of caramel and a final tingle of peppery warmth finish things up.
Nose: Oaken vanilla and buttered corn, with peppery spice prickling away in the distance.

Name: CÃ¹ BÃ²can Creation #4
Palate: Chocolatey, with touches of poached pear and black pepper building.
Finish: A long finish, with vanilla, ginger, nectarine, and delicate yet spicy smoke.
Nose: Plum wine and greengages, with a dusting of toasted cinnamon and nutmeg.

Name: Glenburgie 27 Year Old 1995 (cask 6667 & 6675) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Orchard fruit arrives with milk chocolate and vanilla.
Finish: Gingery and sweet.
Nose: Lilac blossom and citrus (lemon and lime) lead with sultanas and funky fruits in support.

Name: Dailuaine 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 307387, 307404 & 307410) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Vanilla sponge cake, with more nutty character, and a drizzle of salted caramel.
Finish: Warm spices, with a touch of earthy herbs.
Nose: Rich fruit and honey, with beeswax polish, and some toasted almonds.

Name: GlenWyvis Single Malt 2018 Batch 02/18
Palate: Buttery malt, with crumbly fudge and vanilla pod, followed by green apple peel, and pangs of peppercorn.
Finish: Heavy oak char, rich, silky caramel, a sprinkle of bitter cacao, and young orchard fruit.
Nose: Dense summer fruits open the way, with delicately floral honey and ripe plum.

Name: Strathisla 15 Year Old 2005 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Golden syrup leads, joined by a scattering of pepper and nutmeg before vanilla cream and buttery sponge appear. Boozy cherries and sultanas follow, with more hearty spice to balance.
Finish: Balsamic poached fruits tangle with layers of rich, woody spice, red apple, stewed tea, and sherried oak.
Nose: Tarte Tatin, fluffy pancakes with maple syrup, and a tangy note of underripe pear and tangerine. Dried berries and sweet oak follow in time.

Name: Copper Dog
Palate: Chocolate digestives, nutty malt, orange peels and soft simmering spices.
Finish: Baked goods and honey-covered fruit.
Nose: Peach, pear and dried apple. Classic Speysider honey'd cereal notes.

Name: Writers Tears Cask Strength (2021 Release)
Palate: Rounded malt and warming spices, dotted with green apple and white chocolate.
Finish: Creamy vanilla, crushed cardamom pod, a touch of cedar.
Nose: Ginger tea, apricot, melted butter on crumpets.

Name: Benrinnes 12 Year Old 2010 (casks 104 & 106) - Un-Chilfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Toasted walnuts and poached apple, with raisins and sweet dates.
Finish: Drizzles of molasses, and cinnamon.
Nose: Jammy plums and figs, with almond biscotti, and winter spices.

Name: Highland Park 10 Year Old - Viking Scars
Palate: Ginger and waxy orange peel. Earthy peat with a another hint of Sherry sweetness buried underneath.
Finish: Sea salt and heather once again. A few herbaceous hints of coriander leaf and crushed black pepper.
Nose: Subtle Sherry influence, but balanced by heather-y smoke.

Name: Glen Moray Twisted Vine
Palate: Milky coffee, wood spice, sticky dark fruit, and roasted nuts.
Finish: Delicate floral notes linger and fade into tinned apricots and nuts.
Nose: Soft toffee, with dried fruit, a little sweet tobacco, and white pepper spice.

Name: Ezra Brooks Straight Rye Whiskey
Palate: Layers of white chocolate and fudge, with more of those characteristic rye notes floating through.
Finish: Apricot and banana chips, with a touch of honey.
Nose: Vanilla, cedar, white pepper and some earthy rye spices.

Name: Glen Moray Cabernet Cask Finish - Elgin Classic
Palate: Green oak and some grassy notes, with red grape skin, lemon drizzle, white pepper and chocolate-covered almond.
Finish: Oak char and orange peel lead into plump raisin and cinnamon.
Nose: Apple turnover, plum, caramelised nuts and citrus blossom, with honeyed orchard fruits.

Name: Glenglassaugh Torfa
Palate: Not overtly smoky. It's definitely got its coastal elements, but the fruity notes of melon, apple and yet more citrus make it a rather sweet dram, balanced by warming barley.
Finish: Smoke lasts to the end.
Nose: Smoke and citrus in equal measures, with sweet spice happily sitting between the two.

Name: Glen Elgin 16 Year Old - Batch 7 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Sweet and fruity. Fresh plums, candied lemon peel, and runny honey.
Finish: Spicy, with some chilli chocolate heat.
Nose: Fragrant and floral. Rose petals and orange blossom. Pain au raisin, fruit and nut milk chocolate, with hints of dried mixed herbs too.

Name: Jack Daniel's Single Barrel (cask 21-07905) (Master of Malt Exclusive)
Palate: Toasty oak, banana chips, peppercorn, toffee apple, crunchy brown sugar, with a hint of flaky pastry appearing later on.
Finish: More pepper and brown sugar, with a little anise too.
Nose: Scorched caramel, pecan pie, a zesty burst of orange peel and cherry, subtle cardamom spiciness.

Name: Royal Lochnagar Selected Reserve (bottled 2018)
Palate: Treacley notes of toffee and coffee, baked apples, and drying sherry. A touch of cedar joins, bringing warming spice.
Finish: Silky to the end, with chocolate, candied nuts, and raisins.
Nose: Coffee grounds, toasted brown sugar, dried fruit, sawdust, and baking spice.

Name: Armorik 7 Year Old 2011 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Powerful, with bold tannic oak, sweet, biscuity malt, and delicate poached fruit. Buttery pastry and cooked apple lead to fresh strawberries, while peppery, aromatic spice develops.
Finish: Jammy with blueberry and tangy cranberry, backed by a host of woody spices. Peppery oak and maple syrup bring a superb warm and sweet balance as it slowly tails off.
Nose: Sponge cake, crunchy candied biscuits, and wafers, there's sweet fruit too, with stewed redcurrants, a touch of buttered sweetcorn, and just a hint of honey-roasted ham.

Name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label - Legendary Eight
Palate: A wonderful sweetness envelops the taste buds, through which notes of stone fruits, stewing apples and cocoa emerge.
Finish: A wisp of smoke comes through to deepen the flavour resulting in a soft and lightly peppered finish.
Nose: The blend is rich with layers of brown sugars, soft fruit and sweet wood. These flavours evolve to reveal hints of green apple and a subtle zest; complementing the gentle peat unfolding in the background to give an overarching warming sensation.

Name: Dewar's 12 Year Old - The Ancestor
Palate: The palate is perfectly poised with notes of barley malt, hot buttered toast, a little honey, and some aniseed spiciness.
Finish: A touch of smoke on the tail, alongside plenty of thick malt and sweetness.
Nose: A heady note of juicy fruit and thick, creamy malt. Rather floral, and quite sweet with notes of toasted barley, almond and a tinge of honey.

Name: Orkney 15 Year Old 2002 - Fadandel
Palate: Creamy barley with waxy layers of oily oak, smoked kippers, and zesty salted lemons.
Finish: Seaside salinity with vegetal seaweed, prickles of pepper, a sweet drop of honey, and lingering wafts of snuffed candles.
Nose: Plenty of citrus zest, zingy lemon drizzle cake, chalky grist, and distinctly smoky coastal breeze.

Name: Millstone 12 Year Old Sherry Cask Matured
Palate: CuraÃ§ao orange, stewed plums, thick Oloroso Sherry and caramel.
Finish: Christmas cake, cinnamon and lacquered wood.
Nose: Raspberry, cherry and brown sugar. Punchy citrus and ginger.

Name: Glenmorangie The Tarlogan
Palate: Chocolatey as it opens, before diving into clotted cream and honey.
Finish: Cherry ice cream topped with almonds. A subtle touch of fresh kumquat.
Nose: Creamy and luxurious vanilla. A hint of virgin oak intensity and desiccated coconut.

Name: Wolfburn Langskip
Palate: Dried fruit begins to take control on the palate - think sultana and apricot. Still enjoyably nutty with walnut and macadamia. A good helping of nutmeg and stem ginger gives it some heat.
Finish: Last toffee apple sweetness and black pepper.
Nose: Demerara sugar, gingerbread, floral malt, white pepper and sugared almonds

Name: Bowmore 18 Year Old 2001 (Release No.11714) - The Stories of Wind & Wave (The Character of Islay Whisky Company)
Bottler: The Character of Islay Whisky Company
Palate: Mango and papaya brightness juxtaposed by solid oak richness. A hint of perfumed barley tucked away.
Finish: Soft salinity, with a pinch of paprika spiciness.
Nose: Cooked autumnal fruit (think blackberries and red apples and you won't be far off), with sooty smoke bringing balance.

Name: Dunville's Three Crowns
Palate: Milk chocolate, apricot, cardamom and white pepper.
Finish: Raisins and sultanas, dusted with cinnamon.
Nose: Creamy vanilla, with a touch of honey'd cereals and Christmas spices.

Name: Macduff 13 Years Old 2009 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)
Palate: Dried fruit, digestive biscuit, and cinnamon.
Finish: Rich and sweet.
Nose: Mocha, raspberry, walnut, and vanilla.

Name: Old Pulteney Huddart
Palate: Burnt sugar and fried banana, alongside a touch of brine.
Finish: Lingering thyme honey and earthy malt.
Nose: Caramel apple, a whiff of bonfire smoke followed by creamy vanilla.

Name: Singleton of Dufftown 17 Year Old (Special Release 2020)
Palate: Smooth and creamy, like shea butter and beeswax. There's more honey here, plus milk chocolate, vanilla custard over apple crumble, and hints of raspberries. The body is breezily light without feeling flimsy.
Finish: Long and surprisingly warming after the gentle palate - soft chilli comes through to liven things up slightly.
Nose: Like a relaxed orchard on a summer day, the nose offers wildflowers, fresh pears, crisp apples, honey and hay. There's an earthiness too, which grounds things nicely.

Name: Starward Tawny
Palate: Rather Christmassy, with spiced cooked plum, more dried fruit and citrus, a good helping of malt and grape sweetness.
Finish: A dusting of brown sugar and oily nuts on a dry, spicy finish.
Nose: Banana bread and dried peels, with peanut butter and raisin.

Name: Tobermory 24 Year Old Oloroso Sherry Cask Finish
Palate: Buttery toffee, Fig Rolls, and dark chocolate studded with rock salt crystals lead to a crackle of cinnamon, spiced berries, and cacao.
Finish: Crumbly vanilla fudge, balanced by subtle salt in the distance.
Nose: Honeyed figs, candied walnuts, zesty marmalade, sweet sponge cake, and poached plums.

Name: Auchroisk 37 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Fruit Salad sweeties, Seville orange marmalade, mint chocolate and creamy vanilla.
Finish: Citrus sticks around on the finish.
Nose: Honeydew melon and apricot brandy, soft cedar and smoke, just a hint of cut grass in the background.

Name: Singleton of Glen Ord 40 Year Old
Palate: At natural strength, the texture is decadently smooth and lightly waxy while the taste starts sweet, vibrant and very fruity, becoming slightly salty and plum sour mid-palate. Complex layers of flavour suggest pears slathered indulgently in dark chocolate and caramelised tropical fruits, as with toffee-covered banana and pineapple. Beautifully balanced and super-smooth, with sustained rich, sweet fruitiness balanced by slow-building black pepper. Velvet smooth dark chocolate tannins herald an appetising drying note. A drop of water emphasises the fruit and softens the spice, bringing out a mouth-cooling aftertaste.
Finish: Quite long, deep-flavoured and lightly drying, with black pepper spice and another hint of waxy smoke.
Nose: The nose is mellow, with a little prickle at first; fruity top notes hint at dried apple and are soon backed by a more savoury aroma evoking sage, while richer hints of fruit, suggesting plums enrobed in dark chocolate, sit on a balancing base of sweetly spicy oak, with light aromas of hard toffee and oak shavings. A drop of water introduces a wisp of waxy smoke.

Name: The Macallan 24 Year Old 1993 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Redcurrant jelly and pressed blackcurrants pave the way, joined by chocolate-dipped dried orange. Nutty malt follows, with earthy pecan, green walnuts, and a slow build of woody liquorice.
Finish: Dried cranberries, poached plums, and floral goji berries linger alongside dense oak and softly charred herbs.
Nose: Antique furniture and rich, leathery tannins are followed by thick manuka honey, a hint of rooibos tea, and dried citrus peels. Stewed apples and pears, blanketed in buttery pastry, with chocolate raisins and distant chalk in tow.

Name: Dunville's Very Rare 12 Year Old Irish Whiskey
Palate: Sweet and mouthfilling, with more baking spice, strawberry laces, fresh custard and grape skin.
Finish: Stewed apple and dark chocolate-covered raisins.
Nose: Spiced vanilla cream, with cinnamon, praline and plump sultana.

Name: Unnamed Orkney 13 Year Old 2009 (casks DRU17/A67 9+10+13+21) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Sweet hay, floral honey, candied ginger, and warming allspice.
Finish: Crumbly shortbread, with drying oak.
Nose: Lemon curd and oaky vanilla intertwine with peppery spice.

Name: Langatun 5 Year Old - Batch 1 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Sugary cereals (Frosties? Ricicles?), poached pear and chewy toffee. A whisper of peat lingers in the background.
Finish: Fresh peach, vanilla-rich malt and spicy nutmeg.
Nose: Chilli-chocolate, oatcakes, honey roasted peanuts. Hints of spiced fig and sea salt appear after a minute in the glass.

Name: Ardlair 12 Year Old 2011 Whisky (cask 900030)
Palate: Glazed apple, candied nuts, and stewed stone fruits balance warming baking spice and a touch of pepper.
Finish: Nutty malt, chocolate raisins, lingering vanilla, ginger, and toasted oak.
Nose: Creamy butterscotch and vanilla lead to nutty praline and fruity flapjack.

Name: Joe Got A Gun Tennessee Whiskey - 20 Private Barrels
Palate: Smooth vanilla fudge, some peppery spices, and hints of smoke.
Finish: A touch of clove, and drizzles of caramel.
Nose: Caramel corn, with toasted grain, and some oaky char.

Name: Ben Nevis 7 Year Old 2015 (cask BN15622) - Hidden Spirits
Palate: Toasted almonds, melted dark chocolate, dried apricot, and cinnamon.
Finish: Warming Christmassy spices remain.
Nose: Toffee apple and stewed pear with oak spices and thick, creamy vanilla custard.

Name: Ben Nevis 8 Year Old 2014 (casks 277 & 278) - Un-Chilfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Green apples, peaches, and raisins, with warm spices, and a touch of hazelnut.
Finish: Cinnamon and black pepper linger, with sweet malt.
Nose: Some tropical fruit, green grapes, and oaky vanilla.

Name: Glen Garioch 1797 Founder's Reserve
Palate: Chocolate lime sweets and brandy butter. With water there's more allspice, dessert wine, barley malt and cured ham.
Finish: Oak, some subtle smoke, green apple skin and more chocolate limes.
Nose: Lively, oily, slightly peppery malt. Some creamy Danish Blue balanced by hints of citrus including lime and grapefruit squash.

Name: Glenfiddich 15 Year Old Solera
Palate: Medium, Sherry, raisins. Fruitcake, spices, sweetness.
Finish: Candied fruits, raisins, spices, Christmas pudding, oak takes over.
Nose: Sherry, citrus - orange in particular, dry wood. Slight suggestion of smoke?

Name: Lochlea Ploughing Edition - First Crop
Palate: Bonfire smoke stays balanced throughout, with spiced apple compote, toasted cobnuts, and buttery shortbread.
Finish: Damp embers with warming allspice.
Nose: Earthy peat, warm apple pie, dark caramelised sugar, and cinnamon spice.

Name: East London Liquor Co. London Rye
Palate: Nutty brown bread, marmalade, cinnamon, a hint of hickory.
Finish: Almonds, sultanas, toasted oak and another good dollop of tangy marmalade.
Nose: Caramel apples and milk chocolate, followed by a good kick of peppercorn.

Name: Glenallachie 10 Year Old â Batch 6 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Oily malt coats the palate bringing prickles of pepper and warming ginger to the fore. Crisp pear and green apple smooth things out along with burnt toffee and resinous oak char.
Finish: Subtle fruit sweetness, warming spice, and more herbal, grassy barley tangle, keeping things interesting and complex on the finish.
Nose: Candied citrus fruits and creamy vanilla open the way whilst a smidge of lemon peel and cut grass rest beneath.

Name: SmokeStack
Palate: The smoke becomes thicker and drier as the spice sweetens in a brilliantly oily palate. Floral honey keeps things interesting throughout.
Finish: Long and drying.
Nose: With sweet peat smoke there's some creamy vanilla, soft citrus and a hint of iodine. Prickles of ginger linger.

Name: Glenburgie 10 Year Old 2011 - Wee Brother (Na BrÃ ithrean)
Palate: More green apple with citrus, vanilla, ginger, and a touch of salinity.
Finish: Subtle spices.
Nose: Delicate orchard fruits on the nose, honey, malt, and a touch of lemon peel.

Name: Mackmyra 2013 (bottled 2022) - Wonders of the World (Swell de Spirits)
Palate: Floral honey with allspice and a few cracks of black pepper, drizzles of treacle, and caramelised white chocolate.
Finish: The spices build, with oak coming through.
Nose: Fruit gumdrops, with white chocolate and raspberry cookies, oaky vanilla, and baking spices.

Name: Speyside 26 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Heavy layers of honey, strawberry jam and Nutella. A touch of oily barley underneath it all.
Finish: Clove and ginger appear on the finish.
Nose: Apple strudel, topped with brown sugar and cinnamon. After that, more desserts - lemon meringue pie and chocolate tart, namely.

Name: Jim Beam Rye
Palate: The spice delivery is not immediate; first there's a brief caramel vanilla note before it plunges you in. All the notes from the nose are here, delivered with a pleasant, fiery warmth.
Finish: This rounds off to smooth cherry and pepper, with a slightly citric sweetness.
Nose: The spice is immediately apparent... nutmeg, cloves, freshly-ground black pepper. It's clearly going to pack a punch. There's also some maraschino notes too, with a thick caramel undertone.

Name: Old Forester Bourbon
Palate: Starts quite sweet with caramel and maple syrup, though swiftly develops intense oak-y elements and hints of pine resin. Sweetness returns slightly on the mid-palate.
Finish: Juicy orange and spicy oak continue on the finish.
Nose: Top notes of orange blossom and cedar. Soon develops the classic rye bread warmth and a lingering waft of buttered pancakes.

Name: Jameson Caskmates IPA Edition
Palate: Oily walnut and hops, caramelised dates, continued citrus zestiness.
Finish: Malt, white pepper, caraway and green apple.
Nose: Fresh grapefruit and lime, vanilla pod, sugared almonds.

Name: Glen Keith Distillery Edition
Palate: Through oaked dryness and an oily note comes vanilla sweetness with helpings of apricot yogurt, dried mango and nectarines. Suggestions of chocolate pudding, a slight grassiness and a little spice form the backdrop.
Finish: Subtle floral notes and new oak, with a little honey.
Nose: Sweet and crisp with orchard fruits and a malty character. Toffee apples and banana skins linger.

Name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label Gift Pack with 2x Glasses
Palate: Supple and balanced. Good toffee and hints of very wistful smoke. Chocolate, hints of grass and a good hit of malt.
Finish: Floral, oaky, good length, urged on by a plume of very well-kept, highland style smoke. Dried fruit, spice, honey.
Nose: Fragrant with good body. Notes of oak, crisp spice, dried fruit, pastries. Berry fruits, aniseed, hints of cedar, a touch of spice and citrus.

Name: Scorpions Single Malt Whisky
Palate: Fresh red fruits, vanilla-y malt and golden cereals initially, then hints of tarragon and warming oak.
Finish: Christmas cake, with a little bit of honey too.
Nose: Caramel, wood spice and brown sugar combine with plenty of raspberry and cherry notes.

Name: Coven of Resurrection 13 Year Old - Whisky of Voodoo
Palate: Peach pastries and caramel wafers, a touch of praline arrives, with rich, honeyed malt and oaken vanilla.
Finish: Creamy almond and butterscotch wrap things up, with white chocolate and soft, mellow spice.
Nose: Delicate hints of buttered sourdough, sawdust, with a touch of honeyed melon in tow.

Name: Gwalarn Celtic Whisky Blend
Palate: Vanilla fudge, honeyed fruits and ginger cake.
Finish: Smoky, sea salted caramels.
Nose: Rounded barley and orchard fruit notes, with signs of that peated malt from the off.

Name: The Irishman The Harvest
Palate: Custard cream biscuits dunked in tea, cinnamon sticks, peppercorn, and lemon cheesecake.
Finish: More biscuit notes, with a touch of anise.
Nose: Nectarine, honeydew melon, buttered brown bread.

Name: Ben Nevis 10 Year Old  (Parcel No.10) - Reserve Casks (The Single Malts of Scotland)
Palate: Chocolate covered raisins, spiced Christmas cake, and some oily walnuts.
Finish: Rich and velvety, with lingering toasted nuts, and dark chocolate.
Nose: Nutty, chocolatey, oloroso goodness.

Name: Lismore 10 Year Old
Palate: Honey, apricot jam and fresh vanilla bean.
Finish: Light spices and cacao nibs.
Nose: Butterscotch, lightly toasted malt, a few generous handfuls of dried fruit.

Name: Islay Single Malt - As We Get It (Ian Macleod) (60.8%)
Palate: Fresh apple, some zesty citrus, burnt embers, oak char spice.
Finish: More baking spice and coastal tar, lingering vegetal peat with warming prickles of black pepper.
Nose: A balance of sweet sponge cake, herbal malt, and earthen peat smoke.

Name: John Walker & Sons Celebratory Blend
Palate: A hit of spice, malt biscuits, and black pepper, with toasted caramelised nuts.
Finish: Spicy pepper lingers on the finish.
Nose: Touches of Bakewell tart, apricot, and baking spices, with peppery oak in support.

Name: The Matsui Sakura Cask
Palate: Baking spices and citrus once again. A light whiff of spring blossom later on.
Finish: White pepper heat and vanilla sponge cake.
Nose: Almond, faint hints of fresh orange and melon, sawdust spiciness.

Name: Paul John Classic Select Cask
Palate: Lots of honey on the palate, joined by deft spicy notes of cinnamon and cracked black pepper. Glimmers of fruit and dark chocolate.
Finish: Juicy fruits and a hint of oak.
Nose: A big, meaty nose. Stewed apples and pears, freshly-baked sponge cake, golden barley and a pinch of salt.

Name: Paul John Oloroso Select Cask
Palate: Blackberries, honeycomb, dark chocolate bitterness, oaky spice and orange oil.
Finish: Cinnamon, nutmeg and a final helping of redcurrant jam.
Nose: Sherry-soaked fruit and dried peels, date and walnut loaf, buttery malt.

Name: Glenburgie 13 Year Old 2008 (cask 1920212) - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Dense fruits and maple syrup, Jam roly-poly, a touch of dark chocolate arrives before baking spice warmth begins to build.
Finish: A touch of dried orange, nutty oak spice, and sweet butterscotch.
Nose: Summer berries and sweet sultanas with biscuity malt and candied ginger.

Name: Glenfarclas 10 Year Old (Master of Malt Exclusive)
Palate: A punchy start leads to robust, mouthcoating layers of dense, aged fruitcake, sticky toffee pudding, and prunes.
Finish: Buttery biscuits and baking spices linger, with long-lasting helpings of cooked orchard fruits, soaked sultanas, and sherried oak.
Nose: Sweet barley water and vanilla fudge open the way, with crisp green apples and sherry-soaked stone fruits.

Name: Orkney 8 Year Old 2014 (cask 177) - Monologue (Chapter 7)
Palate: Dried cherries, spicy blackberries, and oaky vanilla.
Finish: Fresh cut hay, with summer berries lingering.
Nose: Juicy red berry character from the wine barrel joins creamy grist and spices.

Name: Ben Nevis 7 Year Old Equinox & Solstice Autumn 2022 (Whisky Sponge & Decadent Drinks)
Palate: Waxy and full-bodied, with dark chocolate, milky coffee, dried fruit, nutmeg, and a little cured meat.
Finish: Oily and spicy with stewed black fruit.
Nose: Seville marmalade, toffee apple, roasted nuts, and sherried spice.

Name: Speyburn 10 Year Old
Palate: A light, gentle palate with soft malt, sweet, toasty barley with liquorice and dried herbs.
Finish: Just a touch of smoke trails off on the finish.
Nose: A fruity nose with hints of orange, mandarin and cooking apple. A touch of oak, peppermint and spice.

Name: White Oak Akashi Blended Whisky
Palate: Cherry bakewells and walnut loaf. Sweet cereals with a dusting of nutmeg and black pepper.
Finish: Medium length. Quite sweet with dried apricot and a touch of oatcake.
Nose: Buttered hot cross buns, chocolate peanuts, lemongrass and a light hint of spicy rye grain.

Name: Lismore 8 Year Old Special Reserve
Palate: Cinnamon and burnt sugar, with a touch of Sherry too.
Finish: White pepper and vanilla ice cream.
Nose: Caramel, cinnamon and a core of toasty malt.

Name: Stauning Rye - Sweet Wine Casks
Palate: Spicy rye is balanced by sweet malt, honey, and candied ginger.
Finish: Vanilla pod and black pepper linger alongside juicy orchard fruit.
Nose: Marmalade, fresh summer berries, lemon curd, and red apple.

Name: The Muff Liquor Company Irish Whiskey
Palate: Cinnamon, warming oak, caramelised nuts, Werther's Originals, green apples.
Finish: Vanilla pod and coconut ice.
Nose: Orange peel, cinder toffee, banana chips, and nectarines.

Name: Turntable Track 02: Firestarter
Palate: Charred pineapple, gooey toffee, milk chocolate, and red berries.
Finish: Honey and smoked malt.
Nose: Campfire smoke, salted caramel, browning apples, and cinnamon.

Name: Cotswolds Founder's Choice Whisky
Palate: Mocha sticks around, joined by cinnamon, fiery ginger, foam strawberry sweeties and marmalade.
Finish: Bready on the finish, plus some of those bright mango notes return.
Nose: Mango, peach and pear, with a slow build of mocha and Matchmakers (the minty chocolate sticks).

Name: Ledaig 12 Year Old - Big Brother (Na BrÃ ithrean)
Palate: Dark cherry chocolate and soaked berries gather alongside rich spices, bold, fruity oak and drying, peppery peat smoke.
Finish: Caramel with a touch of salt, more cherries, bold barley, anise and clove.
Nose: Mild malt and slightly vegetal peat lead the way for chocolate raisins, a touch of honey, and distant salinity.

Name: Tomintoul Cognac Cask Finish
Palate: Dried fruit, fresh apples, toffee, and almonds.
Finish: Sweet spicy finish.
Nose: Fruity with lemon and apple joined by notes of chestnut and liquorice.

Name: The One Moscatel Cask Finished
Palate: Honeyed malt, dark chocolate, strawberry jam, buttered crumpets, clove, nutmeg.
Finish: Subtle hints of mocha and diced apricot.
Nose: Dates, chewy toffee, a zesty hint of clementine, maple syrup.

Name: Finlaggan Eilean Mor
Palate: Well-peated and rather intense. Spicy hints of black pepper.
Finish: A long finish of drying peat smoke.
Nose: Salty sea breeze and a touch of TCP.

Name: Glen Garioch 2011 (bottled 2023) (cask 08028) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Toasted tea cakes with plenty of butter, syrupy flapjack, studded with dried fruit, nutty malt, and distant wood smoke.
Finish: Dried fruits, baking spice, and a touch of herbal tea, with whispers of smoke and dense sherried oak.
Nose: Cacao, spiced honey, and sultana-filled pastry, with toasted nuts and oaken vanilla joining in time.

Name: Ledaig 12 Year Old - Discovery (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Peppery smoke mixed with burnt sugar and cloudy lemonade.
Finish: Hints of cedar emerge from the smoke.
Nose: Grassy peat and seaweed, with green apple sweeties in the background.

Name: Edradour Ballechin 13 Year Old Batch 1 - Cask Strength Edition
Palate: Dense layers of peat smoke mingle with woody clove and anise, followed by dried orange wheels, dipped in dark chocolate.
Finish: Sweet dried fruits emerge from the smoke, with salted nuts and peppery oak.
Nose: Smouldering embers and charred oak lead the way with honeyed sultanas and plums in tow.

Name: AthrÃº 14 Year Old Annacoona
Palate: Salted caramel, candied peels, rich dark forest fruits and spices.
Finish: A lingering finish of mocha and jammy cherry notes.
Nose: Autumnal aromas of melted dark chocolate, dried fruits and orange oil.

Name: Mackmyra Destination
Palate: Juicy blackberry, vanilla custard, Bakewell tart, and burnt toast.
Finish: Toasted hazelnut, peppery oak, and a lingering berry zing.
Nose: Berry coulis, brown sugar, frangipane, and woody spice.

Name: Paul John 6 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Peat isn't as pronounced as on the nose, with bourbon-y vanilla and milk chocolate taking the lead instead.
Finish: Peppery peat and squashed blackcurrants.
Nose: A rush of Bonfire Night aromas - particularly smoky embers and toffee apples. After a few minutes, the peat becomes ever-so-slightly coastal.

Name: Aultmore 11 Year Old 2010 (cask 900019) - The Sipping Shed
Palate: Crushed almonds and more rich, dried fruit lead to toffee and smoky whispers of charred heather.
Finish: An elegant balance of baked prunes and sultanas, floral malt, and drying smoke.
Nose: Heaps of sherried fruits, drizzled with honey, followed by rich, earthy coffee and floral orchard fruits.

Name: Teaninich 5 Year Old - Glen Cooper
Palate: Heavy malt, almond and green apple. Slow build of diced kitchen herbs and black pepper.
Finish: Chocolate peanuts, honey and lemon.
Nose: Sugared citrus peels and juicy apricot, alongside a hint of sponge cake.

Name: Craigellachie 13 Year Old - Batch 14 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: All the fruit! More juicy stone fruit sweetness is accompanied by crisp notes of apple and pear, with berry coulis and candied pineapple following behind.
Finish: Robust, biscuity barley, a touch of earthy coffee, distant wild herbs, and pebbly minerality.
Nose: Huge helpings of yellow fruits, with cooked plums and prunes, apricots and peaches, followed by a sprinkle of dried chilli and nutmeg.

Name: Islay #3 13 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company) 48.6%
Palate: BBQ pineapple and leafy mint, with layers of thyme honey bringing a herbaceous sweetness in to the mix.
Finish: Continued peat smoke heat and a whiff of tobacco.
Nose: Powerful smoke balanced by hints of old leather and tropical fruit punch.

Name: Teeling Blackpitts Big Smoke Cask Strength
Palate: Oak spice prickles through more smoke and orchard fruit with a touch of salinity underneath.
Finish: Long and savoury.
Nose: Earthy smoke, red apples, toffee, and a hint of floral notes.

Name: Cutler & Stubbs 42 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Treacle, shortbread, softly coastal, with mature oak building.
Finish: Delicately toasty on the finish.
Nose: Malty vanilla, toasted oak with a hint of aromatic spice, cooked orchard fruit.

Name: Bruichladdich The Organic 2009
Palate: White chocolate fudge, lemon peel, vanilla and brown sugar.
Finish: Citrus notes become more orange-based, with continued vanilla-y barley.
Nose: Melted butter, salt and pepper crisps, sweet pastries.

Name: Linkwood 12 Year Old 2010 (cask DL16339) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Lots of toffee popcorn, vanilla pods, chocolate, and orange peel.
Finish: Marmalade on brown bread.
Nose: Toasted almonds, apple pie, oak char, and nutmeg.

Name: Ledaig 10 Year Old 2008 (cask 70099) - Ancient Mariner
Palate: Roasted barley and earthy smoke, balanced by heaps of chocolate and dried fruit.
Finish: Punchy peppery spice and some oily malt.
Nose: Damson, Sesame Snaps, toasted oak and a touch of rye heat.

Name: Singleton Of Glendullan 15 Year Old
Palate: Silky caramel, toasted oak, spiced fruit compote, with dried apricot.
Finish: Drying oak and vanilla.
Nose: Rich vanilla, cinnamon and clove spice, and some baked apple.

Name: Glenmorangie 15 Year Old - The Cadboll Estate Batch No. 3
Palate: Baking spices, crumbly fudge, and nutty notes of hazelnuts, barley sugar, and frangipane.
Finish: Sweet and silky, with lingering candied nuts and winter spice.
Nose: Ripe stone fruit, candied orange, caramel, and some chocolate hazelnut spread.

Name: Bushmills Original (1L)
Palate: Fruity, aromatic palate. Salty butter, all kinds of blossom, sweet vanilla cream and citrus.
Finish: A malty finish with cardamom and ginger on the tail.
Nose: Aromatic, sweet Riesling-like quality to this. Also cut herbs and blossom.

Name: Canmore 12 Year Old
Palate: Gently cakey spice builds, with soft barley and mellow oak, a touch of orange zest and festive biscuits.
Finish: Lingering, delicate spice and floral vanilla pod, toasted oak with sweet, biscuity malt and a prickle of pepper.
Nose: Chocolate buttons and buttered malt loaf, creamy vanilla, and crisp, green apple.

Name: Forest Whisky Blend Number Nineteen
Palate: Fresh barley, honey, toasted brown sugar, oak, and cinnamon.
Finish: Cereal, clove, and cooked pear.
Nose: Chocolate orange, vanilla, a touch of charred cedar.

Name: Glen Scotia 25 Year Old
Palate: Fruitier on the palate, with fresh apple and orange oil. Coastal air remains.
Finish: Touches of stem ginger and vanilla pod.
Nose: Earthy oak notes arrive alongside coastal breeze.

Name: Glen Moray 8 Year Old 2013 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)
Palate: Honeyed fruits and warming oak spice, a touch of maple nuttiness and syrupy flapjack.
Finish: Silky butterscotch and rich, roasted barley, woody vanilla with hints of dried berries.
Nose: Sweet vanilla sponge with a touch of lemon, light fruits with hints of floral melon leading to gentle oak.

Name: The Glenlivet Captain's Reserve
Palate: Succulent flavours of mandarins in syrup, ripe poached pears and chocolate-dipped raisins.
Finish: Incredibly smooth and luscious.
Nose: Bursting with sweet and fruity aromas. Rich in honey and apricot jam, with notes of sweet cinnamon bread and a subtle sensation of spicy liquorice.

Name: Invergordon 31 Year Old 1990 (cask 906321) - The Whisky Cellar
Palate: Roasted walnuts and chai spices follow buttered popcorn and waxed lemon peels, while a touch of fresh mint tangles with the oily grain beneath.
Finish: Rich caramel and nutty maple remain, with warming, woody spice, citrus zest, and distant vanilla.
Nose: Juicy layers of tangy fruit, syrupy flapjack, and buttery oak.

Name: Port Askaig 8 Year Old Gift Pack with 2x Glasses
Palate: Soft salted caramel brings a sweetness to the palate, with waves of coastal peat smoke crashing underneath.
Finish: Medium length, with a hot kick of peppercorn.
Nose: Charcoal, salted crisps and a good squeeze of lemon.

Name: Paddy Irish Whiskey
Palate: The palate is sweet and of medium-body with toffee and cereals, a rosewater note with a little butterscotch and vanilla.
Finish: The finish is spicy and dry with a little black pepper and oak.
Nose: The nose is oily and fresh with floral notes, cereal grains and plenty of fruit.

Name: Big Peat 12 Year Old
Palate: Sea breeze, earthy peat, peanut brittle, oak, flamed orange peel and toasted sesame seeds.
Finish: Heavy peat smoke sticks around for minutes on the finish.
Nose: Bonfires on beaches, ready salted crisps, brown sugar and a hint of liquorice.

Name: Bunnahabhain 15 Year Old 2006 (cask 15474) - Old Particular Fanatical About Flavour (Douglas Laing) (Master of Malt Exclusive)
Palate: Caramel flapjack, earthy notes of creamy vanilla, nutty barley, and baked walnut. Hints of liquorice and honey bring sweet balance to subtle wafts of smoky bonfire embers.
Finish: Smoke lingers faintly in the distance, crumbly chocolate biscuits and butterscotch continue with soft spice.
Nose: Brimming with vanilla, buttered brioche, honeyed cereal, and charred oak.

Name: Out Of This World Whisky Blend (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: The red fruit notes move to the fore, with blackberry and stewed plums. It maintains its core of leather and mature oak, while developing hints of brown butter and floral grains.
Finish: Forest floor, toasted cereal, butterscotch, and a savoury hint of sea breeze.
Nose: Honeyed apple, old leather, soft hints of spicy rye leading into subtle woody smoke, with red grape lending a rich sweetness to the mix.

Name: The Matsui The Peated
Palate: Toasty oak, brown sugar, creamy vanilla and a touch of orchard fruit, all enveloped by ashy smoke.
Finish: Peat smoke and fresh apple linger.
Nose: Loads of fresh and toasty malted cereal aromas, supported by earthy peat and swirls of smoke and a touch of vanilla oak.

Name: Sagamore Spirit Cask Strength Rye
Palate: Cinnamon gum, orange boiled sweeties, hints of tobacco and dark chocolate develop later on.
Finish: Peppery notes linger on the finish, with some nutmeg and cooked apple.
Nose: Heavy toffee and menthol, with layers of coffee bean and honey.

Name: Flaming Feast - Wemyss Family Collection
Palate: Salted butter on crumpets, lemon curd, almond butter and sugary shortbread.
Finish: Soft hints of heather and sea salt.
Nose: Coastal notes jump out, balanced by whiffs of golden malt and sodabread.

Name: Auchentoshan 2010 (bottled 2022) (cask 700967) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Vanilla sponge cake and floral honey lead the way, with a touch of cardamom resting beside dried orange peels.
Finish: Nutmeg joins towards the end bringing woody warmth alongside chewy toffee, zesty malt, and just a whisper of menthol.
Nose: Apricot, yellow plum, and dried citrus peel, with creamy barley and dried grass in the distance.

Name: Sailor's Home The Journey Gift Set with Glass
Palate: More vanilla custard creaminess, supported by apple crumble and cinnamon sticks.
Finish: A touch of banana bread and salted butter.
Nose: Fudge, coffee cake, clove, apricot jam and vanilla custard.

Name: Lindores Abbey The Casks of Lindores II - Bourbon Barrel
Palate: More oaky vanilla, with some peppery spice, cloves, and cinnamon, along with some green grape freshness.
Finish: Silky caramel and spices.
Nose: Vanilla custard, chocolate chip cookies, warm baking spices, and lemon curd.

Name: Ballechin 10 Year Old 2009 (cask 303) - Straight From The Cask
Palate: Dry smoke with more nutty notes underneath, plus a whisper of toasted marshmallow.
Finish: Very slightly herbaceous on the finish, with sweet popcorn and vanilla-rich barley.
Nose: Honey roast peanuts, smouldering embers, and caramelised peaches.

Name: Deanston 14 Year Old - Chorlton Whisky
Palate: That vanilla carries through, with buttery oak and soft fudge in tow. Caramelised biscuits, flapjack, and candied orange follow.
Finish: Roasty malt and soft notes of peach, with butterscotch and more mellow oak.
Nose: Buttered sourdough, bold barley, porridge oats, vanilla custard.

Name: Armorik Yeun Elez Jobic
Palate: Sweet smoke balanced by savoury coastal notes, with lemon jam and floral vanilla.
Finish: Wood smoke and warming spices, with a touch of salted caramel.
Nose: Banana bread, herbal peat smoke, plum crumble, and custard.

Name: Rock Island 10 Year Old
Palate: Oily malt, honeycomb and a sprinkle of rock salt, with gentle peppery oak influence and orange Starburst.
Finish: Creamy vanilla, bonfire smoke and sea spray.
Nose: Lemon curd, honey ice cream and digestive biscuits, with a smoky sea breeze running through

Name: Deerstalker 12 Year Old
Palate: Orange peel, dry earthiness, sponge cake topped with buttercream frosting.
Finish: Some cedar spiciness.
Nose: Burnt biscuits, dried peach, Demerara sugar.

Name: Glentauchers 17 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Festive notes of cinnamon appear first, followed once again by fresh apple fruitiness. Peppery oak and a touch of cut grass.
Finish: Waxy peels, hay and Dairy Milk chocolate.
Nose: Pears and apples, with waves of honey and a waft of floral barley.

Name: Dailuaine 13 Year Old 2008 - Hepburn's Choice (Langside)
Palate: Gingersnap biscuits, dark chocolate almonds, dark toffee, and oily citrus.
Finish: Fresh tobacco, peppery heat, and clove spice.
Nose: Floral honey, berry jam on toast, and grape skin.

Name: Craigellachie 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 900695) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Bold oak leads joined by robust baking spices, dark chocolate, and treacle toffee.
Finish: Stewed orchard fruits and pastry linger alongside toffee sauce, pepper, and ginger.
Nose: Honeycomb and syrupy sponge cake with nutty malt and bold, spicy oak.

Name: The Quiet Man 12 Year Old
Palate: Orange peel notes begin to develop on the palate. Still chocolatey. A prickle of cracked black pepper spiciness.
Finish: Soft oak warmth and rich honey.
Nose: Freshly baked brownies, brandy butter and a drizzle of honey (sounds like a pretty brilliant pudding).

Name: Ben Nevis 7 Year Old 2014 - Notable Age Statements (Decadent Drinks)
Palate: Orange peel, honey, rich vanilla, and dried fruits are elevated by the palate's waxy texture.
Finish: Baking spice lingers among baked apple and spiced fruit loaf.
Nose: Huge sherried notes combine with sweet tobacco, red apple, butterscotch, and dunnage warehouse earthiness.

Name: Scapegrace Chorus Single Malt Whisky - Limited Release II
Palate: Aromatic orchard fruits, juicy green grapes, drizzles of caramel, and peppery spice.
Finish: Earthy pepper and allspice linger.
Nose: Sweet honeysuckle, with waxy orange peel, and oaky spice.

Name: Corn Whisky #1 5 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Deliciously buttery, with hints of milk chocolate and dried fruit developing from the sherry casks.
Finish: Softly peppery, with another touch of red fruit.
Nose: Honeyed fruit, with a juicy hint of plum shining through. Quite nutty at points.

Name: Willett's Pot Still Reserve (70cl)
Palate: Warming pepper and clove. Buttery corn, with a little caramel later on.
Finish: Still rich in toffee. Some touches of floral oak.
Nose: Dense brown sugar at first, with lemon and orange peels giving it a light fruitiness.

Name: The Gauldrons Sherry Edition Batch 2
Palate: Raisins and dried currants, with wafts of smoke, and warming spices.
Finish: Lingering smoke, with some creamy caramel.
Nose: Spiced, baked apples, with dark caramel, and some cinder toffee.

Name: Glenburgie 12 Year Old 2010 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)
Palate: Roasted nuts tossed in warm caramel, sweet sultanas, and more stone fruits, joined by zesty peels, and spiced vanilla fudge.
Finish: Chocolate chip cookies, a smidge of ginger, buttery flapjack, and silky butterscotch, with a pinch of baking spice remaining.
Nose: Floral tea and caramel wafers, with soft peach, and gently woody spice.

Name: Miltonduff 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 90048) - Cask Collection (A.D. Rattray)
Palate: Maraschino cherry, brown sugar, fig roll and raisin.
Finish: Tangy raspberry coulis drizzled over decadent and luxurious dessert.
Nose: Rosewater, aniseed, fruit cake and royal icing.

Name: Linkwood 14 Year Old 2008 - Paloma (Goldfinch)
Palate: Dark chocolate-coated raisins, a good whack of cinnamon, and jammy red fruit.
Finish: Oily malt and spiced dried fruit.
Nose: Tart plum, black pepper, toffee, and dry kitchen spices.

Name: Redwood Empire Emerald Giant Rye
Palate: Black pepper, caramel, more orange and cinnamon giving it a subtly festive feel.
Finish: Lingering honey and cassia.
Nose: Waxy orange peel, rye bread, butter, cinnamon.

Name: Bruichladdich 10 Year Old 2012 Bere Barley
Palate: Chewy malt, poached pear and apple, buttered tea cakes and juicy stone fruits are followed by spiced vanilla and salted caramel.
Finish: Fruit crumble lingers with dustings of sugar and malted biscuits, with distant coastal salinity and pithy citrus peels.
Nose: Vegetal zest and oaken vanilla lead the way with crisp apple and orchard honey.

Name: Big Peat Edinburgh - Edition #2
Palate: Nutmeg and black pepper, with layers of meaty smoke and caramelised sugar.
Finish: Grassy and peppery. Lots of peat richness.
Nose: Burnt cinnamon rolls (in a good way), earthy smoke and an underlying hint of oily walnut.

Name: Rare Hare 1953 Anniversary Edition
Palate: Medium-bodied with light herbal notes and creamed corn; light oak and baking spices.
Finish: Long-lasting on the tongue with never-ending caramel and a touch of nutmeg.
Nose: Maturity and dried fruit with specific aromas of caramelised nectarine and light clove.

Name: The English - Triple Distilled
Palate: Another helping of vanilla custard, with butterscotch, lemon drizzle cake, bitter dark chocolate and honeyed pastry.
Finish: Buttery toffee and liquorice on the finish.
Nose: Orange marmalade, chocolate sponge cake with vanilla custard, notes of anise and condensed milk.

Name: Smokehead Terminado
Palate: Bonfire smoke, toasted marshmallow, grapefruit and lime zest, and some toasted nuts.
Finish: The smoke stays, along with some red chilli, and peppery heat.
Nose: Earthy peat, with some dark caramel, buttery shortbread, and charred citrus.

Name: Annandale Man OâWords Vintage 2016 - Sherry Cask (cask 587)
Palate: Fruit cake, toasted walnuts, baking spices, and oaky vanilla.
Finish: Drizzles of salted caramel alongside warm spices.
Nose: Rich, sherry character, with dried fruits, and soft brown sugar.

Name: Jack Daniel's Tennessee Rye
Palate: Drying cinnamon and nutmeg, followed by more chocolatey notes. A touch of cooked apple appears later on.
Finish: Black pepper and spicy oak.
Nose: Fried banana, hot chocolate and a hint of toasted grain.

Name: Milk & Honey Apex - Rum Cask
Palate: Further rum character with punchy bittersweet dried fruits, exotic fresh fruits, and wafts of earthy leather, followed by an increasing zesty spice.
Finish: Banana fritters, grilled pineapple with pepper, and a woody drying finish.
Nose: Tropical fruit â bold banana, juicy pineapple, melon and funky esters.

Name: Tomintoul 2001 (bottled 2020) (cask 37) - Bourbon Barrel Matured
Palate: Creamy barley malt in balance with well-defined peppery spice.
Finish: Lengthy and dry with pronounced nutty influence from the oak.
Nose: Honeycomb toffee, buttery sweetness with hints of nutmeg and spice.

Name: Ardmore 2012 (bottled 2023) (cask 9) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Wafts of smoke and woody spices, with treacle toffee, and peppery spice.
Finish: Smoky and moreish.
Nose: Toasted grain and forest bonfires, with some sticky malt loaf.

Name: Caol Ila 6 Year Old - Batch 22 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Dried berries, salted lemons, and a hint of grilled pineapple nestle among rich layers of brine, herbaceous barley, and smoky Earl Grey tea.
Finish: Bonfire embers, salted chocolate, charcoal, and flamed citrus.
Nose: A medley of sweet tropical fruit and lemon curd, smoked chipotle, and sea breeze. Charred herbs and heather follow on, with classic notes of beach bonfire.

Name: Michter's US*1 Unblended American Whiskey
Palate: Wonderfully creamy on the palate, boasting notes of butterscotch, golden syrup and sultanas.
Finish: Corn appears again, with peach and apple alongside it.
Nose: Polished oak, buttery corn and a kick of caraway spiciness.

Name: Aerstone 10 Year Old Sea Cask
Palate: Floral malt, nougat, vanilla sponge and more honey, with orange sweeties, icing sugar and earthy oak.
Finish: Notes of clove, candied lemon and vanilla pod linger, as a pinch of salt appears on the finish.
Nose: Buttery toffee, creamy vanilla, freshly baked shortbread, honeyed malt, orange citrus and a dusting of cinnamon and cocoa.

Name: Tamdhu 15 Year Old 2007 (cask DL16481) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Pineapple chunks, brown sugar, more ripe apple notes, and a hint of cinnamon.
Finish: Mellow and fruity.
Nose: Tropical fruit, vanilla, golden syrup, and green apple.

Name: Violet Tapestry 15 Year Old 2006 - Wemyss Malts (Royal Brackla)
Palate: Honeyed baklava and Turkish delight keep things floral, with vibrant citrus zest, gingerbread, and sandalwood.
Finish: Vegetal herbs join at the end, while aromatic spices, roasted almonds, and oaken caramel linger.
Nose: Zesty, floral Earl Grey tea, and resinous pine. A touch of vanilla and cacao.

Name: Dailuaine 8 Year Old (Release 3) - Concept 8
Palate: A good amount of spice kicks in with cinnamon, pepper and liquorice, balanced by sweet melon and toffee raisins.
Finish: A touch of nutty oak on the finish, subtle fresh menthol, and clove with sweet berry compote.
Nose: Creamy vanilla, honey, and plum jam on buttered granary toast.

Name: Linkwood 8 Year Old 2011 (cask 304196) - The Single Cask
Palate: More cooked fruit, a kick of stem ginger, drying spices.
Finish: Butterscotch and fluffy pancakes.
Nose: Banana fritters and runny caramel, with some gristy savoury hints underneath.

Name: Glendullan 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 367834) - James Eadie
Palate: Juicy peach and melon bring notes of fruit salad, with zesty peels and golden syrup in tow.
Finish: Sweet plums, baked apples, and dark orange chocolate.
Nose: Tinned stone fruits in sweet syrup, and runny caramel, followed by a touch of leathery oak.

Name: Lennox Peat 4 Year Old 2018 - Mystery Malt (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Aromatic peat smoke, pear skin, and spiced, stewed apple.
Finish: Smouldering embers and caramel digestives.
Nose: Burnt sugar, oak char, heather honey, and blackberry jam.

Name: Glen Moray 13 Year Old 2005 (Master of Malt)
Palate: More green apple sweeties, a flash of fresh ginger, robust barley, and creamy key lime pie. Drying oak develops in time, bringing notes of stewed tea and pepper.
Finish: Spices build though the sweetness remains, with a superb tangle of dense toffee and fiery cracked peppercorns.
Nose: Apple candies, a touch of gooseberry, vanilla marshmallow, buttered brioche with a drizzle of honey. Mellow, creamy oak, yellow plums.

Name: Macduff 10 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Honeyed barley and orange peel, with nutty brown bread and hazelnut spread.
Finish: A slow build of spice and malt, with just a touch of red berry sweetness.
Nose: Toffee pennies, melted butter on crumpets, raisin, apricot, a touch of hoppy bitterness.

Name: Tomintoul 15 Year Old Portwood Finish
Palate: Barley sweets, caramel, quince, light wafts of red wine and Chewits.
Finish: Zesty, damson, red grape and a hint of butterscotch candies.
Nose: Blueberries, clotted cream, scones, peppery oak and tobacco.

Name: Jack Daniel's Single Barrel with Presentation Tin
Palate: Full and mouth-filling. There are notes of cereal sweetness, the rye is in evidence with a touch of cigar box and nut oils, a little spice and an aniseed character.
Finish: Good length with a hint of citrus and plenty of cereal sweetness.
Nose: Good body with plenty of toasty oak, there are notes of corn and lovely cereal sweetness, there is a good smoke note, a little spice and toffee.

Name: Johnnie Walker Black Label 12 Year Old Sherry Finish
Palate: Elegant smoke drifts between rich barley and festive biscuits, with candied nuts and bittersweet mocha arriving later.
Finish: A good helping of sherried fruit finishes things off, with dates and figs, chocolate raisins and nutty oak.
Nose: Honeyed prunes, cinnamon and ginger, with a touch of orange peel and pepper.

Name: McConnell's 5 Year Old Irish Whiskey
Palate: Mace and earthy vanilla pod, with golden syrup and Crunchy bar.
Finish: Dark treacle and toasted spices.
Nose: Somewhat floral, with notes of cedar, sweet spice and peppery oak.

Name: Kentucky Owl Bourbon - Takumi Edition
Palate: Thick caramel, supple tannins, woody spices, and sweet cinnamon.
Finish: Balanced, sweet spices and brown sugar.
Nose: Well-baked pastry, leathery spice, and some strawberry jam.

Name: Tamdhu Batch Strength (Batch 7)
Palate: Sweet and sticky fruit compote, with waves of vanilla, peppery spice, and hints of waxy orange peel.
Finish: Dried fruits linger, with smooth oak, and gentle spice.
Nose: Bread and butter pudding, with sprinkles of baking spices, and a hint of roasted nuts.

Name: Lambay Malt Irish Whiskey
Palate: Gingersnap biscuits alongside berries and white chocolate sauce.
Finish: Oily malt lingers alongside a touch of fig.
Nose: Digestive biscuits and freshly baked banana bread, with date sweetness alongside vanilla orchid.

Name: Port Charlotte 13 Year Old - Founder's Collection (The Whisky Baron)
Palate: Intense smoke covers sweet berries, biltong, coffee beans, and apricots.
Finish: Drying with peat smoke and delicate florals.
Nose: Seaspray, cloves, earthy peat, smoked meats, and maraschino cherries.

Name: Eden Mill Single Malt Scotch Whisky 2022 Release - Art of St Andrews Collection
Palate: Rich shortbread, with apple peel, ginger and cinnamon spice, and candied citrus.
Finish: Barley sugar sweets with peppery spice, and some toasted walnuts.
Nose: Oatcakes, raising, brown sugar, and some orange zest.

Name: Mourne Dew Single Malt Irish Whiskey
Palate: Lovely oak spice, peppery with hints of cinnamon and anise countered by sweet apricot and subtle hints of peat.
Finish: Spiced fruitcake and dark chilli chocolate, peat sits comfortably in the background without overwhelming the palate.
Nose: Fruity notes of pineapple and peach, soft peat with a whisper of menthol and gently toasted oak.

Name: Noble Rebel Orchard Outburst
Palate: Malted milk, with more apple, pear, and some waxy orange peel, along with a drizzle of salted caramel.
Finish: Sweet and lingering, with some spiced apple pie.
Nose: Sweet hay, green apples, and floral honey.

Name: Mackmyra Moment - Brukswhisky DLXII
Palate: Vanilla fudge, almond, toasty juniper with some oiliness and herbaceous notes.
Finish: A softly smoky finish.
Nose: Honey nut cereals, ginger, allspice, apricot, and flamed orange peel.

Name: East London Liquor Company London Rye Whisky 2022
Palate: Apricot, black pepper, honey, dry oak, a smidge of floral sweetness building.
Finish: Rye bread with salted butter, plus hints of citrus lingering.
Nose: Roasted nuts, dried fruit, toasty spices with a whiff of red chilli pepper.

Name: Staoisha 9 Year Old 2013 (casks 2 & 3) - Un-Chilfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Large helpings of peat, with toasted nuts, dried cherries and currants, dark caramel, and peppery spice.
Finish: Peat smoke lingers, along with spiced berry compote.
Nose: Coastal smoke, with some red summer berries, roasted malt, and vanilla.

Name: Undisclosed Islay 2007 (cask 10008) (bottled 2021) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Toasted brown sugar, charred staves, seaweed, and orange chocolate.
Finish: Fig jam and roasted oak.
Nose: Heavily coastal, though with enough sweet hints of sultana and orange to keep it balanced.

Name: Johnnie Walker Red Label
Palate: Cedar wood, oak and butterscotch, aniseed, Christmas cake and malt.
Finish: Long, spiced nose with smoke on the tail.
Nose: A surprisingly rich, aromatic nose with heather honey, mixed peels, soft smoke and rum spice.

Name: Clonakilty Galley Head Single Malt Irish Whiskey
Palate: Rich spice and liqourice join orchard fruit and toffee.
Finish: Sea salt and vanilla.
Nose: Red berries emerge through vanilla, chocolate, and toasted oak.

Name: Tormore 27 Year Old 1995 (cask 5384) - Connoisseurs Choice (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Rich in malt with honey-roasted peanuts, buttery sultanas, orange peel, and drying Christmas-y spices.
Finish: Caramel-dipped chocolate with a touch of jammy red berries.
Nose: Cacao, blueberry jam, vanilla-y oak, and clove.

Name: Inchgower 2009 (cask 301012) (bottled 2022) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Bright notes of vanilla, pear tart, and creamy oak, with oily malt and gentle spice building gradually.
Finish: A touch grassy with dried herbs and cooking spices. More toasted nuts and drizzles of caramel keep things balanced.
Nose: Apple blossom and fresh peels, a touch of honey, and roasted nuts.

Name: Johnnie Walker Johnnie Blonde
Palate: Toffee apple, more vanilla sweetness, buttery popcorn, and chewy caramels.
Finish: Soft, light citrus, apple pastry with a dusting of icing sugar.
Nose: Fresh, ripe berries, silky vanilla, soft malt, and toffee.

Name: Tomintoul Cigar Malt
Palate: Another wave of smoke followed by peppery oak, blackberry jam and chocolate spread on toast.
Finish: Buttery oak and roasted coffee bean.
Nose: Maple loaf cake, cinnamon and a whiff of smoke, with spiced raisin cookies.

Name: Chief's Son 5 Year Old - (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Generous waves of treacly toffee, grilled peaches, and prunes, cushion a layer of elegant earthen smoke, while peppery oak and clove simmer in the background.
Finish: The spices linger on the finish, with a vegetal note of dark chocolate mint thins and smoked nuts.
Nose: Rich roasted barley, buttered malt loaf, and toasted oak lead the way, with woody spice and a sweet touch of grenadine in tow. Smoke lingers in the distance, joined by anise and a touch of tobacco.

Name: Bladnoch Alinta
Palate: Still smoky and nutty, with cinder toffee and cassia developing.
Finish: Sweet smoke lasts on the finish.
Nose: Dark chocolate, roasted almonds, a touch of heather honey.

Name: Kavalan Single Malt Whisky (50cl)
Palate: There's mango throughout, spicy barley, gentle oak and creamy richness.
Finish: A touch of allspice, vanilla and fragrant pear skin.
Nose: Fragrant and tropical fruits with floral notes, vanilla and mango.

Name: Dailuaine 24 Year Old 1997 (casks 7764+7765) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Rich, biscuity malt and sweet gingerbread lead the way, followed by warming baking spice and roasted nuts, with tangy marmalade in tow.
Finish: Polished cedar and dense oak finish things off, with layers of caramel and warming prickles of pepper.
Nose: Fruit scones with plenty of butter, toasted marzipan, dried lemon zest, and juicy plums.

Name: Millstone Oloroso Sherry Cask
Palate: Chocolatey malt, honeyed barley, sugary coffee, fresh orange and mint.
Finish: Toffee, raisin, more chocolate and just a hint basil.
Nose: Cooked apples with cinnamon and nutmeg, sugared cereals, sultana and prune.

Name: Clonakilty Port Cask Finish
Palate: Stone fruit, sultana and chilli heat, with cherry and citrus zest appearing.
Finish: A chocolatey, spicy finish.
Nose: Red apple and creamy vanilla, with orange citrus and sandalwood.

Name: Talisker 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 16341) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: A touch of earthiness to the seaside smoke, with fresh herbs and spices.
Finish: Lingering smoke, with roasted spices.
Nose: Seaweed, rockpools, and beach bonfires.

Name: Ardmore 9 Year Old 2012 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)
Palate: Rich smoke and vanilla tangle alongside prickles of peppery oak and cooked apple.
Finish: Butterscotch and soft fudge balance peppery heat, while charred heather and drying peat smoke linger.
Nose: Buttery pastries, wafts of floral tea, hearty bonfire smoke, and woody vanilla.

Name: Scapegrace Rise Single Malt Whisky - Limited Release I
Palate: Crumbly hazelnut crostata, with allspice, pepper, and drizzles of caramel.
Finish: Nuttiness and warm spices.
Nose: Plenty of oaky spice and vanilla, with gingersnap biscuits.

Name: Loch Lomond Coffey Still Single Grain - Distiller's Choice
Palate: A velvety mouthfeel brings red berries, crumbly fudge, vanilla, and cinnamon.
Finish: Long and delicately sweet.
Nose: Soft peaches and creamy coconut are joined by rich chocolate and dark sweet blackcurrant.

Name: Glenfarclas 29 Year Old 1991 (cask 10225) - Family Cask - Master of Malt Exclusive
Palate: Malt loaf with salted butter, cocoa, old sherry, leather, and a whack of citrus peel.
Finish: Butterscotch, a waft of menthol, black pepper, cigar box, and warming oak once again.
Nose: Rich dark chocolate and sherry-soaked sultana notes, plus old oak furniture, good coffee, and a few lighter hints of honey.

Name: Balcones Pot Still Bourbon
Palate: Oily and unctuous, with Seville orange marmalade and candied nuts, plus earthy oak once again at the core.
Finish: Lasting peppery spice, dried fruit, and a hint of smoke.
Nose: Charred oak and roasted corn, with drizzles of honey and caramel.

Name: Cragganmore Distillers Edition - 2022 Collection
Palate: Wine gums, forest fruit, with oaky spice, and distant bonfire.
Finish: Drying, with red fruits lingering.
Nose: Dark cherries, plums, and cocoa nibs, with subtle smoke.

Name: Girvan 32 Year Old 1989 (cask CG011) - The Golden Cask (House of MacDuff)
Palate: Generous layers of juicy soft stone fruits and vanilla cream, custard, and fruit studded muffins.
Finish: Baked apples, drizzled with sugar, with gingerbread and zesty spice.
Nose: Honeyed nuts and granola, fresh vanilla, and melted butter, with drying, woody spice in the distance.

Name: Balcones Texas Single Malt
Palate: Ester-y with apple and orchard fruits. Brown sugar makes an appearance and transforms into molasses.
Finish: Warm, woody spices and some breadiness, but not necessarily maltiness, completes this luscious single malt.
Nose: Freshly baked banana bread with undertones of honey and vanilla and just the faintest hint of cedar wood at the back. Suggestions of roasted chestnuts and heavy cream.
