Name: Glen Moray 15 Year Old - Edinburgh Homecoming Edition
Palate: Toasted marshmallow and chocolate, with some gingernut biscuit notes in the background.
Finish: Lingering touches of ginger and vanilla.
Nose: Orange zest and dried fruit, with a pinch of peppercorn underneath.

Name: The Kurayoshi 18 Year Old
Palate: Fresh orange, black tea smokiness, a pinch of cumin powder, brown sugar.
Finish: Vanilla-forward, with another hint of smoke lingering.
Nose: Slightly grassy at first, before layers of buttered bread and aromatic oak develop.

Name: Ezra Brooks Black Label Bourbon
Palate: Honey, mocha and maple syrup.
Finish: Peppery and warming.
Nose: Buttery corn and hints of vanilla pod.

Name: Talisker 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 19902) - Old Malt Cask (Hunter Laing)
Palate: Fruity, sherry sweetness, with salted caramel, barbecue smoke, and seaweed notes lending a savoury edge.
Finish: Allspice, and lingering peat, with drizzles of treacle.
Nose: Big wafts of coastal peat, with some dried berry notes, brown sugar, and warm spice.

Name: Jameson Irish Whiskey
Palate: Thick and of good body with notes of orchard fruits, both fresh and cooked with a little vanilla cream.
Finish: Medium-length with spice and honey.
Nose: A full and floral nose leads with the smooth sweetness of marmalade and fudge before a hint of Madeira and a little cut grass note emerge.

Name: Black & White Blended Scotch Whisky
Palate: Sugary dried fruit, young oak, vanilla, caramel and lemon.
Finish: Short, with a slight sweetness of honey.
Nose: Some sour citrus, with sharp grain and biscuits, and a touch of peat.

Name: Egan's Endeavour
Palate: Raisin-studded malt loaf, with creamy Horlicks, vanilla oak influence, and gentle bonfire smoke.
Finish: Dried fruit and spices linger, with smouldering embers in the distance.
Nose: Dustings of vanilla sugar, gingerbread, and warming spices.

Name: Finlaggan Sherry Finish
Palate: Sweet smoke, warming, black pepper, raisins and sultanas.
Finish: Long with hints of dried herbs and spice.
Nose: Mixed fresh berries and nuts, sticking plasters and medicinal peat smoke.

Name: North British 18 Year Old 2003 (cask 15587) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Sticky toffee pudding, spiced banana bread with candied ginger, and roasted almonds followed by layers of vanilla.
Finish: Buttery fudge, a touch of pepper, more creamy grain, and nutty oak.
Nose: Gooey flapjack, covered in milk chocolate, lemon blossom, and orange cream.

Name: Hinch 10 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish
Palate: Sugared malty cereal, nougat and chocolate covered marzipan, dry notes of fruity sherry, sultana and a burst of fresh fruit sweetness, with ripe pear and a hint of lychee.
Finish: Lingering red berries and a hint of earthy vanilla pod.
Nose: Ripe orchard fruits, sweet notes of barley sugar and vanilla balanced by rich, slightly tart red fruit.

Name: Croftengea Apple Smoke (cask 454) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Juicy layers of cooked and fermented apples with fragrant peat smoke, roasted barley, butterscotch, and pepper.
Finish: Spiced cider, smoked wood chips, and a touch of root ginger.
Nose: Bonfire ash and soft notes of cured meat support apple chips and toasted herbs.

Name: Loch Lomond 25 Year Old 1996 - Mission Gold (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Sweet popcorn, ripe pineapple, and woody spice.
Finish: Candied ginger, melted brown sugar, and oily citrus.
Nose: Very creamy, with orange curd, sticky liquorice, and tinned fruits.

Name: James E. Pepper 3 Year Old - Oloroso Cask Finish (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Rich dark chocolate, vanilla pod sweetness and aromatic warmth from clove and cinnamon come through first, with lots of chewy rye notes and caramel in support.
Finish: Red fruit and rye spice linger.
Nose: Red cola cubes, sticky toffee pudding made with dates and blood orange rind lead with creamy vanilla and cacao in support. Plenty of dusty oak spice is present throughout.

Name: Unnamed Orkney 12 Year Old 2009 (casks DRU17/A67 #1+2) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Malty and fragrant, with a subtle coastal salinity sneaking through.
Finish: Waxy orange and toasted malt.
Nose: Lemon drops, salted caramel, shortbread, and earthy oak.

Name: Egan's Fortitude
Palate: Swirls of smoke mixed with more sherry notes, chocolate and rich dried fruits.
Finish: A long, sweet finish that lingers.
Nose: Sweet and strong sherry, honey and raisins with a hint of marzipan.

Name: Glenrothes 12 Year Old 2010 (cask 871) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Milk chocolate, cantaloupe, orange marmalade, and spiced apple.
Finish: Cinnamon butter and tinned pineapple.
Nose: Creamy malt, white pepper, and raspberry swirl cake.

Name: Cotswolds Bourbon Cask Single Malt Whisky
Palate: Peanut brittle, sultana, shortbread, and cinnamon.
Finish: Buttery biscuits, white pepper, and orange zest.
Nose: Vanilla custard, green apple, a hint of toasted oak smokiness.

Name: The Busker Triple Cask Triple Smooth
Palate: Enjoyably malty, with touches of dark chocolate popping up underneath juicy apricot and mango.
Finish: Lingering hints of crumbly fudge and nutty barley.
Nose: Caramel, honeycomb, a zesty hint of tropical fruit.

Name: Kavalan Single Malt Whisky
Palate: There's mango throughout, spicy barley, gentle oak and creamy richness.
Finish: A touch of allspice, vanilla and fragrant pear skin.
Nose: Fragrant and tropical fruits with floral notes, vanilla and mango.

Name: Dalaruan - Classic Selection (The Lost Distillery Company)
Palate: The smoke notes become more coastal on the palate. Remains filled with apple and apricot in the background.
Finish: Herbaceous once again, with a touch of sea breeze.
Nose: Earthy/herbaceous peat smoke, paired with juicy orchard fruit.

Name: Woven Superblend
Palate: Spicy oak with fresh orchard fruit, lemon, and orange peel.
Finish: Sweet vanilla and toffee.
Nose: Citrus fruit and fresh green apples.

Name: Tobermory 2013 (bottled 2021) â The Scalasaig
Palate: Sweet dates and plums lead to chocolate honeycomb with oily malt and roasted nuts creeping in.
Finish: Zesty wafts of orange peel, spiced tea loaf, and lingering oak.
Nose: Waxed peels open things up, with juicy raisins and sultanas, a smidge of green oak, and floral honey.

Name: Millstone 100 Rye Whisky
Palate: More lemon notes develop on the palate, now paired with pine. Cardamom spiciness. Maybe even a touch of Fino?
Finish: Waxy fruit and another kick of cardamom.
Nose: Deliciously fragrant with orange blossom, roasted lemon and a touch of thyme. Hints of brown sugar sweetness.

Name: Bladnoch 14 Year Old (2022 Release)
Palate: Sherry-soaked raisins, milk chocolate, floral honey, a touch of grassy barley.
Finish: Drying cinnamon and nutmeg spiciness, with more fruity sweetness for balance.
Nose: Fruitcake, orange oil, and polished oak.

Name: The Oxford Artisan Distillery Heritage Corn Whisky - Grain Stories
Palate: Banana fritters, cut grass, buttered bread, gingerbread, salted peanuts.
Finish: A lasting touch of allspice and vanilla.
Nose: Buttery shortbread, cassia and cinnamon, baked apples, a whiff of floral spring breeze.

Name: Ardmore 13 Year Old 2009 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)
Palate: Woody spice, maple syrup, tawny marmalade, and some toasted coconut.
Finish: Caramelised nuts, toasted oak, and baking spices.
Nose: Sticky dates, toasted walnuts, and toasted barley.

Name: Highland Park 15 Year Old 2006 (cask 5032775) - The Octave (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Roasted almonds, honeycomb, smoky peppercorns, a hint of liquorice.
Finish: The floral hints of heather return for the long finish.
Nose: Heather honey, soft smoke with a dry hint of seaweed, waffles.

Name: Glengoyne BalbaÃ­na
Palate: Earthy clove and cinnamon, chewy dates, a touch of cantaloupe.
Finish: Brown sugar, soft oak, a touch of citrus peel.
Nose: Chocolate orange, malty biscuits, a hint of red wine sweetness.

Name: Tamdhu 8 Year Old 2014 (cask DL16345) - Provenance (Douglas Laing)
Palate: The cinnamon sticks around, with a dash of nutmeg and ginger, while rich, roasted barley and trickles of caramel develop.
Finish: Spiced fruit loaf, buttery shortbread, caramelised almonds, and chewy toffee.
Nose: Roasted walnuts, candied pecans, a touch of maple, and fragrant cinnamon.

Name: The English - Smokey
Palate: Full-bodied smoke, paired with light notes of buttered bread and peppery barley.
Finish: Stem ginger and lingering bonfire embers.
Nose: Cinnamon, smoked malt and blueberry muffins.

Name: West Cork Glengarriff Series - Bog Oak Charred Cask Finish
Palate: Drying spices, Frazzles, barley sugar and yellow plum.
Finish: Lingering smokiness, joined by a touch of brown sugar.
Nose: Smoky notes arrive first - a bit mezcal-esque in their approach. Hints of sultanas and green apple in the background.

Name: Old Perth The Original
Palate: Cherry jam, plump raisin, and more chocolate notes.
Finish: A spicy finish with another burst of berry fruit.
Nose: Festive spices, cocoa, and oily malt.

Name: The Glenrothes 10 Year Old - Canmore
Palate: More fresh apple is followed by sweeter, baked fruits. Vegetal barley rests comfortably beneath softly spiced vanilla biscuits.
Finish: The fruity freshness prevails, with a crisp, delicate spice wrapping things up.
Nose: Crisp green apples with herbaceous zest and vanilla cream.

Name: Mars Tsunuki 2022 Edition
Palate: Creamy cocoa butter balanced by a light citrussy acidity, green oak, sweet maple syrup, and with gentle heat building.
Finish: Oaky bourbon sweetness lingers.
Nose: Touches of apricot, with jammy marmalade and wafts of vanilla.

Name: Loch Lomond 12 Year Old Louis Oosthuizen Limited Edition
Palate: A subtle hint of smoke, before fresh peach and marmalade notes arrive.
Finish: Dry cedar, vanilla pod, and sugared almond.
Nose: Lemon and honey, with a smidge of lavender, and malty biscuits.

Name: SPEY Trutina Cask Strength - Batch 4
Palate: Layers of vanilla, honey, and strawberry jam coat orchard fruit and baking spices.
Finish: Clove and toffee.
Nose: Apple pie topped with brown sugar and cinnamon. Creamy vanilla and a juicy burst of orangey sweetness in support.

Name: Nikka Taketsuru Pure Malt (2020 Release)
Palate: More vanilla, subtly floral at points. Salted butter on toasted teacakes, ripe pear and peach.
Finish: Lingering peat smoke and subtle baking spice warmth.
Nose: Grassy malt, earthy vanilla, toasted coconut and BBQ pineapple.

Name: Jack Daniel's Single Barrel (cask 21-07907) (Master of Malt Exclusive)
Palate: Rounded oak, banana fritters, a core of pecan and malty chocolate.
Finish: A hint of cigar box richness develops on the finish, with continued nutty hints.
Nose: Honeyed cereals with a smidge of toasty warmth, caramelised nuts, a flash of red fruit.

Name: Invergordon 15 Year Old 2007 (cask CG009) - The Golden Cask (House of MacDuff)
Palate: Peaches and cream, toasted cashews, and spiced custard.
Finish: Green cardamom balanced by golden syrup and orange chocolate.
Nose: Dried apple, buttercream, and coffee ice cream.

Name: Malt Riot
Palate: Fruitier on the palate, with some zesty citrus and mango, shortly joined by gingerbread and amaretti biscuits.
Finish: Lingering ginger spiciness.
Nose: Freshly baked bread with marmalade, floral vanilla, a whisper of sawdust.

Name: Glen Elgin 12 Year Old 2009 (casks 806369, 806378 & 806379) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: A brilliant balance of soft, creamy oak and peppery barley, with smotherings of set honey, cooked apricots, and vanilla.
Finish: Barley water and boiled fruit sweets balance dried spices beneath.
Nose: Layers of creamy pastries, toasted almonds, and butter biscuits with sweet citrus zest in tow.

Name: Glen Scotia 12 Year Old Seasonal Release
Palate: Toasted sugar and brown butter, with hints of orange oil and dried fruit.
Finish: Lasting spiciness of ginger, cinnamon, and oak.
Nose: Pear, red apple, layers of toffee, and a hint of sea shell salinity.

Name: Wild Turkey 81 Proof
Palate: Rich and thick, notes of caramel, manuka honey and fudge, hints of rhubarb and custard sweets and oily espresso beans.
Finish: Caramel and coffee, hints of Black Forest honey and Hot Cross Buns. Charred and spicy.
Nose: A spiced, oaky nose with vanilla fudge, rye spices and coffee beans.

Name: Jim Beam Single Barrel
Palate: Oak char leads into creamy vanilla, brown sugar, burnt caramel and peppery spice.
Finish: Hints of dried apricot, toasty oak and baking spices.
Nose: Apple pie and rye spices, with buttery corn and oaky vanilla.

Name: Pikesville 6 Year Old 110 Proof Straight Rye
Palate: Fruity, then wonderfully spicy rye. Sweet liquorice again (specifically the coconutty/nougat-y pink Liquorice Allsorts that have a black bit in the middle), plenty of oak and then clove drops on the tail.
Finish: Vanilla with cinnamon and apricot Danish.
Nose: Some dusty spice, a touch of Norwegian hand cream and cocoa at first with sweet liquorice, CuraÃ§ao, vanilla custard and crÃ¨me caramel developing.

Name: Glencadam American Oak Reserve
Palate: Lemon cheesecake, honeycomb, malted barley, a hint of ginger.
Finish: Toffee and waxy peels.
Nose: Melted butter, almond, a bit floral at points.

Name: St. Thomas 32 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Chocolatey, with more vanilla pouring in. A subtle waft of mint appears along the way.
Finish: Toffee pennies and crumbly fudge.
Nose: Massive caramel and vanilla tablet notes, with hints of warm oak developing.

Name: Woven Experience No.12
Palate: Poached pears and plums, damp leaves, Maltesers, and earthy peat.
Finish: Lingering smoke, with milk chocolate.
Nose: Apple pie, with oaky vanilla, woody spices, and distant bonfire smoke.

Name: Tomatin 15 Year Old 2006 Madeira Cask - The Portuguese Collection
Palate: sweet membrillo, with spiced apple compote, oaky vanilla, and crumbly shortcake.
Finish: Floral honey, and warm spices.
Nose: Poached quince, with twists of oily lemon peel, and drizzles of caramel.

Name: Cardhu 11 Year Old (Special Release 2020)
Palate: Densely creamy and mouth-filling, with icing sugar adding to the fruit-forward palate. There's marmalade on toast, raisins and gentle white pepper in there, too.
Finish: Medium-long, with more of that pepper and cinnamon warmth cutting through.
Nose: An orchard fruit-led delight, with oodles of crisp apple, pear and even some grapes coming through. Over time, the fruit turns a little more tropical, especially juicy pineapple and Galia melon. Rhubarb and custard boiled sweets, pencil shavings and a gentle cinnamon prickle add to the fruit.

Name: Peerless Kentucky Rye 3 Year Old 2016 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Robust layers of earthen vanilla pod, caramel, and peppery spice are supported by salty, nutty, chocolatey suggestions of Reese's Cups.
Finish: Fennel, carraway and toasted rye bread with salted butter.
Nose: Toffee covered nuts and cracked black peppercorns are joined by herbal anise and oaken vanilla.

Name: Randolph Oxford Barrel Proof
Palate: Powerfully malty, with more citrus and toasted spices.
Finish: Lingering hints of cinnamon and chocolate peanuts.
Nose: Chocolate orange, black pepper, pine, and toffee.

Name: Caramel Apple Sauce 1991 (bottled 2018) - Wemyss Malts (North British)
Palate: Marmalade, runny caramel, a hint of butterscotch and buttered brown bread.
Finish: Warming festive spices last.
Nose: Thick honey and molasses, with a hint of pineapple underneath the richness.

Name: Filey Bay STR Finish
Palate: Salted caramel, red berries, subtle barrel char and cinnamon spiciness.
Finish: Strawberries and black pepper, dark chocolate bitterness, dry oak.
Nose: Chocolate orange, toasted teacakes and a hint of fresh barley.

Name: New Town Blends - The Surgeons Ball
Palate: Orange peel and vanilla ice-cream, earthy smoke and melted chocolate.
Finish: Hints of peat go on and on...
Nose: BBQ'd burnt ends, toasted sugar, Eccles cakes and a hint of charred oak.

Name: Ballantine's Finest
Palate: Rich and sweet. Barley and caramel, very gentle peat.
Finish: Soft and sweet, fudge.
Nose: Expressive, crisp barley sugars. Touch of wood smoke, toffee.

Name: Sagamore Spirit Signature Rye
Palate: Chewy dates and candied peels, with pistachio ice cream and nutmeg to follow.
Finish: Lasting vanilla, a hint of drying cedar and more honey.
Nose: Honeyed grains, milky coffee, cinnamon gum and a soft hint of peppery oak.

Name: Tennessee Rye Whisky 5 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Baking spices and rich toffee join the fun with hints of vanilla cola, black tea, and chocolate-covered raisins.
Finish: Burnt toast and a hint of cherry.
Nose: Cherry and strawberries are joined by a medley of tropical fruit among charred oak, dark chocolate, and chalk dust.

Name: Dartmoor Bourbon Cask Matured Whisky
Palate: Malty and light, though with a touch of oiliness to it. Vanilla and quince stick around.
Finish: A fleeting hint of smoke, eclipsed by citrus, crunchy brown sugar and desiccated coconut.
Nose: Fresh pear and peach, with helpings of earthy barley and hay.

Name: Caol Ila 11 Year Old 2010 - Paloma (Goldfinch Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Through oily malt and medicinal peat comes salted caramel, pineapple and cinnamon.
Finish: Lingering peat with a light touch of dried fruit.
Nose: Heaps of lemon zest, wet hay, bonfire smoke, and custard cream biscuits.

Name: Starward Projects - Ginger Beer Cask #6
Palate: Ginger packs some heat with warming spice balanced by bold vanilla and juicy notes of tropical fruit.
Finish: Crystalised ginger, dried orange peels, wafts of sticky toffee pudding follow toasty oak and gently prickling heat.
Nose: Bright and zesty notes of candied orange, dipped in dark chocolate. Plenty of fiery ginger.

Name: Ben Ãideann Distillery Edition
Palate: Tinned pineapple sweetness with porridge sprinkled with brown sugar and a good glug of cream.
Finish: Peppery oak and honeyed spices linger.
Nose: Freshly baked banana bread and vanilla shortbread, with a touch of passion fruit jam.

Name: Glen Scotia Campbeltown 1832
Palate: Salted caramel, cooked fruit (apple and strawberry), coastal smoke.
Finish: Sea salt and waves of honey.
Nose: Dates, oatcakes and smoked cheese, with orange peel cutting through.

Name: Pittyvaich 30 Year Old (Special Release 2020)
Palate: An oily and unctuous dram, with a creamy vanilla ice cream note especially prominent. There's some Victoria sponge cake in there, along with a dash of red fruits, and a gentle cinnamon lift.
Finish: Short-to-medium, with more cinnamon and papaya notes.
Nose: A celebration of tropical fruit, with oodles of green banana, papaya, juicy pineapple and yellow melon. There's a wonderful leafy green quality too, plus a gentle toasted oak quality.

Name: Cotswolds Golden Wold - The Harvest Series
Palate: Silky custard, with toasted oak, cocoa nibs, and warm baking spices.
Finish: Peat smoulders in the background alongside toasted brioche.
Nose: Sun dried hay, with caramelised honey, oaken vanilla, and gentle wafts of peat.

Name: Never Say Die Barrel Strength Whiskey (Barrel No. 3)
Palate: The spice continues on the palate, with woody cinnamon and nutmeg, kept in check by buttery toffee and leathery oak.
Finish: A mellow finish, rye spice gathers some warmth, while butterscotch and oaken vanilla linger.
Nose: Oak char and vanilla lead, with zesty citrus oils and a touch of cinnamon.

Name: Miltonduff 16 Year Old - Chorlton Whisky
Palate: Creamy vanilla, white chocolate, and raspberries join the party.
Finish: A little tropical fruit and cream linger.
Nose: Sweet porridge, orange peel, and cooked apple spiced with a little cinnamon.

Name: Caol Ila 9 Year Old 2014 (cask 303408 & 303410) - Dalgety (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Red berries, sticky toffee pudding with dates, smoked ham, cinnamon, and brine.
Finish: Smoky and sweet until the end.
Nose: BBQ meat, sea shell, orange peel, coffee grounds, and rich smoke.

Name: Starward Octave Barrel - Projects Limited Release
Palate: Red berries, aromatic spice, dried fruit, and some herbaceousness on the palate.
Finish: Long and full of oak and fruit.
Nose: Toffee apple, acacia honey, stewed plums, and orange peel.

Name: Dailuaine 12 Year Old 2008 (cask 308909) - Auld Goonsy's Malt
Palate: Oily oak, sultanas, and gentle baking spice alongside honeyed cereal and a touch of zesty marmalade.
Finish: Sugary jam, more cinnamon, and a touch of herbaceous, oaky pepper.
Nose: Toasty malt and roasted nuts, sweet cinnamon buns, and creamy vanilla.

Name: Kavalan Solist Amontillado Cask (55.6%)
Palate: Chocolate-y at first (think chocolate orange and dark chocolate truffle), though the pineapple and guava notes from the nose soon return.
Finish: Drying spices and a final burst of sharp pineapple.
Nose: Big waves of tropical fruit and almost Fino-like nuttiness coming from the Sherried malt.

Name: Craigellachie 13 Year Old 2009 - Hepburn's Choice (Langside)
Palate: Heather honey, oily barley, juicy marmalade, and toffee.
Finish: Winter spices and crumbly fudge.
Nose: Honeyed porridge, charred pineapple, toasted oak, and ginger.

Name: Balmenach 10 Year Old 2011 (cask 417) - Lady of the Glen (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Crumbly fudge, with peppery spice, creamy malt, and oaky spice.
Finish: Sticky caramel and barley sugar, with toasted oak.
Nose: Dark caramel, with a touch of toasted almonds, coffee, and earthy vanilla.

Name: Glenglassaugh 10 Year Old 2009 (cask 1346)
Palate: Charred peaches, with dried mango, zesty ginger and lime, salted caramel, and warming spices.
Finish: Vanilla, with woody spices, and gentle sweetness.
Nose: Oaky vanilla, with milk chocolate, some dark brown sugar, orange zest, and gorse flowers.

Name: Cotswolds Peated Cask Single Malt Whisky
Palate: Apricot, apple and peach, followed by soft hints of sea salt and cedar.
Finish: Honeyed malt, floral barley and final fleeting waft of spicy smoke.
Nose: Toffee pennies, toasted sesame seeds, cinnamon sticks and sultanas.

Name: Akashi Toji Blended Malt & Grain
Palate: Honeyed prunes and sultanas follow more warming oaken spice, with creamy grain, and biscuity malt shining through.
Finish: Fruited flapjack, warming cinnamon and pepper, a whisper of peat, with nutty oak, and caramel lingering.
Nose: Oaken vanilla and cracked peppercorns open the way, before layers of caramel, and smoky tea creep in.

Name: Inchfad 15 Year Old 2007 - North Star Spirits
Palate: Powerful layers of vegetal peat and sticky sherried fruit tangle, with candied nuts, earthy charred oak, and dried orange.
Finish: Smoky tea and oak char linger with sweet, nutty notes of maple syrup and chewy peat.
Nose: Fragrant dried fruit and cooked apple, herbaceous barley, and a touch of charcoal.

Name: Girvan 26 Year Old 1996 (cask 910315) - Single Cask Series (The Red Cask Company)
Palate: Melted white chocolate, raspberry coulis, old oak, and butter.
Finish: Herbal spices balance buttery caramel and sweet citrus.
Nose: Cooked berries, quince, buttery oak, and pepper spice.

Name: Adnams Triple Malt Whisky
Palate: Chocolate orange, caramelised almond, honey and a kick of white pepper.
Finish: Continued chocolatey elements, with a touch of bubblegum and charred oak.
Nose: Toasted coconut, white grape, foam banana and apricot.

Name: Tomatin 12 Year Old 2008 Rivesaltes Cask Finish - French Collection
Palate: More citrus notes, now in the shape of marmalade and grapefruit pith. Still packed with malty notes, plus a touch of walnut.
Finish: Lasting sugared almond sweetness.
Nose: Orange oil, red berries, buttered bread, and flaky pastry.

Name: Rebel 100 Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
Palate: Buttered corn dusted with black pepper, slightly oily at points, sweet toffee and citrus notes, just a hint of charred oak.
Finish: Cinnamon gum, vanilla pod, and white chocolate.
Nose: Gingerbread and chocolate-chip cookie, with some okay heat building underneath.

Name: Craigellachie 14 Year Old 2008 (cask 19728) - The First Editions (Hunter Laing)
Palate: Charred oak, rich malt, apricot jam on toast, and tropical fruit.
Finish: Buttery popcorn and a little cinnamon.
Nose: Garden herbs, salted caramel, beeswax, mango, ground sweet spices, and peppery oak.

Name: Chivas Regal Extra 13 Year Old Bourbon Cask
Palate: Sweet vanilla caramel, buttered popcorn, pressed apples and mellow spice.
Finish: Gently peppery warmth builds, with plenty of creamy malt, tangy oak, and smooth spice.
Nose: Vanilla and oak are there right away, followed by a touch of orange zest and melted butter.

Name: Talisker 8 Year Old (Special Release 2020)
Palate: Silky smooth and mouth-filling, with prickles of that characteristic Talisker pepperiness. The fruit becomes more caramelised, and the smoke becomes more bonfire-like, but the nose and palate are beautifully aligned.
Finish: Long and warming, with the pepper turning more chilli-like, wrapped up in gentle smoke.
Nose: seaweed, iodine, crystallised citrus fruit and charred meat. After a while, molasses and stewed tropical fruits come through, along with a wisp of smoke.

Name: Waterford Biodynamic - Luna 1.1
Palate: black pepper, cinnamon and ginger. Then creamy, almost cream cheese notes, pastry, vanilla and sugared almonds with orchard fruits.
Finish: Those amazing aromatics linger mingled with creamy custard. Very long.
Nose: Super spicy, almost like a rye whisky. Thereâs cinnamon, cardamom and freshly-baked rye bread, with apples, peaches and apricots.

Name: Starward 5 Year Old 2016 (cask 1870)
Palate: Cigar box, oily walnut, red grape skin, and sweet ginger, alongside a touch of mint.
Finish: A dry finish of cinnamon, tobacco, and oak spice.
Nose: Fairly woody and a touch herbal, with roasted coffee bean, dried apricot, and orange chocolate.

Name: Johnnie Walker Black Label 12 Year Old â Icons 2.0
Palate: Rich and full with notes of wood smoke and dry spice, hints of barley and cereal with creamy toffee and a distinct herbal note.
Finish: Quite fruity and long with a note of sultanas and mixed peels.
Nose: Winter spice and treacle, hints of white pepper and a little citrus.

Name: Fettercairn Warehouse 2 Batch No. 004
Palate: A pleasing continuation of the nose, now with hints of red berries and espresso, but honeyed melon sweetness is never far away.
Finish: Some late palate tannin gives way to soft cocoa and grapefruit peel.
Nose: Whole peanut and some meatiness, before apple strudel fruit notes slowly come to the fore with a touch of Fryâs Orange Cream.

Name: Caol Ila 8 Year Old 2014 Tokaji Wine Cask Finish - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Tropical fruits arrive, with charred apricot and pineapple, hints of salted mango, and waxed citrus backed by runny honey and bonfire smoke.
Finish: Aromatic woodsmoke, salted fudge, pink peppercorn, and lingering smoked fruit.
Nose: Vibrant layers of herbaceous peat and stewed, syrupy sultanas, joined by robust roasted malt and honeyed tea cakes.

Name: Egan's 10 Year Old Single Malt
Palate: Malty cereal notes and cream intertwined with mango, banana and cranberries.
Finish: Honeyed, malty sweetness and notes of oak in the long finish.
Nose: Light smoke alongside aromas of pineapple, coconut, vanilla, apples and freshly baked cookies.

Name: White Oak Tokinoka Black
Palate: Creamy vanilla, exotic fruit and toasted oak lead, with prickles of sweet spice.
Finish: An elegant, medium length finish.
Nose: Citrus fruits, dried apricots and floral honey.

Name: Port Askaig 8 Year Old
Palate: Soft salted caramel brings a sweetness to the palate, with waves of coastal peat smoke crashing underneath.
Finish: Medium length, with a hot kick of peppercorn.
Nose: Charcoal, salted crisps and a good squeeze of lemon.

Name: Johnnie Walker Red Label â Icons 2.0
Palate: Cedar wood, oak and butterscotch, aniseed, Christmas cake and malt.
Finish: Long, spiced nose with smoke on the tail.
Nose: A surprisingly rich, aromatic nose with heather honey, mixed peels, soft smoke and rum spice.

Name: Big Peat Beach BBQ Edition â FÃ¨is Ãle 2022
Palate: Coastal peat is right up front, paired with touches of dark chocolate, salt and pepper crisps, and new leather.
Finish: Peppercorn, smoke, and charred cedar.
Nose: Singed barley with a meatiness to it, joined by honey roasted peanuts and salted lemons.

Name: James Cree's 8 Year Old Cattle Ranch Whiskey
Palate: White chocolate, woody spices, vanilla cream, and clove-studded orange.
Finish: Chocolate spread on toast, with more citrus lingering.
Nose: Orange oil, chocolate fudge, and caramel popcorn, with a hit of chilli spice.

Name: The Balvenie 40 Year Old
Palate: Cinnamon, nutmeg, thyme honey which develops floral hints further on. Sherried goodness surrounds it all wonderfully.
Finish: Sweet and warming with honey.
Nose: Rich, elegant floral notes waft up first, with dried apricots and crystallised citrus peels and ginger. Freshly crushed vanilla pods and a good hint of warm oak.

Name: Aberlour 11 Year Old 2011 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)
Palate: Baked apple, crumbly shortbread, and a touch of Turkish delight.
Finish: Peppery spice and milk chocolate.
Nose: Oat cookies, subtle peach, caramel, and woody spice.

Name: Teaninich 14 Year Old 2008 - Bodega Series (Goldfinch Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Candied nuts mixed with juicy sultanas and currants, herbal barley, and hints of fiery ginger and nutmeg.
Finish: Chocolate almonds, honeyed orchard fruits, lingering cakey spice.
Nose: Zesty marmalade, buttered walnut loaf, and set honey.

Name: Glenburgie 10 Year Old 2011 - Big Brother (Na BrÃ ithrean)
Palate: Sweet dark fruit on the palate with black pepper, chilli, and wood fire.
Finish: Lingering smoke and spice.
Nose: Sweet vanilla and orchard fruit on the nose with spice, and a touch of smoke.

Name: Daddy Rack 4 Year Old Cask Strength (barrel 06)
Palate: Sweet vanilla, oaken caramel with jammy cherry, and dark chocolate.
Finish: Biscuity spice with notes of forest fruits, creamy grain, and oak char.
Nose: Fresh peach and green apple lead, with prickles of pepper and orange zest.

Name: Rabbit Hole Boxergrail Kentucky Straight Rye Whiskey
Palate: Still plenty of oak and spice to it, well-balanced by vanilla and a hint of cigar box.
Finish: Brown sugar, apple, blackberry, cassia.
Nose: Dark chocolate and toffee, underpinned by robust rye spiciness and a waft of warm sawdust.

Name: Port Dundas 15 Year Old 2006 - Single Grain Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Buttery oak and toasted sourdough with sweet strawberry jam, backed up by silky honey and vanilla fudge.
Finish: Butterscotch, a hint of citrus zest, and drying anise.
Nose: Floral notes of vanilla and raspberry with a creamy, sugary touch of crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e.

Name: Balmenach 32 Year Old 1990 - Old & Rare Platinum (Hunter Laing)
Palate: More orchard fruits arrive, with warm, spiced crumble and silky toffee. A touch of gingerbread hovers, balanced by oaken vanilla.
Finish: That ginger heats up towards the end, while creamy barley and butterscotch linger.
Nose: Vanilla caramel and buttery fudge, a touch of roasted coffee, and baked apple sweetness.

Name: GlenAllachie 2014 (bottled 2021) - Wilson & Morgan
Palate: Crushed almonds, toasted pecans, and oily walnut loaf lead to honeyed figs, dates, and prunes.
Finish: Meaty malt, drying sherried oak, poached pears, and leathery tang.
Nose: Heavy sherry with doughy brioche, candied nuts, and bold layers of rich, punchy fruit.

Name: Girvan 16 Year Old 2006 (cask 523223) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Juicy plums are backed by chewy toffee, maple Danish pastries, and sticky dates. Floral malt and sweet oak nestle beneath.
Finish: Caramel, nuts, marzipan, and cinnamon join cooked apples, flapjack, and ginger biscuits.
Nose: Honeyed granola, laced with vanilla and candied nuts, plus baking spice and syrupy stone fruits.

Name: King Of Scots The Peated Edition (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Charred oak and campfire ash are balanced by butterscotch and citrus.
Finish: Vanilla and oak spice linger.
Nose: Rich, earthy smoke drifts through golden barley, honey, and apple peel.

Name: Waterford Single Farm Origin - Lakefield 1.1
Palate: Still nutty, now with brown bread and Sesame Snaps mixed in. A slow build of chocolatey notes appear later on.
Finish: Green apple, cut grass, a pinch of cinnamon.
Nose: Walnuts and pecans, with buttery biscuits and a hint of zesty citrus and crisp melon.

Name: Linkwood Fruity & Sweet Madeira Finish - Cask Craft (Murray McDavid)
Palate: It's a beautifully honeyed palate with syrupy fruits, peanut brittle, and a touch of clove.
Finish: Unctuous and long.
Nose: Raspberry, toasted almond, vanilla ice cream, and a hint of mint.

Name: Caol Ila 16 Year Old 2007 (cask 205) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Something magical happens when you get Caol Ila and oloroso together, it's like a fever dream involving a barbecue and a Christmas cake, in the best possible way.
Finish: Coastal peat, with salted liquorice.
Nose: Caol Ila peat, with dark and brooding oloroso goodness â all the sticky dried fruits, and rich spice.

Name: Writers Tears Red Head
Palate: An oily nuttiness, with fruity Christmas cake, tangy pineapple, liquorice and melted milk chocolate.
Finish: Rich walnut with oak and baking spice lingering.
Nose: Candied orange peel, chocolate covered marzipan, sherried dried fruit, and praline and tropical fruit.

Name: Speyside #4 23 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Spiced apple leads, joined by more sweet, tropical fruit and juicy barley. Baking spices nestle comfortably beneath, with a touch of charred oak in tow.
Finish: Caramelised fruit lingers, with a return of the toasted coconut from the nose, and a sprinkle of cinnamon sugar.
Nose: Light and fruity with tropical notes of coconut, vanilla, and candied pineapples joined by cooked apples drizzled with cream and caramel.

Name: SPEY Fumare Cask Strength - Batch 4
Palate: Toffee apple, malt cereal, and toasty oak join the lush forest fruit sweetness and grassy peat.
Finish: Slightly burnt brown sugar and smoked herbs.
Nose: Subtly smoky, shrouding honeyed nuts, stewed orchard fruit, and vanilla custard.

Name: Caol Ila 2010 (bottled 2022) - Wonders of the World (Swell de Spirits)
Palate: Plenty of bonfire and smoked meats, coastal minerality, plasters, sticky raisins, and drizzles of caramel.
Finish: The coastal smoke lingers, along with treacle and aromatic spices.
Nose: Coastal smoke, with notes of orange blossom, iodine, and sticky molasses.

Name: Nectar Grove 2023 release (Wemyss Malts)
Palate: Fruit cake, with wafts of cinnamon, earthy vanilla pod, and red berries.
Finish: Zesty citrus and fragrant, nutty spice.
Nose: Tinned peaches, rich vanilla, orange peel, and ginger.

Name: Tormore 26 Year Old 1995 - Mission Gold (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Orange chocolate, vanilla, apple.
Finish: Light caramel, sweet spice, oak.
Nose: Boozy raisins, allspice, rich malt.

Name: Benriach 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 2372) - Infrequent Flyers (Alistair Walker)
Palate: More red fruits, raspberry cordial, redcurrants, with oaky vanilla, and a touch of orange oil.
Finish: Peppery spice, with dried cranberries lingering.
Nose: Ripe summer berries, crunchy cherries, waffle cone, and toasted oats.

Name: Taisteal Explorer's Malt
Palate: Biscuity malt and nougat, with citrus curd and lemon blossom.
Finish: A drizzle of treacle lingers alongside oily orange.
Nose: Floral heather honey, tobacco and fresh, sweet malt.

Name: Glenburgie 9 Year Old 2012 (cask 9598) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Maple syrup and more sweet sultanas lead, with chocolatey malt and jammy stone fruits.
Finish: Baking spices creep towards the end, joined by sweet orange zest, burnt caramel, and cinnamon.
Nose: Sweet hedgerow fruits, freshly baked biscuits, and candied ginger, with sticky sultanas and drizzles of honey.

Name: Glen Moray 12 Year Old - Elgin Heritage
Palate: Chewy barley with a drizzle of syrup, a touch of apricot and crushed honey-roasted nuts.
Finish: White chocolate and oak.
Nose: Crisp green apple skin, rhubarb boiled sweets, buttery shortbread, with subtly herbaceous oak developing.

Name: The Woodsman
Palate: Creamy vanilla, ginger root, slight grain sweetness.
Finish: A touch of smoke underneath spearmint and cinnamon.
Nose: Sandalwood, honey, almond slices and sawdust.

Name: Tobermory 17 Year Old 2004 Oloroso Cask
Palate: Christmas cake, toffee, Lion Bars, and subtle whiffs of dry oak.
Finish: Lingering tangy orange, festive spices, and a touch of leather.
Nose: Fragrant raspberries and blackberries, with malty vanilla and toasted cassia underneath.

Name: The English - Double Cask
Palate: Dark, jammy fruit compote, sweet vanilla and fresh raspberries, orange marmalade, tobacco and rose petals.
Finish: Raspberry boiled sweeties and citrus peel linger.
Nose: Creamy vanilla, fruit cake with buckets of raisins and sultanas, wine gums, dates and sweet liquorice.

Name: Johnnie Walker Sweet Peat
Palate: Sweet and indulgent caramel and fudge, married with charred tropical fruits.
Finish: Ripe apples and oranges, followed by a rounded smokiness that stays with you after the last sip.
Nose: The warmth of caramel and spices combined with the fresh smokiness of fruit around a campfire.

Name: Waterford Arcadian - Gaia 1.1
Palate: Vibrant barley notes, supported by more citrus and fruit, as well as a growing touch of earthy spice.
Finish: Dried peels, cedar, spring blossom and menthol.
Nose: Honey, melted butter, fresh orange oil and a hint of cranberry.

Name: GlenAllachie 9 Year Old 2012 CuvÃ©e Cask Finish
Palate: Fruit and nut balance, with cocoa nibs, charred grains, dried currants, and cranberries, joined by candied orange peel, and gingerbread spice.
Finish: Warm spices linger, with roasted almonds.
Nose: Floral, with orange blossom honey, toasted marzipan and pistachios, and warm cinnamon spice.

Name: Raven Rare
Palate: Buttered scones, biscuity oak and dried grass combine with peach and fresh grapefruit before a dusting of cinnamon emerges.
Finish: A herbaceous touch of thyme lingers.
Nose: Vanilla, toffee apple and fried banana, with plenty of nutty malt underneath.

Name: Darkness! Glendullan 8 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish
Palate: Dark fruit compote, golden syrup and burnt malt, with prickles of cinnamon throughout.
Finish: A little bittersweet dark chocolate and more plummy goodness.
Nose: Pinot Noir, plenty of nutty oloroso elements and stewed plums first, followed by tannic wood, leather and blueberries.

Name: Orkney 19 Year Old - Chorlton Whisky
Palate: Salted caramel, with oaky spice, lemon zest, and gentle coastal smoke.
Finish: Distant bonfires, with dried ginger.
Nose: Heather honey, with toasty oak and lemon curd.

Name: GlenAllachie 10 Year Old Chinquapin Oak Finish
Palate: Chocolate-chip cookies, heather honey, waxy peels, and a hint of earthy barley.
Finish: Vanilla pod, crunched peppercorns, caramel.
Nose: Pecan and peanut brittle, with a dusting of nutmeg and cinnamon in the background.

Name: Tomintoul 18 Year Old 2002 - Sauternes Cask Finish
Palate: Peach, more citrus, buttery barley, honeyed sweetness developing later on.
Finish: Sugared almond, nectarine, brown sugar.
Nose: Marmalade, mint imperials, cut grass, brioche, and waxy lemons.

Name: Glencadam Origin 1825
Palate: Sweet winter spice, vanilla, malt, cooked fruits and fruit salad.
Finish: Sweet and fruity.
Nose: Mixed fruit - red fruit from the Sherry casks and tropical from the American oak - with creamy Glencadam character.

Name: Dailuaine 10 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: Vanilla sweetness, nutmeg and clove, stewed fruit, toffee, and apple strudel.
Finish: Long, rich, and sweet.
Nose: Fruitcake, winter spice, caramelised banana, and a touch of rancio.

Name: Glenmorangie X
Palate: Lots of vanilla and apricot notes, with more apple coming along too. A hint of flaked almond later on.
Finish: The honeyed orchard fruit theme continues on the finish, with a pinch of peppercorn.
Nose: Honeyed malt with underlying lemon and apple, plus a touch of nutmeg bringing oaky warmth.

Name: Highland Single Malt #1 42 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Cinnamon, anise, caraway, melted butter, and plum jam, all balanced wonderfully together.
Finish: Vanilla pod richness, with herbal elements once again making their way to the fore.
Nose: Lots of tropical fruit brightness here, with dried mango and pineapple chunks galore. A slow build of herbaceous richness grows in the background.

Name: Glentauchers 12 Year Old 2009 - Big Brother (Na BrÃ ithrean)
Palate: Floral blossom and sweet red berries tangle with more orangey zest, tangy oak, roasted nuts and toasted malt.
Finish: Cherries creep in with sweet vanilla shortbread, sharp citrus with juicy stone fruits, and more malty oak spice.
Nose: Heaps of fruit welcome the way with honeyed figs, juicy raisins, berries. Sweet toffee and a touch of orange peel are followed by sweet syrup and cakey spice.

Name: Teaninich 13 Year Old 2008 (cask 709849) - Auld Goonsy's Malt
Palate: Chocolate wafers, vanilla oak with a soft waft of grassy hay, nutty barley, baked orchard fruits, and cakey spice.
Finish: Lemon drops, toasted nuts, and lingering spice.
Nose: Ripe green apples, lemon shortbread, and buttery grain.

Name: MB Roland Single Barrel Bourbon 56.8%
Palate: Vanilla and spice and all things nice, with caramel corn and rye amongst oaky char, and dried fruits.
Finish: Toffee popcorn stays, with a pleasant hum of rye spiciness.
Nose: Wafts of toasting corn, with plenty of vanilla caramel and woody spice.

Name: Templeton Rye 6 Year Old Signature Reserve
Palate: Silky honey tempers earthy rye spice and menthol notes, with toffee and toasted oak in tow.
Finish: Butterscotch and dark chocolate linger on a peppery finish.
Nose: Tinned peach, liquorice and honeysuckle alongside root ginger heat.

Name: Girvan 19 Year Old 2002 (cask 16487) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Juicy apricot, plum, and more creamy vanilla, with soaked oats and sponge cake. A tickle of nutmeg arrives in time.
Finish: Cooked apple, ginger biscuits, icing sugar, and orange butter.
Nose: Layers of honeyed cereal, toasted nuts, and buttery oak, with fresh vanilla and distant notes of woody spice.

Name: Egan's Vintage Grain
Palate: Smooth and creamy vanilla, with a subtle hint of cinnamon.
Finish: Long, gentle and light oak spiciness.
Nose: Vanilla fudge and caramel notes. Subtle oak and grassy notes.

Name: Ledaig 12 Year Old 2009 (cask CM285) - The Golden Cask (House of Macduff)
Palate: Vegetal peat, a touch nutty with spiced fruit, toasted oak, earthy, drying, peppery smoke.
Finish: Clove and liquorice pick up, some dark cherry notes balance rich, roasty barley and bold black pepper.
Nose: Sweet heather, smouldering earthy smoke, zesty citrus peels and petrichor minerality.

Name: Velvet Cap Single Malt Irish Whiskey - Peated Sherry Cask Finish
Palate: Biscuity malt, cinder toffee, vanilla, flamed citrus, and sweet pears.
Finish: Smoky and sweet.
Nose: Earthy smoke, green apples, butterscotch, and cinnamon.

Name: Islay Journey Blended Malt - Journey Series (Hunter Laing)
Palate: Hallmark notes of earthy peat, sea spray, and mineral-heavy seaweed, with icing sugar and creamier notes of vanilla and milk chocolate.
Finish: Medium length, with a sprinkle of sea salt and a dash of fresh citrus.
Nose: Hefty aromas of peat smoke, a flinty minerality, sea breeze, and bonfire ash, with a burst of red berry and vanilla sweetness.

Name: Miltonduff 13 Year Old 2006 (cask 83900244) - Duncan Taylor
Palate: Oily barley balanced by brown sugar and citrus zest. Quite cakey at points.
Finish: Walnuts, strawberry, another touch of savoury bread.
Nose: Honeycomb, cassia, a hint of buttered bread giving it a savoury touch.

Name: Waterford Single Farm Origin - Hook Head 1.1
Palate: Clove, caraway, and toasted bread. A hint of praline and honey gives it some sweetness.
Finish: Subtly fruity on the finish with apricot and pear.
Nose: Softly coastal and flinty, with a whisper of grassy sweetness to it.

Name: The Oxford Artisan Distillery Rye Whisky - Purple Grain
Palate: Nutty grains, with sticky malt loaf, and drizzles of caramel.
Finish: Peppery rye character builds, with buttered brioche.
Nose: Meadow herbs alongside juicy berries, dried prunes, and aromatic spices.

Name: Tipperary 10 Year Old Knockmealdowns
Palate: Light oak at first, before yet more juicy tropical fruits bring sweetness.
Finish: Lemon curd, honey and milky coffee.
Nose: Fragrant orange oil and fresh pineapple, with a hint of caramel underneath.

Name: Bunnahabhain 13 Year Old 2008 - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Cinnamon pastries lead to jammy fruit and berries, with layers of mouthcoating malt and sweet baking spice.
Finish: Poached stone fruits, floral tea, and oily oak.
Nose: Dense buttered malt loaf, dark chocolate cranberries, toasted nuts, and floral barley.

Name: Smokehead Sherry Cask Blast
Palate: Charred mango, dried fruit, stewed apples, and peppermint are joined by nutmeg, BBQ embers, and roasted nuts.
Finish: Smoky and sweet.
Nose: Heaps of medicinal peat are joined by dried herbs, vanilla, plums, and lapsang souchong.

Name: Ballantine's American Barrel 10 Year Old
Palate: Caramel and a hint of tropical fruit with desiccated coconut, vanilla, and nutmeg.
Finish: Spice and sweet fudge remain.
Nose: Brown sugar, oak char, golden barley, and orchard fruit.

Name: Paul John Brilliance Gift Pack with Glass
Palate: Chomp Bars - lots of chewy caramel and chocolate here. Picks up from lively spice along the way, with a little bit of waxy orange peel on the mid palate.
Finish: Orange lingers. Surprisingly long, with the rye notes from the nose coming back in full force.
Nose: Good core of juicy barley. Ryvita with salted butter. Cinnamon-dusted-red berries, with a little green apple skin following it up.

Name: Blue Hanger - 11th Release (Berry Bros. & Rudd)
Palate: A malty palate carries prickles of oak spice among a little cocoa and mocha. Orange peel and yellow apples linger amongst golden barley and a soupcon of smoke.
Finish: Creamy and sweet, a little spice and smoke carries over on the finish.
Nose: White and citrus fruits break through peat smoke with a helping of honeyed nuts, vanilla and marzipan.

Name: The Double Peat
Palate: Smoky salinity sits at the core, paired with hints of meaty malt and caramel.
Finish: Caraway, ash, and spicy peppercorns.
Nose: Coastal air with a hint of heather honey and roast chestnuts.

Name: Jack Daniel's Tennessee Whiskey
Palate: Quite smooth and soft with notes of banana milkshake, a mixed nut note, a touch of caramel with crÃ¨me anglaise.
Finish: Sweet with a little cereal sweetness and toasty oak.
Nose: Light with plenty of sweetness. There are hints of dry spice and oily nuts, a touch of smoke.

Name: J.J. Corry The Hanson
Palate: Fresh peach and pear, another hint of floral vanilla, a slow build of soft oak spices.
Finish: Chai latte, tropical fruit and honey.
Nose: Sponge cake and rum-raisin ice cream, with a good drizzle of chocolate sauce.

Name: Mannochmore 2010 (bottled 2021) - Small Batch (Berry Bros. & Rudd)
Palate: Still enjoyably fruity, with lime and apple in the mix, plus a crackle of peppery heat.
Finish: Light vanilla hints stick around.
Nose: Green grapes and a hint of kiwi, with drying barley in support.

Name: Gelston's Single Pot Still Pinot Noir Cask Finish
Palate: Red fruit sweetness and touches of dry red grape skin, with jammy berries and building baking spices.
Finish: Homemade blackcurrant jam lingers alongside vanilla sweetness.
Nose: Oily malt and banana ice cream, with summer berries and hints of wood spice.

Name: Berry Bros. & Rudd Sherry Cask Single Malt - The Classic Range
Palate: Sweet and fruity, more apricot, some nuttiness, and baking spices.
Finish: A spicy and sweet finish.
Nose: Apricots and raisins, with cinnamon, and warm oak.

Name: Ardbog (Ardbeg)
Palate: Big - it feels like all the moisture is being sucked out of your mouth at first but in a good way(!). Salt crusted raisins, rich nuttiness, pickled onions. Sounds odd but itâs honestly superb!
Finish: There's red chilli heat on the finish as well as paprika.
Nose: Sea salt and brine with some dark fruit and hints of barbecue. Maple syrup, plum, orange, mint and more herbal notes with a touch of tomato vine. White coffee develops.

Name: Aerstone 10 Year Old Land Cask
Palate: Balanced sweet and smoky notes, with aniseed, burnt brown sugar, charred oak and salted honeycomb. Then there's olive brine, barbecued citrus fruit and smoked meats.
Finish: Sweet and smoky battle it out on the finish, with vanilla fudge and peat smoke alongside dry, spicy oak.
Nose: Earthy peat smoke and vanilla pod, with a briney note, black pepper, smoked meats and burnt rubber, with just a touch of fresh fruity sweetness.

Name: Teeling Stout Cask Finish
Palate: Creamy caramel and vanilla, with layers of orange and plum.
Finish: Chocolate biscuits, more caramel, a subtle jenever-like maltiness.
Nose: Chocolatey and rich, with a light hint of rye spice backing it up.

Name: Highland Park Spirit Of The Bear
Palate: Orange peel and stem ginger. Still enjoyably smoky, though now with hints of floral barley in tow.
Finish: Sandalwood and vanilla-y malt.
Nose: Peat is up-front, though swiftly moves on to brioche dipped in coffee and fresh honey.

Name: Woven Experience No.6
Palate: Oaky vanilla, with woody spices, some cherry, dried mango, and brown sugar.
Finish: Clove, liquorice, and some lingering vanilla.
Nose: Some creamy grain, with notes of redcurrant, and candied orange peel.

Name: Millstone Peated Pedro XimÃ©nez Sherry Cask
Palate: Somewhat perfumed as it opens, before a big whack of oily malt. Chocolate sauce, sherried orange peels and honey.
Finish: Oily hops, salty hints once again and a final hint of brown sugar.
Nose: Sea salt, sultana, a hint of floral barley followed by roasted coffee.

Name: West Cork Original
Palate: Poached pear, buffalo grass, a little light caramel.
Finish: Short with some orchard fruit and pepper.
Nose: Vanilla, hay, biscuit crumbs, touch of glue and yellow fruit.

Name: Benromach Cask Strength Vintage 2012 (bottled 2022) - Batch 03
Palate: Orange marmalade, red fruit, cocoa, toasted oak, and candied ginger.
Finish: Cooked apple, a wisp of smoke, and dried fruit.
Nose: Oily orange peel, melted dark chocolate, vanilla, and cinnamon.

Name: Tomatin 13 Year Old 2006 Fino Sherry Cask
Palate: Frangipane and subtle undertones of dried herbs, followed by fresh bread, flamed lemon peel and mace.
Finish: Spiced, cooked apple lingers alongside a touch of balsamic.
Nose: Fresh, oily malt and rich nuts, with fresh, ripe plum and touches of pear skin.

Name: Mac-Talla Strata
Palate: Rounded barley with waves of soft smoke, dotted by chocolate, vanilla, cassia, and salted butter.
Finish: Very subtly grassy, still with vanilla and coastal peat smoke at the fore.
Nose: Rock pools and sea shells, juxtaposed by redcurrant and toffee pennies.

Name: Smokehead Sherry Bomb
Palate: BBQ smoke, stem ginger, sherried peels, sea salt, rum-raisin ice cream.
Finish: Clove, red chilli flake, treacle.
Nose: Dark chocolate, seaweed, a hint of medicinal peat smoke, prunes and clove.

Name: Miltonduff 13 Year Old 2009 - Hepburn's Choice (Langside)
Palate: Apple peels, ginger, and manuka honey on brown toast.
Finish: Salted caramel cookies and orchard fruit.
Nose: Sweet and malty, with vanilla fudge, peaches, and cinnamon.

Name: The Macallan Concept No.2 2019
Palate: Jammy berry notes take shape on the palate, with walnut and coffee cake, ginger and honeycomb in support. Delicately oaky, helped along by the cinnamon and caraway.
Finish: Vanilla pod earthiness, peaches and cream, shortbread.
Nose: Werther's Original, honeyed cereal, waxy citrus peels and cinnamon sticks.

Name: Orkney 1999 (bottled 2021) (cask 35) â Berry Bros. & Rudd (Master of Malt Exclusive)
Palate: Fresh ginger, yet more honey, Sesame Snaps, a few touches of tobacco.
Finish: A long finish, with creamy vanilla and poached pear, punctuated by soft smoke.
Nose: Sea spray, melon, hickory, honey, and a hint of apricot yoghurt.

Name: Dailuaine 8 Year Old 2014 (cask 16440) - Provenance (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Sticky toffee and sweet, biscuity malt, bolstered by warming waves of cinnamon and candied nuts.
Finish: Sweet baking spice and buttery flapjack linger for a warming, creamy finish.
Nose: Candied citrus and buttery lemon tart, with cookie dough, ginger, and toasted almonds.

Name: Timorous Beastie 10 Year Old
Palate: Chewy apricot and butters scones. A hint of mineral-y smoke develops, but never quite comes to the fore.
Finish: Elegantly spicy on the finish, with honey and yellow plum lingering.
Nose: Roasted almond, maple syrup, fresh cedar, fudge and sponge cake.

Name: The Glenrothes 12 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish (Darkness) (60.6%)
Palate: That sherry cask has worked its magic, with layer upon layer of dried fruit, burnt sugar sweetness, and woody spice mingling with roasted malt and charred oak.
Finish: Yet more candied fruits and sweet baking spices, with a touch of smoke poking through.
Nose: Silky caramel with juicy notes of melon and mashed banana nestled beside floral tobacco and a hint of pipe smoke.

Name: SPEY Fumare
Palate: Roasted nuts, caramelised apples, well-toasted barley.
Finish: Barrel char followed by a little sweet spark of raspberry compote.
Nose: Oily malt, subtly medicinal smoke, sweet herbs.

Name: The Glenrothes 12 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish (Darkness) (56.6%)
Palate: Liquorice, cinnamon gum, coconut ice, brown sugar, and sultanas.
Finish: Orange peel, malty vanilla, mint once again.
Nose: Werther's Original, milky coffee, a hint of mint chocolate.

Name: The English - 11 Year Old (Batch 3)
Palate: Oily malt carries layers of sweet mango, prune, and baked apple, while rich toasted oak brings gently drying spice.
Finish: Woody cinnamon and pepper bring a touch of heat to the finish, while juicy fruit and bold barley linger.
Nose: Fresh vanilla pod and lemon peels are joined by tropical fruit salad and a touch of marzipan. Distant garden herbs and a hint of sawdust nestle beneath.

Name: Berry Bros. & Rudd Peated Cask Matured - The Classic Range
Palate: Continued bright fruit and soft smoke, now with hints of red Jelly Tots and butterscotch.
Finish: Lingering sooty notes.
Nose: Sugared peels, honeydew melon, toasty peat with a hint of dried earth.

Name: Micil Earls Island Single Pot Still
Palate: Smoked salted almonds, berry compote, and plenty of baking spices.
Finish: The spices build, with hints of toasted marzipan.
Nose: Sweet vanilla custard, with spiced apple cake, and red summer berries.

Name: Kaiyo The Peated
Palate: Softly smoky, hints of coffee and forest floor, dotted with anise and mint.
Finish: Cassia, cola cubes, spiced fruit compote.
Nose: Roasted pecans, floral oak, melted butter, tangy citrus peels.

Name: Old Ballantruan 15 Year Old
Palate: Campfire embers and red berries, joined by milky coffee later on.
Finish: Old leather and runny honey.
Nose: Roast chestnuts, pencil shavings, nectarine and a hint of sherry.

Name: Tullibardine 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 804981) - Infrequent Flyers (Alistair Walker)
Palate: Sweet summer berries, star anise, thick set caramel, and leathery spices.
Finish: Spice on the finish, with some dried cherry.
Nose: Lots of jammy red fruit, with sweet cinnamon, and warm oak.

Name: Mortlach 13 Year Old (Special Release 2021)
Palate: Thick texture, hereâs a whisky you can chew. The big bold flavours are almost overwhelming.
Finish: Aromatic and minty.
Nose: Toffee, red berries with aromatic woody and sweet BBQ notes.

Name: Glen Moray 2010 Amarone Finish - Warehouse 1
Palate: Toasted nuts, tangy marmalade, herbaceous touches.
Finish: Cinnamon, tart berries, and cooked apple.
Nose: Bitter woodiness, plum skin, malt biscuits.

Name: The English - First-Fill American Oak
Palate: Peanut brittle, sultana, Granny Smith apples, buttery corn once again, a dry hint of cedar spiciness.
Finish: Apricot jam on granary toast, fresh lemon zest, a touch of hay.
Nose: Pear, peach, buttered corn, toasted teacakes, meadows in spring.

Name: KyrÃ¶ 4 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Brown sugar, jammy red berries, baked earth, peppercorn and nutmeg spiciness.
Finish: The coffee notes return, with a touch of cinnamon.
Nose: Rye bread with butter, flaky pastry, milky coffee.

Name: Auchroisk 11 Year Old 2011 - Hepburn's Choice (Langside)
Palate: Conference pears, red grapes, white pepper, and a little cinnamon.
Finish: Citrus, green tea, and oak spice.
Nose: Rich biscuity malt and salted caramel are joined by red berries and cedar.

Name: Benrinnes 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 310545) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Toffee, flapjacks, milk chocolate, and allspice, with oak char.
Finish: Warming oak, with brown sugar.
Nose: Sweet and malty, with some cinnamon, fresh pastries, and vanilla fudge.

Name: Pintail Blended Malt 2012 - Oloroso Sherry Cask
Palate: Chocolate-coated coffee beans, plump sultanas, cooked apples, a touch of floral barley.
Finish: Rich baking spice joins at the end, backed up by more roasty coffee, stewed fruit and dense oak.
Nose: Spiced plum jam, a dusting of cocoa, sweet malt, and hints of treacle.

Name: Old Pulteney 25 Year Old
Palate: Cinnamon and nutmeg, brown butter, pink peppercorn, dark chocolate and fresh pineapple.
Finish: Soft salinity of sea air and hickory.
Nose: Zesty mango and citrus, followed by forest floor richness and mature oak.

Name: SPEY 12 Year Old Peated
Palate: The spice really develops on the palate, with green apple skin, roasted (if slightly burnt) nuts and earthy vanilla pod.
Finish: A touch of ripe banana sweetness alongside dried fruit and a dry, smoky finish.
Nose: Gentle whispers of smoke, with creamy vanilla, fresh grapes and wood spice.

Name: Glendalough 7 Year Old - Mizunara Finish
Palate: Chocolatey notes continue, with toasted cinnamon and five-spice, plus juicy apricot and nectarine.
Finish: Flaky pastry, brown sugar, lemon peel, anise.
Nose: Sandalwood, orange zest, vanilla pod, and milk chocolate.

Name: Westward Whiskey
Palate: Cigar box and spicy oak, leading into barley sugar, biscuity malt and spiced apple.
Finish: Melted dark chocolate appears alongside brown sugar and a pinch of tobacco.
Nose: Stewed dark berries, vanilla rice pudding and some maple syrup, with crunchy orchard fruits.

Name: Bunnahabhain 11 Year Old 2012 (Cask 356627) - Woodrow's of Edinburgh
Palate: Candied almonds and sultanas join chocolate raisins, with dried berries and baking spice gathering beneath.
Finish: Fruit cake, biscuity malt, cinnamon, and toffee, with a touch of clove and peppery oak in tow.
Nose: Cocoa, runny caramel, toasted pecans, a touch of polished oak.

Name: Aberfeldy 19 Year Old (cask 3076-78) - Exceptional Cask Series
Palate: Dried prunes and figs, with sticky ginger cake, and toasted hazelnuts.
Finish: Shortbread, and sprinkles of allspice.
Nose: Florentines drizzled in dark chocolate, with twists of orange, and baking spice.

Name: Gelston's Blended
Palate: Toasted grain and more honeyed baking spice, with caramelised nuts in tow.
Finish: Oaky vanilla lingers.
Nose: Baking spices and white pepper, with fresh apple, and boiled lemon sweeties.

Name: Sailor's Home Stormchaser
Palate: A dusting of cinnamon, cacao, and coffee grounds joins thick-cut marmalade, dates, and vanilla cream.
Finish: Treacly layers of muscovado sugar, plump raisins, prunes, and just a smidge of pepper.
Nose: Dark chocolate and dense roasted malt are supported by waves of buttery oak and a touch of hoppy bitterness.

Name: Peg Whisky Blended Scotch Whisky
Palate: Buttered bread, honeycomb and black pepper.
Finish: Apricot and peanut brittle.
Nose: Toffee pennies, citrus peels and a generous helping of malt.

Name: Paul John 2015 (cask 6414) (bottled 2021) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Tangy citrus, roasted nuts, bonfire embers, and vanilla pod.
Finish: Scorched barley and a hint of green apple zestiness.
Nose: Robust peat smoke with underlying notes of banana fritter and cinnamon sticks.

Name: Glenglassaugh 8 Year Old 2014 (cask 2370) - Infrequent Flyers (Alistair Walker)
Palate: Sweet toffee, gorse, vanilla, and almond pralines.
Finish: Cinnamon and pepper spice.
Nose: Sugar-dusted waffles, with vanilla caramel, some candied orange, and earthy oak.

Name: Starward Dolce
Palate: Dates, strawberry bonbons, cola cubes, orange peel, caramel, more marshmallow.
Finish: Simmering spices and cherry toffees.
Nose: Raspberry, prune, toasted marshmallow, cardamom, cassia, brown sugar.

Name: The Glenturret 7 Year Old Peat Smoked (2022 Release)
Palate: Earthy, with hearty wood smoke and vegetal peat balanced by biscuity malt, butterscotch, and zesty marmalade.
Finish: Oily notes of tobacco and charcoal, chocolate Brazil nuts, and spiced coffee.
Nose: Robust peat smoke and sweet dried fruits welcome the way for salted almonds and sweet, candied oranges.

Name: Westward Whiskey - Pinot Noir Cask
Palate: Soft apricots and pressed apples with dustings of cinnamon and nutmeg. Raisin studded biscuits arrive, along with banana fruit loaf.
Finish: Sultanas and tangy dried cranberries finish things off, with plenty of hearty spice, and leathery oak.
Nose: A generous abundance of stone fruits, hints of chocolate praline, and robust oak.

Name: Auchroisk 25 Year Old 1996 (cask 19727) - The First Editions (Hunter Laing)
Palate: Spiced apple compote, with fig rolls, brown sugar, and warm oak.
Finish: Sweet, with gentle nuttiness.
Nose: Raisins, sweet sherry spice, some milk chocolate, and toasted walnuts.

Name: The Irishman Cask Strength (2022 release)
Palate: Honeysuckle mingles with crisp green apple, drizzles of caramel, citrussy ginger, creamy vanilla, and cinnamon.
Finish: Warm oak and sweet hazelnut, with a dusting of cocoa.
Nose: Plenty of warm baking spices, with fresh apple peels, pear drops, and a twist of waxy orange zest.

Name: Miltonduff 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 6342) - Infrequent Flyers (Alistair Walker)
Palate: Sweet stewed fruit compote, hot chocolate and sticky fruitcake, with toasted oak and warm tobacco.
Finish: Plenty of pepper and ginger, with toasted brown bread, and apricot jam.
Nose: Drizzles of caramel, cocoa nibs, earthy pepper, cloves, and fruity wine gums.

Name: James Cree's Cattle Ranch Whiskey
Palate: Big helpings of vanilla custard and runny caramel, backed up by toasted oak spiciness.
Finish: Lasting orange oil and peppercorn heat.
Nose: Honeycomb, buttered corn on the cob, toffee.

Name: Milk & Honey Elements Series - Peated Cask
Palate: Citrus notes arrive on the palate, with continued sweet vanilla notes and another waft of smoke.
Finish: Just a hint of toasty spices linger on the finish - black pepper, ginger, and cardamom.
Nose: Lots of vanilla and honey, but a backbone of dry smoke smoulders away underneath.

Name: The Legendary Midnight Silkie Irish Whiskey
Palate: Warming, with dry smoke, treacle, and juicy dried fruit, followed by wafts of baking spice and cigar box.
Finish: Oily citrus peels, plump sultana, and gently peppery smoke.
Nose: Melted brown sugar, apple pie, marmalade, and cocoa, with wafts of fragrant peat.

Name: Old Forester 1870 - Original Batch
Palate: A medley of citrus and spice, with clove, nutmeg, and a twist of black pepper, joined by warm biscuits.
Finish: Warm spices linger.
Nose: Spiced shortbread, with candied mixed peel, and drizzles of vanilla syrup.

Name: Cutty Sark Blended Scotch Whisky
Palate: Rounded, mixed peels, lots of barley.
Finish: Good length, warming, malt.
Nose: Light, gentle. Cut herbs, floral, custard, hay.

Name: Unnamed Orkney 13 Year Old 2009 (casks DRU 17/A67 20+22) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Creamy malt, with drizzles of caramel, and some zingy ginger.
Finish: Nutty malt with peppery spices.
Nose: Warm oak, with vanilla, oatcakes, and some candied lemon peel.

Name: Tormore 21 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Lots more orchard fruits, but this time with an element of dried citrus peels. Grapefruit, toasted barley, coffee beans and a suggestion of bitter dark chocolate.
Finish: Medium and relatively complex, with the oakiness, sweet spices and orchard fruits â this time stewed â all coming through.
Nose: Freshly cut grass, hay, apples, vanilla ice cream, milk chocolate, cashew nuts, slight cinnamon spice prickle, banana chips and nutmeg.

Name: The Dublin Liberties 13 Year Old Murder Lane
Palate: Chocolate-dipped marzipan, tinned peaches in syrup, with coconut cream, nectarine and vanilla cake batter.
Finish: Lots of dried apricot and honey.
Nose: Bounty bar, vanilla macaroons and icing sugar, with almond butter and creamy vanilla pod.

Name: Tamnavulin Red Wine Cask Edition - American Cabernet Sauvignon
Palate: Fresh cherries, blackberries, fig, and some silky caramel.
Finish: Allspice and jammy forest fruits.
Nose: Black Forest gateaux, with soft vanilla, and toasted oak.

Name: Pearse Lyons Founder's Choice 12 Year Old
Palate: The fruit develops to become ripe and juicy against big oak notes and prickles of nutmeg underneath. Butterscotch adds a complex sweetness throughout.
Finish: The oak spice tingles away in a composed, long finish.
Nose: Crackles of woody tannins lead among buttered toast and rich vanilla. Orchard fruits add depth in the backdrop.

Name: Teaninich 12 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Creamy hazelnut latte leads the way with candied nuts and fruit pastries balancing peppery oak. Crisp apple and baking spices follow in time.
Finish: More roasted coffee beans, black pepper, and herbaceous barley bring a brilliantly bittersweet, drying finish.
Nose: Waves of chalky malt and creamy lemon curd join fresh green apples, with breezy layers of dried grass and vanilla.

Name: Old Pulteney 10 Year Old (1L)
Palate: Green apple sharpness is tempered by a touch more honey, lemon meringue pie, a touch of tobacco and overripe pear, with a sea breeze beneath it all.
Finish: Salted caramel lingers alongside drying oak.
Nose: Pear tart and a drizzle of honey, leading into more tropical aromas of banana, supported by vanilla cream, lemon curd and oak spice.

Name: The Glenrothes 11 Year Old - Skene Whisky
Palate: Chocolate chip cookies, grist, just a smidge of cigar box.
Finish: Orange peel, brown sugar, and nutmeg.
Nose: Toffee, sawdust, caramel apples, a dusting of nutmeg and some spicy ginger.

Name: Copperworks 3 Year Old 2015 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: That oak char leads the way, joined by the fresh apple from the nose. Light and fruity with notes of barley water and citrus oil, with a dusting of fresh vanilla.
Finish: More vanilla and buttered malt loaf towards the finish, with a touch of herbaceous zest bringing lift to the rich oak.
Nose: Crisp orchard fruits with juicy pears and green apples aplenty. Earthy notes of walnuts and dried herbs develop in time, backed up by toasted oak and toffee.

Name: Macduff 13 Year Old 2009 (cask 11895) - Connoisseurs Choice (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Meaty malt, honey, citrus, mango, and a little liquorice.
Finish: Ripe and refreshing.
Nose: Red apples, waxy oranges, sugar-coated almonds, and cinnamon.

Name: Strathmill 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 15062) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Molasses, cinnamon, honey again, butterscotch, white pepper, anise.
Finish: A hint of bittersweet coffee develops right on the finish.
Nose: Spiced fruit compote and thyme honey, with some hot cross bun warmth.

Name: Orkney 13 Year Old 2007 - Mey Selections
Palate: Toasty oak, sultanas, cassia, chocolate shavings, Seville orange.
Finish: Another touch of cassia and black pepper, with lingering fruity sweetness.
Nose: Grilled tropical fruit, melted butter, a hint of rock pool minerality

Name: North British 14 Year Old 2007 - Select Grain (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Sweet grain oiliness, coffee ice cream, and orange Starburst.
Finish: Sweetly spiced, with another dollop of vanilla.
Nose: Super creamy porridge, with fresh croissant and warming oak.

Name: Paul John Pedro XimÃ©nez Select Cask
Palate: Espresso, raisins, sultanas, apricot, chocolate mousse and perhaps a touch of mint chocolate too.
Finish: Lasting festive spices and chocolate peanuts.
Nose: Marmalade on toast, mocha, stewed plums and a kick of peppercorn.

Name: Macaloneyâs Caledonian Glenloy
Palate: Spiced fruitcake, heather honey, cocoa nibs, orange zest, and warm oak.
Finish: Peppery spice, with toasted oak alongside.
Nose: Plenty of sherry character, with fresh cherries, marmalade, and oaky vanilla.

Name: Glen Spey 11 Year Old 2009 (cask 110805728) - Dimensions (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Fruit salad with honeydew melon, nutty chocolate chip cereal bars with spicy black pepper.
Finish: Charred oak with warming spice and mixed, toasted nuts.
Nose: Nut oil, bold fresh malt, and freshly cut grass.

Name: Blair Athol 12 Year Old 2009 Syrah Edition - DS Tayman
Palate: Oily malt and more tangy red fruits, chocolate raisins, with old leather in the distance.
Finish: Baking spice warmth gathers, alongside stewed berries and hearty oak, with burnt biscuits and caramel keeping things sweet.
Nose: Sweet layers of summer berries and citrus, with hearty oak beneath.

Name: White Heather 21 Year Old
Palate: More butterscotch, now paired with fruit-forward notes of orange and apple. A touch of earthy spice in the background.
Finish: Smoky wisps stick around a good while.
Nose: Softly peaty, with layers of butterscotch, herbaceous oak, and heather.

Name: Kavalan ex-Bourbon Oak
Palate: Fresh and sweet with creamy barley, coconut, and soft oak.
Finish: Exotic spices.
Nose: Familiar vanilla, nutmeg and banana notes.

Name: Laphroaig 16 Year Old 2005 (cask 56800315) - Duncan Taylor
Palate: Smouldering embers with plenty of peaty iodine and charred oak, with hints of plum and more waxy citrus zest beneath.
Finish: Warming pepper, earthy with more vegetal peat and rich, spiced malt.
Nose: A good dose of charcoal, bold barley, and zesty, oily citrus.

Name: Tomintoul 18 Year Old Gift Pack with 2x Glasses
Palate: CrÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e and apricot tart, with ground almond, a pinch of tobacco, wood spice and honeycomb.
Finish: Floral honey, baking spice and treacle tart.
Nose: Juicy dried fruit and cooked plum, with apple and cinnamon loaf cake.

Name: Compass Box The Peat Monster Cask Strength
Palate: Silky vanilla caramel alongside earthy smoke, with roasted almonds, sea spray, and sweet spices.
Finish: Salted caramel and lingering smoke.
Nose: Beach bonfires, lemon curd, crisp apple, and warm spices.

Name: Ben Nevis 9 Year Old 2012 (cask CM295) - The Golden Cask (House of MacDuff)
Palate: Oily, nutty malt and sweet, candied ginger are wrapped up in layers of butterscotch, apricot, and butter biscuits.
Finish: Brittle toffee, cooked pears, and lingering waxed fruit, with a prickle of cracked peppercorns in tow.
Nose: Zesty waxed citrus peel, dried berries, earthy vanilla, and toasted oak.

Name: West Cork Black Cask
Palate: Sweet malt and wafts of subtle smoke, with orchard fruit, cinnamon and honeycomb.
Finish: A creamy finish with chocolate, ripe pear and oak char.
Nose: Fried banana and toasted nuts, with honeyed orchard fruit and almond cream.

Name: Kavalan Solist Pedro XimenÃ©z Cask (57.1%)
Palate: Chocolate-coated pineapple, cardamom, more dried fruits and malt loaf.
Finish: Sherry-soaked plums and rum-drizzled raisins. Lemongrass once again.
Nose: Fruitcake, walnut, damson jam and a hint of lemongrass.

Name: Burns Nectar Single Malt
Palate: Slightly floral at first, before notes of almond, walnut and toffee pennies appear.
Finish: Peppery malt, hints of tobacco and sultana.
Nose: Sponge cake, honey and plenty of barley.

Name: PUNI 4 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Foam bananas, strawberry bonbons, and white chocolate, balanced by malty notes and a hint of peppery heat.
Finish: Cassia and nutmeg on the finish.
Nose: Dried berries â namely strawberry and raspberry. Sweet nutty notes underneath, plus a good helping of vanilla.

Name: Jim Beam Double Oak
Palate: Subtly peppery/oak-y at first. Soon enough, waves and waves of vanilla ice cream bring balance to the palate. A few touches of fruity malt.
Finish: Charred oak toastiness lingers long on the finish.
Nose: Full-bodied vanilla, old oak, milk chocolate and a kick of cardamom.

Name: Chivas Regal XV
Palate: Butterscotch, red apple and caraway. A touch of grain sweetness in the background.
Finish: Heavy vanilla and pear on the finish.
Nose: Powerful orange and peach notes, backed up by juicy barley.

Name: The One Manzanilla Sherry Cask
Palate: Characteristic Manzanilla floral freshness, green apples and citrus, with a sprinkle of spice.
Finish: Bright and well balanced.
Nose: Candied fruits, floral smoke, a touch of salty sea spray.

Name: Tullibardine 2008 (bottled 2022) - The Murray Triple Port Cask Finish
Palate: Toffee apples, black fruits, clove, and peppery oak.
Finish: Warming, long, and well-spiced.
Nose: Tart red berries, apple pie, caramel, and aromatic spice.

Name: White Oak Akashi 5 Year Old Red Wine Cask (cask 61891)
Palate: Earthy vanilla with subtle toasty spice elements, still rich in strawberry, with damson and blackcurrant too.
Finish: Lingering oaky tannins, mellowed by the red fruit notes.
Nose: Orange sherbet, strawberry jam on toast, a touch of sawdust.

Name: Glengoyne 36 Year Old (cask 1549) - Russell Family Cask
Palate: Silky and rich, creamy with a charming dustiness with tropical fruits, dried banana chips and chocolate cherry.
Finish: Rich gently sherried and spicy.
Nose: Light strawberry and lime sherbet, gentle mint, lemon meringue pie, stewed apples, coconut, sweet cinnamon and leather.

Name: Old Perth Cask Strength Blended Malt
Palate: Earthy root ginger spice, cinnamon stick, and toasted barley.
Finish: Brandy-soaked raisins and burnt brown sugar on the finish.
Nose: Toffee penny, cherry jam, and bundles of dried fruit.

Name: Big Peat at Christmas 2022
Palate: Bonfire embers and black pepper crackle alongside charred herbs, lifted by flamed citrus peels, before more hearty peat smoke drifts in.
Finish: Earthy charcoal and vegetal peat linger, with tarry, coastal breeze and dense, oily malt.
Nose: Plenty of oily smoke, hints of charred herbs, with salted nuts and spiced currant buns in tow.

Name: Bushmills Caribbean Rum Finish Cask Finish
Palate: More tropical fruit with a wonderfully creamy texture, sweet vanilla, buttery barley, and medium peppery warmth.
Finish: Butterscotch, pineapples with chantilly cream, gentle grain, and pepper spice.
Nose: Tropical pineapple, mango, and banana cross with tangy, spicy oak.

Name: Blended Whisky #2 22 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Slightly earthy at points, though mostly remains sweet with caramel and shortbread.
Finish: Citrus peel, more chocolate and a touch of mint leaf.
Nose: Milk chocolate and fresh vanilla, joined by toasted barley later on.

Name: Spice King Batch Strength 002 (Wemyss Malts)
Palate: Slightly burnt brown sugar, more salted caramel and oodles of ginger and orange peel, with a hint of orange pith. Spicy pepper tingles on the tongue.
Finish: Butterscotch, wood char and burnt caramel with a good crack of black pepper heat.
Nose: A grand helping of aromatic spices, namely cinnamon, nutmeg and anise alongside wood spice, new leather and a touch of salted caramel.

Name: SPEY Chairmanâs Choice
Palate: Creamy vanilla, another juicy burst of orange-y sweetness, upside-down cake.
Finish: Subtly spicy on the finish - Christmas cake filled with stem ginger and cinnamon-style.
Nose: Apricots and marmalade, with a slight touch of buttered toast.

Name: Kaiyo Whisky
Palate: Coffee bean, green apple, black tea and alpine herbs.
Finish: Cinnamon rolls and mango.
Nose: Orange peel, jasmine, a hint of coastal air, soft cedar.

Name: Speyside #3 6 Year Old - Batch 2 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Plenty more stone fruits and ripe red apples with notes of barley sugar, toasty cereals and acacia honey in support.
Finish: Good length, with delicate peppery spice and malt extract.
Nose: Very fruity, with nectarines, strawberries and blood oranges, before vanilla and toffee soften plenty of ripe, gristly malt.

Name: Hinch Small Batch Bourbon Cask
Palate: Creamy vanilla, pancakes and maple syrup, floral honey, dried fruit, fresh canteloupe and lively citrus.
Finish: Chocolate covered almond, vanilla shortbread and more honey.
Nose: Orange marmalade, dried apricot, creamy malt and earthy vanilla pod with buttered toast.

Name: MB Roland Straight Malt Whiskey
Palate: Spicier on the palate with black pepper and clove, though its's till got plenty of buttered bread and honey notes to it.
Finish: Lasting red apple and caarmel.
Nose: Waxy peels, honeycomb, charred oak and buttered crumpets.

Name: The English Single Cask Release - Triple Distilled Peated
Palate: A bit chocolatey at first, before cooling hints of apple and orange appear. Still smoky and subtly savoury.
Finish: A medium length finish with scorched bread and marmalade.
Nose: Pear drops, fresh peaches, roasted barley, cask char, a hint of cardamom.

Name: Hatozaki Blended
Palate: Grain sweetness, a touch of honey and barrel char, with more stone fruit and orange blossom.
Finish: An oily nuttiness appears on the finish alongside more cereal notes.
Nose: Light, sweet malty aromas alongside more cereal notes and fragrant lemongrass. Fruity notes of nectarine and banana appear.

Name: Tamnavulin Red Wine Cask Edition - Spanish Grenache
Palate: Sweet jammy notes, with Jaffa cake, and some earthy vanilla.
Finish: Allspice and redcurrants.
Nose: Summer berries, fresh cherries, and oaky spice.

Name: Tomintoul 21 Year Old
Palate: Creamy malt, butterscotch and a tiny pinch of white pepper warmth.
Finish: Fragrant tobacco, more vanilla and some tropical fruit zestiness.
Nose: Rich oak and earthy vanilla pod, with a waft of citrus blossom.

Name: Famous Grouse Blended Scotch Whisky
Palate: Balanced, biscuit-laden palate with a core of thick, creamy malt. Just a hint of spice and the vaguest whisper of smoke really bring a great deal of complexity.
Finish: A slightly sweet, malty finish.
Nose: A crisp, light nose offering up notes of toffee apples, hints of dried flowers and biscuity barley.

Name: The English - Virgin Oak Cask
Palate: Full-bodied barley and almond liqueur notes, with nutmeg warmth growing. Yet more vanilla, now with some chocolate coffee notes developing.
Finish: Honey on toast, soft citrus and some final peppery touches.
Nose: Toasted vanilla pod, coconut ice, ginger and a hint of caraway.

Name: The Norfolk - Farmers
Palate: Drying though sweet, with milk chocolate and white pepper.
Finish: Red berries and toffee.
Nose: Sugar-dusted pastries, apricot and Williams pear.

Name: Balmenach 16 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: Crunchy peanut butter and caramel-coated cashews, Malted Milk biscuits with jammy berries, and chocolate raisins.
Finish: Sugared almonds, yet more nutty malt with sweet, spiced pastries and warming oak.
Nose: Very nutty with wafts of chocolate peanuts and candied pecans, spiced fruit loaf leads to cinnamon and brown sugar, with fresh oak notes beneath.

Name: Lismore 12 Year Old Special Reserve
Palate: Honeycomb, caramel-coated apple and some racy spices.
Finish: Fruity sweetness lingers on the finish for quite a while.
Nose: Dried fruit, quite malty, a pinch of cocoa.

Name: The Fat Trout Blended Scotch Whisky
