Palate: Orange marmalade and a touch of bitter pith are balanced by vanilla and dried apricot while prickles of pepper and cinnamon develop alongside that peat smoke from the nose.
Finish: Drying spice, coffee grounds, cocoa, and candied orange.
Nose: Thankfully no fish here, but there are delicate layers of fruit and heather followed by biscuity malt, vanilla, and a whisper of smoke.

Name: The Glenrothes 25 Year Old
Palate: Rounded malty notes peer out from behind vibrant cooked berry and mulled wine sweetness. Oak spices arrive on the mid-palate, but mellow swiftly.
Finish: Caramelised dates, mango and old leather.
Nose: Stewed plums and apples, polished oak furniture, cigar box leading to a slight hint of soft smoke.

Name: Aultmore 9 Year Old 2011 (cask 900369) - The Whisky Cellar
Palate: Butterscotch, dried fruit, still with plenty of malt notes at its heart.
Finish: Cinnamon cookies, orange zest, and honey.
Nose: Mocha, Mars bars, a hint of lemongrass and barley.

Name: Inchgower 12 Year Old 2010 (cask 801362) -  The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Apple tart, green grape, and floral honey, with dried kitchen herbs in support.
Finish: More honey, oak spice, and red apple.
Nose: Pears in syrup, buttery oak, and apple blossom, alongside hints of nutmeg.

Name: Yushan Signature Sherry Cask
Palate: Chocolatey at first, but once again orange peel and floral barley take the spotlight. Rum-soaked raisin and soft ginger heat.
Finish: Lingering oak spice and a touch of mince pie filling.
Nose: Juicy citrus, chestnut, a touch of Turkish delight, buttery malt.

Name: 22 Year Old Whisky - Chestnut Cask Finish (Defilement)
Palate: Creamy toffee, antique wooden furniture, toasted almonds, a little hint of cinnamon developing.
Finish: Subtle touches of lemon linger, contrasted by more warming tobacco notes.
Nose: Waxy orange peels, dense caramel, cigar box richness leading to walnut and clove.

Name: Compass Box The Peat Monster Gift Pack with 2x Glasses
Palate: Peat, oak. Botanicals, floral, coppery, sweet, smoky bacon, hint of papaya.
Finish: roses and violets, sweet spice, oak.
Nose: Peat, marked salinity, leans to Caol Ila in style, something medicinal. Sweet and fruity, grainy.

Name: Stauning Peat
Palate: A buttery mouthfeel leads into cantaloupe sweetness, with milk chocolate shrouded by notes of floral smoke.
Finish: Cut grass sweetness and singed hay linger.
Nose: Smoky heather florals, with lemon blossom, apple skin and touches of cocoa here and there.

Name: Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival 2015
Palate: Salted caramel, dried fruit, barbecued apple and citrus.
Finish: Marine peat, oak spice and fruit and nut.
Nose: Smoky citrus, nutty cereal, ham and cola.

Name: Lismore 5 Year Old Special Reserve
Palate: Dry orchard fruit, pear drops and butterscotch.
Finish: Peanut brittle and a wisp of smoke.
Nose: Sparkling barley wine and caramel apples.

Name: Ãiregold Irish Whiskey
Palate: Apricots and baked apples, honeyed cereal, vanilla cupcakes, and woody toffee.
Finish: Toasted oak, sweet nuts, and creamy, peppery grain on the finish.
Nose: Creamy barley and vanilla, with caramel pastry.

Name: Cherry Bakewell Tart 22 Year Old 1996 - Wemyss Malts (Glen Keith)
Palate: More red fruits, with damson jam and cherry appearing. A little nutty, plus the reappearance of cinnamon and cassia.
Finish: Marzipan, brown sugar, liquorice.
Nose: Dates and honeycomb, with a smidge of strawberry. Quite malty, some oaky spices tucked away.

Name: 17 Year Old Blended Malt - Notable Age Statements (Decadent Drinks)
Palate: Mocha, orange peel, sherried raisins, and nutmeg.
Finish: Hot cross buns and dried apricots.
Nose: Sherry-stained oak, caramelised brown sugar, baking spice, and dark chocolate.

Name: Dailuaine 12 Year Old 2010 (cask 15920) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Peppery oak, oily barley, creamy vanilla, and golden syrup.
Finish: Runny honey, and buttered hot cross buns.
Nose: Candied ginger, strawberry jam, and cinnamon butter.

Name: Glentauchers 11 Year Old 2011 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)
Palate: Malty biscuits, frangipane, and rich creaminess, with cooked stone fruit.
Finish: Tarte Tatin, cinnamon, and glazed apricots.
Nose: Sweet almond, apricot jam, followed by peaches and cream.

Name: The Glenrothes 15 Year Old 2007 (cask 15583) - Old Particular Fanatical About Flavour (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Subtly mineral, with woody vanilla pod balanced by zingy apple.
Finish: Spiced orchard fruit alongside orange marmalade.
Nose: Underripe tangy kiwi, oak spice, and lemon peel.

Name: Ruadh Maor 11 Year Old 2010 (cask 50) - The Whisky Cellar
Palate: Still packed with peat, slightly sweetened by hints of chocolate raisin.
Finish: Peppery on the finish, with burnt ends and oak stave smokiness.
Nose: Savoury smoke with hints of BBQ meats and roasted oak, with a dusting of cinnamon.

Name: Fleurieu 3 Year Old - Batch 2 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Hearty helpings of sticky sweet raisins and dates, with fig rolls and nutty malt. A touch of salinity arrives in time, bringing savoury balance.
Finish: Oaken spice and coastal smoke linger, backed up by dense toffee and dried fruits.
Nose: Poached stone fruits, caramelised nuts, burnt sugar, and whispers of medicinal peat smoke.

Name: The Lakes Whiskymaker's Editions Mosaic
Palate: Creamy vanilla leading into a touch of orange, soon joined by wood smoke and forest floor richness, plus flashes of caraway.
Finish: A long finish, with toasted spices, lemon peel, and oak lingering.
Nose: Cassia and five-spice, with hints of gingerbread, aromatic sandalwood and mint leaf underneath.

Name: Stratheden - Classic Selection (The Lost Distillery Company)
Palate: Rounded oak once again, with caramel and salted popcorn in support.
Finish: Slightly smokey, though fruit notes still sit at the core.
Nose: Old oak furniture, juicy orange and a touch of vibrant pineapple.

Name: Glencadam 2011 (bottled 2023) (cask 800216) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Dollops of caramel along with dried tropical fruits, black tea, and oaky spice.
Finish: Fruity with a whisper of elderflower.
Nose: Honeyed green grapes and apricot, with a subtle creamy note.

Name: Glendullan 10 Year Old 2011 (cask 125)  - The Wild Scotland Collection (Deerstalker)
Palate: Waxy citrus joins oily barley, with plenty of creamy vanilla and stewed fruit. Zesty, vegetal malt rests beneath with softly spiced butter.
Finish: Crushed nuts and delicate baking spice, honeyed brioche, and a final dose of crisp orchard fruit.
Nose: Cooked apples with dustings of sweet spice, vanilla custard, and herbaceous lemon balm.

Name: Islay 7 Year Old 2013 - Single Cask Series (GreatDrams)
Palate: A bold balance of burning embers and peat with sweet, spicy oak char and treacle toffee lingering.
Finish: Drying herbs and seaweed, smoky yet silky with cakey spice and biscuity malt bringing warming ginger notes on the finish.
Nose: Potent peat smoke, seaside campfire, baked apples, and almond pastries.

Name: Ardmore 12 Year Old 2010 (casks 800518, 800527 & 800531) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Barley sweetness, red apple, spiced cookies.
Finish: Fresh melon balanced by treacle and wood spice.
Nose: Oily walnut, ripe pear, and honeyed porridge.

Name: Hatozaki Pure Malt
Palate: Rich and complex with a good helping of malt, aromatic spices, dried fruit and toasted cereal notes, with a slightly creamy vanilla undertone.
Finish: Delicately smoky and sweet honey on the finish, with lingering cigar box.
Nose: Aromas of dried fruit, sweet malt, a drizzle of honey, aromatic incense and sandalwood.

Name: The One Sherry Cask Finished
Palate: Chocolatey at first, before dates, nutty barley and cracked black pepper appear. A hint of cask char, too.
Finish: Lasting vanilla and sandalwood.
Nose: Sultana and ginger, with underlying touches of earthy peat.

Name: Ninkasi Whisky - Chardonnay Cask
Palate: Fresh croissant, apricot jam, and cinnamon butter, with salted caramel in tow.
Finish: Woody vanilla, peaches, and dark toffee.
Nose: Ripe nectarine, pear skin, and runny honey.

Name: Jura Winter Edition
Palate: Woody vanilla, flaky mince pies with warming wafts of cinnamon and maple.
Finish: Unctuous sweetness and festive spice, rich barley, cakey spice, and a touch of leathery oak.
Nose: Zesty whiffs of citrus peel and candied orange, sweet sultanas, hints of coffee, and oaken caramel.

Name: Hyde No. 6 President's Reserve
Palate: Fresh red berries and baked apple. Gingerbread, cedar.
Finish: Creamy vanilla and a prickle of clove.
Nose: Honey on toast, malt loaf and a touch of coffee bean.

Name: Glentauchers 13 Year Old 2009 Vintage Casks (Mossburn)
Palate: Layers of prunes, sultanas, and candied citrus, with a touch of anise and peppery oak.
Finish: Clove-studded oranges and sticky toffee pudding.
Nose: Floral on the nose, with notes of Turkish delight, dried fruit, and cakey spice.

Name: Cotswolds Founder's Choice Whisky (59.1%)
Palate: A warming kick of ginger builds, accompanied by dustings of cinnamon and dark chocolate. Roasty coffee balances sweet, nutty notes with delicate hints of zesty marmalade.
Finish: Fruity banana bread, still tropical, additional layers of summer fruit berries are followed by a good helping of creamy barley.
Nose: Soft peach and juicy pear, more tropical notes of grilled mango, herbal honey, and chocolate coffee beans.

Name: Glen Elgin 15 Year Old 2007 (cask 807411) - Infrequent Flyers (Alistair Walker)
Palate: Baked apples, more apricots, with light caramel, and peppery spice.
Finish: Peppery spices, and oaky vanilla.
Nose: Nutty grain and praline, with heather honey, and dried apricots.

Name: Dewar's 8 Year Old Caribbean Smooth
Palate: Sweet coconut ice cream dusted with chocolate, pineapple, toffee, and butterscotch.
Finish: Sweet finish with a definite character from the rum barrel, rich caramel, banana, and dark chocolate.
Nose: Tropical fruit aplenty, caramel, and coffee.

Name: Belmont Farm Kopper Kettle American Single Malt
Palate: Cheerios in milk, with chocolate spread on toast. Breakfast-y!
Finish: Cherry jam lingers alongside cookie dough.
Nose: Hibiscus flowers, oaky vanilla, and runny honey.

Name: Mourne Dew Triple Distilled Irish Whiskey
Palate: Toasty grain, hints of sweet red fruits, toffee, and bourbon-vanilla with distant, gentle peat in the depths.
Finish: Smooth and sippable, creme caramel with lingering oak and soft peat.
Nose: Vanilla and creamy malt, fudge, and red berries with a little waft of peat smoke.

Name: Bushmills American Oak Cask Finish
Palate: Soft, buttery grain gives way to flapjack, vanilla custard, and hard toffee with fruity suggestions of apple tart.
Finish: Soft spices, rich oak and a touch of burnt sugar.
Nose: Elegant oak char leads the way with toasted spice and caramelised biscuits. Runny honey follows floral vanilla.

Name: Kirker & Greer 10 Year Old Cask Strength
Palate: Honeyed tropical fruit, banana pancakes and vanilla cream, with caramel and baking spice intertwined.
Finish: Oak spice and lots of toffee.
Nose: Buttery popcorn, with banana foam sweeties, a good helping of cinnamon and nutmeg with a touch of dry oak.

Name: Miltonduff 9 Year Old 2013 (cask 1151, 800697 & 800700) - James Eadie
Palate: Oily malt and ginger biscuits join vanilla shortbread and candied citrus zest.
Finish: Buttery pastry, toasted oak, soft spice, and cream crackers.
Nose: Honeyed stone fruits lead the way, with soft peach and apricot, vanilla, and a touch of sawdust.

Name: Deerstalker Peated Edition
Palate: Flamed orange peel, oatcakes, burning peat and a whiff of TCP once again.
Finish: Smoky charred oak, peanut brittle.
Nose: Herbal smoke - almost medicinal at points! A slight sweetness of sugary coffee underneath.

Name: The Dublin Liberties Oak Devil
Palate: More baking spice, sultanas, vanilla and pepper.
Finish: Warming with a little milk chocolate and burnt malt loaf.
Nose: Toasted malt, caramel, cherry, honey and wood spice.

Name: The Wrecking Coast Rye Whiskey 8 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish
Palate: Sweet summer fruits and darker juicy currants, with herbaceous zest in tow. Earthy spice and cacao build, with liquorice, drying oak, and tangy dried raspberries.
Finish: Dark, charred sugar, fragrant anise, more forest fruits, and just a hint of fresh mint.
Nose: Toasted spices and silky honey waft amongst buttered toast, burnt caramel, and cooking herbs, followed by tangy berries and gentle pepper.

Name: The Epicurean Ruby Port Finish
Palate: Toasty ginger and nutmeg underneath waves of raisin, strawberry, and milk chocolate.
Finish: Fresh raspberry notes linger on the finish.
Nose: Peach, red apple, and juicy plum, with underlying digestive biscuit notes holding it together.

Name: Dunville's 1808 Blended Irish Whiskey
Palate: Silky grain, crumbly vanilla fudge, and sweet cake spice with more orchard fruits lead to warming prickles of pepper, and toasted oak.
Finish: Drying oak with whisps of smoke, still sweet with buttery spice and dried fruit.
Nose: Creamy vanilla leads with crisp green apples and pears, syrupy flapjack and biscuity malt balance gentle wafts of sweet citrus zest.

Name: Balmenach 11 Year Old 2011 - Hepburn's Choice (Langside)
Palate: Caramel, rich malt, crunchy peanut butter, and dried fruit.
Finish: Long and rich.
Nose: Charred tropical fruit, dried apricot, smoked bacon, and nutty biscuits.

Name: Glengoyne Pedro XimÃ©nez Cask Finish
Palate: Honeyed fruits, fresh grapes, caramelised brown sugar, lemon zest, warming pepper and ginger spice.
Finish: More honey, with citrus, more milk chocolate and a pinch more white pepper.
Nose: Dried apricot, caramelised nuts, zesty lemon sweeties, milk chocolate and vanilla fudge.

Name: Dewar's 8 Year Old Portuguese Smooth
Palate: Smooth layers of vanilla, plums, and apricots with floral honey and baked cherries. Distant medicinal herbs are kept in check by nutty nougat.
Finish: Drying spice arrives towards the finish, with sweet dried berries, roasted nuts, and burnt toffee.
Nose: Floral notes of heather and hints of hedgerow berries, with honeyed oats and marzipan in tow.

Name: Glenlossie 13 Year Old 2009 (casks 3392, 3396 & 3400) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Chocolate peanuts, buttered scones, waxy peels.
Finish: Enjoyably nutty, with walnut loaf, and a little tobacco.
Nose: Marzipan, forest floor, chamomile, stewed berries.

Name: Fary Lochan 6 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Cherry, fragrant smoke, heather honey, and the return of the chocolate notes.
Finish: Quite long, with enjoyable bittersweet elements lingering.
Nose: A balanced nose of sweet chocolate and earthy coffee notes, with bright hints of fresh orchard fruits underneath.

Name: The Dublin Liberties 10 Year Old Copper Alley
Palate: Dark chocolate, raisin and touches of oily walnut.
Finish: Nutty notes linger, now leaning more towards sugared almond.
Nose: Sherried peels, custard creams and a flash of hot cinnamon.

Name: Limeburners 5 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Dark red fruit notes continue on the palate, accompanied by dense layers of chocolate fondant and chocolate-coated almonds.
Finish: Hearty roasted malt and leathery oak bring bold balance, while rich cacao and spiced fruits linger.
Nose: Resinous oak, juicy raisins, and treacle are supported by dense cocoa and boozy cherries.

Name: Benrinnes 14 Year Old 2009 (cask 9064) - The Whisky Cellar
Palate: Hints of hedgerow fruits and berries bring a floral touch, with caramel and malt loaf resting at the core.
Finish: Lingering red fruits, berries, and stone fruits are joined by chocolate Brazil nuts and oaken vanilla.
Nose: Apples, pears, and buttery shortbread are joined by biscuity malt and drizzles of honey.

Name: Glendullan 12 Year Old 2009 (casks 315679 & 315684) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Vanilla-rich barley, banana fritters, fresh orchard fruit, and coconut ice.
Finish: Nutella, sultana, and lemon peel.
Nose: Butterscotch, waxy orange, with a hint of toasted oak.

Name: Bourbon Cask - Elements of Islay
Palate: Syrupy sponge cake, drizzled with citrus zest. Nutty maple brings a rich depth, with hefty peat smoke rising from the core, softened by chocolate chip cookies and vanilla cream.
Finish: CrÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e ties things up, while the smoke tails off sweetly.
Nose: Quite tropical with notes of pineapple and banana, vanilla sugar, and fragrant oak. Snuffed candle and oily embers surface from afar.

Name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label - Cities Of The Future London 2220
Palate: Supple and balanced. Good toffee and hints of very wistful smoke. Chocolate, hints of grass and a good hit of malt.
Finish: Floral, oaky, good length, urged on by a plume of very well-kept, highland style smoke. Dried fruit, spice, honey.
Nose: Fragrant with good body. Notes of oak, crisp spice, dried fruit, pastries. Berry fruits, aniseed, hints of cedar, a touch of spice an

Name: Amrut Peated Cask Strength
Palate: Peat, fruit, sweet, over-ripe bananas, pic 'n' mix.
Finish: Sweetness, bonfire smoke, barley and over-ripe fruit appear.
Nose: Peat is surprisingly restrained, toffee, dirty phenols, fruity.

Name: Caol Ila 23 Year Old 1993 (cask 631) -  Rare Select (Montgomerie's)
Palate: Salted caramel, seaweed, pineapple. A mineral edge to it.
Finish: White oak, ash and clementine.
Nose: Oily malt, medicinal peat and lemon tart.

Name: Clonakilty Double Oak Finish
Palate: A spicier palate, with a kick of ginger leading into creamy nuttiness and sweet vanilla.
Finish: Praline and cinnamon butter lingers.
Nose: Grassy sweetness, apple blossom and fresh orchard fruit, with a pinch of tobacco and gentle wood spice.

Name: Glentauchers 12 Year Old 2008 - Forest Whisky
Palate: Malty notes take shape on the palate, but juicy fruit notes stay at the core.
Finish: A slow build towards ginger and white pepper warmth on the finish.
Nose: Brilliantly fruity, with bright apple and orange poking out behind layers of cherry and raisin.

Name: Glenmorangie Grand Vintage Malt 1996 (bottled 2019) - Bond House No.1
Palate: Super creamy, very smooth, dark chocolate, coffee, and salted caramel with fresh peach and pear fruit, itâs like a super-charged 10 Year Old. But itâs not all sweet and smooth, thereâs aromatic tobacco and menthol notes lurking in the background.
Finish: Itâs back to custard, long and lingering with vanilla, cinnamon and almond plus that faint aromatic herbal note.
Nose: Warm baking spices, cinnamon, custard, toffee, vanilla, so opulent. Custard tarts and a hint of espresso â itâs like a Portuguese breakfast here.

Name: Cask Speyside 10 Year Old (A.D. Rattray)
Palate: Smooth and rather gentle, with barley sugar sweetness, creamy milk chocolate praline, fresh cinnamon cookies and black pepper spice.
Finish: A balanced finish with sweet notes remaining alongside a splash of lemon citrus.
Nose: Lemon curd, soft vanilla fudge, mint cremes and floral, fragrant blossom.

Name: Glorious 12th Artisan Whisky
Palate: Sweet vanilla, with candied citrus, creamy malt, and spiced fruit cake.
Finish: Allspice, and vanilla sugar.
Nose: Grain character, drizzles of caramel, and floral honey.

Name: Singleton of Dufftown Malt Master's Selection
Palate: A slightly oily palate carries more sweet notes of rich toffee, vanilla and a suggestion of pear drops. A green, grassy undertone lingers throughout as a youthful, vibrant spice prickles away.
Finish: The spice dissipates among more vanilla and a little wood ash.
Nose: Soft orchard fruit esters develop into boiled apple candies. White pepper begins to crackle through golden syrup and buttered bread, with a little marzipan icing in the backdrop.

Name: Bunnahabhain 40 Year Old
Palate: Sweet malt, creamy caramel, vanilla, creamy berries, with hints of toasted nuts, tropical fruit, banana and pineapple.
Finish: Long sweet and fruity.
Nose: Hints of tropical fruits, banana, berries, creamy toffee, vanilla, rich nuttiness and delicate sweet oak.

Name: Adnams 7 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Enjoyably chocolatey, with a smidge of bittersweet coffee in there too. Rounded malt, more orchard fruit, and a kick of cinnamon.
Finish: Lasting molasses and honey richness.
Nose: Cooked apple and overripe pear, drizzled with runny caramel. A hint of old oak furniture sits in the background.

Name: The King of Scots Blend (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Orange boiled sweeties, melon and brown sugar.
Finish: Cracked black pepper, toffee and lemon.
Nose: Vanilla latte, chewy caramels and a hint of fruity malt.

Name: Dumbarton 21 Year Old 2000 (cask 15825) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Runny honey, vanilla buttercream, and fudge.
Finish: Baking spices return on the finish, alongside toffee penny.
Nose: Delicate and sweet, with brown sugar, marmalade, cinnamon butter, and Scottish tablet.

Name: Starward Tawny (70cl)
Palate: Rather Christmassy, with spiced cooked plum, more dried fruit and citrus, a good helping of malt and grape sweetness.
Finish: A dusting of brown sugar and oily nuts on a dry, spicy finish.
Nose: Banana bread and dried peels, with peanut butter and raisin.

Name: Caol Ila 7 Year Old 2011 (cask 900056) - Fadandel
Palate: Zesty wafts of candied citrus, bonfire embers, and plenty of smoke are lifted by delicately floral fruit and a waft of vanilla.
Finish: Pepper, plenty of prickling spice, the fruitiness remains, but nestled amongst lingering layers of ash and peat.
Nose: A delicate balance of salty peat smoke and sweet, vinous oak.

Name: Kingsbarns Dream to Dram (with 2x Glasses)
Palate: Smooth texture, sweet cereal notes, light and fruity, with some roasty coffee notes.
Finish: Banana bread, of all things.
Nose: You can really smell those first-fill bourbon casks. Thereâs vanilla and crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e plus lots of new make character, tropical fruit, and quite pronounced alcohol.

Name: Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old - Canmore
Palate: Oily malt with a creamy mouthfeel, dark cherry chocolate, dates, and spiced fruit cake.
Finish: Dense dried fruits stick around, with plenty of aromatic spice and nutty malt in tow.
Nose: Boozy berries and candied fruit, sherried oak, with sweet baking spices.

Name: Linkwood 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 306295) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Creamy milk chocolate, with shortbread, cinnamon spice, and green chilli.
Finish: Malty, with some citrus zest, and black pepper.
Nose: Floral honey, and lashings of vanilla caramel, and oaky spice.

Name: Teaninich 13 Year Old 2009 (casks 8 & 17 & 18 & 19) - Un-Chilfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Full-bodied malt character is joined by red berries, liquorice, allspice, and drizzles of treacle.
Finish: Pepper, and some earthy herbs.
Nose: Spicy blackberries, cherries, dried hay, and oaky vanilla.

Name: North British 32 Year Old 1988 (casks 608959/963 & 238960) - Mission Gold (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Tarte Tatin, baking spice, honeyed granola, and sweet oak.
Finish: Caramel sweetness mingles with savoury wafts of oats and hay, a touch of anise and pepper.
Nose: Fresh apples and poached pears, rich oak, buttery popcorn, and wafts of vanilla.

Name: Pokeno - Discovery
Palate: Warm oak, vanilla, cocoa powder, candied orange peel, and warm spices.
Finish: Dried raisins and allspice linger.
Nose: Cocoa nibs, dried figs, and cherries, with a touch of treacle and cinnamon.

Name: Langatun Port Cask Finish (49.1%)
Palate: Stewed prunes, orange peel, brown sugar, vanilla, and aromatic spice.
Finish: Cedar, cocoa, and spiced fruit.
Nose: Dried fruit, caramel, toasty oak, sweet tobacco, and nutmeg.

Name: Aberlour 21 Year Old 1996 (cask 900053) - Rare Select (Montgomerie's)
Palate: Golden syrup, sponge cake, cinnamon rolls and leafy herbs.
Finish: A few hints of ginger and black tea on the finish.
Nose: Toffee apple, black pepper, toasted sesame seeds and sugary shortbread.

Name: J.G. Thomson Smoky Blended Malt
Palate: Coastal breeze and bonfire smoke, joined by cinnamon buns and caramel.
Finish: Lasting hints of black tea and oak, with a medicinal peaty touch.
Nose: Seaweed, ash, brown sugar, and warm malt.

Name: Teaninich 13 Year Old 2009 Vintage Casks (Mossburn)
Palate: Red berry sweetness is complemented by aromatic spice and creamy vanilla.
Finish: Floral honey and orange peel.
Nose: Plum jam and fresh oak, followed by waxy citrus and barley sugars.

Name: The Macallan Edition No.2
Palate: Notes of Sherried raisins and dried citrus peels develop, a hint of vegetal oak. Still a little chocolate-y.
Finish: Spiced fruit cake and lemon peels.
Nose: Mocha, brown sugar, a spark of ginger and some oak-y warmth.

Name: Glen Moray 2008 Manzanilla Finish - Warehouse 1
Palate: Pink wafers, chai spices, orange zest, a smidge of dry oak warmth.
Finish: Still a hint of grassiness to the finish.
Nose: Barley and cut grass, waxy apple peels, a little hint of milky coffee.

Name: Ragtime Rye Whiskey Double Oak
Palate: Earthy vanilla, more cracked black pepper, slight hints of orange and cherry sweetness, with a touch of cardamom.
Finish: Lingering spiciness of rye grain, with a layer of toffee.
Nose: Maple syrup on pancakes, flapjacks, a good kick of peppercorn and red chilli, some subtle pine hints along the way too.

Name: Armorik 10 Year Old Dervenn Single Malt
Palate: Oaky vanilla is joined by white grape, foam banana, and ginger.
Finish: Oak char and citrus.
Nose: Toasted coconut, dried apricot, and cinnamon.

Name: Redwood Empire Pipe Dream Bourbon
Palate: Quite nutty, with almond and walnut making an appearance. Toffee popcorn, milk chocolate, and peppercorn.
Finish: Maple syrup, marmalade, and cedar.
Nose: Orange peel, honeycomb, dry oak, brown sugar, and nutmeg.

Name: Evan Williams Extra Aged
Palate: Raisins and walnuts. Creamy vanilla at the core, with an underpinning hint of vegetal oak. Zesty orange oil.
Finish: Quite spicy, with drying notes of cinnamon bark and pine nuts.
Nose: Caramel apples, spearmint, black pepper. A light hint of corn sits in the background. A slightly spicy kick of clove.

Name: Caperdonich 21 Year Old Peated - Secret Speyside Collection
Palate: A burst of smoke followed by whispers of herbal tea leaves and menthol liquorice root.
Finish: Long and smoky.
Nose: Gentle peat and bonfire embers intermingled with aromas of warm cedar and mandarin orange.

Name: Mackintosh Blended Malt Scotch Whisky
Palate: Fruit cake notes, with warm hints of ginger and pepper, biscuity malt, and silky caramel balance softer notes of cut grass.
Finish: Honey sweetness with toasted nuts and lingering dried fruits, subtle vanilla and bold, peppery oak.
Nose: Rich oak and sweet malt combine with stewed fruits and drying spice.

Name: Miltonduff 11 Year Old 2007 (cask 341) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Prickles of ginger nestle between sweet orange, vanilla fudge, and a hint of milky tea.
Finish: Gently floral, crisp apple, and pear are followed by delicate spice and soft oak.
Nose: Soft vanilla sponge cake, a drizzle of lemon, toasted nuts, and wood chips.

Name: Ardmore 13 Year Old 2008 - The Kilnsman's Dram
Palate: Toasted almond, mint sweeties, followed by fruit and nut chocolate.
Finish: A floral and spicy finish, with heather honey and black pepper.
Nose: Savoury smoke, runny caramel, and orange marmalade, alongside oily malt.

Name: Hyde No.9 Iberian Cask
Palate: Cooked apricot, more raspberry and a touch of honeydew melon, wrapped up in oodles of vanilla.
Finish: Some sweet spices appear on the finish.
Nose: Blackcurrant, dried raspberry, shortbread, and cut grass.

Name: Dartmoor Bordeaux Cask Matured Whisky
Palate: Waxy citrus, more blackcurrant, crunchy brown sugar, cinnamon and almond.
Finish: Fresh barley and some sweet berry hints.
Nose: Soft hints of raspberry and blackcurrant, backed up by malty vanilla and a hint of white pepper.

Name: Hellyers Road 12 Year Old Original
Palate: Floral honey, sweet orange, and pear tart.
Finish: Cooked apple and cinnamon sugar.
Nose: Lemon curd, toffee, and vanilla pod.

Name: SPEY 10 Year Old - Bourbon Cask
Palate: Black pepper appears, leading into vanilla cream, heather honey, and buttered toast.
Finish: Vanilla fudge through and through.
Nose: Oily barley, pear tart, mint chocolate, and orange marmalade.

Name: Overeem 5 Year Old - Batch 3 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Viscous, bold, and incredibly well balanced. Dark chocolate leads hazelnuts and raisins, followed by peppery spices.
Finish: Long and deliciously spicy.
Nose: Rich dark chocolate, dried fruits, plums and raisins, with notes of hazelnut, nutmeg and cinnamon, and just a hint of mint coming through the chocolate.

Name: The Six Isles Batch Strength
Palate: Salty peat smoke, fresh lime, green apple, banana, vanilla, digestive biscuits, black pepper.
Finish: Long and smoky.
Nose: Bonfires on beaches, strawberries and cream, a smidge of cumin powder spiciness.

Name: Blair Athol 11 Year Old 2011 (casks 306899 & 306905 & 306911 & 306913) - Un-Chilfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Some charred peaches, with barley sugar, pepper, allspice, and toasted oak.
Finish: Milk chocolate and more oaky spice.
Nose: Vanilla custard, with some candied lime zest, oaky spice, and vanilla caramel.

Name: Emerald Isle
Palate: Vanilla still sits at the core, with hints of fresh barley and sponge cake popping up along the way.
Finish: Quite short, with apple and orange lasting.
Nose: Floral honey, with a touch of marmalade mixed in. Scones, forest floor and black pepper.

Name: Glentauchers 12 Year Old - Wee Brother (Na BrÃ ithrean)
Palate: Rich, sweet oak, and gently biscuity malt, toasted vanilla with roasted almonds and lemon shortbread.
Finish: Caramel and bold barley, with more notes of sweet apricot and cream, a dusting of warming spice and zesty citrus.
Nose: Sweet orchard and stone fruits, vanilla and honeysuckle with gentle wafts of toasted oak and baking spice.

Name: Heaven's Door Straight Rye
Palate: The flavours intensify on the palate. Thereâs a nutty toffee foundation with more chocolate and spice, followed by apple pie, orange peel, spearmint, salted butter and nougat.
Finish: The spice completely disappears but the mint lingers in a calm, delicate and slightly succulent finish.
Nose: Classic dark and chew rye notes - mint, baking spices, anise, freshly ground pepper - form around a creamy core of banoffee pie and vanilla ice cream. A warming, woody element builds underneath with touches of citrus, leather and molasses. A big whiff of pricey dark chocolate wafts through with time.

Name: Ben Ãideann Galilean Ruby
Palate: Strawberry jam and dark chocolate digestives, with rich notes of mocha.
Finish: Dark red stone fruits alongside summer berries, with hints of baking spice.
Nose: Warming, toasty oak spice alongside dusty cocoa.

Name: Connemara Distillers Edition with 2x Glasses
Palate: More honey develops on the palate, with growing juicy peach and a kick of pepper. Of course, the peat continues to show off on the palate, too.
Finish: Very long, with a note of smoky oak on the end.
Nose: Earthy smoke, developing notes of orchard fruits and a hint of honey.

Name: Croftengea Smoky & Fruity Marsala Finish - Cask Craft (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Honey Cheerios, peaches in syrup, cinnamon-spiced nuts, and a whiff of beach bonfire.
Finish: Cooked apple, treacle, and lingering aromatic smokiness.
Nose: Salted caramel, caramelised (and burnt) pineapple, toasted walnut, and nutmeg.

Name: Tamdhu Quercus Alba Distinction
Palate: Chocolate cake, maple syrup, more zesty citrus notes, and rich dates.
Finish: Lasting oaky warmth, with cinnamon lingering.
Nose: Tangy orange, cherry, and melted chocolate with a dusting of ginger.

Name: Yamazakura Blended Whisky
Palate: Fresh orchard fruit, salted-caramel-coated biscuit, greengages.
Finish: Medium length, rich in vanilla.
Nose: Orange blossom and subtle notes of earthy oak.

Name: Mackmyra Moment - Brukswhisky DLX
Palate: Richly buttery, heavy vanilla and a smidge of dried peels giving it some lift. A slow build of anise and cassia.
Finish: Toasted sesame and vanilla pod lingering.
Nose: Soft cedar and spring meadows, with a touch of cigar box developing. Raisins, pears, and a touch of raspberry.

Name: Noble Rebel Hazelnut Harmony
Palate: Hazelnut spread, with earthy vanilla, warm oak, and poached orchard fruits.
Finish: Warm spices build, with an oily, nutty finish.
Nose: Financiers, ripe apple, honeycomb, and flecks of toasted hazelnuts.

Name: Four Roses Bourbon
Palate: Balanced, rich palate entry with marmalade and acacia honey. Cinnamon, lemon and oak.
Finish: Oaky, spiced finish.
Nose: Sweet, creamy aromas. Hints of Seville orange marmalade and lemon zest. A hint of corn sweetness and caramel.

Name: Longmorn 23 Year Old
Palate: Fruity notes of melon and Jazz apple start to grow. Still chocolatey.
Finish: Very long, subtly peppery but still packed with rounded vanilla.
Nose: Jamaican ginger cake, honeycomb, milk chocolate and toasted malt.

Name: Glenkinchie 2007 (bottled 2019) Amontillado Cask Finish - Distillers Edition
Palate: Grassy barley and lemongrass notes shine out from underneath old brandy, sugared almond and festive spice notes.

Nose: Hazelnut spread, rye bread and runny honey.

Name: DÃ  MhÃ¬le Organic Single Grain - Bourbon Quarter Cask
Palate: Raspberry white chocolate, oaky vanilla, and custard are joined by clove and white pepper.
Finish: Tropical fruit and aromatic spice linger.
Nose: Desiccated coconut, vanilla, toffee apples, and cinnamon.

Name: Writers Tears Single Pot Still
Palate: Hearty spice brings warmth from the depths, while dates, sultanas, and figs bring a chewy sweetness.
Finish: Silky caramel, biscuity with lingering prickles of pepper and ginger heat.
Nose: Heaps of candied fruit and caramelised nuts, with hard toffee and baked apples.

Name: Amaethon
Palate: Oak spice, quince, caramel, apricot, and buttery pastry.
Finish: Candied ginger and vanilla buttercream.
Nose: Rich malt, acacia honey, dried fruit, gingerbread, and banana.

Name: Sailor's Home The Journey
Palate: More vanilla custard creaminess, supported by apple crumble and cinnamon sticks.
Finish: A touch of banana bread and salted butter.
Nose: Fudge, coffee cake, clove, apricot jam and vanilla custard.

Name: McGibbon's 12 Year Old Platinum Ribbon
Palate: Vanilla fudge, a pinch of pepper, and candied ginger.
Finish: Salted caramel, cooked apple, and spicy oak.
Nose: Creamy nuts, cinnamon, and vanilla pod.

Name: Glentauchers 8 Year Old - Chorlton Whisky
Palate: Malted Milk biscuits, cooked apple, and creamy stone fruit, with buttered tea cakes and crackles of oak spice.
Finish: Burnt pepper and charred oak join spiced honey and dark chocolate.
Nose: Sweet, biscuity malt, runny caramel, and juicy fruit salad.

Name: Langatun ChÃ¢teau Kefraya Cask Finish
Palate: Blackcurrant, vanilla, savoury cedar and a whisper of sea salt, nutmeg, dates.
Finish: Dried fruit, gingerbread, and orange zest.
Nose: Marzipan, toasted oak with a smidge of burnt sugar too, quite chocolatey at points.

Name: Nikka Whisky From The Barrel Ice Bucket Gift Set
Palate: Full-bodied and punchy. There is plenty of winter spice and toffee, a little caramel and vanilla, and a good mouthful of fruit.
Finish: Long, warming, and fruity with a little oaken spice.
Nose: Medium-body with good balance. There are notes of cut flowers and fresh fruits, spice, and a little oak.

Name: Glen Spey 10 Year Old 2009 (cask 804620) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Fresh pear and apple with more waxy hints in tow, followed by a touch of fragrant grass.
Finish: Soft hints of toasted marshmallow and cassia.
Nose: Gingersnaps, beeswax, and a hint of heather.

Name: Strathclyde 34 Year Old 1987 - Mission Gold (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Sweet oak, caramel sauce, fresh cereal.
Finish: Long and gentle, peanut brittle.
Nose: Toffee apple, stewed pears, vanilla.

Name: Sacred Peated English Whisky
Palate: Intensely chocolate at first, before a hint of sea salt develops on the mid-palate.
Finish: Christmas cake spices stick around on the finish.
Nose: Bonfires, treacle tart, raisin and diced herbs.

Name: Belmont Farm Kopper Kettle Bourbon
Palate: Butterscotch, toasted corn, and oaky sweetness, with a mineral undertone stopping things getting out of hand.
Finish: Milk chocolate and oak char.
Nose: Dry, spicy oak, with malty biscuit notes, buttery caramel, and grilled corn.

Name: Paul John Nirvana
Palate: Honeyed cinnamon and barley sugar, with a smidge of salt bringing balance alongside ripe orchard fruit.
Finish: Crystallised ginger lingers alongside vanilla and milk chocolate.
Nose: Treacle and butterscotch, with baked pineapple, sweet malt and fig.

Name: Stauning El ClÃ¡sico
Palate: Warm and intense.
Finish: Bitter-sweet.
Nose: Grain and spice.

Name: Jim Beam White Label
Palate: Good body with notes of toasty oak and all the requisite notes of vanilla and crÃ¨me anglaise, a little spice and pepper with an acetone note.
Finish: Toasty oak and resin with a some sweetness.
Nose: Quite sweet with gentle notes of vanilla and cut hay, a touch of fresh corn fields and a little cereal sweetness, like the bluegrass fields of Kentucky.

Name: Lismore 12 Year Old
Palate: Burnt sugar and coffee bean. A light touch of the aforementioned grassy notes.
Finish: Heavy malt and barley sugar.
Nose: Herbaceous and grassy, with an underlying note of vanilla bean.

Name: Blair Athol 9 Year Old 2013 - Hepburn's Choice
Palate: Soft and creamy, with summer fruits and zesty barley backed by a sprinkle of spice.
Finish: Milk chocolate, vanilla fudge, a touch of peppery oak, and dried berries.
Nose: Orchard blossom and vanilla lead, followed by honey and oaty biscuits.

Name: Mortlach (Special Release 2022)
Palate: Full and spicy, caramel, toffee, dark chocolate, bitter espresso, aromatic pink peppercorns.
Finish: Muscovado sugar, a touch of wood tannin, and dark chocolate. Long and intense.
Nose: Big nose! Brown sugar, dried fruit, dark caramel, chocolate, coffee, date, and cherry.

Name: Velvet Cap 5 Year Old Single Malt Irish Whiskey - Bordeaux Wine Cask Finish
Palate: Gingerbread, milky coffee, dried fruit, and orange peel.
Finish: Dark chocolate Digestive biscuits and raspberry.
Nose: Red berries, waves of brown sugar, vanilla, and cinnamon.

Name: Tomatin 30 Year Old
Palate: Herbal, spiced palate with poppy seed cake, mature honey, fresh flowers and custard.
Finish: Custard and digestive biscuits on the finish.
Nose: Manuka honey and calves leather. Hints of gingernut and cut herbs.

Name: Glen Grant 46 Year Old 1972 (cask 8240) - Exceptional Casks (Berry Bros. & Rudd)
Palate: The palate is wonderfully bright and accessible considering its age. The flavours build slowly but smoothly to release their sumptuous cargo of tropical fruits. A hint of creamy coal dust adds to the pleasure.
Finish: The sweet luxurious texture and fruity notes linger long on the palate.
Nose: This exceptional Glen Grant sherry butt oozes rich glazed fruit notes with bees wax and polished oak to the fore.

Name: London Square 12 Year Old
Palate: Vanilla caramel, sweet red berry notes with soaked sultanas and candied fruits. A touch of honeyed granola and sweet, biscuity malt.
Finish: Delicate wafts of red fruits continue, with more characterful oak, buttery barley, and subtle spice.
Nose: Toasted oak with a whiff of smoke, chocolate buttons, and zesty lemon peels with an underlying touch of herbaceous grist.

Name: Teaninich 10 Year Old 2007  - Hepburn's Choice (Langside)
Palate: Runny treacle, vanilla ice cream and porridge oats form a core from which drying nutmeg and citrus add depth.
Finish: Soft barley and drying spices linger.
Nose: Gristy malt and oats initially, with sugared barley and cooked berries underneath.

Name: Fettercairn 18 Year Old
Palate: Lots of signature Fettercairn: biscuity malt, tropical fruit, and aromatic spice are joined by a dark, sweet, and tannic edge that screams Scottish oak. There's richÂ vanilla, menthol herbs, apple pie, cinnamon, black fruits, and a dusting of cocoa powder.
Finish: The sweet notes of the palate are joined by drying tannic elements.
Nose: Charred pineapple, honey-roasted cashew, fresh pastry, and dark chocolate lead with hints of espresso, mango chutney, dunnage earthiness, and salted caramel.

Name: Famous Grouse Toasted Cask Finish (1L)
Palate: Oak, layers of creamy vanilla, caramelised sugar, dried fruits, soft spices and a hint of wood smoke alongside toasted marshmallows.
Finish: A smooth, well-balanced finish.
Nose: Candied fruits, buttery shortbread, delicate citrus peel and butterscotch sweetness.

Name: Tullamore D.E.W. 12 Year Old Special Reserve
Palate: Light and soft with hints of gentle spices (nutmeg, allspice), a touch of honey and creamy fruits in yoghurt.
Finish: Medium length with a little oaky/nutty bittersweetness.
Nose: Scones with clotted cream and vinous strawberry jam, sultanas, dates and digestive biscuits. Linseed and honey.

Name: Hamiltons Lowland Single Grain
Palate: Light toffee apple, dried apricot, green oak and hot grain.
Finish: Milk chocolate and oak.
Nose: Fragrant light oak, lilac, clean linen and vanilla.

Name: Glen Moray Peated Elgin Classic Gift Set with 2x Glasses
Palate: Smoke never gets too intense, rather it remains in the background behind vanilla and orchard fruit.
Finish: A little bit peppery, though still enjoyably sweet.
Nose: Apricot, roasted pineapple and hints of tobacco leaf.

Name: Hebredian Journey Blended Malt - Journey Series (Hunter Laing)
Palate: Grassy smoke, rich citrus, black pepper, and dried fruits.
Finish: Sparkling fruits, salt, and dry smoke.
Nose: Through a sea breeze comes raisins, ripe red apples, cinnamon, and vanilla.

Name: Heaven's Door Double Barrel Whiskey
Palate: Burnt brown sugar, liquorice, apple, peach and lemon.
Finish: A slow build of oak and grilled pineapple.
Nose: Honey on rye toast, apricot, pepper, a hint of strawberry.

Name: Croftengea 14 Year Old  2007 (cask 197) - Smoke & Glory (Heroes & Heretics)

Finish: Candied peels, anise, cinnamon.

Name: Longmorn 13 Year Old 2008 (cask 1227) - Fadandel
Palate: Sweet, candied citrus peels open up, whilst honeyed dates and cherries mingle with oily oak and creamy malt. Prickles of ginger and pepper begin to build.

Name: Glencadam 13 Year Old 2006 (cask 336100) - Port Pipe Matured

Name: Benriach Malting Season (Second Edition)

Nose: Orange peel, vanilla, rich malt, almond, and barrel char.

Name: The Irishman Caribbean Cask Finish

Name: Dewar's 8 Year Old Japanese Smooth

Name: Glen Elgin 2013 (bottled 2023) Small Batch (batch 1) - Berry Bros. & Rudd

Name: Paul John Bold
Palate: Honeyed oak and fruity coffee with that Islay peat again making its character gently known. Spicy porridge, lime and dry toast.

Nose: Lively and vibrant, with pineapple, mango and ginger leaping from the glass like some kind of tropical fruit salad. There's a creamier shortbread vibe and pine needles too, but this one really is all about a peppery punch.

Name: Balmenach 10 Year Old 2012 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)

Nose: Dried fruits, candied citrus, and a touch of cloves.

Name: High Coast Ãlv - Delicate Vanilla
Palate: Full-bodied and fruity, the palate begins with plenty of tropical fruit, vanilla and toffee, which mingle with spicy black pepper and a touch of toasted oak warmth.
Finish: A little cereal and dark fruit sweetness linger.
Nose: Lots of creamy vanilla ice cream leads, with bramble berries, salted peanuts and crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e in support. Freshly grated nutmeg, dried grass, apricot yoghurt and little marzipan are present underneath.

Name: Crabbie's Yardhead
Palate: Mint leaf, toffee apple, white grape, slightly toasty.
Finish: Rye heat and soft cinnamon.
Nose: Custard Cream biscuits, lemon peel, a touch of savoury wood.

Name: DÃ  MhÃ¬le Organic Single Malt (cask MM1607)
Palate: Fruitcake, nutmeg, and some tropical elements underneath as well as prickles of pepper.
Finish: Sweet raisins linger.
Nose: Membrillo, with twists of oily orange peel, toffee, and stone fruits.

Name: SPEY Trutina Cask Strength - Batch 2
Palate: Sweet nougat, buttery caramel, floral malt, vanilla and apple blossom.

Nose: Banana bread, dark chocolate ganache, orange chocolate and zingy apple skin, with malt cereal in milk and a sprinkle of sugar.

Palate: Spiced apple and vanilla join the notes from the nose with a helping of wintery spices.
Finish: Toffee and nutmeg remain.
Nose: Blackcurrant and cherry aromas are layered with vanilla, salted caramel, and spicy black peppercorn.

Name: Ruadh Maor 10 Year Old (cask 222) - DrÃ m MÃ²r
Palate: Salted caramel coats more stewed fruits, dark chocolate, and waxy apple skins.
Finish: Smoky, drying, and delicately spiced.
Nose: Burnt hay, mocha, and dried fruit with a hint of cinnamon.

Name: Dailuaine 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 314939) - Family Series (The Single Cask)
Palate: Red berries, citrus, white pepper, nutty, honey, chocolate.
Finish: Medium-Long, citrus, red fruits, chocolate, malt, oak.
Nose: Floral elements, white pepper, citrus, red fruits, chocolate, malt, oak.

Palate: Fruity notes of blackcurrant jam, peaches and lemon peel fade to reveal honeyed almonds and coconut with a soft floral note and a touch of mint.

Name: Linkwood 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 306305) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)

Nose: Set honey and vanilla fudge, with charred oak, and candied citrus.

Palate: Cedar spices, milk chocolate, apricot, earthy peat, black pepper and a hint of charcoal.

Nose: Matured oak and cigar box, with a good whiff of woody smoke gliding through.

Name: Speyside 12 Year Old - The Classic Series (Heroes & Heretics)
Palate: White chocolate, cereal, toasted almonds, and white pepper.
Finish: Mild chilli, elderflowers, savoury biscuits.
Nose: Butter, caramel, oak, and seashells.

Name: SÃ¤ntis Malt Edition Himmelberg
Palate: Fresh pears this time, along with vanilla custard, cinnamon, ginger and an earthy snuff.

Nose: Vanilla shortbread and a dusting of sugar, with a menthol hint alongside strawberry jam.

Name: Wilderness Trail Family Reserve Cask Strength Rye

Name: Dailuaine 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 1911908/93/94/95) - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)

Name: Slyrs 3 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Fragrant barley, crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e, oat biscuits, lemongrass and some Sichuan pepper.

Nose: Vanilla custard, Mr. Kipling's Bramley Apple Pies, stewed plums and some dried hay.

Name: Craigellachie 12 Year Old 2010 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)

Nose: Bittersweet dark chocolate, dried mango, and oily malt.

Name: Bladnoch Talia

Name: Wee Smoky â Batch 2

Name: SÃ¤ntis Malt Edition Dreifaltigkeit

Name: Ruadh Maor 10 Year Old (cask 220) - DrÃ m MÃ²r
Palate: Dried apricot and golden syrup over waffled, balanced by even more of that smokiness, as well as peppery spice.
Finish: Burnt brown sugar and orange boiled sweets.
Nose: Sweet porridge balanced by generous wafts of peat smoke, alongside cigar box.

Name: Mossburn Signature Casks Series No.1
Palate: Drying spices (think nutmeg and cinnamon), blended with caramelised sultanas and shortbread. Soft smoke continues.
Finish: A lasting finish of sponge cake, marmalade and toasted rye.
Nose: Coastal smokiness develops throughout, with a touch of floral malt bringing sweetness to the nose.

Name: Aultmore 10 Year Old 2012 - Hepburn's Choice
Palate: More sweet cereal notes, along with more orchard fruit, some crumbly shortbread, and peppery spice.
Finish: Light and sweet, with some barley sugar.
Nose: Sweet hay, with some brown sugar, crisp apple, and cinnamon.

Name: La Piautre Whisky Single Malt
Palate: Crisp green apple, buttery vanilla, sandalwood, honey, and ginger root.
Finish: Spice and a slight grain sweetness.
Nose: Dried stone fruit, sweet tobacco, fiery spice, and toasted oak.

Name: The Pogues Single Malt Whiskey
Palate: Dry oak spice and chai spices, with peanut butter, s'mores and floral malt.
Finish: A gentle finish of lingering caramel alongside cinnamon stick.
Nose: Fairly floral, with lavendar, sesame snaps, caramelised nuts and salted chocolate.

Name: Caol Ila 6 Year Old 2014 (casks 1925785/193/194) - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Smoky salinity, creamy vanilla, a good dose of oily citrus peel, hints of warming ginger.
Finish: Sweet vanilla caramel, toasted oak, salty, coastal minerality.
Nose: Green apple, maritime breeze, boozy raisins, charred oak.

Name: Blair Athol 10 Year Old 2012 - Hepburn's Choice (Langside)
Palate: Cooked apples, raisins, milk chocolate, and fresh malt.
Finish: Icing sugar and fresh red fruits.
Nose: Red berries, hazelnut, dark chocolate, and cinnamon.

Name: Blair Athol 2012 (bottled 2022) Small Batch (batch 1) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Warm cinnamon and pepper alongside more orchard fruits, and crumbly shortbread.
Finish: Warm oak and some toasted hazelnut.
Nose: Fruit and spice, with poached apples and pears, fresh plums, and some creamy grain.

Name: Royal Brackla 9 Year Old 2013 (cask 1596, 302353 & 302355) - James Eadie
Palate: Apple and pear pastries, vanilla, and creamy malt, with a touch of anise and spiced plum.
Finish: Nutmeg and ginger bring a touch of warmth to the finish, though things remain sweet with vanilla biscuits and butterscotch aplenty.
Nose: Sweet, malty biscuits and toasted nuts lead while drizzles of honey support fragrant oak char.

Name: Shinju Japanese Whisky - Aged 8 Years
Palate: Orange marmalade, dark chocolate, toffee, and some floral notes emerge on the palate.
Finish: Fresh apple and vanilla linger.
Nose: Apricot, waxy lemon peel, toasted oak, and a dusting of cocoa.

Name: Dufftown 10 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Creamy texture with a sweet fruitiness (more peaches) with pepper and cinnamon.
Finish: A big whack of liquorice at the end, like an old-fashioned sweet shop.
Nose: pineapples and tinned peaches. All with a certain briney quality. Sounds odd but it works.

Name: Glenfiddich 40 Year Old - Rare Collection (Release Number 17)
Palate: Silky smooth and luxuriously mouth coating. The initial flavours are intense dried fruits, Christmas cake, dates, raisins and stewed apples. Over time slightly dryish oak notes appear with some bitter chocolate and just the merest hint of peat.
Finish: Incredibly long lasting and complex â a truly memorable experience.
Nose: Beautifully rich and aromatic with layer upon layer of dried fruits, dark chocolate, roasted coffee and ripe black cherries. Occasional wafts of gentle wood smoke, polished leather and cloves.

Name: Egan's Fortitude Gift Set with Glass
Palate: Swirls of smoke mixed with more sherry notes, chocolate, and rich dried fruits.
Finish: A long, sweet finish that lingers.
Nose: Sweet and strong sherry, honey, and raisins with a hint of marzipan.

Name: Ragtime Rye Whiskey Bottled in Bond
Palate: Cinnamon and nutmeg prickles through astringent oak, leather and jammy berries, as well as a touch of vanilla.
Finish: A little drying, with lemon peel and eucalyptus.
Nose: Red cola cubes, dark fruits and maple syrup, with a hint of white pepper and tart cherries.

Name: Aultmore 10 Year Old 2011 - Bodega Series (Goldfinch Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Silky layers of butterscotch and biscuity malt intertwine with baked fruit. Zesty herbs linger in the distance.
Finish: Toasted almonds and marzipan, a touch of mocha, and a peppering of oaken spice.
Nose: Chocolate coffee beans, honeyed raisins, and earthy oak.

Name: High Coast Quercus IV Mongolica
Palate: Oaky vanilla, with tonka bean, ginger, and peppery allspice.
Finish: Drizzles of caramel and cinnamon with dried apricots in tow.
Nose: Aromatic sandalwood, with apple peels, green grapes, and earthy spice.

Name: The Irishman The Harvest Gift Set with 2x Glasses
Palate: Custard cream biscuits dunked in tea, cinnamon sticks, peppercorn, and lemon cheesecake.
Finish: More biscuit notes, with a touch of anise.
Nose: Nectarine, honeydew melon, buttered brown bread.

Name: Samaroli Without Borders (2020 Edition)
Palate: Fresh malt and rhubarb jam, leading into earthy cut grass and buttered toast.
Finish: Coastal smoke and candied berries.
Nose: Tart red fruit, oily smoke and citrus peels, with a coastal, mineral undertone.

Name: Kentucky Owl Confiscated
Palate: Spicy oak, slightly drying with peaches and cream, cinnamon butter and crackers, with a smidge of red berry.
Finish: Herbal notes appear, supported by oak tannins and lots of spice, with cinnamon and nutmeg rounding things off.
Nose: Hints of peach, mature oak, earthy vanilla and tobacco, with sweeter vanilla and warming aromas of cardamom and baking spice.

Name: High West American Prairie Bourbon
Palate: Sweet, toasty spices, vanilla, cherries and manuka honey.
Finish: Peanut brittle, chocolate orange and hints of dried red berries.
Nose: Light caramel notes supported by mixed peels and cinnamon.

Name: Dailuaine 8 Year Old 2012 (Single Cask Nation)
Palate: Sweet honey, stem ginger, gently herbal wafts of vegetal malt with raisins, and a hint of marzipan.
Finish: More green garden herbs appear, alongside creamy vanilla and lasting baking spice.
Nose: Flaky croissants, zesty lemon, and floral vanilla with a touch of sawdust.

Name: Hyde  6 Year Old No.3 The Ãras Cask
Palate: Vanilla, warming spice, a little chilli and nougat.
Finish: Soft oak and caramel.
Nose: CrÃ¨me caramel and toasty American oak wood spices.

Name: Black Bull Peated Edition
Palate: Stewed apples, toffee and lemon peel lead among earthy peat, roasted salt nuts and a little cinnamon.
Finish: Some salty and smoky notes linger.
Nose: Through sea salt and bonfire smoke comes brown sugar, orchard fruit and rich malt.

Name: Crabbie 8 Year Old
Palate: Buttered scones, waxy orange peel and a touch of cassia.
Finish: Lingering orange oil sweetness.
Nose: Caramel, raisin and honey-coated peanuts.

Name: Eden Mill Madeira Cask 2022 - Cask Mastery Series
Palate: Soft apricots and peaches, with spiced figs, and sponge cake.
Finish: Warm oak, with zingy ginger.
Nose: Bakewell tart, candied citrus, and caramel sauce.

Name: Singleton of Dufftown Sunray
Palate: Soft stewed apples. Thick honeyed texture and taste, with a hint of malt in the background.
Finish: Fairly short, warm and drying.
Nose: Vanilla and honey, apple and blackcurrant - two great pairs working well together. Grassy honey then dehydrated apple with cinnamon moving into strudel with some dark, syrupy blackcurrant.

Name: Teaninich 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 6732216) - The Octave (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Marmalade, melted milk chocolate, and flamed herbs.
Finish: Brown sugar and black pepper.
Nose: Chocolate raisins, orange Starburst, dried apple, and clove-studded orange.

Name: Grace O'Malley Blended Irish Whiskey
Palate: Dried fruits and honey flapjack, resinous oak with cinnamon and pepper spice.
Finish: Caramelised nuts, wafts of vanilla, sweet, cakey spice, and a gently warming finish.
Nose: Oaky vanilla and sweet, nutty caramel meet rich malt, popcorn, and floral spiced orange.

Name: Cask Speyside 12 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish (A.D. Rattray)
Palate: Frangipane, spiced plum, and orange drizzle cake.
Finish: Bramble fruit and baking spices.
Nose: Bakewell tart, berry jam, and apple crumble.

Name: Broger 6 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Still has lots of wood smoke to it, with liquorice root developing, and a touch of orange oil.
Finish: Soot and peppery spices.
Nose: Oily walnuts, roasted oak, BBQ sauce with a hint of honeyed sweetness, tarry ropes.

Name: Craigellachie 7 Year Old 2014 (cask 621) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Juicy sultanas balance robust malt with burnt sugar following wisps of nutmeg and coffee.
Finish: Floral jam, hints of festive spice, dried apricot, and warming oak char.
Nose: Candied fruits, diced nuts with wafts of bold roasted barley, and sweet cinnamon.

Name: Annandale Man OâSword Vintage 2015 - Bourbon Cask (cask 68)
Palate: Smoked spices and rich honey mingle with a medley of tropical fruit and vanilla.
Finish: Creamy nutty goodness lingers.
Nose: Citrus peel, toffee, dried grass, peaty barley, and a touch of polished oak furniture.

Name: GlenAllachie 12 Year Old 2008 (casks 1910865 & 1920865) - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Pear and white grape combine with boozy sultanas, vanilla cream, roasted walnuts and malted oak.
Finish: Spiced malt and nuts continue, along with a splash of boozy coffee and apple tart.
Nose: Jammy berries, honeyed fruit and orange butter.

Name: MacNaMara
Palate: Grassy notes develop, with touches of raisin and butter.
Finish: Continued grassy elements, with a final touch of peat.
Nose: Butterscotch, lightly peated malt, crushed almonds.

Name: Boulder Straight Bourbon Whiskey
Palate: Gently sweet toffee popcorn, biscuity barley, and honeyed flapjack, with oaken vanilla and just a touch of woody spice.
Finish: Lingering notes of baked fruit, juicy barley, and buttery oak.
Nose: Warm, melted butter spread over crisp sweetcorn, stewed apple, dusted with nutmeg and cinnamon.

Name: Whisky Row Smoke & Peat
Palate: Dry peat smoke and wet pebble, leading into lemon zest and tinned pineapple alongside ashy notes.
Finish: Dried apricot and a smidge of burnt rubber linger with smoky barley.
Nose: Fresh, toasted malt, with a pinch of tobacco, smoky cured meat and a burst of tropical fruit sweetness.

Name: John Walker & Sons King George V - Chinese New Year Edition 2022
Palate: Soft, buttery toffee and general fruitiness. Medium bodied, but very malty and well-constructed blend.
Finish: Golden syrup, creamy spices and malt on the finish.
Nose: A mix of heady toffee apple and very faint smoke. Thick, syrupy malt, digestive biscuits, oak.

Name: Chivas Regal XV Gold
Palate: Butterscotch, red apple and caraway. A touch of grain sweetness in the background.
Finish: Heavy vanilla and pear on the finish.
Nose: Powerful orange and peach notes, backed up by juicy barley.

Name: Two Stacks The First Cut
Palate: Seeded bread, a hint of toasty oak, butterscotch, and blackberry.
Finish: A long finish, with plenty of honeyed warmth.
Nose: Melted butter, peach, a hint of black tea, brown sugar.

Name: Dailuaine 9 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Soft waves of clotted cream and vanilla shortbread lead to sweet, zesty citrus and cooked orchard fruits. There's some of that pebbly minerality from the nose coming through too.
Finish: A crackle of peppery oak joins towards the finish, balanced by silky vanilla custard.
Nose: Delicate layers of vanilla pods, buttered crumpets, and a touch of plantain, with toasted malt and a subtle minerality riding elegantly throughout.

Name: Bellevoye Rouge
Palate: Warming toasted oak balances by blueberry and chocolate brownie.
Finish: Citrus blossom and Demerara sugar.
Nose: Floral malt, Amaretto sweetness of cherry and almond, earthy vanilla.

Name: Glenkinchie Distillers Edition - 2022 Collection
Palate: Creamy malt, with some light fruitcake, green grapes, and drying, peppery spice.
Finish: Drying and spicy.
Nose: Dried apricots and sultanas, with some toasted almond, and warming woody spice.

Name: Speyburn 10 Year Old 2008 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Quite zesty with green apple and biscuity malt opening things up, supported by sprinklings of cacao.
Finish: Drying herbs linger beneath silky layers of barley and butterscotch.
Nose: Plenty going on with juicy pear and runny caramel leading the way. Toasted sourdough with plenty of butter and citrus blossom honey join later.

Name: Destillerie Ralf Hauer 4 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Rich, oaken vanilla appears with creamy barley and peppery spice. Fruity berry notes follow with dried herbs and some vegetal undertones.
Finish: The pine and herbs continue with bold baking spice lingering.
Nose: Green and fresh with herbal notes of pine and earthy forest floor, wintery oak spice, and soft salinity.

Name: Peerless Double Oak Single Barrel Bourbon
Palate: Oaky spice followed by more chocolate and caramel, as well as rich leather and gingerbread.
Finish: Toasted oak and nutmeg.
Nose: Caramel, dark chocolate, sweet tobacco, and heaps of seasoned oak.

Name: Deanston 14 Year Old Organic
Palate: Thyme honey, mango and mandarin. Some flaky pastry. Another kick of spicy cedar from the new oak casks.
Finish: Creamy at first, but develops a hint of peppercorn spiciness.
Nose: Cedar and vanilla, with a waft of freshly laundered linen.

Name: Tormore 28 Year Old - Chorlton Whisky
Palate: A slow build of earthy, woody, subtly spice notes, alongside the powerful fruity elements.
Finish: Lasting orange oil and grassy barley.
Nose: Loads of fresh fruit notes here â pears, damsons, pineapples!

Name: Benrinnes 13 Year Old 2008 - Bodega Series (Goldfinch Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Citrus oils open the way, balancing hints of warming, savoury spice while stewed stone fruits and syrupy baked goods keep things sweet.
Finish: Creamy barley, nutty oak, and raisins with layers of vanilla caramel, cracked pepper heat, and just a touch of vegetal oak.
Nose: Doughy cookies, studded with chocolate and dried fruit, dustings of cinnamon, and creamy vanilla.

Name: Writers Tears Double Oak
Palate: Juicy white stone fruits, lychee and lemon peel with a hint of grape skin dryness.
Finish: Rich and aromatic spiced dark chocolate.
Nose: Spiced and stewed orchard fruits, lots of sweet and earthy vanilla pod with a side of pear crumble.

Name: Slyrs Single Malt - Port Cask Finish
Palate: Caramel trickles between biscuity barley and summer fruit compote while warming spices and oak gather beneath.
Finish: Plenty to explore with lingering notes of woody clove, ginger, tangy cranberry, and soft stone fruits.
Nose: Hearty malt opens the way with notes of dried red berries, cinnamon, vanilla, and roasted nuts.

Name: Inchgower 10 Year Old 2012 - Hepburn's Choice
Palate: Creamy layers of vanilla and pastry, cooked pear, and dustings of sweet spice.
Finish: Gingerbread, marmalade, and nutty malt.
Nose: Citrus blossom, honeyed nuts, and fresh apple, with oaken vanilla in tow.

Name: Macduff 11 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Plum sweetness, honey and oak spice initially, then nutty brown bread and white chocolate.
Finish: Salted butter, orange peel and a hint of dry white wine linger.
Nose: Pleasantly grassy, with whiffs of orchard fruit, floral barley, a little toffee and charcoal.

Name: Glentauchers 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 85900534) - Duncan Taylor
Palate: Nutty notes of maple and pecan tart, with flaky pastry, boozy sultanas, and candied orange.
Finish: Caramel, barley, dates, and apricot jam, with a dash of peppery spice on the tail.
Nose: Juicy raisins, berries, and a touch of zesty pineapple, with sweet roasted malt.

Name: Glen Grant 1998 (bottled 2021) (cask 13214) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Crunchy yellow apples, more orange brightness, richly malty with hints of chocolate and black pepper.
Finish: Mature oak lasting long on the finish.
Nose: Coffee and walnut cake, molasses, clove, and orange oil.

Name: Gulliverâs 47 Pedro XimÃ©nez Sherry Casks
Palate: Dark fruit cake, dried figs, prunes, cocoa nibs, and some woody spices.
Finish: Sweet spice, and some liquorice.
Nose: Treacle-y spice, with raisings, and candied citrus peel.

Name: Chivas Regal 25 Year Old
Palate: Soft and gentle but it builds with an elegant toffee-like character, very butter. Hints of boiled sweets, aniseed and custard.
Finish: Abrupt, but earthy, with butterscotch on the tail.
Nose: Rich, nutty and thick with notes of malt and berry fruits, hints of liquorice, raspberries and sweet porridge oats.

Name: Linkwood 12 Year Old 2009 Syrah Edition - DS Tayman
Palate: Those berries and red fruits carry through, joined by hearty oak and candied nuts.
Finish: Set honey and maple syrup bring sweetness, with peppery oak offering some warming spice.
Nose: Heaps of baked orchard fruits and red berries, warm malt, and baking spice.

Name: Laphroaig 15 Year Old 2005 (Release No.11680) - The Stories of Wind & Wave (The Character of Islay Whisky Company)
Bottler: The Character of Islay Whisky Company
Palate: Oily malt with more savoury peat, with some sugared almond and juicy apricot notes to balance the salinity.
Finish: Petrichor, peat, and drying oak.
Nose: Tarry ropes, coastal breeze, a smidge of Golden Graham sweetness lingering in the background.

Name: Mannochmore 9 Year Old 2012 (cask 12494) - The Single Cask
Palate: Plump raisin, melted dark chocolate, and wafts of heather.
Finish: Warming oak spice and fig sweetness.
Nose: Dusty cocoa, juicy grapes, floral honey, and peppery spice.

Name: Ardbeg Auriverdes
Palate: Initially sweet, restrained, more of that bacon, but this time itâs been cured with Muscovado sugar and maybe a touch of Juniper? Progresses through the inevitable onslaught of peat, but itâs there in a slightly different way â more âhighâ, medicinal phenols than we've come to expect with Ardbeg. From the palate alone, Iâm not even sure Iâd peg this as Ardbeg â I might be tempted to go two distilleries further down the coastâ¦
Finish: Long. Cocoa, Charred corners of a pulled pork butt, becomes more ashy as it fades, but clearly from good honest casks albeit with charred heads.
Nose: Smoked bacon, Tarry ropes on a not-long-dry seashore. Loads of Vanilla. Pomegranates, Fizzy-sweets (refreshers, Sherbet Lemons) and Lemon-zest. Not convinced Iâd have got Mocha, if not for the autosuggestion, but itâs definitely there now I think about it.

Name: The English - Sherry Butts
Palate: Sticky toffee pudding and fruit studded dark chocolate, bittersweet marmalade followed by nutty caramel.
Finish: Burnt sugar lingers with gentle spice, followed by more dried fruits with dustings of cocoa.
Nose: Figs, dates, sultanas, dark honey, and sweet, cakey malt.

Name: Inchmurrin 11 Year Old (cask 2996) - DrÃ m MÃ²r
Palate: The strength brings prickles of chilli heat and peppercorns before drying kitchen spices and sticky toffee tangle.
Finish: Powerful all the way, a drop of water opens things up, oaken heat and sweet spice remain.
Nose: Custard creams, rusk biscuits, banana chips, peach, apricot, white chocolate buttons.

Name: Catoctin Creek Roundstone Rye Cask Proof
Palate: Peppery spice leads into buttercream icing, oily citrus and oak, with underlying herbals notes.
Finish: Dried fruit and spicy wood lingers alongside rich chocolate.
Nose: CrÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e and Lotus biscuits, with spicy rye and touches of menthol alongside treacle and date sweetness.

Name: Larceny Bourbon
Palate: Buttered corn, molasses, malt loaf, slowly build Christmas spices.
Finish: Peppery at first, though soon enough the fruity coffee notes return and give it a sweet profile.
Nose: Brioche dipped in fruity coffee, cedar, a kick of aromatic coriander.

Name: Auchroisk 7 Year Old 2010 - Parkmore Selection
Palate: Rounded red fruit juxtaposed by rich smoke. Slightly chocolatey at points.
Finish: Freshly cut herbs and a light touch of oak resin.
Nose: Roasted barley and buttered apples, with a whiff of pipe tobacco underneath.

Name: Compass Box Ultramarine - The Extinct Blender Quartet
Palate: Barbeque smoke, with grilled peaches, wattleseed, and spiced fruitcake.
Finish: Spices build, with meaty smoke lingering.
Nose: Gentle wafts of earthy peat, layered with sweet, sherried smoke, drizzles of caramel, and warm oaky vanilla.

Name: Kilnaughton Secret Islay (cask 1154) (bottles 2023) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Oily and coastal, with tarry oak and smoldering embers supported by helpings of honeyed stone fruits and spiced mocha.
Finish: Peat smoke lingers, with a touch of treacle and musty oak.
Nose: Sultanas, coffee grounds, and cocoa are joined by maritime smoke and ash.

Name: Glen Moray 2013 Amontillado Finish - Warehouse 1
Palate: Woody, nutty dryness, with orange curd, and fresh tobacco.
Finish: A distinct leafy green note lingers alongside toasted nuts.
Nose: Praline, oily malt, and cooked apple.

Name: Strathmill 20 Year Old 1997 (cask 4112) - Mackillop's Choice
Palate: Coconut, pistachio ice cream, mint leaf and flaky pastry make for  fascinating palate that also boasts a hint of morello cherries.
Finish: Medium length and a little malty, there's some foam bananas and chilli-chocolate.
Nose: Peach cobbler, dried apple and biscuits are first, straw, dried oak, seedless raisins and honey'd cereal follow.

Name: Spirit of Hven Seven Stars No.3 Phecda
Palate: Werther's Original and sticky cinnamon rolls, with a core of juicy, honey'd barley. Oily on the mid-palate with peppery touches.
Finish: Subtle smoky, salty air lasts on the finish.
Nose: Opens with buttery brioche dipped in dark coffee, with touches of dried apricot in the mix. Leave it for a minute and it develops bold notes of bacon and wood smoke.

Name: Robert Burns Blended Scotch Whisky
Palate: Fruity, notes of custard and warm pastry, more orchard fruit, some tart citrus.
Finish: Apple peels and vanilla spice.
Nose: Fresh, apple peels, some blossom and spice, vanilla cream and juicy pear.

Name: Auchentoshan 13 Year Old 2007 - North Star Spirits
Palate: Orange, lemon, and dried baking fruits, buttery barley, and spicy oak.
Finish: Toffee, malt, wafts of mint chocolate, more citrus, and a rich, spiced finish.
Nose: Zesty citrus peels and sugary fudge, freshly cut grass, and sultanas.

Name: The Legendary Silkie Irish Whiskey
Palate: Runny honey, chocolate digestives, a hint of spicy fruit cake.
Finish: Caramel sticks around on the finish for a good long while.
Nose: Apricot, white grape, clotted cream and buttered hot cross buns.

Name: Bunnahabhain - Skene Whisky
Palate: Still enjoyably vegetal, with rounded barley and vanilla notes balancing it.
Finish: Sweet peat sticks around on the finish.
Nose: Toasted sugar, eucalyptus, baked earth smokiness.

Name: The Glenrothes 12 Year Old - Battlehill (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Roasted nuts and earthy coffee open the way for honeyed raisins and sweet, biscuity barley.
Finish: Baking spice sweetness finishes things off, with a touch of clove, candied orange, and lingering dried fruits.
Nose: Vanilla custard, poached apples, drizzles of caramel, and leathery oak.

Name: Kavalan Concertmaster - Port Cask Finish (50cl)
Palate: Brown sugar mixed with ground cinnamon and white pepper, doused in good Port. A core of white oak warmth.
Finish: Raisins, prunes, strawberry jam and another pinch of tobacco.
Nose: Red grapes and clove, followed by a good whack of vanilla. A little bit of tobacco leaf and cookie dough.

Name: Veuve Goudoulin Single Malt TourbÃ© (Peated)
Palate: Bold barley with creamy oak and toasty, biscuity notes. Peat wafts gently throughout, rounded by vanilla and baked orchard fruits.
Finish: The peat remains to round things off, with more notes of dried fruits, poached apples, and oily oak.
Nose: Gently sweet wisps of peat smoke are carried by honeyed fruit and rich, roasted malt.

Name: The Perspective Series 21 Year Old - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Creamy vanilla builds into distinct oaky tones, alongside both fresh orchard fruit and dried fruit with a drizzle of honey.
Finish: Creamy notes continue into a lengthy finish with a hint of tannic oak and sherry.
Nose: Sherried dried fruits, rich chocolate and a hint of leather, with a generous helping of baking spices.

Name: Tamdhu Quercus Alba Distinction - Release 2
Palate: Plenty of sherry character, with cocoa nibs, berry compote, and drizzles of caramel.
Finish: Chewy dates, and a touch of vanilla.
Nose: Creamy oatcakes, oaky vanilla spice, and a twist of waxy orange peel.

Name: Grant's Triple Wood
Palate: Honey, foam banana, a touch of lemongrass and oak.
Finish: Layers of barley, caramel and toasted marshmallow.
Nose: Toffee, buttered bread, a little cassia and walnut.

Name: Linkwood 14 Year Old 2007 (cask CM276) - The Golden Cask (House of Macduff)
Palate: Sugared shortbread, praline, and biscuity malt open up to heavier baking spices and a touch of vegetal pepper.
Finish: Tangy spice and roasted nuttiness continues with the addition of clove and anise, chocolate Brazil nuts, and peppery oak.
Nose: Floral honey and vanilla lead, with some zesty lemon and sweet orange, nutty malt, and charred oak.

Name: North British 28 Year Old 1994 (cask 300265) - The Whisky Cellar
Palate: Crumbly vanilla fudge, set honey, and butterscotch are joined by layers of leathery old oak and spiced biscuits.
Finish: A touch of cocoa joins toward the finish, with lingering oak and woody spice.
Nose: Honeyed granola leads the way, with a touch of marzipan, vanilla, and cinnamon.

Name: Hinotori 5 Year Old
Palate: Nice biscuits, peach, more vanilla, now with salted caramel helping it along.
Finish: Subtly chocolatey, with gingerbread and oak spiciness.
Nose: Dried apple and pear, almond, vanilla pod, a hint of dry toast.

Name: Auchentoshan 10 Year Old 2010 (cask 700427) Rebels - The Guerilla Casks (Brave New Spirits)
Palate: Soft oak and warm spices, with fragrant grapes, hazelnut, vanilla and stone fruit.
Finish: Long and lingering, with plenty of spice and oak.
Nose: Fragrant leaves, bay and pine, mingle with warm oak, honey and waxy lemon peel from the Marsala.

Name: Benrinnes 14 Year Old 2007 - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Chocolatey malt, plump dried fruit, cocoa, and buttery oak.
Finish: Dried cherry, runny honey, and a hint of red flowers.
Nose: Almond butter, spiced apple crumble, and chai latte.

Name: RÃ¬gh Seamus II 12 Year Old 2008 - Crafted Blend (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Buttered popcorn, caramel sauce, peppery oak, and apricot.
Finish: More boozy dried fruit, creamy grain, and a touch of honey.
Nose: Dates, raisins, prunes, oaky vanilla.

Name: Nation of Scots
Palate: Winter spice and treacle initially, with helpings of more wood smoke, barley and cereal underneath.
Finish: Hints of white pepper linger.
Nose: Creamy toffee, apricot yoghurt and wood smoke lead with touches of heather and vanilla in support.

Name: Macaloneyâs Caledonian (cask 49) - Invermallie Red Wine Barrique
Palate: Barley sugar sweets, blackberries, a touch of treacle, cocoa nibs, and warm spices.
Finish: Fruitcake, and spices building.
Nose: Oaky vanilla, with fresh cherries, a touch of marzipan, and molasses.

Name: Moon Harbour Pier 2
Palate: Black pepper and smoked sea salt, juicy raspberry, oatcakes and chocolate ice cream.
Finish: Red chilli pepper, solid oak, stewed plum.
Nose: Christmas spices (think clove and cinnamon), fresh orange oil, a touch of cherry and slightly burnt bacon.

Name: Tullibardine 11 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Waxy orange and lemon, supple honey and buttered pastries followed by a hint of toasted oak warmth and a prickle of black peppercorn.
Finish: Rock cakes, dried apricot and a hint of bitter pink grapefruit.
Nose: Soft vanilla, white chocolate and maple syrup lead with fresh orange and an underlying touch of cereal.

Name: Mosgaard Single Malt Whisky - Pedro XimÃ©nez Cask Finish (Batch 8)
Palate: Dried fruits galore, backed up by hints of barley and a smidge of new leather.
Finish: Cassia and orange last for ages.
Nose: Honey, orange zest, sweet coffee, and cereal.

Name: Paul John Edited
Palate: Wood spices, a bowl of porridge with honey and then demerara whilst sat beside a fireplace.
Finish: A touch of mocha, oak and perhaps old fashioned liquorice.
Nose: Toasted cereal, big barley and honey notes, Hob Nobs! Slightly vegetal peatiness, lemon and seaweed. Some beach bonfire but the peat isn't overpowering. Malty.

Name: Strathmill 32 Year Old 1990 (cask 19898) - Old Malt Cask (Hunter Laing)
Palate: Grapefruit, herbal tea, and more delicate lemon notes.
Finish: Long and gentle with lingering honey and citrus.
Nose: Floral with honeysuckle and orange blossom, vanilla, and lemon.

Name: Miltonduff 10 Year Old â Batch 7 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Sweet, light and creamy, some lots of peachy fruit.
Finish: Light, fruity and creamy. Itâs a peach Pavlova of a dram.
Nose: Honey, light orange marmalade and vanilla. Gentle.

Name: The Gladstone Axe The Black Axe
Palate: Sweet caramel and delicate, coastal peat smoke, with floral wafts of heather and rich, bold oak.
Finish: Gentle peat rests amongst roasted malt, charred oak and sea breeze.
Nose: Bold malt with wafts of vanilla, toasted oak, and wafts of firewood.

Name: Sailor's Home Caravelle 10 Year Old
Palate: Tangy orange notes up front, supported by creamy oak and earthy liquorice.
Finish: Banana fritters and grassy barley.
Nose: Toasted brown sugar, pineapple, warm malt.

Name: Pure Scot Virgin Oak 43
Palate: Oodles of honey and more barley sugar, spicy gingerbread and fresh orange notes.
Finish: Lengthy, soft and smooth with sweet oak and honey, ever so slightly spiced.
Nose: Sweet and smoky oak, barley sugar, nutmeg spices, zesty citrus and green apple.

Name: East London Liquor Company East London Single Malt 2021
Palate: Caramel, peanuts, damsons, allspice and caraway, some tangy tropical fruit notes appearing after a few moments.
Finish: Oatcakes, orange oil, buttery toffee.
Nose: Cooked orchard fruits and honeyed porridge, with hints of savoury oak and freshly crushed kitchen spices.

Name: Bunnahabhain Smoke & Sherry (cask 717) (bottled 2023) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Candied nuts, chocolate raisins, and dense notes of liquorice and clove support dried fruits, smoked herbs, and spices.
Finish: Sweeter baking spice joins, with mocha and candied orange backed by lingering peat smoke.
Nose: Fragrant pipe smoke, honeyed sultanas, and dates, with rich oak spice and salted chocolate.

Name: Paul John Kanya
Palate: Butterscotch, dried apple chips, waves of honey, freshly-cooked waffles coated in butter.
Finish: Lightly spiced, though notes of maple syrup and apricot remain.
Nose: Peaches in syrup, almond liqueur and a touch of fresh papaya. Creamy vanilla and

Name: Maison Benjamin Kuentz D'un Verre printanier
Palate: Apricot pastries, with peach, apple, shortbread, and some zesty ginger.
Finish: Peppery spice lingers.
Nose: A medley of ripe fruit, gooseberries, plum, and nectarine, with some warm vanilla.

Name: Ledaig 14 Year Old - Founder's Collection (The Whisky Baron)
Palate: Huge helpings of peat, vegetal and grassy to begin, before developing into sooty smoke. A touch of coastal salinity is backed up by crumbly vanilla fudge.
Finish: Charred embers, sweet peat, salted caramel, and soft oak.
Nose: Dense notes of tarmac and smouldering rubber, supported by sweet liquorice and barley water.

Name: Kingâs Inch 7 Year Old Single Cask (cask 53) - Sherry Edition
Palate: Raisins and prunes, with a drizzle of treacle, earthy vanilla, and some clove.
Finish: Warms spices linger along with soft brown sugar.
Nose: Scones slathered with mixed berry jam, and spiced fruitcake.

Name: Pride Of Sponge 28 Year Old 1993 - Edition No.59B (Whisky Sponge & Decadent Drinks)
Palate: Creamy grain, a touch of pencil shavings, flapjacks, and some candied lemon peel.
Finish: Warm woody spice, and barley sugar.
Nose: Malty, with buttered toast, and some Golden Syrup drizzled porridge.

Name: Kavalan Distillery Select
Palate: Rich oak and warming vanilla, mellow lavender honey notes and orchard fruits.
Finish: Lingering stewed fruit, butterscotch and more vanilla.
Nose: Sweet aromas of tropical fruit, namely mango and banana, buttery caramel with a floral undertone.

Name: Linkwood 9 Year Old 2012 - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Dustings of cocoa join buttery shortbread and creamy malt, with candied fruit and jammy currants bolstered by dense baking spice.
Finish: Honeyed sweetness lingers while juicy oak and marmalade counter wintery spice.
