Nose: Gooey flapjack, loaded with dried berries and raisins, a touch of dried apple, and candied ginger.

Name: J.G. Thomson Sweet Blended Malt
Palate: Brown sugar, maple syrup on pancakes, orchard fruit, and a little hint of roasted almond.
Finish: Coconut ice, marzipan, and malt.
Nose: Toffee apples, lemon drops, custard cream biscuits, and a touch of cinnamon.

Name: Fettercairn 28 Year Old
Palate: Fizzing black pepper and espresso bitterness add depth to notes of roasted chestnuts, dried apricots and sharp citrus. Honeyed raisins and chopped oak are present too.
Finish: Sticky licks of toffee and lime zest linger.
Nose: A sumptuous blend of tropical fruits, black treacle and fiery ginger arise initially, with sugared peels and black liquorice underneath.

Name: Cotswolds Sherry Cask Single Malt Whisky
Palate: Flamed orange peel, fruit and nut dark chocolate, cherry jam, and a touch of vanilla ice cream.
Finish: Black pepper balances heaps of dried berries.
Nose: Toasted (and slightly burnt) fruitcake, with stewed, spiced apple, brown sugar, and candied ginger.

Name: Teaninich 11 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Candied fruit and baking spice initially, before sugared almond, green apple and golden syrup emerge.
Finish: Toffee and lingering citrus notes.
Nose: Thereâs a lovely ripe grain element here that moves into fresh soda bread. Supple lemon citrus notes then develop among dry grass and vanilla.

Name: Flaming Pig Black Cask
Palate: BBQ pineapple and mango develop on the palate. Still quite chocolatey.
Finish: Peaches in syrup, nutmeg and toffee.
Nose: Hot chocolate and strong tea, with toasted brioche underneath.

Name: Monsieur Balthazar Hedgehog
Palate: More baked goodies, with clove, cinnamon, caramel corn, and warm oak.
Finish: Peppery spice, with toasted brioche.
Nose: Fresh baked cookies, brown sugar, vanilla, some orange peel, and a touch of wood polish.

Name: Annandale Man OâSword Vintage 2016 - Bourbon Cask (cask 546)
Palate: Honeycomb and peppery spice, with barbecued meats, and oaky vanilla.
Finish: The smoke lingers, along with some cloves and white pepper.
Nose: Charred tropical fruit, with savoury smoke developing.

Name: Ardbeg Traigh Bhan 19 Year Old - Batch 2
Palate: An intensely salty mouthfeel shifts like the tides into soothing medicinal notes, followed by salted peanut brittle, smoked pineapple and lime juice. Waves of aniseed lap over the palate, before rich fudge, birch tar and peat smoke crash down wildly. This is a dram that coaxes you in, and all assumptions are best left behind. Simply let this alluring spirit surprise and delight.
Finish: Savoury and smoky notes collide in a sharp, intense, yet satisfyingly long finish.
Nose: On the nose, faint ripples of sweet wood smoke and tart crÃ¨me fraÃ®che flow gently into bold notes of savoury fennel, celeriac and roasted tea leaves. Plunge further and discover alluring aromas of charcoal and lightly burnt toast. A splash of water releases a gust of fresh sea spray, followed by eucalyptus oil and pine. Finally, this irresistible nose ends with an unmistakable top note of saddle soap and leather.

Name: Kings County Peated Bourbon
Palate: Smoked brisket, coffee cake, and stem ginger join the aforementioned aromas.
Finish: Wood ash, cinnamon, chocolate, and blackcurrant.
Nose: Wood embers breathe through vanilla, toasted spices, and dark fruit.

Name: Bimber Apogee XII 12 Year Old
Palate: Peaches in syrup, crushed peppercorns, menthol, a hint of warming cedar.
Finish: Crunchy pear and a smidge of lemon, with layers of caramel.
Nose: Nutmeg, honeycomb, brown sugar, soft oak, cooked orchard fruits.

Name: Teaninich 2007 (bottled 2022) (cask 1903083) - Christmas Edition (Berry Bros. & Rudd)
Palate: Zesty marmalade and more sweet honeyed fruit lead to spiced biscuits, raisins, and toasted nuts.
Finish: Figs, dates, and nuts continue, joined by hearty oak spice and charred marzipan.
Nose: Creamy praline and apricot jam lead the way, with honeyed walnut bread and ginger biscuits.

Name: Blair Athol 8 Year Old 2014 (cask 312607) - Lady of the Glen (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Stone fruit, honey and orange blossom with sweeter notes of caramel and vanilla.
Finish: Sweet fudge notes on the finish with a dusting of cinnamon
Nose: Sweet nose with cereal notes, toffee and lemon peel.

Name: Boulder Bottled in Bond Straight Bourbon Whiskey
Palate: Drizzles of caramel mingle with allspice, warm vanilla, and toasted oak.
Finish: Peppery spice and gentle sweetness linger.
Nose: Buttery flapjacks, oaky vanilla, and sprinkles of pepper and baking spices.

Name: Waterford Single Farm Origin - Sheestown 1.2
Palate: Rounded barley and vanilla, supported by subtle fruity hints and a kick of caraway.
Finish: Butterscotch and cantaloupe remain.
Nose: Cinnamon and black pepper, with lighter hints of cooked pears.

Name: Bruichladdich 1985/32 - Hidden Glory
Palate: Coconut ice cream with chocolate sauce, plum grapes, oak-y cinnamon and waxy pine.
Finish: A lingering sweetness of peach and pear.
Nose: Honey'd barley dusted with cacao. Fresh orange and lime, plus a little hint of honeydew melon. A suggestion of savoury basil...

Name: Spirit of Hven Hvenus Rye Whisky
Palate: Smooth, strong vanilla notes, dark berries and toffee, fading into malty notes, rich dark chocolate and sweet, floral lavender.
Finish: Mint returns alongside vanilla, with gentle sweet spices.
Nose: Vanilla at the fore, with a slight pepper spiciness, freshly cut grass and a little menthol.

Name: Black Bottle
Palate: Candied ginger and cigar box, with charred herbs, chocolate spread on brown bread and a drizzle of golden syrup.
Finish: Oak spice and honey.
Nose: Polished oak and porridge with a sprinkle of brown sugar, with cut grass and very subtle smoke in support.

Name: The Macallan Classic Cut (2020 Release)
Palate: Chocolate-coated ginger, vanilla creaminess, and peppery oak.
Finish: A wave of fresh garden herbs brings a savoury nuance to an otherwise citrusy finish.
Nose: Orange curd, plump dried fruit, heather honey, and a touch creamy.

Name: Akashi MeÃ¯sei Deluxe Sherry Cask Finish
Palate: Mellow oak brings drying spice, countered by prunes and candied nuts. Toffee creeps, with hints of cinnamon, and buttery vanilla.
Finish: Candied fruits, figs, and dates join, with a dusting of cocoa, and more woody spice.
Nose: White chocolate, honey drizzled fruit, orange oil, and chocolate raisins.

Name: Kavalan Concertmaster - Port Cask Finish
Palate: Brown sugar mixed with ground cinnamon and white pepper, doused in good Port. A core of white oak warmth.
Finish: Raisins, prunes, strawberry jam and another pinch of tobacco.
Nose: Red grapes and clove, followed by a good whack of vanilla. A little bit of tobacco leaf and cookie dough.

Name: Culdrain 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 9635499) - The Octave (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Toasted brown sugar, marmalade, tart red fruit, and a whiff of cigar box.
Finish: Fruit and nut dark chocolate.
Nose: Candied citrus peels, apricot jam, and spiced nuts.

Name: Deanston Kentucky Cask Matured
Palate: Peppery spice and creamy barley tangle, with buttered toast and hints of green oak.
Finish: Stone fruits with drizzles of runny honey, mellow vanilla, and delicate oak.
Nose: Toffee and toasted oak are followed by honeyed fruits and vanilla pod.

Name: Benriach Smoky Quarter Cask (1L)
Palate: Vanilla tablet and more cooked stone fruit, with sweet layers of smoke and oak, chocolate hazelnuts, and praline.
Finish: Things remain nutty on the finish with mellow peat bringing soft smoke and crackles of earthen pepper.
Nose: Delicate wisps of bonfire smoke, poached pear, and grilled apricot, with juicy, smoky barley in tow.

Name: Dailuaine 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 307385 & 307386) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Dry touches of smoke and malt, with orange peel and a little brown sugar for balance.
Finish: Peppery on the finish, with a hint of creamy oak.
Nose: Herbal crackers with a hint of salted butter, roast walnuts, some fruity sweetness along the way.

Name: Mannochmore 13 Year Old 2008 - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Rich roasted barley brings notes of caramelised nuts and creamy praline, bolstered by hearty helpings of stewed stone fruits.
Finish: Hints of herbal tea arrive on the finish alongside sweet baking spices, nutty chocolate, and cooked apple.
Nose: Sweet, zesty marmalade, drying clove, and buttery apple pastries, with hints of earthen vanilla pod in the distance.

Name: The Cashly (Sons of Scotland) (Third Release)
Palate: Crisp apples, with oaky vanilla, and lemon curd.
Finish: Green pepper spice and warming ginger.
Nose: Sweet hay, with some heather honey, and orchard fruits.

Name: Wolfburn Batch No.458
Palate: Nuts galore, almonds and hazelnuts mingle with pungent smoke, dried fruit, treacle and spices.
Finish: Sweetness and smoke linger on.
Nose: Rich and sweet-smelling with baking spices, molasses, espresso, dark cherries and a hint of bonfire.

Name: Hellyers Road 15 Year Old Original
Palate: Apricot jam, ripe stone fruit, almond butter, and white grape.
Finish: Orchard fruit, a touch of cream, and sultanas.
Nose: Melted chocolate, lemon blossom, and Lotus biscuits.

Name: Ardbeg Blasda
Palate: By what alchemy is it possible for something to be both so creamy and spiced so? Thereâs a lovely herbal development and all the time the sweetness of vanilla and peppermint creams with the semi medicinal undertones of Resolve hangover cure.
Finish: The minty sweetness of the peppermint creams with an interesting little development of sticking plasters. Comment: It still retains the distillery character. But, whilst a very good whisky, this is not a very good Ardbeg...
Nose: Chocolate Ã©clair sweets and dry coastal driftwood, toffee and refreshers sweets with but a hint of gentle smoke. Despite these dangerously low levels of peat, this is still characteristically Ardbeg.

Name: Laphroaig Cairdeas Fino Cask Finish - FÃ¨is Ãle 2018
Palate: Nectarines and apricots arrive first, shortly followed burnt caramel and flamed orange peel. Another whiff of heavy peat and savoury oak.
Finish: Baked earth, iodine, honey, peaches and cream boiled sweeties.
Nose: Burnt grass, almond butter, toasted teacakes and medicinal peat.

Name: High West Rendezvous Rye (70cl)
Palate: Oak spices, pepper and even some chillies. Needles to say, it's rather spicy. Deep inside you'll find a little treasure cove of sweetness, but then it's back to the savoury notes from the nose.
Finish: The heat continues from the palate (how could it not?) with fresh oak and tea leaves.
Nose: Rustic notes of oak and fruit, a little menthol. Slightly grassy, followed by sweeter notes of toffee and classic vanilla.

Name: Bruichladdich The Organic 2011
Palate: Caramelised orchard fruit combines with creamy vanilla and lemon peel.
Finish: Sweet and supple.
Nose: Delicate floral notes drift through butterscotch, citrus, and some oak spice.

Name: Sweetdram Blend #1
Palate: Vanilla and more chocolate, with a slow build of dried fruit, and a smidge of singed hay.
Finish: Aromatic oak lasts.
Nose: Nutty malt, honeycomb, a delicate hint of toasted oak, slightly chocolatey.

Name: Stauning Bastard
Palate: Dried peels and candied ginger, pepperkaker, vegetal oak, brown sugar.
Finish: More citrus, now with the subtle smoke from the nose returning.
Nose: Softly smoky, with cinder toffee and warm sawdust underneath.

Name: Craigellachie 10 Year Old - Derestricted
Palate: Subtle chocolate, with more warming oatmeal notes continuing. Cooked apples and plums. Slightly earthy at points.
Finish: Nice biscuits, black pepper, pine nuts, brown sugar.
Nose: Dry cereals, hay, oatmeal with coconut flakes, toasted cedar, old dunnage warehouses, with fruity hints of pear drops and grapefruit developing in the glass.

Name: Cortoisie Exhalation
Palate: Fresh, sweet malt, with more cooked red fruit, salty smoke and baking spices.
Finish: A crack of black pepper and smoky cigar box lingers.
Nose: Red fruit, plum skin and ripe apple, with a whiff of smoke alongside.

Name: Peat's Beast
Palate: A beach barbecue... salt and kippers, a bit of butter and hot pepper spice. Water brings out some of those lighter apple and banana notes but again the phenols are the main event here.
Finish: This lasts for ages with ash, dark chocolate and pepper riding out over an oily base.
Nose: Crashing waves, wood smoke, ash and tar. A hint of apple and citrus but the peat, unsurprisingly, dominates.

Name: Craigellachie 14 Year Old - Canmore
Palate: Still creamy with fresh notes of crisp apple and sweet, tropical fruit. Buttery barley brings subtle vegetal notes, with earthy oak spice and cocoa following on.
Finish: Spiced biscuits, milky mocha, and honeyed fruits linger.
Nose: Baked apples with a dash of cinnamon, buttered malt loaf, banana, and creamy vanilla.

Name: Annandale Man OâSword Vintage 2016 - Sherry Cask (cask 541)
Palate: Soft smoke is joined by vanilla fudge and warm cinnamon.
Finish: Smoke lingers, with caramel covered nuts.
Nose: Rich and fruity, with spiced mince pies, and some toasty oak.

Name: Beinn Dubh The Black
Palate: Almost like cold coffee with dark brown sugar, vanilla and dried fruit.
Finish: Toffee and chocolate malt.
Nose: Caramel, toasty, soy, walnut and burnt raisins.

Name: Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Rye
Palate: Light oak spices develop first, alongside another helping of corn sweetness. Ripe apricot and orange.
Finish: Lingering peppery warmth.
Nose: Hazelnut and almond, spicy grain and an underlying hint of corn.

Name: Glencadam 16 Year Old 2005 (cask 1) - Pedro Ximenez Sherry Butt
Palate: Fruit crumble and warm pecan pie, with sweet tobacco and gingerbread.
Finish: Long and fruity with hints of coffee.
Nose: Juicy raisins, stewed plum, milk chocolate, and charred oak.

Name: Compass Box The Circle
Palate: Tarte tatin and vanilla cream, with lots of sweet malt and cinnamon.
Finish: A suggestion of smoke, oak spice, floral malt and vanilla pod.
Nose: Barley sugar, fresh stone fruits, crisp apple skin, ginger spice and vanilla fudge.

Name: J.G. Thomson Blended Grain 1972
Palate: Hazelnut spread and brioche, buttery shortbread, bubble gum sweetness, and a dusting of cinnamon.
Finish: Fudge, tropical fruit, and gingerbread.
Nose: Vanilla pod, orange peels, malt loaf, brown sugar, a hint of mahogany.

Name: The Arngibbon (Sons of Scotland)
Palate: Oily malt, vanilla fudge, and warming oak. Malty oak and soft butter tablet
Finish: Buttery oak and a helping of woody vanilla pod.
Nose: Vanilla sponge and buttercream, along with fresh nectarine, and heather honey.

Name: Dalmore 1974
Palate: Soft. White peach, apricot, orange zest, chocolate. Dried peels, nutty, anise, turmeric, pepper.
Finish: Chocolate, fruit salad, sherry, nutty and oily.
Nose: Well balanced, smoke, spice with crushed black pepper. Freshly cut fruits; orange, honeydew melon and pomegranate, malt.

Name: Launceston 5 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Sweet, spiced notes of banana bread, drizzled with caramel. Superbly creamy, with a hint of herbaceous malt resting in the depths.
Finish: Waves of vanilla arrive toward the finish, things remain creamy with elegant oak char and a medley of baking spice.
Nose: Pancakes with maple syrup, pineapple fritters with soft vanilla ice cream, and a hint of vegetal oak.

Name: Spirit of 1966 Whisky
Palate: A touch of red fruit creeps in, alongside rich honey, bold malt, and a peppering of ginger.
Finish: Woody vanilla, rich baked fruit, and sweet butterscotch balance warming oak with lingering spice.
Nose: Fruity notes of pineapple in syrup, floral peach and gentle oaken spice.

Name: Charcoal & Cornmeal & Rickhouses & a Decade 10 Year Old
Palate: Peanut brittle, brioche dipped in coffee, a crackle of nutmeg and black pepper. Just a smidge of raspberry in there too.
Finish: Buttered popcorn, liquorice, cooked apple, a softly sweet spiciness sticks around.
Nose: Freshly baked oatmeal raisin cookies, treacle tarts, brown butter, a few hints of pine resin and charred oak before returning to vanilla fudge sweetness.

Name: Blair Athol 13 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: Toasted marzipan, crumbly fudge, baking spice, and dustings of cocoa powder.
Finish: Lingering Christmas spices and a touch of cranberry sweetness.
Nose: Marmalade, clove, sultana, and dark chocolate.

Name: The Macallan Forties
Palate: White chocolate, almond, a few touches of fino sherry.
Finish: Apple, basil leaf, cinnamon.
Nose: Caramel, dusty oak, slightly herbaceous.

Name: New Riff Straight Rye
Palate: Cinnamon butter and orange oil, with a wave of spicy rye, toasty oak and woody spices.
Finish: Grassy hints of continued spices alongside brown sugar and dark chocolate.
Nose: Orange peel, fresh herbs and vanilla oak, with berry jam and a crack of pepper.

Name: Amrut Triparva
Palate: Fresh fruit salad, grilled banana and malted milk biscuits, caramel sauce over vanilla ice cream, apricots, barley and creamy toasted oak.
Finish: Sweet, tropical honey, banana fritters, coconut cream, and malty oak char.
Nose: Sweet butterscotch and tropical fruit, zesty orange peel, and oaky vanilla.

Name: The Macallan Boutique Collection (2019 Release)
Palate: Initially sweet and fruity with orange oil and oak spices.
Finish: Medium sweet with a lingering oak and fruit finish.
Nose: Sweet dried fruit is balanced with mature oak, warming ginger and nutmeg with hints of dark chocolate and vanilla.

Name: Glentauchers 14 Year Old 2008 (cask 289) - The Whisky Cellar
Palate: Fresh orchard fruits,  with notes of floral honey and creamy barley.
Finish: Honey and nutmeg linger.
Nose: Buttery toasted oak, sweet peaches, soft vanilla shortbread, and gentle lemon zest.

Name: Skara Brae 16 Year Old 2005 (cask 23) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Spiced porridge, oily malt, and bittersweet marmalade, with a savoury, smoky sea breeze.
Finish: Clove-studded orange, salted caramel, and beach bonfire smoke.
Nose: Singed heather, waxy citrus peels, and burnt digestive biscuits.

Name: The Oxford Artisan Distillery Rye Whisky - The Tawny Pipe
Palate: Silky caramel, with spiced apple compote, chewy dates, and prunes.
Finish: Peppery rye spice builds, with delicate meadow herbs.
Nose: Plenty of red fruits, juicy blackberries, dried figs, with sticky malt loaf and nutty grist.

Name: Benriach The Thirty
Palate: Dark fruit, manuka honey and chocolate raisin, with a long and complex smoked honey finish.
Finish:
Nose: Stewed plum, baked orange, smoked walnut and cinnamon cocoa.
Palate: Dark fruit, manuka honey and chocolate raisin, with a long and complex smoked honey finish.
Nose: Stewed plum, baked orange, smoked walnut and cinnamon cocoa.

Name: Kings County Straight Bourbon
Palate: Brioche, nutmeg, and corn-on-the-cob smothered in salted butter.
Finish: Long and robust.
Nose: Wintery spice prickles through caramel, vanilla, and toasted oak.

Name: The Macallan Edition No.5
Palate: Nuttier on the palate, with walnut and macadamia nut appearing as it opens. Continues on to orchard fruits, honeycomb and a kick of oaky black pepper.
Finish: Butterscotch, cedar and lemon.
Nose: Toffee apple, poached pair, savoury hints of sage. Flashes of clean citrus notes.

Name: Ledaig 17 Year Old 2005 (cask 900043) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: More earthy peat, with marmalade, creamy porridge, and oaky vanilla.
Finish: Warming, nutty, and smoky.
Nose: Light fruit cake, with layers of smoke, and some tropical fruit.

Name: Rozelieures Tourbe Collection
Palate: Very chocolately with sea salt, raisin, treacle tart, and fresh herbs.
Finish: Bonfire embers linger with citrus zest.
Nose: Woodsmoke leads with apple turnover, Shreddies, and ginger in support.

Name: Amrut Neidhal
Palate: On the palate, it is fruit cocktail and mesmerising phenols with a touch of iodine.
Finish: The middle ground is an essay in chewability and a finish that is phenolic with a touch of sweet vanilla.
Nose: Notes of tropical fruits, vanilla punctuated by soft phenols and above all sea salt on the nose.

Name: Longrow CV
Palate: Spicy, peaty, hints of lemon zest, cutting lime, toffee, lots of oily smoke.
Finish: Long, peaty, spicy oak driven finish.
Nose: Smoke, cut fennel, spearmint, grass. Peat, touch of the coast.

Name: Benchmark Bourbon Old Number 8
Palate: A creamy spirit carrying custard, toffee apple and biscuity notes.
Finish: Cinnamon, chocolate digestives and tangerine.
Nose: Aromatic and quite sweet. Soft toasty spices, salted caramel and vanilla pod earthiness.

Name: Strathdearn Fruity & Spicy Sherry Finish - Cask Craft (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Oily malt, pain au raisin, candied orange peel, and black pepper.
Finish: Silky praline, plump raisin, and butterscotch.
Nose: Sticky spiced fruitcake, toasted nuts, a touch of balsamic, and cherry jam.

Name: Strathclyde 27 Year Old 1990 (cask 110036) - Revival (The Higginbottom)
Palate: Pear drops, icing sugar, cedar and jam doughnuts.
Finish: Slightly floral, though brown sugar notes keep it sweet.
Nose: Waxy orange, heavy vanilla and a hint of treacle.

Name: Yushan Signature Bourbon Cask
Palate: Smooth caramel, vanilla pod and lime zest, with a good spicy peppery note.
Finish: A burst of tangerine citrus on the finish with a helping of nutmeg.
Nose: Floral honey, peaches and cream, vanilla and buttery apple turnover pastry.

Name: Gulliverâs 47 10 Year Old
Palate: Oak char and wood smoke, with hints of ground almond, earthy vanilla pod and cooked cherry.
Finish: A dry finish of smoke, spices, and dark berries.
Nose: Honeyed baking spices, candied ginger and earthy smoke running through, with cooked red fruit.

Name: Bunnahabhain 1998 Calvados Cask Finish - FÃ¨is Ãle 2022
Palate: Sweet and fruity, lots of green apple and pear candies. Some signature cereal, oily notes of Bunnahabhain and more toffee mixed with dried fruits.
Finish: Spicy powerful then floral on the palate.
Nose: Barley sugar, pear drops, toffee apples. Followed by a burst of dates and a floral top note like conifer trees.

Name: Smokin' - The Gentlemanâs Dram
Palate: More peat smoke, black pepper and salted butter. Chewy.
Finish: Guess what? It's smoky! Fading, sticky barbecue sauce, sweet peat smoke and pepper.
Nose: It's smoky alright. Plenty of peat smoke alongside thick, barbecue marinade and wood smoke, burnt sugar and more medicinal stuff. Crikey!

Name: Airem Blue Edition
Palate: Silky PX sweetness, with plenty of raisins, cinnamon, warm oak, and more toasted nuts.
Finish: Long and lingering, with warms spices, and dried apricot.
Nose: Spiced fruitcake, toasted hazelnuts, and sweet, sherry character.

Name: Alfred Giraud Heritage
Palate: Fresh pear, brandied cherry and candied fruit, with a hint of oak spice.
Finish: A dusting of icing sugar, alongside pear drops and toasty oak.
Nose: Vanilla orchid, fresh oak and some white grape in there too.

Name: Rozelieures Origine Collection
Palate: Rich and sumptuous, with glacÃ© cherries, oily orange peel, and cigar box.
Finish: Nutty, spiced, and very slightly smoky.
Nose: Ripe orchard fruit, frangipane, and slightly burnt toast.

Name: Mackmyra Moment â Virvelvind
Palate: Orange notes persist, with toffee and vanilla in tow. A hint of smoky spice grows in the background.
Finish: Drying oak touches and a smidge of rum-soaked raisin.
Nose: Brown sugar with a touch of toastiness, a flash of citrus peel, soft smoke, pear drops.

Name: Royal Brackla 8 Year Old 2014 (cask 26) - Cask Collection (A.D. Rattray)
Palate: Tart blackcurrants, gingerbread, vanilla, red wine-stained oak, and brown sugar.
Finish: Long and drying.
Nose: Red berries, smoked herbs, orange peel, and buttery pastries.

Name: The Epicurean Rivesaltes Finish
Palate: Fresh oranges and lemons, followed by dried fruits like prunes, dates and apricots, rich chocolate and citrus peel.
Finish: Nut city, hazelnuts and almonds. Long and creamy.
Nose: Sweetly honeyed with pear drops, oats and dried fruit.

Name: The English - Wine Cask Matured
Palate: Liquorice root, raspberry jam, very slightly chocolatey, layers of caramel and vanilla.
Finish: Peppery malt appears on the finish.
Nose: Stewed red berries and fresh cream, followed by cinnamon, ginger and cedar.

Name: The Whistler 5 Year Old Bodega Cask
Palate: Sweet fruitcake, with baking spices, silky vanilla, and some toasted walnuts.
Finish: Sherry sweetness lingers.
Nose: Dried apricots and raisins, alongside some spiced teacake, and oak character.

Name: Deerstalker Highland Edition
Palate: Heavy vanilla and malt, joined by touches of waxy fruit.
Finish: A touch of menthol peeks out from behind buttery pastry and savoury cooking spices.
Nose: Cherry bakewells, oily barley leading towards subtle oak-y smoke wafts.

Name: Langatun Old Crow
Palate: Smoky and salty, red wine and dark chocolate.
Finish: Long and lingering notes of sweet smoke, tobacco, dark chocolate and peanut butter.
Nose: Bonfires, tobacco and peat with a hint of heather.

Name: Wolfburn Poppy Scotland
Palate: The vanilla continues with crumbly fudge and festive wafts of sherried spice. Candied orange and dried fruits tangle with nutty malt.
Finish: Silky honey, more floral fruit, and caramel, with bold barley and oak char bringing warming spice.
Nose: Sweet, oaken vanilla with floral heather followed by denser notes of stone fruits and chocolate nuts.

Name: The Dalmahoy Deluxe (Adelphi)
Palate: Orange peel, oily hops, brown sugar sweetness and creamy smoke.
Finish: Diced almond, more crunchy brown sugar notes and dusty oak.
Nose: Soft cedar with touches of fresh peach developing later on.

Name: Batch Innovations Burnt Malt Whisky
Palate: Sherried fruits open things up, with liquorice, cinnamon, and a touch of ginger. Sweet caramel balances charred oak and delicate peat smoke.
Finish: Vanilla brings a fudgy sweetness whilst more orchard fruits and smoky embers linger.
Nose: Softly spiced currant buns, crisp apple, and biscuity malt.

Name: Kamet Single Malt
Palate: Vanilla, dark chocolate, and stewed fruit as well as nutmeg and cedar spice.
Finish: Orange curd and cinnamon.
Nose: Dried fruits and oaky spice are joined by notes of toffee and crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e.

Name: Spirit of Hven Seven Stars No.2 Merak
Palate: Spiced up front, crushed black pepper and cinnamon joined by oily barley. It slowly turns sweet and juicy with a hint of citrus peels.
Finish: Smoke lasts and lasts on the finish.
Nose: Candy apple and red fruit sweetness, followed by dark cherries, ginger and creamy vanilla. A drop of water unlocks some peaty smoke deep within.

Name: Glann Ar Mor French Single Malt
Palate: Malt-forward initially, followed by fresh garden herbs, golden plum, and cinnamon.
Finish: A creamy finish supported by ripe pineapple.
Nose: Floral honey, pear skin, salted lemon peel, and oaky vanilla.

Name: Dalmore 27 Year Old 1990 (cask 89) - Rare Select (Montgomerie's)
Palate: Almonds and walnuts, with more chocolatey notes coming through. New leather and more mature oak.
Finish: Slightly floral on the finish.
Nose: Polished oak, chilli chocolate and roasted coffee beans. A touch of vanilla pod sweetness.

Name: Old Perth 1996 Vintage Collection
Palate: Baked apple and pear, alongside peaches, apricots, and dates. Baking spice warmth creeps in, with just a whiff of candle wax and soft peat smoke.
Finish: Cinnamon, ginger, charred oak and soft smoke, sultanas, and jammy berries.
Nose: All the stewed fruits, topped with boozy raisins. Rich, malty oak.

Name: Monsieur Balthazar Aumance
Palate: Dried apricots, meringue, some milk chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Finish: Spices build alongside creamy cereal notes.
Nose: Drizzles of caramel, with praline, toasted marzipan, and oaky spices.

Name: Woven Experience No.11
Palate: Super fruity on the palate, lemons and limes with orange peel,
Finish: Vanilla, peach and subtle dried fruit notes.
Nose: Tropical fruits, stone fruit and limes with subtle cereal and malt notes.

Name: Alfred Giraud Voyage
Palate: More sweet honey joins layers of orchard blossom and a hint of woody rooibos tea. Bold spices build beneath, with silky butterscotch in tow.
Finish: Rich wood spice lingers, bolstered by a pinch of pepper and balanced by more sweet, floral malt.
Nose: Delicately floral notes of jasmine, flaky pastry, and honeyed sultanas, supported by creamy vanilla and vinous fruit.

Name: Mossburn Signature Casks Series No.2
Palate: Buttery malt and toasted teacakes, with touches of chocolate chip cookie dough.
Finish: Subtle hoppy bitterness followed by oat biscuits.
Nose: Floral vanilla, dried cherries, orange oil and hints of pineapple.

Name: Rozelieures Rare Collection
Palate: Candied peels, toasted malt, chewy dried fruits, and wood smoke.
Finish: Wisps of smoke linger, alongside blackberry jam on toast.
Nose: Tinned pears, floral honey, marmalade, and mixed nuts.

Name: Peerless Single Barrel Bourbon
Palate: Dried fruit, cherries, and orange peel are joined by clove, cardamom, and black pepper.
Finish: Chocolate, honey-roasted nuts, and old leather.
Nose: Barbecue rub, red chilli earthiness, and herbaceous mint are joined by peanut butter, caramel, and vanilla.

Name: The Epicurean Amarone Wine Cask Finish
Palate: Sweet and spicy, with a medley of red berries and some warm oak throughout.
Finish: Peppery spice builds, with a touch of espresso.
Nose: Cocoa nibs, cherries, acai berries, with warm ginger and cinnamon.

Name: Dewar's Double Double 27 Year Old
Palate: Silky layers of creamy caramel and runny honey mingle with hints of smoked tea, backed up by rich cedar and citrus peel.
Finish: Cinnamon and caramel linger, accompanied by more honeyed stone fruit and elegant, leathery oak.
Nose: Soft notes of apricot and vanilla fudge are backed up by fragrant tobacco, dried spice, and a hint of leather.

Name: Bell's Original
Palate: Quite smooth, medium body. Barley and cereals with nut oils, hints of wood and spice.
Finish: Short with notes of fruitcake and smoke.
Nose: Quite soft and gentle. Malted barley and hints of cut herbs and a fresh floral note. Cereal and grist with a little honey.

Name: Peg Whisky Limited Edition II
Palate: Creamy vanilla custard, lemon curd, and almond croissants progress to prickly, peppery spice.
Finish: Further, lingering pepper spice, plenty of oak char, just a waft of peat and smoky firewood.
Nose: Soft caramel, fresh lemons, sweet vanilla, and drying wood.

Name: The Epicurean Edinburgh Edition
Palate: Underripe, crisp orchard fruits, with lime peel, oak spice and toasted oats.
Finish: A zesty finish with lemon curd and honey.
Nose: Apple crumble, barley sugar and green apple skin.

Name: Glencadam 25 Year Old
Palate: Nutty with starfruit, more citrus and red berries.
Finish: Honeyed oak and dark spices.
Nose: Malt and leather, crushed nuts, resin, touch of acetone and citrus.

Name: The Johnny Hepp Whisky Alsacien
Palate: Tinned plums in syrup, more pear, tart underripe berries and a burst of grape, with citrus peel and cardamom.
Finish: Spicy oak, fresh hay and green leafy notes.
Nose: Floral peony, underripe pear, vanilla oak and candied orange, with sawdust aromas and lots of aromatic baking spice.

Name: Dailuaine 6 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Toffee apples and red berries, with a good kick of cinnamon and more ginger.
Finish: Toasty and warming, with spices continuing from the palate.
Nose: Toasted teacakes, salted butter, gingerbread, and candle wax.

Name: Royal Brackla 15 Year Old - Founder's Collection (The Whisky Baron)
Palate: Poached apples and pears, with drizzles of dark caramel, silky vanilla, and a touch of leather.
Finish: Old books, and drying oak.
Nose: Floral honey, with some toasted hazelnut, potpourri, and oaky spice.

Name: Aberlour Triple Cask
Palate: Now it's Jammy Dodgers a tea rather than Custard Creams and coffee! Underlying black pepper heat and a touch of honey.
Finish: Dried fruit and peanut butter notes.
Nose: Custard Cream biscuits, milky coffee and strawberries.

Name: Lord Randolph Oxford Malt Whisky
Palate: Citrus returns, with orange milk chocolate, dry oak and heather honey.
Finish: Floral malt and lemon shortbread.
Nose: A hint of dry spice, with lemon blossom, fresh malt, digestive biscuits and a touch of caramel.

Name: Benriach Smoke Season
Palate: Thyme honey, scorched bread, ash, fresh lemon zest, another hint of tropical fruit.
Finish: Lingering smoke and porridge with lots of brown sugar.
Nose: Cinder toffee, BBQ-charred pineapple, dry smoke with a touch of peppercorn.

Name: Coastal Stone Bourbon Cask - Element Series
Palate: Apple pie, oak spices, and acacia honey are accompanied by touches of desiccated coconut.
Finish: Salted caramel and cinnamon linger.
Nose: Buttered caramel coats orchard fruit and hints of leather.

Name: Waterford Argot CuvÃ©e
Palate: Layers of dried tropical fruit, with with sweet barbecue smoke, powdered ginger, allspice, and salted caramel.
Finish: Distant bonfires, and peppery spice.
Nose: A good mixture of fruits, and grassy freshness, with some sweet notes of treacle tart.

Name: Spirit of Hven Stjerneborg
Palate: More red berry notes, with a hint of red wine richness. Malty honey, soft coastal smoke, and a touch of chcoolate.
Finish: Hints of cocoa and candied peels.
Nose: Poached pear and raspberry jam on well-toasted bread, plus herbaceous hints of lemongrass and blackberry leaf.

Name: The Kurayoshi Sherry Cask
Palate: Sultana and honeyed bread, with a lingering touch of ground ginger.
Finish: Crunchy brown sugar, stewed pears and blueberries.
Nose: Walnuts and chocolate peanuts, with a touch of cranberry.

Name: Whisky Row Smooth & Sweet
Palate: Waxy peels and lemon curd alongside toasty oak and a drizzle of silky caramel.
Finish: Apple crumble and custard lingers.
Nose: Pear skin and vanilla cream, leading into toasted spices and fudge.

Name: Ardray 2023 Release
Palate: Custard Cream biscuits, green apple, and apricot yogurt with oak char and spice.
Finish: Subtle floral notes with orchard fruits.
Nose: Gentle floral aromas, orange peel, creamy vanilla, and cinnamon.

Name: Big Mouth
Palate: Honeyed barley, cut grass and roasted peanuts form a core. Peat smoke is more prominent among a suggestion of citrus and a crackle of peppercorn.
Finish: A pinch of white pepper lingers.
Nose: Acacia honey, white grapes, sweet grist and malt loaf. Baking spices and hints of peat are present underneath.

Name: Caol Ila 14 Year Old 2007 (bottled 2021) - Wilson & Morgan
Palate: Coastal smoke is balanced by crisp apple and buttered crumpets, while candied lemons bring a zesty lift to herbaceous seaweed and peppery peat.
Finish: Smouldering charcoal and ash, oily barley, warming green peppercorns, and creamy lemon curd.
Nose: Toasted oak and salty oat cakes, whispers of ginger, vanilla, and fiery peat smoke.

Name: The Temple Bar 14 Year Old Malbec Cask Finish
Palate: Dusty cocoa and oak spice, with a touch of milk chocolate and cranberry.
Finish: A dry, spiced finish.
Nose: Dry plum skin, toasty wood and ripe berries alongside green oak and mocha.

Name: Glentauchers 10 Year Old 2011 (cask 423) - Cask Collection (A.D. Rattray)
Palate: Sultana pastries, baked apples and pears, pecans, and malty caramelised biscuits.
Finish: Honey, cherries, berries, dark chocolate, and oaky malt.
Nose: Bursting with fruit, boozy soaked raisins, berries, and wafts of tropical pineapple.

Name: Jura 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 15870) - Provenance (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Lemon curd and candied almonds follow mouthfuls of vanilla cream, prunes, and buttered popcorn.
Finish: Crumbly vanilla fudge, stewed orchard fruits with honey, and sweet, nutty malt.
Nose: Zesty lemon drizzle cake, buttered brioche, distant smoked oak.

Name: Ardbeg Still Young
Palate: Spicy, powerful, cut fruits, citrus. Phenolic, burning rubber, bitumen.
Finish: Long, spicy, punchy heat, plenty of smoke, little brine and fruit.
Nose: Toffee, rich. Creamy sweet, tangy peat and citrus, tarry, smoky bacon.

Name: Masthouse Single Malt Pot & Column Still
Palate: Malty, with touches of buttered toast and brown sugar.
Finish: Oatcakes, caramel, almond pastries.
Nose: Lemon zest, caraway, honey, and banana chips.

Name: Magdalen College Single Malt Whisky
Palate: Zesty marmalade and a smidge of raspberry coulis, enjoyably creamy, with subtle touches of oak spiciness fluttering by.
Finish: Lasting vanilla warmth on the finish.
Nose: Rounded caramel and barley, followed by sweeter hints of almond and cherry. Subtly spicy hints of cinnamon and white pepper.

Name: Kavalan Solist Manzanilla Cask
Palate: Developing notes of citrus peel and strawberry liquorice, with a little bit of sea-salt.
Finish: Juicy raisins and a slight waft of damson jam.
Nose: Fresh fruit, chopped herbs and coffee beans. Subtly sharp with green apples.

Name: Ardmore 14 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Packed with malt and smoke, while a touch of hoppy bitterness introduced more citrus elements.
Finish: Slightly burnt ginger snaps, caraway, treacle.
Nose: Peanut shells, mineral-rich smoke, a hint of orange blossom freshness stands out from the dense savoury notes.

Name: Scallywag The Winter Edition 2022
Palate: Dark chocolate studded with forest fruits follows prunes and dates with nutty malt and maple syrup resting in the depths.
Finish: Fruit cake with hearty spice, cacao, and dark, juicy berries.
Nose: Spiced biscuits, iced gingerbread and dustings of cocoa.

Name: Drumshanbo GalÃ¡nta Release 2021
Palate: Honeycomb, candied ginger, waxy citrus peels, mocha, caramelised peanuts.
Finish: Cassia, flapjacks, and chocolate-chip cookies.
Nose: Apple chips and pear drops, with a layer of runny caramel, and a whiff of sandalwood.

Name: The Macallan Edition No.6
Palate: More toffee and dried fruit, now with fresh orange and pear in support. A hint of oaty biscuit and chocolate in there too.
Finish: Chocolate builds on the finish, alongside citrus, apricot and allspice.
Nose: Caramelised dates, latte topped with a dusting of cinnamon and nutmeg, a hint of cedar.

Name: White Oak Akashi 5 Year Old Sherry Cask
Palate: Charred oak and earthy spice, treacle toffee, jammy berries.
Finish: A touch of orange zest, sugary barley, dried fruit, and baking spice.
Nose: Sweet malt, caramel, raisins, and berries.

Name: Kingsbarns 7 Year Old (Single Cask Release)
Palate: Ginger and butterscotch, with vanilla ice cream and pears.
Finish: A little drying and quite sweet.
Nose: Lots of vanilla and buttery pastries blend with orchard fruit and peppery oak.

Name: Reference Series I
Palate: Barley and Champagne, heading into bread and butter pudding territory. Dry Sherry too and some late sweetness.
Finish: Dry and subtle with bread and also herbal notes clinging on for some time with a little dry vermouth character.
Nose: Perfumed malt, fresh citrus hints, menthol, custard and meatiness. Oats, thyme honey, Jelly Tots and apple juice.

Name: Old Ballantruan 10 Year Old
Palate: Simple and balanced with a solid delivery of rich peat smoke and hints of black pepper.
Finish: Intense and spicy with a crescendo of wood smoke and tar.
Nose: Soft spices and rich peat note. Very punchy and intense, with some inviting vanilla notes.

Name: Black Tartan 88
Palate: Melted butter on crumpets, nutty barley, more zesty fruit though this more more tropical and vibrant.
Finish: Toasted bread, peach, caramel.
Nose: Warm and oaky, with chocolate digestives and tangy citrus fruit in support.

Name: Bushmills Original
Palate: Fruity, aromatic palate. Salty butter, all kinds of blossom, sweet vanilla cream and citrus.
Finish: A malty finish with cardamom and ginger on the tail.
Nose: Aromatic, sweet Riesling-like quality to this. Also cut herbs and blossom.

Name: Miyagikyo Aromatic Yeast - Nikka Discovery
Palate: Radiant, well-balanced. The full-bodied attack is at first refreshingly herbaceous (barley field, fern). Very delicately, the mid-palate then becomes wonderfully rich (brioche, leavened baguette). Next, white peaches and pears release their deliciously tangy juice onto the taste buds as acacia honey spreads voluptuously around the sides of the palate.
Finish: Long, silky. Closely linked to the end of the palate, incredibly fresh flavours of herbal tea (sage, camomile, verbena) cross through the start of the finish. At the end of the finish, grains of salt are placed gently onto a bed of cut grass. The mentholated, very slightly empyreumatic (smoking cigar) and spicy (fresh ginger) retro-nasal olfaction gradually reveals subtle floral notes (pear tree, lily of the valley). The empty glass releases fermentation aromas.
Nose: Refined, full of ardour. The very exuberant first nose (lavender, marshmallow, marsh mallow plant) is also softly liquoricey and lush (malted barley). Allowed to breathe, succulent perfumes of comtÃ© cheese, flowering meadow, and fruits (peach, pear, apricot) intensely take hold of the olfactory arena. Gradually, notes of vanilla, coconut milk and lemon meringue tart draw out the first stage of the tasting.

Name: Glen Elgin 20 Year Old 1995 - Whisky is Class...ical (Silver Seal)
Palate: Shortbread and greengages, with a touch of melted white chocolate.
Finish: A medium length finish, with floral barley lasting.
Nose: Marzipan, ground nutmeg and honey'd barley.

Name: Sagamore Spirit Rum Cask Finish Rye Whiskey - Reserve Series
Palate: Demerara sugar, ripe passion fruit and banana, and vanilla are followed by aromatic spices.
Finish: Cinnamon, peanut brittle, and pineapple remain.
Nose: Bright pineapple, creme brÃ»lÃ©e, and nutmeg.

Name: MacNaMara Double Matured
Palate: Brown sugar starts to appear on the palate, with a little bit of cooking spice and dark chocolate.
Finish: Chewy raisin notes last.
Nose: Honey'd malt at the fore, with a touch of toasted oak and caramel.

Name: Reference Series III
Palate: Thick with loads of chocolate covered dates and a few raisins. Chewy, herbal and meaty too. Quite fantastic, basically.
Finish: Long with pleasant leather notes, cocoa, delicious coffee cake and a touch of mint on the tail.
Nose: Creamy with a little cut grass and pepper quickly give way to fresh orange peel, vanilla, malt loaf, coffee bean, calves leather, rich toffee and molasses.

Name: Yoichi Aromatic Yeast - Nikka Discovery
Palate: Firm, lively. Giving its own take on the herbaceous, salty and empyreumatic register of the first nose, the attack also evokes a field of barley swept with sea spray. The more earthy and rooted mid-palate pours blocks of peat onto the tongue. The floral (tulip, cyclamen) and fruity (Mirabelle plum, greengage plum) end of the palate is also rustic and marine.
Finish: Long, crisp. Unexpectedly, the start of the finish invites us to bite joyfully into whole bunches of white grapes. Flavours of plum and pulp bring lots of smoothness to the end of the palate. On the retro-nasal olfaction, evoking an evanescent peat, a fine layer of liquorice delicately coats the taste buds. The empty glass releases wisps of translucent smoke.
Nose: Fine, distinguished. On the first nose, a herbaceous, salty and empyreumatic (sleet) peat clearly dominates. Allowed to breathe, it makes way for fruits (apple, pear, Canary melon), flowers (lily, carnation) and mint, all of which bring lots of momentum to the aroma palette. Gradually, it becomes increasingly milky (cream, coconut), exotic (pineapple, yellow kiwi) and medicinal (ointment, Arnica).

Name: Taisteal Explorer's Grain
Palate: Toffee apple, floral vanilla and creamy cashew nuts.
Finish: A silky, buttery finish, with more lingering vanilla.
Nose: White chocolate and lots of vanilla along with citrus curd.

Name: Leith Blended Scotch Whisky
Palate: Fragrant vanilla pod floats throughout, while a prickle of pepper is softened by sweet toffee and toasted oak.
Finish: Creamy grain lingers with sugared fruit salad. Warming spice creeps in, balanced by buttery pastry.
Nose: Melted caramel, buttered brioche, a whiff of orchard blossom, and honeyed cereal.

Name: Kavalan Solist Fino Sherry Cask 57.8%
Palate: Juicy fruits galore! Apricot, raisin and plum by the bucket-load. Perhaps a touch of roasted carrot, too... Mocha and buttered popcorn develops later on.
Finish: Candied orange peels, brandied cherries and a pinch of sea salt.
Nose: Grilled pineapple, cinnamon-topped apple pie, a hint of coastal breeze. Black tea, sultanas and honey.

Name: Politician (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Almond butter, dry oak and buttery caramel, with orange blossom and chai latte.
Finish: Candied orange and white pepper.
Nose: Floral chocolate notes, with orange marmalade, barley sugar, creamy lemon curd and apple skin.

Name: Rozelieures FumÃ© Collection
Palate: Velvety smoke drifts through notes of roasted nuts, aromatic spice, and orchard fruit.
Finish: Long and drying.
Nose: Bonfire smoke, candied orange, mocha, and acacia honey.

Name: Bakery Hill 5 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Creamy malt and honeycomb, with the peat smoke taking on a subtly coastal hint along the way.
Finish: Subtly peppery on the finish, though vanilla notes keep it well-balanced.
Nose: Soft, sweet smoke leads the way, paired with a hint of unripe banana and honeyed porridge.

Name: Benriach Malting Season (First Edition)
Palate: Vanilla, lemon, grassy malt, toffee, melted butter on crumpets.
Finish: Lasting sweetness of caramel and vanilla pod on the finish.
Nose: Pear drops and Campino sweeties, with earthy barley and a smidge of cut oak for balance.

Name: Boxes Blend
Palate: Soft and smooth in the mouth, with plenty of light and dark toffee notes. There's caramelised orange and vanilla custard with nutmeg too.
Finish: Medium with overtones of soft brown sugar.
Nose: Buttery and light, with dry grass and soft caramel. A bit of sherried spice and a whiff of banana and fresh apple.

Name: Black Bull Kyloe (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Soft notes of plump raisins and nuts. Milk chocolate comes through.
Finish: A fairly long finish, rich with vanilla.
Nose: Syrup sweetness and warmth, with fruity hints of apples and pears and a touch of oak spice.

Name: Lord Elcho
Palate: Sweet caramel and more fruits, followed by spicy malt and ginger. A subtle nuttiness.
Finish: Surprisingly long with spiciness continuing on and on.
Nose: Fresh, juicy grapes and green apples with a drizzling of honey. Slightly herbal hints of oak.

Name: Dailuaine 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 300127) - Single Cask Series (The Red Cask Company)
Palate: Sticky ginger cake, chocolatey malt, and a touch of burnt toffee pave the way for candied nuts and leathery oak.
Finish: Generous spice arrives, with warming pepper, woody clove, and sweet cinnamon.
Nose: Stewed plums and a touch of toasted coconut lead to floral barley and spiced honey.

Name: Annandale Man OâSword Vintage 2015 - Bourbon Cask (cask 271)
Palate: Spicy peat and creamy vanilla make for a well-balanced palate.
Finish: Nutty barley and dry smoke.
Nose: Ripe mango and charred pineapple, with hints of toasted cedar developing.

Name: Ichiro's Malt Wine Wood Reserve
Palate: Red berry sweetness, oily walnut, white pepper.
Finish: Lingering Sherried spices, with a little hint of chocolate.
Nose: Chocolate orange, black liquorice and creamy malt.

Name: Glen Scotia 21 Year Old
Palate: Heaps of dried fruit, creamy vanilla, clove, and caramel blend with rich smoke and coastal elements.
Finish: Drying and delicately sweet.
Nose: Sea spray, oloroso spice, red fruit, toffee, and rose water.

Name: Highland Park Hobbister
Palate: Smoky peat and sweet floral honey, followed by brown sugar and vanilla pod with a hint of charred pineapple.
Finish: Charred oak and candied fruits with peat smoke returning.
Nose: Tropical fruit and floral notes alongside hefty peat smoke aromas.

Name: Rozelieures Subtil Collection
Palate: Conference pear, quince jam, oak spices, and caramel.
Finish: Full-bodied and sweet.
Nose: Creamy vanilla, acacia honey, orchard fruit, oak char, and golden barley.

Name: Michel Couvreur Candid Malt Whisky
Palate: Very well-balanced. Sherry notes are up front and sweet (almost creamy), but the robust peat earthiness keeps it all in check. There are a few notes of black liquorice tucked away in there too...
Finish: Mineral-y smoke and juicy sultana.
Nose: Mince pie, petrichor, heavy fruit cake and a hearty helping of nutmeg.

Name: Moncreiffe Signature
Palate: Apricot jam, nougat, silky toffee, vanilla fudge and fresh toast.
Finish: More toffee, roasted almond and ripe cherry on the finish.
Nose: Strawberry, buttery caramel, apricot, raisin, praline and a hint of cigar box.

Name: Bowmore 1991 (bottled 2016) (cask 253010) - Rare Select (Montgomerie's)
Palate: Wood smoke, honey'd barley, coffee beans, toast.
Finish: Long and well-seasoned with peat.
Nose: Seaweed, smoked salt, fresh lemon, fudge.

Name: Edradour 22 Year Old 1999 (cask 803 & 804) - Bordeaux Cask Finish
Palate: Toasty oak, juicy blackberries, spiced fruit compote, dark chocolate, and vanilla crÃ¨me fraÃ®che.
Finish: Baking spices linger, with malty grist.
Nose: Plenty of red wine character, ripe cherries, blackcurrants, warm caramel, and cocoa nibs.

Name: Armorik Sherry Cask
Palate: Chocolatey and rich, with notes of red apple and blackcurrant building slowly in the background.
Finish: There's a slight minerality to the finish, though sweetness of sherry remains.
Nose: Red wine booziness, balanced by black pepper and fresh orange.

Name: Gelston's Single Malt
Palate: Dates and ginger cake, with lychee, banana and vanilla custard.
Finish: Honeyed baking spice and toasty oak.
Nose: Toasted teacakes, jam and vanilla pod.

Name: Alfred Giraud Harmonie
Palate: Tangy apple sweeties, silky peat smoke and plums, followed by apple pie and sultana.
Finish: Tannic wood and lingering nutty Cognac influence, with a whisper of smoke.
Nose: A hint of aromatic peat smoke surrounds apple blossom, baklava and toasty oak.

Name: Teaninich 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 361936) - James Eadie
Palate: Papaya, sweet barley, sugary porridge, and citrus.
Finish: A creamy, long finish.
Nose: White fruit, creamy vanilla, and sweet notes of marzipan.

Name: Caol Ila 11 Year Old 2007 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Everything from the nose, wrapped up in a perfect bouquet of cream and smoke. Silky soft vanilla custard, crystalised ginger, charred garden herbs, and elegant peat.
Finish: Candyfloss, burnt sugar, and baked apples linger, while a touch of coastal tar arrives, supported by warming waves of pink peppercorn.
Nose: Baked apples and sweet grist, with layers of creamy rice pudding (including a burnt top), butter biscuits, and smoked sea salt. Hints of herbaceous peat and fennel nestle comfortably among the cream.

Name: Hamiltons The Isles Blended Malt Scotch Whisky
Palate: Apricots, a hint of earthy, smoky peat, red liquorice.
Finish: Gingersnaps, still quite creamy.
Nose: Clotted cream, distant beaches, malty sweetness.

Name: Willowbank 18 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Cherry, chocolate, and brown sugar, balanced by woody tannins with a soft drying hint of baking spices.
Finish: Red fruit sweetness and a hint of leather.
Nose: Blackberry jam on toast, earthy with a savoury touch of tobacco, a pinch of cinnamon.

Name: Auchroisk 25 Year Old 1996 (cask 2) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: The citrus and spice keep on coming, candied orange leads, with boozy sultanas and baking spice in tow, while warming liquorice and earthy malt build at the core.
Finish: Prickles of pepper and warming ginger, candied nuts and marmalade linger.
Nose: Spiced pastries with whiffs of cinnamon and brown sugar are followed by zesty orange peels and wood shavings.

Name: Bowmore 18 Year Old 2002 (Release No.11717) - The Stories of Wind & Wave (The Character of Islay Whisky Company)
Bottler: The Character of Islay Whisky Company
Palate: Rounded and earthy on the palate, with plenty of smoke and vanilla pod notes. A soft hint of blackberry brightness peeks out from behind it all.
Finish: Subtle pine notes, alongside flaky sea salt and orchard fruit.
Nose: Tangy grapefruit brightness, mellowed by soft wafts of coastal smoke, underpinned by creamy waves of vanilla.

Name: Tomintoul Tarn Peated 1L
Palate: Flamed citrus peel, roasted nuts, vanilla, earthy barley, and cinnamon.
Finish: Bonfire embers and orchard fruit.
Nose: Smoked heather, green fruit, toasty cereals, white pepper, and caramel.

Name: The Gladstone Axe American Oak
Palate: Poached apples, barley sugars, and custard cream biscuits.
Finish: Sweet toasted oak with wafts of honey and vanilla and a gentle peppery finish.
Nose: Sweet biscuity malt and soft, drying oak, with caramel and vanilla.

Name: Strathmill 14 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Generous layers of sweet, honeyed orchard fruits and syrupy sponge with a smidge of lemon zest are backed by a herbaceous hint of eucalyptus.
Finish: That oaty, chalky character lingers, with pressed apples, herbal tea, and a trickle of toffee.
Nose: Soft notes of peaches, apples, and pears are joined by yeasty bread with a drizzle of herbal honey and chalky grist... porridge oats perhaps?

Name: Big Peat at Christmas 2021
Palate: Still richly smoky, with a crackle of black pepper bringing a core of spiciness, rounded by orange and lemon.
Finish: Very slightly floral, but peaty notes carry on and on.
Nose: Tarry rope, stroopwafel, toasted brioche, vegetal peat smoke.

Name: The Epicurean 12 Year Old
Palate: Peach, pear and more citrus, with hints of biscuit dough and caraway in support.
Finish: Subtly sweet with brown sugar and white grape.
Nose: Honeydew melon, mixed peels and a whiff of summer meadows.

Name: Auchentoshan American Oak
Palate: Bounty bars, more citrus peels and peaches. A little bit buttery, with golden barley and oak spice developing on the mid palate.
Finish: Lasting notes of grapefruit and toffee pennies.
Nose: Oranges and lemons, toffee chunks and milk chocolate. Wafts of grassy air and clotted cream.

Name: Dartmoor Sherry Cask Matured Whisky
Palate: Chocolatey at first, before a kick of stem ginger and chewy dates arrive.
Finish: Gingerbread, brown sugar and dry malt.
Nose: Red berry jam on toast, almond pastries and a touch of coconut ice.

Name: Wilderness Trail Single Barrel Bourbon
Palate: Rich and viscous, with more buttery notes, toffee popcorn and silky caramel, with just a sprinkle of salt.
Finish: Some vanilla oak in there among cherry jam, and a hint of spice on the finish.
Nose: Grain sweetness and buttered popcorn, with cinnamon French toast and salted butter, with some maple syrup drizzled over.

Name: Tobermory 24 Year Old - Batch 9 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Fiery and floral with aromatic red peppercorns and rose petals.
Finish: Big and spicy, those spices just go on and on. Blows through the nose like a Szechuan soup.
Nose: Spicy initially with cardamom and cloves followed by roasted nuts with green apple and a saline quality.

Name: Spirit of Hven MerCurious Corn Whisky
Palate: Butterscotch, pear tart, mint chocolate and caramel popcorn, alongside buttered corn on the cob.
Finish: Lemon boiled sweeties, with earthy vanilla and some of that oak coming through.
Nose: Raspberry and white chocolate muffin, vanilla sponge topped with buttercream, pear drops and nougat, supported by toffee apple.

Name: Kaiyo Whisky Cask Strength
Palate: Peppery at first, though soon enough wafts of buttery pastry, clove and espresso develop.
Finish: Lingering peppercorn heat and a whisper of caraway.
Nose: Spiced oak, fresh lemongrass and orange oil.

Name: Glen Elgin 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 802067B) - The Single Cask
Palate: Toasted oak, dulche de leche, sticky dried fruit, and raspberry coulis.
Finish: Spiced fudge and chocolate raisins.
Nose: Cinnamon rolls, berry jam, and tart currants.

Name: Islay Mist Original
Palate: Soft, creamy. Barley.
Finish: Spirity, oak.
Nose: Sweet, soft fudge, and all the inherent creaminess, slightly herbal.

Name: Glenmorangie Ealanta 1993 Private Edition
Palate: Yet more candied orange, tropical fruit, a touch of vanilla, and an all-pervading sweetness that leaves you in absolutely no doubt about the fact that this has come from fresh oak.
Finish: This is where the maturity starts to shine through. The complex ethereal nature of the fruit begins to fade, and gives way to a familiar high-note of rancio and dried figs.
Nose: All about Orange Zest. The ethereal long necks of Glenmorangieâs stills are famed for producing a light, fruity and almost zesty spirit, and this characteristic is turned up to 11 in this release. Youâd be forgiven for thinking that youâd just been handed an old-fashioned cocktail.

Name: Ardbeg Traigh Bhan 19 Year Old - Batch 1
Palate: The peaty power of this alluring spirit is undeniable, as it plunges your palate into its smoky depths. An intensely salty mouthfeel drifts into sweet and sour notes of smoked chili chocolate and paprika. Waves of toasted oak and roasted tea leaves emerge, before subsiding to reveal fresh peppermint fondant and salted white chocolate.
Finish: Firm but gentle, soothing wood smoke carries into a length, lingering finish â resonating far beyond the glass.
Nose: Gentle ripples of smoky pineapple, soured cream and wood smoke make for an irresistible nose. Newly planed oak and supple dark leather sing to your soul as sweet toffee and liquorice draw you in. A splash of water releases a surge of unexpected notes. Struck flint, herbal pine resin and coal tar effervesce towards citrusy lime sherbet and subtle, yet sweet vanilla cheesecake.

Name: The Irishman 12 Year Old (2022 Release)
Palate: Roasted nuts, spiced walnut loaf, a little bit of milky coffee, diced apricots and juicy peaches.
Finish: Lasting sweetness of caramel, with a crackle of cassia in the background.
Nose: Honeycomb and toffee ice cream, with a sprinkling of diced almonds. A hint of toasted brioche, too.

Name: Dalwhinnie Distillers Edition - 2022 Collection
Palate: Fresh tropical fruit drizzled with honey, a touch of toasted coconut, and some nutmeg.
Finish: A little nutty, and with warming spice.
Nose: Guava, and mango, with twists of black pepper.

Name: Ardbeg Grooves - Committee Release
Palate: Chocolatey at first, before notes of white grape and clementine appear. Maintains a maritime character. Burnt ends give it more meaty elements.
Finish: Red berry sweetness, vanilla pod, ash and salted caramel.
Nose: Honey-glazed ham, matcha tea, walnut, a hint of sea breeze and burnt wood.

Name: Fable Blended Malt Batch One
Palate: Chocolate ice cream, wheat biscuits, Crunchie bars, vanilla blossom.
Finish: A touch of peppery spice and ground nutmeg.
Nose: Green apple, buttered brown bread, liquorice.

Name: 1776 Straight Rye Whiskey - 92 Proof
Palate: Lots of dark fruit notes complement classic rye heat. Brilliant balance.
Finish: Subtly earthy spice sticks around on the finish.
Nose: Cedar, menthol, lemongrass, cooked summer berries, dark chocolate.

Name: UAIS The Triple Blend Irish Whiskey
Palate: Creamy vanilla fudge and sweet, fruit-studded sponge cake are followed by biscuity barley and sweetly charred oak.
Finish: A prickle of spice on the finish, kept in check by waves of creamy grain, honeyed porridge, and prunes.
Nose: Honey and toasted almonds open the way for waves of oaken vanilla and peppery spice.

Name: Chivas Regal Extra 13 Year Old
Palate: Vanilla fudge, pear and blackberry crumble and lots of baking spice, along with frangipane and toffee apple.
Finish: A pinch of tobacco on a dry and sweetly spiced finish.
Nose: Stewed orchard fruit and sherried dried fruit, with polished oak and caramelised nuts.

Name: Hellyers Road Twin Oak
Palate: Buttered toast, more citrus and red berries, a dusting of cinnamon and ginger.
Finish: Soft oak warmth and a smidge of fizzy strawberry laces.
Nose: Lemon meringue, raspberry, dry cooking spices.

Name: Taisteal Explorer's Blend
Palate: Spiced apple crumble, with cinnamon loaf cake, earthy vanilla pod, home made jam and toasty oak.
Finish: A creamy finish of white chocolate and praline.
Nose: Chocolate fudge, condensed milk and vanilla cream.

Name: Ergaster Single Malt Whisky - Nature
Palate: Rounded layers of sweet yellow plums and soft stone fruits, with soft peach and butterscotch in tow. Bold barley and flaked almonds follow, with a touch of minerality beneath.
Finish: Candied fruits linger, with a bitter touch of cedar and hearty mixed spice cushioned by toasty oak and nutty malt.
Nose: Frangipane, heaps of syrupy stewed fruit, an earthen touch of roasted nuts, supported by roasted malt, and a touch of bee's wax.

Name: AthrÃº Knocknarea 14 Year Old
Palate: Classic sherried sweetness unfolds on the palate with zesty orange and dense raisin, plus softly toasty barley hints.
Finish: Almond, chocolate pears, lingering tobacco and peppercorn spiciness.
Nose: Warming cedar and macadamia nut notes, with a touch of fresh linen along the way.

Name: Ben Nevis 10 Year Old Equinox & Solstice Spring 2023 (Decadent Drinks)
Palate: Soft, buttery oak and vanilla, with oily malt and soft stone fruits in tow.
Finish: Sweet sponge cake, barley sugars, a touch of pepper, and toasted coconut.
Nose: Waxed lemons, creamy fudge, and biscuity barley.

Name: Caol Ila 11 Year Old 2011 - Hepburn's Choice
Palate: Warming bonfire smoke, with milk chocolate, toasted almonds, and spiced fruit cake.
Finish: Ashy smoke, and winter spices.
Nose: Lapsang souchong tea, with some notes of grilled peaches and dried apricot.

Name: The Black Scotsman 9 Year Old
Palate: Gently nutty with hints of chocolate praline, more cherries, and berries, soft vanilla leads to gently spiced oak.
Finish: Candied zests, stewed fruits, cakey spice with cinnamon, nutmeg, and a prickle of warming pepper.
Nose: Sugar dusted baked apple with softer notes of apricot, juicy sultanas, and forest fruits.

Name: Tomintoul 16 Year Old 2004 (cask 2) -  Port Pipe
Palate: Strawberry and lemon zest, with malty bread and currant bun.
Finish: Chocolate peanuts, toffee, and raspberry jam.
Nose: Cherry, almond, buttery biscuits, a good crackle of black pepper and nutmeg.

Name: Ninkasi Whisky Small Batch 2022
Palate: Butterscotch, aromatic spice, oily walnut, and orchard fruit.
Finish: Drying and bright.
Nose: Tonka bean, yellow fruit, brioche, and honey.

Name: Edradour 30 Year Old
Palate: Full, menthol. Oily, sweet cereals. Marzipan, chewy oak.
Finish: Oak develops, nutty.
Nose: Seems thick. Honey, toffee. Juicy barley. Marzipan.

Name: Linkwood 12 Year Old 2010 (cask 310617) - James Eadie
Palate: Oak char and yellow fruit lead with vanilla and salted caramel in support.
Finish: Plenty more kitchen spices join the party.
Nose: Banana and toffee waffles, lemon curd, and baking spice.

Name: The Epicurean Tawny Port Finish
Palate: Chocolatey at first, before creamy caramel and honeycomb take the spotlight. Still packed with juicy fruit notes.
Finish: Warming cedar and caraway spice on the finish.
Nose: Crisp pear and green apple, with a hint of gooseberry too. Some cooked red fruit sweetness develops later on.

Name: The Six Isles Voyager
Palate: Oily malt with vanilla and buttered bread, plus more salty notes and smouldering peat.
Finish: A balanced finish of brown sugar and savoury oak.
Nose: Soft heathery smoke notes, with oat cakes and sea salt in support. Fruity notes of apple and apricot develop later on.

Name: Famous Grouse Highland Decanter
Palate: Light and balanced. Spice, barley. Caramel, touch of smoke.
Finish: Touch of sweetness, caramel.
Nose: Light, crisp. Cut flowers. Barley. Toffee sweetness.

Name: TronÃ§ais
Palate: Buttery biscuits and corn, with toasted almonds, drizzles of honey, and gentle orange blossom.
Finish: Drying and spicy.
Nose: Plenty of oak character, vanilla, cinnamon, and cereal notes.

Name: Yamazaki 25 Year Old
Palate: A smoky first sip of Mizunara sandalwood notes that open and deepen into complex layers of kaki persimmon subtle sweetness, tart ume plum notes and gentle shoga ginger spicy notes.
Finish: nd long finish with Mizunara smokiness and lingering subtly sweet wood notes that remain.
Nose: Mizunara smoky notes of incense, followed by a complex bouquet of mature kaki persimmon and ume plum notes.

Name: Moon Harbour Pier 1
Palate: Vanilla start to take control on the palate, but sweet stone fruit notes remain.
Finish: Flaky pastry and a touch of white pepper.
Nose: Fragrant barley, leading to brown sugar-coated tropical fruit.

Name: Bonailie Blended Malt Whisky
Palate: Baked apples, gorse, and warming allspice.
Finish: Delicate and sweet.
Nose: Heather honey and crumbly fudge.

Name: SPEY Spirit of Speyside Whisky Festival 2022
Palate: More dried fruit and sweet spice, as well as some fresh herbal notes from peppermint.
Finish: Oily walnut lingers.
Nose: A big fruit salad dusted in cinnamon is joined by vanilla, malt, and peppery spice.

Name: Woven Experience No.14
Palate: Peaches and more orchard fruit, with some spicy tobacco, potpourri, and polished oak.
Finish: Lots going on, with dried fruits, and warming spice.
Nose: Some dried mango, crisp green apples, heather honey, and old books.

Name: Black Tartan Batch 21
Palate: Creamy vanilla, butter fudge, and a whisper of cloves, cinnamon, and allspice.
Finish: Silky caramel, and warming spiced apple.
Nose: Baking spices, mellow oak, and caramel.

Name: Old Orkney Malt 16 Year Old 2005 - Edition No.2 (Orkney Sponge & Decadent Drinks)
Palate: Light vanilla, with flapjacks, lemon sherbert, and dried seaweed.
Finish: Some zingy spice builds, along with a touch of salted caramel.
Nose: Refreshing sea spray, with waxy lemon peel, and crumbly shortbread.

Name: Dewar's 25 Year Old Signature
Palate: Hobnob biscuits, more red berry sweetness, sandalwood, toffee and treacle.
Finish: A slow build of Christmas spices on the finish, paired with orchard fruit and mint leaf.
Nose: Honey, dried peels, toasted oak and stewed plum. A soft hint of strawberry jam and old oak furniture too.

Name: Ardmore 11 Year Old 2008 (cask 709235) - Fadandel
Palate: Richly peated with wafts of iodine and charcoal, softer notes of vanilla, butterscotch, and coconut nestle amongst the smoke.
Finish: Softly salty, with sweet caramel to balance. Vanilla continues to mingle with dense tar and oily smoke.
Nose: Wisps of bonfire smoke, quite herbal with hints of dried rosemary, anise, and biscuity malt.

Name: The Macallan M (2022 Release)
Palate: Herbal notes of liquorice and tea leaves combined with smooth crÃ¨me anglaise and chocolate orange with a hint of wood spice.
Finish: Rich dried fruit and decadent dark chocolate.
Nose: Sweet black cherry and demerara sugar with a sensorial mix of polished oak and leather, softened with hints of indulgent chocolate and vanilla.

Name: 26 Year Old Whisky - Maple Syrup Cask Finish (Defilement)
Palate: Runny honey and caramel, with savoury notes of cigar box, earthy peat and charred oak developing later on, plus a touch of fresh cantaloupe.
Finish: Waves of vanilla and heather, with a hint of smoke building.
Nose: Freshly picked pears, buttered apples, ginger and just a pinch of sea salt.

Name: Whisky Works Quartermaster 11 Year Old
Palate: Oily nuts, almond butter and Medjool dates, with chocolate raisin.
Finish: Orange marmalade and coffee ice cream.
Nose: Candied ginger, peaches in syrup and plum jam, with rich mocha.

Name: Woven Experience No.13
Palate: Slick texture, with toasted almonds, dried red fruits, mocha, and beeswax furniture polish.
Finish: Barley sugar, warm oak, and allspice.
Nose: Cacao nibs, papaya, pencil shavings, and cinnamon spice.

Name: Togouchi 15 Year Old
Palate: Nutty malt complemented by milk chocolate, joined by a helping of caraway.
Finish: Peppercorn, vanilla and a lingering peatiness.
Nose: Soft pastry dusted with cinnamon, pear and hints of dried earth.

Name: The London Distillery Company 5 Year Old 109 Cask Edition
Palate: Mango fool, summer fruits, and citrus curd, balanced by a good dose of spicy oak.
Finish: Toasted brioche slathered in berry jam lingers.
Nose: Ripe pineapple and buttered toast, leading into homemade marmalade, and spiced berry compote.

Name: Ardmore 10 Year Old - Canmore
Palate: A balance of rich smoke, wisps of vanilla, and sweet, baked fruits is followed by liquorice, smoked tea, and earthy, vegetal peat.
Finish: Medicinal notes creep through, the peat smoke continues, softened by vanilla fudge and floral oak.
Nose: Woody vanilla, hints of dried flowers, and smouldering embers.

Name: The Macallan M (2020 Release)
Palate: The palate opens rich in wood spices, slowly showing all their viscosity. Wood smoke flits in and out.
Finish: The heavier raisin and sultana flavours take over, meandering to a long full finish.
Nose: Dried fruits ripen, then soften. Vanilla accompanies green apple hand in hand. Ginger, nutmeg and cinnamon create an ensemble in the background, with strong notes of polished oak and a depth of resinous, juicy oranges.

Name: Blended Malt - Prologue (Chapter 7)
Palate: Pear tart, cinnamon butter, and white pepper.
Finish: Brown sugar and more peppery spice.
Nose: Barley sweetness, apple blossom, and runny honey.

Name: Pointe Blanche Single Malt
Palate: Fruity malt, orange peel, vanilla latte, and chewy caramels.
Finish: Cracked black pepper and brown sugar.
Nose: A little bit of bonfire smoke, buttery pastry, and gingerbread.

Name: Dalmore 1978 - Sherry Finesse
Palate: Very fruity and full-bodied, it clings to the palate with oily, rich notes of vanilla spice, coffee beans, almond oil, black treacle, thick malt and sherried peels.
Finish: Long and very creamy, spicy and sweet.
Nose: Sweet, creamy nose with notes of honey, peppermint, coffee, bananas, coffee beans and buttery toffee. A little almond, pear drops and citrus too.

Name: Villa NÂ°16
Palate: Fragrant wafts of grapes and plums, honeyed cereal with earthy notes of leather, and hints of wood smoke.
Finish: Creamy vanilla and cask char combine with soft, vinous fruit and roasted coffee.
Nose: Rich, roasted malt, buttery vanilla, and toasted oak with delicate fruit wafting throughout.

Name: Blair Athol 12 Year Old 2008 - Mey Selections
Palate: Leads with gristy barley, evolves into chocolate Hobnob biscuits and strawberry laces.
Finish: Peppery malt, a smidge of coffee bitterness.
Nose: Stewed tea, a touch of peat warmth, with damson jam in support.

Name: The Lost Distilleries Blend - Batch 10
Palate: A very sweet palate opens up with notes of soft, warm raisins dotted through sticky-toffee pudding, vanilla ice-cream and a crumbling, buttery fudge. Sharp green apple builds, with a touch of smoke and rich oak tempering the sweetness.
Finish: Long and incredibly full, the lusciously creamy texture is tempered with a bite of charred oak warmth.
Nose: Aromas of chocolate-covered coffee beans, marzipan and vanilla cream unfold amongst a complex blend of polished oak, liquorice tea, aniseed, and a touch of toffee apple.

Name: Whisky Row Smoke and Peat - Batch 3
Palate: Dried apricot, cured meat, citrus, and aromatic spice join more smoke and sea.
Finish: Salted caramel and sweet tobacco.
Nose: Rock pools and dry peat smoke with tropical fruit sweetness.

Name: George Dickel 10 Year Old 2011 (cask 35) - Stateside (Heroes & Heretics)
Palate: Still packed with vanilla, now with brown butter and toffee apple in tow.
Finish: A long finish with honey and dashes of cooking spice.
Nose: Vanilla ice-cream with toffee sauce, cut grass, dusty oak and a smidge of leather.

Name: Belmont Farm Kopper Kettle Bonded Virginia Whiskey
Palate: Oily and nutty, along with pithy citrus, and toffee popcorn.
Finish: Melted brown sugar and buttered (if slightly burnt) toast.
Nose: Apple strudel, hints of summer berries, and charred corn.

Name: Tomintoul 14 Year Old 2008 White Port Cask Finish
Palate: Plenty of fruity tang with summer berries, sultanas, and honeyed prunes. Syrupy flapjack joins, with a dash of fresh vanilla.
Finish: Praline, yellow plums, spiced biscuits, and hints of creamy mocha.
Nose: Floral notes of elderflower and orchard blossom, white grapes, and pineapple sweeties, with soft barley in tow.

Name: A. Roborel De Climens Finition Sauvignon
Palate: Light, juicy fruit notes with peaches, pear, and white grapes, alongside richer, dried fruit and soft spice.
Finish: Sultanas, a touch of chamomile, delicate barley, and oaken vanilla.
Nose: Elegant notes of crisp zest and fruity floral character mingle with sweet oak and crushed almonds.

Name: The Kurayoshi 8 Year Old
Palate: Pink peppercorn, orange peel, lingering toasted oak warmth.
Finish: Macadamia nuts, strawberry jam.
Nose: Toffee, red berry and a hint of violet.

Name: Linkwood 11 Year Old 2010 (cask 209) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: More ripe orchard fruit, with a touch of nettle tea, followed by singed spices.
Finish: Loads of vanilla and apple on the finish.
Nose: Lemon, nectarine, cut grass, and honeycomb.

Name: Glen Elgin 12 Year Old 2009 Syrah Edition - DS Tayman
Palate: Stewed cherries, chocolate raisins and baked apples mingle as peppery heat develops beneath.
Finish: Honeyed plums, sweet barley, and more fresh pear, with lingering drying oak and prickling spice.
Nose: Juicy pears and gristy barley open things up, with jammy pastries and heart wood spice.

Name: Cragganmore Limited Release (Special Release 2016)
Palate: Spicy rhubarb and other stewed fruits, clove, a touch of treacle, cocoa and winter spices.
Finish: Long with more of the same thick fruit as well as some fresh cardamom.
Nose: Thick and fruity from the off with Liquorice Allsorts and pineapple turkish delight dancing above vanilla and hints of sandalwood.

Name: Timberman 15 Year Old
Palate: Peaches in syrup join fresh apricot, dusted with fresh vanilla. Juicy sultanas join, with buttered fruit loaf and spiced biscuits.
Finish: Spices kick in towards the end, dried fruits counter peppery warmth and distant smoked oak.
Nose: Charred, floral oak, and aromatic herbal tea with soft stone fruits and sprinkles of sweet spice.

Name: Kavalan Distillery Select No.2
Palate: Mixed garden herbs and wafts of floral tea with lemon combine with tropical fruits covered with cream and rich vanilla.
Finish: Dry on the finish, with prickly white pepper, bitter oak spice, and wafts of juicy pineapple.
Nose: Sweet, floral melon, bold malt, and tannic oak.

Name: East London Liquor Company East London Blend
Palate: Loads of vanilla notes arrive on the palate, still packed with cherry and raisin, and sparks of peppery rye heat.
Finish: A long finish, with a touch of salted nuts.
Nose: Honey, peanut butter and jam, kirsch, a touch of herbal spice.

Name: Woven Experience No.5.1
Palate: Barley sugar, green peppercorns, vanilla, tobacco, sweet smoke, and warm spices.
Finish: Toasted brown bread, with a touch of tawny marmalade.
Nose: Woody spices, damp oak, distant bonfires, and dried tropical fruits.

Name: Ardmore 13 Year Old 2008 - Paloma (Goldfinch Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Burnt vanilla pod and baked fruits followed by liquorice and earthy, vegetal oak.
Finish: Smoked tea and bright citrus.
Nose: Bittersweet marmalade, toasted almonds, and vanilla.

Name: Talisker 43 Year Old - Xpedition Oak
Palate: Black pepper and chilli dance on the tongue, and then theyâre overtaken by a creaminess. Thereâs a little custard, white peaches and that waxy character again. The smokiness is there in the background but itâs very restrained. That creaminess lingers and is joined by salty maritime notes.
Finish: Very long and mellow, the texture taking on a little marzipan with a crackle of black pepper.
Nose: Vanilla, cooked apple and waxy aromas lead when you first take a sniff. Thereâs a mellow smokiness swirling around beneath with notes of bacon, varnish and that characteristic Talisker saline quality.

Name: Reference Series I.3
Palate: Sourdough and sweet barley, bread crusts and dry Sherry.
Finish: Light, fairly crisp, hints of apÃ©ritif wine, but perhaps more Lillet than the dry vermouth found in I, or are we splitting hairs now?
Nose: Custard cream biscuits shine through initially with fragrant, almost soapy malt developing - or is that the Jelly Tots from Reference Series I? There's a menthol edge, and notes of distant muscovado and cooked apples.

Name: Tobermory 24 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Full body, peppery and aromatic, lots of dried chilli flakes, dark cherries, toffee, and cloves.
Finish: Fiery spice with just a little lingering fudge.
Nose: Wham! Thatâs a mighty nose: dried fruit, Christmas cake, Jamaica Ginger Cake, all the cakes with some fresh raspberry fruit. Wallop!

Name: Maison Benjamin Kuentz Vegetal Musette
Palate: Oaky vanilla, with candied lemon peel, cinnamon, clove, nutmeg, and some green peppercorn.
Finish: Vibrant, sweet and spicy.
Nose: Orange blossom honey, creamy grain, crisp apples, and fresh cut hay.

Name: Reference Series II.2
Palate: Quite meaty again but with less overt Sherry influence than II. Dried apricots and mixed nuts are far more prominent than cherries and chocolate, but they are still there.
Finish: Slightly smoky, nutty oak goes on and on with just a hint of cherry ice cream.
Nose: Juicy and honeyed with a hint of blue cheese that develops as both the meatiness from II and more elemental coastal notes including harbour ropes and seaweed. Well rounded with an almond cake note too.

Name: Lochindaal 10 Year Old 2010 (cask 4359) - Auld Goonsy's Malt
Palate: Peppery spice and oily smoke, a touch medicinal with a sweet balance of green apple, apricot, and oaky vanilla.
Finish: Lingering whisps of earthy iodine, floral honey, and a touch of citrus zest.
Nose: Smouldering sawdust and sea breeze waft beside chocolate and salted vanilla.

Name: Ben Ãideann FÃ¬onain
Palate: Vanilla custard and berry crumble, with barley sugar and spicy oak.
Finish: Cooked cherry and melted dark chocolate, with fragrant tobacco lingering.
Nose: Blackberry jam and toasted oak, with notes of red grape skin and festive spices.

Name: Ergaster Single Malt Whisky - TourbÃ©
Palate: Smoked spices, generously toasted oak, and smouldering bonfire embers lead to vinous fruit and silky vanilla.
Finish: A touch of damp oak lingers with grassy peat smoke, baking spices, and sultanas.
Nose: Vibrant malt and earthen peat open the way, with delicate notes of lemon and mandarin in tow.

Name: Cask Orkney 15 Year Old (A.D. Rattray)
Palate: Grilled tropical fruit, burnt brown sugar, salty nuts, and cinnamon.
Finish: Rich smoke, orange peel, and pine.
Nose: Floral honey, syrupy stone fruit, smoked heather, and bonfire embers.

Name: Catoctin Creek Barrel Select Rye Whisky
Palate: Chocolate, crumbly fudge, and hazelnuts, with big helpings of well-rounded spice and a touch of grass.
Finish: Lingering clove, cinnamon, and chocolate, with a whisper of the lemon peel coming back.
Nose: Fresh baked cookies, with a hint of waxy lemon zest and mint, plenty of spice, and warm oak.

Name: Glenrothes 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 498963) -  Duncan Taylor
Palate: Marzipan, nutty malt, and roasty coffee lead to spiced notes of clove and dense dried fruits.
Finish: More cakey spice, sweet butterscotch, hints of orange zest, finished up with a dash of warming nutmeg.
Nose: Gentle spices with wafts of tea loaf, cooked apple, and musty oak.

Name: Glenalmond Blended Malt
Palate: Oodles of fruity sherry notes alongside fresh white stone fruits, candied citrus peel, vanilla cream and sugared almond.
Finish: Dried fruit and a sprinkle of brown sugar alongside vanilla pod on a lengthy finish.
Nose: Vanilla fudge, sweet malt cereal, cinnamon and a drizzle of honey.
