Name: Glencadam 21 Year Old 2000 (cask 1) - Port Pipe
Palate: Raspberry jam on brown bread, cinnamon, caraway, orange zest.
Finish: Heavy vanilla and toffee, with hints of cinnamon, fizzy oak, and raspberry.
Nose: Cooked rhubarb, anise, honey, vanilla pod, and soft oak.

Name: Moon Harbour Dock 2 - ChÃ¢teau Cantenac-Brown
Palate: Raisins and dried prunes, with a touch of treacle and toasted almond, along with oaky vanilla.
Finish: Lingering nutty finish.
Nose: Dark berry notes, with some dried cherry and earthy blackberries, along with some festive spices.

Name: The Macallan 21 Year Old Fine Oak
Palate: Bourbon oak is prominent on the palate, with citrus and soft spicy smoke.
Finish: Medium length, with chewy spiced oak.
Nose: Fruit salad, fresh herbs and exotic spice.

Name: Glen Garioch 12 Year Old - Canmore
Palate: Drying malt brings subtle spice, with warming cinnamon softened by creamy vanilla pod and sugared almonds.
Finish: Ginger joins bringing more spicy warmth whilst notes of oily barley and waxy citrus continue to develop.
Nose: Burnt sugar, caramelised nuts, a touch of liquorice, and zesty lemon drizzle cake.

Name: Kingsbarns 4 Year Old (Single Cask Release)
Palate: Dried apricots appear among creamy vanilla, ginger nut biscuits, and stewed dark fruits.
Finish: Waxy peels and clove linger.
Nose: Earthy, rich spice prickles through notes of black Wine Gums, dark chocolate, and malt.

Name: GlenAllachie 14 Year Old 2008 (cask 309008011) - (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Dark chocolate, toffee and orange peel with ginger, black pepper and cinnamon.
Finish: Long and nutty with hints of vanilla.
Nose: Dried fruit, dates and toasted nuts with lemon peel.

Name: Glen Aln 9 Year Old
Palate: Roasted nuts, oily malt, and toasted kitchen spices.
Finish: Just a whisper of smoke, with peppery oak lingering.
Nose: Grain sweetness, apple blossom, dried fruit, and cinnamon rolls.

Name: Beverbach Sherry Cask Finish
Palate: Sweet sherried fruits waft amongst tangy oak, creamy vanilla, and caramel digestive biscuits.
Finish: Baking spices increase with hints of leathery oak balancing sweet poached fruit.
Nose: Candied fruits, cakey spice, and rich, roasted malt.

Name: Reference Series II.3
Palate: More fruit now with that old fashioned Sherry influence that permeates II. Chocolate develops towards the end with some rich oak.
Finish: Black Forest gÃ¢teau, milk chocolate and fresh cherries. Glorious.
Nose: Sweet barley, orange and buttercups, as well as some cakey-ness - all notes from II, but are they coming through differently? Given a little time in the glass the juicy fruits that led the nose of II do emerge as well.

Name: Inchgower 13 Year Old 2008 (cask 814356A) - Family Series (The Single Cask)
Palate: Homemade jam, sultana, oily malt, and dulche de leche.
Finish: Nutmeg and treacle.
Nose: Brown sugar, fruit scones, buttery oak, and cut grass.

Name: St. Laurent Whisky - 3 Grains
Palate: A dusting of cocoa, alongside juicy sultana, vanilla pastries, and toasted nuts.
Finish: Dried fruit sweetness, oak char, and a drizzle of caramel.
Nose: Praline, buttery corn, and honeyed porridge.

Name: Rozelieures Vosne RomanÃ©e Cask
Palate: Ripe golden pear, spicy oak, fig, and back pepper.
Finish: Mineral hints alongside dark berries.
Nose: Apricot jam, golden syrup, plum skin, and pomegranate.

Name: Auchnagie - Classic Selection (The Lost Distillery Company)
Palate: Sponge cake (with yet more honey), rice pudding, dried apricot.
Finish: A subtle lick of baking spice appears on the finish.
Nose: Digestive biscuit, banana and thick waves of honey.

Name: Knockdhu 10 Year Old - Skene Whisky
Palate: Floral vanilla, acacia honey, and gingerbread join the notes from the nose.
Finish: Medium-length and a touch spicy.
Nose: Creamy toffee and oak with bright blackberry beneath.

Name: Invergordon 33 Year Old 1988 (cask 528136) - Rare Auld (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Sweet cinnamon, waxy peels, honeyed sweetness, and some spearmint.
Finish: Marmalade, melted chocolate, and a hint of brandy.
Nose: Dried fruit, milk chocolate, brown sugar, a touch of candied peel later on.

Name: Mosgaard Single Malt Whisky - Oloroso Cask (Batch 10)
Palate: Cinnamon and ginger arrive first before honeyed sweetness livens up the palate.
Finish: Toasted cedar, fruitcake, and grilled peach.
Nose: Earthy barley juxtaposed with sultana and dried cherry.

Name: Cladach (Special Release 2018)
Palate: Both sweeter and smokier on the palate with wood smoke, blackberry, stewed apple, and hard toffee. Liquorice Allsorts, honeycomb and a dash of mint keep it lively.
Finish: Gently drying with dark chocolate and more of that smoke, dried orange peel and a dash of vanilla.
Nose: Cladah opens with rich, dark fruits, distant bonfire smoke, petrichor, and leafy pine, before seaweed, salted caramel, and orange oil come through. Lemon drizzle cake and an aromatic fresh air note lift proceedings.

Name: Gerston - Vintage (The Lost Distillery Company)
Palate: Plum, cinnamon, more floral malt and some sugary shortbread.
Finish: A lingering hint of mineral-rich smoke, followed by a hint of red fruit.
Nose: Deliciously floral and aromatic, with a touch of fruitcake underneath.

Name: Dalmore 40 Year Old 1966
Palate: Sherried sultana, wood tannins rise to provide balance and oomph. Thick toffee and zesty ripe orange and marmalade bubbling in a saucepan.
Finish: A little short, chocolate, syrupy, orange.
Nose: Sublime balance and clarity. Winter spice, ginger, cocoa dryness, slightly herbal. Toasted malt loaf buttered and with a liberal helping of Seville marmalade. Oily nuts, banana grilled with Demerara sugar and hazelnut spread. Hint of smoke.

Name: Kinahanâs The KASC Project (M)
Palate: Papaya, peaches, and crÃ¨me caramel, with raisins and dark muscovado sugar.
Finish: Buttery apricot crostata with drying oak.
Nose: Tropical fruit funk, with spiced apple compote, earthy vanilla, and drizzles of dark caramel.

Name: Domaine des Hautes Glaces Moissons Single Malt
Palate: Buttery sultanas, fried banana, beeswax. Subtly earthy with touches of moss and lemongrass.
Finish: Touches of Alpine herbs and caramel.
Nose: Flaky pastry and freshly baked bread, with light wafts of white wine and green apple.

Name: Convalmore 32 Year Old 1984 (Special Release 2017)
Palate: Soft oak and spice with some orange and tomato stem. Adding just a little water transforms the texture of this malt, however, as well as releasing more intense herbal notes. There are signs here of why Convalmore is the most fought-over malt at Diageo HQ.
Finish: More gentle oak, birch sap and oatcakes. Some biscuits too, including Hobnobs.
Nose: Initial Dolly Mix with floral notes at full strength, taking it into Jelly Tot territory too. Barley sugar develops with a touch of tangerine, apple and cedar. Impressive.

Name: Chivas Regal 12 Year Old
Palate: More of those banana chips showing through on the palate, this time there's a creamy hit of barley malt too, pepped up with a little allspice. Notes of ground walnut and caramel.
Finish: Light spice and black pepper on the tail. Lingering notes of cereal sweetness.
Nose: A creamy, aromatic melange of vanilla custard, hints of aniseed, lemon curd and butter toffee. Wood shavings and dried banana chips develop with just a hint of cassis.

Name: Talon's Select Blended Malt
Palate: Honeyed baking spices, digestive biscuits, and fresh white stone fruit.
Finish: Grist, brown sugar, and vanilla linger.
Nose: Hints of orange, malty sweetness, chocolate, and spices.

Name: Bowmore 17 Year Old - 2000s
Palate: Creamy and malty, cinnamon, toffee apples, bread and butter pudding and warming smoke.
Finish: Long and creamy with a smooth vanilla note on the tail.
Nose: Gently smoked with soft peat, Golden Syrup, rum spice, toffee apples and tropical fruit.

Name: The Gladstone Axe The Black Axe with 2x Glasses
Palate: Sweet caramel and delicate, coastal peat smoke, with floral heather and rich, bold oak.
Finish: Gentle peat rests amongst roasted malt, charred oak, and sea breeze.
Nose: Bold malt with layers of vanilla, toasted oak, and wafts of firewood.

Name: Tomintoul 17 Year Old 2005 Pedro XimÃ©nez Sherry Cask Finish
Palate: Rich fruitcake, with warm spices, gentle sweetness, and a touch of toasted hazelnuts.
Finish: Winter spices, with some dryness.
Nose: Fruity and spicy, with cinnamon, candied citrus peel, and raisins.

Name: Auchnagie - Vintage (The Lost Distillery Company)
Palate: Robust vanilla pod, clove and touches of aloe.
Finish: Rather long, with cooked apple and Custard Cream biscuits.
Nose: Poached fruit, barley sugar sweets, caramelised pear and a hint of leather.

Name: Glen Keith 21 Year Old - Secret Speyside Collection
Palate: Peach and pear, basil leaf, dried sultanas and seeded bread.
Finish: Runny toffee and a very subtle hint of smoked almonds.
Nose: Apples, oranges and greengages, with brown sugar and cedar underneath.

Name: The Macallan Classic Cut (2017 Release)
Palate: Caramel, hints of orange zest and a warming nutmeg spice.
Finish: Satisfyingly long, with a warming oak and a sweet mouth coating.
Nose: Creamy vanilla custard, sweet ginger and fresh sweet oak.

Name: Balvenie 1993 PortWood Finish
Palate: Honey, creamy and quite buttery, allspice and a lovely richness with dried mixed peel and ripe fruit.
Finish: A welcome return from the hazelnuts, which remain soft and moist, fading gently.
Nose: Aromatic, raisins, nutty, hazelnuts and almonds, soft acacia honey.

Name: Strathcolm Extra Special (Alistair Forfar)
Palate: Becoming more floral and fruity, a hallmark of the range.
Finish: Vanilla fudge pieces.
Nose: Classic citrus and vanilla grain notes.

Name: Langatun Jacobâs Dram 2016
Palate: The nuttiness builds with roasted almonds, earthen walnuts, and rich, roasted malt. Warm cinnamon buns, vanilla cream, and some gingery heat follow.
Finish: Layers of toasted oak and dark fruit on the finish, with sweet caramel balancing subtly bitter spice.
Nose: Buttered sourdough with nutty honey, oaken vanilla, and sweet sultanas.

Name: Maison Benjamin Kuentz Spicy Nouba
Palate: Cereal, silky caramel, oaky vanilla, some scorched lemon and orange, and more gentle smoke.
Finish: Smoke lingers, along with some alpine herbs.
Nose: Soft smoke, charred peaches and pineapple, with vanilla, and some earthy spices.

Name: Blooming Gorse - Wemyss Family Collection
Palate: Still floral, with hints of citrus blossom and vanilla. Slowly building notes of earthy barley leading to subtly peppery heat.
Finish: Hints of apricot and walnut.
Nose: Heather, milky tea, floral honey and chocolate muffins.

Name: Kura The Whisky - Rum Cask Finish
Palate: Tangy orange and lemon, followed by a touch of menthol. Still quite smoky.
Finish: Burnt sugar, stewed pears and heavy hints of clove.
Nose: Toasted oak to the fore, before a kick of green apple and spiced mango chutney.

Name: Ragtime Rye Whiskey
Palate: Brilliantly mouth-coating. The rye spice gets dialled up a notch here, alongside hearty helpings of nutmeg and cinnamon. Still has plenty of berry notes to it (think blackberry and a hint of raspberry), though now with a pleasing orange glaze.
Finish: Subtly drying, with very evocative notes of fresh, juicy clementine lasting. Red rope liquorice, too.
Nose: An elegant nose full of red berry and clean, classic rye notes. Touches of cherry, golden syrup and a hint of white pepper. Perhaps a whiff of salted liquorice.

Name: The Glenrothes 2010 (bottled 2022) - Wilson & Morgan
Palate: Ginger and cinnamon, dried apricots, walnuts, warm oak, syrupy flapjacks, with some tannins throughout.
Finish: Peppery spices build, along with aromatic oak character.
Nose: Shortbread, toasted almonds, waxy orange peel, and a touch of fruitcake.

Name: Invergordon 19 Year Old 2002 (cask DL16274) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Heaps of green apples with milk chocolate melted over them, and a hint of raspberry.
Finish: Madeira cake and toasted almonds.
Nose: Spicy oak, nougat, apricot yogurt, and creamy vanilla.

Name: Alpenglow Whisky #21
Palate: Smooth and round with notes of dried fruits and almond paste.
Finish: Long and sustained with sweet spices lingering.
Nose: Fruity and delicate with notes of ripe grapes, cereals and malt.

Name: Deanston 12 Year Old 2009 (cask CM279) - The Golden Cask (House of Macduff)
Palate: Creamy lemon curd, a hint of ginger, and waxy honeycomb. Earthy vanilla and coffee nestle beneath.
Finish: Floral malt and drizzles of honey finish things off, with buttery oak and delicate spice.
Nose: Rich barley, toasted oak, and zesty peels with soft pears and a dusting of cinnamon.

Name: Auchentoshan 44 Year Old 1966
Palate: The mouth-feel is incredibly soft and sweet with honey and mead notes followed by a distant herbaceousness.
Finish: The finish is long, fresh and minty.
Nose: A eucalyptus aroma emerges first followed by acacia honey and Christmas cake.

Name: Glentauchers 2008 (bottled 2022) - Distillery Labels (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Cinnamon dusted on apple pie, toasted almonds, and treacle toffee.
Finish: Foam bananas and oak spice.
Nose: Medjool dates and dark chocolate blend with zesty orange and nutmeg.

Name: Gerston - Classic Selection (The Lost Distillery Company)
Palate: Peanut brittle, olive oil, mint leaf and more pastry notes.
Finish: A subtly salty kick on the finish.
Nose: New leather, dried barley, charred oak and apple turnover.

Name: Auchentoshan 10 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Subtle baking spice warmth blends well with continued hints of greengage, mint and orange.
Finish: Nutmeg, soft sawdust salinity and green apple.
Nose: Yellow plum and white grape, with wafts of lemongrass flowing through it.

Name: Tullibardine 7 Year Old (cask 140) - DrÃ m MÃ²r
Palate: Warm, buttery pancakes drizzled with golden syrup, plenty of spice and vanilla bourbon influence coming through, with sweet dried grass.
Finish: Pepper and ginger spice linger, along with creamy vanilla and a hint of waxy lemon zest.
Nose: Light vanilla, with fresh oak, delicate orange blossom, and creamy oatcakes.

Name: Tomintoul 15 Year Old with a Peaty Tang
Palate: Burnt, buttered toast, green apple chunks and vegetal oak with hot white peppercorns. Honey-roasted walnuts linger with a few herbaceous notes underneath.
Finish: Long, warm with spicy cardamom prickling away in the backdrop.
Nose: Aromatic heather roots and charred, musty oak opens onto copper and sherbet lemon effervescence amongst gristly barley sugar.

Name: The Dancing Cultist 12 Year Old - Spirit of Voodoo
Palate: Creamy oak, with wafts of vanilla and buttered teacakes. A touch of caramel balances herbal malt, with a slow build of resinous, vinous oak.
Finish: Rich, dark grapes and heavy oak finish things off, with ripe apples and a touch of clove.
Nose: Floral honey and orchard blossom balance prickles of green pepper.

Name: Dailuaine 14 Year Old 2007 (bottled 2021) - Wilson & Morgan
Palate: Chalky grist and sawdust follow biscuity spice before damp herbs and earthy leather arrive.
Finish: Waxed citrus and a touch of mango join towards the finish, backed up by powerful oak and drying spice.
Nose: Buttered, toasted fruit loaf with candied ginger. Dried apple leads to floral malt and a dusting of nutmeg.

Name: A. Roborel De Climens Finition Rolle
Palate: Stone fruits build with peaches and apricot crossing paths with roasted almonds, and toasted oak. Gently spicy malt gives delicate balance to the sweeter notes.
Finish: Lingering woody spice, floral vanilla, and silky fruits.
Nose: Elegant fruit welcomes the way, white plums, and grapes, a touch of prune and light, floral tobacco.

Name: Beverbach White Oak Cask Finish
Palate: Sweet, floral honey and fragrant vanilla, poached pears drizzled in warm caramel.
Finish: Caramelised biscuits, gently spicy, peppery notes are balanced by more silky vanilla.
Nose: Rich, roasty barley, apricots, and peaches, with floral hints of fresh oak.

Name: Highland 11 Year Old - Founder's Collection (The Whisky Baron)
Palate: Milk chocolate Digestives, with distant bonfires, and candied citrus.
Finish: Peppery spice, grilled stone fruit, with some salted caramel.
Nose: Layers of warm spices, brown sugar, and oaky vanilla, with a touch of orchard fruit.

Name: Stratheden - Vintage (The Lost Distillery Company)
Palate: Crumbly fudge, a very light whiff of coastal peat, brown bread.
Finish: Chocolate-coated raisins and cooking spices.
Nose: Dark fruits and rolling tobacco, with a few hints of brown sugar. Subtly old rum-esque.

Name: Glentauchers 14 year Old - Chorlton Whisky
Palate: Soft layers of sultana studded pastry, drizzles of caramel, with cooked apples and candied pecans in tow.
Finish: Spiced honey and a touch of cocoa, with oily malt and charred oak.
Nose: Malted biscuits, trickles of toffee, chocolate almonds, honeyed peach.

Name: Whisky Magazine Editor's Blend 2018
Palate: Toffee apple and soft oak smokiness, with fresh papaya underneath.
Finish: Lingering citrus freshness and some peppery spice.
Nose: Caraway, caramel and orange peel. A slight whiff of peat warmth.

Name: Teacher's Highland Cream
Palate: Soft smoke, barley malt and manuka honey. Hints of Malt-driven palate with soft spices.
Finish: Malt and smoke on the finish. Classic.
Nose: Fruity, malty aromas. Just a hint of peat smoke with a good dollop of gooey toffee.

Name: The Macallan M Black (2022 Release)
Palate: Candied oranges, charred peaches, and honeyed fig combined with sultana, decadent dark chocolate, emerging into warming peat and spiced ginger.
Finish: Long peat smoke and sweet raisin.
Nose: Fresh apple, pear, and citrus combined with sweet dates developing into subtle light peat.

Name: The Macallan M Black (2020 Release)
Palate: Warming wood spices and peat with black forest fruits opening into vanilla, dark chocolate, ginger and fig medley. Ginger continues throughout as the combination of orange oil and peat gently rises and falls.
Finish: Long lingering peat smoke with a raisin sweetness.
Nose: Dark chocolate and cherry, moving into vanilla and peat. Delicate wood spices, hints of dried fruit and treacle.

Name: Reference Series III.3
Palate: Thick and chewy with calves leather and crumbly chocolate. Juicy dates, Corinth raisins and a touch of subtle mint.
Finish: A little more pleasant leather and tiramisu sprinkled with cocoa.
Nose: Coffee bean, chocolate bread, a touch of marzipan, ice cream with toffee pieces, flamed orange peel and vanilla pods. Just a hint of blackcurrants on the bush.

Name: Port Charlotte PMC:01 2013
Palate: Conference Pears, blackberries, stewed plums, vanilla, melon, and ginger, with a touch of marzipan.
Finish: Smoke and sea linger with more cooked black fruit.
Nose: Classic Islay salty maritime notes meet rich peat smoke, red fruits, rose, honey, aged leather, and clove.

Name: Artesia Limited Edition Porto
Palate: Creamy cereal, with more dried fruits, apricots, figs, and currants, with toasted almonds.
Finish: Nuttiness on the finish, with some peppery spice.
Nose: Some cherries, dried apple and raisins, with a touch of coffee beans.

Name: The Oxford Artisan Distillery Rye Whisky - Batch 4
Palate: Vanilla cheesecake, digestive biscuits, liquorice, black pepper, clove, a hint of warm oak.
Finish: Slightly chocolatey, with hints of banana once again.
Nose: Subtly floral at first with citrus blossom and lavender, before a bundle of baked goods arrives â ginger snaps, banana bread, chocolate chip cookies.

Name: Bower Hill Barrel Reserve
Palate: Well-rounded vanilla. Subtle vegetal sweetness at points (tobacco perhaps?). Sugary boiled sweets.
Finish: Brown sugar and Swedish pepparkakor.
Nose: Pear, apple and milky coffee. A hint of burnt sugar.

Name: Reference Series III.1
Palate: Even thicker and chewier than III, you need a fork for this. Dates and raisins again, with a little more prune but it's all wrapped in chocolate still. Great intensity.
Finish: Thick chocolate, cocoa mousse, coffee cake and the faintest suggestion of mint but the herbal notes have been dialled down in favour of darker notes throughout.
Nose: Creamy with fresh berries, macadamia and Ferrero Rocher. The coffee bean, calves leather and rich toffee from III are all there too before more perfumed notes emerge, crÃ¨me fraÃ®che and fruit and nut.

Name: Inchgower 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 348069)  - James Eadie
Palate: Stem ginger, dark chocolate, a smidge of anise and orange.
Finish: Marmalade on rye toast, vanilla pod, a hint of coffee.
Nose: Soft currant bun sweetness, with some grassy malt and a touch of flinty minerals.

Name: Lossit - Classic Selection (The Lost Distillery Company)
Palate: Cigar box, buttered crumpets, sea salt light hints of basil.
Finish: Remains packed with vanilla and peat.
Nose: Damp oak, earthy peat and a hearty helping of milk chocolate.

Name: Reference Series I.2
Palate: Mouthfilling and slightly effervescent all at once, roasted chestnuts, chardonnay and flatbread with a hint of smoky baba ganoush.
Finish: Well-rounded with seeded bread and clean oakiness as well as lingering smoke.
Nose: A sack of perfumed malt sat on a harbour quay, custard and salted butter, flaxseed oil and Jelly Tots.

Name: Mars Komagatake Shinshu Aging 2022 Edition
Palate: Waves of vanilla and caramel counter prickles of pepper and ginger, while toasted hazelnuts and leathery oak develop beneath.
Finish: Barley sugars, a touch of tannic oak, melon, and sweet citrus.
Nose: Floral honey and orchard blossom are followed by hints of green apple, vanilla, and a touch of woody spice.

Name: Artesia Limited Edition Sherry
Palate: Sweet sherry character, with drizzles of caramel, fresh peaches, hazelnuts, and some gingery spice.
Finish: Sweet and nutty.
Nose: Dried apricots and sultanas, with some toasted brioche, and brown sugar.

Name: Brig O' Perth 14 Year Old
Palate: Creamy malt and a touch of milk chocolate, followed by peppercorn, orange zest, and vanilla tablet.
Finish: Warming oak sticks around long on the finish.
Nose: A bounty of vanilla and cooked fruit, with a good whiff of forest floor richness developing later on.

Name: Benrinnes 2011 (bottled 2022) - Wilson & Morgan
Palate: Floral orchard honey and fragrant dried spices mingle, while oaken caramel and soaked sultanas bring sweetness to buttered malt loaf.
Finish: Things stay fruity, with notes of blueberry pancakes, candied nuts, milk chocolate, and vanilla cream.
Nose: A host of fresh apples and pears are followed by sweet peaches and dried berries, joined by waves of buttery pastry.

Name: Ardmore 2010 (bottled 2022) - Wilson & Morgan
Palate: A rich tangle of peat smoke and vanilla fudge, with sticky toffee and baked apple pastry cushioning warming green peppercorns.
Finish: Silky butterscotch tackles the pepper, while drying bonfire smoke and burnt toffee remain.
Nose: Sweet and smoky with oily malt and buttery shortbread, a hint of fruit tea, apricot, and charred oak.

Name: Waterford Arcadian - Gaia 2.1
Palate: Toasted almond, flaky pastry, vanilla pod, citrus peels, a good crack of peppery heat.
Finish: Strawberry tart, with a dollop of vanilla ice cream.
Nose: Soft hints of rhubarb and red berry sweetness, with touches of popcorn and floral breeze alongside.

Name: SPEY Trutina Cask Strength - Batch 3
Palate: Creamy custard, buttery fudge, sweet pear, and apricot tart.
Finish: Apple crumble with subtle spice and vanilla cream, just a pinch of pepper on the end.
Nose: Delicate vanilla, butterscotch and toffee apples.

Name: Peg Whisky Small Batch Exclusive Series 1
Palate: Biscuit dough, chocolate once again, growing hints of anise and nutmeg.
Finish: Lingering baking spice warmth.
Nose: Chocolate orange, vanilla pod and some floral malt.

Name: Twilight Gold 10 Year Old Blended Malt Scotch Whisky
Palate: More candied citrus, underripe pear, and crystallised ginger.
Finish: Set honey, and woody spices.
Nose: Dried apple, lemon jam, and heather honey.

Name: The Epicurean Glasgow Edition Release No.2
Palate: A slick balance of creamy vanilla, fresh pastries, and vegetal herbs, with soft butterscotch lingering throughout.
Finish: Fresh mint rests beneath milk chocolate Brazil nuts and peppery oak.
Nose: Zesty malt and citrus peels lead, with hints of seeded bread and peppery spice.

Name: Armorik 10 Year Old
Palate: Zesty citrus, more tropical fruit, butterscotch, and sweet malt, with hints of nuts and raisins.
Finish: Ginger spice and marmalade on toast.
Nose: Green apple, pineapple, and vanilla blossom, with some frangipane and freshly-baked bread in tow.

Name: Annandale Man OâWords Vintage 2015 â Sherry Cask (cask 821)
Palate: Cinnamon biscuits, walnut, raisin, a little milk chocolate.
Finish: Dry barley, orange once again, and nutmeg.
Nose: Honey and waxy citrus peels, with sultanas and pecans in support.

Name: Hamiltons Lowland Single Malt Scotch Whisky
Palate: Light, as can be expected of a release looking to capture a classic Lowland style with more sweet fragrant cereal.
Finish: Delicate and moreish.
Nose: Attractive summer nose with dried grass, malt and sweet violet.

Name: Islay 8 Year Old 2013 - South Star Spirits
Palate: Salted caramel, vanilla tablet, seaweed, and shortbread.
Finish: Roasted nuts and a hint of ash.
Nose: Earthy smoke, with fragrant malt and some coastal salinity.

Name: Old Perth 12 Year Old - Aged Collection
Palate: Plump sultanas and raisins, dates, and wafts of dark jammy berries, honeyed biscuits, spicy oak, and cinnamon.
Finish: Dried, boozy fruit notes continue along with milk chocolate and spicy wafts of ginger, nutmeg, and anise.
Nose: Fruit and nut chocolate, rich malt, warming baking spices.

Name: Highland Lights 12 Year Old Whisky
Palate: Toffee pennies and an abundance of stone fruits, with dried apricot and peach backed up by warm blueberry muffins. Walnut oil follows, with bold barley in tow.
Finish: Malted biscuits, stroopwafels, dried apples, and cinnamon sugar.
Nose: Stewed plums and pears, a touch of pine. Notes of maple and blueberry bring fluffy pancakes to mind.

Name: Linkwood 9 Year Old 2012 - Benchmark (Murray McDavid) 46%
Palate: Delicious layers of sweet candied fruit, vanilla custard, and buttery pastry, with charred pineapple and zesty marmalade.
Finish: Honeyed fruit remains, joined by mellow spice, juicy sultanas, and sweet oak.
Nose: Honeyed granola, fresh apples, and berries, with creamy oak and a hint of ginger.

Name: Angelsâ Nectar - Cairngorms Edition (Third Edition)
Palate: Crunchy pear and apple, with a thick layer of toffee.
Finish: Marzipan, lemon cheesecake, and hint of crushed cinnamon.
Nose: Honeyed malt and juicy orchard fruit, whiff of cedar underneath.

Name: Catoctin Creek Roundstone Rye Distiller's Edition
Palate: A big hit of ginger and toasted nuts alongside cigar box, cocoa and maple syrup.
Finish: Butterscotch lingers alongside more cocoa and a touch of lemon peel.
Nose: Mint chocolate and spicy oak, with sweet shop aromas leading into freshly baked cookies.

Name: The Oxford Artisan Distillery Rye Whisky - Batch 2
Palate: Richly fruity with redcurrant and blackberry, though the earthiness of the rye still manages to sneak through. Honey and vanilla remains.
Finish: Spicy cardamom and cassia, with a touch of fried banana.
Nose: Toffee pennies, almond and walnut, red liquorice, cooked orchard fruit, and familiar peppery heat.

Name: Wire Works Virgin Oak Finish
Palate: Vanilla fudge, banana foam sweeties, dried fruit, and some chocolate emerge first followed by hints of marmalade, dates, lime zest, and a nutty element.
Finish: Sweet and slightly drying.
Nose: Brown sugar, red apples, cinder toffee, and a little cinnamon as well as some leather.

Name: Towiemore - Classic Selection (The Lost Distillery Company)
Palate: Caramelised banana and apple, with a layer of salted butter.
Finish: Christmas spices and toasted almonds.
Nose: Juicy white peach and raspberries, with underlying hints of oily walnut.

Name: Waterford Heritage - Hunter 1.1
Palate: Rich shortbread, with a touch of orange oil, fragrant orchard fruits, dusty grain, and rounded spices.
Finish: A touch of oaky char lingers, along with green oak.
Nose: Sun dried hay, with some pencil shavings, oaky spice, and apple.

Name: Dailuaine 2011 (bottled 2022) - Wilson & Morgan
Palate: More sweet citrus, with a touch of bitter pith in tow, honeyed nuts, and sultanas follow with a balance of creamy malt and drying oak.
Finish: A touch of tobacco towards the finish, with silky caramel and chocolate raisins balancing prickles of root ginger.
Nose: Zesty marmalade and fresh orchard fruits aplenty, with biscuity malt and toasted oak.

Name: Staoisha 3 Year Old 2018 - Signature Series (The Whisky Baron)
Palate: Sweet smoke, maple glazed bacon, and a touch of spiced fruit cake.
Finish: A touch of seaweed, with lingering bonfire.
Nose: Coastal peat, with notes of brown sugar, and prunes.

Name: Hibiki Japanese Harmony Master's Select
Palate: Chocolate orange, creamy wood notes, dried apricot and sultanas, cinnamon.
Finish: Plum and ginger. Brown sugar and milk chocolate.
Nose: Citrus blossom, mango and juicy raisins. A slight touch of vanilla-rich oak.

Name: House of Macduff Selkie Batch #3
Palate: Delicate lemon and salted caramel with singed heather shrouded by bonfire embers.
Finish: Oak char and a touch of ginger.
Nose: Grassy peat smoke drifts through creamy vanilla, poached pears, and a little marzipan.

Name: Linkwood 14 Year Old - Skene Dhu
Palate: Toffee apples and cinnamon with dark chocolate in support.
Finish: Medium-length and pleasant.
Nose: Heaps of autumnal fruits are partnered welcomely by baking spice and sherry-soaked nuts.

Name: Bowmore 30 Year Old (2021 Release)
Palate: Intense tropical fruits with a subtle sweetness and warm peat smoke.
Finish: Mouth warming with ripe fruits lingering on the tongue.
Nose: Ripe apricot, charred pineapple, mango, and butterscotch.

Name: Hellyers Road Pinot Noir Cask Finish
Palate: A big, rich, sweet palate with strawberry jam and cracked black pepper. Oily and mouth-filling, with a wonderful blackcurrant note. A dash of nutmeg adds some real complexity late palate.
Finish: Short-to-medium with sweet, fruity honey on the finish.
Nose: Buttery, biscuity, malty aromas. Hints of Pina Colada, allspice, a little tropical fruit. Thereâs also an underlying berry fruit character. Honeyed and very inviting.

Name: Clynelish Select Reserve (Special Release 2015)
Palate: Custard and cocoa, thick, delicious and comforting.
Finish: Spicy and sweet with a hint of salinity.
Nose: Super buttery at first, rather than waxy per se, it's like custard. There's some jaffa cake in there, but it's more cake than jaffa, pepper too.

Name: Strathcolm 12 Year Old (Alistair Forfar)
Palate: Caramel and more citrus zest and sweets with white chocolate.
Finish: Subtle heather toffees.
Nose: Light and fragrant with vanilla and orange blossom.

Name: The Oxford Artisan Distillery Rye Whisky - Batch 3
Palate: Honeydew melon, raspberry, white chocolate, dry oak, a familiar peppery heat lingering, plus smoke reappearing.
Finish: Vanilla, blackcurrant, soft rye, and apple.
Nose: Wine-soaked dried fruit, liquorice, toasted cedar with a smidge of smoke, and a few vegetal flickers.

Name: Bruichladdich High Noon - Feis Ile 2015
Palate: Juicy with fresh berries and Sherry. A slight coastal hint comes through. Cracked black pepper.
Finish: Lingering Sherry-soaked orchard fruits and white oak.
Nose: Strawberries, vanilla malt and old oak.

Name: Langatun Old Deer Classic Cask Proof
Palate: More malt, with orchard fruit and orange peel coming through.
Finish: Long and surprisingly mellow for a cask strength whisky.
Nose: Clean malt and fresh vanilla bean. A little bit of fresh apple.

Name: Dewar's 8 Year Old Ilegal Smooth
Palate: Sweet honey and caramel, cooked green vegetables and peppers, with warming heat.
Finish: Lingering peppery spice with herbaceous funk and sweet oaken malt.
Nose: Vegetal notes with malted barley, soft smoke, sweet agave, honey and dried heather.

Name: The Macallan 12 Year Old 1992 Elegancia
Palate: Spice and citrus balanced with a nutty maltiness.
Finish: Sweet toffee with spice and light oak.
Nose: Light citrus with vanilla, sweet toffee, spice, and oak.

Name: ChÃ¢teau du Breuil Single Malt
Palate: The nuttiness continues with toasted almonds and sweet marzipan. Floral vanilla leads to a touch of citrus zest, with cedar resting beneath.
Finish: Fresh and fruity with vibrant, biscuity malt, delicate oak, and sweet, lingering spice.
Nose: Delicate fruits with soft peach and ripe pear, followed by nutty, woody malt.

Name: Dalmore 40 Year Old (2022 Release)
Palate: Orange peel, chocolate truffles, old English marmalade, and crushed walnuts.
Finish: Black forest fruits, poached pear laced with caramel, and dark chocolate.
Nose: Cherries, plums, sultanas, toffee apple, and vanilla pod.

Name: Beathan 2010 (bottled 2022) - Wilson & Morgan
Palate: Bold barley with layers of leathery oak and elegant smoke, juicy sultanas, and floral honey.
Finish: Rich oak char, hints of heather and toffee, with plenty of warming baking spice and lingering whispers of peat smoke.
Nose: Hearty helpings of soaked berries, buttery pastry, and sherried fruit, alongside earthy peat, and smouldering hay.

Name: Amrut Peated Port Pipe (cask 2712)
Palate: Fragrant tobacco, bonfire embers, drying spice balanced by juicy stone fruits.
Finish: A touch vegetal with robust malt, balanced by delicate red fruits and smoked oak.
Nose: Dark, stewed berries, sweet liquorice, roasted nuts, and earthy oak char.

Name: Caperdonich 25 Year Old Peated - Secret Speyside Collection
Palate: A melody of sweet pear and gentle bonfire smoke, soft fruits and green apple echoing the nose.
Finish: Balanced and long.
Nose: Sweet smoke, notes of seaweed and freshly cut green apple.

Name: Ardmore 10 Year Old 2009 - Single & Single
Palate: Peppery oak and earthy vanilla pod, with a touch of oak char and golden syrup.
Finish: Honey and mint milk chocolate.
Nose: Candied ginger and chocolate marble cake, with hints of toasted nuts.

Name: Linkwood 9 Year Old - Solasta Spirits
Palate: A slow build of vanilla sponge, cut grass and honeydew melon.
Finish: Sugared peels and crushed peppercorns.
Nose: Tangy mango and pineapple, with a touch of cask char giving a savoury, balancing note.

Name: Crabbie 18 Year Old
Palate: More tropical fruity notes, along with singed heather, cinnamon rolls, and milky coffee.
Finish: Spiced, honeyed French toast.
Nose: Banana bread, golden syrup, orange chocolate, and oak spice.

Name: Teerenpeli 2013 (bottled 2022) (cask 13B) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Manuka honey, blood orange, cinnamon, and a helping of malty vanilla.
Finish: Notes of fruitcake linger.
Nose: Sherry-soaked dates, toasted almonds, gingerbread, and BBQ meats.

Name: Tobermory 9 Year Old 2013 (cask 9664) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: The ginger is more syrupy now, followed by ripe pear, honey, and vanilla sweetness.
Finish: Sweet barley, a touch of white pepper, stewed apple, and golden syrup.
Nose: Toffee apple, fried banana, and a kick of spicy ginger.

Name: Arbikie Highland Rye 1794 (2020 Release)
Palate: Nutmeg, biscuit dough, honeyed cereal, jammy sultanas, liquorice.
Finish: Chocolate sponge cake, clove, candied ginger.
Nose: Damson jam, toasted cedar, black pepper, fudge, and cinnamon.

Name: High Coast Hav - Oak Spice
Palate: A little cracked black pepper flickers through a rounded and full-bodied palate, which carries plenty of thick caramel, tropical fruit and vanilla cookies.
Finish: A hint of citrus fruit, brown sugar and earthy florals remain.
Nose: The first thing you notice is spicy malt notes, then comes the fruit - candied orange peel and raspberries. Dark chocolate, dried grass and cinnamon flavours emerge and are then followed by a little marzipan.

Name: The English 2010 Heavily Smoked
Palate: Caramel, more of that beautiful salinity and more than a touch of red fruit, and nectarine.
Finish: Long, lingering, and with unremitting wave after wave of that sweet, sweet peat.
Nose: Seaweed, salted caramel, and oodles of rich and creamy smoke.

Name: Ardmore 2011 (bottled 2021) (cask 801901) - Samaroli
Palate: Quite oily on the palate, with more savoury, meaty notes balanced by sweet spices, plus a touch of cherry.
Finish: Slightly bready, with smoke and salted peanut notes.
Nose: Gingerbread, old oak furniture with a hint of wood polish, Frazzles.

Name: A. Roborel De Climens Finition Ugni Blanc
Palate: Heavy notes of sweet poached fruit and oily, leathery oak with musty, earthen spice lingering.
Finish: Dense oak and roasted malt continue, with more baked fruit and powerful spice.
Nose: Creamy vanilla with floral oak, charred wood, and delicate orchard fruits.

Name: Peated Blended Malt - Prologue (Chapter 7)
Palate: Sugary cereals, toasted almonds, and orchard fruit are joined by sparks of white pepper.
Finish: Smoky, spicy, and delicately sweet.
Nose: Cooked apple, floral barley, bonfire smoke, and lemon peel.

Name: Shortcross Rye & Malt Irish Whiskey
Palate: Heaps of homemade marmalade on brown bread, so vibrant and clear you can almost taste the little bits of orange peel. Thereâs also dark honey, aromatic ginger, and some green apple sharpness.
Finish: Soft and supple, with more creamy fudge and orangey goodness.
Nose: Orange chocolate, coffee fudge, dried apricot, vanilla, and some toasted almonds in support with a sprinkling of sweet baking spice.

Name: La Piautre Single Malt TourbÃ©
Palate: Lemon peel, vanilla sweetness, and toasted peppercorns.
Finish: A smoky finish, with hints of floral honey.
Nose: The initial peat smoke leads into lemon blossom, honeyed toast, and tannic oak.

Name: Spade & Bushel 14 Year Old - Sweet Marsala Wine Finish
Palate: Aromatic baking spice with warm toasty oak and red berry sweetness.
Finish: Spicy and smooth.
Nose: Butterscotch, marzipan, and lots of bright citrus fruits.

Name: Tomintoul 20 Year Old 2001 (cask 1) - Port Pipe
Palate: Cocoa powder, blueberry muffin, maple syrup, cinnamon, and strawberry ice cream.
Finish: Lasting strawberry and blackcurrant hints.
Nose: Raspberry jam on toast, with hints of clove and vanilla underneath.

Name: Mars Maltage Cosmo â Manzanilla Cask Finish
Palate: Still has a raspberry jam hint to it, now paired with raisin and prune. Nutty coffee, vanilla, and caramel.
Finish: Quite long, with whispers of cassia and black pepper developing underneath the wine-like sweetness.
Nose: Milk chocolate, raspberry, orange zest, and walnut.

Name: Bruichladdich 1988/30 - The Untouchable
Palate: Like liquid velvet laced with coconut and citrus. Honeyed granola, toasted malt and mellow toasted oak take a hold of your palate. A classic Bruichladdich style, elegant and floral at first before allowing the oak to sweep in with pipe tobacco and fudge. A second sip brings some fruit, ripe pineapple, mango and hint of mint.
Finish: The finish shows a little more of the marine element of the maturation. A sea breeze with wood spice and fudge. The toasted oak goes the distance too and seems to bring along a little mango and aniseed to finish.
Nose: Hugely floral, sun dried hay, coconut oil, buttercups and primrose. Vanilla fudge, porridge with golden syrup and a sweet citrus tang. Over time the coconut becomes stronger and dried apricot and sherbet come through more. A definitive American oak style, toasted oak and vanilla caramel hold the fruit from the spirit.

Name: The Exceptional Malt - 2nd Edition
Palate: Thick and nutty. Peanut skins and some corn notes too with anise spice throughout and gingerbread also.
Finish: Into mixed nuts now, slightly dry and lip smacking before red berries linger.
Nose: Pleasantly meaty at first with Dolly mixture, touches of toastiness (almost peaty for a moment) then into swathes of brandy butter. Orange peel and sweet dried fruit develop.

Name: Henstone Single Malt Whisky - Ex-Oloroso Casks
Palate: Dried apricots, earthy vanilla, ginger snaps, and stewed plums.
Finish: Waxy peels, clove, and chocolate ice-cream.
Nose: Blackcurrant Starburst, cinnamon, and earthy barley, along with some dark chocolate.

Name: Westland Colere 2nd Edition - Outpost Range
Palate: Brown sugar sweetness, with orange marmalade, bittersweet dark chocolate, and forest fruits.
Finish: Orange chocolate lingers.
Nose: Lemon curd, gentle woody vanilla, raspberry coulis, and citrus peels.

Name: Benrinnes 9 Year Old 2012 (GreatDrams)
Palate: Waves of vanilla and milk chocolate, with spiced fruit compote and a touch of caraway.
Finish: Bold clove and cinnamon sweetness building from the sherried fruit, and a low hum of mahogany.
Nose: Dense malt with a hint of meatiness to it, backed up by dried fruit and festive spices.

Name: Speyside & Lowland - Double Barrel (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Flaky almond pastries, milky tea, more orange and lemon, now with a smidge of mango in tow.
Finish: Softly spicy with dry cedar and nutmeg.
Nose: Honeyed barley with a whiff of fresh citrus and peach in the background.

Name: Black Bull 21 Year Old (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Spicy on the palate with nutmeg and clove, balanced with rich vanilla, malt and more demerara sugar.
Finish: A balanced finish of spice and sweetness.
Nose: Opens with huge notes of juicy, fresh apples and oranges, followed by sweet, slightly burnt brown sugar notes.

Name: Tomintoul 40 Year Old Quadruple Cask
Palate: Subtle yet exquisitely complex, as summer fruits and buttery toffee intermingle with refined notes of coffee, liquorice and lemon sherbet.
Finish: Gentle oak-spice swirls with sweet liquorice.
Nose: Delicate and reassuringly mature. Mixed fruits dance with the gentle barley-sweet malt that is buttery and creamy. Hints of pineapple caress invitingly.

Name: Arran Smugglers' Series Volume Three - The Exciseman
Palate: It coats the tongue and the notes of apple and vanilla are in abundance. No hint of dryness on the palate, it grows in sweet intensity and provides a rounded mouthfeel. The addition of water opens up the complexity beautifully and reveals a lighter sweetness of candied lemon.
Finish: Long, luxurious and yet delightfully fresh. The notes of apple and citrus give a lightness of character whilst the body remains solidly complex and robust. A typical Arran with an added layer of sweetness.
Nose: The rich honeyed character is immediate on the nose, luxuriously decadent. The fresh coastal character is also evident. Apples, vanilla and a touch of spice are also subtly present with a hint of toasted oak.

Name: Strathcolm 8 Year Old (Alistair Forfar)
Palate: Dried grass, soft toffee, foam bananas and milk bottle sweets.
Finish: Subtle with cornflour covered sweets.
Nose: Light oak supported by aromatic flora and bison grass.

Name: Cambus 33 Year Old 1988 (cask 59256 & 59258) - The Whisky Cellar
Palate: More brown sugar and nutty notes, with a smidge of bubblegum balanced by mature oak richness.
Finish: Toasted cedar, dried apricot, and cinnamon.
Nose: Nutty hints of almond and pecan, drenched in caramel.

Name: Glengoyne 8 Year Old 2014 (cask DL16333) - Provenance (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Creamy, rich malt with apple pie, toffee, and a hint of porridge oats.
Finish: Lemon zest and honey-coated barley.
Nose: Red berries, earthy vanilla, with sugary white chocolate, and a touch of cinnamon.

Name: Filliers 10 Year Old Single Malt - Sherry Oak Casks
Palate: Nutty caramel, gingerbread, stewed apple, and earthy vanilla.
Finish: Garden herbs and hints of sherried funk.
Nose: Richly sherried with dried fruit, cinnamon, oily walnuts, and dark chocolate.

Name: The Lost Distilleries Blend - Batch 11
Palate: Thick, honeyed and deep, with zesty orange peel, candied rhubarb and a layer of darker fruits. Oak spices begin to grow as the palate progresses with helpings of bittersweet dark chocolate, menthol tobacco and the slightest forest floor note.
Finish: A final lick of heather honey appears in a very long, juicy and ripe finish.
Nose: The nose is all bread and butter pudding with plenty of dried fruit and vanilla ice-cream initially, before ripe banana and custard apple develop. Distinctive damp grass and polished oak emerge underneath among some creamy cashew nuttiness, white chocolate and lemon sherbets.

Name: Langatun 4 Year Old 2014 - Winter Wedding
Palate: More earthy smoke, with peppery oak and sultana sweetness alongside fresh malt.
Finish: Woody smoke and sweet brown sugar lingers.
Nose: Burnt custard, barley sugar and ripe orchard fruit, with summer berries and a whisper of smoke.

Name: The Boston Bakers Irish Whiskey
Palate: Gentle wafts of oaken caramel, more orchard fruits, oatcakes with marmalade, an underlying prickle of peppery warmth.
Finish: Fresh pear, baked apple, and dried berries with mixed nuts and vanilla cream, countering a bold, spicy core.
Nose: Chocolate coated nuts, creamy malt, buttered popcorn with zesty green apples to balance floral vanilla.

Name: Benrinnes 13 Year Old 2008 - Paloma (Goldfinch Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Spiced biscuits, soft peaches and plums, and a touch of white chocolate.
Finish: Crisp lemon zest and a touch of vegetal oak.
Nose: Orange zest, vanilla cream, and a whiff of cinnamon sweetness.

Name: A. Roborel De Climens Finition SÃ©millon
Palate: Rich and mouthcoating, sweet, vinous character and bold malt combine with silky fruit notes and oily oak.
Finish: Plump sultanas and candied fruits, soft peat lingers with floral smoke and toasted oak spice.
Nose: A whiff of grilled peach, orange zest, and crushed nuts. Subtle peat smoke is apparent, amongst sweeter fruit notes.

Name: Blair Athol 2008 (bottled 2022) (cask 11086) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Apple crumble, spiced apple chutney, apricot compote, and some oaky vanilla.
Finish: Oaky spices linger.
Nose: Fresh and fruity, with dried apricots, candied peel, and some hazelnut.

Name: Fercullen 10 Year Old
Palate: Soft mouth feel carries notes of vanilla pod, pear, peach and more honey, with a touch of white chocolate in there too.
Finish: Gingerbread warmth and citrus peels.
Nose: Ripe mango and apple, with honey on toast and citrus blossom.

Name: Benrinnes 15 Year Old 2007 (cask 362134) - James Eadie
Palate: Dark chocolate, buttered malt loaf, Toffee Crisp, and apple skins.
Finish: Some floral elements and rooibos tea.
Nose: Buttery biscuit, red berries, and hickory-smoked bacon.

Name: Islay #3 13 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Mocha, more spicy smoke, blackcurrant, and toasted teacake.
Finish: Salted butter and malt loaf, and the final embers of a bonfire.
Nose: Richly smoky, with drying hints of anise and menthol underneath, supported by rum soaked raisins.

Name: Clynelish Select Reserve (2014 Special Release)
Palate: Great mouthfeel, more orange, more sweeties too but again they're kept in check by the balanced citrus and wood spices. Honeysuckle and ginger, complex and delicious.
Finish: Long,warming and spicy with some satisfying grip.
Nose: Waxy, Jaffa Cakes, milk choc. It's Clynelish alright, and a good'un. Disco sweets, jazzes too (the white ones), but don't think this is all sugary or sickly because it isn't. A sprinkling of cinnamon, fresh orange and orchard fruit round off a beautiful nose.

Name: New Riff Single Barrel Rye (50.6%)
Palate: Somewhat oily, with a touch of honey balancing heaps of spice, with Turkish delight and strawberry laces.
Finish: Barrel char and hallmark rye spice lingers on.
Nose: Baklava sweetness and a good crack of black pepper, with clove-studded orange.

Name: AthrÃº Keshcorran 14 Year Old
Palate: Honeyed melon, orange, brown sugar, cinnamon, ginger, a touch of strawberry liquorice laces.
Finish: Toffee, melted butter, more strawberry sweeties.
Nose: Pear tart and apple crumble, with oak and toffee carrying on underneath.

Name: Ledaig 17 Year Old - Batch 7 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Salted butter, seaweed, brown sugar, smoke, lemon zest and fizzy strawberry laces.
Finish: Earthy smoke lasts for minutes afterwards.
Nose: Driftwood, roasted barley, cooked apple and sugary pastry.

Name: Fettercairn 10 Year Old 2009 (cask DMG13923) - Clan Denny  (Douglas Laing)
Palate: CrÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e, caramelised pineapple, and runny honey.
Finish: Sweet porridge and green apple zing.
Nose: Old bookcase, raspberry tarts, and fresh toast.

Name: Moon Harbour Dock 2 - ChÃ¢teau Rieussec
Palate: Velvety and sweet, with buttered popcorn, salted caramel, almond pastries, and some oaky spice.
Finish: Some peppery spices but with lingering vanilla sweetness.
Nose: Delicate orange blossom honey, with creamy vanilla custard, and some nuttiness.

Name: Macduff 12 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Cereal sweetness takes the lead, orange blossom, caramel and dry spice follow.
Finish: Black pepper, a hint of brown sugar and more citrus.
Nose: Sweet floral, nutty malt and bruised black fruit initially. Burnt tobacco and roasted nuts add an interesting depth among vanilla, lemon sponge and a little herbal note.

Name: Mosgaard Single Malt Whisky - Port Wine Cask (Batch 4)
Palate: Red fruit jam, hints of sultanas and plums, crushed nuts lead to spicy wafts of currant buns.
Finish: Sweet biscuity barley, soft caramel, dark pressed fruits, a prickle of spicy oak.
Nose: Dark, vinous fruit with roasted coffee, hints of toasted oak, and sweet cake spice.

Name: Glen Moray 14 Year Old 2007 - North Star Spirits
Palate: Winter spices, vanilla custard with warm jam, raisins, spiced fruits.
Finish: Clotted cream, dried raspberry, sherried fruit, and warming, cakey spice.
Nose: Juicy red fruits, floral berries, and charred, sweet oak.

Name: Beverbach Limited Release 2018 Single Malt
Palate: Stewed plum, spicy oak, cinnamon-spiced apple crumble and lots of dried fruit.
Finish: Caramel, grape skin and vanilla oak.
Nose: Sherried fruit, with floral malt, raisin and swirls of smoke, with vanilla custard.

Name: Longmorn 23 Year Old - Secret Speyside Collection
Palate: Sweet fruity pear mixed with lemon curd and a touch of crystallised ginger.
Finish: Voluptuous with a warming spice.
Nose: Sweet and fruit with notes of creamy milk chocolate orange and a scent of sandalwood.

Name: Bowmore 1969 50 Year Old - Vaults Series
Palate: Initially dry and floral with notes of carnations, developing into sweeter notes of lemon meringue, grilled almonds, and light crÃ¨me caramel fudge, with a hint of white pepper, nutmeg oak spices, and light coconut.
Finish: Lightly sweet and warm with subtle floral notes and malty flavours.
Nose: Freesia, dried geranium, and lilies of the valley merge with the aromas of Chablis, citrus fruits, and gooseberries, followed by sweeter notes of acacia honey, apple pie, vanilla pods, and cream.

Name: Tormore 24 Year Old 1995 (cask 13455) - Xtra Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: The palate has an abundance of stewed fruit, oven baked butter pastry with a hint of spice and a touch of oak.
Finish: A beautifully elegant and long finish with a citrus tang... lemon peel and tangerines balanced by a creamy barley style.
Nose: The nose opens with fresh passion fruit, Malted summer barley married alongside soft pears and cinnamon sticks.

Name: Rock Island 14 Year Old Sherry Edition
Palate: Sweet smoked meats, salted caramel, with cinnamon and nutmeg.
Finish: Lingering smoke and raisin sweetness.
Nose: Sea spray and coastal peat, with some dried red fruits.

Name: Teaninich 10 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: More brown bread with honey and marmalade notes lead among aromatic winter spice and some creamy, nutty elements.
Finish: Lingering orchard fruit sweetness.
Nose: Applesauce, dried pear and toasted barley initially, followed by walnut husk, spiced oak and seeded wholemeal loaf.

Name: Bruichladdich 9 Year Old - Founder's Collection (The Whisky Baron)
Palate: Red fruits and berries, boozy cherries, and cacao with a bold backdrop of rich oak and roasted hazelnuts.
Finish: More of those dense dark fruit notes, shavings of dark chocolate, and gently drying oak.
Nose: Toasted oak and elegant notes of tobacco are joined by forest fruits, damp malt, cocoa, and a touch of dried chilli.

Name: Longmorn 25 Year Old - Secret Speyside Collection
Palate: Incredibly sweet with a hint of spice, echoing the nose through red apple, mandarin orange and rich sultanas.
Finish: Long, smooth and dry in character.
Nose: Fruit notes of ripe plum, fresh peach and plump sultanas meet cinnamon.

Name: Lagavulin 26 Year Old (Special Release 2021)
Palate: Sweet toffee, and Jamaica cake notes, layered with wood fires and coal dust. Quite prominent mouth-gripping tannins like a really old Cognac.
Finish: Thick with salted caramel and cigar ash.
Nose: Dried fruit, pungent smoke, cured meats and  touch of varnish. A truly mighty nose.

Name: Teaninich 12 Year Old 2008 - Mey Selections
Palate: Enjoyably spicy on the palate with cinnamon and ginger, with malty notes sit in the background.
Finish: Almonds, more orange, dried fruit.
Nose: Juicy orange and lemon, with a touch of coconut underneath the zestiness.

Name: Caperdonich 25 Year Old - Secret Speyside Collection
Palate: Aromas of blackcurrant progressing with a prickle of cinnamon spice.
Finish: Long, luscious and sweet.
Nose: Notes of blackcurrant jam, sweet pear and creamy milk chocolate with hazelnuts.

Name: Armorik MaÃ®tre de Chai 2010
Palate: Smoked nuts, notably more almonds along with a handful of creamy cashews, lots of spices emerge with clove and cinnamon, sherried dried fruits, sweet liquorice and candied orange peel.
Finish: A pinch of sweet tobacco, smoky oak, sweet malt and tart berry compote.
Nose: Scones and blackberry jam, caramelised almonds and stewed orchard fruits with a hint of vanilla.

Name: Wire Works Alter Ego
Palate: Sweet caramel, toasted oats, some candied citrus, and very gentle peat.
Finish: Peppery spice and well integrated oak.
Nose: Notes of lemon meringue pie, with vanilla marshmallow sweetness and biscuity grain, with some charred tropical fruits.

Name: John Walker & Sons Bicentenary Blend
Palate: The first sip opens the doors to reveal delicious layers of spice mingling with sweet honey and rich molasses inspired by the rows of tempting jars. Waves of sultanas, cocoa beans and herbal notes are carried on wisps of soft smoke leading you further down the aisles of Johnâs store with every sip.
Finish: A sweet spice lingers as the door closes behind you.
Nose: A complex, rich whisky with layers of flavour in which an array of fruit aromas come together in harmony, balanced with warming spices and a soft, rolling smoke redolent of the rich array of exotic goods on offer. Dried fruit such as sultanas and figs are sweetened by hints of candied ginger, before berries, brown sugar and aromatic spices fill up the senses.

Name: Benrinnes 11 Year Old 2010 (cask 311020) - The Whisky Cellar
Palate: Allspice prickles through orange oil, toffee chip biscuits, and stewed apples.
Finish: Layers of oak and just a hint of heather honey.
Nose: Cookie dough, red berries, vanilla, and cinnamon sticks.

Name: Redwood Empire Lost Monarch
Palate: Heavy vanilla, still backed up by warming spice and buttered corn.
Finish: Toffee ice cream with a drizzle of chocolate sauce, cinnamon, dry oak.
Nose: Chocolate mousse, caramel cooking in a pan, peppery rye spiciness in the background.

Name: Moon Harbour Dock 1 - ChÃ¢teau Rieussec
Palate: Fresh stone fruits alongside vanilla, toasted almonds, brown sugar, and some peppery spice.
Finish: Warm oak with a lingering fruitiness.
Nose: Some floral character from the wine barrels, with cinnamon, ginger, and candied orange peel.

Name: Highland Journey Blended Malt - Journey Series (Hunter Laing)
Palate: Surprisingly sweet at first, with a big slice of lemon drizzle cake up front. It then swiftly develops bold, spicy notes of cinnamon and cracked black pepper.
Finish: Medium length, with honeyed barley and crushed almonds.
Nose: Freshly baked brown bread, vanilla fudge, floral heather, and red apple skin.

Name: Grant's Elementary 6 Year Old - Carbon
Palate: Buttered toast notes grow slightly smoky, joined by citrus zest and creamy barley.
Finish: Demerara sugar and cedar.
Nose: Straw, buttered toast, a hint of toffee.

Name: Spirit of Hven Seven Stars No.5 Alioth
Palate: Honey-roasted nuts, coffee beans and soft oak-y spices.
Finish: Lingering smoke and sugared almonds.
Nose: Rolling tobacco and earthy smoke, joined by touches of malty chocolate and peanut shells.

Name: Tomintoul 10 Year Old (cask 32) -  DrÃ m MÃ²r
Palate: Sweet raisins and pressed berries lead with floral sweetness while soft, syrupy sponge cake balances oaken spice.
Finish: Buttery malt and candied nuts, with a dusting of baking spice.
Nose: Vanilla toffee, buttered shortbread, and toffee apples, with soft honeyed sultanas.

Name: Teerenpeli 5 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Red liquorice, orange boiled sweets, malty vanilla and a touch of sponge cake.
Finish: A touch of cinnamon and burnt sugar on the finish.
Nose: Fruit cake, gingerbread, and almond biscuits. Baked goods galore!

Name: Moon Harbour Dock 1 - ChÃ¢teau Pipeau
Palate: Oaky vanilla, with more red fruit notes, a touch of aniseed, and some citrus.
Finish: Winter spices linger.
Nose: Some red berries in there, along with cinnamon, clove, and vanilla.

Name: Johnnie Walker 48 Year Old Masters of Flavour
Palate: Rich and oily with exotic fruit and vanilla custard taking centre stage again, with stewed orchard fruit, butterscotch, an underlying herbaceousness, a little star anise, and warming oak in the backdrop.
Finish: A little ginger, black pepper, molasses, and mango.
Nose: Ripe tropics fruit, subtle fireplace smoke and musky oak combine with an underlying grain sweetness (Scotch tablet, foam banana and creamy vanilla). There's also touches of darker fruits, marmalade on wholemeal toast, sea air and old books.

Name: Beverbach Adventures Edition I - Aged at Sea
Palate: Soft layers of vanilla, apricot, and floral honey balance soft smoke and oaky spice.
Finish: Charred wood and toasty malt, gently nutty with warming cinnamon and pepper.
Nose: Rich malted barley and autumnal fruit, a whiff of woody smoke.

Name: Staoisha 7 Year Old 2013 (cask 13000728) - Fadandel
Palate: Robust, nutty malt, burnt sugar, and earthy smoke are layered between tropical whiffs of pineapple and salted caramel.
Finish: Pebbly minerality with more sprinkles of salt, a touch of sweet vanilla, and lingering peppery peat smoke.
Nose: Fresh, coastal notes are followed by charred heather, woody smoke, and roasted nuts.

Name: Aberlour 6 Year Old 2012 (Master of Malt)
Palate: A spicy start with cracked peppercorns and ginger, quickly mellowed by waves of vanilla cream. Earthy walnuts and a touch of citrus oil join in time.
Finish: Hearty cinnamon and clove rest among zesty layers of thick-cut marmalade, joined by stewed apricot and vanilla custard.
Nose: Sweet barley water, vanilla wafers, and crisp green apples open the way, joined by dried lime and soft oak.

Name: Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1983 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Coastal peat and exotic fruit mingle, bringing a balance of salted papaya and fresh charcoal. Rich oak char follows, with hearty notes of cacao and wintery spice.
Finish: A long finish with smoked salt and spiced fruit loaf lingering beside earthy notes of mocha and bonfire smoke.
Nose: Smouldering coal and flamed orange peels, biscuity malt, dried pineapple, and delicate notes of crumbly vanilla fudge.

Name: Irish Single Malt XO - The Nectar of the Daily Drams
Palate: Linseed oil-lined palate with juicy barley, ginger wine and white toast. Allspice too.
Finish: An oaky, spiced finish with cut hay.
Nose: Sweet, honeyed aromas joined by stewed apples, warm pastries and hints of malt.

Name: Kingsbarns 5 Year Old (Single Cask Release)
Palate: Orange blossom, Custard Cream biscuits, aromatic spice, and green apple.
Finish: Fresh grass sweetness, lemon tart, and biscuity malt.
Nose: Fresh notes of vanilla pod lead to toasted almonds, sweet oak char, and caramel.

Name: Black Gate 3 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Burnt sugar, heavy vanilla, raisin, oily malt, and another rich helping of oak spices.
Finish: Lingering honey, brown sugar, and plum notes.
Nose: Ripe red grape sweetness, with a good helping of treacle and warming oak.

Name: Auchentoshan 14 Year Old 2007 (cask CM292) - The Golden Cask (House of MacDuff)
Palate: Drying spice and more zesty citrus lead the way before oily walnuts and charred apricot join. Warming oak spice and hints of floral barley tangle beneath.
Finish: Things stay spicy, mellowed by oaken vanilla, salted caramel, and floral tea.
Nose: Grassy malt, creamy vanilla, and toasted oak, with a helping of dried orange and lemon peels.

Name: Kempisch Vuur 3 Year Old Single Cask
Palate: Full bodied mouthfeel, slightly oily with unmistakable peat and a pinch of rock salt, alongside rich earthy notes, somewhat muddy. Cooking apple tanginess is complimented by warming cinnamon spice.
Finish: Sweet and smoky notes intertwined, while the spice lingers on a long finish.
Nose: White fruits, fresh hay and oodles of rich buttery caramel, with subtle smokiness and just a hint of plasticine.

Name: Laphroaig Cairdeas Origin - FÃ¨is Ãle 2012
Palate: Rounded and smooth, the butter spreads itself, melts and reveals Laproaig's signature smoky heart. It's pungent but not overpowering, a cushion of smoke rather than an enveloping cloud. But this is a big mouth-filling whisky; it just does it with finesse. That sweetness from the nose is heavily pronounced, and tastes remarkably like the crumbly fudge you find all over Islay.
Finish: Sweet, long and comforting.
Nose: Buttery and soft, with just a wisp of smoked kippers. There's only the slightest hint of the carbolic notes you find in the ten year old expression. It's a heavy butterscotch sweetness that runs the show, with a hefty portion of salted caramel.

Name: Deanston 10 Year Old 2009 (cask 97) - Rest & Be Thankful
Palate: Maple syrup, Frosties cereal, dried cranberries and a hint of toasted barley.
Finish: Citrus oils, a hint of hoppy fragrance and cedar spiciness.
Nose: Apple pie with flaky pastry, softly oaky, floral malt lightness.

Name: Spey Fumare Cask Strength - Batch 3
Palate: Vanilla custard, browning apples, rich smoke, and toffee.
Finish: Smoky and spicy.
Nose: Burnt toast, acacia honey, garden herbs, and flapjacks.

Name: Lord Elcho 15 Year Old
Palate: Spiced and malty with notes of cocoa butter and sandalwood. Hints of chocolate, salt caramel and custard.
Finish: Malt-driven finish with notes of spice on the tail.
Nose: Gingernut biscuits and vanilla cream. Hints of toffee apples, porridge oats and nutmeg. It develops on furniture polish and cooked fruit.

Name: Eden Mill Rum Cask 2022 - Cask Mastery Series
Palate: Molasses, tropical fruits, and woody spices.
Finish: Sticky malt loaf, with zingy ginger.
Nose: Some caramelised sugar, with banoffee pie, and oaky spices.

Name: Glenfiddich 50 Year Old Simultaneous Time - Time Reimagined
Palate: A lingering sweetness softens into deep, silky smooth oak tannin and sun-dried vanilla.
Finish: Oaky, sweet, and incredibly long-lasting.
Nose: Rich orange peel and clementine meet complex notes of Madeira cake and muscovado sugar. Maturing over time into the dewy petrichor of a Dufftown morning, mingling with flowering geranium.

Name: Stalk & Barrel Red Blend
Palate: Orchard fruit and orange peel combine with crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e and cinnamon.
Finish: A good length with a prickle of rye spice.
Nose: Floral rye blends with golden barley, vanilla, and citrus pith.

Name: Highland Park 12 Year Old - Early 2000s
Palate: The palate is quite full with a pleasant subtlety to the depths. Lurking somewhere in the substratum a grilled orange lies. Notes of granary toast and green tea with jasmine. A touch of sweetness.
Finish: The finish is quite long with peppered spicy and wood shavings.
Nose: The nose is clean and floral. Notes of creamy manuka honey and a touch of juicy lemon with cream and a well-balanced sweetness.

Name: Black Bull 8 Year Old
Palate: Sugared peels and honeycomb. Develops into notes of nutmeg and porridge.
Finish: Lingering malty, peppery warmth.
Nose: Honey'd cereal, a pinch of peat smoke followed by malty chocolate.

Name: Scottish Glory 3 Year Old
Palate: Malty palate. Quite simple stuff, with a core of barley and a little sweetness.
Finish: Honeyed finish. Oak.
Nose: Malty, spicy nose with hints of soft fruit and oak. Toffee apples and honey.

Name: Secret Highland 11 Year Old 2011 - North Star Spirits
Palate: The baked goods carry through with drizzles of icing sugar, vanilla custard, and buttercream, balanced by rich oak and dense baking spice.
Finish: A solid backbone of oily barley, dark berries, and leathery oak builds beneath.
Nose: Cooked orchard fruits, Black Forest gateaux, vanilla wafers, and a touch of dried hay.

Name: Timorous Beastie 13 Year Old â Meet The Beast
Palate: Vanilla pod and spiced oak, plus layers of honeycomb and bruised apple.
Finish: Bold ginger and cassia, with a touch of smoke lingering.
Nose: Roasted nuts and flamed orange peel, with a backdrop of vanilla sponge.

Name: Ardmore 2011 (bottled 2021) (cask 801902) - Samaroli
Palate: Salted nuts, a smidge of heather honey, cooling mint leaf.
Finish: Peppery, cumin powder, caramel.
Nose: Smoky bacon crisps and candied peels, with a malty backdrop.

Name: Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old Feis Ile 2012
Palate: A hugely spiced, rich palate with notes of sultanas, malt, cedar wood potpourri, butterscotch and gingerbread.
Finish: Ginger and black pepper on the tail, very oily with soft smoke.
Nose: Spiced and intense nose with dark, rich honey, sherried peels, salted, smoked almonds and dry oak. Malty and nutty.

Name: Glenfarclas 42 Year Old 1977 (cask 7027)
Palate: Light, punchy, zesty fruit on the front of the mouth. With a few drops of water a much bigger sherry flavour with all the aromas of a forest floor presents itself. This is a fantastic marriage of oak, sherry, and spirit, finishing with a waxy, oily apricot warmth.
Finish: Cumulates in Seville orange, fresh oak, showcasing that well balanced, classic Glenfarclas Cask Strength flavour from the 1970s.
Nose: Aromas you would usually associate with a much older dram, the vapours offer a lovely sweetness of honey, candy floss, and barley sugar.

Name: Caol Ila 19 Year Old 1999 (Master of Malt)
Palate: The floral notes continue on the palate with suggestions of heather honey, baklava, and stone fruits countering hearty, ashen peat smoke.
Finish: Herbaceous smoke, rock salt, root ginger, and crackling bonfire embers.
Nose: Sugared lemon and drying orange lead to classic oily, coastal smoke, balanced by floral malt and aromatic oak.

Name: Fercullen 20 Year Old - Five Elements 2021
Palate: Malty chocolate, fruitcake, orange peels, red grapes, subtle clove and cinnamon.
Finish: Honeyed sweetness sticks around long on the finish.
Nose: Candied pineapple and yellow plum, with grassy barley and hints of sawdust.

Name: Tomatin 11 Year Old 2007 - Poise and Perseverance
Palate: Still retains sweetness, but it's ably kept in check by a lick of tannin. Pineapple and guava make a surprise appearance as we glide into the finish.
Finish: Becomes more tannic, but this is balanced by the emergence of treacle-rich parkin made with a touch of peated barley.
Nose: Sweet, creamy barley backed up by comb honey. Absolutely textbook 'whisky-whisky'.

Name: The GlenDronach 25 Year Old 1993 - Master Vintage
Palate: Sip cocoa-dusted coffee and sultana brioche enlivened by a twist of baked orange rind and the juiciness of prune oil.
Finish: Savour the long velvet taste of rich cocoa and dates as pecan toffee lingers into the sumptuous finish.
Nose: Rich brandy-laced fruitcake and marzipan on a base of smoked walnut and toasted sultana bread.

Name: Beinn Dubh Thunder in the Glens 20th Anniversary
Palate: Almost like cold coffee with dark brown sugar, vanilla and dried fruit.
Finish: Toffee and chocolate malt.
Nose: Caramel, toasty, soy, walnut and burnt raisins.

Name: Yamazaki Mizunara 18 Year Old (2017 Edition)
Palate: Condensed sweetness, silky texture, dry fruits, coconut, orange marmalade.
Finish: Distinctive spiciness lingers with Japanese incense, aloe wood, cinnamon and tartness.
Nose: Rich and elegant fragrance, aloe wood, cinnamon.

Name: Caol Ila 10 Year Old 2010 - Single & Single
Palate: Still subtly fruity, though more vanilla and floral malt comes through on the palate. Vegetal peat and a touch of sea spray.
Finish: Lingering hints of cigar box and caraway.
Nose: White grape and green apple, contrasted with hints of soot and smoke.

Name: The 48 10 Year Old (Cask 23) - Heroes & Heretics
Palate: Sponge cake, peanut butter, grilled apricot and chocolate ice-cream.
Finish: A lingering hint of toasted spices.
Nose: Honeycomb and sultana, followed by fresh barley and a touch of charred oak.

Name: Craigellachie 13 Year Old 2008 â The New Star (James Eadie)
Palate: Caramel latte, cassia, more peppery malt, a drizzle of chocolate sauce.
Finish: Ice cream wafers, juxtaposed with a hint of smoke.
Nose: Biscotti, peach, white pepper, dry oak.

Name: Teerenpeli 3 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Juicy pineapple and more grapefruit, now paired with layers of toffee and wood smoke.
Finish: Hints of vanilla and Sichuan pepper last.
Nose: Soft whiffs of peat, with citrus and leafy herbs mellowing the smoke.

Name: Port Ellen 40 Year Old - Untold Stories Series
Palate: Much more pronounced bonfire smoke, pope tobacco, leather, wood spice.
Finish: Long, wispy smoke finish.
Nose: Delicate, grassy/herbal, burnt tangerine skin, very mild smoke at cask strength, opens up a little with the addition of water, crÃ¨me caramel/roasted coffee, red fruit compote, ripe peach skin.

Name: Arbikie 4 Year Old Highland Rye Limited Edition
Palate: Fruity notes develop alongside the spices, with some peach, raisins, and a touch of toasted walnut.
Finish: Pepper, mint, and dried apricot linger.
Nose: Nice and spicy, with cloves, cinnamon, and some alpine herbs.

Name: Inchgower 14 Year Old 2008 (cask 805911) - Single Cask Series (The Red Cask Company)
Palate: Forest fruits and caramelised biscuits mingle, joined by honeyed dates and prunes. Toasted brown sugar and drying oak rest beneath.
Finish: Mocha, berry jam, hearty malt, and bittersweet oak.
Nose: Rich, sweet barley, toasted currant buns with tangy marmalade, plus a dusting of grated dark chocolate.

Name: AthrÃº Small Batch Release #1
Palate: The berry notes come to the fore on the palate, with fresh strawberries and blackcurrants. Still packed with vanilla.
Finish: Peanut brittle, waxy lemon peel, and dry oak.
Nose: Vanilla tablet and crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e, with a hint of raspberry jam underneath.

Name: Akashi Bourbon Cask 5 Year Old
Palate: Poached orchard fruits, woody spices, and distant bonfire smoke.
Finish: Drizzles of salted caramel, black pepper, and lingering smoke.
Nose: Sweet vanilla and caramel, with biscuit notes.

Name: Turns on a Daim 1988 (bottled 2019) - Wemyss Malts (Invergordon)
Palate: Resinous oak and creamy grain, mixed nut granola with a roasty touch of coffee and maple syrup.
Finish: Still plenty of butter and grain going on, mellow spice, chocolate nuts, some citrus zest, and candied ginger.
Nose: Buttery flapjack, sweet syrup, and bitter chocolate sit comfortably beside rich, oily nuts and sherried fruits.

Name: Benriach 6 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Buttered malt loaf, salted caramel and whipped hazelnut cream provide a decadent opening to which burnt oak, blackberries, sea salt and ginger root add depth.
Finish: Burnt cedar and sticky toffee pudding linger.
Nose: Youthful white pepper spice and meaty oak lead, with barley sugar, wood ash and milky coffee underneath. Soft toffee and lemon peel emerge with time.

Name: Waterford Single Farm Origin - Grattansbrook 1.1
Palate: Chocolatey notes persist, backed up by rounded malt and fresh vanilla, plus a splash of citrus.
Finish: Drying spiciness of cinnamon and ginger.
Nose: Fruit-forward with dried nectarine and sultana, with a dusting of cocoa.

Name: Islay #1 10 Year Old  (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: More bittersweet charred woodsmoke, lemon peel and dried pineapple initially, with sweet tobacco and green grapes developing.
Finish: Dry, smoky and lingering.
Nose: Apple wood on a charcoal fire brings a herbal, sweet smokiness through which strawberry, rhubarb and citric brightness emerge. Floral honey, fluffy Scotch pancakes and a little dark fruit emerge.

Name: Rosebank 12 Year Old - Flora and Fauna (with Wooden Box)
Palate: Tangerines, sugared peels, winter spice, Parfait Armour, Cointreau with notes of tannic oak.
Finish: Long and punchy with good smoke and spicy fruit.
Nose: Cereal notes abound with hints of juicy barley sweetness. Crisp wood smoke cutting the cold air with herbal freshness. Winter spice, cut limes, mandarins and potpourri.

Name: Mackmyra 5 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Zesty raspberry and ripe cherry, balanced by waves of creamy vanilla and a little buttered corn.
Finish: Popcorn, peppercorn and some lingering juicy summer berries.
Nose: Caramelised nuts, soft sawdust, lemon meringue.

Name: Glengoyne 19 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Gentle and mature, the palate begins with soft dark fruit, Seville orange and warm gingerbread spiciness. Resinous wax, sweet florals and red chilli pepper heat add interesting depth. Big chewy toffee notes are present throughout.
Finish: Prunes, stewed plums and oak spice remain.
Nose: Dry, roasted spice, creamy Walnut Whip and milk chocolate provide the backdrop to fruit cake, marmalade and thick treacle. An autumnal forest floor note develops along with bourbon vanilla, toasted oak and dried black cherries.

Name: Two Worlds La Victoire - First Edition
Palate: Flaky pastry dipped in coffee, crisp pear, cinnamon and clove. Dark chocolate, sponge cake, black pepper.
Finish: Caramelised nuts, more cinnamon, heavy vanilla.
Nose: Buttery popcorn and fresh oranges, with a touch of nutmeg spiciness slowly building.

Name: Teaninich 9 Year Old 2012 - Benchmark (Murray McDavid) 46%
Palate: Prunes and dates are joined by figs and sultanas, with floral oak balancing notes of muscovado sugar and biscuity barley.
Finish: Syrupy flapjack, studded with raisins, and a dusting of wintery spice.
Nose: Orchard honey, ripe apples, and roasted almonds, with sweet, roasted malt and buttered shortbread.

Name: Coppersea 3 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: More baked goods - cinnamon buns and salted caramel brownies, with allspice and nutmeg heat growing.
Finish: Lingering nutmeg and cinnamon.
Nose: Caraway, freshly baked rye bread, heather honey and a hint of floral grain.

Name: Jura 7 Year Old Moscatel Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: Chocolate-coated fruit and nuts balance richly roasted barley. Oaty flapjack with gooey caramel keeps things sweet alongside fresh red berries and mellow oak.
Finish: Hefty malt lingers on the finish with suggestions of spiced biscuits, fruit loaf, and subtle woody tobacco.
Nose: A floral start with wafts of herbal honey, chocolate cake, buttered malt loaf, and a touch of fresh garden peppermint.

Name: Skara Brae 16 Year Old 2005 (cask 22) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Bold malt, oaty biscuits, spiced oranges with distant sea breeze and soft smoke.
Finish: Coastal salinity continues, alongside dried citrus peels, cloves, and anise, with fading smoke on the end.
Nose: Heather honey, gentle smoke, a touch of zesty citrus, and rolled oats.

Name: Benrinnes 13 Year Old 2007 (cask 310411) - The Whisky Cellar
Palate: Allspice, orange oil, cinnamon sticks, more vanilla, cookie dough.
Finish: Nectarine, cassia, a touch of white chocolate.
Nose: Powerful vanilla notes, with a touch of banana fritter heat to it.

Name: Aultmore 14 Year Old 2008 - Vintage Casks (Mossburn)
Palate: Tangy berries, sticky toffee pudding, sweet spices, and orange peel.
Finish: Long and sweet.
Nose: Christmas cake, caramel, dried fruit, and oak char.

Name: Loch Lomond 47 Year Old Remarkable Stills Series
Palate: Opens with a velvety mouthfeel, caramel and vanilla with crisp green apple, melon and kiwi fruit with floral notes of elderflower.
Finish: Long, initially sweet melted brown sugar then mouth-watering lime citrus and gently warming cinnamon spice.
Nose: Toffee, orange and green apple with floral notes of rose then sultanas, cinnamon and nutmeg.

Name: Glentauchers 14 Year Old 2008 - North Star Spirits
Palate: Heaps of dried, sherry-soaked fruit arrives on the palate, with dates, sultanas, and prunes, supported by candied nuts and iced fingers.
Finish: Dense drying oak lingers for the finish, backed by rich baking spice and drizzles of burnt caramel.
Nose: Sourdough crumpets and creamy chocolate lead to plump raisins and freshly baked sponge cake.

Name: Aultmore 13 Year Old 2009 (cask 304855) - The Whisky Cellar
Palate: Layers of butterscotch, raisins, and plums are backed by notes of cocoa and milky coffee.
Finish: Gently zesty, with notes of fruit-studded sponge cake and elegant oak char.
Nose: Rice pudding with spiced sultanas, runny honey, and buttery malt.

Name: Caol Ila 8 Year Old 2014 - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Burnt florals, flamed orange peel, golden syrup, and peat smoke.
Finish: Oily smoke, red apple, spicy oak, and aromatic smoke.
Nose: Red grape, orchard fruit, smouldering embers, and coastal sea breeze.

Name: MacNair's Lum Reek 10 Year Old - Cask Strength Batch 2
Palate: Roasted malt, rich coffee, and bittersweet cacao tangle with charred peat and honey cake.
Finish: Zesty marmalade and spiced fruits finish things up, supported by cinnamon sticks, and murmurs of sweet smoke.
Nose: Sticky toffee, burnt sugar, and smouldering bonfire embers are joined by spiced biscuits and oaken vanilla.

Name: Henstone Single Malt Whisky - Ex-Peated Casks
Palate: Peach and orange peel, with a dusting of brown sugar and oak char.
Finish: Smoke and sweet fruit.
Nose: Gingery spice, rich smoke, and toffee pennies, as well as cooked apple.

Name: Inchgower 6 Year Old 2016 (cask 300750B) - The Single Cask
Palate: Earthy oak, jammy raisins, sweet malt, and salted caramel.
Finish: Red apple, dried cherry, spicy oak, a flecks of dried herbs.
Nose: A balance of sweet and savoury, with cured meats, red grape skin, rancio, and black pepper.

Name: Spirit of Hven Seven Stars No.1 Dubhe
Palate: Black pepper, greengages, vanilla, a dusting of cocoa just before a wave of peat and oak.
Finish: Warm and slightly drying.
Nose: Vanilla, Maraschino, red apple and drying grass that's just catching in the sun.

Name: Driftless Glen 5 Year Old Single Barrel Bourbon
Palate: The vanilla continues on the palate alongside poached pear and apple pastries. Sweet oak and barbecued corn build beside prickles of pepper and cinnamon.
Finish: A well-balanced end with warming spice and toasty sweetness lingering.
Nose: Toasted oak and dustings of clove, with softer notes of vanilla and butterscotch.

Name: Kingsbarns 6 Year Old (cask 1650751) (Single Cask Release)
Palate: Brown sugar, shortbread, orchard fruit, tinned peaches, and gentle smoke.
Finish: Sweet tobacco, leather, and smoke linger among sparkling green fruits.
Nose: Earthy peat, dried apricot, green apples, and malt loaf.

Name: Elsburn 7 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Rich and rewarding with almond butter, red berry sweetness, earthy pepper, and dark chocolate.
