Finish: Long and full of sweet fruits and chocolate.
Nose: Among dried fruits and cacao there's spiced wood, nougat, and honey-roasted cashew nuts

Name: Craigellachie 10 Year Old 2009 (cask 301035) - The Single Cask
Palate: Barley sugar and honeycomb, fresh hay, silky caramel and buttery apple turnover alongside earthy oak and warming clove and nutmeg.
Finish: Lemon blossom, toasted oak and a salty smokiness linger.
Nose: Salted nuts, sea washed pebbles, pear crumble and caramelised brown sugar with orange marmalade and sweet malt.

Name: Blair Athol 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 30793) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Still very fruit forward, with white grape and honeyed pear, followed by a handful of baking spices.
Finish: Yet more honey notes last on the finish.
Nose: Apple pie, hazelnuts, slightly drying flinty hints with fragrant barley developing.

Name: Girvan 14 Year Old 2007 - Rare Cask Series (GreatDrams)
Palate: Buttery vanilla, liquorice, black pepper leading into warm cinnamon rolls. Dried fruit remains constant.
Finish: A smidge of blackcurrant jam and brioche on the finish.
Nose: Currant buns with a good helping of icing, soft oaky spice, a smidge of dried orange peel.

Name: Linkwood 11 Year Old (cask 804348) - The Sipping Shed
Palate: Apricot and pear, butterscotch and liquorice allsorts, with drying oak spice and a sprinkle of brown sugar.
Finish: Fruity freshness fades alongside spicy oak.
Nose: Apricot jam, citrus boiled sweeties, Jelly Babies, dark berry coulis and fresh mint leaves.

Name: Speyburn 10 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: White grape acidity, golden barley and salted caramel with dark chocolate, orchard fruits and a little minty herbal quality in support.
Finish: Long and soft.
Nose: Melting butter on warm soda bread, soft toffee pennies, Conference pears and a little ginger, with touches of beeswax and citrus in the backdrop.

Name: Whitlaw 16 Year Old Moscatel Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: Peat smoke continues, balanced by vanilla pod richness and dried fruit sweetness.
Finish: Christmas pudding and dried peels, with sea salt lingering.
Nose: Singed grass, coastal breeze, sherried citrus peels, and juicy plum.

Name: Blended Whisky 21 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Nutmeg and clove add a drying spice which contributes depth to butterscotch and hazelnuts. Thereâs a subtle tropical fruit note underneath.
Finish: Medium length, with touches of burnt oak.
Nose: A very malty nose opens with Seville orange marmalade and buttered burnt toast. Thereâs some vanilla, juicy toasted barley and a touch of donuts underneath. Charred oak and red chilli add warmth and savoury spice throughout.

Name: Egan's Vintage Grain Gift Set With Irish Coffee Glass
Palate: Smooth and creamy vanilla, with a subtle hint of cinnamon.
Finish: Long, gentle, and light oak spiciness.
Nose: Vanilla fudge and caramel notes. Subtle oak and grassy notes.

Name: Glencadam 6 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Oily barley and apricot, black pepper, lemon.
Finish: Green olive and brown bread.
Nose: Vanilla essence, dried fruit, cut grass.

Name: Deanston 12 Year Old 2009 (cask DL16329) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: The vanilla continues joined by creamy fudge and dense biscuity malt. A hint of pink grapefruit follows in time, with nutty granola in tow.
Finish: Rich and roasty, with layers of charred oak, candied nuts, and buttery flapjack.
Nose: Bold barley, toasted sourdough, soaked oats, and vanilla cream.

Name: Inchgower 26 Year Old - Batch 4 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Honeyed barley, slightly leafy at points, still got that classic Inchgower leather note running through it.
Finish: Cooking spices take control on the finish, with black pepper and clove at the core.
Nose: White grape, leather, dusty oak and warm apple turnovers fresh from the oven.

Name: The Glenrothes 12 Year Old 2008 - North Star Spirits
Palate: Chocolate raisin takes shape on the palate, along with a helping of treacle.
Finish: Intense dried fruit, black pepper and nutmeg.
Nose: Toasted teacakes, melted butter and a touch of honeyed cereal.

Name: Islay 8 Year Old 2011 - Chronicle (Chapter 7)
Palate: Somewhat zesty, hints of lime and sweet orange cross with butter vanilla fudge and peat smoke.
Finish: Fresh oak, floral wafts of burnt lavender, sweet, creamy vanilla, and medium peat.
Nose: Vanilla and peat, foam bananas with wafts of candied oranges.

Name: Kingsbarns 7 Year Old (cask 1510248) (Single Cask Release)
Palate: Candied apple, foam bananas, oak char, and toffee.
Finish: Cinnamon swirls and orchard fruit.
Nose: Lemon posset, vanilla, aniseed, and pepper.

Name: Tipperary Watershed
Palate: Raisins and sultanas, with hints of cinnamon and brown sugar underneath.
Finish: Rather long indeed, with white chocolate and more brown sugar lasting.
Nose: Buttered bread, mango chutney, turmeric.

Name: The Golden Age Blend 55 Year Old
Palate: A thick slice of fruitcake, chocolate truffles, vanilla pod earthiness, profiteroles, cigar box leading into notes of worn leather and tomato stem.
Finish: Fragrant vanilla blossom, mahogany, a hint of strawberry, orange oil, and candle wax.
Nose: Buttered crumpets, antique oak furniture, figs, shortbread, Lyle's Golden Syrup, nutmeg, a tiny touch of pomander, stroopwafel, mint leaf, and star anise.

Name: Auchroisk 13 Year Old 2008 (cask 9068) - The Whisky Cellar
Palate: Buttery flapjack, sweet marmalade, and some herbal spice join the party with dried fruit and dark honey.
Finish: Toasted oak and crunchy brown sugar linger.
Nose: Milky coffee, cinnamon, baked apples, and a rich nutty quality in the backdrop.

Name: Armorik 8 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Through ginger and hints of oaky spice comes more caramelised orchard fruits.
Finish: Long and aromatically spiced.
Nose: Toffee apples dusted with cinnamon, with charred oak and floral honey in support.

Name: Braeval 23 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: A sticky opening with toffee, then spice from red chilli flake and ginger which is soon tempered by white chocolate, greengages and apricot.
Finish: Vanilla pod earthiness mixed with banana and caraway.
Nose: Sugary biscuits and buttered soda bread. Quite nutty too - sugared almonds and macadamia nuts.

Name: Speyside 10 Year Old 2011 - South Star Spirits
Palate: Salted caramel, more citrus brightness, and warm oaky spices.
Finish: Apple pie with brown sugar and nutmeg.
Nose: Lemon cheesecake, maple syrup, and a whiff of floral barley.

Name: Aultmore 38 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Orange moves to the fore, bringing with it some warming five-spice and clove. Still packs a wonderful fragrant earthy quality.
Finish: A dusty hint of oak lingers long on the finish, dotted with stem ginger.
Nose: A fine balance of orchard fruit sweetness and forest floor earthiness, decorated with whiffs of fresh clementine and barley sugar sweeties.

Name: Annandale Man OâSword Vintage 2017 - S.T.R. Cask (cask 375)
Palate: Charred oak and hints of summer fruits lead to vegetal smoke, with wafts of vanilla and coconut flakes.
Finish: Fiery ginger arrives, warming things up while vanilla and plums balance vegetal barley.
Nose: Charred marzipan, nutty praline, pipe tobacco, and plenty of peat smoke.

Name: Ardmore 11 Year Old 2011 - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Fruit loaf with generous spices and melted butter. Chewy toffee and oak char open the way for elegant peat smoke.
Finish: Festive spice remains, with sweet dried fruits and plumes of soft smoke.
Nose: Zesty spiced orange, honeyed nuts, juicy sultanas, and chocolate wafers, with whispers of smoked tea.

Name: High Coast Silent Mills Collection - #1 Marieberg
Palate: Rich, sweet smoke, with warming ginger and peppery spice, toasted vanilla marshmallows and fruit compote.
Finish: Earthy peat lingers, with warming oak and orchard fruits lingering.
Nose: Plenty of sweet, earthy smoke and oaky vanilla. With a touch of buttery apple pastries.

Name: Bell's Queen Mother 100th Birthday Decanter
Palate: Quite smooth, medium body. Barley and cereals with nut oils, hints of wood and spice.
Finish: Short with notes of fruitcake and smoke.
Nose: Quite soft and gentle. Malted barley and hints of cut herbs and a fresh floral note. Cereal and grist with a little honey.

Name: Aberlour 6 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Black pepper arrives first, shortly followed by more vanilla and oily walnut notes.
Finish: Apricot jam, cinnamon and a good whack of orange.
Nose: Apple slices and vanilla rich barley sugar. A touch of earthy lime leaf.

Name: Glendullan 7 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Winter spices add an aromatic heat to acacia honey and toffee pennies. Tannic oak and a touch of raspberry with time underneath.
Finish: A little orange lingers among black pepper.
Nose: A floral quality from honeysuckle leads and brings a soft, sweet element that Granny Smith apples, grassy malt and earthy vanilla supports.

Name: Cotswolds 3 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Rich malt, oaky tannins and winter spices lead. Thereâs also plenty of sweetness from toffee apples, dark red fruits and golden syrup, and a touch of pink grapefruit bitterness.
Finish: Dark treacle toffee and cloudy apple juice, with a hint of dried grass.
Nose: Butterscotch and brown sugar are followed by soft nectarines, apricots and caramelised Seville orange marmalade. Marzipan, creamy vanilla and a little ginger develop.

Name: Peatside 7 Year Old 2011 - The Vatting (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Fruity and oaky with whisps of smoke.
Finish: A sweet, lingering finish.
Nose: Hints of smoked fish and spiced sweet fruits.

Name: High Coast Silent Mills Collection - #4 Box
Palate: More rich, earthy smoke, with jammy port, warm, oaky vanilla and hints of clove-studded oranges.
Finish: The peat lingers, with sticky gingerbread.
Nose: Sweet smoke lingers with poached apples and pears, sticky ginger cake, and waxy orange peel.

Name: Strathmill 21 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: An interesting hint of Oloroso sweetness and winter spice rises among vanilla custard, chocolate mousse and charred oak.
Finish: Thereâs almost a note of foam bananas as the dram fades in a medium-length finish.
Nose: A little anise and lemon oil are present among more prominent notes of golden barley, dried grass, acacia honey and peach cobbler. A little grapefruit adds a lively citrus note.

Name: Rosebank 21 Year Old 1992 (Special Release 2014)
Palate: Grapefruit turkish delight with all the powder, light sponge cake, marshmallow and more delicate but flavoursome floral notes.
Finish: Drying, with some well-measured oakiness becoming prominent for the first time.
Nose: There are floral notes, as is to be expected, but they're of the orange citrus variety here. There's a 'window thrown open (by a meadow)' freshness, lychee, grapefruit, and some faint, gentle spice and malt.

Name: Dailuaine 8 Year Old - Premier Barrel (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Creamy layers of barley, crushed almonds and cinnamon buns. Toasted oak and marzipan bring vanilla sweetness.
Finish: Orange peel, winter spice, and candied fruits, with drying herbs tailing off in the distance.
Nose: Syrupy flapjack, vanilla pod, and toasted spiced fruit loaf with plenty of butter.

Name: Miltonduff 13 Year Old 2008 (cask 700988) - The Single Cask
Palate: Vanilla, cardamom, and honey. Shows off some good oaky elements, too.
Finish: Rolos and malt loaf.
Nose: Almonds, chocolate digestive biscuits, slightly buttery.

Name: Arran Smugglers' Series Volume One - The Illicit Stills
Palate: Peat warmth really starts to build up here, alongside robust Christmas spices. Hints of Sherried plums and a touch of apple.
Finish: Long and full, with plenty of smoke.
Nose: A rather busy nose, packed with dried fruit, floral wafts and light BBQ embers. Subtle coastal elements too...

Name: Wilderness Trail Cask Strength Rye (51.5%)
Palate: Tobacco leads into chilli chocolate, orange peel and oak char, with some fragrant clove in there too.
Finish: Orange oil and creamy vanilla notes.
Nose: Solero ice cream, lemon curd and spiced dessert, with a helping of custard.

Name: Caperdonich 23 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Full texture, smooth, round, lots of fruit, dark cherries, kirsch, dried fruit, and toffee. One moment itâs dry and then next itâs sweet.
Finish: Builds and builds, very long, finishes with sweet fudge notes.
Nose: Fresh red cherries leading to aromatic notes of tobacco and cedar with a gingery spice.

Name: Inchgower 26 Year Old - Batch 1 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Buttery at first, but the fresh fruit notes from the nose develop once again.
Finish: Layers of honey and malt, followed by a kick of cumin powder.
Nose: Yellow plum and apricot, with a dusting of thyme, bringing an earthy edge to the nose.

Name: Dufftown 11 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: A whole host of woody spices, with a touch of leather, and some syrupy figs.
Finish: Some candied citrus, with gentle tannins, and allspice warmth.
Nose: Warming clove and cinnamon, with delicious sherry sweetness.

Name: HighGlen 3 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Toffee, almond, marzipan, a soft hint of smoky oak.
Finish: Prickles of wood linger underneath sweet caramel and dried fruit.
Nose: Plum, raspberry jam, and spiced hot chocolate.

Name: Dailuaine 20 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Through a whiff of dry smoke and subtle menthol herbaceousness, thereâs oily walnut, thick toffee and white pepper spice.
Finish: Dry earth and a little clove.
Nose: Toasted sugar, hazelnut and sugary shortbread, with cedar and sandalwood, then hints of lemon verbena.

Name: Benrinnes 9 Year Old 2012 (cask 313794C) - The Single Cask
Palate: Honeyed spices, dark chocolate, fresh tobacco, and ripe plum.
Finish: Baked apple, cinnamon, and toasted teacake.
Nose: Banana bread, homemade jam, and candied ginger.

Name: Glentauchers 10 Year Old 2008 - Vintage Casks (Mossburn)
Palate: Cherry Bakewell, spicy cassia, brown sugar and buttered crumpets.
Finish: Salted caramel and sponge cake.
Nose: Lemongrass and fresh orange, with oily barley in support.

Name: Aberfeldy 27 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Stewed apples and pears, delicately floral and earthy, with a touch of lemongrass.
Finish: Short, with sweet vanilla, orange peel and honeydew melon.
Nose: Distinct aromas of mechanical oil and fresh paint, with undertones of freshly cut grass and banana foam sweeties.

Name: Tamnavulin Red Wine Cask Edition - German Pinot Noir
Palate: Sour cherry, black pepper, and berry coulis, followed by fresh oak.
Finish: A whack of dry baking spices and forest fruits.
Nose: Woody cinnamon stick, cherry jam, tart raspberry, and polished leather.

Name: Strathisla 15 Year Old Moscatel Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: Salted caramel shortbread, toasty cinnamon, a touch of herbaceous malt.
Finish: Black pepper, spearmint sweetness, red apple.
Nose: Densely chocolatey, with hints of cigar box underneath adding yet more richness.

Name: Rosebank 26 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: The palate is delicate but well-rounded, with notes of barley sugar, honey and green fruits, with candied citrus peel, cedar wood and some ancient oak spice.
Finish: The grapefruit returns with a little golden syrup.
Nose: Thereâs foam bananas, vanilla and white chocolate at first, then some grapefruit bitterness and old book musk. Lemon sherbets, almond butter and soft toffee pennies develop with time.

Name: Benriach 11 Year Old 2010 - Vintage Casks (Mossburn)
Palate: Toblerone chocolate bars, walnuts, orange, and cinnamon.
Finish: Short and sweet.
Nose: Marzipan, marmalade, burnt heather, and vanilla.

Name: Smooth Ambler Big Level Wheated Bourbon
Palate: Caramelised nuts, more red berry sweetness, a dusting of cinnamon, chewy toffee, sponge cake, baking spices.
Finish: Subtly floral on the finish, though brown sugar and soft fruit notes continue.
Nose: Cooked blackcurrants and raspberries, buttery shortbread, a touch of honey, soft oak heat developing alongside waxy peels.

Name: Cambus 40 Year Old 1975 (Special Release 2016)
Palate: Baked pears now, in pastry, with hints of cinnamon, fresh flowers, cloves and lemon thyme.
Finish: Pow! Peach melba and a touch of pot pourri, fragrant and delicious.
Nose: Rich fudge pieces with an aromatic edge reminiscent of fabric softener. Fruit soon develops with gooseberries in cream and a little pear drop.

Name: Cameronbridge 15 Year Old 2006 (cask CG004) - The Golden Cask (House of Macduff)
Palate: Waxed lemons, creamy coconut, and melted milk chocolate, with an array of baking spices and kitchen herbs balanced by toffee popcorn.
Finish: Fruit-filled pastries, yoghurt coated raisins, creamy grain, and chunky marmalade.
Nose: Vanilla custard opens the way with green apple and floral citrus. A touch of honeyed oak arrives in the distance.

Name: Belgrove 4 Year Old (That Boutique-y Rye Company)
Palate: Honeyed cereal juxtaposed by toasty oak, with layers of smoke and brown sugar.
Finish: A hint of fiery cinnamon remains on the finish.
Nose: Grilled peaches and pineapples, smoky paprika, black pepper, a touch of waxy orange peel.

Name: Teaninich 17 Year Old 1999 (Special Release 2017)
Palate: More floral with orchard fruit, some stalky notes and lemon tea. Fizzy apple sweets too.
Finish: Fresh peach skin and gentle oak.
Nose: Vanilla, barley and pleasant waxy character. A little water reveals citrus zest (and orange jelly), melba toast and melon notes.

Name: Langatun 6 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Continued notes from the nose, with toasted nuts, toffee and sweet malty cereal notes, with an orchard fruit freshness appearing.
Finish: Melted dark chocolate lingers balanced by floral malt.
Nose: Oily nuts, namely walnuts and salted dark chocolate, with dusty oak, buttery caramel and chilli spice.

Name: Benriach 8 Year Old 2013 - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Zesty malt opens the way, with candied orange and lemon peels balanced by oaken vanilla and char.
Finish: Toffee sponge and baking spices build, while buttery vanilla and a pinch of pepper linger.
Nose: Barley sugar sweeties and fresh fruit salad, with waves of silky vanilla caramel and soft fudge.

Name: Inchgower 13 Year Old 2008 (cask 10121) - The Whisky Cellar
Palate: Still has dried fruit notes in abundance, with notes of dry cedar and anise developing.
Finish: Crunchy brown sugar, a hint of coffee, and strawberry sweeties.
Nose: Spiced fruit loaf and a hint of savoury malt.

Name: Glenburgie 21 Year Old - Distillery Labels (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Fragrant fruitcake spice, toasted pecans, buttery biscuits with leathery oak lingering beneath.
Finish: Oak char and cinnamon pick up, with prickles of ginger and nutmeg, softened by creamy barley and earthen oak.
Nose: Malt milkshake with a touch of roasted coffee and creamy vanilla pod.

Name: The Macallan 15 Year Old Gran Reserva (2017 Release)
Palate: An explosion of spice with soft notes of rich fruit, lingering orange and oak
Finish: Complex and long. Wood and warm spices harmoniously combine with dark chocolate and orange
Nose: Rich dried fruit, warm winter spices, orange and dark chocolate, underlying oak notes

Name: Strathmill 14 Year Old 2008 (cask 803048B) - The Single Cask
Palate: Black pepper and rich coffee complement notes of red berries, vanilla, and a little rancio.
Finish: Dark chocolate, toasted almonds, and raisins.
Nose: Some dark fruits, bittersweet chocolate, charred oak, and nutmeg.

Name: Langatun 5 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: A delicately oily mouthfeel, with barley sugar, milk chocolate, fresh pineapple and oily malt.
Finish: A prickle of spice and new oak with a short, clean and drying finish with a hint of dried mango lingering.
Nose: Highly floral, with fresh hay and a sweet grassy note, a hint of burnt rubber, old leather and tropical fruit.

Name: Ledaig 17 Year Old 2001 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Gently coastal with salted fudge, apricot, and charcoal leading the way before cinnamon and ginger join. Resinous oak is backed up by tropical fruit and a touch of biltong.
Finish: Herbaceous peat brings a medicinal touch to the finish, balanced by salted papaya and stewed stone fruits.
Nose: Sweet notes of mango, charred pineapple, and floral honey lead to tinned peaches and chantilly cream. A hint of smoked meat and oily oak join in time.

Name: Craigellachie 10 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: In a dense palate thereâs more exotic fruit and caramel notes which take centre stage with support from some delightfully meaty and funky notes.
Finish: A rich waxy element lingers in the finish that's lifted by flickers of spice.
Nose: Pungent, complex and oily with aromas of toasted vanilla, runny vanilla and overripe banana. That classic grilled pineapple is present throughout among pine nuts and Indian cooking spices.

Name: Annandale 7 Year Old 2015 - North Star Spirits
Palate: Buttery notes of cinnamon swirl, spicy root ginger, and peppery malt, with sticky dried fruit in the depths.
Finish: Warming spices linger, with a sprinkle of nutmeg supported by dense toffee.
Nose: Burnt brown sugar, poached plums, and sweet, fruit-studded Madeira cake.

Name: Wambrechies Single Malt - Madeira Cask Matured
Palate: Sweet grapes, more dried fruit, oaky tannins, and some black pepper.
Finish: Warm oak lingers with some sweet dried apricot.
Nose: Dried apricots, pears, and plump sultanas, with some earthy cinnamon, and candied orange peel.

Name: Strathmill 22 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: What a sweetie, layers of caramel and dark chocolate. This is rich and smooth with a creamy mouth-filling texture.
Finish: Long and chocolately, with almonds and then a bit of black pepper spice and leather to finish things off. Very satisfying.
Nose: Toffee, apricots, dried fruit, a touch of furniture polish, and some tobacco just peeking through.

Name: Longmorn 1966 (bottled 2019) - Private Collection (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Sweet with bursts of pepper. Steeped dark fruits - blackberry and ripe cherries envelop warming spice leading to flavours of liquorice with dried tobacco and oak.
Finish: Long; mulled fruits and charred oak providing a subtle ash finish.
Nose: Intense sweet fruitcake aromas align with brown sugar, sticky prunes, and candied citrus peel. Spice provides warmth with cinnamon and clove. Hints of vanilla come to the fore followed by forest fruits. A delicate oak smoke is present.

Name: Aikan French Malt Collection Batch NÂ°2
Palate: Rich cocoa notes join on the palate, alongside silky vanilla and warm, spiced caramel. There are more of those tropical notes, with pineapple turnover and a sprinkling of nutmeg.
Finish: Drying oak wraps things up, with biscuity malt, a dusting of cinnamon, candied, chocolate-dipped orange wheels, and hearty fruit sweetness.
Nose: Sugared citrus peels and runny, floral honey lead, with soft stone fruits leading to more tropical notes of mango, charred pineapple, and robust barley.

Name: Caol Ila 6 Year Old 2011 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Juicy roasted barley takes centre stage, with honey trickling through layers of dried herbs and smoked samphire.
Finish: Waxed lemon peels are joined by salted crackers, with lingering peat smoke and woody fennel seed spice.
Nose: Tahini bread and toasted seeds lead to hints of herbaceous peat and rich roasted malt.

Name: Tomatin 21 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Nutty brown bread with marmalade, lemon rind, honey, cinnamon and a touch of earthy barley.
Finish: Dried peels, white chocolate and dried oak.
Nose: Melted butter on a crumpet, blueberry pancakes and some sugary porridge. Breakfast-y.

Name: Highland 10 Year Old 2011 - South Star Spirits
Palate: Still chocolatey, with fresh citrus notes building.
Finish: Robust barley notes, dry oak spice, and a touch of anise.
Nose: Walnut, milk chocolate, a touch of cigar box.

Name: Glenburgie 8 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Slightly peppery as it opens, but soon enough you're treated to notes of orange flesh, green apple, buttered bread and fresh flowers.
Finish: Lasting fruit sweetness and a hint of thyme.
Nose: Melon and strawberry, with a hint of vanilla-y grist underneath.

Name: Allt-Ã¡-Bhainne 26 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Brown sugar, sponge cake and milk chocolate are tempered by darker fruits and cinnamon spice.
Finish: Vanilla lingers.
Nose: Aromas of crisp citrus, wet grass and white bread emerge ahead of sweeter notes from creamy vanilla, butterscotch and white chocolate.

Name: The Secret Series No.2 29 Year Old (Vintage Bottlers)
Palate: Cinnamon snap, raisin, toasted teacakes, ginger, and prune.
Finish: A long finish with caramel and oak galore.
Nose: Caramelised nuts and honeyed malt, with chocolate chip cookies developing.

Name: Glen Grant 1952 - Platinum Jubilee Release (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Stewed blackberry compote, sweet clementine, and milk chocolate flavours are followed by dried tobacco leaf and a menthol undertone.
Finish: A long finish with a touch of smoke and a hint of pepper.
Nose: Notes of beeswax polish give way to honeyed ripe fig aromas, toffee, and orange zest. Aged leather complements rum and raisin.

Name: East London Liquor Company & Sonoma Distilling Co. Whisky
Palate: Black pepper, dried apricot, mocha and toasted oats, with Reese's Peanut Butter Cups, orange peel and a drizzle of caramel.
Finish: Cinnamon pastries, sultana and dates with more of that cherry jam.
Nose: Candied ginger, almond croissant and honey, marzipan, toasted sourdough with cherry jam, and a waft of tobacco.

Name: Strathisla 13 Year Old Moscatel Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: Rich brown sugar and coffee notes, with fresh peach and stewed plum bringing some fruity lightness.
Finish: Black pepper, clove and cinnamon last.
Nose: Oodles of fruit notes - apple, quince, raisin, cherry! Subtle whiffs of heather and oak sneak by.

Name: Fettercairn 10 Year Old - Founder's Collection (The Whisky Baron)
Palate: More of that vanilla fudge from the nose, with peaches and cream alongside more prominent floral notes, namely honeysuckle.
Finish: More fruit appears on the finish in the form of plums and peaches, with oak spice and a dry finish.
Nose: Creamy vanilla fudge straight off the bat, fading into more delicate floral notes and sweet, ripe citrus.

Name: The English - Gently Smoked Sherry Hogshead
Palate: Creamy malt, unctuous with sweet spice, and soft smoke, and woody notes of anise and drying oak.
Finish: Sweet toffee and nutty syrup, lingering dry smoked oak, and cakey spice.
Nose: Dried fruits and boozy cherries, rich oak and a touch of liquorice.

Name: Caperdonich 23 Year Old 1997 - The Nectar of the Daily Drams
Palate: More dark fruits welcome woody spice, wafts of cinnamon buns, earthy coffee, and sweet caramel.
Finish: Lingering sweet vanilla, rich butterscotch, and creamy barley.
Nose: Ginger fudge, cherries, and berries, rich, charred oak, nutty vanilla.

Name: Rosebank 21 Year Old 1990 (Special Release 2011)
Palate: Just as the nose suggests, those Parma violet notes take the fore. Thereâs some rather pleasing notes of bramble leaves, toffee apple and cranberry, as well as a little kiwi and pine sap.
Finish: It finishes beautifully with potpourri, liquorice, lemon sherbet and (and this really is going to sound bad, but itâs really not a bad thing, honest)â¦ â¦detergent. It was difficult to even type that, but there genuinely is just a hint of it, and itâs very, very interesting.
Nose: An intensely floral nose, with huge notes of Parma violets, rose petals and just a hint of lavender. Thereâs also just a touch of bicarbonate of soda (not a bad thing) alongside oodles of sweetness.

Name: Aberlour 9 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Milk chocolate, sultana and grist. A hint of peaches in syrup underneath.
Finish: Fresh citrus peels and a hint of almond.
Nose: Vanilla-rich malt with brown sugar and green apple freshness. A hint of cut grass, too.

Name: Tomatin 11 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Brown sugar, banana and baking spice give this a rum-like opening, which develops into butterscotch, more vanilla and fresh orange peel.
Finish: Itâs a long woody and dry finish.
Nose: Homemade ginger nut biscuits, vanilla ice cream and juicy barley, then dark chocolate shavings, floral honey and heaps of ripe exotic fruit.

Name: Tobermory 23 Year Old Oloroso Sherry Cask Finish
Palate: Crunchie Bars, melted butter with a subtle salty tang to it, a hint of rum cake, sultana and fig.
Finish: Soft vanilla tablet and milk chocolate.
Nose: Caramelised dates and walnuts, followed by orange, barley, blackcurrant jam and brioche.

Name: The Glenrothes 12 Year Old - Founder's Collection (The Whisky Baron)
Palate: Freshly baked gingerbread, with oodles more baking spices in tow, namely cinnamon and nutmeg, with buttery shortbread and sultanas.
Finish: Spices continue strongly into a long and dry finish.
Nose: Stewed and spiced apples and pears, with a drizzle of caramel and just a touch of pepper spice.

Name: St Patrick's Cask Strength
Palate: Fairly gentle, with creamy vanilla, sweet malt and barley sugar, with a tang of citrus and warming oak spice.
Finish: A creamy finish, with earthy oak, vanilla and lemon curd.
Nose: Floral honey, vanilla pod, white flowers and tangy lemon peel alongside apple skin.

Name: Gulliver's 47 Toasted & Re-charred Edition
Palate: Butterscotch, caramelised dates, a slow build of cinnamon and more ginger, a touch of milk chocolate.
Finish: Lingering clove and black pepper, mellowed by sultana and poached pear.
Nose: Honeycomb, redcurrant, orange peel, gingersnaps and barley.

Name: Aberfeldy 10 Year Old - Premier Barrel (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Juicy barley and freshly baked cookies accompany honeyed dates and rich marmalade, with waves of soft, oaken vanilla throughout.
Finish: More vanilla and dried orange finish things off, bolstered by a dusting of cinnamon and syrupy flapjack.
Nose: Apple pastries, oily malt, and stewed, earthen tea lead to hints of Pear Drops and waxed citrus.

Name: Macduff 8 Year Old 2013 (cask 800568) - The Single Cask
Palate: Toffee apples, roasted nuts, and some dried herbs join the notes from the nose.
Finish: Drying oak alongside dark fruit and wintery spices.
Nose: Stewed plums and dark chocolate alongside salted caramel, wet leaves, nutmeg, and drying malt.

Name: Waterford Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.2
Palate: Mouth filling oiliness with barley, apricot, runny caramel and a kick of peppercorn.
Finish: Quite long, with crushed cinnamon and another hint of cocoa.
Nose: Forest floor and earthy spices, balanced by wine sweetness and a hint of dark chocolate.

Name: Mortlach 1969 (bottled 2019)  - Private Collection (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Smooth and rich; flavours of ripe forest fruits and fragrant blood orange peel are complemented by subtle traces of white pepper. Cinnamon comes to the fore alongside intense dark chocolate with mature oak.
Finish: Long and smooth with lingering chocolate smothered almonds and oak tannins.
Nose: Aromatic ginger and brown sugar aromas combine, giving way to rich cocoa beans. A subtle vanilla edge develops alongside succulent fruitcake and roasted almond notes.

Name: Glenkinchie 2009 (bottled 2021) Amontillado Cask Finish - Distillers Edition
Palate: Candied pecans, roasted almonds, and grassy barley are followed by zesty notes of orange-infused brandy butter.
Finish: Nutty granola and baked walnuts arrive, while fresh peach, toasted marzipan, and sweet oak linger.
Nose: Creamy praline, floral honey, and buttered sourdough, with whispers of distant herbs.

Name: Glengoyne 9 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Heather honey, cracked black pepper, oily oak and citrus peels.
Finish: Cinnamon sticks and more soft oak warmth lasts.
Nose: Brown sugar, barley, honey and a hint of salted butter.

Name: The English - Smokey Virgin Oak Cask (bottled 2022)
Palate: Through grassy peat comes nutmeg, milk chocolate, and apples.
Finish: Floral, as well as a little smoky and sweet.
Nose: Peaches in cream, fresh citrus, smoky malt, and a little ginger.

Name: Rosebank 31 Year Old (bottled 2022) - Release Two
Palate: Fantastic age while still light and vibrant, mint, chamomile with leather, berry, and banana bread.
Finish: Sweetens with hints of peach, oak, and long herbal notes.
Nose: Citrus burst, lime, lemongrass, and coriander seed, clove with soft vanilla and sugar coasted almonds.

Name: Teaninich 12 Year Old 2007 (cask 702596) - The Whisky Cellar
Palate: Cloudy lemonade, shortbread, oily barley and mixed nuts.
Finish: Runny caramel, fresh florals and salted butter.
Nose: Cinnamon rolls and pecan plaits, with a hint of coffee bean in the background.

Name: The Macallan 18 Year Old Triple Cask (2019 Release)
Palate: Fresh vanilla, dark chocolate, toasted coconut, ginger, mature oak.
Finish: Cassia, nutmeg, almond and toffee.
Nose: Roasted chestnut, thick caramel, slightly floral at points, orange oil.

Name: Hellyers Road 15 Year Old Slightly Peated
Palate: Candied ginger, buttery oak, gentle smoke, and a touch of caramel.
Finish: Lots of sweet, oily citrus and woody vanilla.
Nose: Boiled orange sweets, fragrant smoke, vanilla, and black pepper.

Name: Dewar's 16 Year Old Double Agent - Sweet and Smoky (1L)
Palate: Grilled peach is followed by toasted clove and a touch of nutmeg, silky caramel, and candied nuts tangle with distant Islay peat.
Finish: Orchard fruits linger on the finish, with sweet toffee, bold roasted malt, and singed oak.
Nose: Fresh stone fruits, almonds, and honey, with elegant smoke drifting through.

Name: Port Ellen 35 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Thick, oily and sublime, we begin with charred pineapple, warm citrus and tangy oak, then creamy nuttiness, a little brine and soft rolling coastal smoke. More dark fruits emerge with cough syrup and flickers of peppery oak. As the palate keeps going (and going and goingâ¦), thereâs Chamois Leather, subtle peat and a hint of cookie dough ice cream. Some baking spice, mahogany and candied fruits appear throughout.
Finish: The lemon sherbet note returns among a little sea air.
Nose: Fragrant smoke, honey-glazed gammon and a little apricot yoghurt, followed by brown sugar, charred oak and prickly tannins. Gingernut biscuits, white chocolate and lemon sherbets develop, with blackberry jam, oily barley, acacia honey and bittersweet garden herbs arriving soon after.

Name: Glen Elgin 18 Year Old 1998 (Special Release 2017)
Palate: Still creamy and somewhat honeyed, although in a more conventional sense now. A little water then brings out fruitier elements with orchard fruit and orange blossom.
Finish: Nut brittle and a touch of oaky smoke.
Nose: Immediately curious, perhaps from the Pombe yeast, there are notes of Greek yoghurt and honey. Fluffy white bread, chÃ¨vre, chamomile and hints of violet. Lots of fruit too, apple and blackcurrant lozenges.

Name: Aberfeldy 21 Year Old 1996 (cask 4713) - Rare Select (Montgomerie's)
Palate: It's all about the fresh fruit notes on the palate - green apple, papaya and honeydew melon.
Finish: A lasting sweetness of sugared almond and sultana.
Nose: Cinnamon-dusted shortbread and fresh mince pies with brandy butter. A hint of thyme gives it a herbaceous edge.

Name: Tullamore D.E.W.
Palate: Good body with notes of sherried peels and spice, granary toast with butter and honey, grains and vanilla cream.
Finish: Quite vegetal and long with notes of caramel and toffee.
Nose: Fruity and biscuity. There are gristy notes with caramel and toffee sweetness and plenty of peels.

Name: Auchentoshan 22 Year Old 1999 (cask 3) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Rich cherries followed by warming cinnamon spice and hints of herbal barely. Sweet sultanas and clove-studded oranges begin to make an appearance.
Finish: Drying oak, a touch of maple with sweet caramelised nuts balancing prickles of pepper.
Nose: Vegetal malt bolstered by a good helping of dried, sherried fruits and fresh vanilla pod, with hints of floral citrus poking through.

Name: Knockdhu 16 Year Old 2006 (cask KN0622) - Hidden Spirits
Palate: More of that smouldering smoke, flamed lemon peel, stone fruit, and nutmeg.
Finish: Cinnamon butter and lingering bonfire.
Nose: Charcoal smoke and burnt herbs, with flecks of seaweed, barbecued tropical fruit, set honey, and oily citrus.

Name: SmÃ¶gen 8 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: More peanut notes â now it's peanut brittle! Malty vanilla and some peppery sandalwood.
Finish: BBQ charred lemon and a dry spiciness.
Nose: Candied peanuts, earthy peat, Seville orange marmalade on toast.

Name: High Coast Silent Mills Collection - #3 SvanÃ¶
Palate: Sweet smoke develops, with creamy vanilla custard, poached pears and apple peels, and gentle, warming spice.
Finish: The peat lingers, but doesn't overpower. Stewed fruits remain, with the lemon peel re-emerging.
Nose: Subtle smoke considering the phenol content, rich oaky vanilla, buttery apple cake, and a touch of waxy lemon peel.

Name: Henstone Single Malt Whisky - Ex-Pedro XimÃ©nez Casks
Palate: More sticky dried fruits with marmalade, walnuts, and gingerbread.
Finish: Rich and sweet with aromatic spice in support.
Nose: Stewed dates, espresso, mulch, oily barley, and cinnamon.

Name: Speyside 13 Year Old 2009 (cask 14) - The Classic Series (Heroes & Heretics)
Palate: Rich malt, cinnamon, toasted oak, and ripe apples.
Finish: Baking spice and vanilla linger.
Nose: Banoffee pie, floral notes, dried fruit, and honey.

Name: Brackla 15 Year Old 2006 (cask 93311998) - Duncan Taylor
Palate: The orchard fruits continue, alongside sweetly spicy malt and crumbly vanilla fudge.
Finish: Creamy custard and earthy oak, dark chocolate brings bitter balance to the honey sweetness.
Nose: Melted caramel, lemon curd, grapes, pears, and sultanas.

Name: Secret Speyside 12 Year Old 2010 - North Star Spirits
Palate: Sweet layers of meringue and soft fruits, with stewed berries and stone fruits joining a sprinkling of baking spice.
Finish: A touch of earthy malt and pepper wraps things up, with caramelised nuts and sweet, sherried oak.
Nose: Candied tropical fruits and creamy malt, with toasted nuts and chocolate chip cookies in tow.

Name: Lehmann Câest La Vie
Palate: Flaky, sugar-dusted pastry, crystalised ginger, and dried fruits with a touch of bitter chocolate bolstering the spice.
Finish: Lingering prickles of pepper with delicate pressed fruit, oaken vanilla, and buttery barley.
Nose: Lemon peels and zest lead the way, balanced by creamy vanilla and sweet, baked apples.

Name: Craigellachie 15 Year Old 2007 (cask 19528) - Old Malt Cask (Hunter Laing)
Palate: Apple and plum notes, with some fig, dried berries, and crumbly fudge.
Finish: Winter spices and gentle sweetness.
Nose: Orchard fruits, apples and pears, with heather honey.

Name: Blair Athol 7 Year Old 2013 (cask 311432C)  - The Single Cask
Palate: Zesty citrus and a hint of chocolate, before flapjack and honey notes take shape. A good kick of dry barley spiciness underneath.
Finish: The mineral hints from the nose return, with a smidge of summer berry tart.
Nose: Flaky pastry with a mineral edge, swiftly followed by sweet ginger notes and a hint of mango.

Name: Blair Athol 10 Year Old - Premier Barrel (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Chocolate flapjack, packed with dates, apricots in syrup, a little coffee, and cacao.
Finish: Peppery spice and a hint of carraway, with biscuity malt and maple syrup in tow.
Nose: Zesty marmalade, lemon balm, honeyed barley, and dustings of cinnamon sugar.

Name: St. George Baller Single Malt
Palate: Some damp oak and rich malty notes, supported by more mango, syrupy tropical fruit and sugared grapes.
Finish: Gala apples and boiled apple sweeties too.
Nose: Fresh citrus, with grapefruit peel and some white grape wine-y notes in there too, apple skin and dried mango.

Name: Blair Athol 13 Year Old 2008 (Cask 306148B) - The Single Cask
Palate: Grilled fruit, peppery spice, golden syrup, and black tea.
Finish: Dried fruit and cinnamon linger.
Nose: Orchard fruits doused in caramel as well as hints of marmalade, espresso, and dried herbs.

Name: Dufftown 14 Year Old 2008 (cask 900705313) - Woodrow's of Edinburgh
Palate: Layers of honeyed fruit, chocolate raisins, and walnut loaf, with dried berries and toasted marzipan in tow.
Finish: Ground almonds, more sherried fruit, cinnamon, and cocoa linger.
Nose: Rich caramel, cinnamon, and clove join dense sherried fruit cake and chocolate-coated nuts.

Name: Benrinnes 11 Year Old 2010 - Hepburn's Choice (Langside)
Palate: Through sawdust and white grape comes bruised pear and allspice.
Finish: The finish is satisfying with wintery spice and cooked apple.
Nose: Sweet barley malt, cooked fruit, butter fudge, and grapefruit aromas.

Name: Bunnahabhain 14 Year Old 2008 (cask 38551188) - (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Sweet, digestive biscuits, apricots and toffee balanced by spicy ginger and cinnamon notes.
Finish: Caramel and vanilla.
Nose: Honey, vanilla and stone fruit on the nose.

Name: Glen Garioch 10 Year Old Equinox & Solstice Summer 2022 (Decadent Drinks)
Palate: Sweet oaky influence, with floral notes, creamy porridge, and crumbly vanilla fudge.
Finish: Some green pepper, with sweet hay.
Nose: Fresh cut hay and green apple, with some heather honey notes.

Name: Goldlys 12 Year Old Amontillado Cask Finish (1st Release)
Palate: Sweet with nutmeg as well as darker, more exotic spices, herbs and plenty of thick caramel.
Finish: Peppery oak.
Nose: Toffee and caramel, spicy rye and toasted oak.

Name: Tomintoul 11 Year Old 2011 (cask TM1122S) - Hidden Spirits
Palate: Creamy layers of vanilla fudge, flapjack, and barley sugars lead to a hint of honeyed melon and Rich Tea biscuits.
Finish: Cracked pepper, roasted nuts, dark chocolate, crumbly shortbread.
Nose: Soft, sweet toffee, vanilla, and distant notes of zesty, vegetal barley.

Name: Highland 7 Year Old 2014 (cask 700001) - Monologue (Chapter 7)
Palate: Boiled lemon sweets, salted caramel, and toasted (if slightly burnt) black pepper.
Finish: Ashy smoke, oily barley, and woody vanilla.
Nose: Smouldering embers, smoked nuts, heather, and fragrant tobacco.

Name: Dunville's Peated Three Crowns
Palate: Apricot, salted caramel, a touch of blackberry followed by basil leaf.
Finish: A sweet finish of butterscotch and honey.
Nose: Toffee and roasted coffee bean. Orchard fruit notes develop with a drop of water.

Name: Benriach 7 Year Old 2015 (cask BH1522) - Hidden Spirits
Palate: Silky vanilla caramel, candied orange, toffee sponge, and peppery spice.
Finish: Honeyed nuts and a little oak char.
Nose: Fresh fruit salad, with waves of buttery vanilla and nutmeg.

Name: Goldlys 14 Year Old Manzanilla Cask Finish (cask 2629)
Palate: A nice balance between sweet and spicy, with nutmeg, exotic spices and grainy caramel.
Finish: Short, distinctive Sherry flavour.
Nose: Rich, sweet honey. Oak and stewed fruit.

Name: Balblair 10 Year Old 2011 (cask 15593) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Nutmeg and caraway, followed by honey and orange peel.
Finish: Golden syrup cake, fresh ginger, and almonds.
Nose: Buttery at first, before hints of cakey vanilla and apple sweetness develop.

Name: Annandale Man OâWords Vintage 2017 - Sherry Cask (cask 1024)
Palate: Butterscotch, sweet tobacco, stewed orchard fruit, and orange peel.
Finish: Oily and nutty.
Nose: Creamy vanilla, cinnamon, dark fruit, chocolate biscuits, and oak char.

Name: Blended Malt #2 - Batch 2 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: The spice continues on the palate, but with a much more herbaceous approach. Sweet, jammy notes develop, before making way for cluster hops and white pepper.
Finish: Quite drying. Touches of Black Forest gÃ¢teau appear near the end, rich in cherry sweetness.
Nose: Spicy with cinnamon and clove. Honeysuckle bursts through after a minute, with chocolate and caramel in tow. Charred oak and a touch of red chilli.

Name: Jura 8 Year Old 2014 - Hepburn's Choice (Langside)
Palate: Crisp apple and lemon zest join biscuit dough and syrupy flapjack. A touch of citrus oil and herbal honey nestle beneath.
Finish: Candied almonds, Madeira cake, oaken vanilla, roasted malt.
Nose: Floral layers of honey and orchard blossom lead the way, joined by malt biscuits and distant dried herbs.

Name: The Cally 40 Year Old 1974 (Special Release 2015)
Palate: Bitter caramel now, warming wood spices, dates and cinnamon.
Finish: Creamy vanilla takes centre stage for a moment.
Nose: Coconut, candy lipstick then into concentrated Werther's Originals and richer, spicier treacle.

Name: Bruichladdich 15 Year Old 2005 (cask 1405) - The Red Cask Co.
Palate: Hugely chocolatey, plus more dried fruit and a waft of cigar box.
Finish: Cassia, cinnamon, dark chocolate, and menthol.
Nose: Fruit cake, dense vanilla and raisin, with hints of dusty oak developing later on.

Name: Ledaig 17 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Stone fruit, brown sugar, burnt wood and salt-washed rocks initially. On the mid-palate, thereâs sweet spices and prickly tannins followed by tinned pineapple and Frazzles.
Finish: A little salt and some medicinal elements linger among more fruity sweetness.
Nose: Ripe and cooked tropical fruits, peach cobbler and hints of meatiness, then beeswax, heather honey and slightly drier oak.

Name: Ardmore 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 191340) - Duncan Taylor
Palate: Flaky pastry, salted butter, grilled almonds, and a hint of vegetal oak.
Finish: Lasting caramel and black pepper.
Nose: Softly peaty at first, with some green apple juiciness in support.

Name: Kingsbarns 5 Year Old (cask 1610944) (Single Cask Release)
Palate: Tinned peaches, oak spice, green apple, toasted almonds, and oak char.
Finish: Vanilla pod and caramel.
Nose: Vanilla, desiccated coconut, marzipan, and pineapple rings.

Name: Linkwood 14 Year Old 2008 - Bodega Series (Goldfinch Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Buttery caramel, cinnamon biscuits, and floral hedgerow fruits, with dark chocolate nestling beneath.
Finish: Lingering baking spices, syrupy sponge, jammy berries, and robust oak.
Nose: Cooked stone fruits and autumn berries are followed by warm toffee with a sprinkle of herbal spice.

Name: Ballechin 10 Year Old 2009 (cask 328) - Straight From The Cask
Palate: Dried herbs, dark brown sugar, rich malty oak, and earthy peat.
Finish: Flaked dark chocolate, candied orange, and bonfire smoke.
Nose: Grilled pineapple, honey-roasted nuts, Frazzles, and baked earth.

Name: Macduff 12 Year Old 2007 (cask 11200) - Rest & Be Thankful
Palate: Vanilla and honey comes to the fore on the palate, still with ginger and bready malt underneath.
Finish: Slightly fruity with hints of honeydew melon and lemon peel.
Nose: Sweet rose and violet, seeded loaf, fresh ginger and a sprig of thyme.

Name: Lochindaal 12 Year Old 2009 - The Single Cask
Palate: Earthy peat and orchard fruit take centre stage.
Finish: Tangy lemon and wood ash linger.
Nose: BBQ ribs, iodine, and treacle with honey-roasted nuts in the backdrop.

Name: Pure Kentucky XO
Palate: More cinnamon spice returns on the palate, with a good helping of toffee, clove-studded orange, peppery oak and toasted corn.
Finish: Vanilla and white pepper on an oily, sweetcorn finish.
Nose: Slightly herbal oak, with dried apricot, building oak spice and honeyed cinnamon, along with a dash of maple syrup.

Name: Glen Garioch 11 Year Old 2010 - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Zingy tropical fruit, buttery vanilla, and lychee.
Finish: oily, delicate, sweet oak spice
Nose: Sweet orange oil, floral honey, toasted malt, and pineapples in syrup.

Name: High Coast Silent Mills Collection - #2 SandÃ¶
Palate: Rich smoke, with sticky malt loaf, dried prunes and apples, and gentle spice.
Finish: The peat lingers, backed by sherry soaked fruits, and crisp apple.
Nose: Mouth-watering barbeque smoke, with creamy vanilla and barley sugar, plenty of sherry character with dried raisins and cocoa nibs.

Name: Tresor Legendaire Finish En FÃ»t De Vin Jaune
Palate: Dried fruits, malt, cereal and toast and a touch of honey.
Finish: Powerful and persistent.
Nose: Expressive with aromas of honey, biscuit and smoke.

Name: Moon Harbour Dock 1 â ChÃ¢teau La LouviÃ¨re
Palate: Black Forest gÃ¢teau, cocoa nibs, brown sugar, and woody spices.
Finish: Warm cinnamon and raisins linger.
Nose: Fresh cherries and grapes, with a touch of aniseed, and floral honey.

Name: Blair Athol 8 Year Old - Premier Barrel (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Marmalade and lemon curd, mellowed by caramel and grassy malt.
Finish: Baking spices, treacle tart, and toffee apples.
Nose: Crisp green apple, honeyed barley, cinnamon buns dipped in coffee.

Name: Loch Lomond 25 Year Old - Lee Westwood Single Cask
Palate: Very fruity with bursts of fresh ripe peach and crisp apple, followed by caramel sweetness and toasted oak.
Finish: Long and lingering ginger and cinnamon spice.
Nose: Sweet vanilla fudge and juicy pineapple.

Name: Linkwood 9 Year Old 2013 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)
Palate: Creamy malt, with warm spices, and some delicate tropical fruit.
Finish: Woody spice, with dried mango.
Nose: Toffee, sweet hay, and pencil shavings, with some ripe honeydew melon, and fresh apricots.

Name: Blair Athol 21 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Cinnamon and sandalwood, followed by honey, quince, and cooked apple.
Finish: Sultana, apricot again, a smidge of tangy pineapple.
Nose: Soft hints of dry oak and Brazil nuts, wrapped up in caramel and apricot jam.

Name: Dufftown 13 Year Old 2008 (cask 700203) - Artful Dodger
Palate: A subtle peppery heat, but still jam-packed with creamy vanilla and caramel.
Finish: Zesty green apple and juicy orange.
Nose: Floral honey and fresh barley, wrapped up in vanilla.

Name: Glen Spey 13 Year Old 2008 (cask 801878A) - The Single Cask
Palate: Another smoky hint on the palate, wrapped up in creamy vanilla and bruised apple.
Finish: Rounded barley notes last long on the finish.
Nose: Honeycomb, muesli with milk, a hint of coastal breeze.

Name: Glen Spey 21 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Thick-cut marmalade, red fruits and a little warming cedar make way for waves of milk chocolate goodness, toffee and a little salted butter.
Finish: Drying nutmeg lingers.
Nose: Fragrant barley, thyme honey and vanilla ice cream upfront which moves into roasted apricot and pear.

Name: Blair Athol 14 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: The earthy notes remain, with a touch of pine for company, while chocolate praline and plum notes develop.
Finish: Oak richness in full force.
Nose: Brilliantly chocolatey, with flashes of tangy red fruit and softly earthy malt popping up.

Name: Glen Spey 14 Year Old 2007 - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Oily malt is accompanied by plenty of candied fruit, drizzles of dark caramel, and jammy hedgerow fruits.
Finish: Dustings of cinnamon and cocoa finish things off, with sweet baking spice and sherried oak in tow.
Nose: Toasted almonds, poached peaches, chocolate fondant, and earthy coffee grounds.

Name: Strathisla 11 Year Old 2010 (cask 582) - Explorations (The Single Cask)
Palate: Creamy malt, with oily orange and lime zest, warm oak, buttered and honeyed toast, and gentle peppery spice.
Finish: The peppery spice lingers, with oaky vanilla and gentle citrus.
Nose: Drizzles of caramel alongside orchard fruits, earthy spice, and gentle floral notes.

Name: Speyburn 15 Year Old 2007 (cask 19721) - Old Malt Cask (Hunter Laing)
Palate: Maltesers, with some brown sugar, praline, and candied orange peel.
Finish: Rich and sweet, with warming spices.
Nose: Milk chocolate, sweet cereal notes, and some dried vine fruits.

Name: Knockdhu 8 Year Old 2013 - Single Cask Series (GreatDrams)
Palate: Bold oak and rich barley lead the way with sweet honey, soaked sultanas, and nutty spice.
Finish: Dark fruit cake notes, with cinnamon, a touch of clove, toffee sauce, and spiced cedar.
Nose: Rich wafts of coffee and malt, dried, sherried fruits, and warming baking spice.

Name: Braes of Glenlivet 27 Year Old - Secret Speyside Collection
Palate: Sweet, creamy flavours with hints of ripe banana and butterscotch.
Finish: Long and velvety.
Nose: Notes of sweet red apple and nutty oak.

Name: The Speysiders 10 Year Old 2009 - The Vatting (Murray McDavid) (2019 Release)
Palate: Oily malt, a hint of barrel char and vanilla shortbread, with a hint of fruitcake.
Finish: Berry jam and subtle oak spice.
Nose: Fresh raspberry, chocolate digestives and toffee apple.

Name: Teaninich 13 Year Old 2009 (cask 712136) - Single Cask Series (The Red Cask Company)
Palate: A good helping of rich baking spice leads the way while warming barley and stewed stone fruits gather.
Finish: Nutty, with herbaceous malt and marmalade joined by juicy sultanas and peppery warmth.
Nose: Creamy praline, zesty orange peels, and floral malt, with roasted almonds and cinnamon sticks.

Name: Strathdearn 7 Year Old 2014 (cask 9900002) - Family Series (The Single Cask)
Palate: Juicy and peaty, barbecued fruit, baking spice, and roasted coffee bean.
Finish: Light smoke, candied ginger, citrus peels, and Bakewell tart.
Nose: Delicately smoky, lemon curd, apple tart, and honey.

Name: Greenkeeper's Gloves 1988 (bottled 2019) - Wemyss Malts (Invergordon)
Palate: Leads with pineapple and white grape, before another helping of earthy, leafy notes arrive. A dusting of brown sugar later on.
Finish: Dried cherry, cassia, a hint of olive oil.
Nose: Earthy vanilla pod and mature oak, with some green moss notes. Subtle touches of good rum to it.

Name: Teaninich 10 Year Old 2011 (cask TH1122S) - Hidden Spirits
Palate: Chocolate-coated raisins, savoury smoke, and ripe plum.
Finish: Bittersweet cocoa and oily almond.
Nose: Sweet notes of toffee and caramelised nuts balanced by touches of flint and wood char.

Name: Teaninich 2009 (cask 11092) (bottled 2022) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Sticky dried fruits with plenty of floral honey are joined by juicy plums, and biscuity malt. Candied orange peels and cakey spice build, with a touch of tobacco beneath.
Finish: Earthen vanilla pod, more soft stone fruits, burnt sugar, and elegant spice.
Nose: Woody apricot and sultanas follow soft peach and vanilla, with hints of zesty lime and smoked oak in the distance.

Name: Pulteney 11 Year Old 2011 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)
Palate: Vanilla pod, sweet barley, and zesty lemon are balanced by a pinch of sea salt.
Finish: Candied citrus, runny honey, and salted cashews.
Nose: Flamed orange peel, buttered fruit scones, and a sea breeze.

Name: Auchroisk 13 Year Old 2008 (cask AK822) - Hidden Spirits
Palate: Bakewell tart, cinnamon rolls, and oak char.
Finish: Dried fig, and hot cross buns.
Nose: Plump raisin, apple pie, and peppery wood.

Name: Pelter 5 Year Old â Batch #2
Palate: Malty, with a layer of honey and some warm oak.
Finish: Slightly chocolatey on the finish, plus tobacco hints.
Nose: Pecan, lemon drizzle cake, melted butter, slightly floral.

Name: Caol Ila 13 Year Old 2007 - Equinox & Solstice Autumn 2021 Edition
Palate: Smoke remains at the fore, but never becoming overwhelming and intense. Barley, heather honey, and stewed apples.
Finish: Baked earth with a prickle of peppery spice.
Nose: Oat cakes, flint, smoke drifting in delicately, a touch of lemon meringue.

Name: Craigellachie 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 14967) - Clan Denny (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Crumbly fudge, with allspice, clove, some ginger, and poached orchard fruits.
Finish: Toasty grain, with warm winter spices.
Nose: Fruity Speyside character, dried apples and apricots, with some barley sugar, and nutty grain.

Name: The English 11 Year Old 2011 - Signature Series (The Whisky Baron)
Palate: More toffee sweetness, with toasted coconut, syrupy flapjacks, and earthy peat.
Finish: The peat lingers, along with vanilla fudge, and some black pepper.
Nose: Sweet bourbon character joins subtle smoke.

Name: Elsburn 3 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company
Palate: Gloriously rich with sweet dates, juicy raisins, and maraschino cherries balancing bitter dark chocolate and rich oak.
Finish: A fabulous balance of dark fruit, chocolate, and spice.
Nose: A big hit of dark cherry chocolate kicks things off with notes of almond butter, fragrant tobacco, and a whiff of wood smoke.

Name: Paul John 4 Year Old 2016 (Single Cask Nation)
Palate: Oatcakes with marmalade, creamy malt with hearty notes of anise and baking spice, ash lingers in the distance.
Finish: Rich robust coffee, roasty and gently earthen with dark chocolate, spiced nuts, and oaken caramel.
Nose: Bold barley, zesty honey, a touch of fennel, and crisp green apples with wafts of oak char.

Name: Tresor Legendaire Finish En FÃ»t De Vin Paille
Palate: Fruity with orchard fruits at the fore and a hint of vanilla.
Finish: Smooth, long and lingering.
Nose: Toast, vanilla, peaches, apples.

Name: Gelston's 12 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish
Palate: Orange peel, brown sugar, chocolate raisins.
Finish: A slow build of cinnamon and black pepper on the finish.
Nose: Honeycomb, raspberry, a light touch of mint, coffee bean.

Name: Annandale Man OâSword Vintage 2017 - Sherry Cask (cask 1088)
Palate: Toasted almonds, rich malt, dried fruit, liqourice, and Lapsang Souchong.
Finish: Earthy peat embers linger.
Nose: Fruit cake, burnt pine, roasted nuts, sherry-stained oak, and orange peel.

Name: Glen Garioch 8 Year Old - Premier Barrel (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Currant buns and gooey flapjack are followed by hearty layers of toasted spices, malt loaf, and roasted nuts.
Finish: Ginger, cinnamon and just a touch of fennel finish things off.
Nose: Custard tarts dusted with vanilla and nutmeg, a drizzle of honey, and buttery oak char.

Name: Black Bull 40 Year Old - 7th Release (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Toffee apples with honeyed orchard fruit, more chocolate and vanilla.
Finish: Long with reduced fruit, vanilla caramel and soft spice.
Nose: Full and rounded with butterscotch, milk chocolate and citrus hints.

Name: Life's A Peach 14 Year Old 2008 - Wemyss Malts (Dufftown)
Palate: Runny caramel and creamy vanilla soften notes of buttered fennel while oily oak and soft stone fruits bring juicy sweetness.
Finish: Treacle toffee arrives, along with sweet baking spices, salted fudge, and a hint of cinnamon heat.
Nose: Homemade marmalade and fresh hay. Honeyed flapjack, candied pecans, and vanilla.

Name: Blair Athol 23 Year Old 1993 (Special Release 2017)
Palate: Toffee apples lead the way on the rich, firm palate, again without things getting too sweet. Some raisins in the tail.
Finish: Creamy with lingering plum, grapefruit squash and nettle notes.
Nose: 'Sherried' off the bat with peppermint creams. Burnt toffee, Christmas spice, orange and sweetpea strike a good balance between sweet and savoury.

Name: The Secret Series No.3 32 Year Old (Vintage Bottlers)
Palate: Medicinal iodine notes and rich smoke move through toffee pennies, vanilla, and nougat with ripe white fruit underneath.
Finish: Long and full of smoke and sea.
Nose: Ashy smoke, brine, caramel, and rich tropical fruits.

Name: Tomintoul 19 Year Old 2000 (cask 1) - Port Pipe Matured
Palate: Raisins join the plums and summer fruits backed by peppery and cumin notes.
Finish: Joyful balance of sweetness and spice in a lingering finish.
Nose: Plummy sweetness overlying creamy toffee malt with a hint of summer fruits.

Name: The Glenrothes 36 Year Old 1986- North Star Spirits
Palate: Dry vanilla, raspberry, and Doc Brown's banana skin.
Finish: Roads? Where we're going we don't need roads.
Nose: Rooibos tea, thick bracken, and tablet.

Name: Ledaig 21 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: The whisky's age starts to be shown off on the palate, with mature oak and new leather notes appearing underneath the peat, toffee and roasted pineapple.
Finish: Lasting chilli-chocolate and coastal air.
Nose: Smoked meats, white grapes and sea spray, then drying wood spice and salted caramel tart.

Name: The London Distillery Company Rye Whiskey LV-1767 Edition (2020 Release)
Palate: Rich cinnamon & stewed peaches compliment the beeswax not from the oak.
Finish: Lingering white pepper spice & dark cherry.
Nose: Chocolate & lightly roasted coffee, followed by banana & pear notes, with an apple mint to finish.

Name: Spirit of Hven Seven Stars No.6:2 Alcor
Palate: Chocolatey at first, before earthy peat develops. Balanced by sweeter hints of liquorice and barley.
Finish: Quite long, with red fruit appearing later on.
Nose: Fruity coffee, tobacco smoke and orange rind.

Name: Glen Elgin 10 Year Old 2008 - Cask Strength (Mossburn)
Palate: Cask spiciness starts to come in to play here, with cinnamon and ginger developing on top of the ripe orchard fruit sweetness.
Finish: Packed with honey and greengage, plus a lasting tickle of black pepper.
Nose: Cooked pear, melted butter and a whiff of floral barley.

Name: Deanston 11 Year Old 2009 - Single Cask Series (GreatDrams)
Palate: Mocha notes creep in with some poached peach, earthy oak, and buttery barley to balance zesty lemon.
Finish: Soft and buttery, gently floral with hints of honey and creamy oak.
Nose: Cinnamon buns, vanilla fudge, juicy raisins, roasted walnuts.

Name: The Nailed Puppet 11 Year Old - Whisky of Voodoo
Palate: Sweet zesty fruit and sugary Pear Drops, robust malt, and softly mineral peat smoke mingle, while a touch of bitter oak rests beneath.
Finish: Elegant smoke and tropical fruit notes linger, with buttery vanilla and drying, spicy oak.
Nose: Quite tropical with wafts of charred pineapple and plantain, plus creamy vanilla and peach tagging along.

Name: Cragganmore 26 Year Old 1995 - Old & Rare Platinum (Hunter Laing)
Palate: Woody spice builds alongside biscuity malt and chocolate raisins. Roasted nuts and drying spice gather beneath.
Finish: Sweet and spicy with fiery cinnamon, poached pears, prickles of pepper, and boozy sultanas.
Nose: Toasted almonds and cherry Madeira cake, leathery oak, and soft, buttery fruit.

Name: The Rusty Cauldron 11 Year Old - Whisky of Voodoo
Palate: Vinous red fruits and berry compote lead to rich dates and nutty oak. Gentle smoke floats throughout, with salted chocolate and a touch of meaty malt beneath.
Finish: Warming pepper builds on the finish, with a touch of brine and iodine, vegetal peat, and charcoal.
Nose: Smouldering bonfire smoke welcomes the way for jammy cherries and berries. Coastal breeze and dried fruits join, with oily oak in the distance.

Name: Spirit of Hven Seven Stars No.6:1 Mizar
Palate: Dry notes of toasted oak and subtle peat, with more violets and vanilla accompanied by loads of chocolate, sweet malt, rich coffee and cinnamon.
Finish: The palate continues onto the finish, with the addition of rich fruity wine notes and gently tannic oak.
Nose: Gentle smokiness alongside sweeter notes of raisins, liquorice, vanilla and cacao. Delicately floral chamomile and violet balanced by old leather and grassy aromas.

Name: Carriages At Midnight 14 Year Old 2007 - Wemyss Malts (Glen Moray)
Palate: Chocolate and marshmallow bring suggestions of rocky road, while crisp gingerbread and peppery heat are softened by creamy peach.
Finish: Poached stone fruits, caramel wafers, and lemon tart keep things sweet and zesty, with lingering notes of candied ginger and vanilla.
Nose: Waxy honeycomb, fresh pear, and sweet vanilla with hints of nutty nougat and bold oak.

Name: Orkney's Finest 8 Year Old 2014 - Provenance Coastal Collection (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Stone fruits and fragrant peppercorns tangle, while floral malt rests comfortably in the depths. A whisp of charred herbs and seaweed are softened by silky caramel.
Finish: Hefty baking spice, toasted oak, and grilled apricot, with lingering prickles of pepper and a far-off coastal bonfire.
Nose: Creamy barley and chalky grist mingle with a herbaceous sea breeze, with zesty lemon curd in the distance.

Name: Tomintoul 16 Year Old 2004 (cask 775) - Sauternes Barrel
Palate: Peach, honeycomb, vanilla pod, candied peanuts, and sweet cinnamon.
Finish: Lemon drizzle cake, milky tea, and gingerbread.
Nose: Lemon curd, waxy peels, aromatic honey, and fresh barley.

Name: Seaweed & Aeons & Digging & Fire & Cask Strength 18 Year Old
Palate: Tarry smoke, mocha, and salted dark chocolate lead to notes of barbecued meats and smoked peppercorns, backed by powerful oak and salted plums follow.
Finish: Sherry and peat tangle gloriously, with smouldering driftwood, smoked almonds, and dried seaweed joined by dates, charred apricot, and toasted vanilla.
Nose: Freshly laid tarmac on a hot summer's day, earthy malt and bonfire smoke are joined by fruitier notes of grilled peach. Old oak furniture, cedar, and a touch of herbaceous tobacco follow, with whispers of vanilla.

Name: McGibbon's 8 Year Old Gold Ribbon
Palate: Dried berries dusted with Christmas spices and drizzled with golden syrup. A touch of filo pastry.
Finish: Subtly minty, with notes of apple turnover and shortbread.
Nose: Toffee, beeswax and a pinch of peppercorn. Some earthy vanilla sticks around.

Name: Tomintoul 15 Year Old 2005 (cask 1772) - White Moscatel Barrel
Palate: Rose petal jam, milk chocolate, more orange and grapefruit zest.
Finish: Almond croissant, gingerbread, and a hint of tobacco.
Nose: Bright citrus notes, paired with mellow vanilla and a whisper of fresh violets.

Name: Glen Moray 13 Year Old (cask CM266) - The Golden Cask (House of Macduff)
Palate: Nutty barley dominates the palate, with more apple and cedar developing later.
Finish: Vanilla essence, chocolate digestives, and cinnamon.
Nose: Fried dough, fruit salad (both the sweeties and actual fruit salad), and dry oak.

Name: Old Bardstown Kentucky Straight Bourbon
Palate: Rye bread, melted brown sugar, cocoa powder, white flowers, and a waft of menthol.
Finish: Toffee popcorn, blackberry jam, and one last hit of baking spice.
Nose: Gentle oak spice, butterscotch, nougat, orange marmalade, and a smidge of cut grass.

Name: Longrow 14 Year Old - Early 2000s
Palate: Apple blossom and smoky malt on the palate - coffee and nutmeg flavours, hints of linseed and oily peat.
Finish: Long, spiced finish with oak and potpourri.
Nose: A medium-bodied nose with hints of freshly mown grass, heather honey and malt. A little soft smoke.

Name: Sierra Norte Black Corn
Palate: Fairly funky, with ripe plantain and banana, coffee bean, rich brown sugar and salted caramel.
Finish: Marzipan, vanilla sponge and a touch of dusty oak.
Nose: Cherry jam, orange peel, a vegetal note and banana peel.

Name: Teaninich 8 Year Old 2014 (cask 703177B) - Family Series (The Single Cask)
Palate: Dried fruit, nutmeg, milky coffee, and chocolate nuts.
Finish: Walnut bread and orange zest.
Nose: Orange peel, oily walnuts, buttery pastries, and plenty of rich malt.

Name: Glenlossie 12 Year Old 2008 (cask 9603) - Monologue (Chapter 7)
Palate: Nutty fudge, floral fruit blossom, butterscotch, and allspice.
Finish: Sweet orchard fruits with gentle oak and earthy spice.
Nose: Almond butter on toasted brioche, honeyed cereal, and sawdust.

Name: Port Dundas 18 Year Old 2004 (cask 16483) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Creamy butterscotch, vanilla wafers, and toffee popcorn, with gentle baking spices gathering beneath.
Finish: Charred oak, a hint of toasted coconut, and fresh cinnamon buns, drizzled with icing.
Nose: Buttery vanilla shortbread, a dusting of ginger, and syrup-soaked fruits.

Name: Bushmills 30 Year Old 1991 Madeira Cask Finish - The Causeway Collection
Palate: Full-bodied, almost chewy, with stone fruits, dates, pecans, sultanas, vanilla, toffee apples, and wintery spice.
Finish: Drying oak and still an abundance of tropical fruit.
Nose: Incredibly fruity with mandarin, charred pineapple, dried mango, and creamy banana with chocolate truffle, rich nuts, and pipe tobacco.

Name: Cambus 31 Year Old 1991 (cask 104229) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Sponge cake and honey are joined by spiced biscuits and butterscotch while vanilla and hazelnut cream and zesty lemon nestle beneath.
Finish: Granola packed with milk chocolate and raisins, a touch of pepper, milky coffee, and buttery oak.
Nose: Warm caramel, sweet cereal, buttery flapjack, and cooked apple.

Name: Dailuaine 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 307367) - Monologue (Chapter 7)
Palate: Toasted almonds, buttery biscuits, citrus, and orchard fruit.
Finish: Rich oak char and caramel.
Nose: Vanilla, oily malt, pork scratchings, and black pepper.

Name: Dallas Dhu 50 Year Old 1969 - Private Collection (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Toffee apples with fruit and nut dark chocolate flavours accompany mouth-warming cracked peppercorns. Spice sits in the background while wood tannins begin to take hold.
Finish: Lingering and warming; roasted coffee beans evolve into a subtle herbal edge. Full of character with a crisp clean edge.
Nose: Aromas of rich fruitcake laden with plump raisins, sultanas, and orange peel. An elegant sweetness of candied ginger, almond marzipan, and treacle toffee. Wisps of wood smoke and tobacco linger upon a back drop of subtle oak.

Name: Millstone 3 Year Old (That Boutique-y Rye Company)
Palate: Spiced apple turnover, more maple syrup, subtly oaky and with a hint of white pepper.
Finish: Cinnamon, brown sugar and black pepper.
Nose: Maple syrup, toasted rye, orange peel and waves of honey.

Name: Caol Ila 9 Year Old 2010 - Hepburn's Choice (Langside)
Palate: Still packed plenty of coastal notes, though how with honey and damson jam in support.
Finish: Cinnamon and smoked paprika spiciness, mellowed by caramel.
Nose: Strawberry tart, seaweed, and some savoury oatcake warmth.

Name: Dailuaine 2010 (bottled 2022) Small Batch - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Still zesty with marmalade and creamy lemon curd, lifted by sweet sultanas and vanilla fudge. Honeyed nuts join in time, bolstered by buttery barley.
Finish: Creamy crushed nuts and burnt custard, a touch of clove, and herbaceous pepper spice.
Nose: Creamy praline and sugared shortbread, orange zest, toasted oak and biscuity malt.

Name: Moon Harbour Dock 1 - ChÃ¢teau Haut-Bergeron
Palate: Creamy vanilla, with apricots, ginger, and some dried orange peel.
Finish: Peppery spices build, along with oaky vanilla character.
Nose: Floral fruitiness from the wine barrels, with nectarines and some heather honey.

Name: Craigellachie 10 Year Old 2006 (cask CM237) - The Golden Cask (House of Macduff)
Palate: White grape, crunchy brown sugar and woody tannins.
Finish: Dry toast and a smidge of lemon zest.
Nose: Fragrant barley and ripe apricot, with a hint of dusty oak in the background.

Name: Inchmurrin 22 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Aromatic smoky spices dominate with sweeter vanilla and toffee notes.
Finish: Sweetness continues until the end with coconut plus some pungent lingering spices.
Nose: Zingy fresh on the nose, lemon peel and lime juice, with black pepper and chillis.

Name: Glen Spey 12 Year Old 2009 (cask GS922S) - Hidden Spirits
Palate: Honeyed sultanas and biscuity barley lead the way, joined by creamy milk chocolate and spiced nuts.
Finish: Buttery, oily malt, dried orange peels, a touch of nutmeg, and ginger.
Nose: Sweet melon, herbal honey, toasted nuts, and a touch of grassy malt.

Name: Teaninich 9 Year Old 2007 (cask CM229) - The Golden Cask (House of Macduff)
Palate: Dried orange, walnut loaf and spicy barley.
Finish: Buttery, with a touch of white grape.
Nose: Soft notes of milky coffee, apricot and sandalwood.

Name: Blair Athol 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 304006) - Auld Goonsy's Malt
Palate: Butterscotch, a hint of toffee popcorn and flaked almonds, sweet toasted oak with rich vanilla.
Finish: More sugared nuts, peppery spice picks up with a touch of burnt sugar to balance.
Nose: Honeyed fruit and buttery shortbread, creamy vanilla fudge.

Name: Benrinnes 8 Year Old 2013 (cask 15650) - Provenance (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Creamy vanilla and stewed stone fruits take the lead, with buttered shortbread and biscuity malt in tow.
Finish: Fresh pastries, flaked almonds, vanilla fudge, and a touch of vegetal, oaken spice.
Nose: Fresh apples, pears, and plums, followed by melted butter and honey on sourdough.

Name: Langatun 5 Year Old - Batch 3 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: The tropical fruit fiesta continues, wrapped up in an oily, creamy mouthfeel. There are some more delicate florals that come through, along with a breakfast cereal graininess. Raisins, pecans, dried banana slices and some gentle red fruits add interest.
Finish: Long and oily, rounding off with a pleasingly sweet spice warmth.
Nose: Immediately grassy and honeyed, with a real vegetal vibe. Thereâs a burnt rubber quality too, along with pineapple, mega-ripe banana, a whisper of cinnamon, and a dash of black pepper.

Name: Strathmill 11 Year Old 2010 (cask 9933026) - The Octave (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Vanilla fudge, a nutty touch of maple followed by cooked apple, and a touch of mint chocolate.
Finish: Yet more oaken vanilla and herbal barley, with honeyed apricot balancing soft baking spice.
Nose: Gooey flapjacks with roasted nuts and sweet honey. Floral notes of grassy malt and toasted oak.

Name: Craigellachie 10 Year Old - Batch 6 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Brown sugar, spiced apple pie and earthy coffee bean, with runny honey and orange boiled sweeties. Notes of clove and cinnamon develop later on.
Finish: Cedar and a little hickory linger.
Nose: Barbecued pineapple, fresh barley and a hint of nutty brown bread with salted butter lead among thick dates, toasted almond a bit of flint-y minerality.

Name: Be Thankful And Rested 14 Year Old 2008 - Wemyss Malts (Blair Athol)
Palate: Mellow golden syrup, yellow fruit, and nutty spice.
Finish: Rich warming spice remains.
Nose: Pink grapefruit provides a bright citrus backdrop from which sugared cereal, a touch of vanilla, and chocolate Brazil nuts emerge.

Name: The Busker Single Malt
Palate: Chocolate-dipped banana, raisins, new leather, and cinnamon buns.
Finish: Banana custard and sweet cereals.
Nose: Candied orange, dried apple, digestive biscuits, tobacco, and apricot jam.

Name: Armorik 5 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Rich, gloopy honey, toasted nuts, and more stone fruits welcome the way for warming baking spices.
Finish: Gingerbread, more sweet, floral honey, and a well rounded peppering of toasted oak and spice on the finish.
Nose: Plenty of peach and apricot with aromatic wafts of wildflowers and soft oak spice.

Name: Dalmunach 6 Year Old 2016 - Big Brother (Na BrÃ ithrean)
Palate: Raisins, orange peel, dried apricots, with big spices and maraschino cherries.
Finish: Lingering vanilla and spice.
Nose: Big sweet nose with dates, raisins, spice, and molasses.

Name: Peatside 7 Year Old 2011 - The Vatting (Murray McDavid) (2019 Release)
Palate: A hit of oak spice, woody vanilla and rich peat, and a spoonful of cherry jam.
Finish: Buttery pastries linger alongside bonfire smoke.
Nose: Waves of smoky peat, with a savoury maritime touch alongside stewed red berries.

Name: Waterford Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.2
Palate: Honeyed malt and juicy orchard fruits meet on the palate, with a hint of earthy spice.
Finish: A subtle hint of salinity on the finish, with lingering pepper and caraway.
Nose: Bright barley notes - not nutty, more floral and malty. Hints of sultana and crisp pear shine through.

Name: Ledaig Un-Peated 23 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Pineapple once again, now with a hint of BBQ char. Loads of toffee and banana. Subdued coastal salinity.
Finish: Ginger, mint, mango and apple.
Nose: Honeyed barley and pineapple cubes. Slightly chocolatey at points. A whiff of spiced fruit compote develops later on.

Name: Ledaig 12 Year Old - Wee Brother (Na BrÃ ithrean)
Palate: Fruit and nut cake, rich charred oak, and spice build alongside a touch of butterscotch, earthy peat, and bold barley.
Finish: Prickles of black pepper, spicy oak with hints of vanilla, plenty of warm spice, and dry smoke.
Nose: Grassy malt and peat, gentle smoke with a touch of walnut oil, vanilla, and dried fruits.

Name: The Glenrothes 18 Year Old 1997 (cask 234) - Mackillop's Choice
Palate: Barley sugar, Sherried fruit, vanilla and blueberry muffins.
Finish: Peppercorns, apple and runny toffee.
Nose: Jamaican ginger cake, mixed peels and walnuts.

Name: Glenfiddich 21 Year Old Experimental Series - Winter Storm (Batch 2)
Palate: Soft sweet notes reminiscent of candied fruit and Turkish delight develop into flavours of mouthwatering lychee. The fusion of sweet flavours is soon met with a rich drying sensation from the icewine.
Finish: Short and crisp.
Nose: A bouquet of tropical fruit and candied sweets are perfectly balanced with underlying wine notes.

Name: Glen Garioch 8 Year Old 2014 (cask 16334) - Provenance (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Marmalade, cocoa, toffee, a little manuka honey.
Finish: Notes of custard and hints of smoke.
Nose: Vanilla, lemon peel, milky coffee, and golden barley.

Name: Irish Single Malt #2 16 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Bourbon cask vanilla, apricot and green apples, followed by dried mango, honey spread on granary toast and zesty wood spices.
Finish: Long and quite dry with cereal and marmalade.
Nose: Buttery fudge, toasted coconut and golden barley, with salted peanuts, orange peel and nutmeg underneath.

Name: Tomintoul 11 Year Old 2010 (cask 11124) - Monologue (Chapter 7)
Palate: Caramelised nuts, cigar box, plum sauce, and salted fudge.
Finish: Fiery ginger, creamy vanilla, and green apple.
Nose: Coffee and walnut cake, black pepper, cut grass, and toffee apple, with subtle flinty undertones.

Name: Benriach Peated 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 740016) - Duncan Taylor
Palate: Toasted nuts and chocolatey malt tangle with hearty peat smoke, while root ginger and cinnamon murmur in the depths.
Finish: The coffee returns joined by bittersweet cocoa and lingering bonfire smoke.
Nose: Robust roasted coffee and dark chocolate cherries, woody spice, and charred earth.

Name: Speyside #3 8 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Fiery alcohol, very peppery, but tempered by some sweet notes, green banana, and a creamy texture.
Finish: More spice, lingering taste of Thai green curry.
Nose: Lots of new make character, fruity cherry and peach notes with grassy vegetal flavours.

Name: Ballyhoo Irish Whiskey
Palate: Brown sugar and a little espresso with dark fruits in support.
Finish: Spicy, with a little grain sweetness tempering it.
Nose: Floral notes breeze through sweet melon and vanilla.

Name: Tullibardine 7 Year Old (cask 144) - DrÃ m MÃ²r
Palate: Butterscotch, hazelnut whip, dates, and cinder toffee.
Finish: Sweet nut brittle and baking spice linger.
Nose: Gingernut biscuits, caramel, orange peel, and a little floral honey.

Name: Dalmunach 6 Year Old 2016 - Wee Brother (Na BrÃ ithrean)
Palate: Very cereal led on the palate with orange blossom and apple fruit.
Finish: Vanilla and subtle spice.
Nose: Light citrus fruit on the nose with honey and oats.

Name: Benrinnes 12 Year Old (cask 302360) - DrÃ m MÃ²r
Palate: Vibrant, fresh orchard fruits with a touch of funky tang, spiced fruit cake follows before dryer kitchen spice and sandalwood join.
