Finish: Tingles of warmth edge in, with earthen vanilla resting in the depths.
Nose: Delicately floral malt, buttery, flaky pastries, a touch of marzipan and cider apples.

Name: Beldorney 24 Year Old 1997 (cask 2031153) - The Octave (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Rhubarb and custard sweeties, ginger, plenty of earthy spice to go along with it.
Finish: Vanilla pod, a touch of beeswax, nutmeg.
Nose: Green apple and fresh raspberry, followed by a flash of orange zest. Buttered bread and polished oak later on.

Name: Dailuaine 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 307387 & 307404 & 307410) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Toasted tea cakes with juicy sultanas, bold, peppery barley, softer notes of vanilla, and hints of floral honey.
Finish: Slightly herbaceous towards the end, with fruit cake spice, toasted nuts, and dried fruits lingering.
Nose: Nutty malt and buttery flapjack, with stewed, spiced orchard fruit.

Name: Aultmore 10 Year Old 2010 (cask CM271) - The Golden Cask (House of Macduff)
Palate: Peanut brittle, cut grass, vanilla wafers, and some peppery spice.
Finish: Honey, green apples, and another touch of grassy malt.
Nose: Banana fritters and vanilla ice cream, with a hint of oak spiciness.

Name: Tullibardine 10 Year Old 2007 (cask CM243) - The Golden Cask (House of Macduff)
Palate: Waxy orange and lemon, with a hint of white pepper warmth too.
Finish: A very subtle touch of cask char, tempered by generous waves of caramel.
Nose: Subtly gristy, but loads of honey notes give it oodles of sweetness.

Name: The Oxford Artisan Whisky 3 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Sourdough bread, biscotto, lemon balm, thyme, and honeyed sultanas.
Finish: Buttery on the finish, with a subtle herbal edge.
Nose: Apple turnovers, oily malt, a familiar peppery rye spiciness.

Name: Stauning 2017 (cask 6493) (bottled 2022) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Herbal rye spice leads into sweet anise, fruitcake, and chewy dates.
Finish: Baking spice and savoury rye spice linger.
Nose: Apricot jam on toasted rye bread, along with cigar box, peppery herbs, and cinnamon.

Name: Tomatin 21 Year Old - Batch 1 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Soft oak warmth, paired with buttery shortbread, juicy redcurrant and hazelnut cream.
Finish: Toffee, almond and a hint of fruitcake.
Nose: Vanilla, blueberry muffins, a good whack of fresh apricot.

Name: Cult of Islay 8 Year Old 2014 - Crafted Blend (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Flamed orange peel, savoury smoke, caramelised apple, and cinnamon sugar.
Finish: Oily peat smoke and warming oak.
Nose: Coastal smoke, fresh strawberry, and maple syrup.

Name: Sweet Disposition 25 Year Old 1996 - Wemyss Malts (Glen Keith)
Palate: Richly honeyed, plus custard cream biscuits and lightly toasted sugar.
Finish: A long finish, with creamy vanilla lasting on and on.
Nose: Sponge cake with strawberry jam and a dusting of icing sugar, with some balancing hints of savoury malt and oak.

Name: Craigellachie 13 Year Old 2006 (cask CM257) - The Golden Cask (House of Macduff)
Palate: Orchard fruit notes pick up here - think clementine and Jazz apples. A hint of black pepper in the background.
Finish: Subtly smoky, with more digestive biscuits sweetness.
Nose: Rye bread with farmhouse butter, chocolate digestives, a touch of flint.

Name: J. Blackâs Double Barrel Whiskey
Palate: Cinnamon gum, sultanas, a drizzle of maple syrup.
Finish: Buttery caramel and a good kick of rye spiciness.
Nose: Toasted brown sugar, chocolate chip cookies, a smidge of dried fruit.

Name: J.G. Thomson 23 Year Old Blended Malt
Palate: Decadent dried fruit and robust malt, with sparks of cinnamon and ginger appearing later on.
Finish: Cooked apple, floral breeze, and caramel.
Nose: Redcurrant and raspberry, with layers of honey and molasses, plus cigar box earthiness.

Name: Highland Park 25 Year Old 1991 (cask 8103) - Mackillop's Choice
Palate: Plump dried fruits keep things interesting through waves of smoke and wood spice, which are then joined by sea breeze and vanilla custard.
Finish: Rich, long and warming, cracked black pepper and a little liquorice root are present.
Nose: Rum-soaked raisins, dark chocolate and salted caramel give a complex sweetness, with a helping of vanilla and a hint of smoke.

Name: Auchentoshan 14 Year Old 2007 (cask 4200) - Lady of the Glen (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Lemon drizzle, runny honey, and ripe tropical fruit.
Finish: Citrus blossom, more vanilla, and juicy lychee.
Nose: Ginger cake, milk chocolate, oaky vanilla, and cut grass.

Name: Mannochmore 12 Year Old 2009  (cask 5875)  - The Red Cask Co.
Palate: Juicy barley with hints of marmalade, praline, and dates, rich baking spices build alongside a touch of vegetal oak.
Finish: Nutmeg, ginger, and cinnamon are followed by dark chocolate, with wafts of stewed apples and sweet herbal tea.
Nose: Vanilla cupcakes with a drizzle of lemon, prunes, sweet figs, and fruity pastries.

Name: Bunnahabhain 2002 Spanish Oak Finish - FÃ¨is Ãle 2018
Palate: Vanilla, cigar box, dates, basil leaf and sugary pastries.
Finish: Honeyed barley and toasted oak.
Nose: A balanced nose of dried fruit and rancio, with a touch of five-spice heat.

Name: Craigellachie 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 7537899) - The Octave (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Coffee bean, roasted apricot, hickory, and vanilla.
Finish: Fruity and creamy.
Nose: Grilled pineapple, toffee popcorn, beeswax and Custard Cream biscuits.

Name: Benriach 2010 (bottled 2023) (cask 08037) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Honeyed apricots, baked plums, with sticky gingerbread, and oaky vanilla.
Finish: Gentle tannins, with spiced fruitcake.
Nose: Sweet PX sherry spice, with dried apricots, and raisin.

Name: Tin Shed Distilling Co. 3 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Enjoyably robust, with more of that toasty malt warmth balanced by juicy red berries and cakey vanilla.
Finish: Cherry liqueur, a smidge of cask char, orange peel.
Nose: Almond, Bounty bars, red apples, blueberries, raspberries, and dense, rounded malt notes.

Name: The Perspective Series 25 Year Old - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Somewhat oily and mouthfilling, with more fresh fruit and stewed, spiced apple compote with rhubarb crumble.
Finish: A lengthy finish, full of spices and a touch of maple syrup.
Nose: Juicy autumn fruits, namely plums and figs, with a dash of sharper citrus aromas alongside more warming autumnal notes of honey and baking spices.

Name: St Patrick's Oak Aged Irish Whiskey
Palate: Chewy toffee, peanut brittle, stewed apples and a slow build of ginger.
Finish: Very subtly savoury on the finish...
Nose: Fresh and slightly floral barley, peppery oak, orange and mint.

Name: Williamson 10 Year Old 2012 (Cask 223) - Woodrow's of Edinburgh
Palate: Rich, coastal smoke, with sticky malt loaf, toasted nuts, and Christmas pudding.
Finish: Peat, raisins, and praline.
Nose: Bold Islay smoke is joined by sweet dried fruits, and frangipane.

Name: Irish Single Malt #2 29 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Loads more apple and dried fruit notes, now paired with pear, melon, and a hint of stem ginger.
Finish: Subtly spicy on the finish with clove, though its fruitiness persists.
Nose: Dense raisin and toffee apple notes, with a zesty hint of kiwi too.

Name: Invergordon 20 Year Old 2002 - Rare Cask Series (GreatDrams)
Palate: Spices gather, with cinnamon and ginger snaps cushioned by waves of vanilla cream, baked apples, and burnt sugar.
Finish: Marzipan, caramel, milk chocolate, and oak char.
Nose: Tangy fruit, granola, buttered popcorn, and mixed nuts, with leathery oak resting beneath.

Name: Orkney 14 Year Old 2006 (cask 18474) - Old Malt Cask (Hunter Laing)
Palate: More citrus with candied orange, sugary apple crumble, and clotted cream. Hints of heather poke through, with oily, mouth-coating malt.
Finish: Rounded notes of juicy orchard fruits and waxy peels, with a peppery warmth, lingering sweet oak, and dense caramel.
Nose: Butterscotch, zesty peels, and floral fruit, with sweet blossom honey and wood shavings.

Name: Macduff 13 Year Old 2008 (cask 900225) - The Disciples (Heroes & Heretics)
Palate: Fruity raisins, hints of apricot, with rich barley and salted caramel softening warm notes of pepper and ginger.
Finish: Zesty dried fruits, floral blossom honey, underlying garden herbs bring more peppery warmth alongside sweet, oaken spice.
Nose: Buttered shortbread, salted almonds, crisp green apple, and vanilla fudge.

Name: Macduff 21 Year Old - Batch 9 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: A thick, rich sweetness from dried fruit, cinnamon, vanilla and treacle kicks things off. Slightly astringent oak, red chilli warmth and baked earth add to a complex palate.
Finish: Warming golden barley, toffee apples, and drying oak spice.
Nose: Crystallised ginger, musky oak and salted caramel, then lemon peel, barley sugar and a touch of saddle leather.

Name: Ardmore 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 16980) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Charred meats, with maple candy, and earthy smoke.
Finish: Smoke lingers, with some sweet spices.
Nose: Baked orchard fruits, with cold embers, and wafts of smoke.

Name: Staoisha 7 Year Old 2013 (cask 10444) Rebels - The Guerilla Casks (Brave New Spirits)
Palate: More herbal smoke, with estery bananas cooked over the BBQ, driftwood, crÃ¨me caramel and peppery spice.
Finish: The vegetal smoke lingers, with spicy brown sugar.
Nose: Maritime smoke mingles with fresh baked banana bread and muscovado sugar.

Name: Longrow Red 11 Year Old - Cabernet Franc Cask Finish
Palate: Toasted vanilla pod, petrichor, jammy strawberries with a zesty hint of orange peel, continuing muscular peat notes.
Finish: A final waft of dense smoke lingers for ages on the finish.
Nose: Raspberry and blueberry, joined by a hearty blast of earthy peat smoke.

Name: Glen Elgin 11 Year Old 2011 (cask GE1122S) - Hidden Spirits
Palate: Cherry jam, spicy oak, and a whiff of tropical fruit.
Finish: Grilled nectarine, fresh berries, and a load of kitchen spices.

Name: Glen Moray 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 361159) - James Eadie
Palate: Chewy barley, cinnamon rolls, cooked plum, and spiced nuts.
Finish: Marmalade, woody vanilla pod, and stewed apple.
Nose: Fruit and nut chocolate, cherry jam, and spicy oak.

Name: The Macallan 24 Year Old 1993 Single Cask (Master of Malt) (47.8% ABV)
Palate: An abundance of dark forest fruits and berry jelly kick things off, while creamy stone fruit and dried orange wheels nestle in the background. Beneath, chocolate walnuts bring a bittersweet, earthy layer with hints of anise and herbal barley.
Finish: Drying oak lingers with hints of vegetal spice and a whisper of smoke, while more dried berries and stone fruits keep things sweet.
Nose: Old, leather-bound books, hearty aged oak, and sticky honeyed dates open the way before a lift of orange peel and sultana arrive. Baked apple and dustings of cocoa arrive later, with freshly baked biscuits, and a hint of minerality.

Name: Blair Athol 8 Year Old 2013 (cask 15649) - Provenance (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Poached apples and more buttery pastry. Creamy vanilla leads to syrup-laden flapjack packed with honeyed nuts.
Finish: A touch of zest arrives, with hearty marmalade, a pinch of ginger, and rich oaken warmth.
Nose: Peach pastries with fruit syrup, a dash of milky coffee, dusted with cinnamon.

Name: Knockdhu 16 Year Old 2006 (cask 6) - Monologue (Chapter 7)
Palate: Spiced nuts, green apples, rhubarb, and nutmeg develop among the aromas from the nose.
Finish: Orange peel and sweet, buttery oak.
Nose: Oaky vanilla opens with rich malt, creamy butterscotch, freshly cut grass, and gingery spice in support.

Name: The English 7 Year Old - Rolls Royce Exclusive
Palate: Robust, with hints of oily lemon peel, sticky malt loaf, lashings of sherry sweetness, and spiced fruitcake.
Finish: The fruit cake lingers, with gentle spices building.
Nose: Plenty of sherry character on the nose, with dried raisins and apricots alongside cocoa nibs.

Name: Glen Garioch 8 Year Old 2013 - Single Cask Series (GreatDrams)

Finish: Nutty fudge, a touch of green melon and zest, gentle vanilla, soft spice.

Name: Speyburn 18 Year Old 2001 (cask 701503) - Mackillop's Choice

Name: Westport 15 Year Old 2006 (cask 900214) The Macnab - Cordings (Heroes & Heretics)

Name: Mannochmore 13 Year Old 2009 (cask 1390) - Woodrow's of Edinburgh

Name: Miltonduff 6 Year Old 2015 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)
Palate: Crystalised ginger brings a touch of heat, quickly mellowed by zesty marmalade and vanilla cream pastries.

Name: Bunnahabhainn 15 Year Old 2007 (cask 16490) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)

Name: The Busker Single Pot Still
Palate: Autumnal with some dark spices, resinous oak and white pepper.

Name: Glen Moray 12 Year Old 2008 (cask 28B) - Fadandel

Palate: Allspice pokes through, along with buttery shortbread, vanilla ice cream, more peppery spice, gentle charred oak, and warm heat building.

Name: Blended Malt #5 21 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)

Finish: Medium length, with touches of burnt oak.
Nose: A very malty nose begins with Seville orange marmalade and buttered burnt toast. Thereâs some vanilla, juicy toasted barley and a touch of donuts underneath. Charred oak and red chilli add warmth and savoury spice throughout.

Name: Dumbarton 20 Year Old (cask 211894) - DrÃ m MÃ²r
Palate: Heaps of creme brÃ»lÃ©e with white chocolate drops join the flavours from the nose.
Finish: Dried apricot and nutmeg linger.
Nose: Oaky vanilla, foam banana sweets, and a little cinnamon.

Name: Caol Ila 12 Year Old 2010 (cask 16987) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)

Name: Mask of Death 10 Year Old - Spirit of Voodoo
Palate: Sweet apple, floral malt, and candied fruits open the way for layers of silky caramel, vanilla, and crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e.

Name: Macduff 9 Year Old (cask 900047) - DrÃ m MÃ²r

Name: Glenburgie 12 Year Old 2008 (cask 15059) - Clan Denny (Douglas Laing)

Name: Half ânâ Half 11 Year Old 2009 - Crafted Blend (Murray McDavid)

Name: Mannochmore 12 Year Old 2010 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)

Name: Secret Orkney 14 Year Old (cask 148) - DrÃ m MÃ²r

Palate: Raisins, dried apricot, walnuts and toffee.
Finish: Very long with nuts, baking spices and vanilla.
Nose: Fruitcake, molasses, nut and orange peel.

Name: Glen Moray 13 Year Old 2008 (cask 7033294) - The Octave (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Bold barley leads the way, with honey-roasted nuts and poached stone fruits to follow.
Finish: A touch of cedar rests beneath fragrant vanilla, silky caramel, apples, and apricots.
Nose: Vanilla cupcakes, fruit salad, a touch of zest, dry oak.

Name: Allt-Ã¡-Bhainne 26 Year Old 1995 - Mission Gold (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Apricot jam, dark chocolate, tart strawberry.
Finish: Oily malt, pomegranate, vanilla, and spicy oak.
Nose: Honeyed baking spices, toasted almond, plum, and apple blossom.

Name: Craigellachie 12 Year Old 2009 (casks 307703 & 307704) - Dalgety (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Melted brown sugar, stewed forest fruits, and clove-studded orange.
Finish: Oat and raisin cookies, a touch of pepper, and more rich sweetness.
Nose: Marmalade, spiced porridge, cherry jam, and fudge.

Name: An Islay Kildalton Distillery 7 Year Old 2007 (cask SE035) - Svenska Eldvatten
Palate: Malty and robust, with a spicy kick of cardamom hiding behind layers of peat.
Finish: Remains barley-fuelled on the finish with perhaps a hint of ash.
Nose: Toasted teacake, TCP, a whiff of roasted coffee bean.

Name: Glentauchers 10 Year Old 2013 (cask 800466) - Lady of the Glen (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Sweet vanilla, milk chocolate, and cinnamon, followed by marmalade and ripe plum.
Finish: Citrus and winter spice.
Nose: Waxy orange peel, brown sugar, sticky black fruit, aniseed, and ginger.

Name: Royal Brackla 13 Year Old 2009 (Cask 19897) - Old Malt Cask (Hunter Laing)
Palate: Juicy roasted barley and a touch of vegetal oak, toasted tea cakes, toffee, and dried berries.
Finish: Dried fruit and spices linger, with burnt biscuits, maple syrup, and charred oak.
Nose: Orchard blossom and honey balance robust oak and a whisper of smoke.

Name: Westport 15 Year Old 2006 (cask 900214) The Macnab - William Evans (Heroes & Heretics)
Palate: Creamy vanilla, gingerbread, stone fruit, and a little peppery spice.
Finish: Citrus lingers with a little honeyed sweetness.
Nose: Green apples, orange peel, golden barley, and toasted oak.

Name: Blended Malt #4 6 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: White pepper and soft wood spice cut through honeyed barley, sliced pear, beeswax and cocoa butter, before cigar box and oak char emerge. The palate is a little hoppy in places, but doesnât stagnate as gingerbread and black cherries maintain the backdrop.
Finish: The finish is drying and a tad bitter. Thereâs a beautifully decadent warm fudge conclusion with a little red fruit.
Nose: Apple strudels, honeysuckle and the rich spice of cinnamon and clove rise through charred oak and an autumn bonfire. Galaxy Caramel, creamy vanilla and a hint of pine nuts with aromatic red chilli form the backdrop.

Name: Ledaig 13 Year Old 2007 (cask 800022) - Smoke & Glory (Heroes & Heretics)
Palate: Toasted oak, burnt brown sugar and a waxy lemon note.
Finish: A smouldering, smoky finish.
Nose: Seaside smoke, teriyaki sauce and barbecued meat.

Name: Blair Athol 9 Year Old 2012 (cask 306693) - Lady of the Glen (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Toffee apple, apricot jam, and cinnamon butter.
Finish: Honey, flaky pastry, and more red apple.
Nose: Buttered toast, apple crumble, and stone fruit.

Name: Ardmore 8 Year Old 2014 (cask GD-ARD-14) - Christmas Series (GreatDrams)
Palate: Smoked nuts, black pepper, dried fruit, and dark chocolate.
Finish: A super dry smoky and spicy finish, with another drizzle of that floral honey.
Nose: Floral smoke, clove-studded orange, and heather honey.

Name: Teaninich 9 Year Old 2013 (casks 312993, 312995 & 713957) Small Batch (James Eadie)
Palate: Orchard fruits, apple blossom, honeyed oats, and vanilla.
Finish: A grassy, sweet finish, with shortbread biscuits and peppery spice.
Nose: Bright citrus, cut grass, apple skin, and caramelised ginger.

Name: Smooth Ambler Old Scout 5 Year Old Bourbon (cask 24176) - Drinks by the Dram Exclusive
Palate: Still has that black pepper warmth to it, mellowed by waves of marmalade, Dairy Milk, and honey.
Finish: Spiced hot chocolate, toasted sugar, and hickory.
Nose: Cinnamon gum, brown sugar, coffee, cracked black pepper, liquorice, Crunchie Bars.

Name: Ben Nevis 9 Year Old 2012 (cask 1725) - The Wild Scotland Collection (Deerstalker)
Palate: Creamy macadamia and almond lead to a touch of toasted marzipan and root ginger. Bready malt, and juicy apricot tangle with prickles of black pepper.
Finish: Buttery sponge cake, burnt sugar, poached pears, and smoked caramel.
Nose: Waxed lemons lead the way, followed by creamy coffee, and a touch of tobacco.

Name: Annandale Man OâWords Rare Vintage 2014 - Bourbon Cask (cask 143)
Palate: Clean and sweet initially with mixed fruit, apple sauce and traces of nectarine and melon. This gives way to creamy vanilla and a florist shop of fresh flowers and green leaves. All is held together with an underlying earthy, pine-like note.
Finish: Green apples, honey and cream with a dry resinous note.
Nose:
Palate: Clean and sweet initially with mixed fruit, apple sauce and traces of nectarine and melon. This gives way to creamy vanilla and a florist shop of fresh flowers and green leaves. All is held together with an underlying earthy, pine-like note.
Finish: Green apples, honey and cream with a dry resinous note.
Overall: A lovely fresh whisky with excellent balance between fruit and vanilla, and intriguing depth.

Name: W.D. OâConnell 12 Year Old 2008 (cask 100007985) - Sherry Series
Palate: Marmalade on toast, heaps of dried fruit, and white stone fruit, along with oily nuttiness.
Finish: Dark chocolate and rich praline appear on a toasty finish.
Nose: Fig, dry, toasted nuts, fresh orchard fruit, and cranberry.

Name: Royal Brackla 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 110001316) - Lady of the Glen (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Strawberry jam on toast, dark chocolate, toffee, figs, and a good kick of ginger.
Finish: Festive spices with a hint of coffee bitterness.
Nose: Rich syrupy fruits, toasted almonds, cinnamon, and cedar.

Name: Bunnahabhain 17 Year Old Westering Home - Feis Ile 2014
Palate: Sweet and nutty with complex spices including plenty of nutmeg.
Finish: A little smoke and some fruitiness in the form of kiwi and starfruit.
Nose: Luxurious, sweet and creamy. Nuttiness soon emerges - whole almonds, nougat and sweet malt. Light caramel and a little Haribo develop. Gregg Wallace would like this.

Name: Glen Garioch 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 521) - The Wild Scotland Collection (Deerstalker)
Palate: Buttered tea cakes with dried berries, a touch of herbal barley leads to buttery oak and creeping gingery spice.
Finish: The ginger takes hold, alongside a touch of liquorice for a warming finish, with oily malt and zesty citrus peels in tow.
Nose: Almond croissants and vanilla cream, drizzles of honey, and a dash of nutmeg.

Name: J.P. Wiser's 22 Year Old 1998 - Ex Libris Smaller Hero
Palate: Baking spices prickles through notes of mocha, liquorice, candied orange, and stewed plums.
Finish: Marizpan and malty biscuits linger with red fruits.
Nose: Leather-bound books, dried apricot, toffee apples, dried fruit, and ginger.

Name: Benriach 1991 (bottled 2023) (cask 46507) - Exceptional Casks (Berry Bros. & Rudd)
Palate: This theme continues on the palate, which displays a beautifully aged character, with notes of spiced custard, cardamom fudge. Hints of praline build alongside dried apricot and something pleasingly musty.
Finish: Lingering spice and fruit show with an unexpected puff of wood smoke on the back palate. This is a marvellous example of aged Speyside whisky.
Nose: Aromas of banana bread, musty attics, leather and wax blend with fresher fruit notes to create an incredibly deep nose.

Name: Glen Grant 63 Year Old 1959 - Mr. George Legacy (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Stewed red fruit flavours lead to Seville orange with a hint of garden mint. Tart raspberry notes develop accompanied by cocoa powder and mature oak.
Finish: A full finish with lingering cinnamon and forest fruits.
Nose: Fragrant autumnal spice aromas intertwine with sweet dried fruit and Demerara sugar. Soft citrus zest comes to the fore alongside beeswax polish and walnut.

Name: Bunnahabhain 35 Year Old 1979 (cask 9521) - Artist #8 (La Maison du Whisky)
Palate: Unctuous, smooth. A real sweet treat, the attack wavers between purple violets, dark chocolate, liquorice and dried fruit (dates, walnut). With lots of freshness, the mid-palate is fruity (black grape), liquorice (stick) and honeyed (lime blossom). These tones just precede bourbon vanilla, ripe banana and clove.
Finish: Long, silky. The finish keeps intact each flavour revealed on the palate. Then, it gradually quenches its thirst for the exotic (passion fruit, mango, guava). On the retronasal olfaction, milky coffee, crushed strawberry, blueberry and ginger flood the palate. The empty glass is resinous (pine, Vosges bonbons) and empyreumatic (eucalyptus).
Nose: Voluptuous, concentrated. Irresistible notes of emery cloth, iodine tincture, heady florals (purple lilac, geranium), cocoa beans and leather bring lots of body and depth to the initial nose. Allowed to breathe, it becomes more fruity (orange, fig, apricot), spicy (cinnamon, grated ginger) and exotic (passion fruit, mango). Balsamic, it lingers with eucalyptus, cardamom and even basil.

Name: Hyde 6 Year Old No.5 The Ãras Cask
Palate: Iced buns, cinnamon, grapefruit and a touch of vanilla.
Finish: Dried fruits and mocha.
Nose: Strawberries, cherries and waves of brown sugar.

Name: Haran 8 Year Old Classic
Palate: Rounded malt with touches of apricot, honey, and new oak.
Finish: Vanilla pod lasts long on the finish.
Nose: Lemon peel, biscuit dough, melted butter.

Name: Macduff 18 Year Old 2002 (cask 900262) - Cask Collection (A.D. Rattray)
Palate: Sultanas and raisins, dark cherry with malty spice
Finish: Toasted nuts, dark salted caramel, pipe tobacco, and gentle sea air.
Nose: Figs and dates, waxed lemons, musty woodsmoke, and coastal breeze.

Name: Mortlach 10 Year Old 2012 - Artist Collective 6.6 (La Maison du Whisky)
Palate: Roasted almonds, porcini, woody spice, and buttered malt loaf.
Finish: Sweet spice and oak.
Nose: Grilled peach, cocoa nibs, and some spiced biltong.

Name: Lehmann Rendez-vous Peated Single Malt
Palate: Citrus comes through with lemon peels and sweet orange, gently herbaceous with silky, vinous grape notes.
Finish: A touch of fiery ginger and a prickle of pepper balance the lingering peat smoke, earthy malt, and zest.
Nose: The peat is present immediately with notes of dusty tobacco and elegant wafts of pungent smoke.

Name: John Walker & Sons King George V - Chinese New Year Edition 2021
Palate: Soft, buttery toffee and general fruitiness. Medium bodied, but very malty and well-constructed blend.
Finish: Golden syrup, creamy spices and malt on the finish.
Nose: A mix of heady toffee apple and very faint smoke. Thick, syrupy malt, digestive biscuits, oak.

Name: English Whisky Co. 12 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Biscuit dough, lemon peel, vanilla pod, melted chocolate, and cassia.
Finish: Orange oil, clove, and malted milk biscuits.
Nose: Butterscotch, sawdust leading into warming oak spices, a floral waft of barley and vanilla blossom.

Name: Westport 15 Year Old 2006 (cask 900214) The Macnab - Farlows (Heroes & Heretics)
Palate: Creamy vanilla, gingerbread, stone fruit, and a little peppery spice.
Finish: Citrus lingers with a little honeyed sweetness.
Nose: Green apples, orange peel, golden barley, and toasted oak.

Name: KyrÃ¶ 2016 (bottled 2021) (cask 16037) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Banana chips, peppercorn, mint leaf, cooked apple, pine, and juicy red berries.
Finish: Lingering hints of caraway and toasted sesame seeds.
Nose: freshly baked rye bread, with a good layer of salted butter. Hints of caramel pop up later on.

Name: Grace O'Malley Rum Cask Irish Whiskey
Palate: Boozy fruit, currant buns, malt loaf, and ginger cake. Peppery, charred oak, and sweet creamy caramel.
Finish: Sweet dark sugar and vanilla with ripe tropical fruit, toffee popcorn, and toasted cereal.
Nose: Rum and raisin fudge, baking spice, mashed banana, and malty biscuits.

Name: English Whisky Co. 11 Year Old - North Star Spirits
Palate: Dark chocolate-dipped cherry, with a flinty backdrop, a dusting of five spice and raspberry jam.
Finish: A malty finish with stewed plum.
Nose: Oak char and red grape skin, with distinctive wine aromas and a hint of liquorice.

Name: Teaninich 11 Year Old 2010 (cask 356846) - James Eadie (Master of Malt Exclusive)
Palate: Sultanas and raisins, cereal, coconut, fruit salad, a hint of savoury spice (think paprika and nutmeg).
Finish: Slightly chocolatey on the finish, with another helping of almond.
Nose: Caramel latte, tangy orange, walnut, almond, with a touch of nutty bread too.

Name: Royal Brackla 13 Year Old 2009 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)
Palate: Caramel, coconut, and cinnamon emerge under more orchard fruit and lemon peel.
Finish: Sweet and satisfying.
Nose: Bright citrus and sparkling orchard fruit are joined by vanilla and toasted oak.

Name: Dailuaine 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 307208) - Lady of the Glen (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Delicate layers of smoky, meaty malt bring an oily, buttery coating, joined by silky caramel and balanced by plenty of sweet stewed stone fruits.
Finish: Nutty barley, charred oak, and candied tropical fruits tangle towards the end, with barbecued pineapple and a prickle of pepper.
Nose: Apricot pastries, flaked almonds, and vanilla custard, with zesty orange marmalade and waxed lemons.

Name: The Lockdown Lock-In Dram 12 Year Old Blended Malt - Blended Cask Series (GreatDrams)
Palate: Honeyed fruit, boozy sultanas, dollops of vanilla cream and baking spice.
Finish: Silky caramel, baked pears, malt oak spice.
Nose: Orchard blossom, vanilla fudge, a touch of orange zest and toasty oak.

Name: Pearse Lyons 7 Year Old
Palate: Biscuity, with white pepper, dried apple and spiced pear crumble with a dollop of vanilla custard.
Finish: Freshly baked pastries, with sultana, more clove and orchard fruit.
Nose: Honeyed malt, clove-studded orange and plump, sherried dried fruit, leading into resinous oak.

Name: Hinch 5 Year Old Double Wood
Palate: More creamy notes of vanilla alongside apricot, peach, cinnamon and oak spice.
Finish: Honeyed fresh fruit, fresh melon and milk chocolate digestives.
Nose: Sweet and creamy with a touch of lemon peel, vanilla cream and tobacco.

Name: Dailuaine 10 Year Old 2012 (casks 308754 & 308758 & 308762 & 308763) - Un-Chilfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Heather honey, oatcakes, warm oak, vanilla custard, and some salted caramel.
Finish: Oak char, peppery spice, and some vanilla.
Nose: Toasted grain, baking spices, flapjacks, and candied orange peel.

Name: Blair Athol 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 306651) - Monologue (Chapter 7)
Palate: More vinous fruit, alongside a touch of plum. Honeyed nuttiness continues, with sweet sultanas and baking spice building.
Finish: A prickle of pepper creeps in, balanced by nutty malt and a touch of zest.
Nose: Toasted almonds, a touch of floral vanilla followed by raisins, and a hint of oily oak.

Name: Teaninich 9 Year Old 2012 Pineau Des Charentes Finish - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: More prune, joined by figs and dates alongside bready malt and spiced apple cake.
Finish: Orchard fruit and sweet sultanas stick around while peppery oak and a dusting of nutmeg bring a touch of spice.
Nose: Fresh apple pastries and honeyed prunes, with toasted, flaked almonds and creamy coffee.

Name: Westport 18 Year Old 2004 (bottled 2022) - Wilson & Morgan
Palate: Plump raisins, berries, and stewed stone fruits lead to sweet, nutty malt, and rich oak with prickles of cracked pepper.
Finish: Dense sherried fruit and nuts with hefty layers of leathery oak, balanced by root ginger and warming spice.
Nose: Rich notes of vinous dried fruit, honeyed nuts, and juicy apricot.

Name: Fercullen 8 Year Old
Palate: Sultanas and apples, with waves of fresh vanilla.
Finish: Medium length, with a hint of black pepper.
Nose: Honey, soft hints of grain sweetness and a good helping of nectarine.

Name: Deanston 11 Year Old 2009 (cask 116) Rebels - The Guerilla Casks (Brave New Spirits)
Palate: Spiced poached prunes, cocoa nibs, crumbly shortbread, warm oak, and peppery spice.
Finish: Lingering chocolate and dried sour cherries, with a pleasant amount of oak.
Nose: Soft forest fruits mingle with crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e, warm chocolate, and gentle spices.

Name: Linkwood 10 Year Old 2012 - Artist Collective 6.2 (La Maison du Whisky)
Palate: Oaky vanilla, gorse, praline, and lemon curd.
Finish: Long, with fruit and spice lingering.
Nose: Fruit forward, orchard fruits, banana bread, and zingy spices.

Name: Ruadh Maor 8 Year Old 2012 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)
Palate: Sweet, barbecued, honey roasted ham with vegetal peat smoke.
Finish: Smoked paprika, waxed lemons, charred oak, and earthen peat.
Nose: Oily smoke, earthy notes with cured meat, salted fried potatoes, and honeyed parsnips.

Name: Driftless Glen Straight Rye Whiskey
Palate: Thick slabs of posh chocolate â laced with ginger, toffee, and a little peppermint â compete with boisterous rye spice.
Finish: The above notes drift away pleasingly.
Nose: Peppery, minty, slightly citrusy, and full of chewy, spicy, caramel notes.

Name: Caol Ila 10 Year Old 2010 (bottled 2020) - Hepburn's Choice (Langside)
Palate: A gingery heat is softened by rich, fruity oak, plums, and jammy berry notes tangle with smoky, coastal peat and waxy lemon rind.
Finish: Cracked peppercorns, raisin studded fudge, lingering, tarry smoke.
Nose: Sweet berries, slightly vinous with salted crackers and smouldering embers aplenty.

Name: Secret Lowland Spring Blossom (cask 73) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Malty vanilla, floral fruit progresses to aromatic dried fruit, rich toffee, and a whiff of heather.
Finish: Warming spices and muscovado sugar, gentle oak char, and milk chocolate raisins.
Nose: Orchard blossom and gentle citrus with sweet, toasted oak.

Name: Auchroisk 10 Year Old 2010 (cask 805482) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Orchard fruits with rich, sweet honey. Orange and citrus combine with toasted, peppery oak and malt loaf.
Finish: Honey nut cereal and sherried raisins with prickly root ginger on the finish.
Nose: Wafts of coconut with ginger biscuits and oaky baking spices.

Name: Egan's Conviction
Palate: Still floral with silky honey, soft notes of fresh apricot, and denser, sweet prunes. Notes of sweet granola, toasted nuts, and leathery oak build.
Finish: A creamy balance of earthen oak, warming spice, and dried fruits.
Nose: Honeysuckle, soft peaches, toasted almonds, a touch of lemon zest.

Name: Kentucky Owl Bourbon - Batch 10
Palate: Molasses, mango still wonderfully buttery, a good hint of oak developing later on.
Finish: Fruity coffee, chilli flake, milk chocolate, shortbread.
Nose: Cooked apple and Seville orange marmalade, buttered popcorn, and cinnamon.

Name: Sagamore Spirit Tequila Cask Finish
Palate: Wafts of peppercorn, underlying herbaceous oak, vanilla continues with sweet floral honey, tangy marmalade, and prickly spice.
Finish: Sweet orange peels, savoury spice, earthen, mineral notes and rich peppery oak.
Nose: Oaken vanilla, wafts of roasted agave, zest, and caramel.

Name: The Legendary Red Silkie Irish Whiskey
Palate: Toasted sugar, warm barley, more sweet strawberry, now with drying oak tannins.
Finish: Cooked fruit and a smidge of black pepper.
Nose: Rounded notes of strawberry and blackcurrant, with vegetal peaty notes growing.

Name: Starward Unexpeated
Palate: Juicy red berries, coastal saltiness, toffee apple, milk chocolate, and hints of smoke.
Finish: Rich and earthy.
Nose: The nose is very tropical and fruity, with medicinal peat, cacao, and toasted oak.

Name: Linkwood 2011 (bottled 2022) Year of the Rabbit (casks 314464/66) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Sticky malt loaf, with some dried cranberries and sour cherries, along with a touch of tobacco.
Finish: Summer berry compote and warm cinnamon.
Nose: Dried raisins, apricots, and prunes, with some gorse, and baking spices.

Name: Wave 7 Year Old August 17th W.10 Single Cask - Rare Cask Edition
Palate: Roasted nuts, beeswax, dried apricot, candied orange, and nutmeg.
Finish: Long and sweet with floral honey and dried fruit.
Nose: Stone fruit, drying oak, floral notes, salted caramel, and cinnamon.

Name: Glentauchers 13 Year Old 2009 - Artist Collective 6.4 (La Maison du Whisky)
Palate: Rich fruit cake, with some lighter apricot notes, and woody spice.
Finish: Black pepper and delicate florals.
Nose: Honeycomb, milk chocolate, stewed plums, and cinnamon and clove spice.

Name: Teaninich 12 Year Old 2010 (cask 707333) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Pineapple sponge cake, cinnamon, and oaky vanilla.
Finish: Warm spice and nutty oak.
Nose: Creamy grain alongside syrupy fruits, and some clove.

Name: Teeling Sommelier Selection - Douro Old Vines Casks
Palate: Stewed plums, toffee apples, dry tannins, and mocha.
Finish: Fruit and spicy.
Nose: Dried fruit, cinnamon, dark chocolate, and cherries.

Name: Benrinnes 11 Year Old 2010 (cask 303340) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Soft and still creamy, with the baked goods continuing on the palate. Flaky berry tarts and baked orchard fruits mingle with rich vanilla and sweet sultana.
Finish: Sweet toasted almonds and vegetal oak with fragrant peppercorns, and lingering vanilla pod.
Nose: Fresh baking with notes of doughy bread and fruited sponge cake mingle with floral blossom and creamy barley.

Name: North British 29 Year Old 1992 (cask GD-NB-92) - Rare Cask Series (GreatDrams)
Palate: Chocolate fudge (the crumbly kind), more vanilla, stewed pears with waxed peels, and oily grain.
Finish: Nutty granola, fruity honey, spices build with peppery warmth.
Nose: Earthen vanilla pod and creamy milk bottle sweeties, buttery oak with sweet toffee apple.

Name: English Whisky Co. 7 Year Old 2014 (cask GD-EN-14) - Rare Cask Series (GreatDrams)
Palate: Fig and strawberry jam, cinnamon sticks, a touch of pineapple.
Finish: Malty and subtly peppery.
Nose: Honeyed barley and sherried fruit, with gingerbread underneath.

Name: Caol Ila 11 Year Old 2010 - Artist Collective 6.8 (La Maison du Whisky)
Palate: Bonfire smoke, a savoury seaweed note, drizzles of caramel, and woody spice.
Finish: Lingering peat and green pepper.
Nose: Plenty of coastal peat and warming spice.

Name: Bowmore 16 Year Old 2003 (Release No.11698) - The Stories of Wind & Wave (The Character of Islay Whisky Company)
Bottler: The Character of Islay Whisky Company
Palate: Waxy peels and green apple brightness, balanced by mellowing vanilla and flashes of smoke.
Finish: Petrichor and peppercorn.
Nose: Oak staves, almond croissants, a pinch of sea salt and brown sugar.

Name: Caol Ila 14 Year Old 2008 (cask 2806) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Caramel joins the peat, with sticky gingerbread, and mellow oak.
Finish: Lingering peat and caramel, with a sprinkle of sea salt.
Nose: Coastal peat, with waves of vanilla, and warm spice.

Name: Bower Hill Single Barrel
Palate: Red plum, more chocolate, barrel char, clove and green apple.
Finish: Blackberry bush, butterscotch.
Nose: Cedar spice, chocolate mousse, buttered corn and dry earth.

Name: Blair Athol 12 Year Old 2008 (casks 1909775/77/78/79) - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Cakey spices, malt loaf, chocolate Brazil nuts, a whiff of date and oaky vanilla.
Finish: Lingering spice, more sweet nuttiness and sherried fruit with creamy oak on the finish.
Nose: Caramelised nuts, sugared cereal, a touch of vanilla, and sweet dried fruit.

Name: Benrinnes 8 Year Old 2014 (cask 16320) - Old Particular The Midnight Series (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Sticky dates, fruit cake, treacle tart, and candied orange.
Finish: Dark brown sugar, with caramelised almonds.
Nose: Plenty of rich sherry character, with raisins, warm spices, and caramel.

Name: Half 'n' Half 10 Year Old 2009 - Crafted Blend (Murray McDavid) (2019 Release)
Palate: Golden syrup and banana bread, with some milk chocolate in there too.
Finish: Chai spices, white flowers and a herbaceous note to balance out the sweetness.
Nose: Brown sugar notes intertwine with floral malty aromas and red grapes.

Name: Westland Single Malt - Garryana 6th Edition
Palate: Dried stone fruits with wafts of farm apples, rich raisins, and bold, malty oak.
Finish: Cloves and baking spices kick in, with dark sugar, baked apple, and pepper.
Nose: Honeyed fruits with apricots, pear, and plum, toasted wood, and sweet spice.

Name: Kirker & Greer Shamrock
Palate: Caramel milk chocolate, honeyed orchard fruit, white pepper and oaky vanilla.
Finish: Cinnamon-spiced pear with a good helping of floral honey.
Nose: Toffee apple, with buttery croissant, a sprinkle of brown sugar, marmalade and white flowers.

Name: Helsinki Whiskey Rum Cask Rye Malt
Palate: Smooth rye spice, raisins, orange zest, and a touch of liquorice.
Finish: Mellow and delicately sweet.
Nose: Toasted oak, some rummy tropical fruit, and a hint of juniper.

Name: Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1983 (Release No.11535) - The Stories of Wind & Wave (The Character of Islay Whisky Company)
Bottler: The Character of Islay Whisky Company
Palate: A fine balance of peaty salinity and tropical fruit freshness, punctuated by oak, soot and spice.
Finish: Subtly chocolatey on the finish, with the final smoky spices continuing on and on.
Nose: Smoky charcoal and toasted barley, with candied lemon peel and a touch of vanilla tablet in support.

Name: Inchgower 8 Year Old 2014 (cask GD-INCH-14) - Single Cask Series (GreatDrams)
Palate: There's oily malt, roasted nuts, Conference pears, and vanilla.
Finish: Apple blossom and acacia honey.
Nose: Baking spices prickle through marmalade, toffee, dried grass, and oak char.

Name: Sailor's Home The Horizon 10 Year Old
Palate: Layers of honey and pineapple, joined by a touch of pink peppercorn.
Finish: Fruit tea, toasted crumpets and brown sugar.
Nose: Apricot, vanilla pod, banana muffin and clove.

Name: RÃ¬gh Seumas II 10 Year Old 2008 - Crafted Blend (Murray McDavid) (2019 Release)
Palate: Freshly baked croissant, with tinned peaches and green oak.
Finish: More creamy pastries, and some plump raisin there too.
Nose: Some banana in there among vanilla ice cream and a touch of dark chocolate.

Name: Peerless Single Barrel Rye 55.8%
Palate: Sun dried hay, peppery rye, and allspice, with drizzles of caramel and warm malt loaf, and a generous heat.
Finish: Oak and sawdust linger, alongside rye spice and ginger.
Nose: Sprinkles of cinnamon, nutmeg and clove, with brown sugar and buttery toffee apples.

Name: Peerless Small Batch Rye
Palate: An impressive variety of flavour emerges from that same core of apple fruitiness, baking spice and nutty woody goodness. Fresh malty rye grains, earthy vanilla, stem ginger and floral honey emerge among touches of chocolate milk, raspberry, black tea and apricots in syrup. Underneath thereâs charred pepper, toasted oak and just a handful of dried herbs.
Finish: Homemade apple juice, salty porridge, marmalade and hints of cedar, clove and menthol linger.
Nose: Thereâs ripe green apples, cranberry, peanut brittle, buttery vanilla, toasted brown sugar and toffee popcorn bring a wave of complex sweetness while nutmeg, ginger, black pepper add aromatic spice. As it develops thereâs orange peel, fennel and baked earth with touches of Dr Pepper, rosewater, Taveners Coconut Mushrooms, fluffy marshmallow and sandalwood in support as well as some barrel char.

Name: Loch Lomond 22 Year Old 2000 Open Course Collection - 151st Royal Liverpool 2023
Palate: Grapefruit, vanilla, caramel, pineapple, mango.
Finish: Long spicy finish with ginger, cinnamon, and toasted oak.
Nose: Honey, peach, melon, lemon, stem ginger.

Name: Bowmore 16 Year Old 2003 (Release No.11699) - The Stories of Wind & Wave (The Character of Islay Whisky Company)
Bottler: The Character of Islay Whisky Company
Palate: Vanilla ice-cream with salted caramel sauce, grilled fruit and fresh barley.
Finish: Softly smoky, with cut grass in the background.
Nose: Milky coffee, sea spray, leafy herbs and Victoria sponge cake.

Name: Bowmore 16 Year Old 2003 (Release No.11697) - The Stories of Wind & Wave (The Character of Islay Whisky Company)
Bottler: The Character of Islay Whisky Company
Palate: Tropical fruit once again, now with some BBQ-charred pineapple in the mix. Softly oaky, plus a good helping of vanilla custard.
Finish: A smidge of tarry smokiness appears on the finish, as well as some forest floor earthiness.
Nose: Floral barley wafts arrive first, shortly followed by wave after wave of rich smoke, with a hint of orange oil and papaya underneath.

Name: Ruadh Maor 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 303) - Lady of the Glen (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Salted caramel sauce drizzled over pancakes, with smoked meats in tow, alongside cooked plum.
Finish: Stewed blackberry, fragrant peat smoke, and a good crack of black pepper.
Nose: Salted butter on toast, with a dollop of raspberry jam balanced by savoury smoke.

Name: Mannochmore 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 1446) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Sweet malt, more orange peels, and sugared marmalade, dates and rich baking spices.
Finish: Spiced toffee apples, nutmeg, ginger, fruit and nut chocolate with a soft herbal touch on the finish.
Nose: Zesty orange peels, sweet figs, vanilla cream, and sugar dusted filo pastry.

Name: English Whisky Co. 9 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Still has a lot of coffee and chocolate elements to it, with smoky peat bringing a spicy depth to the flavour profile.
Finish: Plum, ginger, and drying spices.
Nose: Charred oak and smoky bacon crisps, balanced by fig rolls and mocha.

Name: Ledaig 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 700102) Rebels - The Guerilla Casks (Brave New Spirits)
Palate: Balanced, with sweet dried fruits, pears, peppery spice, and BBQ smoke.
Finish: Pleasant smoke lingers, with those fruit notes from the Madeira alongside.
Nose: Meaty smoke with warm candied nuts, and touch of grassy herbs.

Name: Cedar Ridge Single Malt
Palate: Less sweet than the nose suggests, with dry notes of leather, vanilla oak and melted dark chocolate, with a hint of menthol and rich, juicy wine notes.
Finish: A dry, smoky, lengthy finish with a hit of oak spice.
Nose: Toffee apple, heather honey and fresh orchard fruit, with aromas of caramelised nuts.

Name: Glen Elgin 11 Year Old 2010 (cask 801463) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Chocolate digestive biscuits, waxed citrus peels, and trail mix. Fruity, tangy barley, and developing peppery notes.
Finish: Toasted brown seeded bread with honey. Peppery fennel, stone fruits and warming spice.
Nose: Honeyed corn flakes, buttered oatcakes, and sweet boozy fruit sprinkled with vanilla.

Name: Old Williamsburg Bourbon
Palate: Gingersnap biscuits and toasted rye bread, with silky caramel and apple pie.
Finish: Oak char appears alongside more of those rich pastry notes.
Nose: Apple chutney and buttered corn on the cob with a hint of fudge.

Name: Dailuaine 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 305101) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Dried currants and cherries, with baked plum, some spiced syrup, and milk chocolate.
Finish: Peppery spices, with some tart redcurrant jelly.
Nose: Red fruits are joined by vanilla sponge cake, and cinnamon spice.

Name: Ruadh Maor 10 Year Old 2010 (cask 177) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Maritime notes of vegetal seaweed salinity and smouldering ash, sweet, toasted malt and oaken vanilla with silky caramel and sooty smoke.
Finish: Peppery oak and charcoal, with lingering, salty dry smoke.
Nose: Meaty smoke, salty air, and dense, earthen peat balanced by sweet vanilla fudge.

Name: Wardington's Ludlow Single Malt English Whisky - Distiller's Cut Cask Edition No.3
Palate: Buttery pastry and crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e are joined by floral malt and set honey. Vegetal peat murmurs in the depths, with rich, smoky oak in tow.
Finish: A touch of pepper, peanut brittle, and baked apple towards the end. More creamy barley cushions distant chimney smoke.
Nose: Drizzles of honey, vanilla custard, and soft caramel, with charred herbs and woody peat smoke in the distance.

Name: Lochindaal 2009 (bottled 2022) - Co-Bottling Series No.5 (Swell de Spirits)
Palate: Damp bonfires, plasters, numbing pepper, woody spices, and singed caramel.
Finish: Iodine, and treacle toffee.
Nose: Meaty smoke and coastal character, with some baked apples, and roasted almonds.

Name: Glen Elgin 14 Year Old 2008 - Artist Collective 6.5 (La Maison du Whisky)
Palate: Sticky figs, marmalade, cinder toffee, with dark chocolate, oak, and cinnamon spice.
Finish: Oaky spice, and some dates.
Nose: Rich fruit and nuts, with woody spices, and some zesty citrus peel.

Name: Kinahan's Single Malt Heritage - American Oak
Palate: Coffee grounds, green apples, and pears with floral, nutty vanilla.
Finish: Some dark fruits and zest along with charred oak and bitter coffee chocolate.
Nose: Candied orange, burnt toffee, toasted nuts, dark chocolate, and tobacco.

Name: Teeling Small Batch Amber Ale Cask Finish
Palate: Cooked apple, more citrus (now with clementine boldness at its heart), cinnamon, vanilla, a touch of pine.
Finish: Toffee, almonds, custard cream biscuits.
Nose: Allspice, lemon zest, caramelised nuts, a hint of grassy sweetness developing.

Name: Indiana Rye 4 Year Old 2017 (cask GD-IR-4) - Single Cask Series (GreatDrams)
Palate: Black pepper and more cinnamon warmth, with woody vanilla pod, and oily orange peel.
Finish: A generous helping of baking spices on a hot finish.
Nose: Cinnamon buns, buttery fudge, spicy oak, and a touch of mint.

Name: Glen Ord 9 Year Old 2012 - Artist Collective 6.3 (La Maison du Whisky)
Palate: Spiced gingerbread, barley sugar, poached orchard fruits, and oaky vanilla.
Finish: Floral honey with woody spice.
Nose: Sweet cereal notes, dried hay, with some crisp apple, and golden syrup.

Name: The Busker Single Grain
Palate: Banana foam sweets, vanilla cream, coconut, more zingy fruit, and earthy oak.
Finish: Fried banana now, alongside cooked apples and custard.
Nose: Sharp green apple, milk chocolate, cinnamon butter, and hints of minerality.

Name: Royal Brackla 8 Year Old 2014 (cask 9599) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Chocolate-coated ginger, almond butter, and strawberry jam on buttered toast.
Finish: Juicy sultana, red grape, and a dusting of cocoa.
Nose: Black pepper, chocolate raisins, stewed cherry, and honeyed oak.

Name: Braeval 13 Year Old 2009 (cask 4147) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Apple compote, dried apricots, and nutty malt, with some peppery spice.
Finish: Oaky vanilla joins warming spice.
Nose: Buttery shortbread, poached pears, and a touch of almond nougat.

Name: Stork Club Straight Rye Whiskey
Palate: Butterscotch and ginger spice, with rich mocha bringing toasty warmth.
Finish: Oily citrus and dark chocolate.
Nose: Chocolate spread and peppery oak, with a touch of berry fruit and rye bread.

Name: Benrinnes 10 Year Old 2011 (cask 307205) - Artist #12 (La Maison du Whisky)
Palate: Dried apricots, toasted walnuts, some cocoa powder, and some coffee fudge.
Finish: Woody spices and orchard fruits.
Nose: Apple and stone fruits, with some heather honey, and spiced ginger loaf cake.

Name: Glenlossie 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 4466) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Lemon posset, with toasted pralines, warm oak, and vanilla caramel.
Finish: Fresh cut hay and toasty spices.
Nose: The sherry brings a nutty note to creamy malt and orchard fruits.

Name: Cameronbridge 15 Year Old 2007 (cask 462894) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Company)
Palate: Shortbread, with candied almonds, some milk chocolate, and woody spices.
Finish: Sweet and nutty.
Nose: Creamy grain, with nut butter, and honeyed fruits.

Name: Benrinnes 11 Year Old 2010 (cask 303341) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Honey and maple granola with roasted nuts, crumbly chocolate fudge, sultanas, raisins, and a touch of dried fig.
Finish: Buttered tea loaf studded with dried fruits, cinnamon, butterscotch, and lingering woody baking spice.
Nose: Set honey on seeded bread, a whiff of sawdust, baked apple, and gristy barley.

Name: Port Dundas "Cheers To Better Days" 15 Year Old 2006 (cask 15316) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Maple syrup on pancakes, cereal and milk, gingerbread.
Finish: More ginger, more citrus, more vanilla!
Nose: Buttery and sweet with vanilla and brown sugar, alongside a zesty kick of citrus.

Name: Williamson 14 Year Old 2005 (cask 9018) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Still packing plenty of coastal brilliance, with a touch of dry toast and peppery spice growing.
Finish: Hints of brown sugar sweetness make for a welcome contrast to the salinity.
Nose: Smoked meats and sea breeze, with a hint of vanilla pod.

Name: Aberfeldy 7 Year Old 2015 (cask 1203) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Red apples and plums, with zesty marmalade and vanilla joined by waves of dark chocolate.
Finish: Ginger, cinnamon, and fruit-studded flapjack.
Nose: Sweet layers of cinnamon, raisins, and stewed red fruit are joined by honeyed biscuits and a touch of floral malt.

Name: The Irishman Cask Strength (2021 Release)
Palate: Still has plenty of vanilla to it, now with cardamom and cinnamon developing, plus a smidge of apricot.
Finish: Candied ginger, honeycomb, and macadamia nuts.
Nose: Malty vanilla and custard cream biscuits, followed by dried cherry and a touch of citrus.

Name: Muteman Rye Whiskey
Palate: Vanilla and cask char balance vegetal oak, with a touch of herbal bitterness leading to dense spiced fruits.
Finish: Spiced banana bread with burnt sugar, dustings of cinnamon, and apple crisps, with powerful rye spice.
Nose: Buttered rye bread with a drop of honey, sweet baking spice, and notes of syrupy sponge cake.

Name: Boondocks 11 Year Old American Whiskey
Palate: Rounded red fruit (think cherries and strawberries), with balancing salted butter and toasted rye spice.
Finish: A mellow finish of charred oak and honey.
Nose: White chocolate, buttery corn, polished oak and dried fruit. A subtle whisper of cinnamon and coffee.

Name: Wild Turkey Master's Keep - One Batch 1
Palate: Vanilla, caramel, and butterscotch.
Finish: Toasted oak.
Nose: Sweet honey and subtle brown spice.

Name: Reservoir Hunter & Scott Bourbon
Palate: A slight vegetal hint as it opens, before raisin, caramel and fried banana notes take control.
Finish: Milky coffee, cinnamon and menthol.
Nose: Melted chocolate, peach, pistachio ice cream and honeysuckle.

Name: Driftless Glen 51 Rye
Palate: More ginger, with cinnamon and nutmeg in tow, mellowed by molasses and milky coffee.
Finish: Redcurrant, orange oil, chewy toffee.
Nose: Clementine, sponge cake, ginger snaps, chocolate mousse.

Name: Glenmorangie Millennium Malt
Palate: Soft feel, but the flavours retain great clarity. Fresh oranges, bananas and a bit of baked apple. Hint of peppery spice buried in honey sweetness.
Finish: Medium with lovely malted honey sweetness and a twist of pepper.
Nose: Light tropical fruit and vanilla with a touch of banana essence and malty sweetness.

Name: Gelston's 12 Year Old Single Malt
Palate: Charred pineapple, roasted nuts, fruit cake spice with a touch of clove, silky butterscotch.
Finish: Syrupy flapjack, more vanilla and zesty citrus, a prickle of ginger creeps in, balanced by sweet caramel and biscuity malt.
Nose: Light, sweet tropical fruits and crisp green apple, toasty malt, caramel biscuits, orange peel, vanilla cream.

Name: Hyde 6 Year Old No. 7 President's Cask
Palate: Rich, oily malt, vanilla cream and dried apricot, with red fruits appearing, namely stewed plum and raspberry.
Finish: Honeyed spices and caramel, with tart red berries.
Nose: Fresh malt and orange chocolate, leading into baking spice and creamy vanilla, lemon curd and honeyed stone fruit.

Name: Yellow Rose Premium American Whiskey
Palate: Banoffee pie, toffee penny and vanilla, with a side of Bakewell tart.
Finish: Cherry jam and more banana return on a fruity finish.
Nose: Fresh apple sprinkled with brown sugar, alongside lemon curd and a little oak spice.

Name: MB Roland Straight Bourbon
Palate: Toasted corn and buttered popcorn lead the way, with more chocolate supported by melted brown sugar and fried banana.
Finish: Dry, spicy oak and buttery caramel.
Nose: Maltesars and honeycomb, with citrus curd and wild berries alongside spicy oak.

Name: MB Roland Straight Rye
Palate: Melted brown sugar and cinnamon, with mint chocolate and dried herbs.
Finish: The mint continues onto the finish, balanced by buttery corn sweetness.
Nose: Kitchen spices and light notes of menthol, along with oily nuts, caramel and pear skin.

Name: Hyde No.8 Heritage Cask
Palate: Biscuity with sweet spice, raisins, and hoppy cold brew coffee.
Finish: Butterscotch with lingering toasted oak, soaked fruits, warm baking spice and dark, malted chocolate.
Nose: Vanilla and creamy malt with wafts of freshly roasted coffee beans.

Name: Egan's Centenary
Palate: Honeyed oats, apple, cinnamon, five-spice, a smidge of prune.
Finish: Toasted teacakes, coconut flakes, vanilla pod.
Nose: Candied nuts, dried peels, ginger, a touch of forest floor earthiness.

Name: Hardenberg Club Straight Wheat
Palate: Milk chocolate with fruit and nuts, boozy sultanas, fresh oak, vanilla.
Finish: Pepper, charred fruit, cinnamon, and spiced chocolate.
Nose: Sweet soaked raisins, sweet caramel, and a touch of vinous oak.

Name: Stauning 3 Year Old (That Boutique-y Rye Company)
Palate: Softly fruity, with the rum cask notes shining through. More crushed spices and crumbly toffee.
Finish: Slightly nutty and chocolatey on the finish.
Nose: Cedar and cinnamon, with a little caraway too. Plenty of honey, citrus and vanilla notes for balance.

Name: WhistlePig 15 Year Old
Palate: Toffee and butterscotch, a little bit of dark chocolate too. Soft spices grow and grow. A touch of intense oak warmth.
Finish: There's still a good helping of exotic spice on the finish, with a lingering caramel sweetness.
Nose: Bursts of peppery rye, alongside buttery biscuits and toasted nuts.

Name: MB Roland Straight Corn Whiskey
Palate: Continued gentle spice, with cinnamon butter and more classic corn notes.
Finish: Melted milk chocolate appears on a subtly spiced finish.
Nose: Buttered popcorn, along with Sugar Puffs and cinnamon rolls.

Name: Reservoir Wheat
Palate: Rich honey, marmalade, buttered toast and chocolate-coated peanuts.
Finish: A hint of orange chocolate remains.
Nose: Juicy red berries and thick layers of caramel.

Name: MB Roland Straight Malt Whiskey (55.7%)
Palate: More chocolate on the palate with walnuts, cinnamon, liquorice, and mint.
Finish: Sweet with layers of milk chocolate and caramel.
Nose: Big sweet nose with chocolate, toffee, tobacco, and a menthol note.

Name: Beverbach Craft Beer Cask Finish
Palate: Rich barley continues with plenty of tangy oak, sweet wafts of orchard fruit balance dryer hoppy undertones.
Finish: Fruit tart, flaky pastry, and a prickle of peppery, toasted oak.
Nose: Sweet, juicy malt and fruity flapjack, green oak, and floral vanilla.

Name: Catoctin Creek Ragnarok Rye
Palate: Butterscotch, plums, Christmas spice, and some ashy notes.
Finish: Rye spice and toast linger.
Nose: Dark fruit, chocolate, coffee beans, tobacco, and some orange peel.

Name: Ha'penny Original Blend
Palate: Jamaican ginger cake, poached pears, vanilla pod and clove-studded orange.
Finish: Lightly toasted teacakes with butter, a hint of grain sweetness sticking around.
Nose: Plum, cinnamon, soft sawdust woodiness and clean malt.

Name: Method and Madness Single Pot Still 28 Year Old
Palate: Vanilla and cinnamon, port wine and barley grains.
Finish: Lingering succulent fruits, toasted oak and light spice.
Nose: Fleshy mango, kiwi and green banana and ripe plums.

Name: W.D. Oâ Connell Bill Phil - Batch 02
Palate: Citrusy notes grow on the palate - think flamed orange peel and grapefruit. Oily smoke, toasted malt and buttery vanilla.
Finish: Softly spicy with cassia and clove, while maintaining a fruit-forward freshness.
Nose: Grassy malt with a whiff of earthy smokiness, balanced by crisp green apple and poached pear warmth.

Name: Woodford Reserve Baccarat Edition
Palate: Elegant vanilla, dark chocolate, dried fruit and creamy caramel top layers of rich malt and oak.
Finish: Velvety with a long delicately spiced caramel mocha note.
Nose: Rich toasted oak dusted with chocolate and cocoa notes, creamy vanilla bean, and hints of clove and cinnamon spice cover a deep layer of dried fruit and citrus peel.

Name: Reservoir Rye
Palate: A subtle floral hint develops on the palate, but it remains firmly in the 'cooking-spice-and-caramel' camp.
Finish: Fizzy oak, strawberry and black pepper.
Nose: Cardamom, clove, a light touch of camphor, burnt sugar and cedar.

Name: Beverbach Tequila Cask Finish
Palate: Crisp green apples and pears rest between rich, biscuity malt and tangy, peppery oak.
Finish: Gently zesty, subtly earthy, herbaceous woody undertones, butterscotch, and warming malty spice.
Nose: Dark fruit, green oak, and caramel with a hint of fresh hops.

Name: Catoctin Creek Rabble Rouser Rye Whiskey
Palate: Classic peppery rye, with a hint of oily oak developing. Still has some stone fruit sweetness running through it.
Finish: Cassia, clove, and salted caramel.
Nose: Brown bread with a layer of Nutella, forest floor, toasted sesame, yellow plum.

Name: Two Stacks The Blenders Cut
Palate: Raisins and sultanas, cedar, ginger, almonds, black pepper, caramel.
Finish: Still enjoyably honeyed, with spicy hints of pepper and nutmeg in tow.
Nose: Molasses, nectarine, cinnamon, warm oak and a touch of tea leaf.

Name: Haran 12 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish
Palate: Cinnamon, sultanas, a hint of black pepper and cedar.
Finish: White chocolate, more dried fruit, and pencil shavings.
Nose: Almonds, cherries, nutty barley, vanilla pod.

Name: Benjamin Chapman 7 Year Old Whiskey
Palate: Gently sweet with soft notes of toasted oak, vanilla custard, and woody spice.
Finish: Peppery grain and spicy cinnamon bring bold warmth to the finish, softened by caramel and honey.
Nose: Syrupy notes of honey and maple, sweet granola and grain.

Name: Bushmills 25 Year Old
Palate: The nuts are dry and toasted now, with bittersweet dark chocolate tempered by sweeter notes of candied ginger, treacle, and blackberry jam.
Finish: Old oak and dark tobacco linger while that gingerbread returns.
Nose: Warming and decadent, with almost-overdone caramelised nuts, honeycomb, and an unmistakable note of dark gingerbread. Then the juicy fruit comes in, with syrupy cherries and plum skin.

Name: Teeling Small Batch Gift Set with 2x Glasses
Palate: Spiced, rich palate with rose petal jelly and lemon curd. Creamy vanilla, hints of dried herbs and cinnamon.
Finish: Floral, herbal finish. Caramel on the tail.
Nose: Cut grass and orange blossom. Allspice, hints of vanilla, apple pie and blackberries.

Name: Teeling 37 Year Old - Vintage Reserve Collection
Palate: Silky smooth with ripe peaches, honey, smoked sea saltiness and subtle spices on the tongue.
Finish: Long and mellow with a continuation of the sweet spice.
Nose: White peaches, cut grass, white chocolate and a hint of toasted almonds.

Name: Boondocks Straight Rye
Palate: Rich, sweet and mouthcoating, Worther's Originals meet toasted oak and savoury grain to bring spicy warmth and balance.
Finish: Lingering warmth with sweet toffee and gentle pepper spice.
Nose: Caramel sauce with wafts of sweet vanilla and grainy, grassy notes.

Name: Westland American Oak
Palate: Caramel, buttered bread, a touch of cigar box.
Finish: Peppery oak returns on the finish, with a touch of pear.
Nose: Cherries, coffee and chocolate. Vanilla custard and peppery wood.

Name: Griffo Stout Barreled Whiskey
Palate: Fresh-ground black pepper crackles through dark chocolate, burnt toast and oily walnuts. Classic bourbon nutty sweetness fills the backdrop with gingernut biscuits, prunes and a little caramel.
Finish: Toasted oak and espresso linger with a hint of tobacco.
Nose: Roasted chocolate malt, coffee beans and dry earth lead, before lively orange peel and fresh fig provide a sweet underlay.

Name: St Patrick's 7 Year Old
Palate: Soft caramel and milk chocolate, ice-cream wafers, fruity malt and just a touch of nutmeg.
Finish: Pear drops, milky coffee, apricot jam.
Nose: Orange oil, slightly grassy, Custard Cream biscuits and honey.

Name: Sailor's Home The Haven
Palate: Black pepper, nectarine, chocolate chip cookies, cinnamon and dry oak.
Finish: Just a hint of orange peel and honey lasts.
Nose: Croissants, buttered bread, sultanas and ginger.

Name: Hardenberg Club Straight Rye
Palate: Honeyed grains and more buttery vanilla, now with pepper and clove spiciness.
Finish: Lingering oaky warmth.
Nose: Toasted bread with a layer of salted butter, plus some chewy caramel.

Name: Wilderness Trail Small Batch Bourbon
Palate: Orange peel, rich oak and some berry jam, with cigar box and a tropical fruit tang.
Finish: Cinnamon buns and cooked apple.
Nose: Peppery freshly baked bread, accompanied by wood smoke and just a hint of honey.

Name: Bushmills 30 Year Old
Palate: The PX influence comes in waves with bundles of dried fruit sweetness, with orange curd, hazelnut frangipane, and a smidge of apricot yogurt too.
Finish: Cherries in syrup and black pepper stay on and onâ¦ and on
Nose: Fruity and buttery, with decadent pain au raisin leading into prunes, thick molasses, and something like Turkish delight. A spicy, oaky backbone supports it all.

Name: Bower Hill Reserve Rye
Palate: New oak, fresh apricot, spiced rum and mint.
Finish: More mint, followed by a helping of cinnamon sticks.
Nose: Toasted rye warmth, with layers of brown sugar and dried orange peel.

Name: Bushmills Port Cask Reserve - Steamship Collection
Palate: Damson and honey, followed by drying touches of cacao and cinnamon.
Finish: Juicy red berries and spiced fruit compote.
Nose: Ripe red apples, chocolate aromas, a hint of red wine booziness.

Name: Kinahan's Small Batch Irish Whiskey
Palate: Subtle orchard fruit develops, along with a touch of cigar box.
Finish: White pepper and thyme honey.
Nose: Sweet and light, with notes of caramel, butter and soft cereals.

Name: Pearse Lyons Marriage of Malt Distillery Edition
Palate: Shortbread biscuits, charred cedar, fig, clove, and orange wine gums.
Finish: Dense vanilla lasts on the long finish.
Nose: Raisin and prune, joined by brown sugar and flaky pastry.

Name: Copeland Merchants' Quay Blended Irish Whiskey
Palate: Still packed with orchard fruit notes, now paired with cinnamon, clementine zest, and brown sugar.
Finish: Subtle simmering spice sticks around.
Nose: Ripe nectarine and red apple, with a few handfuls of raspberries too. Warm toffee and a hint of oak later on.

Name: Westland Colere 1st Edition - Outpost Range
Palate: Granola and cereal grain along with fresh tropical fruits and marzipan.
Finish: Deep, warm and long with lots of roasted almond and toasted pineapple.
Nose: Sweet with depth and with blueberry muffin hits of fruit.

Name: Belmont Farm Kopper Kettle Virginia Whiskey
Palate: Creamy praline and oak char, with orange marmalade and toasted nuts.
Finish: Peanut brittle lingers alongside citrus curd.
Nose: Honeyed orchard fruit, fresh hay, and homemade strawberry jam, with a smidge of buttery corn sweetness.

Name: Wilderness Trail Small Batch Rye
Palate: More citrus zest keeps things zingy with toasted rye bread and spiced butter in tow. Charred oak and butterscotch are followed by hints of liquorice and pepper.
Finish: That peppery heat takes hold on the finish, green peppers, and crushed peppercorns tangle with sweet toffee and orchard fruits.
Nose: Lemon peels, zesty satsuma, and crisp apple bring fruity balance to woody rye spice. Soft notes of vanilla caramel and floral honey drift in the distance.

Name: Haran 12 Year Old Traditional
Palate: Milky tea, sponge cake, a hint of almond croissant.
Finish: Green apple, vanilla pod, and caramel.
Nose: Honey, waxy peels, a hint of oatcake salinity.

Name: Rebel Small Batch Reserve
Palate: Plenty of honey, spicy vanilla and Raisin Wheats.
Finish: Big, with more dark brown sugar.
Nose: Classic notes of caramel, toasty oak, tobacco, vanilla and erm... brown sugar.

Name: Kentucky Owl Bourbon - Batch 11
Palate: Creamy vanilla juxtaposed by spicy oak, with building orchard fruit and citrus oil sweetness.
Finish: A little redcurrant twist appears on the finish.
Nose: Milk chocolate, cinder toffee, quite buttery, before a deft whack of baking spice and rye heat.

Name: Westland Peated
Palate: Smoky peanut shells and a little medicinal malt, alongside leafy mint.
Finish: Fruity esters and a pinch of ground pepper.
Nose: Orange and lemon peel at first, before a wave of smoky peat rolls in.

Name: Boulder New American Single Malt Whiskey
Palate: Scoops of vanilla ice cream, with malty grist, toasted oak, and gentle citrussy ginger.
Finish: Long and silky, with lingering spice and citrus.
Nose: Creamy oatcakes, with gentle citrus, allspice, and warm vanilla.

Name: Haran 12 Year Old Port Cask Finish
Palate: Raspberry jam, white chocolate, a touch of mint.
Finish: Crunchy brown sugar and toasted bread.
Nose: Vanilla pod, strawberry bonbons, orange peel.

Name: Kings County Bottled in Bond Bourbon
Palate: Maple syrup, with some red berry notes, cinnamon spice, and more oak character.
Finish: Winter spices and earthy vanilla.
Nose: Fresh baked cookies, with dark caramel, woody spices, and toasted oak.

Name: Westland Sherry Wood
Palate: Pancakes with honey, icing sugar and fresh red fruits. A few more raisins for good measure.
Finish: CrÃ¨me de Cassis and vanilla-y malt.
Nose: Raisins, milk chocolate and fresh malt, with a little bit of honey too.

Name: Lambay Small Batch Blend Irish Whiskey
Palate: Peppery barley and creamy vanilla, mixed with notes of strawberry and peach.
Finish: Lingering cassia and chamomile.
Nose: Porridge with honey and cinnamon, a soft hint of torn orange peel.

Name: Gelston's 12 Year Old Rum Cask Finish
Palate: Lemon, more peach (and now apricot, too), stem ginger and pepper.
Finish: Lingering oak heat balanced by a burst of papaya.
Nose: Creamy caramel and fresh peach, with a hint of cut grass underneath.

Name: Springbank Rundlets and Kilderkins
Palate: Huge in the mouth with a succulent honey sweetness. Lots of depth in the form of muscovado sugar and more chocolate.
Finish: Smooth and creamy vanilla.
Nose: Caramel sweetness with honey and milk chocolate. It smells wonderfully thick and spicy - nutmeg and cloves.

Name: Reminisce Blended Irish Whiskey
Palate: Runny honey, zingy apple, buttery oak, and oily barley.
Finish: Creamy vanilla balanced by green oak.
Nose: Caramel digestives and orange marmalade on toast.

Name: Griffo Stony Point Whiskey
Palate: Enjoyably creamy, with a crisp touch of black pepper adding spice.
Finish: Brown sugar, fresh ginger.
Nose: Peanut brittle, toasted marshmallow and grassy rye.

Name: Kilkerran 12 Year Old
Palate: vanilla, butterscotch, honeycomb and digestive biscuits can all be tasted and enjoyed.
Finish: Velvet and smooth with lemon meringue, to conclude, thereâs an oiliness and a saltiness that youâd expect from a Campbeltown dram.
Nose: Oak notes are dominant, followed by toasted marshmallows and dried fruit pudding, as well as cherries, marzipan and a hint of peat.

Name: Helsinki Whiskey Rye Malt
Palate: Dried apricots, toffee apple, liquorice, and hints of espresso.
Finish: Cacao powder, Seville orange marmalade, and rye spices.
Nose: Caramel, vanilla, dark chocolate, and toasted rye bread.

Name: Midleton 47 Year Old - Very Rare Silent Distillery Collection Chapter Three
Palate: Opens with a luxuriously rich and full-bodied texture accompanied by notes of freshly brewed dark roasted coffee, caramelised fruits, crushed pistachio and hazelnut. Hints of dried herbs and peppermint add further complexity, along with the oakâs soft tannins and subtle pot still spices.
Finish: A lasting finish finds soft fruits and old pot still spices lingering in harmony with the oak and emphasises how decades of undisturbed ageing can create such balance and complexity.
Nose: The first impression is a rich medley of forest fruits. Notes of sugar-glazed cherries, earthy and toffee tones of muscovado sugar and almond flake follow, complementing the oakâs enduring influence on the spirit. Aromas reminiscent of worn, leather-bound ledgers and pipe tobacco linger, while measured levels of pot still spices add their own delicate presence.

Name: Bowmore 22 Year Old Aston Martin - Masters' Selection
Palate: Malty spice notes of vanilla fudge, golden syrup and butterscotch, with thyme and white pepper, woody notes of dry oak, hazelnut, Demerara sugar, maple syrup, and dates.
Finish: Sweet and woody with notes of liquorice sticks deliver a spicy mouthfeel and a touch of peat smoke.
Nose: Sweet and fruity notes of heather honey, vanilla, cherries and lychees, with a floral character and a hint of eucalyptus. Oak spices, liquorice and fresh tobacco leaves with a touch of aniseed and mint.

Name: The Macallan Rare Cask (2023 Release)
Palate: An intense sweet raisin dominates before giving way to vanilla and dark chocolate, with layers of light citrus zest.
Finish: Long, rich and velvety.
Nose: Soft notes of vanilla with rich raisin, followed by a sweet fusion of fresh apple, lemon and orange.

Name: St. George Breaking & Entering American Whiskey
Palate: Pecan, chocolate, spicy rye warmth, honeyed cereals and a few hints of cherry pie.
Finish: Strawberry jam on toast, hickory and caramel.
Nose: Coffee beans, peanut brittle, a very soft hint of oaky char, maple syrup and fried dough.

Name: Clan Colla 20 Year Old 2001 - Pedro XimÃ©nez Cask Finish
Palate: Smooth and complex, creamy with honey, caramel, and dried fruit.
Finish: A long and rich finish.
Nose: Toasted nuts, figs, seedless raisins, and dark chocolate.

Name: The GlenDronach 15 Year Old Revival
Palate: Oily walnut, new leather, blackberry and apple crumble, toasted brown sugar and a touch of liquorice root.
Finish: Fresh ginger, waxy orange, caramelised dried fruit and a hint of cigar box.
Nose: Coffee beans, sponge cake drenched in sherry, mint leaf, slightly buttery, sultana.

Name: Boulder Peated Malt American Single Malt Whiskey
Palate: Sweet oaky vanilla and woodfire combine, with hints of earthy moss and waxy lemon, and drizzles of caramel.
Finish: The smoke lingers, with gentle oaky spice.
Nose: Cinder toffee, with damp embers, spicy toasted oak and vanilla in the background.

Name: Adelphi Blended Scotch Whisky
Palate: The palate takes on a coastal quality with an all-round nuttiness and a medium-body.
Finish: The finish is long with beach bonfire notes and some pear-drop flavours.
Nose: The aroma is a pleasing fusion of salty peat and estery fruitiness. If you like your big fruits Speysiders and your peaty Islays this could be just your thing!

Name: Kentucky Peerless 3 Year Old (That Boutique-y Rye Company)
Palate: Chocolate peanuts, earthy vanilla, another crackle of peppercorn, salted caramel.
Finish: Buttered rye bread and a hint of caraway.
Nose: Toffee and honey, swiftly followed by freshly crushed black pepper and a touch of fennel.

Name: The Macallan 25 Year Old Sherry Oak (2022 Release)
Palate: Full and rich, with dried fruits and a hint of wood smoke.
Finish: Long, with dried fruit, wood smoke, and spice.
Nose: Citrus, balanced with cinnamon, sherry, and wood smoke.

Name: The Macallan A Night On Earth In Scotland 2022 Release
Palate: There's the shortbread! Creamy vanilla and toasted flour, with rich fruitcake, and figgy pudding.
Finish: Drizzles of caramel with speculoos biscuits.
Nose: Warm apple crumble with dollops of vanilla custard, crunchy stone fruit, and gentle nuttiness.

Name: Fercullen Falls Small Batch Blended Irish Whiskey
Palate: Lots of sweetness here, with peppery spice and cloves, plus orchard fruit.
Finish: Sweet notes linger.
Nose: Fresh apples on the nose with cinnamon, muscovado sugar, and toffee.

Name: Glenburgie 23 Year Old 1995 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Stewed plums and apricots lead to runny layers of toffee, with a touch of woody spice followed by marmalade and cacao.
Finish: Sweet and zesty, with candied oranges, butterscotch, and soft oak spice.
Nose: Sweet blondies, dried raspberries, vanilla fudge, and baked apple, with a touch of cedar resting beneath.

Name: Indiana Straight Rye 2017 (bottled 2022) - Wonders of the World (Swell de Spirits)
Palate: Fresh baked banana bread, with malt loaf, floral honey, toasted oak, and warming spice.
Finish: Peppery rye spice builds, with oaky vanilla.
Nose: Peppery spice, with ripe peaches, burnt sugar, and a touch of earthy peat.

Name: Boulder Port Cask American Single Malt Whiskey
Palate: Tangy notes of rhubarb crumble, stewed plums, and berries, backed up by dense fruitcake spice, orange zest, and candied ginger coated in dark chocolate.
Finish: Drying oak spice tangles with juicy forest fruits, with sticky ginger cake, and a prickle of cracked pepper.
Nose: Stewed raisins and grape skins, dried cinnamon, with notes of chocolate covered Brazil nuts in tow.

Name: Ardbeg BizarreBQ
Palate: Warming chilli and dried red pepper spice, meaty Maillard reaction, smouldering bonfire, and cinnamon and clove spice.
Finish: Smouldering charcoal and spicy biltong.
Nose: Deliciously smoky, with maple glazed bacon, molasses, and some earthy herbs.

Name: Speyside 7 Year Old 2015 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Creamy, zesty key lime pie, yoghurt-coated raisins, and soaked oats are accompanied by sugared orange zest and butter biscuits.
Finish: Fresh peach, plum, and apricot linger, with plenty of buttery fudge and poached pear. Soft spices rest elegantly beneath.
Nose: Fragrant florals with citrus blossom and light, fruity tea, warm sourdough, and buttered shortbread. A touch of apricot fromage frais and candied pineapple come later.

Name: Springbank 12 Year Old Cask Strength
Palate: Soft peat smoke and notes of morello cherries and aniseed, accompanied by a creamy mouthfeel reminiscent of custard creams.
Finish: The coastal influence emerges in the finish in notes of brine, oil, and salted caramel, along with the endurance of peat smoke.
Nose: Toffee apple sweetness kicks off this cask-strength whisky, along with notes of parma ham, hazelnut, and marzipan.

Name: Girvan 32 Year Old 1990 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Rich, juicy grain coats the mouth with creamy vanilla, while drying oak rests in the depths. Hints of underripe plum and warm rice pudding, a dash of nutmeg, soft sponge with stewed fruit.
Finish: Apple crumble with sugared breadcrumbs and ginger remain with a rich balance of fruity sweetness and spice. Butterscotch, mulled apple juice.
Nose: Crunchy Nut cornflakes, mellow, buttery oak, vanilla pod and toasted oak drizzled with syrup. A touch of polished pine/pine oil/wood polish in time, with hints of drying spice.

Name: Springbank 15 Year Old
Palate: Quite full and rich. There are notes of creamy fruit salad and more exotic fruit notes. There is palpable mastication from the oaked tannins with a hint of spice.
Finish: Fairly long with a gentle warmth.
Nose: Fragrant with a certain richness. Notes of fruit salad and a hint of caramel, pineapple, guava and passion fruit lurk. There are notes of dried leather and old ropes. A hint of toffee sweetness and some granary toast.

Name: Westland Single Malt - Garryana 5th Edition
Palate: A slow build of meaty smoke and stone fruit, with helpings of baking spice along the way.
Finish: Lasting clove, caraway and toffee.
Nose: Honey and warming with toasted wood, hot chocolate and a hint of fresh lemon.

Name: Boulder Bottled In Bond American Single Malt Whiskey
Palate: Treacle, fig jam, chocolate orange, a good whack of black pepper, and candied ginger.
Finish: Clove-studded orange and more peppery oak linger.
Nose: Marmalade, chilli spice, and cooked orchard fruit.

Name: Peerless Small Batch Rye (54.7%)
Palate: An impressive variety of flavour emerges from that same core of apple fruitiness, baking spice and nutty woody goodness. Fresh malty rye grains, earthy vanilla, stem ginger and floral honey emerge among touches of chocolate milk, raspberry, black tea and apricots in syrup. Underneath thereâs charred pepper, toasted oak and just a handful of dried herbs.
Finish: Homemade apple juice, salty porridge, marmalade and hints of cedar, clove and menthol linger.
Nose: Thereâs ripe green apples, cranberry, peanut brittle, buttery vanilla, toasted brown sugar and toffee popcorn bring a wave of complex sweetness while nutmeg, ginger, black pepper add aromatic spice.
