As it develops thereâs orange peel, fennel and baked earth with touches of Dr Pepper, rosewater, Taveners Coconut Mushrooms, fluffy marshmallow and sandalwood in support as well as some barrel char.

Name: Speyside 8 Year Old 2014 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Elegant layers of Custard Cream biscuits and white chocolate with hazelnuts are joined by hints of honeyed fig and vanilla tablet.
Finish: More gentle spice, with creamy oak and biscuity malt in tow. Fresh orchard fruits, cream crackers, and milky tea linger.
Nose: Sweet notes of zesty lemon curd and floral honeysuckle, buttered shortbread, and red apple. Soft caramel chocolates and vanilla pod join along the way.

Name: The Macallan Harmony Collection Intense Arabica
Palate: Dark roasted coffee character, toasted wattleseed, cocoa nibs, bursts of red berries, oaky spice, and a touch of orange peel.
Finish: Toasty notes from the coffee linger, with shavings of chocolate.
Nose: Vietnamese iced coffee with its sweet creamy notes of condensed milk, joined by sundried raisins, praline, and gentle spice.

Name: Rebel Yell 10 Year Old Single Barrel
Palate: Cinnamon gum, cookie dough and heavy layers of caramel.
Finish: Lasting vanilla and black pepper spiciness.
Nose: Chocolate, burnt sugar, charred oak, blackcurrant.

Name: Caol Ila 18 Year Old
Palate: Big, refined sweetness, leafy. Well integrated oak, smoke, oily, peat. Barley.
Finish: Long, herbal notes, gentle smoke, soft peat. Oily wood.
Nose: Aromatic, darkness. Herbal, vegetal. Grassy, creamy malt.

Name: Nc'nean Organic Single Malt Whisky (with Gift Tube)
Palate: Tangy tropical fruits aplenty here, with charred pineapple and drizzles of honey. Vanilla takes the lead bringing notes of creamy fudge, with hints of ginger and stewed berries resting beneath.
Finish: Dark chocolate, candied orange, buttered shortbread, and toasted, oaken spice.
Nose: Barley sugar sweeties and orange oil lead the way, with notes of apricot jam and summer berries joining. Biscuity malt rests beneath, with a touch of vanilla.

Name: Haran 12 Year Old Cider Cask Finish
Palate: Cinnamon and nutmeg, with heavy vanilla and zesty green apple.
Finish: Caramelised nuts and a touch of dried apricot.
Nose: Cooked apple, fragrant oak, rounded malt sweetness.

Name: Glentauchers 21 Year Old 1996 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Soft prunes and buttery fudge lead to zesty orange marmalade and flamed peels. Peppery oak crackles beneath, with a touch of herbaceous barley in the distance.
Finish: Vanilla custard, buttered toast, a touch of root ginger and nutmeg, and subtle flinty minerality.
Nose: Chocolate and caramel digestive biscuits and nutty malt lead to juicy red apples and stewed berries, with waves of toasted oak and vanilla in support.

Name: Irish Single Malt Whiskey 14 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: More biscuity notes, now with some bourbon biscuits thrown in too. Still got a good kick of cinnamon and ginger to it.
Finish: Lingering hints of old sherry richness stick around on the finish.
Nose: Blackberry, chocolate gateaux, apricot, a hint of Christmas cake, biscuit dough.

Name: Egan's 17 Year Old Legacy Reserve III
Palate: Ginger, red apples, more rounded malt, with a zesty hint of white grape later on.
Finish: Fresh ginger, marmalade on toast, cinnamon.
Nose: Honeycomb, fresh lemon peel, malty warmth developing soon after.

Name: Kilchoman Loch Gorm 2023 Release
Palate: Fresh citrus, aromatic spices, tinned peaches, and salty peat smoke.
Finish: Ginger and orange zest linger.
Nose: Peat smoke, dark chocolate, and rich fruits.

Name: Boondocks 11 Year Old Cask Strength American Whiskey
Palate: Shortbread, flaked almonds, coffee bean, peppery rye, buttery corn.
Finish: Brandy snaps, fresh ginger, a whisper of smoke.
Nose: Dark chocolate, cassia, cedar, vanilla pod earthiness.

Name: Teeling 30 Year Old 1991 â Vintage Reserve Collection
Palate: Velvety smooth with real depth of peach and apricot, hints of citrus fruits are interwoven with a light touch of smoke and herbal woody notes.
Finish: Long, lingering fruit notes with a distinctive mix of spicy oak and smoked sea salt.
Nose: A luxurious combination of fresh orchard fruits, roasted nuts, and chocolate.

Name: Springbank 10 Year Old
Palate: A full, sweet, creamy palate with hints of smoke, marzipan and cigar boxes.
Finish: A smoky finish, trailing off on sweet cider and toasty barley.
Nose: The nose offers up plenty of oak, exotic spices, guava, heather honey and soft smoke.

Name: Kilkerran Heavily Peated Batch No. 8
Palate: Orchard fruits, apple blossom, and poached pear notes emerge, and the peat smoke becomes more prominent on the palate in notes of campfire embers.
Finish: A long, sweet finish concludes this heavily peated dram.
Nose: The nose is slightly mineral, with peat smoke apparent from the outset and a malty, cereal note.

Name: WhistlePig 12 Year Old Oloroso Cask - Old World (Master of Malt)
Palate: A gentle creamy undertone with more caramel and baking spices, new leather and wonderful rich sherry notes.
Finish: Warming spice and rich, dark fruits linger alongside a pinch of tobacco on a lengthy finish.
Nose: Bucketfuls of dried fruit, with sweet caramel and vanilla alongside prominent spicy notes and orange oil.

Name: Grace O'Malley Dark Char Cask Irish Whiskey
Palate: Fruit cake burnt ends, charred bourbony vanilla oak, malted milk biscuits.
Finish: Creamy coffee, sweet, lingering toasted wood and grain.
Nose: Vanilla latte with caramel, sweet malt, tangy oak, and sugared cereal.

Name: Velvet Cap Irish Whiskey Triple Cask
Palate: Nutty malt and vanilla biscuits join more dark stone fruits, backed by silky caramel and a hint of herbaceous oak.
Finish: Candied mango arrives for the finish, with a touch of cinnamon, fruity granola, black pepper, and cacao.
Nose: Honeyed stone fruit and a touch of plum jam support banana bread, vanilla, marzipan, and cocoa.

Name: Midleton Very Rare 2023
Palate: Luscious at first with succulent fruits and a distinctive creaminess along with a herbal quality akin to camomile tea. The pot still spices add depth and intrigue as they weave amongst the floral grain qualities found lingering throughout. The charred oakâs influence continues to build over time creating additional complexity as the wood-derived spices complement the ever-present fruits of candied orange and dried apricot.
Finish: The fruits and pot still spices build to a crescendo before giving way, leaving the final say to the oak tannins and antique grain whiskey.
Nose: Opens with an intricate medley of fruits including nectarines, ripe melon, green apple, and apricot. A solid foundation of pot still spices, showcasing notes of freshly peeled ginger and crushed peppercorns, work in tandem with the aged grainâs perfumed notes of dried flowers and delectable golden syrup. The oak continues to reveal itself, adding notes of vanilla, combined with a honeycomb sweetness and freshly roasted coffee beans.

Name: Haran 18 Year Old Original Small Batch Reserve
Palate: Brandy snaps, apple chips, flakes almonds, honey, and dusty oak.
Finish: A hint of leather persists.
Nose: Walnuts, nutmeg, sultanas, chewy caramel, and chocolate digestives.

Name: Lismore 21 Year Old - The Legend
Palate: Fig, mint chocolate, grapefruit and a little touch of coconut ice.
Finish: Sherried spices develop on the finish, with honey and toffee popcorn in tow.
Nose: Chocolate fudge, intense citrus sweetness and a hint of maple syrup.

Name: The Lakes Whiskymaker's Reserve No.5
Palate: Coffee cake, cinnamon, rich red wine, a hint of tangy tropical fruit giving it some lift.
Finish: Toasted brown sugar and cassia, plus mahogany warmth lasting.
Nose: Cherry Bakewells, dried fruit, old oak furniture, and a touch of pecan.

Name: Tyrconnell 10 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish
Palate: Delectable and utterly decadent! This dessert in a glass with a hugely authentic note of wonderfully thick Fino sherry. Also hints of tarte tatin and custard.
Finish: More of that sherry, with apple tart and cinnamon.
Nose: Strong on sherry, it has a strong Fino feel to it, very grape-like, with notes of juicy raisins, golden berries, just a hint of mint.

Name: Driftless Glen 5 Year Old Single Barrel Rye
Palate: Light caramelised honey, with plenty of peppery rye spice, cacao nibs, and a warm heat building.
Finish: Complex and characterful, with the spices and sugar notes lingering.
Nose: Sticky brown sugar, spicy pepper and warm baking spices, with light wafts of vanilla.

Name: J.J. Corry Anfa No.2
Palate: Soft hay notes as it opens, before juicy nectarine and pear, with a good crackle of nutmeg and black pepper.
Finish: Enjoyably creamy on the finish.
Nose: Stone fruit, granola with fresh yoghurt, dried barley, rich tea biscuits.

Name: Westland Single Malt - Garryana 2019 Edition 4|1
Palate: Mint chocolate and dried berries, with rye bread and plum jam alongside green oak. muscular and savoury.
Finish: Drying black pepper appears on the finish.
Nose: Oak char and blueberry muffin, with cooked condensed milk, oily malt and a touch of savoury brine.

Name: Berry Bros & Rudd Single Malt Irish Whiskey - The Classic Range
Palate: More fruit now with apples, apricots, and dried peels balancing delicate oak and creamy barley.
Finish: Subtle spice develops with hints of clove and pepper, cushioned by soft fruits and silky oak.
Nose: Creamy vanilla custard, zesty lime with floral fruit.

Name: The GlenDronach 21 Year Old - Parliament
Palate: Golden syrup, soft, juicy raisins, tangy oak notes, peach, cherry blossom, cocoa and honeydew melon.
Finish: Sherry tones lead the finish, with a hint of sulphur, chocolate, luscious fruit and pepper.
Nose: Soft smoke and lemon juice, cedar wood, apple peel, toasty oak, soft earth, date and walnut cake and a hint of freshly made espresso.

Name: Creag Dhu
Palate: Vanilla, honey, dates, more walnuts, and a hint of Toblerone.
Finish: Fruity on the finish with cooked apples and raisins.
Nose: Waxy orange peels, coffee and walnut cake, a good pinch of cinnamon.

Name: The Macallan 30 Year Old Sherry Oak (2022 Release)
Palate: Deliciously smooth, with dried fruits, sherry, orange and wood smoke.
Finish: Long and rich, with orange and spice.
Nose: Rich sherry, with orange clove, nutmeg and wood smoke.

Name: Hazelburn 21 Year Old (43.2%)
Palate: On the palate, there are notes of marshmallow and candy floss, with a syrupy mouthfeel and subtle mineral note. The earthy tone from the nose carries through.
Finish: Notes of cocoa powder, cappuccino, and mint linger in the finish.
Nose: Notes of leather-bound books, bung cloths, and dunnage warehouses are followed by sweeter characteristics of treacle, caramel, and bramble.

Name: Longrow Peated
Palate: Light and sweet with notes of green grapes and rhubarb, a great contrast to the nose. Then comes a big blast of smoke.
Finish: That salty smokiness returns from the nose providing a deeply satisfying ending.
Nose: Salt and a leathery smokiness come to the fore in a maritime combination, like a Harbourmaster's Jacket.

Name: Haran 21 Year Old Original Casks Selection
Palate: Dry oak and toasted spices, leading into poached pear and runny caramel.
Finish: Hints of black tea balanced by toffee and orange sweetness.
Nose: Mahogany, barley sugar sweeties, lemon peel, and a touch of dark chocolate.

Name: Glentauchers 44 Year Old 1975 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Layers of creamy barley welcome the way for a medley of tropical fruits, drizzled with honey. Oily oak brings depth, with delicate spice creeping in.
Finish: That fruitiness lingers beside drying spice and treacle toffee.
Nose: Apple crumble with a dusting of spice opens the way before things develop towards grilled pineapple and caramel sauce. Antique furniture and old oak linger in the distance.

Name: Edradour 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 305) - Un-Chilfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Dark caramel, ginger biscuits, malt loaf, and some dark chocolate.
Finish: The warm spices stick around, along with some liquorice.
Nose: Warm, woody spices, with dried figs and raisins.

Name: The English - The Royal Coronation
Palate: Shavings of milk chocolate, with dried figs and raisins, and some spiced fruit cake.
Finish: Cinnamon spice, and dried fruits.
Nose: Crumbly fudge, dried apricots, apple pie, and a touch of toasted almond.

Name: Finlaggan Red Wine Cask
Palate: A salty savoury note of smoked meat against a backdrop of sweet fruit, made up of plum jam, red grapes, orange marmalade and more berries, shrouded by earthy peat smoke.
Finish: Sweet malt and grape skin supported by bonfire smoke on a lingering finish.
Nose: Smoky and peaty aromas intertwined with lovely sweet red berries as well as dried fruit and a hint of oaky vanilla.

Name: Glen Spey 11 Year Old 2010 - Ghost (Fable Whisky)
Palate: More fruity sweetness, now with pineapple and citrus. Earthy malt gives it some balance.
Finish: Subtly buttery at points.
Nose: Pear drops, dry oak with a subtle waft of smoke, cinnamon.

Name: Campbeltown 8 Year Old 2014 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Candied apple, dried, salted mango, leathery oak. Nutty notes of maple syrup lead to robust woody spice with hints of blueberry and roasted coffee beans. Custard cream biscuits and hazelnut cream linger beneath.
Finish: Crackles of pepper and a smidge of root ginger are kept at bay by drizzles of icing sugar, butter biscuits, and sweet, herbaceous, red fruit notes of rooibos tea and dark chocolate Malteasers.
Nose: Oily brine and sugar-dusted pear drops, green apple, creamy grist, and a touch of sawdust, followed by hints of prune and honeyed fig.

Name: Pokeno - Origin
Palate: Big helpings of vanilla caramel, warm oak, cinnamon, and candied citrus.
Finish: Brown sugar notes and peppery spice.
Nose: Warm fudge, allspice, black pepper, and a touch of lemon peel.

Name: Secret Highland 9 Year Old 2010 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Strawberry shortcake with a big dollop of clotted cream. Juicy notes of crisp white grapes and honeyed dates are followed by butter biscuits, chewy toffee, and a touch of toasted malt.
Finish: Warm blondies drizzled with white chocolate bring perfect balance to delicate oaken spice.
Nose: Cinder toffee lingers in the distance with delicate notes of fresh pear and almond croissants. Creamy barley develops in time, joined by sweet, crumbly vanilla fudge.

Name: Glenglassaugh 40 Year Old
Palate: Thick and syrupy. Oloroso Sherry, crystallised ginger and toffee-dipped raisins. Hints of cocoa and cinnamon.
Finish: Drying and rich with Sherry spice.
Nose: Ripe banana, pineapple and the first whiff of Oloroso Sherry.

Name: Aberlour 14 Year Old Double Cask Matured
Palate: Full texture, round and creamy, with sweet dark cherries, fudge, and mocha coffee with a refreshing minty breeze.
Finish: Quite long with lingering honey and wood spice.
Nose: Big aromatics on this one with cloves, cardamom and camphor, and then comes a wave of sweeter notes like toffee, milk chocolate and orange rind.

Name: Spirit of Yorkshire 2017 (bottled 2023) (cask 2237) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Unctuous. Creamy grain, spiced figs in syrup, and warm oak.
Finish: Sweet, with cinnamon spice.
Nose: Rich spice, barley sugar, with candied orange peel.

Name: Jameson 18 Year Old
Palate: Candied fruit, cut herbs, nutty malt and rum-soaked raisins. Lingering toffee and oak-y spices.
Finish: Honeycomb, citrus peels, ginger, new leather and waft of fresh florals.
Nose: Toasted sugar, hot cross buns with salted butter, a hint of leafy coriander gives it a vegetal touch, orange zest.

Name: Knockando 18 Year Old Slow Matured
Palate: Toasted almonds, flamed orange peel, butterscotch, and a just hint of spicy clove.
Finish: Marmalade and Christmas cake richness.
Nose: Brown sugar, nutty barley, and soft red berries.

Name: Benromach Contrasts Peat Smoke
Palate: More fruit-forward on the palate, with flamed orange peel and a splash of apple. Still packing plenty of peat smoke.
Finish: Bonfire embers, brown sugar, grilled pineapple.
Nose: Roasted nuts, vanilla pod, earthy barley, cinnamon, ginger, a hint of summer meadow.

Name: Jack Daniel's Master Distiller Series No. 6
Palate: Smooth and soft with notes of banana milkshake, a mixed nut note, a touch of caramel with crÃ¨me anglaise.
Finish: A little cereal sweetness and toasty oak.
Nose: Quite light and smooth with plenty of sweetness. Hints of dry spice and oily nuts, a touch of smoke.

Name: Berry Bros. & Rudd Blended Malt - Speyside Reserve
Palate: Creamier than you'd expect, with more orchard fruits coming through, plus golden syrup, caramel and soft spices.
Finish: Medium length with even more of those apple-y orchard fruits.
Nose: Oodles of tropical fruit, honey, a gentle oakiness and fresh orange peels.

Name: Charlie Parry's 3 Year Old Bourbon
Palate: Honeyed cereal with more charred oak, sweet butterscotch, and silky vanilla.
Finish: Buttered popcorn, and prickly pepper spice on the finish.
Nose: Sweet toasty oak, caramel, vanilla granola.

Name: Dunville's Very Rare 10 Year Old Irish Whiskey
Palate: Stewed red fruits, candied orange and a crackle of black pepper initially, before a little mocha, custard and spice rise.
Finish: Juicy and pleasant on the finish with some lingering wood.
Nose: Fresh green apples, tropical chews and coconut lead, with dried grass and a touch of crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e.

Name: Oban 14 Year Old
Palate: Smoky, creamy palate with notes of marmalade, toffee apples and pear cider. A development of cloves comes late palate.
Finish: A long, malty finish with toasty oak and spice.
Nose: Smoky, maritime nose with hints of sticking plasters and toffee brittle.

Name: Strathisla 1965 (Gordon & Macphail)
Palate: There is a fruitiness on the palate off-set with denser sweet sherry notes and an almost imperceptible hint of smoke.
Finish: The finish is long and reminiscent of red fruits and menthol.
Nose: Toffee, vanilla and fleshy dried fruits with a hint of pineapple and thyme.

Name: Craigellachie 11 Year Old 2011 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: A big welcoming embrace of bold, robust oak, countered by treacly toffee, cocoa, and caramel. Sprinklings of warming baking spice coat the palate, balanced brilliantly by the toffee sweetness.
Finish: Complex layers of poached apples, sweet souffle, and toffee sauce tangle with cracked black pepper, and dark chilli and ginger chocolate.
Nose: Burnt toffee and toasted, honeyed nuts, buttered malt loaf, and sweet, syrup-soaked sponge cake. Drying oak spice arrives in time, cushioned by hedgerow fruits.

Name: Dailuaine 7 Year Old 2015 Oloroso Finish Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Sticky sweet malt coats the palate, bringing biscuity spice before a whole heap of stewed apples and clove-studded orange. Oily barley brings buttery layers of caramel and pastry, with a meaty hint of beer sticks and fennel.
Finish: A hint of root ginger warmth pokes through in time, with candied pineapple to balance.
Nose: Doughy with notes of yeasty bread and parbaked cookies. Crisp pear and lemon peel lead to candle wax, subtle whisps of candyfloss, mango sticky rice, and salted parma ham.

Name: Springbank 23 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Black Forest gateau â loads of dark berries and chocolate rest among layers of leathery oak and oily malt, with waves of coastal salinity riding through.
Finish: Salted chocolate and a hint of menthol gather for the finish, with earthy old oak, charred peppercorns, and dried stone fruits.
Nose: Big bold layers of burnt rubber and tar, oily ropes, resinous tobacco, and walnut oil.

Name: The Macallan Concept No.1 2018
Palate: Sweet orange and lemon citrus with soft oak spices, fresh fruit and ginger.
Finish: Medium sweet, dry with a lingering oak, citrus fruit and ginger finish.
Nose: Sweet butterscotch toffee, with almond, ginger spice and cinnamon. Hints of dried fruit, citrus and green banana.

Name: North British 13 Year Old 2008 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Fluffy vanilla souffle is followed quickly by a splash of warming spice as it goes down, soon mellowed by more creamy grain and soft apricot.
Finish: Butterscotch rests beside sweet orange zest with warming notes of brandy butter bringing brilliant balance to rich charred, peppery oak spice.
Nose: Buttery sponge, syrup-soaked oats, sawdust, and peppery spice with crisp toasted oak, cereal, and an almost mineral vibrancy.

Name: Yoichi 10 Year Old
Palate: Oily and sweet, with peat smoke following swiftly afterwards. Light oak and developing fruit notes beneath.
Finish: Appealing oak lasts on the finish.
Nose: Plenty of fruit notes - peach stands out in particular, ripe, vibrant and subtly floral. Then there's rich vanilla custard, peat smoke and a hint of nutmeg spice.

Name: Coperies Single Malt French Whisky
Palate: Rum and raisin ice cream, toasted oak, burnt sugar, and golden cereal.
Finish: Sweet and richly spiced.
Nose: Floral with delicate fruits and cinnamon in support.

Name: Dalmore The Trio
Palate: Still fruity with dark berry compote and stewed plums. Hints of leathery oak creep in, with creamy barley and buttered shortbread.
Finish: A touch of woody anise and clove are balanced by silken caramel, rounded off with plenty of oaken vanilla.
Nose: Heaps of tangy, zesty fruit with notes of dried cranberry, orange peel, and cherry chocolate.

Name: Secret Speyside 17 Year Old 2005 (cask DRU 17/A106 #28) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Spiced fruitcake, Lamingtons, with some oily walnuts, and warming pepper.
Finish: Sweet and spicy.
Nose: Big sherry notes, spiced syrupy figs and raisins.

Name: Ben Nevis Coire Leis
Palate: Orchard and stone fruits, sugary barley, spiced fruit loaf, and toasted oak.
Finish: Baking spice continues alongside bold malt and baked apple.
Nose: Woody spice, floral honey and vanilla, sweet malt, and buttery biscuits.

Name: Aberlour 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 367497) - James Eadie
Palate: Raisins, baked plums, leathery spices, and a touch of candied orange.
Finish: Hazelnut praline, and sweet spices.
Nose: Rich dried fruit, with some sticky balsamic glaze, and Christmas cake.

Name: Dailuaine 21 Year Old 1997 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Walnut oil and a touch of citrus are supported by toffee pennies and woody spice, while a whisper of earthen smoke and herbaceous malt develop in the depths.
Finish: A prickle of pepper, coffee grounds, and anise, with a square of hazelnut dark chocolate.
Nose: Praline, burnt brown sugar, buttery, sugar-dusted shortbread, a subtle touch of polished oak, and fresh mint.

Name: Glen Scotia 8 Year Old 2014 (cask 21/655-9) - Master of Malt Exclusive Cask
Palate: Charred brown sugar opens the way for cooked, spiced apples, flaky pastry, and sweet liquorice while dustings of nutmeg and crystalised ginger develop.
Finish: Juicy fig returns on the finish, with drizzles of dark honey and treacly molasses, backed up by sweet stewed fruits and mixed spices.
Nose: Layers of sticky dates and figs, fragrant spices, and fresh orchard fruits.

Name: Arran Sauternes Cask Finish
Palate: Sweet but cut with warm spice. Lemon zest announces itself with the addition of water and a slight saltiness plays with this dram's sweet character.
Finish: Seville orange, Sauternes and an ounce of honey in a crisp finish.
Nose: Initially acacia honey but then opening up to apricots, bananas and pears. With time a floral elegance presents itself.

Name: Fercullen 18 Year Old
Palate: Toffee Crisp bars, melted butter, gingerbread and nutty malt.
Finish: A touch of orange zest develops on the finsh.
Nose: Layers of caramel and honey, punctuated by flashes of cinnamon, dark chocolate and mint.

Name: Arran The Bothy Quarter Cask
Palate: Coconut and almond, followed by apricot and pineapple. Black pepper and menthol.
Finish: Lingering cherry and cinnamon on the finish.
Nose: Honeyed malt balanced by oaky spice and a whiff of bright citrus.

Name: The Kurayoshi Tottori Bourbon Barrel
Palate: Plenty of malt up front, bringing continued smoky warmth and caramelised fruit with it.
Finish: White grape and icing sugar.
Nose: Peaches in syrup, lemon peel, a hint of earthy smoke.

Name: Octomore 10.2 8 Year Old
Palate: Honeyed cereal, juicy peach and pear. A kick of earthy peat gives it some salinity along the way.
Finish: Citrus zest returns, plus dried mango, meaty barley and red pepper flakes.
Nose: Charred lemons on a BBQ, fragrant malt and maple syrup on pancakes.

Name: Cambus 28 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Thereâs more vanilla - this time like freshly whipped ice cream - as well as white chocolate, French pastries and hazelnut butter before things move towards blackcurrants, firm oak and gingery spice.
Finish: There are some unctuous apricot-like fruits before the finish concludes on a slightly bitter and peppery note.
Nose: Gentle and welcoming, with creamy vanilla, Conference pear and fresh grass followed by crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e, waxy orange rind and a little rich marzipan.

Name: Nevis Dew Special Reserve
Palate: Balanced, toffee with oak, peat. Gentle fudge note.
Finish: Good length with toffee and oak.
Nose: Fragrant, quite rich. Malt and hints of smoke, a touch of peat with honey and spice.

Name: The Gauldrons Sherry Edition
Palate: Sultana, nutmeg, earthy smoke, damson, black pepper.
Finish: Milk chocolate, savoury smokiness lingering.
Nose: Toasted marshmallow, oatcake, toffee apple, and cinnamon.

Name: Dumbarton Rock Blended Malt Whisky
Palate: Cooked orchard fruits, chocolate raisins, and fruit-studded tea loaf are joined by a gentle dose of baking spice.
Finish: The spices develop toward the finish bringing a touch of gingery warmth.
Nose: Vanilla fudge and creamy milk chocolate lead the way, with buttery oak and cake batter in tow.

Name: The Glenturret Triple Wood (2022 Release)
Palate: Candied ginger, dark chocolate with leathery oak, and malted milk biscuits. A touch of treacle and peppery spice begin to build.
Finish: Barley sugar sweeties, a sprinkle of nutmeg, dried orange peel, and clove.
Nose: Juicy dried fruits with vanilla custard and sprinklings of spice, alongside hearty oak char.

Name: Springbank 10 Year Old - Pedro XimÃ©nez Sherry Cask Matured
Palate: Sticky, sherry-soaked fruits, alpine herbs, drizzles of treacle, and smouldering campfire.
Finish: Sweet tobacco with peppery spice.
Nose: Fudgy dates, fruitcake, dried fruits, faint smoke, and earthy forest floor.

Name: Linkwood 25 Year Old 1997 (casks 7572 & 7573) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Warm charred oak, with dollops of custard, stone fruit, and some salted caramel.
Finish: Pepper, allspice, and some oaky vanilla.
Nose: Some buttery pastry, with nutmeg, cinnamon, and some lemon peel.

Name: The Macallan No.6 in Lalique Decanter
Palate: Silky dried fruits, almost perfumed, with dark toasty notes and some warming ginger.
Finish: Figs and dark spices.
Nose: Fragrant red apple skin, orange peel, fruit cake, vanilla and redcurrant.

Name: Famous Grouse Sherry Cask Finish
Palate: Sweetly spiced biscuits lead, joined by stewed fruit and creamy malt. Toasted almonds follow, with shavings of dark chocolate.
Finish: Baking spices finish things up, with hearty barley and toffee in tow.
Nose: Warm candied nuts, biscuity malt, baked apples, and a sprinkling of cinnamon.

Name: Cardhu Gold Reserve
Palate: Fairly dry with biscuity oak and a little cinnamon as well as some development of those toffee and apple notes.
Finish: Gentle oak and (milk chocolate) caramel digestives.
Nose: Honeyed tinned stone fruits, toffees and a hint of strawberry with red apple and ginger coming through with a little water.

Name: Secret Islay 32 Year Old 1990 (cask 4367) - Field Trip Collection (Swell de Spirits)
Palate: More iodine notes, with orchard fruits, bonfires, and crumbly fudge.
Finish: Long and lingering, with smoke, toasted walnuts, and some citrus zest.
Nose: Medicine cabinets, with sweet barbecue smoke, and fragrant spices.

Name: The Macallan Sienna - 1824 Series
Palate: Raisins and dried apricots, ripe greengages, frozen currants.
Finish: Fruity and slightly spiced with a touch of anise.
Nose: Noticeably bigger than Gold and Amber, orange peel, vanilla sugar and hot cross buns.

Name: Glen Spey 32 Year Old 1989 - Edition No.80 (Whisky Sponge & Decadent Drinks)
Palate: Heaps of orchard fruit sweetness meets coconut freshness, caramel, and just a hint of spent matches.
Finish: Long and oh-so decadent.
Nose: Tinned peaches, floral honey, barley sugars, and vanilla.

Name: The Singleton of Glen Ord 18 Year Old (Special Release 2019)
Palate: Warming orange with a prickle of spice. Chocolate and caramel notes. Post-water it's sweeter and smoother, and first sip is still quite warming. Still spicy, but more orange and berry fruits.
Finish: Long finish, warming taste. Drying mouth feel. Post-water still a long finish, smooth and spicy on the tongue.
Nose: Orange peel and berry fruits. Post-water it's more fruity, with more orange coming through.

Name: Cambus 30 Year Old 1991 (cask 104230) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Runny honey, festive spice, stewed apple, and floral sweetness.
Finish: Roasted coffee and rounded oats.
Nose: Werther's Originals, cinnamon, citrus, and Weetabix.

Name: Wolfburn Coronation of King Charles
Palate: Dense layers of dates and dried fruits, toasted nuts, and cakey spice followed by oaken vanilla and butterscotch.
Finish: Maple and vanilla wrap things up sweetly, with elegant spice resting in the depths.
Nose: Orchard blossom and poached stone fruits with a drizzle of syrup, backed by delicate oak char and biscuity malt.

Name: Glenrothes 13 Year Old 2009 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: More patisserie notes, with the crisp buttery pastry and creamy custard of a pastel de nata, chased by a peppering of gingersnap biscuits.
Finish: Rich, sweet malt brings notes of simnel cake and toasted marzipan, while warming spice tickles at the edges.
Nose: Cinnamon swirls with dustings of cinnamon sugar. Toasted sourdough with butter and honey, bubbling caramel, and juicy raisins.

Name: Glenrothes 20 Year Old 1997 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Soft and fruity to begin, with apple and fresh peach. Spices soon set in with peppercorns, a touch of nutmeg, and stewed floral tea. Drying oak is countered by silky butterscotch and vanilla, with biscuit/caramel notes of Millionaire's Shortbread.
Finish: Sweet and spicy. Honeyed stone fruits, dark chocolate caramel, and boiled apple sweeties cushion dense oak, prickles of fiery pepper, dried chilli, and ginger.
Nose: Clotted cream and vanilla custard, cooked apples, fresh pear, and buttery pastry. Sweet malt and cedar develop in time, joined by plump sultanas, milk chocolate, and a touch of wood polish.

Name: Ardnamurchan AD/09.22 Cask Strength
Palate: Coastal peat, with ripe summer berries, warm oak, and gentle, peppery spice.
Finish: The peat lingers, with gentle seaweed salinity.
Nose: Waves of maritime smoke, with oaky vanilla, and lemon zest.

Name: Jack and Victor Blended Whisky
Palate: Cakey vanilla and cooked apricot, the subtle smoke still sticking around.
Finish: Walnut, freshly sawn oak, orange zest.
Nose: Rounded barley notes, dotted with whiffs of peat smoke and honey.

Name: Millstone 4 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Chocolatey malt, milky coffee and a touch of orange peel combine with hints of toffee and cooked apples with cinnamon and nutmeg.
Finish: Dark fruits and chocolate lingers.
Nose: Dried fruit, furniture polish and brown sugar initially, with notes of orange blossom, garden herbs, Christmas Cake and Pinot Noir in the backdrop.

Name: Ardbeg Galileo
Palate: When the Ardbeg smoke clears the first step is salty, before cream and dried apricots land.
Finish: The finish is soft and sweet, with earthy smoke swirling about.
Nose: Pineapple slices and desiccated coconut rocket out of the glass followed by toffee and spice, finally there is a big phenolic launch-pad of peat.

Name: Miyagikyo Peated (bottled 2021) - Nikka Discovery
Palate: Distinguished and dynamic. The attack is just as exotic, while also revealing both honeyed and floral notes. As for the peat, it finesses itself into every nook and cranny. Covered in a fine layer of ash, the mid-palate is deeply rooty allowing the expression of a refreshing minerality.
Finish: Long and well-balanced. At the start of the finish, a chocolate, vanilla and spicy peat takes centre-stage. Tangy flavours of ripe fruit slowly spread across the taste buds. The empty glass precisely replicates the aromas of cigar, wildflowers and black liquorice.
Nose: Rich and complex. Subtle notes of toast, dry peat and twigs highlight the distinguished character of the first nose. Allowed to breathe, the peat becomes more intense, almost meatier while simultaneously taking on a light veil of smoke. In the climax, exotic fruit and fresh fig bring lots of breadth and energy to the palette of aromas.

Name: Hazelburn 21 Year Old
Palate: Toasted marzipan opens the way for sweet dried apricot and flaky almond croissants, with more warming ginger poking through.
Finish: A dash of bitter cocoa with dried cherries followed by distant wafts of wood polish and clove.
Nose: Sticky treacle and sugared dates, chocolate raisins with mixed nuts, and crumbled ginger biscuits.

Name: Wolfburn 7 Year Old Cask Strength - 2022 Release
Palate: Hazelnuts and stewed, spiced fruits with syrupy sponge cake lead the way before elegant whispers of peat smoke creep in.
Finish: Chewy toffee and burnt sugar keep things sweet at the end, while the peat tails off delicately.
Nose: Buttered popcorn, oaken vanilla, and sweet, sherried fruits are followed by creamy butterscotch.

Name: Blair Athol 7 Year Old 2014 (cask 7035) - The Whisky Cellar
Palate: Robustly malty notes abound, with strawberry, milk chocolate, and a hint of new leather.
Finish: Oaky on the finish, with red liquorice sweetness in contrast.
Nose: Cinnamon and nutmeg spiciness, with a layer of raspberry and damson.

Name: Ardmore 18 Year Old 2003 (cask 15228) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Figs and prunes bring some sweetness with a good helping of peat smoke followed by nutmeg and citrus zest.
Finish: Warming ginger and honey linger alongside smoked spice and peppery oak.
Nose: Charcoal embers and toasted oak mingle with robust barley and a hint of heather.

Name: Craigellachie 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 2340) - Infrequent Flyers (Alistair Walker)
Palate: Sweet pastries, frangipane, dried fruits, and cinnamon and nutmeg spice.
Finish: Dark caramel, and some warm spices.
Nose: Charcuterie, with woody spice, and soft oak.

Name: Tormore 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 8003 & 8004) - Dalgety (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Chocolate fudge, floral citrus, and fruit and nut chocolate.
Finish: Buttery brioche and peanut brittle.
Nose: Marmalade, candied nuts, and buttered white bread.

Name: Masthouse Grain Whisky
Palate: Vanilla shortbread, nutty brown bread, mint creams, and earthy spices.
Finish: Soft, creamy vanilla, and herbal rye spices.
Nose: Toasted nuts, cinnamon porridge, and light biscuity sweetness.

Name: Bowmore 27 Year Old - Timeless Series
Palate: Sweet with chestnut honey and strong beeâs wax, fresh leather and Montecristo cigar tobacco, roasted coffee beans and dark chocolate with a hint of oak tannins.
Finish: Long with scented burnt wood notes, dry fruits and a touch of frankincense.
Nose: Fruity cooked plums and prune jam. Corinth raisins and sultana notes with a strong Oloroso influence. Toffee and maple syrup, liquorice, grilled orange peel and smoked seaweed.

Name: Glen Elgin 16 Year Old 2006 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: A glorious dollop of clotted cream counters fragrant green peppercorns, silky honey, and syrupy fruit suggestions of boiled sweeties. Peaches and cream.
Finish: Sweet shop notes linger with chalk candies and barley sugars. Things remain creamy with coatings of vanilla, and beneath, delicate woody spice hovers in perfect harmony.
Nose: Zesty, creamy notes of lemon posset and yellow plum. Buttery madeleines, flaked almond, and sweet key lime pie with a ginger snap base.

Name: Staoisha 2013 (cask 10520) (bottled 2022) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Hearty roasted barley keeps things nutty, with layers of charred sugar and peat smoke. Banana chips follow, tangling with peppery spice and a delicate violet.
Finish: Vegetal peat lingers, alongside spiced tea loaf, a crunch of brown sugar, and anise.
Nose: Quite coastal with salty smoke and floral malt. A touch of vanilla and earthy roasted nuts creep in.

Name: Ledaig 13 Year Old 2005 - Single & Single
Palate: More sea salted caramel, with melted dark chocolate and burnt treacle toffee.
Finish: Charred herbs alongside peppery oak.
Nose: Marshmallows on a campfire, with hints of salted caramel and oak char.

Name: Blair Athol 14 Year Old 2008 - Bodega Series (Goldfinch Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Apricot jam and soaked berries lead to chocolate-coated nuts, a touch of anise, and soft gingerbread.
Finish: Fruits and spices mingle with generous helpings of juicy sultanas, vanilla, and citrus.
Nose: Fruity flapjack with poached peach, nutty oak, and spiced toffee.

Name: Midleton Barry Crockett Legacy
Palate: Sweet tobacco leaves and ceda, sugared peels, toffee, honey softness, vanilla and boiled sweets.
Finish: Very creamy and vanilla-rich, cinnamon and a little pear drop on the tail.
Nose: Soft, sweet notes of barley, floral honey, rosemary, citrus, cut hay, Summer meadows and toffee apples.

Name: Ballantine's 17 Year Old
Palate: Balanced. There are notes of cut herbs and a defined vegetal character. Fresh citrus and fudge. Touch of peat smoke.
Finish: Fruit, becomes dry.
Nose: Feinty. Smoke and a touch of mochaccino. There are some notes of leather and Madeira with a little chocolate.

Name: Secret Islay Distillery 10 Year Old 2012 (Masters of Malt)
Palate: Big dollops of vanilla cream tangle with briny, oily malt, and vibrant, herbaceous peat. Grilled apricot and more creaminess follow, backed by waves of peppery spray.
Finish: Superbly balanced, with fresh, doughy bread and butter pudding, elegant smoke, and buttery oak, backed by a sea spray and delicate spice.
Nose: Yellow fruits, juicy pear, doughy bread, and creamy suggestions of rusk biscuits. Oatcakes with salted butter follow, with a sweet touch of toasted marshmallow and sponge cake.

Name: Nikka Taketsuru 17 Year Old
Palate: Spicy and rounded with vanilla, blood orange and a little chocolate.
Finish: Medium-length, slightly bittersweet, oak, fruit and cocoa.
Nose: Fresh and fruity with fruit salad, berries, sultanas and some other dried fruit, vanilla, fragrant wood and honey.

Name: Linkwood 11 Year Old 2008 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Leading from the nose, but with a tuck shop element in tow - apple fizzy belts and sour apples, rhubarb and custard boiled sweets, getting into some tropical pineapple cubes.
Finish: Balancing bitter peels, honeyed oak and soft spice.
Nose: Breakfast-y with inviting orchard fruit, a touch of Farley's Rusks, and Oat So Simple (Apple & Blueberry). Gingernuts biscuits are in the vicinity.

Name: Balvenie Founder's Reserve 10 Year Old (1L)
Palate: Sweet and spicy with notes of lightly sherried peels and acacia honey.
Finish: Long and viscous with plenty of spice and sweetness.
Nose: Medium-bodied with notes of marmalade and rosewater, honey and spice with a gentle smoky note.

Name: Lochlea Harvest Edition First Crop
Palate: Summer berries and floral jam, with chocolate-dipped s'mores and drying herbs.
Finish: Maple granola, roasted almonds, vegetal malt, and vanilla.
Nose: Syrupy flapjack, honeyed apples, and fresh pear with a touch of hay in the distance.

Name: Annandale Man OâWords Vintage 2017 - S.T.R. Cask (cask 306)
Palate: Dark berries, creamy malt, oak char, and apple tart with cinnamon.
Finish: Soft winter spices and buttery pastries.
Nose: Buttered shortbread, prunes, apples, and oaky vanilla.

Name: Old Pulteney 10 Year Old Flotilla Vintage 2010
Palate: Vanilla ice cream, with crispy nori and warm spices building.
Finish: Drizzles of salted caramel linger, alongside peppery baking spices.
Nose: Fresh green oak, with singed toast, vanilla, and sprays of salinity.

Name: Tomintoul Pinot Noir Cask Finish
Palate: Dark chocolate, soft vanilla, juicy blackberries, and pepper.
Finish: Red fruit and baking spices.
Nose: Marzipan, oak, syrupy morellos, with hints of toasted coconut

Name: Tobermory 12 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Still packing plenty of fruit and malt, now with milk chocolate and desiccated coconut in the mix.
Finish: Drying baking spice warmth, plus toasted sesame seed and digestive biscuit.
Nose: Greengage, melon and honeyed porridge, with a whisper of aromatic, almost floral barley in there.

Name: Yamazaki Bourbon Barrel 2011 (48.2%)
Palate: Tropical like the Hakushu, with a predominance of creamy, sweet coconut milk, peach melba, rum spices and toasty oak.
Finish: Allspice, nutmeg and Nutella on the tail.
Nose: A perfumy, aromatic nose with lemon zest, heather honey and hazelnut. Hints of cinnamon, rose petal jelly and custard.

Name: Secret Speyside Distillery 24 Year Old 1998 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: A gentle start with vanilla cream and buttery flapjack soon develops into richly warming spice. Notes of Madeira cake, packed with sultanas, with dustings of fiery cinnamon warming the edges.
Finish: Juicy stewed apples, and dense, woody spice. Anise and clove are joined by herb-infused caramel, black pepper, plus a hint of liquorice, though sweet vanilla cream remains in play.
Nose: Fresh apples and a hint of drying hay before a big wave of creamy vanilla and soft, buttery barley. Fluffy pancakes, grilled peach, a delicate hint of marzipan.

Name: Bruichladdich 28 Year Old 1990 (Master of Malt)
Palate: That toasty coffee continues, joined by prunes, raisins, cinnamon, and a touch of woody clove. Jammy dark berries keep things sweet, while oaken spice develops in time.
Finish: Silky, bittersweet dark chocolate, baking spice, crÃ¨me de cassis, and spiced winter berries.
Nose: Warm chocolate soufflÃ©, drizzled with maraschino cherries and rich, dark forest fruits. Roasted coffee, juicy barley, and charred oak nestle beneath.

Name: Bunnahabhain Aonadh
Palate: Cherry, poached pear, a gentle whiff of sea salt and roasted almonds punctuating the fruity notes.
Finish: Slightly chocolatey, with the black pepper notes from the nose returning.
Nose: Dates and plums, with a dusting of cassia and black pepper. Subtle treacle tart richness in the background.

Name: GlenAllachie 14 Year Old 2008 (cask 190034) - Woodrow's of Edinburgh
Palate: Honeyed stone fruits, aged fruit cake, and zesty orange peels are backed by clove and resinous oak, with creamy vanilla beneath.
Finish: Red apples, plums, cocoa, and baking spices.
Nose: Sweet, cakey spice, brown sugar, and red fruits are joined by peach, stem ginger, and marzipan.

Name: Teaninich 12 Year Old 2009 (casks 717628 & 717632) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Fresh apples, pears, and orange blossom are backed up by chocolate walnuts and earthen malt.
Finish: More tangy citrus and a smidge of vegetal barley, runny honey, and spiced pear.
Nose: Flaky, buttery pastry and hazelnut latte, a touch of spicy oak, and floral citrus oil.

Name: Balblair 10 Year Old 2011 (cask 800130) - Explorations (The Single Cask)
Palate: Chewy malt, bittersweet cocoa, and plum skin.
Finish: Classic fruitcake flavours linger.
Nose: Juicy dried fruit, tart berries, golden syrup.

Name: MotÃ¶rhead Ace Of Spades Straight Bourbon Whisky
Palate: Oaky vanilla, dark fudge, cigar box, and dark chocolate.
Finish: Spicy cinnamon and peppery rye.
Nose: Cinnamon sugar, herbal rye, peppercorn spice, and mint chocolate.

Name: Kilchoman Feis Ile 2013 - Limited Cask Release
Palate: Boozy blueberry pancakes.
Finish: A touch of ice cream and peat on the finish.
Nose: Cookie dough, lime curd, custard. Fizzy apple sweets, cloudy lemonade.

Name: Bunnahabhain 2002 Madeira Cask Finish - FÃ¨is Ãle 2020
Palate: A layered complexity of sweet vanilla, caramelised fruit and rich spicy cinnamon packed with raisins and hints of dry oak.
Finish: A dry but warm finish, fading into a lingering sweet marmalade finish.
Nose: Sweet ripe figs, creamy berries and orange marmalade with hints of nutmeg.

Name: Laphroaig CÃ irdeas Warehouse 1 - FÃ¨is Ãle 2022
Palate: Full-bodied with vibrant aromas from nose to finish.
Finish: Peaty and acidic with lingering herbal and spicy notes leading to a floral aftertaste.
Nose: Peaty, sweet and nutty with âmedicinalâ notes. Strong vanilla cake, fudge, heather-honey, golden syrup, walnuts and nutmeg.

Name: Glen Scotia 12 Year Old Seasonal Release 2022
Palate: Toffee apples, apricot yogurt, ginger snaps, and creamy vanilla are joined by more coastal elements.
Finish: Creamy, nutty, and with drying spice.
Nose: Orange marmalade, salted caramel, and a hint of sandalwood as well as baking spices.

Name: J.J. Corry The Flintlock - Batch 3
Palate: Lemon cheesecake with a few blueberries and raspberries thrown in for good measure, plus layers of toffee and mint.
Finish: Cinnamon and ginger last.
Nose: Fresh florals, marzipan, grapefruit zest, white chocolate, anise, a touch of milky coffee.

Name: Lagavulin 12 Year Old (Special Release 2019)
Palate: Citrusy, spicy and smoky. Like taking a drag on your Grandadâs cigar. Intense ashes to start, smooth in texture with a warm finish. Being at natural strength allows the water to not diminish the character.
Finish: A nice warming sweet smoke with lemony tones. A dash of salt through the smoke.
Nose: Everything you would expect from the annual Lagavulin 12 Year Old. Sweet peat smoke like a recently extinguished bonfire accompanied by memories of sparklers on 5th November. Salty sea breeze, shellfish and seaweed. Tangy fruity aroma, like Bramley Apples ready for a homemade apple pie. Add a little water and you get freshly cut wet grass and autumn leaves after a downpour.

Name: Lindores Abbey Friar John Cor - The Cask Strength Congregation Batch - Chapter 1
Palate: Peaches and cream with dustings of cinnamon and citrus zest are accompanied by sticky dried prunes, dates, and figs. Waves of vanilla and honey ride throughout.
Finish: A touch of marzipan and honeyed almonds wrap things up, joined by cakey spice and buttery malt.
Nose: Buttery pastry, packed with honeyed apricot and crisp apple. Vanilla cream follows, joined by plump sultanas and more soft stone fruit.

Name: Aberlour 12 Year Old Non Chill-Filtered
Palate: Nutty, fruit and warming. More caramel, cinnamon, nutmeg and plenty of entertaining fruit notes.
Finish: Dark chocolate returns for the long finish.
Nose: Rich fig, raisin and caramel. Soft, warm apples and a very light sprinkle of dark chocolate flakes.

Name: Peat (Pure Islay) - Elements Of Islay
Palate: Mineral-y at first, with sweet orange and white chocolate notes developing. Peat smoke remains a constant feature.
Finish: A lingering notes of sea salt and malt.
Nose: Waves of coastal smoke, with hints of fresh lemon and caramel underneath.

Name: Campbeltown Journey Blended Malt - Journey Series (Hunter Laing)
Palate: Vanilla pod, blackberry compote, and rose petals drizzled in salted caramel.
Finish: Bright orange oil zestiness, paired with chocolatey malt and raspberry.
Nose: Cardamom and cinnamon prickle through toasted oak, earthy vanilla, and dried fruit.

Name: Bowmore 21 Year Old Aston Martin - Masters' Selection
Palate: Richly elegant sherry merges with raw Islay peat, whilst bitter dark chocolate unites with vanilla and coffee beans. A fruity flair is defined by Morello cherries and a touch of papaya.
Finish: Sweet, spicy and mouth warming, with notes of oak spices, chestnut cream and coconut lingering.
Nose: Sweet and nutty with notes of Manuka honey and maple syrup, with praline and grilled hazelnuts; combine with rich aromas of freshly tanned leather.

Name: Glen Moray Port Cask Gift Pack with 2x Glasses
Palate: Butterscotch candies, golden barley and a touch of cinnamon. The port cask influence comes through with light notes of raisins and freshly picked red berries.
Finish: Rather long, with honey, vanilla and a dusting of cocoa.
Nose: Creamy vanilla at the fore, joined by jammy redcurrants and blackberry. Toasted oak touches in the background.

Name: Glenmorangie 1993 Truffle Oak Reserve
Palate: Very oaky, with notes of tropical fruit, vanilla, charcoal, rum and raisin ice-cream, cookie dough and honey.
Finish: Long and buttery with notes of pannacotta and cookie dough ice-cream.
Nose: Spicy and intense with notes of stem ginger, black pepper, manuka honey and smoked meat. Very interesting and unusual for Glenmorangie, but with plenty of that house creamy sweetness.

Name: Gold Spot 9 Year Old
Palate: Superbly soft, with delicate stone fruits balancing woody spice and whisps of cinnamon. Buttery vanilla joins, with gentle zest and toasty baked almonds.
Finish: A glorious harmony of pineapple and baked apples, peppercorns, and rich oak.
Nose: Candied tropical fruits, juicy melon, and zesty lime, with nutty oak and spiced orchard fruits in tow.

Name: Laphroaig 10 Year Old Cask Strength - Batch 014
Palate: Honeyed cereals, sea salt, Sesame Snaps, cigar box, dense peat smoke, cinnamon and nutmeg.
Finish: Lasting salinity, juxtaposed with vanilla and caramel.
Nose: Roasted oak, iodine, thick waves of toffee, coffee cake, and a hint of grass.

Name: Teaninich 12 Year Old 2010 (cask 721589) - Lady of the Glen (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Cooked apple, blackberries, allspice, silky vanilla, and some star anise.
Finish: Peppery spices linger, with some juicy redcurrants.
Nose: Layers of red fruit, with apple crumble, woody spices, and some thyme.

Name: Bowmore Darkest (Old Bottling)
Palate: Oaky and malty. Hazelnut, barley, toffee apples, spices, Oloroso sherry. Hints of rum spice, aniseed and granary toast with melted salty butter.
Finish: Long, rum spices, nutmeg, cinnamon. Salt caramels.
Nose: Perfumed, salty, notes of Oloroso sherry, peat smoke, blackcurrants and aniseed. Nutty, floral.

Name: Tamdhu 7 Year Old 2014 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Hot cross buns with plenty of sweet spice and candied fruit are bolstered by nutty caramel, robust barley, and gingerbread.
Finish: Sugared almonds, cinnamon snaps, chocolate brazil nuts, and mellow oak.
Nose: Toasty notes of maple syrup and caramelised pecan, with sweet cinnamon sugar and a dusting of nutmeg.

Name: Amrut Single Malt Cask Strength Whisky
Palate: Biscuit and fruit, citrus, malt perks up now, slightly tarry, toffee.
Finish: Apricot, spicy, blackcurrant tea. Sweetness.
Nose: Biscuity, fruity, fig-rolls, herbal, Werther's Originals, almost pepperminty.

Name: Braes of Glenlivet 30 Year Old - Derestricted
Palate: Perfumed malt, brown sugar, pencil shavings, tangy pineapple and mango, honey, a touch of black tea.
Finish: Lots of tropical fruit notes stick around on the finish, with a little sultana and candied ginger too.
Nose: Fresh linen, white grapes, coffee beans leading into softly spicy oak, linseed, coconut ice, apricot jam, gingerbread.

Name: Teaninich 8 Year Old (Release 4) - Concept 8
Palate: A big hit of malt and earthen oak, with stewed orchard fruit and walnut bread.
Finish: Chocolate nuts, buttery pastry a touch of spice, and lemony zest.
Nose: Sugared lemon drizzle cake and milky coffee, with almond syrup.

Name: Four Walls Cask Strength Single Barrel 15 Year Old
Palate: Rich and complex layers of honey, vanilla custard, and dried fruit mingle with baking spice and a bold pop of alcohol that balances the multi-dimensional sip enveloped in a rich, creamy viscosity.
Finish: Long, lingering, and warming with a viscous delivery revealing gentle baking spice, leather, menthol, and a hint of chocolate.
Nose: Malty cereal, baking spice, and leathery notes mingle with creamy nut butter, a hint of chocolate, and a thick slice of alcohol-soaked fruit cake.

Name: Strathclyde 35 Year Old 1987 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Buttery caramel coats the palate, with generous layers of creamy vanilla gushing behind. Butter biscuits and brioche join, while woody spice nestles in the depths.
Finish: Candied ginger brings warming touch, with caramelised stone fruits and roasted walnuts, rich oak, and vanilla buttercream.
Nose: Slightly tangy underripe plums open the way before creamier notes of apricot and buttery pastry take hold. Fruity banana bread, mellow oak, and zesty candied orange.

Name: Glenlossie 27 Year Old 1993 (cask 3650) - Celebration of the Cask (CÃ rn MÃ²r)
Palate: Peppercorn and honey as it opens up, leading into more tropical fruit and a hint of menthol.
Finish: Honeyed cereals and macadamia nuts.
Nose: Slightly floral malt, dusty oak, mango, a touch of fresh linen.

Name: Glasgow 1770 - Golden Beer Cask Finish
Palate: A medley of vanilla, stewed forest fruits, and caramel are followed by juicy barley, candied pecans, and toasted oak.
Finish: Hints of herbaceous hops bring a dry, gently bitter finish, balanced by butterscotch and more oaken vanilla.
Nose: Toasted nuts, malted biscuits, melted toffee, and distant hops.

Name: Annandale Man OâWords Vintage 2016 - Bourbon Cask (cask 96)
Palate: Oaky vanilla, some poached apple, and more warm spices.
Finish: Spicy and moreish.
Nose: Creamy malt, ginger, cloves, allspice, and floral honey.

Name: Glen Elgin 14 Year Old 2008 (cask 3010) - Floc de Gascogne Barrique Finish (Pintail)
Palate: Dark plums and cherries join salted almonds, while warming nutmeg and gently smoked spices gather in the depths.
Finish: More berries and cherries bring a fruity finish, with hints of tobacco, oak char, and woody spice.
Nose: Sweet notes of dried red berries, marzipan, and floral honey, with aromatic peppercorns nestling beneath.

Name: Monkey Shoulder Smokey Monkey
Palate: Vanilla sits at the core, its earthy notes bolstered by the peat running alongside it. Still enjoyably fruity.
Finish: Toffee Crisp bars and the last wafts of drying smoke.
Nose: Honeydew melon, flamed orange peel, a touch of Frazzles.

Name: Isle of Raasay Single Malt
Palate: Pebbly minerality with crisp peat smoke, sweet, dark caramel, and biscuity malt. Creamy oak and peppery barley tangle beneath.
Finish: Just a subtle whiff of smoke on the finish, cushioned by salted nuts, chewy butterscotch, and sweet oak char.
Nose: Baked plums, red apples, and cherries lead to drying wood smoke with earthy vanilla and a hint of flint.

Name: Ardmore 17 Year Old 2003 (cask 801285) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Malty, mineral peat, salted popcorn, caramel, vanilla, floral orange, and poached pear.
Finish: Lingering smoke and charred oak with a herbal zest, sweet vanilla and ginger spice.
Nose: Grassy peat smoke with a whiff of dried fruits and sweet caramelised peanuts.

Name: Bunnahabhain 26 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Cooked orchard fruit, more fragrant barley, dark chocolate with a sprinkle of sea salt.
Finish: Softly peppery, the oak notes building, mellowed by malt.
Nose: Juicy citrus and fields of barley, with a whisper of earthy oak.

Name: Ardnamurchan 6 Year Old 2016 (cask 911) - James Eadie
Palate: Rich and smoky, with vegetal peat and roasted barley supported by zesty citrus peels.
Finish: A touch of sweet pear joins for the finish, with plumes of smoky coastal character lingering.
Nose: Waves of salty, coastal breeze, tar, and seaweed are followed by smoked nuts and meaty malt.

Name: Mortlach 10 Year Old 2012 - Notable Age Statements (Decadent Drinks)
Palate: Stewed blackberries and plums join robust malt, with chocolate-coated coffee beans and praline cushioning woody spice.
Finish: A big bold finish with more earthy coffee and spice, sprinkles of cacao, and maple syrup.
Nose: Huge helpings of sticky sherried fruit and dense, leathery oak, with aged fruit cake and a touch of cured meat.

Name: Highland Park Cask Strength - Release No.1
Palate: Ginger, nutmeg, heather honey, apricot and orange oil. Continued smoke builds, introducing earthy spices later on.
Finish: Warming peppery notes and a lingering hint of caramelised nuts.
Nose: Wafts of sweet peat and brown sugar simmering in a pan, with jammy sultana and buttered crumpet in the background.

Name: Akashi Red
Palate: Brown sugar, with ginger biscuits, milk chocolate, and dried apricot.
Finish: Oaky vanilla and lingering pepper.
Nose: Sweet cereal notes, along with some candied citrus, peaches, and woody spices.

Name: Glendalough Double Barrel Irish Whiskey
Palate: Succulent caramel, salty melted butter and crÃ¨me anglaise provide a thick, decadent sweetness with a fruity underlay from blackberries and marmalade.
Finish: Polished oak and a hint of wood spice linger.
Nose: A creamy, malty nose begins with rich vanilla, white chocolate and buttery fudge. Notes of cooking apples, white grapes, marzipan icing and toasted oak form in the backdrop.

Name: Never Say Die Barrel Strength Whiskey (Barrel No. 2)
Palate: Elegant spices emerge with warming cinnamon leading the way. A prickle of pepper is tamed by silky layers of toffee and oaken vanilla.
Finish: Mellow oak and bold spice linger, with a touch of rye heat softened by sweet butterscotch.
Nose: Buttery oak and runny caramel, with wafts of floral vanilla and a dusting of nutmeg.

Name: Ben Nevis 21 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: There are more rich, unctuous sweet notes from dark fruit jam, salted caramel and buttery biscuit. A flash of tropical fruit sharpness and a pinch of cumin providing some heat and complexity.
Finish: Dense malt and dark chocolate.
Nose: Thick, luscious toffee at first, followed by stewed fruits, caramelised pecans and candied peels. Itâs enjoyably chocolatey throughout, with some savoury notes of salted rye crackers to balance the sweetness.

Name: Fuyu Whisky
Palate: Rounded orchard fruit sweetness comes up against savoury grains and subtle nutmeg warmth.
Finish: Dusty oak and earthy vanilla pod.
Nose: Greengages, sandalwood, a touch of earthy peat followed by slowly developing hints of buttered rye.

Name: Inchgower 25 Year Old 1995 (cask 14183) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Lots of spices (cinnamon, nutmeg) running to vanilla essence and stewed fruits.
Finish: Long â detect golden syrup, a slight floral character, milk chocolate and barley.
Nose: Sweet and barley-rich initially, then comes tangerines, brown sugar and a damp oak style.

Name: Deanston 12 Year Old 2008 Oloroso Cask Matured
Palate: Thick honey and more chocolate, now with plum, liquorice, orange oil, and underpinning malty notes.
Finish: A lasting sweetness of sultana and toffee.
Nose: Spiced hot chocolate and sun-dried raisins, with a pinch of aromatic sawdust sneaking in underneath the sweetness.

Name: A Secret Irish Distillery 15 Year Old 2003 (Master of Malt)
Palate: Thick-cut marmalade and fresh lemon zest are countered by chocolate buttons and delicate hints of cream soda, with hints of allspice developing.
Finish: Praline and more of those fresh stone fruits from the nose, joined by plum jam and earthy walnuts.
Nose: Awash with soft peaches and apricots, juicy nectarines, and fresh pressed pears. Toasted oak brings creamy vanilla with hints of herbaceous malt in tow.

Name: Bunnahabhain An Cladach
Palate: Raisin, more cherry, black pepper and clove. A touch of walnut.
Finish: Medium length with sherried malt in charge.
Nose: Almond and cherry, fruity coffee, a hint of damp oak.

Name: Kilchoman Casado 2022 Release
Palate: Black pepper is cracked over smoked fish as well as lemon peel, tannic wood, and stone fruits. There's a sweet jammy element present throughout.
Finish: Aromatic spice and red berry tartness linger.
Nose: Bonfire smoke with dried apricot, Dr. Pepper, and some coastal salinity as well notes of marzipan and toffee apples underneath.

Name: Cragganmore 2008 (bottled 2020) Port Wood Finish - Distillers Edition
Palate: Hickory, honeycomb, walnut, waxy orange, red apple, and blackberry.
Finish: Lingering salinity and a hint of chocolate truffle.
Nose: Roast chestnuts, redcurrants, strawberries, a touch of smoked meats.

Name: Glenrothes 24 Year Old 1996 (cask 3144 & 3145) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Unctuous and rich with plenty of spice and vanilla.
Finish: Long and contemplative.
Nose: Fruitcake and spice.

Name: Tullibardine 2008 (bottled 2021) - The Murray Cask Strength
Palate: More citrus zest and buttery pastry, butterscotch and popcorn, with a prickle of peppercorn creeping.
Finish: Oak spice and citrus continue with zesty malt and creamy caramel lingering.
Nose: A hint of orchard blossom, creamy vanilla, custard tart, a touch of lemon.

Name: Clove-Studded Oranges 25 Year Old 1996 - Wemyss Malts (Glenrothes)
Palate: Sherry sweetness with dried vine fruits, oily citrus peel, dark brown sugar, cloves, and warming cinnamon.
Finish: The dried fruits linger, alongside warming spices and, yes, clove-studded oranges.
Nose: Sticky marmalade, with sherry soaked raisins and warm baking spices.

Name: Arran Machrie Moor Cask Strength
Palate: Lime peel and pineapple, punchy peppercorn and nutmeg, a touch of cask char.
Finish: Toasted barley and cacao.
Nose: Bonfire embers and coastal air, balanced by waves of juicy mango and kiwi.

Name: Scallywag The Chocolate Edition 2022
Palate: Silky layers of sherried fruits, cakey spice, and huge malted chocolate character with burnt toffee and dark chocolate Brazil nuts.
Finish: Lingering notes of indulgent fondant, still nutty, with praline and fruitcake lasting.
Nose: Definitely chocolatey with wafts of chocolate milk, and bittersweet cacao followed by nutty caramel and candied biscuits.

Name: Glencadam 13 Year Old 2008 RÃ©serve de Sauternes
Palate: Spun sugar, cheesecake, just a hint of crushed peppercorn, apricot and nectarine.
Finish: Some strawberry sweetness appears on the finish.
Nose: Sugared almonds, hay, candied orange, a dusting of cinnamon.

Name: Auchentoshan Blood Oak (1L)
Palate: Some classic red-wine spiciness starts to ramp up on the palate, with a little bit of Christmas-y clove. Citrus sits in the background.
Finish: Spicy and drying on the finish.
Nose: Juicy and rich with elegant wine notes, joined by a touch of golden barley.

Name: Arran 18 Year Old
Palate: Vanilla rice pudding and brown sugar, with orange blossom, allspice and candied ginger.
Finish: Lots of melted chocolate appears, with citrus peel and bread and butter pudding.
Nose: Syrupy peaches, green apple and toasty oak.

Name: The Macallan Amber - 1824 Series
Palate: Surprisingly thick and fruity compared to the nose. Golden sultanas, dates, apple peelings and a dusting of cinnamon. Cereal notes on the mid-palate, joined by mince pies with crumbly shortbread.
Finish: Fragrant oak finish, with the mince pie notes lingering.
Nose: Soft aromatic vanilla, lemon and barley with hints of ginger. Milk chocolate buttons and hints of Sun-Maid Raisins.

Name: anCnoc 24 Year Old
Palate: Rich and citrus forward, think oodles of lemon peel and marmalade with creamy vanilla toffee and honeyed barley.
Finish: Old leather and tannic oak rounding it out with a hint of orange peel.
Nose: Christmas cake with a splash of lemon juice and vanilla custard.

Name: Cambus 25 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Cooked apple, brown sugar, maple syrup, a good touch of oily oak.
Finish: Baking spice, vanilla blossom, and more orchard fruit.
Nose: Vanilla sponge, jam tarts, and red chilli flake.

Name: Bell's 2000 Christmas Decanter
Palate: Quite smooth, medium body. Barley and cereals with nut oils, hints of wood and spice.
Finish: Short with notes of fruitcake and smoke.
Nose: Quite soft and gentle. Malted barley and hints of cut herbs and a fresh floral note. Cereal and grist with a little honey.

Name: Bivrost Helheim
Palate: Crumbly fudge, with some oaky char, peppery spices, and wafts of gentle smoke.
Finish: Distant peat, with some cloves, and crackers.
Nose: Oaky vanilla, porridge sprinkled with brown sugar, and a touch of allspice.

Name: Invergordon 34 Year Old 1988 (cask 804137) - Infrequent Flyers (Alistair Walker)
Palate: Madeira sponge, with layers of soft caramel, gorse flowers, and warm oaky spice.
Finish: Gentle spice, with crumbly fudge.
Nose: Honeycomb, toasted marzipan, oaky vanilla, and creamy oatcakes.

Name: Talisker 10 Year Old with Waterproof Dry Bag
Palate: It's a bonfire of peat crackling with black pepper, with a touch of brine and dry barley. A welcome delivery of orchard fruit provides a delicate and beautiful balance.
Finish: In a long finish, bonfire embers toast malt and crystallise a sugary underlay.
Nose: A fresh and fragrant nose. Through thick, pungent smoke comes sweet pear and apple peels, with pinches of maritime salt from kippers, seaweed.

Name: Tobermory 17 Year Old 2003 Madeira Cask Finish
Palate: Nutty malt and maple syrup are balanced by creamy pastel de nata, leading to zesty peels and juicy sultanas. Warming root ginger rests beneath.
Finish: Stewed prunes and raisins soften prickles of pepper, with aromatic baking spices and distant leather towards the end.
Nose: Sweet, clove-studded orange, oily oak, and wafts of floral tea, with layers of gloopy toffee and clotted cream.

Name: The Macallan 12 Year Old Fine Oak
Palate: Good sherried malt in here, rich and sweet with plump raisins. Developing orange peel notes. Warm oak at the core.
Finish: Quite long with vanilla and sultana.
Nose: Nectarines, sugared almonds and vanilla toffee. Spicy oak and golden malt lend a good balance to the sweet opening notes.

Name: Peatside 6 Year Old 2014 - The Vatting (Murray McDavid) (2021 Release)
Palate: Sweet peat smoke with an oily mouthfeel, plenty of sherried fruit and oak spice.
Finish: Prickling smoked pepper, warming baking spice, and charred oak.
Nose: Smoky sea breeze, grilled pineapple, clotted cream, vanilla custard tarts.

Name: Linkwood 15 Year Old 2007 (cask 358022) - James Eadie
Palate: Floral honey, with spiced, poached orchards fruits, blackberries, and winter spices.
Finish: Clove and pepper build, with dried prunes.
Nose: A touch of juicy cherries and plums, with toasted almonds, and oaky vanilla.

Name: Cambus 29 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: Dried berries and candied fruits continue, with sweet notes of buttered corn bringing an oily texture. Fiery prickles of ginger and black pepper tangle with creamy butterscotch.
Finish: Yet more fresh sweetcorn, drowned in herby butter, with chocolate cereal and warming spices bubbling beneath.
Nose: Dried fruit granola with tangy cranberries and diced dates. Sweet wafts of chocolate raisins follow buttery shortbread, with a touch of pepper in the distance.

Name: For Peat's Sake
Palate: Peat jumps out on the palate, smoky and softly spicy. Caramel and grassy malt, with more candied fruit later on.
Finish: Quite short, with citrus peels and a final waft of smoke.
Nose: Brown sugar with a touch of toastiness to it, followed by some cherry drop and peach. A slow build of earthiness.

Name: Glenmorangie 1981 Sauternes Wood Finish
Palate: Caramelised bananas, orange marmalade and melted vanilla icecream. Hints of brandy, prune and dates.
Finish: Sparkling spicy oak, banana and vanilla. Beautiful.
Nose: Creamy and sweet nose, with notes of various berry fruits, and the jams thereof. Custard, stewed fruits and apple strudel. Huge vanilla notes.

Name: The Singleton of Glendullan Muscat Cask Finish - Master's Art
Palate: Toffee and milk chocolate, followed by another splash of orchard fruits.
Finish: A slight touch of orange oil and sponge cake.
Nose: Grassy malt and fresh pear, with zesty hints of juicy orange popping up every once in a while.

Name: James E. Pepper 3 Year Old - Pedro XimÃ©nez Cask Finish (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: New oak warmth and sherry-drenched dried fruit provide a balance between a toasted, dry mouthfeel and plenty of viscous and well-rounded sweetness. Notes of toffee popcorn, candied ginger and rye bread bring depth.
Finish: A light glaze of burnt honey remains.
Nose: Sweet dried fruit, cream sherry and a touch of peppermint initially, with orange peel, walnuts and dusty rye spice in support.

Name: Elvis The King Straight Rye Whiskey
Palate: A balance of rye spice and toasted oak bring hints of cracked pepper and delicate vanilla, with a touch of sawdust in tow.
Finish: Spices linger with prickles of chilli, ginger, and drying oak.
Nose: Liquorice is joined by herbal notes of pine, menthol, and peppery oak.

Name: Glen Keith 28 Year Old 1993 - Connoisseurs Choice (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Strawberry jam sandwiches, white pepper, a touch of forest floor.
Finish: More earthy notes linger, with a hint of pineapple too.
Nose: Buttery blueberry pancakes, with a smidge of white chocolate and hazelnut.

Name: Port Charlotte 14 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Dark and rich notes from chocolate, black fruits and oak char are tempered by lively winter spices and a thick helping of sweet treacle. Phenol notes are prominent throughout.
Finish: A hint of rhubarb and a flicker of peppery spice emerge with time.
Nose: Ripe apples, butterscotch and drying ginger complement plenty of oak-y smoke and salty sea air. In the backdrop thereâs plenty of minerality and a touch of polished leather.

Name: Jura 20 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Honey-drenched orchard fruits, sweet honey and toasted almonds, then baking spice and coastal elements.
Finish: Buttered brown bread and orange oil.
Nose: Rock pools, lemon peel and a little gingerbread, with notes of dried grass, tropical fruit and vanilla.

Name: Orkney 14 Year Old 2007 - The Kilnsman's Dram
Palate: A whiff of savoury smoke, followed by raisin cookies and black pepper.
Finish: Spicy oak, dried fruit, and aromatic smoke linger.
Nose: Dried seaweed, cooked plum, candied ginger, and apple tart.

Name: Linkwood 12 Year Old 2010 (cask 9067) - The Whisky Cellar
Palate: Fruity flapjack and set honey lead to creamy malt, caramel, and layers of tropical fruit salad.
Finish: A touch of root ginger and woody clove, backed by cooked apricot, dried orange wheels, and chocolate raisins.
Nose: Juicy apricot, plump sultanas, and dried mango are joined by toasted marzipan and vanilla fudge.

Name: Ledaig 19 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Chilli spice, black peppercorns, an earthier peatiness this time. Roast pork sausages with a smoky apple sauce, a malty element, and some rich 90% cocoa dark chocolate for good measure.
Finish: All about the leathery peat smoke and a sweet chilli kick.
Nose: Classic Ledaig â all roadworks, smoky bacon, peppercorn sauce, chamois leather and metallic peat, but also some aromatic lemon zest and a floral airiness, too.

Name: Tobermory 14 Year Old 1995 - Murray McDavid
Palate: Lemon and tangerine sharpness, tropical banana, fruity melon and pear with a scattering of vanilla pod.
Finish: A creamy praline finish.
Nose: Barley sugar, citrus and vanilla custard.

Name: Port Charlotte PC12 Oilenach Furachail
Palate: Mouthcoating smoked dates, poached pear, lemon curd, brown sugar and porridge.
Finish: Malt loaf and plum wine.
Nose: Rounded nutty smoke, citrus, blueberry, old fashioned sweets and honeycomb.

Name: Tomatin 15 Year Old 2006 (cask 17601408) - Connoisseurs Choice (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Cooked orchard fruits balance hints of herbal malt while creamy vanilla coats the palate. Flaky fruit pastries and drying oak spice lead to prickles of pepper and ginger.
Finish: Tannic oak, with candied nuts and spiced currant buns in tow, lifted by vibrant citrus and lingering stewed fruits.
Nose: Buttery barley and crisp green apples open the way for floral honey and fleshy pear.

Name: Japanese Blended Whisky #1 21 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: A ripe and refined mix of red and black fruits initially, followed by cherry cola, dried orange peel and creamy fudge. Nutty oak, exotic honey and bittersweet herbs develop, alongside winter spice and cherry blossom.
Finish: Dried mint and thyme linger among salty butter and resinous sherry notes.
Nose: Plenty of sherried funk at first, with hazelnut, dark chocolate, ripe blackcurrants, soft peaches and Christmas pudding. Lean gamey savouriness and a touch of spent firework keeps things interesting. A powerful hit of warm out of the oven gingerbread is joined in the backdrop by sweet tobacco, waxy leather and browning apples.

Name: Springbank 28 Year Old 1993 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: A spicy start with dense, drying oak bringing notes of tobacco, dried fruit, stewed tea, and nuts. Tinned peaches and cream follow, with the cherry almond flavours of Bakewell Tart.
Finish: More drying spice, black tea, leathery old oak, and candied pineapple, are joined by bittersweet marmalade, and softer notes of blueberry porridge with warm syrup.
Nose: Plum syrup, blueberries, and a touch of beeswax lead to leather and orange oil. Vanilla shortbread, roasted nuts, and distant brine develop in time.

Name: Glen Garioch 18 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: A warming core of richly roasted malt leads to woody spice and dark forest fruits. Plums and cherries build, with hints of dates and clove in the distance.
Finish: Bittersweet cacao tangles with the drying oak spice, with lasting notes of dark cherries and berries.
Nose: Chocolate hazelnuts, sweet prunes, and fragrant tobacco open the way for juicy raisins and bold, spicy barley.

Name: The Macallan Easter Elchies Black â 2020 Release
Palate: Warming ginger and cinnamon, polished oak, smoked orange peel and an herbal whisper.
Finish: Sweet and smoky, peat lingers with cardamom chocolate creaminess.
Nose: Smoked toffee, orange, raisin and oak spice with an aniseed and sweet ginger warmth, walnuts, and a gentle herbal note.

Name: Oban 12 Year Old (Special Release 2021)
Palate: really gets up your nose with Szechuan pepper and cloves, but then the spice fades and fruit and subtle vanilla notes come through.
Finish: Long and creamy with a note of custard.
Nose: Quite restrained, subtly maritime with distant smoke, seaweed and iodine.

Name: Mannochmore 11 Year Old 2010 â The Rising Sun (James Eadie)
Palate: Brown sugar, peppercorn, clementine, buttered crumpets.
Finish: Grassy malt gives it a fresh feel on the finish.
Nose: Bright fruit sweetness, with hints of roughly chopped herbs and freshly baked rye bread.

Name: Auchroisk 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 801419) - Auld Goonsy's Malt
Palate: Buttered fruit scones, creamy barley with a scattering of citrus peels and zingy ginger.
Finish: Apple crumble with a good helping of prickly ginger, soft vanilla cream.
Nose: Crunchy honey biscuits, fragrant baking spices, roasted peanuts with wafts of vanilla caramel.

Name: Strathclyde 31 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Somewhat oily, with more floral honey, cereal notes, drying oak spice and hints of candied citrus peel alongside vanilla pod.
Finish: A creamy finish of banana milkshake, with lingering notes of white pepper spice and butterscotch sweetness.
Nose: Initially super light and tropical, with lots of pineapple and banana, a hint of vanilla ice cream and a drizzle of honey develops with a flint-y mineral backdrop.

Name: Mortlach 19 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
Palate: Citrus zests, bittersweet oak, cinnamon, tonic water, honey and sweetened lattes with nutmeg.
Finish: A long, malty finish.
Nose: Vanilla, spices, coffee, peppermint, star anise and cinnamon on the nose (it's delicious basically), with a little wine gum and toffee apple character.

Name: Penderyn 6 Year Old 2012 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: A vibrant display of more yellow stone fruits, peaches and cream, honeyed figs, and sweet vanilla fudge, followed by blueberry muffins and stewed summer fruits.
Finish: Those blueberry notes keep going, accompanied by suggestions of fluffy pancakes and maple syrup. Milk chocolate, more funky fermented fruit, milky coffee, and biscotti.
Nose: Wow, it's fruity! Poached apricot, cooked yellow plum, freeze-dried berries, and peach bring those fermented notes of barrel-aged Belgian beer, with boozy sultanas, Madeira cake, and ground almonds.

Name: Glen Ord 12 Year Old 2007 - Mey Selections
Palate: Baking spices appear alongside winter fruit crumble and vanilla cream, with an oily nuttiness.
Finish: Ginger spice continues onto the finish, accompanied by sweet malt.
Nose: Waxy peel and barley sugar, with grape skin and crÃ¨me caramel.

Name: Glenmorangie 18 Year Old Extremely Rare (without Presentation Box)
Palate: The palate is tropical and creamy with nectarines in yoghurt, acacia honey, peaches in cream and butterscotch.
Finish: Ends on tangy oak and grilled grapefruit with plenty of dark sugar caramelised on topâ¦
Nose: Creamy and tangy notes of citrus, cinnamon, stewed fruits and caramel-drizzled pannacotta.

Name: Ardbeg Alligator
Palate: Creamy and zesty, with a huge whack of grapefruit and lemon, as well as BBQ sauce, ginger and orange zest. Like a really toasty rye whiskey in parts, with hints of icing sugar, cocoa, gingernut biscuits and intense smoke.
Finish: Sweet and creamy with peppery, crackling peat smouldering away for hours.
Nose: Stunning aromas of charcoal, mulled wine and lemon icing sugar. Very creamy, with notes of vanilla and yoghurt, with a huge BBQ note. Some gingerbread and tangy apricots, and burning brown sugar.

Name: Caol Ila 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 367731) - James Eadie
Palate: Earthy peat, clove, dark chocolate, and orchard fruits covered in dark honey.
Finish: Eucalyptus and a little salted caramel.
Nose: Citrus peels and brioche buns are joined by dried fruit, smoked meats, seaweed, and honey.

Name: Strathmill 13 Year Old 2008 (cask 804817) - Connoisseurs Choice (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Honeyed barley and subtle peppery hints, with cooked apple developing later on.
Finish: Subtly minty, still packed with vanilla.
Nose: Almond pastries, caramel, a hint of sandalwood.

Name: Kirker & Greer 10 Year Old Single Grain
Palate: Toffee popcorn, caramelised banana and tinned pineapple, with creamy vanilla, a touch of cinnamon and floral oak.
Finish: Chai spices on the finish alongside vanilla pod and even more banana.
Nose: Subtle grassy oak amid bucketfuls of vanilla fudge, banana bread and lots of honey.

Name: Mortlach 13 Year Old 2008 (casks 314536 & 314537 & 314560) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Buttery barley and set honey bring a sweet touch, with a base of hearty, earthen spice and walnut oil at the core.
Finish: More nutty, earthen cigar box, candied ginger, a hint of olive brine, softly sweet sultanas, and woody, oaken spice.
Nose: A good helping of crushed almonds, oily barley, and honeyed sourdough, with fresh apple, and a touch of fennel salami.

Name: Caol Ila 13 Year Old 2009 (cask 321158) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Toasted oak, more peat, some salted caramel, and a touch of waxy orange.
Finish: Beach bonfires and oaky vanilla.
Nose: Nutty toasted barley, with waves of coastal peat, crumbly shortbread, and set honey.

Name: The Glenlivet XXV (25 Year Old)
Palate: Thick and smooth. There are notes of Sherried peels and sultanas; chewy toffee and walnut; dried fruits emerge with a juicy touch.
Finish: Long and rich with winter spice.
Nose: Rich. There are notes of chewy sultanas and morello cherry; dried herbs and cooked fruits with apple crumble and a balanced acidity; crÃ¨me de cacao.

Name: Johnnie Walker Blenders' Batch - Bourbon Cask & Rye Finish 1L
