Palate: Sweet oaky vanilla, with apples and dried orchard fruits. Warm baking spices build, joined by peppery rye.
Finish: The spices linger, alongside golden caramel.
Nose: Drizzles of caramel, sticky heather honey, and spiced fruit compote.

Name: Cragganmore 2009 (bottled 2021) - Distillers Edition
Palate: Jammy apple and plum compote, with charred oak, and hints of malt loaf.
Finish: Lingering cocoa nibs, vanilla, and a touch of drying oak.
Nose: Drizzles of caramel, with touches of grist, baked orchard fruits, and light wisps of smoke.

Name: Miltonduff 12 Year Old 2009 (casks 701804 & 701805 & 701806 & 701807) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: A prickle of candied ginger is softened by sweet, dried orange and vanilla sponge cake. Delicately milky chai spices begin to build.
Finish: Lingering vanilla, a good helping of creamy cereal, malt bread, and toasted oak.
Nose: Honeyed stone fruits, prunes, and biscuity malt with buttery nuts drifting throughout.

Name: Tobermory 13 Year Old 2008 - Strictly Limited (CÃ rn MÃ²r)
Palate: Subtly floral oak, joined by apple blossom and buttery pastry. A pinch of green apple sharpness, followed by toasty oak spices.
Finish: Honeydew melon, cassia again, waxy peels.
Nose: Pine, mint imperial sweeties, lemon curd, brown sugar, cassia and orris.

Name: Clynelish 14 Year Old - Flora and Fauna (with Wooden Box)
Palate: Dry oak, salty, interesting balance, sweetness, smoke.
Finish: Good finish, coastal character, sweetness.
Nose: Lots of malt, coastal, wood, sherry, spiced.

Name: Cask Edit - Elements of Islay
Palate: Woody caramel opens the way for fresh almond croissants and robust roasted coffee beans. A dusting of pebbly petrichor mingles with earthen vanilla and distant bonfire smoke.
Finish: Things remain fresh and fruity towards the end, with elegant smoke and sweet spice lingering.
Nose: Charred oak and candied nuts, with heaps of fresh orchard fruits, are followed by soft praline and creamy vanilla. Delicate peat smoke floats seamlessly throughout.

Name: Nobushi Japanese Whisky
Palate: Mint and earthy vanilla pod, with orange curd and sultana.
Finish: Peppery wood spice and buttery caramel.
Nose: Caramel and heaps of spices, with cinnamon, nutmeg and honeycomb alongside toasty oak.

Name: Glen Garioch 1999 Wine Cask Matured (bottled 2018)
Palate: Amaretti biscuits, raspberries, a touch of mead, dried cherries and lemongrass.
Finish: Christmas spices, ginger biscuits and another helping of red berries.
Nose: Red apples, strawberries and cream with a touch of sugar, a slow build of honeyed oak.

Name: Tomatin 8 Year Old 2013 (cask 9531) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: More redcurrants and juicy raisins are followed by candied nuts, vanilla, and drying malt with crunches of brown sugar.
Finish: Powerful oak, bold dark berry richness with woody wafts of walnut and baking spice.
Nose: Jammy berries and cherries, spiced fruit loaf, and nut brittle.

Name: Phenolix 10 Year Old
Palate: Drying smoke ripples on the palate, alongside apple chips, red chilli flake, and a touch of milk chocolate.
Finish: Meaty malt and cask char, with a dollop of creme patissiere.
Nose: Sea shores, roast chestnuts, singed grass, and distant bonfires, with hints of apricot jam and poached pear.

Name: Scapa Glansa
Palate: Peach and ripe flavours and creamy caramel toffee and vanilla balanced perfectly with soft smoke.
Finish: Very long with a markedly smoky finish.
Nose: Fruity sweet notes of soft peach, pineapple, vanilla intermingled with subtle bonfire smoke.

Name: Caol Ila 1998 - Feis Ile 2013 - Triple Matured
Palate: Orange bread and Madeira.
Finish: Hazelnuts and dried orange.
Nose: Sweet, shredded seaweed, honey, orange peel and glacÃ© cherries.

Name: Glenrothes 11 Year Old 2007 - Vintage Casks (Mossburn)
Palate: Shortbread, peanut brittle, sultana, a bit peppery at points.
Finish: Buttery vanilla and a hint of sponge cake.
Nose: Still fruity, despite the lack of sherry cask - dried apricot and cherry, with soft malt notes.

Name: Glengoyne 18 Year Old
Palate: Creamy custard and dried peels. Allspice, manuka honey and hints of butterscotch.
Finish: Creamy caramel and malt. Candied peels.
Nose: Hints of soft spice and dried peels. A little apricot, honey and vanilla.

Name: Hellyers Road Original Roaring Forty
Palate: Grassy at first, before juicy notes of pear and plum appear.
Finish: Peanut brittle, cedar.
Nose: Creamy lemon and vanilla - a bit like Lemon Meringue Pie. Hints of banana and toffee.

Name: Invergordon 25 Year Old - Batch 22 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Sweet creamy coffee, salted caramel, vanilla custard, and woody spices.
Finish: The sweetened coffee notes fade to leave lingering toasted spice.
Nose: Toasted brown bread, sweet Demerara fudge, digestive biscuits, woody spices, and hints of milk chocolate and candied citrus peel.

Name: Canadian Corn Whisky 8 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: Buttery toffee popcorn, toasted nuts, candied cherry, and black tea.
Finish: Maple syrup and dates.
Nose: Dark chocolate, dark sticky fruits, charred oak, and milky coffee.

Name: Ledaig 16 Year Old 2005 (cask 1900201) - Benchmark (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Rounded caramel and peach notes, with some tangy spices later on. A constant hum of toasty smoke.
Finish: Long and well-balanced between fruit-forward sweetness and coastal salinity.
Nose: Smoked meats and baked earth, with a splash of citrus developing.

Name: Ardbeg Kelpie
Palate: A peppery mouthfeel is followed by a crescendo of rich flavours.  Treacle toffee, Turkish coffee, smoky bacon and lots of dark, dark chocolate.  A curious burst of peachy, estery fruit, hickory wood, clove oil and a suggestion of black olives.
Finish: Seemingly lasting forever, with deep, deep, almost subterranean flavours of clove, tar, and rich toffee.
Nose: A wonderful, intense, âdancingâ nose, with lots of different, intertwined aromas â powerful, oily peat, dark chocolate, smoked fish, hints of seaweed, and a curious, sharp herbal note. Waves of spicy black pepper.

Name: Tamnavulin 13 Year Old 2009 (casks 800484 & 800485) - Dalgety (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Juicy melon sweetness, with bittersweet marmalade and candied ginger.
Finish: Stem ginger and ripe tropical fruit.
Nose: Orange peel, oak spices, fresh pineapple.

Name: Blended Malt #1 24 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Praline, orange oil, fennel, toffee, brioche dipped in coffee.
Finish: Fragrant oak and dates.
Nose: Floral vanilla and freshly made latte, plus a touch of rye toast.

Name: Glen Keith 27 Year Old 1993 (cask 82838/39) - Mission Gold (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Honeycomb, vanilla, gentle oak, fruity zest.
Finish: Stewed fruits, sweet sultanas, crystalised ginger, and rich, malty oak
Nose: Wafts of pineapple, mango, candied orange, and ginger biscuits.

Name: The Glenturret Peated Edition
Palate: Smoky, oily cereal and sweet citrus (lemons and grapefruit).
Finish: Smoky oak with a sweet edge.
Nose: Peaty nut cookies. Barbecue and coffee cake.

Name: Allt-Ã¡-Bhainne 23 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Through sweet, oaky elements and dried grass thereâs tart citrus, caramel and stewed fruit. Orange peel and raspberry ice cream notes emerge.
Finish: Lemon sponge lingers in a soft finish.
Nose: Vanilla, puff pastry and dusty apple skins, with rhubarb crumble and a little gooey toffee.

Name: Caol Ila 8 Year Old (Release 2) - Concept 8
Palate: Oatcakes with salty butter, smouldering sawdust sweet vanilla and oily brine.
Finish: Waxed citrus and sweet malt intertwine with smoky salinity and spice that lingers on the finish.
Nose: A combination of earthen floral notes, grassy campfire, and seaweed.

Name: Kingsbarns 6 Year Old (Single Cask Release)
Palate: Oaky spice prickles through vanilla fudge, toffee sweets, and orchard fruit.
Finish: Sweet with a little peppery spice.
Nose: Golden cereals, dry grass, apple pastries, and toasted almonds.

Name: Benriach 22 Year Old 2000 (cask 2) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Dark fruit, caramel sauce, soft spices and touches of manuka honey and chocolate raisin.
Finish: Long and complex finish.
Nose: Marmalade, stewed plums, oily walnut, and cinnamon cocoa.

Name: Elvis Tiger Man Straight Tennessee Whiskey
Palate: Pecan pie, cinnamon, black pepper, and candy apples.
Finish: Balanced sweetness, with charred oak character.
Nose: Caramel corn, with woody spices, freshly baked cookies, and some orchard fruit.

Name: Balvenie 21 Year Old - The Second Red Rose
Palate: An initial burst of blackberry and ripe peach sweetness, conceal flavours of vibrant oak and cracked black pepper leaving a gentle woody spice.
Finish: Lingering oakiness.
Nose: Intense ripe fruits combined with robust earthy tones, reveal the mouth-watering fragrance from fresh mango and subtle oak.

Name: Chichibu The Peated 2012 (bottled 2016)
Palate: Slightly grassy at first, followed up by flamed orange peel and earthy pear.
Finish: Touched of grilled fruit and toasted rye bread.
Nose: TCP and wood smoke, with underlying caramel sweetness.

Name: Mortlach 12 Year Old 2010 (cask 900300644) - Woodrow's of Edinburgh
Palate: Chocolate coffee beans, sweet raisins, candied almonds, and walnuts with a touch of tangy fruit beneath.
Finish: Ginger and cinnamon heat, earthy coffee grounds, clove, and nutty malt.
Nose: Heaps of juicy raisins and sultanas, dense oak, and earthy notes of herbal tea joined by black pepper and stone fruits.

Name: Bruichladdich Islay Barley 2009
Palate: Fresh waffles with apple slices and a generous pouring of syrup. Oak builds up, as does a floral malt.
Finish: Warming with continued golden cereals.
Nose: White grapes and orchard fruits (a touch of stewed plum too), herbaceous mint and vanilla.

Name: The Woodcock
Palate: More honey, now with cedar and cassia in support. A hint of chocolatey sweetness develop later on.
Finish: Dried fruit and vanilla last.
Nose: Honeyed cereal and warm barley, with a drizzle of floral honey.

Name: Longmorn 11 Year Old 2008 (cask 1229) - Highland Laird (Bartels Whisky)
Palate: Oaky vanilla, lemon peel and mint chocolate alongside blueberry muffin.
Finish: Baking spices appear on the finish with sweet malt.
Nose: Vanilla buttercream and fresh toast with jam, with touches of apple blossom.

Name: Craigellachie 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 900694) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Warm, toasted oak, with a touch of furniture polish, treacle tart, dark chocolate, and baking spices.
Finish: Some orchard fruit, with peppery spice.
Nose: Cinder toffee, raisins, dates, candied citrus, and oaky spice.

Name: Balblair 10 Year Old
Palate: Gingerbread, malty and peppery, golden syrup, rum spices. Vanilla, a touch of burnt orange peel.
Finish: Spicy, malty finish.
Nose: Peppery nose, with crÃ¨me caramel, malt, cinnamon, orange marmalade and maple syrup.

Name: Beverbach
Palate: Oak influence is clear here, with oily nuts, vanilla sponge cake, slightly burnt toast and baking spice.
Finish: Nougat, more dried fruit returns alongside vanilla pod.
Nose: Strong malt aromas alongside a whisper of smoke, subtle vanilla, dried fruit and honey.

Name: Fettercairn 12 Year Old 2010 (cask 16272) - Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Candied nuts, a touch of ginger, fresh cream, and blueberry jam, with vegetal barley and zesty citrus peels beneath.
Finish: Spiced apple, gingerbread, more dark fruit, and silky oak char.
Nose: Freshly baked biscuits, hedgerow berries, nougat, and milky coffee.

Name: Campbeltown 5 Year Old Moscatel Finish (Darkness)
Palate: Red berry notes take shape on the palate, alongside a touch of salted peanuts.
Finish: Chocolate mousse and rich vanilla.
Nose: Classic Campbeltown salinity, with hints of salted crackers and earthy oak, balanced by hints of apricot sweetness.

Name: Stalk & Barrel Blue Blend
Palate: Among creamy vanilla, chocolate, and apricot yogurt there's hints of black tea and mixed nuts.
Finish: Slightly grassy and spicy with more orchard fruit.
Nose: Clove spice, juicy apple, and lots of charred wood take centre stage here.

Name: Firean
Palate: Light whispers of dry peat smoke surround delicate floral notes, vanilla and oak spices.
Finish: A gentle finish as the peat smoke slowly fades.
Nose: Sweet peat and lovely malty aromas.

Name: Edradour Ballechin 8 Year Old Double Malt Double Cask
Palate: Caramelised dates, more earthy smoke, strawberry bonbons, walnuts.
Finish: Subtly meaty malt grows on the finish.
Nose: Coffee cake, cooked apples and a hint of baked earth spiciness.

Name: Glasgow 1770 - Tokaji Cask Finish
Palate: Vanilla shortbread, juicy apricot, and honey-soaked sultanas lead the way, with a touch of baking spice. Candied tropical fruit follows while the spice gently builds.
Finish: Drying oak, poached pears, roasted hazelnuts, and a dusting of cinnamon.
Nose: Tangy marmalade and spiced fruits, with cooked apples and pears, toasted nuts, and vanilla cream.

Name: The Macallan 18 Year Old 1996 Sherry Oak
Palate: Stewed apples, again dusted with cinnamon. The oak from the nose develops. Clove and hints of orange peel.
Finish: Lasting notes of toffee, raisin and that final hint of oak.
Nose: Soft, plump raisins, ginger snaps dusted with cinnamon and vanilla creaminess. Oak in the background.

Name: Springbank 25 Year Old
Palate: The palate is gentle and refined with a smooth, buttery feel. There are touches of gingerbread and liquorice, along with a note of coffee grounds hinting at a slight woody element.
Finish: The emergence of peat smoke in the finish rounds off this dram.
Nose: A sweet, inviting introduction to this dram, there are notes of caramel and millionaire shortbread, dried pineapple and honeydew melon.

Name: Ben Nevis 9 Year Old - Battlehill (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Plump sultanas and toffee-coated raisins lead to candied almonds, stewed plums, and robust, peppery malt.
Finish: Spicy ginger, more citrus zest, finishing up with sweet, biscuity barley and fragrant oak.
Nose: Mixed nuts, candied citrus peels, dried berries, and earthen vanilla.

Name: The Macallan Ruby - 1824 Series
Palate: Raspberry coulis, maraschino, prunes, marmalade.
Finish: Long and rich, dark berries and ginger.
Nose: Rich wedding cake and espresso, cocoa, a little clove and walnut.

Name: Label 5 Classic Black
Palate: Apples, pears and a subtle grassy note or two. A little citrus and caramel.
Finish: A clean finish with lemon zest and brown sugar.
Nose: Rather sweet with vanilla and sticky toffee pudding. Hints of ginger and cinnamon.

Name: Secret Orkney 17 Year Old 2005 (cask DRU17/A63 #8) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Dark roasted barley, with smouldering embers, floral honey, some waxy orange peel, and dried raisins.
Finish: Nutty, with lingering smoke, and peppery spice.
Nose: Waves of smoky peat, dried apricots, vanilla, and some oily pine nuts.

Name: Spirit of Hven Seven Stars No. 7 Alkaid
Palate: Rich and luxurious melted dark chocolate, though no bitterness here, with sweet prunes, floral white peony and green freshly cut grass.
Finish: Toffee apple, glazed cinnamon buns and ginger spice, with sweet smoke supported by a drizzle of honey.
Nose: Strong aromas of toasty oak, old leather and lots of tobacco, with fresh orchard fruits, while vanilla and cocoa intertwine.

Name: Ledaig 11 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Initially, there are preserved lemon, dark fruits and charred barley, followed by flickers of warm cinnamon and ground black pepper. Hints of smoked chestnut and peppermint add depth.
Finish: The meaty smoke lingers with a touch of chocolate and blackcurrant compote.
Nose: Plenty of wood smoke upfront, then dried fruit, soda bread sweetness and damp grass. There's a little hickory and baking spice underneath.

Name: Smokehead
Palate: Big, puckering peat. Smoky, fruity sweetness, touch of sherry, sultana. Herbal.
Finish: Herbal, tangy fruits and more peat smoke!
Nose: Smoke! Lapsang souchong. Cool wood smoke. Thick and full.

Name: Glenfarclas 21 Year Old
Palate: Incredibly smooth. Barley-rich, just a textbook smoothness and rounded character that leaves you gasping for another sipâ¦
Finish: Long, barley-rich, awesomely smooth, very little oak influence.
Nose: Apple, orange, less sherry than the 15yo. Peppermint again?!

Name: Base Spirits Blended Scotch Whisky
Palate: Toffee pennies and vanilla fudge, dried fruit, Brazil nuts and a waft of salty sea air.
Finish: Green apple, nutmeg, toasted oak staves and barley.
Nose: Warm malt, waxy peels, marzipan and smoked almonds.

Name: Highland Park Cask Strength - Release No.2
Palate: Savoury peat and a smidge of salted liquorice, plus thick honey, crunchy red apple, and cassia.
Finish: Almond, chocolate, red chilli flake, and oak.
Nose: Roast chestnuts, pear drops, earthy smoke and with a hint of caraway.

Name: KilchArd
Palate: Chocolate brownies and Crunchie Bars, continued citrus freshness, sultanas and a distant coastal salinity. Peppery malt in the background.
Finish: Black tea, homemade blackberry jam and baked earth.
Nose: Softly toasted barley, orange zest, plus a hint of stem ginger spiciness.

Name: Caol Ila 6 Year Old - Batch 3 (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Oily, with more thyme and a hint of green olive. Sweeter hints of citrus peels and blueberry develop.
Finish: Long and smoky, with enjoyable salinity lasting on and on.
Nose: Black pepper, heather and a hint of thyme. Sea salt-coated crackers, too.

Name: Ardmore 12 Year Old 2008 (cask 706110) - Auld Goonsy's Malt
Palate: Charred oak, coastal smoke, sweeter notes of tropical fruit, and a peppery oak prickle.
Finish: Salted almonds, peat smoke, and toasted sourdough with honey with salted butter.
Nose: Honey roasted nuts, oak-smoked salt, zesty citrus, and vanilla wafers.

Name: Bowmore Dawn
Palate: Toffee, and malt, strawberries, spices, peat smoke and hemp ropes. Nutmeg, cherries. Very wine-like.
Finish: Wine-like again, tangy and very fruity. Wood smoke, toffee.
Nose: Smoky and spicy. Rosemary, lavender, peat and salinity. Redcurrants, malt, rhubarb crumble, orange zest, seaweed.

Name: Grant's Distillery Edition
Palate: Surprisingly full-bodied with layers of vanilla pod, charred oak (leading to a good whiff of smoke) and lime cordial.
Finish: Oily malt and marmalade.
Nose: Banana yoghurt, grist and orange oil.

Name: Epidion 10 Year Old
Palate: Roasted barley and bonfire embers, honeyed sweetness building with a touch of cooked apple, chocolate raisins, and sea salt.
Finish: Lingering vanilla and cask char, plus a hint of nutmeg warmth.
Nose: Waves of earthy peat arrive first, with deeper hints of sherried malt tucked away behind the savoury smoke.

Name: Kamiki
Palate: Floral notes remain at the fore, with touches of forest floor, apricot and kumquat developing in the background.
Finish: Slightly peppery, earthy vanilla pod and a whiff of pine.
Nose: Fragrant citrus blossom and baked apple, with a hint of balsa wood and dry peat.

Name: North British 31 Year Old 1991 (casks 272176 & 272182) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Crunchy granola, apple, fruit cake, and gingerbread.
Finish: Chocolate honeycomb and festive spice.
Nose: Sweet flapjack, honey sweetness, and candied fruits.

Name: Glasshouse Whisky
Palate: Ripe pineapple and more even riper banana, alongside plain digestive biscuits.
Finish: Honeycomb and a touch of milk chocolate.
Nose: Tangy, crisp apple, with Sugar Puffs and a hint of banana.

Name: Cambus 30 Year Old 1990 (cask 1909948/53/57) - Mission Gold (Murray McDavid)
Palate: Orange zest, apples, raisin fruit loaf with silky grain, and oaken vanilla.
Finish: Spiced fruit cake, baked pear, apple pastries, gently oily, and peppery on the finish.
Nose: Berry tarts, creamy vanilla, cut grass, and crushed almonds.

Name: Blair Athol 14 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Mint chocolate, strawberry ice cream, a touch of minerality at its heart.
Finish: Softly toasted nuts and a layer of brown sugar.
Nose: Walnuts, fruit tea, a few whiffs of cigar box earthiness.

Name: North British 11 Year Old (The Easy Sipper)
Palate: Drizzles of honey lead, with apricots and peaches in tow. More vanilla, a touch of vegetal oak, and chewy toffee.
Finish: A gentle balance of cracked pepper and burnt sugar, backed up by more creamy vanilla and butterscotch.
Nose: Vanilla fudge, buttered popcorn, creamy custard, and blanched almonds.

Name: The Macallan Estate
Palate: Soft and warming with wood spice, opening into a dry oak flavour spiked with candied raisin and fresh fig. Moving into a sweet fresh orange and delicate fresh citrus.
Finish: A sweet citrus twist.
Nose: Warm, comforting and homely notes of cinnamon. Wood spice and orange oil, opening into dried fruits with a sweet lemon, banana and caramel.

Name: Cardhu 12 Year Old
Palate: Smooth, rounded, gentle sweetness, soft peat. A little smoke whispers sweet nothings.
Finish: Long, dry smoke, malty touch of peat.
Nose: Good body, decent sweetness, richness. Streaks of smoke, apple peels, bruised pears.

Name: Glenfiddich 26 Year Old Grande Couronne - Artist Edition
Palate: Deep, velvety smooth and indulgently sweet. CafÃ© crÃ¨me with soft brown sugar and a hint of spice.
Finish: Very long-lasting sweet oak.
Nose: Vibrant and lively with an abundance of toasty oak sweetness. Reminiscent of a French pÃ¢tisserie, freshly-baked Tarte Tatin and buttery choux pastry.

Name: Bowmore 18 Year Old Moscatel Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: Salted lemons, sultanas, earthy smoke and a touch of old leather.
Finish: Cocoa, more maritime hints, and a little smidge of tobacco.
Nose: Sea breeze, toasted almonds, a hint of meaty malt.

Name: Kavalan Solist ex-Bourbon Cask
Palate: Honeycomb, tangy orange, apricot, fresh vanilla and peanut brittle.
Finish: Subtly oaky, with buttery vanilla and toasted barley.
Nose: Subtly floral up front, followed by waves of tropical fruit juice and subtle cigar box richness.

Name: The Girvan Patent Still 30 Year Old
Palate: Up front we're treated to fried bananas drizzled with honey, juicy peaches and oodles of vanilla. Rich nutty notes follow on, as does spiced oak and Victoria Sponge Cake.
Finish: Long and full of all the great stuff that came before, the vanilla and oak standing out amongst it all.
Nose: Floral honey, home-made vanilla ice cream, toffee pennies and dried sultanas. Old oak sits at the centre.

Name: Kenthachy
Palate: Fresh apples and sweet banana notes.
Finish: Clean with sweet vanilla and dry spice.
Nose: Vanilla pods and fresh mown grass.

Name: Caol Ila 2000 - Feis Ile 2011 - Bodega Sherry
Palate: Textbook Caol Ila, but with a strong backbone provided by the Sherry cask. Much akin to the distillersâ edition, but at full and unadulterated cask strength. Sterling stuff. Huge Cinder-Toffee sweetness creeps in gently, but doesnât overpower.
Finish: The peat gives way somewhat to a butterscotch, salted caramel flavour which persists beautifully, interweaving itself with the smokiness to provide one of the best Caol Ilas weâve tried in ages.
Nose: Lemon Sherbet, fresh and zingy peat, and just a little hint of Raisin, provided by the superb Sherry butt from which this bottle was drawn.

Name: Ardbeg Drum
Palate: Loads of spices, with pepper, clove, cinnamon and more ginger surrounded by swirls of earthy smoke, with sweeter notes of liquorice, even more dark chocolate and vanilla pod.
Finish: Roasted, slightly burnt coffee beans, and sweet cinnamon and cocoa.
Nose: Bonfire wood smoke intertwines with earthy pine, as sweeter tropical aromas of ripe banana, banana bread and pineapple come to the fore. Some richer notes of dark chocolate and candied ginger add depth.

Name: St Patrick's 10 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish
Palate: Citrus remains from the nose, fruity and floral. Nutty notes build on the palate, with subtle cinnamon and clove.
Finish: Dates, mixed peels, drying spices and toffee.
Nose: Banana chips, raisins, chocolate mousse and pomander fragrance.

Name: Bivrost Muspelheim
Palate: Vanilla-y grist, with underlying hints of peppercorn and caramel. Warming earthy peat sticks around.
Finish: Cinnamon and another crackle of pepper, supported by smoke.
Nose: Toasted vanilla pod, roast chestnuts, honey, and a hint of woody pine.

Name: Kamiki Sakura
Palate: Floral, sweet hints of cherries and toasted nuts cross with aromatic sandalwood and cedar reminiscent of a pine forest.
Finish: A pleasing balance of intense wood, rich fruit and lingering spice.
Nose: Fruity wafts of melon and banana cross with woody cinnamon and Christmas trees.

Name: Balblair 1969
Palate: Complex and rewarding, it begins with the fruit sweetness of oranges, apples and bananas. This is followed by oak spices, warming up the palate for the smoky vanilla that comes afterwards.
Finish: The finish lasts and lasts. The apple notes continue to linger.
Nose: Smoke and spice waft up, with apples, pear drops and a subtle mint note.

Name: Ardbeg Ardcore
Palate: Anise, more citrus flashes, ash, mint, vanilla pod, and roasted barley.
Finish: Salty liquorice, leather, and cedar.
Nose: Tarry ropes, grapefruit zest, toasted bread, menthol, lasting peat reek.

Name: Dalmore Luceo
Palate: More coffee! More cherries (and oodles of raisins now too)! A honey'd glaze to it, too.
Finish: Ginger and cocoa - a good combination.
Nose: Cherry bakewell, sugary coffee and a touch of ginger.

Name: Braeval - Skene Whisky
Palate: Hot cross buns with butter, walnut loaf, a little hint of flint.
Finish: Soft winter spices develop on the finish, though sultana and apple persist.
Nose: Apricot, pineapple, a smidge of rhubarb, drizzled with honey.

Name: J.A. Baczewski Whisky
Palate: Fresh, green oak, with baking spices and some grain sweetness.
Finish: Ginger spice returns on a warming, dry finish.
Nose: Fresh hay and gingersnap biscuits, with a drizzle of caramel and honey sponge cake.

Name: DYC Whisky 1l
Palate: Subtle vanilla and unripe fruits notes, perhaps the tiniest hint of peat?
Finish: Clean and refreshing.
Nose: Very light, a little caramel and oak.

Name: PUNI NOVA
Palate: Slightly floral and punchy with yellow pear skin and a hint of fruity rye, dried grass and pink peppercorns (could be the rye or the Limousin there).
Finish: Light, clean, cereal with subtle cinnamon and cedar.
Nose: Fragrant citrus sorbet with touches of caramel, wheat, apple and vanilla.

Name: Ardbeg Grooves
Palate: Vanilla fudge, toffee popcorn and tarred orchard fruits rise through a big, salty opening. Savoury BBQ notes of cured Italian meats are percolated by paprika, green chilli and scorched herbs. Antique leather and damp oak form an interesting backdrop.
Finish: Seaside bonfire and smoked salts percolate through a mellow sweetness.
Nose: A thick, spiced aroma of iodine, seaweed and golden syrup leads among a herbal note of lavender. An earthy funk from damp bonfire wood, old oak and dried grass is complemented by lighter touches of butterscotch, stone fruits and a little marzipan icing.

Name: Bivrost Nidavellir
Palate: Vanilla builds on the palate, its sweetness juxtaposed by medicinal peat smokiness.
Finish: Hints of clove and cinnamon stick around ion the finish, as does the vanilla.
Nose: Dried apricot, floral barley, thyme honey and a hint of barrel char.

Name: Fettercairn Fasque
Palate: Toffee pennies, oak spice and vanilla. Subtle mocha notes along the way.
Finish: Medium, with raisins and sultanas reappearing.
Nose: Baking spices, dried fruits, poached pears and a good whiff of oak.

Name: Bivrost Asgard
Palate: Chewy dates, cinnamon buns, and toasted oak meld together in a rich palate.
Finish: Long and intense.
Nose: Vanilla oak, caramel, leather, and dried fruit. There's a hint of incense drifting away in the backdrop.

Name: Kilbeggan Rye
Palate: More apples are joined by fresh pears, with a kick of root ginger spice and creamy vanilla building into peppery rye spice.
Finish: A rather speedy finish, with a dash of oak.
Nose: Milk chocolate chip cookies and warm porridge, fresh brioche, candied ginger and warming allspice balanced by refreshing zingy apple peel and green notes of freshly cut grass.

Name: Akkeshi Shosho Blended Whisky (bottled 2021)
Palate: Dried currants and apricots, with some cocoa nibs, woody spice, and oaky vanilla.
Finish: Peppery spice, with a slight nuttiness.
Nose: Some floral notes, with beeswax polish, drizzles of caramel, and candied orange peel.

Name: Balblair 1975
Palate: Rich, lots of malted cereal notes and sugared barley.
Finish: Oak, still the cereal and barley notes are ubiquitous.
Nose: Very rich. It's all in the poise, notes of smoke and vanilla dance with veritable refinement. Also, warm berry fruits immersed in spiced cream.

Name: GlenDronach Peated
Palate: Cinnamon and more wood-smoke lead to runny honey and dried raisin further on.
Finish: Golden barley shines through here.
Nose: Wafts of juicy (and maybe even a little tropical) fruit and vanilla cream mingle with plumes of charred oak.

Name: Ardbeg 25 Year Old
Palate: An extremely vibrant, hot peppery mouthfeel leads into a burst of sherbet lemon sweetness (candied apples, pears and orange), hints of carbolic soap and tar, more creamy toffee, aniseed and chilli pepper.
Finish: A long, mellow, lingering aftertaste, with lots of cream, fudge and delicate antiseptic notes. An elegant, soothing style of Ardbeg.
Nose: A pungent burst of smoked cream, peppermint and toffee, with Ardbegâs classic fennel and pine resin. Distant earthy bonfires mix with herbal and fruity (banana and tropical) notes, along with fragrant candle wax.

Name: PUNI ALBA
Palate: A little farmy with hay, some floral cereal, dark fruit and clove.
Finish: Peppered dried fruit and sweet vanilla.
Nose: Fruity, tart, burnt herbs, gooseberry, dried fruit and a little rye spice.

Name: Shinju Japanese Whisky
Palate: Apple, gingerbread, and chewy toffees, with hints of savoury oak and subtle praline.
Finish: Sandalwood and rich dates linger.
Nose: Waves of acacia honey, orange peel, and slick vanilla, accompanied by hints of garden herbs and toasted oak.

Name: Tomatin 1980
Palate: Smooth and full-bodied, with underlying creaminess; fills the palate. Clovey-spiceness mixed with orange peel.
Finish: Full and long with lasting orange notes.
Nose: Light and fresh. Quite aromatic. Pear drop, orange, apple, citrus notes. Like walking through an orchard.

Name: Jura The Loch
Palate: Thick caramel and treacle, balanced by a hint of peat smoke. Lasting zesty citrus peel notes.
Finish: Robust spices kick in on the finish.
Nose: Rich oak and milky coffee, with a burst of juicy raisin sweetness.

Name: Bruichladdich Laddie Five-O Feis Ile 2013
Palate: White pepper and pear skin.
Finish: A slight saltiness alongside light fruit tang.
Nose: Sweet barley, yellow and green Wine Gums, hints of corn and raspberry. A little grist develops with butterscotch and Kettle chips!

Name: The Macallan Quest
Palate: Slightly spicier than the nose, with warming oak and cinnamon developing underneath caramel notes.
Finish: Touches of raisin and vanilla pod.
Nose: Gentle lemon notes arrive first, with milk chocolate and butterscotch leaping out afterwards.

Name: Glengoyne Cuartillo
Palate: The palate begins with creamy vanilla, nectarines in syrup and spice and a touch of espresso. Butterscotch, stem ginger and chocolate orange bring depth.
Finish: An oily finish concludes with a little oak spice.
Nose: Toffee apples, a little acacia honey and toasted barley initially, with dried peels and soft spice in the background.

Name: Ardmore 7 Year Old 2013 (cask 9374) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co)
Palate: Oatcakes, toasted barley with a touch of nuttiness to it (think almond flakes and honey-roasted peanuts), brown sugar.
Finish: Softly peppery smoke, contrasted by a sweet hint of strawberry.
Nose: Gingerbread, flamed orange peel, damson and stewed plums.

Name: Crabbie 12 Year Old Speyside Single Malt
Palate: More sweet apple and juicy pears, citrus zest balanced by hints of nutmeg and cinnamon with bourbon-oaky vanilla throughout.
Finish: Orchard fruits and vanilla continue for a well balanced, sweet and warming finish.
Nose: Green apples, gentle spice, sugar roasted nuts and sweet vanilla.

Name: Dalmore Dominium
Palate: Exotic spice, sweet chilli, dried fruit and mixed peels.
Finish: Fruit salad, caramel and a little black pepper.
Nose: Spicy, vinous and honeyed with incense notes.

Name: Dalmore The Quintet
Palate: Red apples, Cadbury's Fruit & Nut, mint leaf, cinnamon sticks, toffee, old oak furniture.
Finish: Lingering whispers of cigar box and espresso.
Nose: Dried pineapple, floral honey, stewed plums, strawberries, a hint of baked earth.

Name: Ardmore Traditional
Palate: Lots of barley and cereal notes, oodles of rich bourbon, smoke and peat still present. Charming interplay through the caramel sweetness and the vanilla spiced oak.
Finish: Has a sharp edge, more caramel and sugary barley notes and a lanolin smoothness and more tapering smoke.
Nose: Full of caramel. Toasted oak is evident and rich and just the faintest peat has muscled its way through.

Name: Dalmore The Quartet (1L)
Palate: Christollen cake, sherry-soaked raisins, and soft chewy liquorice.
Finish: Doyenne pear with raspberry coulis and chocolate truffles.
Nose: Madagascan vanilla pods, candied blood orange, and ripe red grapes.

Name: Amrut Portonova
Palate: Fruity and intense with tropical fruits, redcurrant jelly, baked bananas and cinnamon.
Finish: Long and fruity, hints of cranberry.
Nose: Fruity, chocolate-driven nose with syrup, toffee and a hint of coconut, pepper and allspice. Red berries too!

Name: Smoky Shores (Wemyss Malts)
Palate: Softly peppery, with continued peaty wafts and coastal breeze.
Finish: Bonfires on beaches, rosemary, and a touch of dark chocolate.
Nose: Sea shells, tarry ropes, orange peel, wood smoke.

Name: The Macallan Terra
Palate: Melted chocolate, dried apricot, toffee pennies and a touch of strawberry jam.
Finish: Baking spices and dried oak notes take shape on the finish.
Nose: Fresh orange, brioche, coffee, sultana and walnut loaf.

Name: Bivrost Niflheim
Palate: Festive spices and orange oil, plus a few wafts of toasted cedar.
Finish: Subtly earthy with barley and oak, though chocolate sweetness persists.
Nose: Honeycomb and crisp pear, with a hint of coconut ice.

Name: Kura The Whisky
Palate: Brown sugar, burnt oak again (now with a touch of earthiness to it), lime marmalade.
Finish: Rye bread and a touch of bitter grape.
Nose: Toasted oak and a touch of moss, creamy lemon and soft malt.

Name: Mannochmore 10 Year Old 2011 (cask 15446) - Provenance (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Cinnamon and black pepper spiciness, mellowed by a thick layer of toffee.
Finish: Cooked apple and pear, dusted with nutmeg.
Nose: Vanilla latte, raisin, and nutty malt.

Name: Glenmorangie The Tayne
Palate: Orange oil starts off the palate, before giving way to brown sugar and more mixed nuts.
Finish: Quite long and spicy.
Nose: Almonds and walnuts, covered in caramel and brown sugar. A little hint of ground clove brings spiciness.

Name: Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbon 15 Year Old
Palate: Buttery and very rum-like in the mouth. Candy floss sweetness, caramel richness, and the softest, juiciest oak imaginable.
Finish: Hints of exotic spices combine with Demerara. Long and rich.
Nose: Wood, but so very balanced with nuttiness, toffee and a rum-like complexity, that itâs just perfect. Wood shavings, hints of dried berry fruits, and a faint shade of pepper provide a mouth-watering aromaâ¦

Name: Ardbeg Blaaack
Palate: Spiced fruit compote, more red berries, another helping of smoked meat, coffee, charred oak and brandied cherries.
Finish: Black pepper and cinnamon spiciness, with orange zest bringing some balancing fruity notes.
Nose: Raspberries and blackcurrant, followed up by baked earth and honey-glazed ham.

Name: Van Winkle Special Reserve 12 Year Old
Palate: Soft with gentle spices, charcoal, cinnamon bark, hints of cold coffee and honey.
Finish: Pertains to sweetness, but really the beauty of this is the aromatic savouriness that lies underneath the caramel.
Nose: Butterscotch on the nose, with soft sweetness and Demerara sugar.

Name: Benromach 1968
Palate: Full, sherried. Dry oak. Fruity.
Finish: Refined, fruitcake, spicy.
Nose: Sultana. Cigar boxes, honey. Calves leather.

Name: Islay Journey
Palate: Hallmark notes of earthy peat, sea spray and mineral-heavy seaweed, with icing sugar and creamier notes of vanilla and milk chocolate.
Finish: Medium length, with a sprinkle of sea salt and a dash of fresh citrus.
Nose: Hefty aromas of peat smoke, a flint-y minerality, sea breeze and bonfire ash, with a burst of red berry and vanilla sweetness.

Name: Knockando 1976
Palate: The delivery is surprisingly light given the rich nose and the depth of sherry-infused colour. There are still some tropical fruit notes, however soon the caramel, tobacco, take control.
Finish: A very floral finish riding over caramel undertones.
Nose: Caramel, salted figs, toffeed leather, and floral celery are all elements of this very complex nose. There's a small hint of sulphur too.

Name: Cameron Brig
Palate: Caramel, mixed peels, a touch of sherry, sultanas.
Finish: Medium length, oak and honey, more peels.
Nose: Light, subtle. Honey, spice.

Name: Edradour 30 Year Old 1973
Palate: Various fruits, touch of vinosity, dark rum. Cereals, spices.
Finish: Long and effortless. Cereals. Oak.
Nose: Good body. Textured. Sublime balance. Damson jam, plummy, herbal. Rather lovely vegetal note.

Name: Dalmore Cromartie
Palate: The palate is as thick as the nose suggests. The dried fruit dominates... add figs to the mix, plus there's sweet marmalade, chocolate and leather, with a good jolt of pepper.
Finish: Dark, dark chocolate, 80 percent cocoa solids at least. A balanced bitterness over marmalade caramel.
Nose: Floral, with thick dried fruit; there are raisins, dates and some candied peels.

Name: Macallan Genesis
Palate: Subtle spices (cinnamon), ginger, chocolate, an elegant mouth coating, the dried fruits on the taste are far more intense than on the nose.
Finish: Medium length, sweet yet dry. A clean and warming finish.
Nose: Subtle sweet dried fruits, oak, fresh apple and chocolate.

Name: Scarabus Batch Strength
Palate: Pink peppercorn and red chilli flake, balanced by soft vanilla and a drizzle of honey.
Finish: Toffee, honeycomb and a touch of ash.
Nose: Cut oak, pear, green apple, smoke slowly building the longer it stays in the glass.

Name: Drumguish
Palate: Rich, soft, fudge, touch of rum.
Finish: Cereals, toasted oak, vanilla spice, caramel.
Nose: Walnuts, honey, barley. Pepper. Smoke, herbal, leather, cigar boxes, a little fudge.

Name: Benriach 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 4835) - Peated
Palate: Still has hints of rich coffee to it, along with red fruit and a smidge of anise.
Finish: Lasting cacao and earthy peat.
Nose: Dark chocolate dotted with cherry and coffee, plus a fair waft of spicy smoke.

Name: The Belgian Owl Whisky
Palate: Cookie dough, golden syrup, a touch of floral barley.
Finish: Sweet fruit notes once again, now paired with brown sugar and Alpine herbs.
Nose: Fried banana, fresh pear, charred oak and a touch of baking spice.

Name: Balblair 1989
Palate: Full and tight, barley notes with their silken sweetness and more vanilla oak.
Finish: Good length, the sweet, bourbon oak lingers and with it creamy barley.
Nose: Crisp, balanced, a lovely dose of bourbon. Vanilla and spicy oak roll.

Name: Bowmore 52 Year Old 1965
Palate: Burnt heather and fresh spring flower.
Finish: A touch of jasmine, dried fruit and apricots. Best savoured neat.
Nose: Fragrant fruits, sweet beeswax and intense dark chocolate.

Name: Kilchoman Machir Bay Cask Strength
Palate: Oily orange is joined by more earthy peat, dried fruit, and peppery spice.
Finish: Long and full of spice.
Nose: Lemon peel, orchard fruit, oak char, and grassy peat.

Name: Opulence
Palate: Full and buoyant, akin to a private party submarine drifting beside the Lucayan Archipelago on the way to a festival on the island of Great Exuma.
Finish: As lengthy as a handshake from the bank manager as they congratulate you for depositing yet another Â£1 million cheque.
Nose: Rich in smoothness, like caressing a gold bar with your hand in a platinum glove that was once owned by a Danish monarch.

Name: Seven Islands
Palate: Lemon zest and honey. Spongecake, golden syrup and spicy oak.
Finish: Toasted, spiced finish.
Nose: Florentines become acacia honey and allspice. Stone fruit too, with gingerbread and golden syrup.

Name: Frisky Panky Blended Whisky
Palate: Grain sweetness, caramel and tropical fruit, with barley sugar and toasted nuts leading into candied peels.
Finish: Waxy honey and oak spice with cereal in milk, and a sprinkle of brown sugar.
Nose: Banana in custard, with malt emerging alongside touches of citrus, honey and toasty oak.

Name: Kamiki Intense Wood
Palate: Bold cedar with earthen wafts of tobacco and tea. Malt and cinnamon spice combine with plenty of intense wood influence.
Finish: Peppery cedar, brown bread and honey with lingering wood and spice on the finish.
Nose: Fresh, drying wood, and dried tea leaves in a tin.

Name: Bell's 1998 Christmas Decanter
Palate: Quite smooth, medium body. Barley and cereals with nut oils, hints of wood and spice.
Finish: Short with notes of fruitcake and smoke.
Nose: Quite soft and gentle. Malted barley and hints of cut herbs and a fresh floral note. Cereal and grist with a little honey.

Name: Secret Irish Distillery 8 Year Old 2011 (Master of Malt)
Palate: A soft opening with oily, melted butter quickly leads to warming layers of candied root ginger and green peppercorns. The strength certainly shows, while dried goji berries, creamy vanilla, and fresh oak spice nestle in the depths.
Finish: Those delicate berry notes continue with hints of tangy freeze-dried raspberry, green apple, and notes of soft marshmallow, blanketed with a tangle of fiery spice and silky clotted cream.
Nose: Lime peels, a touch of pith, pepper, dried herbs, cedar, pancake batter, fresh oak and a touch of nutmeg.

Name: Glenmorangie A Tale of Cake
Palate: The palate is complex, tart and has some slightly tannic wood notes which cut through flinty minerality tones as well as tinned peaches, orange chocolate, apricot croissant and more vanilla. There are honey roasted almonds and a little dark fruit underneath.
Finish: The finish lingers for an age with notes of marmalade, honeycomb and some fresh pear.
Nose: Thereâs plenty of classic Glenmorangie goodness here, orchard fruits, acacia honey and creamy vanilla initially, followed by stewed orange, golden sultanas and a little Amalfi lemon. Then thereâs white chocolate and crÃ¨me brÃ»lee with hints of elderflower, a fresh wholemeal loaf and a little mint among an array of fruity elements like nectarines in syrup, dried mango and apricot yoghurt.

Name: Craigellachie 10 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish (Darkness)
Palate: Sweet, sherried fruits and Madeira cake with dried apricot and sultanas. Crystalised ginger brings warmth alongside bold oak char and meaty, spicy malt.
Finish: A brilliant balance of sweetness and spice, with rich fruit cake, peppery barley, and delicate oak.
Nose: Robust notes of roasted malt lead, with poached pear and burnt sugar, while wafts of leathery oak and peppery spice linger in the distance.

Name: Penderyn Sherrywood Finish
Palate: Barley sugar sweets, Ryvita crackers and sherried sultanas, hints of peach and creamy malt throughout.
Finish: Peppery dry, creamy butter fudge and yet more pepper prickle on the finish!
Nose: Heaps of fresh apples and pears! Sweet candy floss, creamy vanilla, oak and prunes.

Name: Spice King 12 Year Old Highland and Islay (Wemyss Malts)
Palate: Pepper crackers, lemon tarts, nutmeg, burnt heather, and herbal smoke.
Finish: Charred oak, spicy zest, toasted barley and floral peppery peat.
Nose: Black pepper, cinnamon sticks, and candied orange, with mellow sweet smoke.

Name: Speyburn Hopkins Reserve
Palate: Fruity and sweet, with crisp toffee apple, cereal notes and lemon peel underpinned by a gentle smokiness.
Finish: Citrus zest and subtle hints of spice linger on the finish.
Nose: Very subtle aromas of peat smoke tease out candied citrus fruit, with sweet butterscotch, vanilla and baking spice.

Name: Port Dundas 43 Year Old 1978 (cask 14767) - Xtra Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: The palate bursts with rich cocoa, charred oak and an allspice warming kick.
Finish: The finish lingers wonderfully with more spice, a touch of butterscotch and crunchy biscuits.
Nose: Anticipate treacle, juicy cranberries, cinnamon and sweet cereal on the nose.

Name: Torabhaig Legacy 2017
Palate: The peat is more pronounced here and has an ashy profile with a touch of iodine. More briny sweetness and orchard fruit (apples and pears mostly) are present too, as well as notes of tinned apricots, wild herbs, fennel, brown bread with salted butter, shellfish doused in lemon juice and freshly cracked black pepper. Throughout there are some light floral and medicinal elements, while the cask adds flavours of vanilla, banana and roasted nuts.
Finish: The finish is lightly charred with wood smoke and has plenty of that salty, seaside charm (cockle brine, rock pools etc.) Thereâs also browning apples, eucalyptus, a little chewy liquorice and dark fruit.
Nose: Whispers of coastal peat pass through vanilla and a rich, warming apple note, like the inside of a freshly baked crumble. Thereâs also wet oak, limestone, mineral salts, seaweed, cockle brine, dried grass and a slight vegetal element among a very pleasant note of sherbet lemons. Underneath there are touches of toasted almond, darker fruits, sugary latte, white pepper and toffee.

Name: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year Old 107 Proof (75cl)
Palate: Rich and thick with notes of caramel, vanilla, dates, walnuts, coffee beans and soft oak. Very buttery and incredibly smooth.
Finish: Long and spicy with notes of gingernut biscuit and golden syrup on the tail.
Nose: Sweet and soft, with notes of wheat, corn and custard. Caramel, candy floss and dried fruits.

Name: Miyagikyo 1988
Palate: Big on zesty malt and sweet spices with  tiny hint of tangy mature cheddar in the background. Impeccable oak.
Finish: Sweet, balanced oak lasts long into a barley driven finish.
Nose: Dry sherry wood, toffee apples, hints of under-ripe plum and maybe even a chocolate.

Name: Tullibardine 1968
Palate: Balanced, hints of spice, hints of butterscotch, hints of coffee beans, hints of cocoa, of oak and of leather.
Finish: Long, creamy, thick, rich, tingling with light spices and cut grass.
Nose: Medium bodied with some dry oak and toffee, wonderful complexity. Walnut, oily, orchard fruits, hints of smoke, stewed fruit.

Name: Deanston 1967
Palate: Creamy. Honey, barley, walnut.
Finish: Nutty, developing oak.
Nose: Touch of dryness. Manuka honey, apple blossom, sherry and marmalade. Oily, nutty and a touch of oak.

Name: Ardbeg 1978
Palate: Beautifully balanced herbal notes. Coffee beans. Cut hay, full-bodied. Woody.
Finish: Long, becomes very spicy and oaked.
Nose: Full, slightly herbal. Notes of brine and peat smoke, espresso beans, fresh lime and cedar wood. Vanilla spice and a little toasty oak.

Name: Scallywag The Chocolate Edition
Palate: Brown sugar, chocolate peanuts, sultana, a pinch of cinnamon and black pepper.
Finish: Caramelised fruit, coffee bean, and of course, yet more chocolatey richness.
Nose: Chocolate mousse, dates, a hint of honey lending a vanilla note.

Name: Benromach Organic
Palate: Oaked, oily. Toffee sweetness with freshly cut overripe fruit. Toasty spice.
Finish: Wood shavings, quite fresh.
Nose: Woody, spicy and malty. Some caramel and resin.

Name: Lochlea Fallow Edition
Palate: Dried prunes and figs, spiced fruitcake, earthy grist, and twists of aniseed.
Finish: Dark treacle, drizzles of honey, and winter spices.
Nose: Plenty of sherry character, with juicy plums, poached apple, and warm pancakes.

Name: Arran Machrie Moor
Palate: A burst of lychee juice as it opens, before waves of dry smoke and cut grass appear.
Finish: Lingering orange zest and lemongrass.
Nose: Peppery malt with a hint of baked earth sneaking in there. Balanced by orchard fruit and eucalyptus.

Name: Balblair 1997
Palate: Sweet, a little earthen quality with a fruity robustness. More vanilla, but now creamier, and gently infused with the oak.
Finish: Silken with warm pastries.
Nose: Crisp, herbal, berries and barley, nutty vanilla.

Name: Limitless
Palate: Racy and vibrant, though unhurried and muted. It exudes agitated calmness at every step.
Finish: A medium-to-long-to-short finish which continues on and on and on and on... Limitless.
Nose: An exciting nose, joined by expressive and vivacious notes. A subtle elegance develops in the glass.

Name: Ardbeg 23 Year Old - Twenty Something
Palate: At first, rich chocolate flavours combine with a silky mouthfeel. The second sip begins with more chocolate, then something deeper â vanilla pods and intense dried fruits glide into pine needles and pine smoke. Then finally, more chocolate, this time rich chocolate covered raisins.
Finish: Herbal notes and incense create a long, lingering finish, rounded off with a hint of spice.
Nose: Initial bursts of vanilla cream, sweet wood smoke and antique furniture mingle with sweet bubble gum, roasted pinecones and chocolate. On the second nose, fresh tropical fruits are infused with deeper chocolate and sherry led notes. A splash of water releases robust flavours of smoke, creosote and coal tar, followed by medicinal notes and ripe mangos.

Name: Ardbeg Renaissance 10 Year Old
Palate: Sharp and smoky, there is a lanolin coating and a big, potent peat exuding exceptional balance.
Finish: Long with good character, a bitter edge creeps in with a nuttiness and moist cocoa.
Nose: Big and medicinal, with an iodine-like quality and a full richness with gentle citric notes.

Name: Glen Elgin 7 Year Old 2014 - Piper (Fable Whisky)
Palate: Chocolatey as it opens, before hints of cut grass, clementine, and baking spices take shape.
Finish: Lemon peel, brown sugar, a hint of cedar.
Nose: Pear drops, dried apple, a subtly flinty hint with some nutmeg spiciness building.

Name: Springbank 26 Year Old 1991 Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: That tangy citrus carries through, with sugared lemon peels tamed by soft praline and candied almonds.
Finish: Pine oil rests in the distance, with sultanas and pressed grapes, and dense maple roasted pecans.
Nose: Plenty of zest with hints of lemon drizzle cake, and ginger-studded cookies. Barley sugar sweeties, a touch of vanilla, and lemon curd gather.

Name: Sonoma Distilling Co. Cherrywood Rye
Palate: Redcurrant and blackberry, clove, hints of stem ginger developing.
Finish: Waxy orange, toasted nuts, more brown sugar, white pepper.
Nose: Cinnamon, cooked fruit and a whiff of burnt brown sugar.

Name: Azabu Pure Malt
Palate: More grassy barley, a slow build of sherry-soaked raisin sweetness paired with fresh citrus, another kick of black pepper.
Finish: Gingersnaps and mint leaf.
Nose: Nutty, grassy malt arrives first, supported by touches of cinnamon and black pepper.

Name: Mars Tsunuki The First
Palate: Still quite nutty, with more almonds and not chocolate peanuts. White grape, crisp apple and toffee.
Finish: It remains fruity on the finish, though subtly drying with cinnamon and peppercorn.
Nose: Sultana, almond, dry oak, ripe cherry and some spicy ginger.

Name: Rock Oyster
Palate: Yet more sea breeze, with oat cake crumbs, growing spicy notes of cracked black pepper and a deft whiff of peat smoke. Hints of vanilla here and there.
Finish: Salinity lasts on the finish along with peppery warmth.
Nose: Wind-swept beaches, coastal peat and a hint of ash, complimented by touches of green fruit.

Name: Bowmore No.1
Palate: Vanilla notes are up front and sweet (though earthy vanilla pod does appear after a minute). Plenty of coastal peat smoke.
Finish: Lingering smokiness.
Nose: Nutella on brown bread, sea salt and a hint of lemon zest.

Name: Yamazaki Sherry Cask
Palate: Mouth puckering balance with cocoa, prunes, plums, sweet sherry. Chocolate.
Finish: Long and balanced. Cocoa, toffee, aniseed, plums and dates.
Nose: Sweet and ripe. Very fruity and rich with notes of prunes, dates, espresso beans, ginger, sherry, spices.

Name: Hawkshead English Whisky
Palate: Malty, with baking spices and layers of caramel.
Finish: Tannic oak notes last on the finish.
Nose: Fruit Salad sweeties with a touch of oak warmth.

Name: Campbeltown 8 Year Old 2014 - North Star Spirits
Palate: Jammy red fruits and tannic oak tangle, with dates, dried cherries, and currants supported by biscuity barley.
Finish: Nutty malt, leathery oak, and more stewed red fruits are joined by sweet baking spice.
Nose: Heaps of soft fruit, syrupy flapjack, and vanilla cream with drizzles of syrup and sugared shortbread.

Name: Wolfburn Ukraine Appeal
Palate: Layers of fruit with more tangy citrus balanced by sweet prunes, figs, and dates. Nutty malt builds with a good helping of baking spice in tow.
Finish: Burnt sugar, vanilla cream, and candied fruit linger, with charred oak and a prickle of pepper in the distance.
Nose: Zesty peels with sharp lemon and sweeter orange, backed up by fresh oak and fragrant vanilla pod.

Name: Highland Park Valkyrie
Palate: Plump dried fruits are complimented by vanilla, dried apple and waves of smoke and wood spice.
Finish: Liquorice and more fruit too, plus a return of some chocolatey notes.
Nose: Chocolate and some nutmeg off the bat before the smoke develops, balanced by dried apricot, plum and, increasingly, zesty orange too.

Name: Singleton of Dufftown Tailfire
Palate: Raspberry bush, more Wensleydale. Oats, vanilla and a hint of pepper.
Finish: Drying and hot rod with lip smacking fruitiness.
Nose: Crisp apple, red grape, raspberry and candied orange peel all jump out. A grassy green note and Wensleydale & Cranberry maintain balance whilst a touch of tobacco develops over time.

Name: Ardbeg 1974 Provenance
Palate: Herbal and very complex palate with fiery peat smoke and citrus zest. Bitter lime juice, caramel, toasted teacakes and cocoa powder. Hints of curry spice and cardamom.
Finish: Very long finish with hints of burnt sugar, black pepper and mixed spices.
Nose: Spiced, rich nose with notes of baked apple and cinnamon. Hints of beeswax, potpourri and iodine. A little furniture polish, dried apricot, sticking plasters and parsley.

Name: Compass Box Menagerie
Palate: More forest floor notes on the palate, now with layers of honeyed barley and tangy tropical fruit for balance. Smoke surrounds it all, plus a hint of new leather.
Finish: Meaty malt, dried mango, a final waft of subtly spicy smoke.
Nose: Earthy peat with a hint of tarry rope tucked away, cooked orchard fruit, a whiff of damp oak and petrichor.

Name: Blair Athol 11 Year Old 2011 (cask 19614) - Old Malt Cask (Hunter Laing)
Palate: Toasted brown sugar, salty butter, a little espresso coffee, and hints of sugary porridge on the tail.
Finish: Vanilla custard and gingerbread.
Nose: Dried apricots, acacia honey, vanilla, and caramel.

Name: Tomatin 2015 - Skene Whisky
Palate: Spice continues with cinnamon and liquorice, rich dried fruit, orange peels and oaken vanilla.
Finish: Dry on the finish, the spices stick around alongside currant buns and stewed berries.
Nose: Butter fudge and green apples, chocolate Malted Milk biscuits, and bold baking spice.

Name: Yushan Blended Malt
Palate: Creamy vanilla and tangy orange, joined by rounded malt and buttery biscuit.
Finish: Coffee bean, orange again and a slightly floral hint lingering right at the end.
Nose: Sultana, pineapple chunks, thyme honey and some spicy nutmeg.

Name: Rampur Single Malt Whisky
Palate: Tropical fruits, more rich vanilla, apple and a touch of pepper.
Finish: Long and quite drying.
Nose: Thyme honey, dried apricot, cinnamon and vanilla custard.

Name: anCnoc 1998
Palate: Fruity at first but develops into lemon sherbert, and towards the finish there is a little bit of peat swirling around.
Finish: Chocolate eclairs and yellow jelly babies.
Nose: Honey, lemon and vanilla, just like a hot toddy.

Name: Amrut Spectrum 004
Palate: Sandalwood and more vanilla appear among caraway, blackberry jam, and coconut cream.
Finish: Dried fruit and vanilla sponge remain.
Nose: Dried mango and vanilla lead with star anise, burnt oak, vanilla, and caramel in support.

Name: The Singleton of Glendullan Classic
Palate: Green apple sharpness, mellowed by yet more full-bodied vanilla.
Finish: A touch of ginger appears late.
Nose: Aromatic malt, earthy vanilla, light sawdust.

Name: Glen Moray 1959
Palate: Medium, stewed fruits, spice, malmsey, pears, apple, dried peels.
Finish: Oak, apple peels.
Nose: Medium, smooth. Fresh, farmy. Cut hay, herbal. soft oak, barley, hay. Dried fruits, a soft smoke.

Name: Chivas Regal Ultis
Palate: Rounded fruit notes all the way throughout (poached pears, clementines and a touch of persimmon). Slight drying notes of fresh barley.
Finish: Sugared peels, dark chocolate and a pinch of ginger.
Nose: Richly honey'd, with a kick of fiery cinnamon underneath. Tinned peaches and crumbly fudge.

Name: The Macallan Estate Reserve
Palate: Spices, nutmeg, cinnamon, rich sherry, cocoa, coffee beans and caramel.
Finish: Citrus, potpourri, malt, berry fruits, toasted walnuts, almond oil.
Nose: Sherry on the nose, sweet Olosoro, pepper, berry fruits, calves leather and cedar wood.

Name: anCnoc 2002
Palate: Waves of honey milky coffee, with yet more creamy lemon following shortly after.
Finish: A subtly hoppy bitterness - paired with the orange peel notes, it's somewhat reminiscent of an IPA.
Nose: Fresh citrus peels and a hint of pineapple. Spicy malt with a pinch of vanilla.

Name: Auchentoshan Springwood 1l
Palate: Chocolatey on the palate, with continued vanilla fudge and citrus peels.
Finish: A rather refreshing palate of lemon and orange.
Nose: Light and fragrant with classic bourbon-cask vanilla and honey, with hints of orange oil shining through.

Name: Peat - Elements of Islay
Palate: Fruity barbecue notes, kiwi, a little hot with more smoke building.
Finish: Smoky cinnamon apples and a touch of brine.
Nose: Citrus, smoky barley, sea air and a touch of bacon.

Name: Dewar's Double Double 32 Year Old
Palate: Manuka honey, orange peel, strawberry jam, Christmas spices, and old oak furniture too.
Finish: Treacle and a little mint leaf.
Nose: Stewed plums and stem ginger are joined by old leather, brown sugar, and clove.

Name: Dalmore 25 Year Old
Palate: Madagascan vanilla pods, thick treacle toffee and chocolate truffles.
Finish: Maple syrup, dark chocolate and spiced gingerbread.
Nose: Exotic fruits, citrus, vanilla pods, treacle toffee and fig cake.

Name: anCnoc Peatlands
Palate: Vegetal though slightly refreshing. Wafts of fresh, leafy herbs and pinches of peat, with a hint of cooking spice at its core.
Finish: A subtle sweetness lasts on the medium finish.
Nose: Elegant peat smoke, light and earthy. Vanilla, honey and waxy apples. A little bit floral.

Name: Glen Grant 22 Year Old 1998 (cask 13212) - Lady of the Glen (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: A slow build of apple, raisin oatmeal cookies, cinnamon and milky coffee.
Finish: Pencil shavings, chocolate and black pepper.
Nose: Shortbread, caramel, a hint of lemongrass and menthol.

Name: Glenlossie 10 Year Old (casks 5704, 7124 & 1598) - Small Batch (James Eadie)
Palate: Chocolate fudge, orange curd, caramel, and spiced nuts.
Finish: Coffee and walnut cake, a pinch of tobacco, and cinnamon.
Nose: Almond croissant, runny honey, fresh hay, and stewed blueberries.

Name: Glen Scotia Victoriana
Palate: More fruit forward on the nose, with dark berry juiciness at its core.
Finish: Orchard fruits dusted with dark chocolate.
Nose: Elegantly oak-y, with notes of toasty sugar and citrus peels.

Name: Ardmore Tradition 1l
Palate: Lots of barley and cereal notes, oodles of rich bourbon, smoke and peat still present. Charming interplay through the caramel sweetness and the vanilla spiced oak.
Finish: Has a sharp edge, more caramel and sugary barley notes and a lanolin smoothness and more tapering smoke.
Nose: Full of caramel. Toasted oak is evident and rich and just the faintest peat has muscled its way through.

Name: Scallywag Year of The Dog
Palate: Chewy raisins and thick honey, with a touch of cacao bitterness underneath. Some red chilli, too.
Finish: Christmas cake sweetness and a hearty pour of runny caramel.
Nose: Dates, mint chocolate, rum-raisin ice cream and some strawberry freshness.

Name: Talisker Neist Point
Palate: More of the same on the palate, which is no bad thing, with pear drops and fennel seed welcome additions.
Finish: Sweet smoke, sweet spice, slightly drying. Very long.
Nose: Caramel, toasted sweet spices, vanilla and, as with many of the newer Taliskers, definite smoke.

Name: Bivrost Jotunheim
Palate: Chocolatey once again, with a touch of hoppy brightness along the way. Still wonderfully malty.
Finish: Milky coffee and a hint of earthy spice.
Nose: Honeycomb, dense malt, with layers of dark chocolate and red fruit.

Name: Lord Calvert Canadian Whisky
Palate: Warming and peppery, drying oak, more vanilla, grapefruit and orchard fruit.
Finish: Drying and spicy.
Nose: Corn, vanilla, maple syrup, spiritous fruit.

Name: Amrut Fusion X
Palate: The tropical notes continue, alongside heaps of dried baking fruits and spices. Creamy wafts of vanilla, salted almonds, and crumbly fudge soften underlying notes of menthol and earthen peat smoke.
Finish: A brilliant balance of sweet fruit cake, warming spice, and pungent peat.
Nose: Tangy notes of juicy, tropical fruits with grilled pineapple and candied mango. Crushed nuts, flaky pastry, and salted caramel with rich, oaken depth.

Name: Edradour Highland Heritage
Palate: Mint chocolate and intense raisin sweetness, though balanced by subtly floral malt.
Finish: Oak-y spice and summer berries.
Nose: Dried barley, chocolate chips, redcurrants and figs.

Name: Wolfburn Love Potion
Palate: Cinnamon and nutmeg, with chocolate chip cookie and raisin developing later on.
Finish: Dry oak balanced by sweet sultana.
Nose: Marzipan, orange zest, barley, and blackberry jam on slightly singed toast.

Name: anCnoc Blas
Palate: Plum, peach, a touch of leather, lemongrass, yuzu and honeysuckle.
Finish: More fragrant fruit, orange peel and dark chocolate.
Nose: Citrus and honeycomb, boiled sweets, cinnamon and praline.

Name: Loch Lomond Signature
Palate: More dried fruit on the palate, with layers of vanilla and pepper.
Finish: Light and refreshing with citrus peels.
Nose: Chocolate covered raisins, yellow plums and a waft of aromatic tea.

Name: Peatreekers Double Standard
Palate: Milk chocolate, orange, sawdust, earthy peat and a light whiff of floral malt.
Finish: Fresh vanilla pod, lemon peel and lasting toasty barley.
Nose: Fragrant oak-y smoke followed by honey-coated cereal and a touch of rye bread.

Name: Four Roses Bourbon (1L)
Palate: Balanced, rich palate entry with marmalade and acacia honey. Cinnamon, lemon and oak.
Finish: Oaky, spiced finish.
Nose: Sweet, creamy aromas. Hints of Seville orange marmalade and lemon zest. A hint of corn sweetness and caramel.

Name: Wire Works Double Oak Port
Palate: Chocolate raisins, flaked, toasted almonds, dried cherries, and berries, with elegant layers of tannic oak and crackles of smoked peppercorns.
Finish: A hint of hibiscus and rooibos tea bring a sweet, woody finish with more cooked red fruit, softly smoky embers, and a dusting of cacao.
Nose: Cinnamon buns drizzled with runny icing, followed by candied fruit and dense, dark caramel. A touch of peppery oak and dark cherry chocolate rest beneath.

Name: Dalmore Regalis 1l
Palate: Honeyed red fruit, almond slice, cinnamon and touches of blackcurrant.
Finish: Sweet caramel latte.
Nose: Stewed fruit, vanilla, orange, light caramel and bakewell.

Name: Loch Ness Malt Whisky
Palate: Toast, digestive biscuits and fresh cut grass.
Finish: Dry hay with a hint of smoke seeping through.
Nose: Star fruit and parma violet candy.

Name: anCnoc Rascan
Palate: Peat is more pronounced on the palate, though well balanced with handfuls of sweet vanilla. A touch of old leather, too.
Finish: Light and elegant as it ends, the last hint of smoke slowly fading out.
Nose: Honey and orange (perhaps a little bit of apple too), complimented by developing, earthy peat smoke.

Name: Dalmore Gran Reserva
Palate: Medium, cream. Notes of orange and zest, herbs and spices; star anise, fennel, chamomile and orange blossom. Fudge.
Finish: Medium to short. Malty, salty butter, cocoa.
Nose: malty toast with jam and butter, marmalade too, filter coffee and tobacco (not breakfast for everyone).

Name: anCnoc Barrow
Palate: Smoke builds, with a bit more oak-y warmth to it compared to the nose. Sweetness falls into the background.
Finish: Continued peat embers.
Nose: Rich, smoky peat arrives first, joined by orange segments, sliced apples and a scoop of coffee ice-cream with toffee sauce.

Name: Golden Horse Musashi
Palate: Soft notes of apple, pear and pineapple, with a core of earthy vanilla pod.
Finish: Chewy barley notes linger.
Nose: Ripe banana, a hint of oatcake, coffee bean and wet grass.

Name: Ardmore Triple Wood
Palate: Peppery peat develops more on the palate, paired with raisins and robust vanilla.
Finish: A dry smoky finish.
Nose: Chocolate digestives, honey, red berries and a subtle whiff of peat.

Name: Glenrothes Three Decades
Palate: Vanilla cream and orange Starburst, with woody spices.
Finish: A touch of nutmeg and more of that honey.
Nose: Set honey and citrus curd, with polished wood and candied peels.

Name: Bruichladdich The Organic 2010
Palate: Butterscotch, barley sugar, boiled apple sweeties, chocolate, macaroon, freshly baked bread and spicy oak.
Finish: Oak char and orange chocolate alongside a maritime finish with a touch of salt.
Nose: Loads of fresh malt, with lemon curd, toasted marshmallow, tropical fruit and floral heathy alongside buttery pear tart.

Name: Lark Single Cask Whisky
Palate: Big and bold, with plenty of sweetness, and a curious, oily peat which builds to a crescendo atop chili, toffee apples and malt.
Finish: Decent length, with vanilla sweetness and Christmas spices. Toffee again, with spicy oak and smoke.
Nose: Very malty, spicy nose, with big notes of dried fruit, especially dates, figs and sultanas. A touch of nutmeg, cinnamon and black pepper heat, with a suggestion of smoke.

Name: anCnoc Rutter
Palate: The apple now becomes fruity boiled sweets, and on into bubblegum, all sat on a cloud of smoke. Slightly chocolatey too.
Finish: Still relatively light but now there are notes of tobacco and leather too.
Nose: Yep, there's peat in there alright. Soon though, we're into lemon and nuttiness, then spice, Earl Gray tea, oat biscuits, and yes, pineapple chunks. Vanilla develops, as do green apple slices.

Name: Golden Horse Bushu
Palate: Crunchy cereals, honey, those edible flowers you get with fancy meals, hazelnuts.
Finish: Vanilla and sandalwood last on the finish.
Nose: Subtly perfumed peaty notes, with layers of creamy caramel and sweet porridge.

Name: Bunnahabhain 8 Year Old 2013 MÃ²ine Bordeaux Finish - FÃ¨is Ãle 2021
Palate: Oily barley and barbecue notes open the way with smoked almonds and thick maple syrup. Salted chocolate and summer fruits emerge while peppery spice and medicinal herbs nestle in the depths.
Finish: Smouldering ashes and sweet, vinous fruits intertwine, with a pinch of cocoa and flaked chilli heat.
Nose: Jammy berries and cherries bring a layer of sweetness to bold, meaty malt and coastal bonfire smoke.

Name: The Macallan Edition No.3
Palate: Sweet fruit, vanilla and rich fruit cake with suggestions of apricot, pear and crisp green apple. Hints of ginger and cinnamon are balanced with a light resinous oak finale.
Finish: Long, sweet and fruity, leaving a lasting impression on the senses.
Nose: Reminiscent of a fine fragrance, the nose leads with vanilla ice cream, fresh cut oak and delicate florals. Orange oil provides subtle grandeur while ginger, cinnamon and nutmeg flit in and out in various guises. Vanilla imparts sweetness, leading citrus fruits forward then allowing chocolate to show. Burnished oak delivers a soft ending.

Name: White Walker by Johnnie Walker
Palate: More vanilla again, this time paired with cinnamon and almond. Hints of fresh cherry and cut oak heat.
Finish: Lingering peppery malt and festive spices.
Nose: Soft hints of orange Fruit Pastilles and dried apricot. Toffee, vanilla pod and ginger snaps.

Name: Glenfarclas - Movember 2011
Palate: Starts off big with just a smidge of sweetness before the savoury Fino takes over. An almost saline note creeps through before moving into blue agave tequila, with a hint of lime zest bitterness.
Finish: Dries out, with freshly-shaved oak, Christmas spices, and a touch of pine. Very moreish.
Nose: A whiff of salted almonds is overtaken by sherry â somewhere between Manzanilla and Fino â surprising, since this was matured solely in Oloroso. With warmth applied, the caramel-rich Oloroso starts to come through, with a hint of Brazil nut shell.

Name: Hakushu Bourbon Barrel
Palate: Creamy and thick with banana split, butterscotch and barrel char upfront. Hints of smoke, alongside melon and pineapple. A little allspice develops.
Finish: Fruity and tangy with porridge oats and golden syrup.
Nose: Creamy and sweet, some lemon drizzle cake and black forest honey, a litle coconut milk and buttery toffee. A touch of cooked banana and guava too.

Name: Mortlach Special Strength
Palate: Valencia orange, Crunchie bars (honeycomb and chocolate), tobacco and continued meaty notes.
Finish: A little wisp of smoke and apricot sweetness.
Nose: Big vanilla pod, chewy raisin and a good touch of meatiness.

Name: Timorous Beastie 18 Year Old
Palate: Packed with barley and vanilla, joined by a crackle of black pepper and cinnamon.
Finish: Spices linger, as does chocolate ice-cream.
Nose: Richly honey'd, with a touch of grilled apricot underneath.

Name: The Macallan Gold - 1824 Series
Palate: Citrus and boiled sweets rule the palate, along with hints of ginger and cinnamon, while soft oak tones reveal toasted apples.
Finish: The finish is medium sweet, malty and slightly dry.
Nose: This burnished gold spirit presents a lemon citrus nose, the orange peel and an interlacing sweetness that softens but doesn't eliminate the zest. A quiet note of vanilla is followed by dark chocolate - more assertive, yet not overly so - with a lingering floral and light oak notes.

Name: The Epicurean Glasgow Edition
Palate: Heavy with vanilla and Victoria sponge cake. Grassy at points. Mint leaf herbaceousness.
Finish: Subtly chocolatey on the finish.
Nose: Fresh barley and zesty lemon top notes, backed up by a whiff of peppery rye bread.

Name: Glasgow 1770 - Triple Distilled Gift Pack with 2x Glasses
Palate: Fresh orchard fruit arrives first - think green pear and apricot. Soft malt, sugary coffee and subtle spicy flashes of caraway.
Finish: Honey on brioche and cut grass on the finish.
Nose: Teacakes, candied peels, a few whiffs of well-roasted coffee and flaky pastry.

Name: IrishAmerican Classic Blend
Palate: Buttery at first, with hints of sugared peels and herbaceous oak developing underneath.
Finish: Milky coffee and sharp apple.
Nose: Gentle and slightly floral, with underlying butterscotch sweetness.

Name: Benriach Heart of Speyside
Palate: Rounded smoothness. Marmalade. Gentle smoke, earthy peat somewhere in the substrata.
Finish: Peppery oak develops.
Nose: Fresh. Cut hay, acacia honey. Damp earth, spicy.

Name: Mortlach 15 Year Old 2007 (cask 8) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Sticky ginger cake, walnut loaf, and flamed orange peel.
Finish: Polished oak, black pepper, and toffee and raisin sweetness.
Nose: Fresh tobacco, gingersnap biscuits, toast, and dark treacle.

Name: Highland Malt Stag
Palate: Grainy, cut hay, barley.
Finish: Short, warming.
Nose: Clean, malty, spirity.

Name: Amrut Raj Igala
Palate: Honey'd fruit and peat smoke, with a crack of black pepper.
Finish: Lasting warmth of peat and a subtly sweet touch of liquorice.
Nose: Opens with pear and peach. Developing notes of toasted oak stave and vanilla-rich barley.

Name: anCnoc Flaughter
Palate: Big and mouth coating with peat, barley, white peach and toffee, then fennel and a hint of mint.
Finish: Long. Nice and sooty to start with, nutty too, before medicinal iodine and more smoke emerge.
Nose: Oilier and a little fatter than the Rutter, with linseed, peanut skins, coffee and soot. Blackcurrant and then caramel emerge along with a touch of salinity.

Name: anCnoc Stack
Palate: Lemon cheesecake with a thick biscuit base, dark chocolate, earthy peat smoke growing as it develops.
Finish: Still quite fruity, though well balanced with the peat smoke.
Nose: Vegetal oak, honey'd cereals and a helping of flamed orange peels.

Name: Highland Park Valfather
Palate: Simultaneously huge and yet elegant, the palate is beautifully integrated. Layers of creamy vanilla, apricot yoghurt and a helping of crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e interplay with notes of incense burners, iron and salted almonds. Then thereâs bitter orange marmalade, charred wood and dried earth among touches of cacao powder, toffee apples and smoked paprika.
Finish: Long and confident. The floral smoke lingers for an age but is offset by tropical fruit and black pepper.
Nose: Robust, but refined smoke fills the nose initially followed by delicate vanilla, Conference pears, green apple skins and a heady, heavy floral richness. Underneath thereâs cedarwood, honeycomb, spice from black pepper and nutmeg, as well as salted caramel before the heathery peat makes itself known. A sprightly sea breeze note emerges with time.

Name: Reference Series II
Palate: Big, satisfying entry with plenty of classic Sherry influence, herbal and malty with cherries and chocolate.
Finish: Rich oak, chocolate and fantastic creamy Black Forest gÃ¢teau.
Nose: Juicy and honeyed with sweet barley and orange. Hugely buttery and quite meaty, extremely well-rounded. Nettle, buttercups, oak, cakey-ness and a little pepper.

Name: Highland Park 1994
Palate: Dried fruits, notably dates and raisins, smoke, toffee and a smidgen of cinnamon.
Finish: A long smoky finish with flavours from the palate making welcome encores.
Nose: Almonds and caramel with plenty of figs and cherries to provide substance.

Name: Bruichladdich Rocks - 2nd Edition
Palate: More red fruits (think strawberries again but now with some cherry and raspberry in the mix). Slight hints of coastal breeze.
Finish: Medium length, with sea air and barley sugar lingering.
Nose: Brown sugar and cinnamon, followed by a heaped spoonfuls of strawberry jam.

Name: Glenallachie Distillery Edition
Palate: Oodles of vanilla, with a zesty kick of fresh citrus at the centre.
Finish: Fruity esters last long on the finish.
Nose: Caramel-dipped apples and pears, with hints of brown sugar and digestive biscuits.

Name: anCnoc Cutter
Palate: you've got the sooty, smoky peat, you've got bundles of apple, peach and orange, and then you've got plenty of creamy vanilla. It's all balanced and blends together well.
Finish: Long and oily with smokiness simmering to the end.
Nose: Wafts of iodine, ash and smoke, joined by toffee-dipped peaches and cake-y vanilla sweetness.

Name: Dalmore Valour 1l
Palate: Chocolatey and rich, with treacle and malt loaf. Despite all this decadence, it still shows off some lightly qualities with golden barley and a touch of nutmeg.
Finish: Long and warm - plenty of orange aromas and cinnamon.
Nose: Crumbly shortbread drizzled with toffee and dotted with plump raisins. Deeper notes of candied orange peels.

Name: Hibiki 12 Year Old
Palate: Crushed almonds, stewed fruits, clove-studded oranges. Sherried malt and a subtle core of oak.
Finish: Bright and flavoursome with crisp apple and citrus.
Nose: Juicy marmalade with real chunks of orange, cooked apples dusted with cinnamon, thick honey and plum wine.

Name: Smokehead Extra Rare 1l
Palate: Big, spicy peat - warm slabs of the stuff. Thick smoke, coal tar and iodine, a little honey, lemon zest and sticking plasters.
Finish: Long and smoky with toffee brittle and tangy fruits.
Nose: Sherry and malt, thick plumes of cool maritime smoke, barley, tar and old ropes on the beach.

Name: Scallywag The Winter Edition 2020
Palate: A dusting of cocoa supports bramble fruit and home-made cherry jam, along with sherried dried fruits.
Finish: Melted milk chocolate and seasonal spices linger.
Nose: Gingerbread and chocolate-coated raisin alongside bittersweet dark chocolate.

Name: Kilchoman Am BÃ¹rach
Palate: Lemon bon-bons and red liquorice, savoury basil and roasted barley, cassia and black pepper.
Finish: Just a whiff of coastal air on the finish, with continued red berry brightness.
Nose: Honeycomb, red apples, smoky turf earthiness, summer berry tart with extra thick double cream.

Name: Bn7 - Elements of Islay (Bunnahabhain)
Palate: Christmas spices and salted butter. Plenty of barley, too.
Finish: Tangy red berries and creamy vanilla.
Nose: Irish coffee, raisin and a helping of cinnamon.

Name: Hellyers Road Peated 2004
Palate: The exotic fruitiness continues, bringing balance to a depth of herbal, vegetal zest, and bonfire smoke.
Finish: Sweet caramel and boozy trifle with wafts of coastal salinity and rich, oily peat smoke.
Nose: Tropical fruits lead the way with grilled pineapple and tangy passion fruit, floral malt, and medicinal peat follow with tangy spice.

Name: Big Peat at Christmas 2020
Palate: Loads of smoke and soot, with a kick of peppercorn and cooling mint leaf.
Finish: Salty peat smoke lasts long on the finish.
Nose: Toasted cedar and BBQ meat, with lighter hints of green apple hiding in there.

Name: Ardbeg Drum - Committee Release
Palate: Dried fruit soaked in rum, stem ginger, mint imperial sweeties, fiery peat and a waft of coastal salinity.
Finish: Toasted brown sugar, red chilli chocolate and a juicy hint of papaya.
Nose: Roasted pine, fresh vanilla pod, meaty malt, fried banana and spicy clove.

Name: Balblair 2004 (bottled 2017)
Palate: More honey balanced by dried berries, tobacco and spice alongside vanilla sweetness and more dark chocolate.
Finish: Lengthy and warming with a balanced bitterness.
Nose: Raisins, honey, leather and gingersnap biscuits, with green apple, liquorice and dark chocolate.

Name: Glenmorangie Madeira Wood Finish
Palate: Butterscotch, manuka honey, malt and fruit gums, apple juice, caramel, salted butter and chocolate.
Finish: Long and spiced, creamy and very fruity.
Nose: Sweet and sticky aromas, with hints of fresh, tangy citrus, dates and plums, stewed fruits, apple sauce and pepper.

Name: Copper Republic Single Grain Whisky
Palate: Creamy vanilla leads into maple-cured bacon, fresh peach and sponge cake.
Finish: Milky coffee lingers and wood spice on a dry finish.
Nose: Buttered (and slightly burnt) popcorn, with oak char and sticky honey and hoisin sauce.

Name: Octomore 13.2 5 Year Old
Palate: Hickory smoke, with almond brittle, candied citrus peels, and warm spices building.
Finish: Campfires and forest floor, with sherry character lingering.
