Nose: Smoked almonds, with plenty of jammy, dried fruit character coming from the sherry. The earthy peat smoke has taken on a sweet, barbecue character, with spicy plum pudding, and oily orange zest.

Name: Lagavulin 10 Year Old
Palate: Sweet and salty, with a good kick of chilli pepper, followed by roasted almond and more smoke.
Finish: A creamy, smoky, spicy finish.
Nose: A sea breeze runs throughout rock salt, ripe apple, burnt sugar and maritime peat smoke.

Name: Lp9 - Elements of Islay (Laphroaig)
Palate: Sea salt and kippers, dark chocolate, continued medicinal peat and fresh red fruit.
Finish: Drying smoke and coastal air linger.
Nose: Brandied cherries, TCP, menthol and smoke.

Name: Big Peat at Christmas 2019
Palate: Juicy stone fruit and more caramel. Still plenty smoky, with loads of toasty peat wafts.
Finish: Ash, drying baking spice and another helping of sea breeze.
Nose: Burnt wood and salted caramel, with a whiff of sea air.

Name: Kilkerran 16 Year Old
Palate: A touch of dried apricot leads into earthy peat, with peppery spice, biscuits, more herbs and a hint of brine.
Finish: Stone mineral notes balanced by ash and waxy peels.
Nose: Lemon shortbread and zest, with white flowers, cut grass and dried kitchen herbs.

Name: Talisker 8 Year Old (Special Release 2021)
Palate: Lots of black pepper with smoke, heather and honey notes and peaches.
Finish: Black pepper and chilli with a little caramel. Long and fiery.
Nose: Sweet notes initially, vanilla and sponge cake and then bonfires on the beach with salty seaweed notes. Thereâs stone fruit fruitiness here too.

Name: Mackmyra Moment - Prestige
Palate: Surprisingly earthy and vegetal at first, but soon enough develops layers of sponge cake, honey and white fruit.
Finish: Cedar, tomato stem and honeydew melon.
Nose: Apricot, cherry, almond and a touch of toasted brioche.

Name: Lg12 - Elements of Islay (Lagavulin)
Palate: Meaty malt and barbecue smoke welcome the way for hearty layers of warming cooking spice, and sweet baked pastry.
Finish: Peat smoke lingers, with woody liquorice, clove, and a touch of smoked, floral tea.
Nose: Classic notes of Frazzles, smoked nuts, and gooey toffee, with a whiff of floral honey.

Name: Woven Experience No.5
Palate: Fruitcake, vanilla pod earthiness, nutmeg, cigar box, and a touch of mint leaf.
Finish: Freshly baked bread, lots of honey, and a hint of orange marmalade.
Nose: Fragrant with crisp oak spice, dried fruit, buttery pastries, orange peel, aniseed, hints of cedar, and bonfire smoke.

Name: Glenrothes 1994 (bottled 2008)
Palate: Dried fruit and diced almonds, pink peppercorn, buttery brioche and a some dry hickory.
Finish: Toffee and milk chocolate notes stick around on the finish.
Nose: Apple orchards, honey on rye toast and a whiff of vanilla blossom.

Name: Amrut Kadhambam - Third Edition
Palate: A drizzle of honey alongside very dark chocolate, balanced by sweet notes of vanilla and ginger loaf cake.
Finish: Black pepper appears, with oak char, cigar box and more cinnamon.
Nose: Caramel digestives, fresh malt, apricot jam and cinnamon butter, with oak spice.

Name: anCnoc RÃ¹dhan
Palate: Burnt oak staves tempered by layers of honey and golden syrup. Fruit Salad sweeties and citrus peels.
Finish: Golden Grahams, cinnamon and light wafts of earthy smoke.
Nose: Toasted grains and fried banana, with underlying black pepper warmth.

Name: Mackmyra Moment - 22
Palate: A slow build of toasty spices and maybe even a little hint of coastal peat minerality, plus waves of thick honey and sherry.
Finish: Lingering oily barley, dried pear and caraway notes.
Nose: Buttery and oaky, with a layer of blueberry preserve and some liquorice brightness.

Name: Milk & Honey 2018 (bottled 2022) (cask 858) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Rich and viscous with dark chocolate, black cherry, nutmeg, and earthy malt.
Finish: Orange peel, red grape skin, and oaky spice.
Nose: Stem ginger and sweet tobacco are joined by dried apricot and mango pieces as well as a hint of espresso and bonfire smoke.

Name: Auchentoshan 12 Year Old
Palate: Oaky and sweet palate, with barley sugar, a little passion fruit and vanilla custard too. Perhaps some rose petal jelly in there.
Finish: A lengthy, dry and oaky finish with barley sweetness and cocoa powder.
Nose: A cereal-sweet nose with notes of guava and mango, with a drizzle of honey.

Name: Glentauchers 6 Year Old - Founder's Collection (The Whisky Baron)
Palate: Winter spices, with syrupy figs, fruitcake, and toasty granola.
Finish: A touch of liquorice, with some dark chocolate.
Nose: Rich and malty, with barley sugar, and cocoa powder.

Name: Balvenie 30 Year Old
Palate: Warming and rich. A sweet honey develops, vanilla, a hint of cigar leaf with nutty Sherry and a faint hint of smoke or malty peat.
Finish: The finish is long and honeyed, subtly fading away with floral and fruity hints.
Nose: Round and complex with a gentle development of floral honey. Nutty and oily with allspice aplenty.

Name: Amrut Madeira Cask Finish
Palate: Rounded nutty toffee, stewed orchard fruits and manuka honey, with toasted almonds underneath.
Finish: Long, with some delicate citrus notes.
Nose: Desiccated coconut, creamy vanilla and rich toffee, with a little marzipan and bitter orange.

Name: Craigellachie (cask WG222) - Ainneamh
Palate: Sweet floral blossom, zesty citrus, nutty bread, and a lasting oily texture.
Finish: An array of spices continues with sweet cinnamon, nutmeg, and prickly pepper, balanced by buttery pear.
Nose: Oily oak with a touch of mixed spice and herbaceous malt.

Name: Glenglassaugh Port Wood Finish
Palate: Brandied cherries, heather, damson and a touch of green apple sharpness.
Finish: Peppermint leaf and jammy berries.
Nose: Ginger snaps, good stout ale, wafts of baking bread.

Name: Glenfarclas 40 Year Old (46%)
Palate: About as rich and intense as anything weâve ever tried from Glenfarclas. The chocolate richness develops in the glass, with notes of chocolate raisins, dates and figs, orange and maraschino cherry. Then spices and thick espresso coffee.
Finish: Sublimely concentrated waves of mochaccino and gingerbread, with deep leathery notes clinging to the end.
Nose: Very complex and rich. Calves leather, cedar wood cigar boxes and cocoa kicking things off. Then weâre onto waves of sweet sherry and chocolate orange, marmalade and butterscotch. Hints of molasses develop and just a whisper of pepper.

Name: Arran 1998 Westie - Icons of Arran
Palate: Big and bold and very fruity with Arran's signature zesty/maltiness and pepper.
Finish: Sweet and fruity, coffee notes and nutmeg.
Nose: Big on lemony, citrusy notes, with hints of zest and intensely sweet freshness. Notes of apricots too, and a subtle sherried character.

Name: Bruichladdich Islay Barley 2012
Palate: Vanilla wafers, sugared almonds, oatcakes, a hint of buttered bread and spring blossom.
Finish: Soft hints of spicy oak develop later on, mellowed by mint chocolate and walnut loaf.
Nose: Waxy orange peels, nutty malt, soft wafts of rock pool aroma and some fresh peaches.

Name: Glen Scotia Campbeltown Harbour
Palate: Apple crumble and more florals, with a herbaceous undertone followed by brine and fudge.
Finish: Dry smoke alongside a sweet, caramel-forward finish.
Nose: Toffee penny, iodine and flamed heather, with hints of smoke and sea spray.

Name: Springbank 18 Year Old
Palate: Big, spicy and gutsy, with notes of chilli, pine, citrus, aniseed and rich fruits.
Finish: Long, salty, chocolate caramels with hints of smoky fruit.
Nose: Toasted bananas, honey and bakewell tarts with coastal hints. Quite oily.

Name: Glenturret 10 Year Old
Palate: Sugared almonds, cut grass, buttery brioche, apricot and peach.
Finish: Tangy marmalade and mellow vanilla, plus some drying oak warmth.
Nose: Honeyed porridge with a dusting of brown sugar, very subtle forest floor earthiness, fresh melon.

Name: Compass Box Hedonism Felicitas
Palate: Chocolate-coated Brazil nuts, green apple, extra thick double cream, slightly perfumed at points, soft peppery warmth.
Finish: Layers of vanilla, dried fruit and chocolate on the finish.
Nose: Honeydew melon, floral grain, honeydew melon, a slow build of allspice and cinnamon.

Name: Glenrothes 1988 (bottled 2011)
Palate: Creamy, zesty and spicy palate which opens on sweet malt, Fruitcake, custard and just a hint of smoke.
Finish: Creamy, gingernut biscuits, allspice.
Nose: Spicy and fruity with notes of Red apples, berry fruits, oak and vanilla. Some nutmeg, allspice and Madeira cake. Musty orange zest.

Name: Tamdhu Batch Strength (Batch 5)
Palate: More winter spice initially, which bramble fruit, thick treacle and dense fruitcake emerge through. Seville marmalade, occasional pangs of liquorice and chewy, tannic oak add depth among touches of walnut skin bitterness, earthy vanilla and barley sugar. With time comes cedar, cracked black pepper, leather and chocolate ice cream.
Finish: Graciously long and slightly dry, with apple skins, lime, chocolate fudge and fizzy cola bottles.
Nose: Sultanas, dates and blackberry compote provide a rich, thick opening with dark chocolate and Brazil nuts in support. Huckleberry honey and vanilla tablet bring American oak sweetness alongside notes of bread and butter pudding, fresh apricot jam and caramelised ginger. Thereâs leather-bound books, some sherried funk and spice from clove and cinnamon throughout along with a sprig of mint.

Name: The English - Heavily Smoked
Palate: Roasted barley, salted butter on toast, cinnamon, granola, bonfires, and flaked almonds.
Finish: Black pepper and red chilli flake, with a slow fade of caramel.
Nose: Meaty malt with hints of cured ham and vegetal peat. A little touch of yellow plum sweetness develops underneath.

Name: Scallywag 12 Year Old
Palate: Sweet and rich, more rich treacle, sweet, almost honeyed vanilla cream, barley sugar and toasted oak among lots of jammy blackberries.
Finish: The fruity, sweet palate continues onto the finish, with even more spicy notes building, lots of cinnamon and allspice remaining.
Nose: A good hit of sherry, with dark cherry jam, dark berries and treacle, with a hefty sprinkling of baking spices.

Name: Highland Park Viking Tribe
Palate: Orange peel and honey. Peppery peat slowly develops alongside hints of apricot and clove.
Finish: Soft smoke lingers on the finish.
Nose: Butterscotch, floral barley, crumpets with salted butter, a hint of sandalwood.

Name: Starward Projects - Bourbon Cask
Palate: Sweet and buttery, think millionaire's shortbread with caramel biscuit notes, returning to tropical fruit freshness with a subtle pinch of white pepper.
Finish: Indulgent and sweet vanilla custard, coconut and banana with a drizzle of honey.
Nose: Oodles of bright tropical fruits including roasted pineapple, green bananas, and honeydew melon with a background of lemongrass and sweet white chocolate.

Name: Kingsbarns Family Reserve 2020
Palate: Another helping of mango, now with apricot and peach. Cedar and cinnamon develop. Sugared almond and black pepper.
Finish: Dried pineapple, vanilla and subtle charred oak heat.
Nose: Zesty orange and lime, fresh mango and waves of honeyed barley.

Name: Bn9 - Elements of Islay (Bunnahabhain)
Palate: Honey roasted peanuts, green apples, peppery heat building.
Finish: White chocolate and smoked almonds.
Nose: Maritime breeze and a hint of roasted oak, plus apricot sweetness.

Name: Tamdhu Batch Strength (Batch 6)
Palate: Dates, Christmas cake, cinnamon, oak, barley sugar, and more coffee.
Finish: Red apple, a smidge of citrus, leather, good sherry.
Nose: Walnut loaf, coffee, and a good whack of dried fruit.

Name: Peat Chimney Batch Strength 002 (Wemyss Malts)
Palate: Smoky and spicy cured meats, a good helping of paprika and salt. An underlying minerality is balanced by orchard fruits and a squeeze of lemon juice, underpinned by an intense smokiness.
Finish: Sweet, smoky and lingering.
Nose: A good maritime influence, with notes of seared scallops and charred seaweed alongside wet rope.

Name: The Nikka 12 Year Old
Palate: Buttery oak, rounded malt, a touch of leather and a hint of smoke.
Finish: Spicy, fruity, decent length with a little cocoa.
Nose: Butterscotch, poached pears, toffee apples, nougat and nutmeg.

Name: Fettercairn 23 Year Old
Palate: Creamy toffee, with plenty of warm spice and gentle heat, fruit compote, and grilled peaches.
Finish: Dried apricots and baking spices linger.
Nose: Fresh red apples and poached pears, with lightly toasted hazelnuts.

Name: Mortlach 30 Year Old
Palate: A richly winey, apple fruity and mouth-watering start delights the palate, backed by a long spicy intensity with a delicious black pepper note that really persists.
Finish: Long, sweet and deep-flavoured, with a light peppery spiciness. With water, still sweet and softer, with the spicy heat joined by a suggestion of mint chocolate in the lingering aftertaste.
Nose: A mellow nose with some initial prickle. This settles in time to reveal a savoury and faintly herbal top note, suggesting pork crackling sprinkled with dry sage.

Name: KryptÃ³s
Palate: Nope, we're not even going to tell you what it tastes like either. The puzzle is too good.
Finish: No one is really sure what a "finish" is, so we're going to leave this as a mystery too.
Nose: You didn't think we'd tell you what is smells like, did you? That would give away too much!

Name: Lp10 - Elements of Islay (Laphroaig)
Palate: Sea spray mingles with smoky barbecued tropical fruit, as well as salty smoked meat and a sprinkle of caramelised brown sugar and vanilla shortbread.
Finish: Salted caramel and dark mint chocolate with a pinch of dried herbs.
Nose: Fresh and slightly sweet, with gentle wafts of bonfire smoke, heather honey and freshly cut grass.

Name: Mackmyra Moment - Karibien
Palate: Chocolate eclairs, pineapple fritters, vanilla-rich barley and quince.
Finish: Soft hints of sultana, raisin and ginger snaps.
Nose: Buttery pastry filled with rum-soaked dried fruit. Ground almond savoury oak.

Name: Aultmore 21 Year Old
Palate: Rosemary returns alongside more fresh fruit, with melon, ripe banana and mango, olive oil, porridge and toasted sourdough.
Finish: A spicy finish, with aromatic baking spice leading into a peppery hit that lingers.
Nose: Fresh and fruity, peaches and cream, roasted pear, canteloupe and dried mango and waxy peels, floral sweeties, sweet malt, smoked rosemary and fresh mint leaves.

Name: Scallywag The Munro Bagging Edition
Palate: Baking spice and dark chocolate brownie, with more plump dried berries.
Finish: Chocolate ganache lingers alongside a hint of fig.
Nose: Obvious sherry influence, with rich mocha notes alongside dried fruit sweetness.

Name: Glenmorangie Allta Private Edition
Palate: A crisp citrus bite to the mouthfeel. Butter candy, creamy vanilla, orange syrup with slightly yeasty background. Gentle mint, the tiniest hint of sweet chilli and delicate, dancing, floral notes.
Finish: Long and earthy with hints of bittersweet orange and peppermint.
Nose: Rounded, with biscuity, yeasty tones. Gentle floral notes of carnations and Parma violets, baking bread, very gentle vanilla, soft raisins and sweet mandarin orange.

Name: Ichiro's Malt 1986 King of Hearts
Palate: Full bodied and very rounded in the mouth with loads of spiciness â a big rush of chilli spice, sweetness and herbs with just a touch of wood late palate.
Finish: Strong, complex, herbal finish.
Nose: Very spicy and full bodied with hints of apple sweets, sherbet and cinnamon. Maybe a touch of cloves, with raspberries.

Name: Mackmyra Moment - Efva
Palate: Caramelised almond, mint leaf, slightly floral at points, red apple.
Finish: Mint-chocolate chip ice cream and strawberry sauce.
Nose: Orange peels and raspberries. Digestive biscuits, fresh malt and gingerbread.

Name: Wolfburn Batch No.375
Palate: Sultana and dried cherry, peppery oak, very slightly chocolatey at points, with some waxy apple too.
Finish: Layers of toffee and milky tea on the finish.
Nose: Honeyed malt with hints of heather and citrus blossom in tow. A touch of sawdust and straw.

Name: Chichibu On The Way (bottled 2015)
Palate: Baking spices, apple turnovers and slowly growing notes of nutty malt.
Finish: Dried apple chips and hints of sawdust.
Nose: Herbaceous at first, though soon enough hints of caramel and tinned peaches arrive.

Name: Glenfarclas 18 Year Old
Palate: Rich and full with toffee, rum and raisin, plum, warm lemon and hazelnut.
Finish: Spicy toffee'd oak.
Nose: Honeyed apples, citrus, vanilla and sultana.

Name: Glenglassaugh 30 Year Old
Palate: Dark chocolate, ginger, plenty of stewed golden fruits supported by oak.
Finish: Nutty and lasting.
Nose: Coffee and toffee, citrus, fruit cake, fruit salad and spice.

Name: Allt-Ã¡-Bhainne
Palate: Butterscotch, roasted apricot and honey provide sweetness among gingerbread and cinnamon spice and earthy peat.
Finish: A long finish has plenty of drying smoke and fizzing spice.
Nose: Smoky malt and a prickle of white pepper spice blend with toffee apples, buttery pastry, a hint of heather and toasted oak.

Name: Langatun Old Bear Smoky
Palate: Malty notes develop on the palate, with a touch of raspberry and waves of toasted cedar.
Finish: Quite long, with peppery smoke and melon.
Nose: Savoury, salty peat smoke, elderflower, waxy orange and mint.

Name: The Macallan Gold Double Cask
Palate: Citrus and boiled sweets rule the palate, along with hints of ginger and cinnamon, while soft oak tones reveal toasted apples.
Finish: The finish is medium sweet, malty and slightly dry.
Nose: This burnished gold spirit presents a lemon citrus nose, the orange peel and an interlacing sweetness that softens but doesn't eliminate the zest. A quiet note of vanilla is followed by dark chocolate - more assertive, yet not overly so - with a lingering floral and light oak notes.

Name: Ar8 - Elements of Islay (Ardbeg)
Palate: Pistachio ice cream, freshly zested citrus peels, crashing waves of smoke.
Finish: Quite oak-y on the finish, pairing well with juicy peach and toasty peat notes.
Nose: New leather, caramelised dates, a hint of salted peanuts before leading into well-toasted tea-cakes and seaweed.

Name: Tomatin Five Virtues - Wood
Palate: Soft and subtly herbaceous. Rounded, creamy vanilla. Liquorice root.
Finish: Peppery oak and a slight hint of plum.
Nose: Caramel, vanilla pod, a hint of dried fruit, cinnamon sticks.

Name: The Singleton of Glendullan Double Matured
Palate: Fresh orange-y notes continue on to the palate, joined with caramel, red berries and floral barley.
Finish: Sherbet lemon, Mocha.
Nose: Juicy notes of buttered sultanas and apricots, with a hint of sharp orange zest.

Name: Tullibardine - Highland Laird (Bartels Whisky)
Palate: Creamy vanilla, fresh peach and brandy snaps combine while underlying cereal and honey blend throughout.
Finish: Butterscotch emerges among the remaining charred oak.
Nose: Aromas of zesty tropical fruit, buttered granary toast and drying ginger initially, before white pepper spice fizzes through milk chocolate.

Name: Glenfarclas 1996 (bottled 2015)
Palate: Syrupy and rich, this is just packed with honey'd raisin and melted chocolate elements.
Finish: Drying spices begin to take shape on the finish.
Nose: Sherried peels, nutty oak and slowly developing notes of Mocha.

Name: Scallywag 13 Year Old
Palate: Brown sugar, blackberries and chocolate fudge.
Finish: Granola bars and milk chocolate, with a hint of cinnamon warmth.
Nose: Steamed berry pudding, ginger and vanilla-rich malt.

Name: MacNair's Lum Reek
Palate: Still packed with dense smoke, though dark chocolate and blackberry notes bring balance to the palate.
Finish: Dry cooking spices and a lasting hint of charred oak.
Nose: Earthy peat and thyme honey. A hint of orange peel cuts through.

Name: Tobermory 42 Year Old
Palate: More roasted chestnut, now with notes of oily walnut and dry oak. Cherry, redcurrant, thick treacle and a touch of cracked black pepper.
Finish: Dry spices last ages on the finish, with chocolate-covered raisins bringing a balancing sweetness.
Nose: Massive waves of dark chocolate, tobacco, Sherry-soaked raisins and roasted chestnuts. A touch of liquorice root.

Name: The Dubliner 10 Year Old
Palate: Begins to develop chocolatey notes as the palate opens, but retains the light, elegant floral elements.
Finish: Quite long and drying.
Nose: Subtly floral, backed up with spiced porridge and honey.

Name: Benriach 16 Year Old
Palate: Medium. Sweet barley and vanilla. Buttery, some apple peel. Perhaps a spot of peat.
Finish: Medium length, some caramel, dark sugar and a pinch of peat.
Nose: Fruity-fresh. Honeyed sweetness, touch of dryness.

Name: Tobermory 20 Year Old
Palate: Salted chocolate, yellow plum, toffee and ginger.
Finish: Buttered scones and basil leaf.
Nose: Vanilla, light sherry cask influence imparting raisin and fig, a touch of spent match.

Name: Balblair 2005 - 1st Release
Palate: Citrus blossom (and citrus peels) mixed with hints of barrel char spice and treacle tarts.
Finish: Fresh and spiced, with a little more floral malt.
Nose: Classic Balblair nose of oak-y vanilla, chocolate-y malt and light wisps of smoke.

Name: Lg7 - Elements of Islay (Lagavulin)
Palate: BBQ embers, ham, honey-roasted peanuts and a lingering hint of burnt sugar.
Finish: Long and rich with smoke, sea salt and sugared peels.
Nose: Honeycomb, fig and toasted vanilla pods. Particularly meaty malt sits at the core.

Name: Lg11 - Elements of Islay (Lagavulin)
Palate: Bold charred oak, grilled tropical fruits, and smoked cured meats. Earthy peat smoke, burnt caramel and herbal salinity.
Finish: Lingering smoke and coastal air, bonfire ashes, spicy oak, sweet honey, and salty brine.
Nose: Salted seafood and medicinal peat smoke, smoked rosemary and thyme, with wafts of floral honey.

Name: Glenrothes 2006 (bottled 2017)
Palate: Seville orange marmalade and zesty tropical fruits, with layers of caramel and cinnamon.
Finish: Chocolatey, though very slightly earthy.
Nose: Brandied cherries and fruity esters. A hint of treacle tart.

Name: Benromach Triple Distilled 2009
Palate: Dark chocolate, menthol and a dash of smoke. Creamy vanilla keeps this rather boisterous trio of flavours in check.
Finish: Citrus returns on the finish in the shape of fresh grapefruit. Still chocolatey.
Nose: Chai latte, lime peel and a whiff of rum-like spiciness.

Name: The Macallan Rare Cask Black
Palate: Damson, dates and Demerara sugar. The earthy and herbaceous peaty elements take their time to reveal themselves.
Finish: A mixture of dark chocolate, fresh ginger and a whiff of bonfire smoke.
Nose: Tobacco-rich smokiness, with spicy hints of old oak and pepparkakor. Heavily Sherried notes of fig jam and buttery sultana scones give away the whisky's Speyside roots.

Name: Big Peat at Christmas 2014
Palate: Bonfire embers, light struck matches and sea breeze. The oatcakes are back, but this time they've been loaded up with fruit chutney and served alongside some blackberries. A drop of water opens up salty notes.
Finish: It just goes and goes, this one. Smoke and earth all the way to the end.
Nose: Thick, crumbly oatcakes with a bit of brie. Ice cream and jelly. Pencils. Big notes of earth, with medicinal notes coming through after a minute or two. Ham - plenty of ham.

Name: Tomatin Five Virtues - Water
Palate: Walnut and almond appears first before waves of malt loaf and raisin sweetness develop.
Finish: A hint of oily malt and toasted cinnamon.
Nose: Hot chocolate, toffee apples and honey on toast.

Name: Tyrconnell 16 Year Old
Palate: Oily and smooth, a tropical fruit fiesta leads the way, with dollops of fresh cream and a very slight oaky bitterness tempering beautifully.
Finish: Almost too long, the richness of the spice sees off the fruit and concludes a strong dram.
Nose: Tinned pineapple rings, fleshy melon and banana cream pie soothes bold baking spices, with flashes of vanilla and coconut in the backdrop.

Name: Lg8 - Elements of Islay (Lagavulin)
Palate: Powerful notes of burnt oak stave paired with caramel and lemon.
Finish: Charcoal, clove and a hint of passion fruit.
Nose: Bonfires and rock pools. Sweeter notes of thyme honey underneath.

Name: Glencadam 19 Year Old
Palate: More Christmas spices, now paired with Christmas cake. A little bit of smoky oak.
Finish: Lingering creamy malt and chocolate-coated espresso beans.
Nose: A balanced nose of brown sugar, cinnamon and clove. Flashes of chewy raisins and sloe berries hide underneath.

Name: Longmorn Distiller's Choice
Palate: Creamy malt, a touch of praline, caramel and chocolate orange.
Finish: Sweet barley and oak spice.
Nose: Citrus and toffee apples, caramelised pears, stem ginger and other subtle spices.

Name: Balblair 2000 (bottled 2017)
Palate: Stocky toffee pudding, citrus zest, cinnamon, a touch of sea salt.
Finish: Warming oak, CuraÃ§ao orange and coffee bean.
Nose: Honey-drizzled barley, gingerbread, chocolate buttons.

Name: Wolfburn Batch No.128
Palate: Subtly grassy at first, with layers of black pepper, chocolate chip cookie dough and another wave of smoke.
Finish: Simmering exotic spices and fresh tangerine.
Nose: Sweet smoke (almost floral at points), joined by underlying hints of lemon sorbet and vanilla-y oak.

Name: Benriach 10 Year Old
Palate: Fried banana, brown sugar, powerful barley notes driving it all along.
Finish: Lasting hints of peppery malt and vanilla custard.
Nose: Citrus-forward, with gingerbread and cinnamon in support.

Name: Glenmorangie A Tale Of Winter
Palate: Cocoa, Brazil nuts, vanilla tablet, jammy red berry sweetness developing, crystallised ginger.
Finish: Spicy ginger remains, mellowed by vanilla and chocolate mousse.
Nose: Honeycomb, chocolate digestives, fragrant lavender, sultana, and cinnamon.

Name: Tamdhu Batch Strength (Batch 2)
Palate: Orchard fruits and rich oak, more sultanas, Victoria sponge and Sherried peels.
Finish: Pain au chocolat, redcurrants and lemon biscuits.
Nose: Fruit and nut notes, sultanas, orange peel, apricot jam and sweet cereal.

Name: The Big Strand
Palate: The coastal theme continues on the palate, with a touch of bonfires too.
Finish: Vanilla and smoke. Some fresh fruit sweetness.
Nose: Delightfully coastal, with hints of oily barley underneath.

Name: Box Quercus I - Robur
Palate: Summer berries, sticky toffee, ground coffee and warm ginger.
Finish: Sweet and spicy, with a slight menthol note in the backdrop.
Nose: Elegant smoke, creamy barley and apple chutney.

Name: Royal Canadian Small Batch
Palate: Subtle oak-y elements develop into maple syrup and another kick of peppery rye. Fruity esters remain prominent.
Finish: Medium length - honey'd grain and sponge cake.
Nose: Fresh orchard fruits - particularly green apple and apricot. Hints of peppery grain and banana fritters.

Name: Tomintoul 18 Year Old
Palate: CrÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e and apricot tart, with ground almond, a pinch of tobacco, wood spice and honeycomb.
Finish: Floral honey, baking spice and treacle tart.
Nose: Juicy dried fruit and cooked plum, with apple and cinnamon loaf cake.

Name: Tobermory 18 Year Old
Palate: Toffee ice cream with chocolate sauce and topped with diced almonds. Yum!
Finish: Fresh barley, black pepper, Refresher Bars.
Nose: Golden syrup, pineapple chunks, toasted walnut, sponge cake.

Name: Mortlach 18 Year Old
Palate: The decadent syrup and caramel notes develop on the palate, with oak, earthy tobacco and almonds adding depth. Tropical fruit notes give it a lively backbone.
Finish: Citrus, mocha and more tobacco notes last.
Nose: Nutty at first, followed by vibrant spices - think ginger and cinnamon - paired with fresh green apples and lemon zest. Lyle's Golden Syrup and toffee pennies too.

Name: Langatun Marsala Cask Finish
Palate: Fermented fruits and boozy cherries, caramelised nuts, burnt marzipan and sweet, roasted malt.
Finish: Lingering sweet and nutty peanut brittle, with warming pepper spice.
Nose: Fragrant oak with sweet notes of toasted almonds and tobacco.

Name: anCnoc 2009 (bottled 2021)
Palate: Green apple vibrancy mellowed by milk chocolate and caramel, plus rich tea biscuits.
Finish: Waves of butterscotch and a soft touch of oaky spice.
Nose: Honey and lemon, with malty vanilla and a hint of heather.

Name: Peg Whisky Limited Edition I
Palate: Vanilla custard, more sweet biscuity malt, rich dried fruits and cinnamon swirls.
Finish: Caramelised sugar, dates, raisins, rich oak with just a waft of spearmint and sweet vanilla on the finish.
Nose: Soft buttery fudge, boozy soaked fruit and malted milk biscuits.

Name: GlenAllachie 25 Year Old
Palate: Pecan, chocolate orange, still enjoyably cake-y. Mature wood notes stick around at the core.
Finish: Lingering cassia and black pepper, balanced by dried fruit sweetness.
Nose: Fruit cake, polished oak, walnut loaf and waxy orange.

Name: Big Peat - London Edition
Palate: Toasted rye bread with butter, cut grass and earthy smoke.
Finish: A kick of black pepper joins in with peat and vanilla on the finish.
Nose: Wafts of oily smoke and toasted walnuts, with a helping of green apple and ground clove in the background.

Name: Balblair 1991 (bottled 2018)
Palate: Crunchy brown sugar, honeycomb ice-cream, walnut loaf and apple turnover.
Finish: Long and rich with runny caramel sweetness.
Nose: Orange chocolate brownie, sultanas, stem ginger, strawberry bon-bons.

Name: Suntory Kakushiro White Label
Palate: Drying notes of cinnamon and oak spice develop.
Finish: Medium length, with a hint of dried red berries.
Nose: Floral malt, with a hint of caramel and baking bread.

Name: Dalmore Cigar Malt 1l
Palate: Yet more toffee, caramel edging towards the burnt cinder-toffee side of things. Flamed orange-zest, and perfectly integrated sherry.
Finish: Reasonably simple, Christingles (orange Zest and clove with a touch of cinnamon), more mid-palate than palate-coating.
Nose: Caramel, shortbread, biscuits, coffee and chocolates. Simple, clean and moreish.

Name: NV Blended Scotch Whisky
Palate: Gathering warmth with pepper and nutmeg. Subtly grassy.
Finish: Fudge and apricot, alongside a hint of baking spice.
Nose: Light orange and barley, with touches of toasted brown sugar.

Name: Okayama Single Malt
Palate: Floral, with a touch of coconut and sweet honey. Still spicy with pepper.
Finish: Light oak spice lingers on the finish.
Nose: Zesty fruit as it opens (perhaps even a hint of tropical fruit), developing a fragrant spiciness of crushed pink peppercorn.

Name: Compass Box Magic Cask
Palate: Fragrant vanilla, peaches and cream, soft oak, cinnamon.
Finish: Citrus oils and cocoa last on the finish.
Nose: Ripe plum, a touch of chocolatey malt and something subtle herbaceous wafts.

Name: Suntory Kakubin Yellow Label
Palate: More honey, now with the addition of citrus peels, peppercorn and cinnamon.
Finish: More honey'd barley.
Nose: Big scoops of fresh cereals and honeycomb ice cream. Light spiciness to it.

Name: Kavalan Solist Peaty Cask
Palate: Oily barley leading to earthy peat smoke. Some new leather richness, balanced by zesty orchard fruit.
Finish: Quite long, with hot pepper once again developing alongside vanilla and fruit.
Nose: Fresh peach and guava, toasted almond, a hint of peppery oak.

Name: Caermory 21 Year Old
Palate: More oak now, hazelnutty with fresh nutmeg and linseed with a little marmalade and real lemonade.
Finish: Surprisingly clean with late, subtle florals (again on the nutty side).
Nose: Green apple, rubbed mint, vanilla and cinnamon swirls with maltiness and some oak developing.

Name: Heaven Hill Bourbon
Palate: Spices, oak, cedar, a little rum-like character develops.
Finish: Fruity, dark brown sugar.
Nose: Rye-rich, quite spicy and sweet.

Name: Dalmore 12 (Old Bottling)
Palate: Rich and rounded, juicy and fruity stuff with notes of nutmeg, allspice, cinnamon and orange peels. Golden syrup and treacle notes develop with spicy aplomb.
Finish: Long, spicy finish. Honey and nectarine.
Nose: Burnt sugar, delicious old brandy, grape must, coffee beans and sweet cigar leaves. A little malt too, and orange marmalade.

Name: Balblair 1983 - 1st Release
Palate: The sweet treats from the nose calm down just a little on the palate, with a spicy flutter of cinnamon and oak balancing out the fresh fruit and butterscotch rather well.
Finish: Long and equally enjoyable as the rest of this whisky.
Nose: Warm toffee syrup drizzled over a classic banana split, complete with vanilla ice-cream, chocolate sprinkles and a cherry on the top. Yum yum!

Name: Strathisla 1972 (Gordon & Macphail)
Palate: This whisky tastes of raisins and spices with a little chocolate covered almonds in the background.
Finish: The finish is long and complex with notes of Christmas pudding and green apples.
Nose: Christmas cake and rum-soaked raisins form a big sherried nose with mixed spice dancing in the background.

Name: Glenfarclas 1984 Family Cask
Palate: Rich and fresh. Toffee, oak, hay. Barley, zesty fruit.
Finish: Citrus, freshness, barley, honey, mochaccino.
Nose: Zesty, fruity. Marmalade. Granary toast.

Name: Longrow 18 Year Old
Palate: Peaty with notes of spicy. Very oily, with hints of orange zest, pepper and chili. Very "big". Kippers, smoked meats and honey.
Finish: Spicy and oily, with notes of dark, earthy peaty.
Nose: Apple peels, and smoke. Earthy peat, damp leaves, notes of truffle, woodshed, porridge oats and soot.

Name: anCnoc 22 Year Old
Palate: Full-bodied palate entry with notes of Corinth raisins and citrus. Hints of spice, custard and calves leather. Quite juicy and faintly smoked.
Finish: Long finish with honey and allspice.
Nose: Sweet, biscuity aromas. Hints of manuka honey and toffee apples. Notes of mince pies, a touch of smoke and candied lemon peel. Slightly floral.

Name: Balblair 2002 - 1st Release
Palate: Victoria sponge without the jam, vanilla custard and a hint of wood-spice.
Finish: Sweet and satisfying.
Nose: Sponge cake, vanilla, a lawn mown in the summer, icing sugar.

Name: Tamdhu 10 Year Old
Palate: Soft red fruit followed by brown sugar and spicy clove. A touch of chocolate-covered Brazil nut.
Finish: Crystallised ginger, cacao and juicy blackcurrant.
Nose: Dried orange peel, red wine, pecan and raspberry jam.

Name: Longmorn 1971 (Gordon and MacPhail)
Palate: Cocoa, hints of smoke, sherry, very complex, mint, polish, toffee.
Finish: Sherried peels, rich oak, spices.
Nose: Lots of fruit, thick and rich. Cut grass, mint, floral, oak.

Name: Mortlach 1976 (Gordon & Macphail)
Palate: The sultanas become raisins and the black pepper becomes smokier finally there is a nutty quality that emerges with water.
Finish: The finish is fruity with notes of figs and dates with a little ground pepper to round it off.
Nose: Sultanas, vanilla and cracked black pepper.

Name: Balblair 1979 (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Sweet with masses of vanilla essence and a distinct sponge cake flavour.
Finish: The finish is smooth and pleasing with big vanilla flavours.
Nose: Heather and apple tart leading to baked Brambly apples and a little acacia honey.

Name: Knockando 1996 - Managers Choice
Palate: Rich and intense with notes of coffee cake, chocolate, fresh flowers, musty sherry, potpourri and hints of Morello cherry.
Finish: Long and spicy, ending on espresso and Oloroso.
Nose: Tangy and fruity nose with coffee, aniseed liqueur, leather, rose petals and cocoa powder.

Name: Mortlach 1971 (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: The palate is sweet with a pleasant sherried character of dried fruits and spices.
Finish: The finish is spice led but with some dried red berries on the tail,.
Nose: The aroma is sweet yet malty with candied orange peel and raisins forming up with time.

Name: Glenfiddich 50 Year Old
Palate: aromatic herbs, floral and soft fruits, silky oak tannin and hints of gentle smoke.
Finish: Exceptionally long with a touch of dry oak and the merest trace of peat.
Nose: A beautifully harmonious with an uplifting, vibrant and complex aroma. Delicate floral notes (rose petals and violets) are intriguingly intertwined with green tobacco leaf and oak and just a faint hint of smoke.

Name: Master of Malt Island Single Malt
Palate: A great balance between a malty, almost caramel-like sweetness and hints of oily smoke. It becomes more oily, with a touch of bergamot late-palate.
Finish: Good length, mouth-coating, with a pinch of nutmeg.
Nose: Dry and distinctly Island in style, but with a waft of cool wood smoke lying something underneath a sweet/salty note. Good malt notes, some spice, vanilla from the oak.

Name: Benriach 30 Year Old
Palate: Sherry and honey fill the mouth with vibrant depth. Pastry and sweetness, dried yoghurt and stem ginger provide ample means for mastication.
Finish: Malty, sherried notes, toffee with a resilient drying oak.
Nose: Oaky, vanilla, thick barley. Nuttiness.

Name: Bladnoch 9 Year Old
Palate: Light, gentle and spicy, a touch of crÃ¨me caramel, floral notes, apple peel, toffee and acacia honey.
Finish: Lemon peel, honey and malt.
Nose: Bold and bright, hints of salty butter, light citrus, floral notes, a little cocoa and coffee.

Name: Speyburn 25 Year Old
Palate: Lemon peel and berry fruit. Candied peels, allspice and honey. Big malty core.
Finish: Spicy, citrusy finish.
Nose: Creamy sweet vanilla and hints of toasted oak. Slightly floral, with notes of Demerara sugar, candied lemon peel and honey.

Name: Karuizawa 12 Year Old
Palate: Hints of peat with notes of the forest floor, pine resin, oak, vanilla and soot.
Finish: Quite short, with coal tar soap and musty woodsheds.
Nose: Apricots, sultanas, dates and notes of lemon sherbet. This is very malty and rich with notes of smoke, toffee and custard.

Name: Hakushu 10 Year Old
Palate: Thick and rich, very vanilla-led, with notes of malt, grist and soft, oily peat. More apples, some pear and a little citrus.
Finish: Good finish, with notes of toffee apple and smoked prune juice.
Nose: Creamy with notes of butterscotch, mint and custard. There are hints of soft, fruity peat smoke as well as oak and strawberry jam.

Name: Balblair 1990 - 2nd Release
Palate: Citrus fruits come through first, followed by honey-covered raisins. The spice from the nose makes an appearance.
Finish: Lengthy and full-flavoured.
Nose: Lush toffee, milk chocolate and a good helping of vanilla. A sprinkle of spice round out the nose.

Name: Ardmore 25 Year Old
Palate: A fruity and rich mouthfeel with brandied cherries, fruit, oak, oily smoke.
Finish: Long, fresh, tangy, rich.
Nose: Almond and hints of smoke, dark and rich fruit, dried peels, berries, malt.

Name: Smokehead - The Rock Edition
Palate: Big, puckering peat. Smoky, fruity sweetness, touch of sherry, sultana. Herbal.
Finish: Herbal, tangy fruits and more peat smoke!
Nose: Smoke! Lapsang souchong. Cool wood smoke. Thick and full.

Name: Cardhu 15 Year Old
Palate: Butterscotch, lychees and lots of banana! Rich tea biscuits dipped in a warm milky tea.
Finish: Super light and creamy, foam bananas, with suggestions of yoghurt and granola. There is an almost rum like quality to this one.
Nose: Oats and apples, malty caramel, plenty of fresh fruit going on. Hints of marzipan and almond pastry, sugared buttermilk pancakes.

Name: Balblair 1999 - 2nd Release
Palate: Sherry spices still at the fore, though the vanilla sweetness from the bourbon barrel shines through, as does some warm, oak-y touches.
Finish: Full and long.
Nose: The Sherry oak takes hold of the nose with thick slices of warm Christmas cake and juicy raisins. Beneath you'll find apple peel and honey'd malt.

Name: Old Fettercairn 10 Year Old
Palate: A creamy, milky body with more porridge and treacle. The peat is there in the background too.
Finish: A good long finish with the peat slowly taking precedence over the malt and toffee.
Nose: Some smoke on the nose, quite heathery actually. There's a lot of malty grain notes too. Porridge and caramel sweetness.

Name: Longmorn 1964 (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Mixed spice, rich dried fruits and a lingering nuttiness.
Finish: The finish is long with notes of raisins and marzipan.
Nose: Almonds, dried fennel, ground coffee with a little dark chocolate at the back.

Name: Mortlach 25 Year Old
Palate: Dark chocolate, oak spice and dried fruits. Baking spices grow on the mid palate, building a rich core alongside the fragrant oak. Subtly herbal further on.
Finish: Sweet, drying notes, highlighted by cocoa and oak spice.
Nose: Vanilla pods, pineapple, lemon zest and a warming hint of tobacco. Touches of crushed almond. Wafts of light oak develop and grow gloriously rich.

Name: Glenburgie 1966 (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: The palate is spicy with delicate red fruits drizzled with melted dark chocolate.
Finish: The finish is rich with red berries and has a lick of menthol on the tail.
Nose: Bees wax and fresh stone fruit form a sweet sherried aroma.

Name: Glenglassaugh 26 Year Old
Palate: Very fruity with all kinds of conserves, as well as pecan Danish pastry, baked Alaska, porridge oats, sultanas and raspberries.
Finish: Berry fruits and orange marmalade on the finish, with hints of black pepper and digestive biscuit.
Nose: Custard and Christmas spices. Notes of buttery biscuits, berry fruits and hints of roasted nuts.

Name: Tomatin 1973 Cask 25602
Palate: Rich, sweet and mellow. Gently toasted hazelnuts and almonds, stewed plums giving way to subtle oaky flavours.
Finish: Subtle and creamy with a hint of coconut.
Nose: Soft and honeyed with gentle hints of aniseed. Darjeeling Tea leaves banoffee pie with a minty undertone.

Name: Highland Park 1998 1l
Palate: Aromatic and honeyed, vanilla sweetness, oak, peppermint, a touch of tasted oak, heather honey, walnut and nutmeg.
Finish: Spiced and sweet, malty.
Nose: Sweet, heady nose with thick honey, apricot conserve, pepper and cut hay. Gingernuts, malt.

Name: Glenglassaugh "The First Cask"
Palate: Sweet cereals and toasted almond. Thick malt, porridge oats, berries and spice.
Finish: Long with chilli heat and red berries.
Nose: Fruity and rich, notes of mango chutney, coriander, honeycomb, toffee brittle and berries.

Name: The Glenlivet 1980 Cellar Collection
Palate: Tangy and filling with notes of Calvados (musty apples and pears and perfumy potpourri), a little orange zest, peppermint oil and creamy vanilla.
Finish: Long and dry with oak, coconut milk and a little more orange zest.
Nose: Sweet and spicy with berry fruits, blackcurrant conserve, granary toast, marmalade, digestive biscuits and stem ginger.

Name: Tormore 16 Year Old
Palate: Cinnamon spice and pepper appear on palate entry, swiftly balanced with orange oil, juicy melon and crunchy red apple.
Finish: Warming and sweet with continuing notes of cinnamon and vanilla cream.
Nose: Hobnob biscuits, vanilla essence, ripe pear and a good core of spiced oak.

Name: Tullibardine 25 Year Old
Palate: Thick, creamy palate entry with notes of bitter orange marmalade, kiwi fruit, custard apples, baking spice and oak.
Finish: Long finish with banana and strawberry jam.
Nose: Rich notes of spice and manuka honey, hints of cooked fruit, toasted oak and malt loaf.

Name: Glendullan 1995 - Managers Choice
Palate: Oaky and rich palate, with more of that aniseed, hints of potpourri and red berries. It develops with notes of Turkish coffee, marmalade and spongecake.
Finish: Good lengh with notes of peppermint oil and hazelnut.
Nose: Vanilla and sweet hazelnut greet the nostrils, with hints of aniseed, toffee apple and almond.

Name: Talisker 30 Year Old
Palate: A finely-tuned balance of sweetness from plump berries and an enjoyable peppery heat. Its age shines through.
Finish: Final flourishes of smoke and salinity.
Nose: Elegant smoke blends together effortlessly with red fruits and coastal peat.

Name: Glenfarclas 1986 Family Cask
Palate: Rich, sherry. Candied fruits, stem ginger, Christmas cake. Port.
Finish: Long, sweetness, sultana.
Nose: Rich, sultana. Honey, unlit pipe tobacco.

Name: Arran 25 Year Old
Palate: Fruit cake with toasted almonds and cinnamon. The juicy zestiness of oranges and mandarins mellows perfectly with manuka honey, muscovado sugar, baked apricots and an interesting white pepper note that provides even more complexity.
Finish: Creamy and spicy with dark chocolate, walnuts and dark fruits compote.
Nose: Rich oak with a gentle nutmeg note. Sweeter aromas of baked ripe figs, sultanas and black cherries.

Name: Compass Box Experimental Grain
Palate: Savoury BBQ smoke again, with vanilla and red berry sweetness for balance.
Finish: Forest floor, honey, orange peel.
Nose: Fried banana and BBQ pineapple, with a hint of smoked almond growing.

Name: Timorous Beastie - Meet the Beast
Palate: Cinnamon and nutmeg, followed by pancakes with maple syrup, spun sugar, anise, and cedar.
Finish: A touch of oaky spice lingers on the finish, balanced by sweet popcorn.
Nose: Red apples, slightly toasted barley, pain au chocolat, walnuts, mahogany.

Name: Famous Grouse 30 Year Old
Palate: Good sweetness, Muscovado sugar, rum, figs. Fruitcake.
Finish: Fruity, gentle spice, medium long.
Nose: Thick. Rum, toffee. Dried peels sherry, nutty spice.

Name: Amrut Bagheera Sherry Cask Finish
Palate: More dried fruit character, date chutney, some black pepper, and wafts of peat.
Finish: Lingering smoke, with warm spices building.
Nose: Distant smoke, with sherry sweetness, dried raisins and pears, and cinnamon and clove.

Name: Veuve Goudoulin Single Malt
Palate: Oily almond butter and poached pear lead to vanilla caramel with soft, vinous oak and hearty spice.
Finish: Sweet dried fruits and toffee, bold oak, a hint of leather and peppery spice.
Nose: Malted Milk biscuits, rich hints of date and fig, with butterscotch and a soft nuttiness.

Name: Glenmorangie Finealta Private Edition
Palate: Creamy, gently peated palate with spice, candied orange, peach nectar and tropical fruit. Develops on sultanas and cocoa.
Finish: Long, chocolate-driven finish with Corinth raisins and cooked fruit.
Nose: Soft smoke and dried fruit. A little banana chip, hints of cereal sweetness, rose petals and applewood.

Name: Scallywag The Winter Edition 2021
Palate: Cinnamon and black pepper as it opens, mellowed by sweet raisins and hot chocolate.
Finish: Malty vanilla, lingering festive spices and a hefty slice of Christmas cake.
Nose: Chocolate sponge cake, citrus peels, prunes, a kick of ginger.

Name: Laphroaig The 1815 Legacy Edition
Palate: TCP, brown sugar and caramel, a hint of raisin.
Finish: Robust notes of peat last.
Nose: Cinnamon-spiced apricots, marmalade, heavy layers of toasty peat.

Name: Bruichladdich Bere Barley 2011
Palate: Toasted nuts, banana chips, milk chocolate, a splash of green apple acidity, sponge cake.
Finish: Hints of sea breeze stick around, with a touch of lemon.
Nose: Orange and lime, with herby freshness bringing some savoury balance.

Name: Scapa 25 Year Old
Palate: Rich and big-bodied. There are notes of acacia honey, the barley is crisp and juicy and there are notes of orange and cacao. Hints of oak and a touch of winter spice.
Finish: Long and warming with a strong spicy note.
Nose: Rich and spirity. There are notes of spicy barley and cinnamon, manuka honey and hints of zest with a fresh barley note, the cereals and sweet and plentiful.

Name: Glenfarclas 1981 Family Cask
Palate: Rich, espresso, chocolate, fruity, dark and deep.
Finish: Smoke on the finish, big and beefy, thick and fruity, spicy.
Nose: Rich, sherry. Juicy sultana, peels, oak, pipe tobacco.

Name: Wolfburn 1821 200th Anniversary
Palate: More oaty warmth with chewy flapjack notes. Peppery barley leads into festive spice and jammy sultana.
Finish: A long finish, with layers of caramel and cooked fruit.
Nose: Oatcakes, sherried malt, apricot, and stewed apple.

Name: Glenfarclas 185th Anniversary Edition
Palate: Christmas cake, mint chocolate, stewed berries, strong coffee, prune.
Finish: Lingering spiced fruit compote, blackcurrant jelly, and mahogany.
Nose: Damson jam, toasted teacake with butter, festive spices, and a hint of waxy orange.

Name: Wolfburn Batch No.318
Palate: Cinnamon and more clove arrive first, mellowed by apple strudel and sherry-soaked raisins.
Finish: Cinder toffee, pear tart, a little hint of singed barley.
Nose: Well-balanced between dried fruit and smoky oak, with a lingering hint of clove.

Name: Dalwhinnie 20 Year Old
Palate: Perfumed, refined. Cherry, strawberry, sherry, sultana. Malt, oranges. Madeira.
Finish: Oak tannins draw out the finish, winter spice, soft phenols.
Nose: Malty, buttery toasty, lashings of honey, barley. Stone fruits, nectarine. Touch of fragrant espresso.

Name: Glenfarclas 1983 Family Cask
Palate: Sublime. Sugared peels, fruit salad, honey. Great mouth feel.
Finish: Long, cereals, toasty spice.
Nose: Herbal, pine oil, earthen, buttery, hazelnut. Heather.

Name: Glenfarclas 1974 Family Cask
Palate: Honey, dried fruits, citrus, beeswax, oaky.
Finish: Long, herbal, toasted oak, spice, barley.
Nose: Rich, caramel, nutty. Gentle salinity. Caramel, mint.

Name: Glenfarclas 1964 Family Cask
Palate: Sherry, conserves, marmalade, oak builds.
Finish: Long, oaky, port and Tokaji.
Nose: Rich, sherried, balancing oak, spice.

Name: Glenfarclas 1980 Family Cask
Palate: Shortbread, buttery toffee. Good sweetness, herbal, cut hay.
Finish: Long finish, thick, oak.
Nose: Fruity, citrus. Leathery, aromatic.

Name: Cragganmore 17 Year Old
Palate: Aromatic, vanilla, chocolate. Nutty, hazelnut, almond, chocolate, grapey, coffee. Apple crumble.
Finish: Long, spicy, pepper, star anise, nutmeg, balanced oak.
Nose: Rich, espresso beans, tiramisu. Creamy vanilla, barley, almond, hazelnut. Bramley.

Name: Glenfarclas 1953 Family Cask
Palate: Full, cereals. Barley and toffee. Something slightly herbal. The oak develops.
Finish: Long, ripe citrus, hints of the botrytis - Tokaji?
Nose: Rich, honey, sherry. Peels, beeswax. Kirsch, winter berry compote.

Name: Compass Box No Name 3
Palate: Charred pineapple and BBQ smoke, with a touch of TCP in there too.
Finish: Peppercorn, liquorice, and grassy peat.
Nose: Savoury herbs and singed barley, with a waft of sea shell salinity lingering throughout.

Name: Bunnahabhain Moine 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 188) - Lady of the Glen (Hannah Whisky Merchants)
Palate: Cigar box smokiness, balanced by fresh citrus and custard cream biscuits.
Finish: A fleeting hint of pepper on the finish.
Nose: Grilled lemon and thyme honey, with a good whisper of earthy peat in there.

Name: Glenfarclas 1968 Family Cask
Palate: Nutty, stewed fruits, cocoa, toffee, pluming smoke.
Finish: Long, rubbery.
Nose: Excellent depth, spice and mixed peels. Minty. Damson jam, peppery. Stone fruit.

Name: Aberlour 16 Year Old
Palate: The sherry and oak are in good harmony. The toasty bourbon notes are harnessed well, the vanilla spices are nicely ingrained in the barley.
Finish: Soft and smooth, with waxy honey notes and a barley sweetness.
Nose: Creamy and delectable, in true Aberlour style.

Name: Longmorn 16 Year Old
Palate: Rich and compact. Notes of lemon zest and a leafy greenness. A good level of tannins develops with a vinous character and spice. The oak is dry and full.
Finish: Long and dry with a zesty quality.
Nose: Fresh and green. Notes of apple peel and bramley apple, hints of citrus and herbal notes. There are some notes of balsa wood, calvados and plenty of dry oaken tannins.

Name: Glenfarclas 1975 Family Cask
Palate: Thick, barley rich. Big oak, grapey, rummy.
Finish: Long, charred spice, peppery.
Nose: Fruity, zesty. Mulled wine. oak. Spices.

Name: Linkwood 15 Year Old - Distillery Labels (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Cloves and allspice, rich tea biscuits, dried red berries, wafts of vegetal grass, and pepper.
Finish: More spice, hints of anise, and rich tangy, almost nutty oak.
Nose: Green and grassy, nutty, gloopy almond butter and a touch of lemongrass.

Name: Big Peat Heroes Edition
Palate: Brown sugar, oatcakes with just a smidgeon of apple chutney, yet more drying smoke.
Finish: Hints of lemon shine out behind charred oak and sea salt.
Nose: Smoked meats and earthy peat, with layers of vanilla and cinnamon underneath.

Name: Benromach 25 Year Old
Palate: Upfront sweetness. Vanilla and toasty spice.
Finish: Woody spice, buttery, vanilla.
Nose: Barley, a little vanilla sweetness and spice. Gentle tannins, trace of smoke.

Name: Dalwhinnie 36 Year Old
Palate: Silken, wet hay, chamomile. Peppery, tropical fruit. Candy floss.
Finish: Long, refined, herbal.
Nose: Slightly dry, gristy, walnut, hazelnut. Green oak, honeyed sweetness.

Name: Tobermory 32 Year Old
Palate: Thick and firm. There are notes of crÃ¨me de fraise des bois and notes of crÃ¨me de cacao and wood shavings. There is a strong mocchaccino note.
Finish: Medium-length with espresso and oak.
Nose: Quite rich and dry. There are notes of thick sultanas with espresso and mocchaccino. Winter spice emerges with buttery rum and malmsey. A solid smoked ham note with eucalyptus oil and Sherry.

Name: Glenfarclas 17 Year Old
Palate: Full-bodied and rich, it fills and coats the palate with warming nutmeg, sherried fruits, cinnamon and mixed peels.
Finish: Long, spicy and sweet with just a hint of smoke on the tail.
Nose: Complex and sophisticated, notes of buttery toffee, malt sherried peels, dates and even a hint of peat!

Name: Glenfarclas 1971 Family Cask
Palate: Mochaccino, cooked fruit, lovely sweetness, dry wood, dark rum, touch of smoke.
Finish: Long, sublime with soft wood and herbal notes.
Nose: Aromatic, winter spice. Dark toffee. Peels, rich sherry, liqueur-like character

Name: Glenfarclas 1970 Family Cask
Palate: Thick, chewy. Sherry. Fruit, ripe and lush. Rum spice. Pepper.
Finish: Spiced rum, heavy, buttery, oak, allspice.
Nose: Rich, spicy. Thick, fruity malt loaf. Toasted cinnamon buns, rum. Stem ginger in syrup. Sherry, pepper.

Name: Laphroaig 27 Year Old
Palate: The tropical fruit opens up with soft citrus and delightful pangs of nectarines, banana and a suggestion of lychee. Sweet smoke smoulders and lingers, and jalapeÃ±os in brine give a savoury spice that white pepper cuts through beautifully. Punchy, nutty espresso and polished wood rounds it off.
Finish: Long and dry, with notes of tobacco tin, spicy oak, some citrus and a touch of leather.
Nose: A sharp tropical fruit burst is littered with macadamia nuts and suggestions of vanilla, wet ash and a sprinkling of sea-salt.

Name: Bruichladdich Islay Barley 2011
Palate: Almond, walnut and barley, joined by tinned peaches, milk chocolate and orange peel.
Finish: Subtly coastal, with white grape and barley sugar in support.
Nose: Bright grapefruit and nectarine, balanced by a hint of sea spray.

Name: Balblair 1997 (cask 1146)
Palate: Thick honey and savoury thyme, joined by hints of green apple boiled sweeties.
Finish: Grassy once, more, now with liquorice root and a touch of sea salt.
Nose: Banana fritter, lemon drizzle cake, buttery malt and dried grass.

Name: Tamdhu Batch Strength (Batch 4)
Palate: Think Pavlova with summer berries, a sprinkle of brown sugar, freshly baked biscuits and flickers of baking spices.
Finish: Dried fruit, lemon zest and dark chocolate. This one certainly isn't in a hurry.
Nose: Delicate oak spice, Black Forest gateau and oily walnut, then thick layers of maple syrup, orange marmalade and ripe barley. Thereâs a little marzipan in the backdrop.

Name: Benriach 21 Year Old
Palate: The Sherry cask-matured whisky really starts to take control on the palate, with milk chocolate and rain notes developing at its core. Lemon zest and shortbread.
Finish: A lengthy finish, boasting caramel and rye bread.
Nose: Spiced fruit punch, with a touch of warming oak in the background. A few hints of zesty tropical fruit, too.

Name: Glencadam 18 Year Old
Palate: More malt and spice from the nose with cakey notes, orchard fruit and orange blossom.
Finish: Warming nutmeg, white chocolate and a hint of berries.
Nose: Creamy malt, wood spice and tropical fruits.

Name: Tomatin Five Virtues - Fire
Palate: Cinnamon sweeties, more citrus oils, a touch of creamy vanilla.
Finish: Drying and spicy.
Nose: Burnt sugar and fried banana. Hints of flamed orange peel (there may be some autosuggestion here, what with "FIRE" written on the bottle and all that).

Name: Benriach Peated Quarter Casks
Palate: Bonfires and apples. Peaches too, with smoky vanilla.
Finish: Toasty oak smoke and hazelnut.
Nose: Peat, barley, oak and pear drops with further orchard fruit depth emerging.

Name: Lucifer's Gold Original
Palate: More toasty warmth, with chewy dates and walnuts in support. Sweet custard notes throughout.
Finish: Lasting cinnamon and pepper.
Nose: Buttery at first. Dried peels and a touch of raisin. Toasted oak staves.

Name: Big Peat at Christmas 2017
Palate: Campfire embers with toasted marshmallows and milk chocolate. Subtly oak at points.
Finish: Oily malt, pine nuts and a lingering earthy quality.
Nose: Roasted peanuts, sea breeze, hints of spearmint and tarry ropes.

Name: Big Peat at Christmas 2016
Palate: Intense peat smoke all the way through, with a few bright bursts of juicy pineapple and white grape.
Finish: Warming maritime notes last and last.
Nose: Big waves of sea breeze and toasted barley, with a hint of soot in the mix too.

Name: Suntory Kakubin Black Label
Palate: Earthy at first, before giving way to vanilla and cardamom pods.
Finish: Floral vanilla. A touch short.
Nose: Brown sugar, creamy malt, quite crisp in spots.

Name: Fettercairn (cask WG219) - Ainneamh
Palate: Gingernut biscuits, white chocolate with light floral melon, and gentle citrus zest.
Finish: Tropical fruit meets crunchy barley with dried baking spice and warming pepper.
Nose: Sweet orchard fruits and creamy vanilla cheesecake.

Name: Tomatin Five Virtues - Metal
Palate: A creamy mouth-feel carries melted butter, vanilla pod and a pinch of ginger.
Finish: Fizzy oak spices and Refresher bars.
Nose: Sourdough bread with hazelnut cream spread. A touch of white peach.

Name: Mackmyra Vintersol 2019
Palate: Gently spiced, with peppery oak and warmer root ginger spice, with custard creams, fruitcake, tinned pear and subtle sherry influence.
Finish: Toasted hot cross buns, with spicy oak and orchard fruit on the finish.
Nose: Oaky vanilla, with liquorice, grape skins, pear tart and vanilla custard, gingerbread and lots of dried fruit, with a subtle note of pine.

Name: Tomatin 15 Year Old
Palate: Continued barley-forward vanilla-y/earth-y notes, while caramel, apple and orange blossom sit in the background.
Finish: Cassia, white peppercorn, pear drops.
Nose: Cut oak, melon, honey and barley.

Name: Ailsa Bay Single Malt
Palate: Undoubtedly meaty 'n' peaty. More of that chalky cereal (dry muesli?) and golden syrup with Big Red in support.
Finish: Sweet, smoky and drying. More Big Red with vanilla.
Nose: Custard and some phenolic ash, some Big Red too, becoming more chalky and cereal driven with subtle golden syrup. As the producer's notes state, bacon then emerges.

Name: Mackmyra VinterglÃ¶d
Palate: Blackcurrant, pink grapefruit and a little floral barley blend with caramelised almonds and tobacco leaves.
Finish: Oak spice and ginger linger with a little cherry.
Nose: Christmas cake spice cuts through blood orange and red berries. Aromas of burnt toffee popcorn, caramel fudge and a little marzipan develop throughout.

Name: Speyburn 16 Year Old
Palate: Cinder toffee and more of that vanilla, balanced by vibrant citrus zest and tangy pineapple.
Finish: White chocolate creaminess with a drizzle of floral honey.
Nose: Dried apple, anise and hallmark vanilla creaminess.

Name: Balblair 2005 (bottled 2017)
Palate: Lemon blossom and caramel digestives, alongside lemon shortbread and flamed orange peel.
Finish: Chewy lemon sweeties on a fresh, zesty finish, with a drizzle of floral honey.
Nose: Honeyed apple and a smidge of vanilla, with lemon curd and boiled pear sweeties.

Name: Nectar Grove (Wemyss Malts)
Palate: Orange peel, strawberry bon-bons, almonds and cherry. A hint of herbaceous lemongrass.
Finish: Lasting red fruit sweetness and crunchy brown sugar.
Nose: Redcurrant, blueberry muffin and a honey glaze.

Name: Wolfburn Lest We Forget
Palate: Oily walnut, toasted brioche, Bakewell tart and scones with fresh cream.
Finish: Just a hint of toasted oak smoke sticks around.
Nose: Whiffs of smoky peanut shells and baked earth, well-balanced by layers of apricot and lemon drizzle cake.

Name: Kingsbarns Bell Rock
Palate: The sherried notes start to take shape on the palate, with dried cherry and raisin, plus almond and peanut brittle.
Finish: Lingering pear tart notes on the finish, plus a dusting of nutmeg and cinnamon.
Nose: Crunchy pears and juicy red apples, with a drizzle of honey and just a smidge of floral heather.

Name: Ardmore Traditional Peated 1l
Palate: Sweetness of vanilla and barley sugar blend well with earthy peat.
Finish: Petrichor and honey'd cereal.
Nose: Burnt sugar and toasted malt, with layers of light peat smoke.

Name: Glenmorangie Milsean Private Edition
Palate: Cinnamon spice begins to develop, alongside yellow plum, melon and more coconut. Subtly oak-y, but the focus here is on the fruity sweetness, which hints more towards orange segments as it goes on.
Finish: An intriguing balance of sweetness and spice (think strawberry laces and ginger snaps) finish it off.
Nose: Seaside fudge, coconut ice, blueberries and candied peels. Develops more 'fresh fruit' than 'candied fruit' with a drop of water.

Name: Highland Park Dragon Legend
Palate: A robust core of heather-y, earthy smoke arrive straight away, with peppercorn, mince pie and oily malt in tow.
Finish: Notes of dried citrus and toasted barley linger, but the finish doesn't drag on too long (get it?).
Nose: Cut grass, roasted vanilla pod and a hint of mulled wine.

Name: Aultmore 25 Year Old
Palate: Crumbly fudge, buttered bread, more banana. Plum, orange and maybe some pineapple on the mid-palate, joined by leather and oak.
Finish: Warm, stewed fruit lasts on the finish, with a prickle of oak spice right at the end.
Nose: Sticky toffee pudding, top with sliced banana and apple. Earthy oak comes through after a minute.

Name: Balblair 1996 (cask 22)
Palate: Vanilla, more orange freshness, fig, cinnamon and cassia spiciness, a touch of old leather.
Finish: Yellow plum, quince jelly, peppercorn, cinnamon once again.
Nose: Black liquorice, fresh citrus, a good waft of menthol.

Name: The Koshi-No Shinobu Blended Whisky
Palate: Fresh, oily malt, with hints of orange and sherry influence alongside creamy coconut.
Finish: Lasting notes of chocolate and creamy vanilla.
Nose: Lemon curd and buttery grain sweetness, with mint white chocolate and fragrant wood.

Name: Big Peat at Christmas 2018
Palate: Ash and earthy oak, with layers of cooking spice and boiled sweeties.
Finish: Lingering hints of soot and white pepper.
Nose: Dense smoke and coastal air, punctuated by hints of pineapple.

Name: Dalwhinnie Triple Matured Edition
Palate: Full-bodied, fresh pear, prominent oak spice, a drizzle more honey and a floral touch, with a handful of herbs.
Finish: Intense with a spicy heat and sweet notes balanced by bitter dark chocolate.
Nose: Soft floral notes with fragrant honey, juicy fruits and nutty sherry hints.

Name: Balblair 1999 - 3rd Release
Palate: Autumnal fruits and ground winter spices blend beautifully amongst toffee apples. Toasty oak glazed in honey and a citrusy bite linger.
Finish: Smooth and lengthy, with gingerbread spice and a hint of leather.
Nose: Soaked raisins, Christmas cake, vanilla, oily orange peel, a good helping of caramel and a sprinkle of cinnamon spice.

Name: Kavalan Solist Port Cask
Palate: Chocolate Ã©clairs, summer berries (think blackcurrant and strawberries atop a cheesecake) and vanilla-forward malt.
Finish: A zesty hint of passion fruit and lemon appears on the finish.
Nose: Light oak spice as it opens, before notes of refreshing tangerine and dried fruit develop.

Name: Kavalan Solist Moscatel Cask
Palate: Quite nutty (think walnuts and almonds). Still has big notes of apricot and sultanas all the way through.
Finish: Rather chocolate-y on the finish.
Nose: Toffee Crisp bars and honey, before layers of caramel-drizzled dried fruits and peaches.

Name: Mackmyra Ãppelblom
Palate: Well rounded fruity and spicy notes continue with the marriage of pear and citrus. Cedar wood emerges alongside aniseed, caramelised almonds, white pepper and ginger spiciness.
Finish: Spicy tones linger with gentle oak and zesty lemon and apple.
Nose: Toasted oak and orchard fruits galore, namely apple and pear with a hint of lemon, delicate floral notes with sweet vanilla and toffee.

Name: Highland Park Full Volume
Palate: More creamy vanilla, sweet lemon peel and tropical fruits, rich coconut balanced by hallmark aromatic smokiness.
Finish: Barley sugar returns on a long finish, supported by slightly tannic oak, even more creamy vanilla and lemon, with cedar wood and a hint of tangy pineapple.
Nose: Vanilla cream, smooth fudge and barley sugar sweetness, balanced by citrus zest, lemon curd and oak spice.

Name: Deanston 20 Year Old
Palate: Chocolate peanuts, Mocha, candied ginger, sugared orange peels. Raisins continue to develop on the mid-palate.
Finish: Warming and long.
Nose: Sultana, raisin, rum cake dotted with cherries and a hint of festive spices.

Name: Paul John Mars Orbiter
Palate: On the palate the whisky is smooth and malty with flavours of dark cocoa, salted almonds and a sweet oak.
Finish: The finish is long and delightfully spicy with a toasted sugar laced with gorgeous tannic smokiness.
Nose: Aromas of honeyed orange blossom with a dash of Muscovado sugar tinged with smoked bacon and delicious peat.

Name: Wolfburn Highland Whisky Festival 2019
Palate: Cookie dough ice cream and buttery pastries, with cinnamon butter and cut grass.
Finish: Milk chocolate and floral honey linger.
Nose: The subtlest hint of fragrant smoke, with lemon curd, creamy almond and apple blossom.

Name: Glengoyne 28 Year Old
Palate: Baking spices rush to the fore of the palate but are tempered well by blackcurrant compote, seedless raisins and Demerara sugar. Spiced apricot and orange chutney and drying cacao form in the backdrop.
Finish: A sumptuous and spicy finish clings on for an age, with just a touch of espresso.
Nose: Classic sherry-cask notes of marmalade, black cherry and dark chocolate lead, before fresh red berries and rum-soaked dried fruits, emerge. Furniture polish, toasted oak and a hint of marzipan icing linger underneath.

Name: Langatun Port Cask Finish
Palate: Waxy orange and fresh vanilla, all surrounded by layers of raspberry and chocolate.
Finish: Fizzy strawberry laces and caramelised dates.
Nose: Summer fruit tart, digestive biscuits, subtle earthy salinity.

Name: Kilchoman STR Cask Matured
Palate: Waves of runny caramel building into sweet summer berries, a dusting of cinnamon, thick lemon curd, buttery shortbread and maritime peat smoke.
Finish: Lingering sweet notes of floral honey and caramel biscuits with fragrant baking spices.
Nose: Summer fruit compote, rich, buttery toffee and maritime aromas with swirls of peat smoke, baking spices and salted caramel.

Name: Highland Park Voyage Of The Raven
Palate: Peat is still in the background, but this expression is very much a showcase of Sherried Highland Park malt.
Finish: Drying Christmas-y spices last on the finish.
Nose: Chocolate mousse and black cherry, with a subtle wisp of floral smoke.

Name: Kavalan Solist Amontillado Cask
Palate: Coffee bean spiciness, leading into rich toffee, treacle and toasted oak.
Finish: Peppercorn and Sherry-soaked cherries.
Nose: Vanilla-y barley, with peanut brittle and dried apricot. Subtle white chocolate notes develop.

Name: Balblair 2000 (bottled 2018)
Palate: Ground spices and toasted nuts, balanced by sweeter notes of more tropical fruit, bitter orange peel and a drizzle of honey.
Finish: A lengthy finish, sweet and creamy notes melting into bitter chocolate.
Nose: Full bodied, with notes of oaky vanilla, spiced fruitcake and ripe tropical fruits.

Name: Tamdhu Batch Strength (Batch 3)
Palate: Thick honey, damson jam, oily barley with fresh strawberries in tow.
Finish: Lasting nutmeg and clove spiciness, plus a touch of chocolate muffin.
Nose: Black Forest gateau, vanilla pod, marmalade and maple syrup.

Name: Ar11 - Elements of Islay (Ardbeg)
Palate: Barbecued meat marinated in honey and soy, with clove-studded orange, burnt brown sugar and anise.
Finish: Plum tart and lots of barbecue smoke, with dusty cocoa.
Nose: Smouldering smoky oak, with dried fruit, liquorice and cherry jam.

Name: Aultmore 18 Year Old
Palate: Herbaceous, vinous (Riesling and Chardonnay), syrupy orchard fruit, biscuit, fresh orange blossom.
Finish: Sultana, citrus, malt, light and lingering.
Nose: Cereal, fruit salad, vanilla, citrus, peach. Very inviting.

Name: Tomatin Five Virtues - Earth
Palate: Layers smoke and malt, followed by a kick of blackberry sweetness.
Finish: Roasted coffee beans, salted chocolate.
Nose: Almond croissant, toasted vanilla pod and a hint of heather honey.

Name: Tomintoul With A Peaty Tang 1l
Palate: Quite rich and powerful. There are notes of toasted oak with notes of pepper and the smoke thereof. Notes of toasty cereals and supple peat. A wistful ash note builds.
Finish: Long and hot with pepper and a leafy green note.
Nose: Full and pungent. There are notes of heather roots and wood smoke. A dark peat with notes of copper and pine oils with a touch of gentle sweetness from the barley malt.

Name: Ardbeg 1974 (Spirit of Scotland)
Palate: Rich peat smoke and iodine. Sticking plasters, fiery wood smoke, linseed oil and dried herbs.
Finish: Long finish with mixed peels, lime zest and herbs.
Nose: Notes of spice and pepper. Hints of lime zest, manuka honey and mixed herbs. A little cocoa butter.

Name: Glenfiddich Reserve Cask 1l
Palate: Christmas spice up front, joined by fresh lemon, chewy barley, almonds and a little old oak.
Finish: Long, with a good balance of sweet citrus and oak spices.
Nose: Waxy peels, marmalade and Christmas-y clove warmth. Vanilla, raisin and a touch of dark chocolate.

Name: Kiln Embers (Wemyss Malts)
Palate: As you would expect from a name like 'Kiln Embers', there's plenty of warming, spicy ember notes coming through. Malty.
Finish: Sweet peat lasts and lasts.
Nose: Opens with citrus and smoke - a little bit meaty, too.

Name: Yamazaki 50 Year Old
Palate: Incredibly rich - this is an enveloping malt, filled with aromatic wood, dried herbs and a barrage of exotic spices. A touch of manuka honey sweetness, chestnut mushrooms, allspice and even a hint of blossom.
Finish: A very long finish with a predominance of fruit of all kinds, from dried apricot to stewed apples and Madeira wine. A hint of agave nectar sweetness, and a plume of wood smoke.
Nose: Spiced and intense, with an almost perfume-like delivery of sandalwood, potpourri and incense. Supple sherry and even the vaguest whisper of smoke. The oak grip is good and very deep.

Name: Master of Malt Islay Single Malt
Palate: Rounded with dry notes of iodine amidst a beautiful butterscotch sweetness. Dry wood smoke, and hints of tarmac on a hot day, but gentle ones, mind.
Finish: iodine, smoke etc. Very good indeed.
Nose: Southern coast of Islay on the nose! Big on classic cool wood smoke with sweet honey sweetness. Hints of sticking plasters, grist and maybe lemon sherbet?

Name: Benromach 1999 Latitude 53
Palate: Thick, full-bodied. Sherried and oily. More marmalade, sugared peels, delightful bitter sweetness.
Finish: Sublime. Oranges, sugared peels with building smoke and spice.
Nose: Sherried raisins, and dark peat. Whirls of smoke, bittersweet oak and marmalade. Very aromatic.

Name: Benromach 30 Year Old
Palate: Rich Christmas cake covered in marzipan and icing with a sprinkling of winter spice on top!
Finish: The finish is long and rewarding with dried fruit and warm spice notes.
Nose: Rum-soaked raisins leading to roasted stone fruits and delicate spice highlighted with vanilla.

Name: Hellyers Road Slightly Peated
Palate: Gingerbread, vanilla-y malt, apricot toasted sugar and peppermint.
Finish: Very slightly coastal, but still rich in orchard fruit.
Nose: Orange peel and coconut ice. A subtle waft of mineral-rich smoke.

Name: Tullibardine 20 Year Old
Palate: Honeyed, malty palate with vanilla and mixed spices. Orange blossom honey, allspice and pepper.
Finish: Long finish with gingerbread and porridge oats on the tail.
Nose: Cocoa butter and allspice, notes of vanilla creamy and candy floss. Manuka honey.

Name: Glenrothes Sherry Cask Reserve
Palate: Flamed orange zest and cinnamon, with more ginger and spice from the cask up front. This swiftly turns to juicy sultanas and raisins, with perhaps a tiny wisp of earthy smoke.
Finish: Brown sugar, citrus peel and nutmeg last on the finish.
Nose: Plump raisins, candied ginger and crumbly shortbread dusted with sugar. Crushed walnuts and oak appear further on.

Name: Cardhu 18 Year Old
Palate: Quite chocolatey on the palate, with notes of pear and citrus never far away.
Finish: Drying oaky spices and another hint of dark chocolate.
Nose: Cakey vanilla, caramelised fruit, a hint of new leather.

Name: Highland Park Sword 1997
Palate: The palate is smoky with a hint of salt and then comes a generous helping of dried fruits and warm spices.
Finish: The finish is long and smoky with a little vanilla and plenty of fruit.
Nose: Smoky heather, citrus zest and plenty of dried fruit.

Name: Littlemill 21 Year Old
Palate: Lemon curd and peppermint sweets. Gingerbread, malt and a little manuka honey. Vanilla develops.
Finish: Vanilla custard, butterscotch and cooked apples. Becomes quite nutty on the tail.
Nose: Fresh flowers and dried fruit. Candied lemon, cantaloupe and just a hint of coconut ice.

Name: Glenrothes Robur Reserve 1l
Palate: Sweet spices, nutmeg, prune juice, a hint of uncooked pastry, a little golden syrup and Demerara rum.
Finish: Cloves, more of those prunes, a hint of dried apricot and toasted barley.
Nose: Sherry on the nose, sweet Olosoro, pepper, berry fruits, calves leather and cedar wood.

Name: Karuizawa 17 Year Old
Palate: Sweet and intense, with notes of TCP, driftwood, hints of peat smoke, musty tool sheds, peanuts, floral hints and baked apple.
Finish: Sherried and dry, black pepper, very spicy, peaty, oily, some chili.
Nose: Smoky and oily, with notes of iodine, oak, acetone hazelnut, rapeseed oil, peanuts and granary toast. Goodness gracious malt it's good.

Name: Strathisla 1969 (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: The palate is fruitier with notes of pineapple and mango with wood smoke drifting on top.
Finish: The finish is long with spice and subtle peat smoke.
Nose: Rich Christmas cake aromas of currants, raisins, brown sugar and mixed spice are woven into candied orange peel and marzipan.

Name: Dalmore 18 Year Old
Palate: A delicious fireside dram with notes of chocolate raisins, juicy citrus, stewed fruits, old sherry and pepper.
Finish: A long, fruity finish ending on almond, buttery toffee apples and cocoa.
Nose: Fruity and spicy with notes of vanilla, orange zest and potpourri, marmalade and sweet milk chocolate. A touch of leather and sultana.

Name: Glenfarclas 1958 Family Cask
Palate: Big and zealous. Oak, sherry. Rum, nice sweetness.
Finish: Toffee, dark sugar. Long and intense.
Nose: Aromatic. Berry fruits, quince jam. Allspice, cinnamon. Toasted malt loaf, hazelnut spread.

Name: Highland Park Dark Origins
Palate: Sweet, fragrant peat emerges with nutty melted milk chocolate and a little orange alongside some pastries.
Finish: Long and sweet, a little dry chocolate, just a hint of that heather smoke, then salivating.
Nose: Dusty baking spices and cocoa at first, cinnamon, vanilla, dates. Coffee cream Revels (possibly a couple of the orange ones too), a touch of blackcurrant/liquorice, plus butterscotch and an interplay between milk and dark chocolate.

Name: Ardbeg Corryvreckan - Committee Reserve
Palate: Round and rich in the mouth. Very much on mochaccino, with a big coastal presence. Dry smoke, tar and sticking plasters.
Finish: Long, develops with smoky bacon, coffee and olive brine.
Nose: Big bodied and brooding. Opens on massive peat, tar, spices and herbal notes. Coastal and fruity. Hints of cocoa.

Name: Balblair 1997 - 2nd Release
Palate: Sweet, a little earthen quality with a fruity robustness. More vanilla, but now creamier, and gently infused with the oak.
Finish: Silken with warm pastries.
Nose: Crisp, herbal, berries and barley, nutty vanilla.

Name: Strathisla 12 Year Old
Palate: Malty core with notes of sultanas and cinnamon pastries. Allspice, cooked apple and mince pies.
Finish: Long finish. Very fruity.
Nose: Soft oak and hints of candied peel. A little floral character too, with notes of spice and Danish pastries.

Name: Bladnoch 13 Year Old
Palate: Juicy, estery with limes and lemon. Seville marmalade, spicy.
Finish: Long and crisp, more citrus, floral, malty cereal every now and then.
Nose: Rich and pungent. Notes of barley, oats, citrus. A little pink grapefruit, rose petal, grassy.

Name: Fettercairn 30 Year Old
Palate: Pine resin, beeswax and thick barley malt. Spiciness from cinnamon, toasty oak and a touch of something rubbery.
Finish: Good length with more of those pine-y, resinous notes, potpourri and honey.
Nose: Beeswax and dried herbs, some toffee apple, and a hint of fresh peppermint leaf. Cedar, cigar leaves and butterscotch.

Name: Glenfarclas 1963 Family Cask
Palate: Rich, solid dryness. Chewy. Madeira, rum, noble rot.
Finish: Long, oaky, espresso, bittersweet.
Nose: Rich and floral. Blossom, nutty. Almond, woody. Praline.

Name: Glencadam 21 Year Old
Palate: Spicy and tingling on the tongue with oak-led spices, vanilla, cinnamon and allspice, creamy pineapple and hints of coconut alongside toasted barley.
Finish: Good length with some oaky dryness and tropical fruit.
Nose: Buttery and sweet with notes of tropical fruits, citrus, marmalade, toast, and custard.

Name: Hanyu 1991 Cask 370
Palate: Big, chewy, tannic oak. Pleasant acidity.
Finish: Remins us of Watermelon Nerds. You'll just have to try this one for yourselves!
Nose: Lots of dark fruits, dried and rich. Figs, dates, nutty. Fruit salad. Tannins.

Name: Tobermory 10 Year Old
Palate: Quite sweet and light. There are elements of acacia honey and continuing oak from the nose. Smoke and black pepper notes rise gently with a touch of dried fruit and peels. A flash of cinnamon later on.
Finish: Long and herbal with a touch of pepper.
Nose: Barley sugars and toasted cereal, supported by hints of winter spice and soft oak. Salty melted butter and ground ginger develop.

Name: Glenfiddich 30 Year Old
Palate: Very rich with a mix of dates, peels and nuts from the sherry barrel, and then a surge of vanilla sweetness and oak. Hints of blossom, mixed fruits.
Finish: Long and malty, toffee and honeyed sweetness.
Nose: Cocoa, espresso coffee, oak, malt, hints of very rich sherry. A perfect Glenfiddich, with predominance of sublime oak.

Name: FEW Single Malt
Palate: Red apple now along with more fragrant exotic spices on a chocolate Flake.
Finish: Oak, spicy caramel, Ovaltine and chocolate.
Nose: garam masala and turmeric. Dark chocolate winds its way throughout.

Name: Master of Malt Lowland Single Malt
Palate: Very floral - rose petals, apple blossom. It has a lift of ginger spice which perks up a soft core of fruit and barley. Very balanced and soft.
Finish: Good length considering how soft the whisky is, fades out like silk with hints of pear and oak.
