Nose: Youthful, very fruity... apple-like even, not dissimilar to Calvados. Very pleasing with sweet, thick notes of jam and praline.

Name: Glenfarclas 1982 Family Cask
Palate: Rich, spicy, creamy, oak sweetness. Barley.
Finish: Nutty, herbal, creamy, toffee.
Nose: Herbal, oaky vanilla, toffee, hay, rooty.

Name: Glenfarclas Family Cask 1966
Palate: Classic sherry Christmas cake with a mug of coffee dominant mocha on the side with a sprinkling of Demerara sugar on top.
Finish: A long finish with bitter plain chocolate and roasted coffee beans.
Nose: Melted dark chocolate drizzled over malt biscuits with a glass of sweet sherry on the side.

Name: Ardbeg Feis Ile 2011
Palate: An explosion floods over the palate, and it gives up intense notes of prunes, tangy plums, warm pastries and thick smoke. Hints of burnt sugar too, with just a little citric tanginess late palate.
Finish: Very long, and big on sherry. It has a perfect balance of wood smoke and sweet, over-ripe grapes, with a tinge of drying oak on the tail.
Nose: Really thick and rich. Thereâs an incredible amount going on, all of which is underpinned by this meaty, BBQ smoke. Thereâs some of the Ardbeg citrus, but mostly youâre greeted with aromas of tar, black treacle, smoked prune juice and sweet sherry.

Name: Tobermory 15 Year Old
Palate: Full-bodied with notes of sherried peels and winter spice, crÃ¨me de cacao and peppery oak.
Finish: Long and spicy with notes of walnut and salty melted butter.
Nose: Medium-bodied and rich. There are notes of sultanas and Oloroso sherry, lemon and orange peels with feinty, honeyed cigar box hints with requisite smoke rising gently.

Name: Craigellachie 23 Year Old
Palate: Salted caramel, creamy vanilla and more orange zest. Cinnamon, nutmeg and a subtle whiff of sulphur give it plenty of depth.
Finish: The sulphur lasts, but it's not overpowering - the sweet spices bring balance to the long finish.
Nose: Lemon, orange and pineapple up front, backed up by warm oak and golden barley. Oak notes become increasingly toasty as it goes on.

Name: Ardbeg 1998 Single Cask
Palate: Thick and oily with notes of fresh espresso, hot milk, aniseed and winter spices. Some cloves, nutmeg, and a touch of vanilla, leather armchairs and old books. A little icing sugar, and a big whack of fiery peatsmoke.
Finish: Beautiful finish with stewed fruits, plum jam, winter spices and orange zest.
Nose: Intense and very rich with notes of golden syrup, gingernut biscuits and tar. Hints of cigar smoke, sultanas, rum and raisin icecream and cherry liqueur chocolates develop, with more than a suggestion of hot wood embers.

Name: Springbank 1997 Batch 1
Palate: Pungent and full. Notes of tangerine juice and sugar, hints of lime, buttery barley and malt extract. There are some hints of smoked toffee with cream and sea weed. Winter spice develops with a little juicy sultana.
Finish: Long and quite fresh with a little vanilla spice.
Nose: Clean with some cut hay notes, herbal tones and notes of damp moss and earthen roots, hints of tropical fruit and dried leafs. Some notes of dried cereals and a hint of Eastern spice.

Name: Cardhu Special Cask Reserve
Palate: Plenty of cereal and barley at its centre, surrounded by home-made fudge, raisins, citrus zest and a good chunk of dark chocolate. Cinnamon and ginger pop up in the mid-palate.
Finish: Long and intense with spice.
Nose: Dried apricots and pineapple. Thick waves of caramel and honey'd barley. The "old oak" makes a spicy appearance later on.

Name: Balblair 1965 Single Cask
Palate: Resplendent with sweetness and lush creamy notes. Barley glowing, with beautiful spicy smoke and perfect depth of oak.
Finish: Sublime, dry oaky notes retaining good barley sweetness and little whirls of smoke on the tail.
Nose: Complex, great refinement. The oak has nurtured an exquisite smoke, honey and toffee notes emerge with a balancing citric character, a little sherried perhaps with juicy sultanas and a touch of winter spice.

Name: Cragganmore 29 Year Old
Palate: Crisp, pineapple, more papaya and citrus. Juicy, winter spice.
Finish: Long, spicy, a touch of wax.
Nose: Floral, fresh. Fruit salad. Papaya, grenadine, development of fresh ripe mango, citrus. A little oak.

Name: Dalwhinnie 29 Year Old
Palate: Good body, cooked fruit, malmsey. A little lemon zest, calvados with vanilla cream, desiccated fruit.
Finish: Fresh, punchy, honey.
Nose: Buttery oak, hay, grasses. Barley sweetness. Subtle peat, delicate.

Name: Cameronbridge 27 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Itâs a sweet and delicately spiced palate. Caramelised fresh pineapple, coconut snowballs and earthy vanilla, which is followed by toffee and a little drying nutmeg.
Finish: White chocolate and orange wine gums linger.
Nose: Vanilla ice cream, tropical fruit and little sharp green apple, then orange blossom, banana foam sweets, and milk chocolate. A touch of anise is there too, as well as a little baking spice.

Name: VAT 69 Blended Scotch Whisky
Palate: Ground almonds and barley malt. Slightly biscuity, more of those pear notes, a little pepper. Sweet, rounded.
Finish: Woody, spiced finish. Caramel.
Nose: Hints of spice and caramel, notes of barley malt, with a soft wheat character. A touch of pear juice.

Name: A. Roborel De Climens Finition Merlot
Palate: Bold barley with elegant, jammy fruit and lingering spice, rich and oaky mouthfeel.
Finish: Plenty of spice, with polished oak and black forest gateaux.
Nose: Tangy notes of cherry and sweeter red fruits, bold barley with a whiff of smoked oak.

Name: Master of Malt Highland Single Malt
Palate: Toffee apple and prunes, pleasing hints of sweet sherry entwined with rich malt. Notes of spices develop toward the late palate which has hints of apple strudel and orange zest.
Finish: Good length with a great rich, fruity sweetness.
Nose: Creamy, sweet cereal notes, like cinnamon and Demerara in porridge, maybe sprinkled with a handful of soft sultanas. Very gristy.

Name: Glenfarclas 1987 Family Cask
Palate: Gently sherried, vanilla, menthol
Finish: Burnt rubber emerges, astringent, very long.
Nose: Fruity, floral. Homemade conserves, Cut herbs, grassy, almond. A hint of bitumen?

Name: Glen Garioch Virgin Oak
Palate: A big, chocolate burst, with chewy toffees and sugar coated sweeties. This is followed by the oak that you knew was coming, but it's surprisingly subtle. Spices and cloves too. Complex and tasty.
Finish: Vanilla reappears to calm down the oak spices for a nice, long finish.
Nose: Oat cereal with a sprinkle of brown sugar. Pine breeze and a vanilla hum.

Name: Glenfarclas 1991 Family Cask
Palate: The nose is thick and darkly nutty. Chocolate eclair sweets.
Finish: Big, fruity, toffee, rubbery.
Nose: Thick, darkly nutty. Cherry, stewed fruits, salted butter, fudge. Orchard fruit.

Name: Strathisla 1970 (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Marzipan and Christmas spices with a lick of vanilla.
Finish: The finish is long and lingering with stewing sweet mincemeat and a hint of smoke.
Nose: Burnt Christmas cake, rum-soaked raisins and demerara sugar.

Name: Glenfarclas 1957 Family Cask
Palate: Sherry, fruit. Raisins, Muscovado. Toffee. Oak.
Finish: Very long, oak, tannic, bittersweet with barley and sherry.
Nose: Firm. Oily wood. Sandalwood, pine. Sherry. Ripe, lush fruit.

Name: Convalmore 28 Year Old
Palate: Pungent, rich, excellent sweetness, estery fruit. Fruit salad, stone fruits, grenadine, eucalyptus.
Finish: Bitter sweetness from the oak, long, rich and fruity.
Nose: Rich, heaps of barley, stewed fruit. Christmas cake, brandy butter. Astringent oak, herbal. Mochaccino.

Name: Tomatin 21 Year Old
Palate: The fruits play a big part on the palate, but the smoke sneaking through from deep within make it an absolute pleasure.
Finish: Oak spices appear on the finish.
Nose: A bounty of fruits! Peaches, gooseberries and kiwis, all jostling for attention. A floral touch near the centre.

Name: Bruichladdich 16 Year Old 2002 - Single Cask (Master of Malt)
Palate: Toasted barley, brown sugar, vanilla and lemon peels lead. Plenty of earthy spice and oak shavings emerge underneath.
Finish: Lasting citrus sweetness and vanilla-y barley.
Nose: Apple and dried pear, golden syrup over steamed pudding, thick vanilla and toasted almond, then freshly polished wood and light wood smoke.

Name: Glen Mhor Pure Malt Whisky
Palate: A curious mix of intense oily, spicy, peaty malt, alongside a sweet, floral character. Very interesting indeed, and pepped up with ginger and sweet cereals.
Finish: Peppermint and honeydew melon on the tail.
Nose: Spiced and peaty, oily smoke and coal dust, cut grass and floral notes, a little herbal character and nutmeg.

Name: Invergordon 34 Year Old 1988 (cask 8156) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Toasted walnut, a drizzle of caramel, and cardamom.
Finish: Crunchie bar, banana ice cream, and marmalade.
Nose: Brown sugar, fig, milky coffee, and buttery oak.

Name: Glengoyne 2000 Millennium Clock
Palate: Huge body and very rich with raisins, espresso and demerara sugar.
Finish: Christmas cake and bitter coffee.
Nose: Roasted coffee beans, heaps of dried fruit and mincemeat.

Name: Glenfarclas 1962 Family Cask
Palate: Herbal and musty. Creamy, sherry, prune, spicy oak.
Finish: Smoke, aniseed. Port.
Nose: Rich, almost smoky. Earthy and rich. Big oak, spices, vanilla.

Name: Glenfarclas 1988 Family Cask
Palate: Rich, fruity, candied peels, winter spice, menthol. Vanilla.
Finish: Firm, long, fruity, slightly rubbery.
Nose: Lovely clarity. Fruit salad. Minty, jammy. Floral. Toffee.

Name: Glenfarclas 1955 Family Cask
Palate: Thick, warming. Smoked meats, charcoal, mixed fruits, dark toffee, slightly herbal.
Finish: Quite long and robust, big oak.
Nose: Aromatic, slightly astringent. Herbal, eucalyptus oil, smoky toffee. Acetone, dark chocolate. Espresso.

Name: Bunnahabhain 10 Year Old - Discovery (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Key lime pie, toffee apple, oak char, anise and smoky bonfire embers.
Finish: Lemon peel and warming nutmeg and ginger, with just a hint of persisting smoke.
Nose: Ground almond, tinned pear and salted caramel, with an aromatic smoky note running through alongside a hint of vanilla.

Name: The Singleton of Glendullan 18 Year Old
Palate: Coconut ice, lemon peel, drying oak and cassia spiciness.
Finish: Peppery malt and more mature oak finishes this one off.
Nose: Nutella, sultana and honey, with hints of fresh green apple in the background.

Name: Glenfarclas 1976 Family Cask
Palate: Rich, balanced. Fruity, exotic spice, earthy. Aniseed.
Finish: Plum jam, soft, rubbery, herbal.
Nose: Jammy, fruity, Sauternes, herbal, menthol freshness, toffee.

Name: Carsebridge 30 Year Old 1981 - The Clan Denny (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Butterscotch and foam bananas, hints of dark cocoa and aniseed, a touch of oak.
Finish: Almond and pastis.
Nose: Sweet and grainy, notes of vanilla and chocolate, almond oil, caramel and porridge.

Name: Arran 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 2012/0854) - Private Cask
Palate: Cinnamon and clove, with syrupy figs, coffee beans, and rich fruitcake.
Finish: Nutty, with sweet dates.
Nose: Dried apricots, with cocoa nibs, toasted grain, and woody spice.

Name: Cambus 48 Year Old 1963 - The Clan Denny (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Spiced oak, honey and nectarine. Zesty citrus and pepper.
Finish: Vanilla and butterscotch.
Nose: Vanilla and white chocolate, porridge oats, cinnamon and fruit.

Name: Glenfarclas 1956 Family Cask
Palate: Firm. Sherry, sultanas, rum, nutty, oily. Walnut, hazelnut, meaty oak.
Finish: Dry, oaky, dark fruits.
Nose: Full and sumptuous. Rich and fruity, berry fruits, conserves, counterbalancing caramelised sugar, winter spice.

Name: Glenmorangie 1975 Tain L'Hermitage
Palate: Rich and intense with notes of cloves, aniseed and stewed fruit. A hint of vanilla cream, berry fruit and pepper.
Finish: Long, peppery finish with dried grass and malt.
Nose: Sweet and rich with boiled sweets and Demerara sugar. Hints of banana chips, morello cherry and allspice.

Name: Glen Ord 13 Year Old 2008 (casks 318697 & 318698 & 318700) - Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Oaky vanilla, porridge drizzled with golden syrup, and gentle peppery spice.
Finish: Fresh hay and drizzles of caramel.
Nose: Vanilla fudge, crunchy apple, and creamy oatcakes.

Name: Loch Lomond Single Cask (cask 1912)
Palate: Packs plenty of vanilla and caramel, combined with a waft of floral air underneath.
Finish: Brioche and summer berries.
Nose: Orange boiled sweeties and candied peels, with a touch of ginger to keep it from becoming sickly sweet.

Name: Aberlour 10 Year Old
Palate: Quite full-bodied, spicy rich fruitcake, toffee notes and a creamy malty-feel and the vaguest whisper of something akin to synthetic banana.
Finish: Caramel and honey, the malt still evident and the sweet spices still linger.
Nose: Sweet and full. Sherried raisins, hints of toffee and a pleasant nuttiness.

Name: Forest Whisky Blend Number Eleven Gift Set with Glass
Palate: Malty on the palate with lots of vanilla and honey, supported by flashes of stem ginger and dates.
Finish: Spicy cassia and toasted teacake.
Nose: Melted butter, caramel popcorn, sultanas, dried apricots.

Name: Hazelburn 12 Year Old
Palate: Spicy on the palate, nutty and cocoa rich, oak, coffee, gentle peat.
Finish: Coffee, spices, citrus, chocolate, long finish.
Nose: Pungent and aromatic with notes of dried fruits, plenty of sherry integration with notes of citrus, toffee and nuts.

Name: Jura 21 Year Old
Palate: Good body with notes of winter cake, damson jam, marzipan and an uprising of cooked fruit with winter spice and fudge.
Finish: Medium-length with notes of chewy oak tannins.
Nose: Full and fragrant. Notes of toffee and fudge, a touch of vanilla with a spread of sweet nuts. There are honeyed notes creeping in with tones Tokaji and port.

Name: The GlenDronach Cask Strength Batch 11
Palate: Rich fruitcake, cocoa nibs, dried currants, clove, cinnamon, and some dark muscovado sugar.
Finish: Warm winter spices build, with almond nougat.
Nose: Dark gingerbread, with candied orange peel, dried raisins, and a touch of toasted almonds.

Name: Glenfarclas 1977 Family Cask
Palate: Honeycomb sweetness, spices, Sauternes, cereals, some creamy sherry.
Finish: Abrupt, but explosive, tingling oaky smoke, vanilla milkshake.
Nose: Buttery. Honey on granary toast, gentle sherry, spice.

Name: Benrinnes 30 Year Old 1984 (cask 2268) - Whisky is Nature (Silver Seal)
Palate: Green Fruit Pastilles, Alpine herbs, toasted pine.
Finish: The remains of the smoke stick around, with a balancing hint of grapefruit.
Nose: Waxy peels and resinous oak, with a good kick of robust smoke elbowing its way to the fore.

Name: Royal Brackla 21 Year Old
Palate: Chocolate flake with just a few dark spices adding complexity.
Finish: The green edge seen in the other expressions seems to appear on the finish with cocoa, chocolate sponge and cream.
Nose: Vanilla crÃ¨me, some sweet ans slightly sharp fresh berries and gooseberries - much fruitier than the 12 & 16 year olds.

Name: Glenfarclas 1954 Family Cask
Palate: Rich, intense, peppered spice. Oak, tannic. Rummy, dark sugar, barley, juicy.
Finish: Long, oaked, drying, malmsey, kirshwasser.
Nose: Barley sugar, sherry. Oak, cinnamon, nutmeg and cloves.

Name: The Singleton of Glendullan 12 Year Old
Palate: Drying at first with oak and cinnamon, before hints of fresh apple and caramelised pear bring a juiciness to the palate.
Finish: A very subtle touch of smoke develops underneath toffee and blueberry on the finish.
Nose: Soft vanilla and sawdust as it opens, leading on to notes of dried fruit and mixed nuts.

Name: Glenfarclas 1952 Family Cask
Palate: Fruity, malty. Grist. Cereals, fruit liqueurs, tangy zest. Plumes of whirling smoke.
Finish: Long, oaked, toasty. Hints of smoke.
Nose: Tight, floral. Smoky toffee. Candied peels.

Name: Caledonian 45 Year Old 1965 - The Clan Denny (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Sweet and intense, oily and nutty. Notes of praline, lemon oil, toasted brioche.
Finish: Maple spices and nutmeg.
Nose: Bourbon barrel notes - charred oak, vanilla and espresso, a little caramel. Notes of toffee brittle, mozzarella and barley sugar.

Name: Angelsâ Nectar Islay Rioja Cask Edition
Palate: Layers of fresh fruit and juicy blackcurrants with a digestive biscuit sweetness and hint of beeswax.
Finish: Lingering notes of sweet fruit, smoke and vanilla.
Nose: Smoke, blackcurrant jam and strawberries.

Name: Mars Komagatake Shinanotanpopo - Nature of Shinshu
Palate: Floral malt starts to take control on the palate, though sweetness of blueberries and caramel continues to hold its ground.
Finish: A touch of honeysuckle and mint on the finish.
Nose: Summer berry tart with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on the site.

Name: Kilkerran Heavily Peated Batch No. 7
Palate: Plenty of citrus and orchard fruit as well as honey-roasted nuts and Caramel Digestives.
Finish: Green apple, damp oak, salted pretzel, and lemon peel linger.
Nose: Forest floor earthiness leads with raspberry, oak char, shortbread, and bonfire ash in support.

Name: Lagg Inaugural Release Batch 2
Palate: Earthy peat smoke is joined by silky caramel, dried prunes, and warm cinnamon.
Finish: Bonfire smoke lingers, along with gentle tannins, and baking spices.
Nose: Smouldering camp bonfires, a touch of milk chocolate, dried vine fruits, and cacao nibs.

Name: Compass Box Delilah's XXV
Palate: Spicy sherried malt (plenty of clove and ginger notes coming through), atop layers of chocolate ice cream and praline.
Finish: Fruitier on the finish than the palate, with lingering apricot and green apple.
Nose: Pecan, blackberry, butterscotch, Bourbon biscuits, a touch of grassy malt.

Name: Black Bottle Gift Pack with Glass
Palate: Candied ginger and cigar box, with charred herbs, chocolate spread on brown bread and a drizzle of golden syrup.
Finish: Oak spice and honey.
Nose: Polished oak and porridge with a sprinkle of brown sugar, with cut grass and very subtle smoke in support.

Name: Old Perth Number 7 Release
Palate: Chocolate-coated nuts and hints of dried kitchen herbs, with a good helping of floral honey.
Finish: Green leafy notes alongside honeycomb.
Nose: Maple syrup sweetness is balanced by cut grass herbaceous notes and toffee apple sweetness.

Name: Balvenie DoubleWood 25 Year Old
Palate: Aromatic oak and rich waves of earthy vanilla. Simmering cinnamon and five-spice. Dried fruit and a hint of hot chocolate give it a welcome sweetness.
Finish: Cigar box, continued spice and just a touch of cranberry.
Nose: Dense shortbread and mince-pie filling, joined a whiff of old leather later on.

Name: Cl11 - Elements of Islay (Caol Ila)
Palate: Earthy peat and eucalyptus, melted chocolate, salted caramel, clove.
Finish: A hint of lemon drizzle cask develops.
Nose: Brioche, smoked meats, dried orange peel and sultana.

Name: Ardmore 9 Year Old (Chorlton Whisky)
Palate: Oatcakes and Christmas spices, with the continued orange notes pairing wonderfully.
Finish: Meaty smoke and hints of cinnamon bark.
Nose: Citrus-forward, with enough peaty smoke to balance the fruit freshness.

Name: Ardbeg Perpetuum - Bicentenary Committee Release
Palate: More chocolate, fresh citrus, hazelnut, treacle toffee, fig and smoked meat. Creamy, great mouthfeel.
Finish: Smooth tar smoke, nutmeg, anise, lemon.
Nose: Vanilla and pine, chocolate and coffee grinds, pleasingly coastal peat. Deep and yet lively.

Name: Tamdhu Cigar Malt - Release 2
Palate: A thick, rich texture brings notes of earthy vanilla, manuka honey, malt loaf, and dried fruits.
Finish: Honey-roasted nuts and dried apricot linger.
Nose: Stem ginger, sherried fruits, rich golden syrup, and hints of tannic oak.

Name: Benromach Organic 2011 (bottled 2018)
Palate: More sweet malt, creamy mocha and dark chocolate, with sweet banana and lemon zest with a little oak spice and peppery heat.
Finish: Toasty oak, lemon peel and a good crack of black pepper.
Nose: Sweet vanilla and malt aromas, caramelised banana, tangy pineapple and a touch of orange zest.

Name: Burnside 20 Year Old (Chorlton Whisky)
Palate: Bitter orange and lush nectarine fruitiness blends with salted butter, sauerkraut hazelnut and vanilla custard. Drying oak permeates throughout.
Finish: Medium length, with mulched leaves, citrus pepper, juicy barely and honeycomb.
Nose: Complex sweetness from highland shortbread, caramel, tinned peaches, with alfresco notes of heather, pine needles and damp hay.

Name: Balvenie Tun 1509 - Batch 6
Palate: Beautiful depth on the palate with a touch of maple syrup, candied orange and runny honey.
Finish: Sweet and malty on the finish alongside swathes of oak vanilla and a spicy layer.
Nose: Rich on the nose with soft brown sugar, toffee, blossom honey and ginger oak spices.

Name: Teaninich 11 Year Old - Chorlton Whisky
Palate: Tinned peaches and oily lemon peel, with browned (slightly burnt) butter and dark berry coulis.
Finish: Boiled citrus sweeties, balanced by burnt rubber and fragrant peat.
Nose: Just a whisper of maritime smoke and green seaweed notes, with underripe plum and vanilla custard.

Name: Orkney 12 Year Old (Chorlton Whisky)
Palate: Aniseed balls, black pepper, cooked apples and salted butter.
Finish: Crunchy brown sugar, a burst of citrus and lasting fiery ginger.
Nose: Fragrant honey and toasted almonds, grassy malt, a hint of damp oak.

Name: Glenfiddich Finest Solera - Cask Collection
Palate: Velvety smooth and mellow. Luxurious oak and sweet crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e flavours intertwine with soft spices, raw cane sugar and caramelised fruit.
Finish: Beautiful with a long-lasting sweetness.
Nose: Rich vanilla and toffee notes overlaid with a deep oakiness. Adding a few drops of water releases a ripe autumn fruitiness, full of red berries, rich apricots and poached pear.

Name: Ardbeg Supernova (2009 Stellar Release)
Palate: Mescal, chili, smoked paprika, medicinal, huge peat. Very big fruit, sweet.
Finish: Massive spices, peppercorns, charcoal, chilli, nutmeg.
Nose: Incredible aroma, top quality tequila, toffee, vanilla. Quite sweet, youthful. Peaty, but not what you'd expected. Floral, dry.

Name: Lagg Inaugural Release Batch 3
Palate: Earthy peat is joined by cocoa nibs, hedgerow berries, and a touch of salted vanilla fudge.
Finish: The earthy peat lingers, with drizzles of salted caramel.
Nose: Distant, damp bonfire, oaky vanilla, a touch of dusty cocoa powder.

Name: Dalmore 21 Year Old (2022 Release)
Palate: A symphony of dried fruits appear while the spices become dustier (think fresh cinnamon and clove), supported by old leather, dark chocolate, and juicy citrus.
Finish: A dry finish of curiously savoury baking spices, rich nuttiness, and fresh orchard fruit.
Nose: Rich notes of rancio, cigar box, damp wood, and baking spices, bolstered by bittersweet cocoa and a lick of butterscotch.

Name: Longrow 21 Year Old
Palate: Stewed berries and green apple notes arrive first, before earthy smoke and hickory. Pockets of vanilla and sugared almond pop up later on.
Finish: Final wafts of orange oil, cask char, floral malt and star anise.
Nose: Streaky bacon and burnt ends, with juicy mango and a touch of toffee.

Name: Ezra Brooks White Label Blended Whiskey
Palate: Caramel, resin, pepper, more vanilla, more prominent oak now.
Finish: Quite short.
Nose: Vanilla, honey, corn, some cereal and oak.

Name: Orkney 9 Year Old (Chorlton Whisky)
Palate: A bit gristy, but with plenty of vanilla and salted caramel to back it up.
Finish: Lingering smoke and olive oil.
Nose: Coffee bean, sea air and a touch of cookie dough.

Name: Timorous Beastie 12 Year Old
Palate: Buttery as it opens, leading to heavy vanilla and soft caramel. Warming nutmeg and cracked black pepper notes develop.
Finish: Brown sugar, baked earth, Cognac and shortbread.
Nose: Honeyed barley and toasted almond. Hints of oatcake, Turkish delight and sugary porridge.

Name: SPEY Spirit of Speyside Whisky Festival 2020
Palate: Crisp green apple, sugared almond, more vanilla sweetness and fresh barley. Grows spicier as it develops with hints of pepper and cedar.
Finish: Lightly toasted cinnamon bagels and salted butter.
Nose: Slightly floral at first, with citrus blossom and vanilla, before moving into soft apricot and nectarine territory.

Name: Dark Bargain 10 Year Old
Palate: Continued savoury notes of sea salt, charred oak and salted peanuts, while hints of chocolatey malt and caramel wafers offer sweetness.
Finish: Strong coffee, black pepper and earthy peat slowly fade.
Nose: Heavy smoke with a helping of iodine underneath, plus some sherried notes tucked away.

Name: Old Perth 23 Year Old 1994
Palate: Heather-y smoke at first, though swiftly overtaken by mature oak and waves of old sherry.
Finish: Lingering orange peel, ground coffee and menthol.
Nose: Roasted hazelnut and almond, with golden syrup and milk chocolate bringing balance.

Name: Forest Whisky Blend Number Six
Palate: Orange peel, Jammie Dodgers, cinnamon, black pepper, a hint of dark chocolate and plenty of malt.
Finish: Cinnamon sticks around, as do the vanilla biscuit notes.
Nose: Stem ginger and green tea, fragrant vanilla and Medjool dates.

Name: SmÃ¶gen 2012 (bottled 2022) (cask 34) - Berry Bros. & Rudd
Palate: Oily, coastal smoke, but a little fruitier now, backed by toasted nuts and liquorice.
Finish: A touch of brine, orange peel, and lasting smoke.
Nose: Savoury peat, flamed citrus, a touch of smoked meats, and cigar box.

Name: Rock Island 21 Year Old
Palate: A crack of black pepper, a hint of salty smoked meats, barley sugar, earthy malt, and maritime peat smoke with vanilla sponge.
Finish: A dash of vanilla in between returning salty coastal notes and warming spice.
Nose: Sea spray intertwined with bonfire smoke, peat and vanilla pod.

Name: Glenfarclas 105 22 Year Old
Palate: Walnut, honey, prune, punchy cinnamon and nutmeg, more tobacco and earthy oak.
Finish: Sherried spices and coffee bean notes last ages.
Nose: Dense malt loaf with salted butter. Dark chocolate and wafts of cigar box.

Name: Aberlour A'Bunadh Batch 74
Palate: Sweet and sticky parkin, dried raisins, and a touch of waxy orange peel.
Finish: Warm ginger and pepper linger, with chewy raisins and prunes mingling.
Nose: Tawny marmalade, dried prunes, a drizzle of caramel and warm spices.

Name: Aberlour Casg Annamh Batch 7
Palate: Christmas cake, cherries, cinnamon, and oaky tannins.
Finish: Orange zest and a spicy finish.
Nose: Vanilla leads with distinct fruity and rich sherry notes underneath.

Name: Cl13 - Elements of Islay (Caol Ila)
Palate: Oak char and smooth praline leads into savoury spicy notes, with peppercorns and a pinch of rock salt, alongside summer berry sweetness.
Finish: Salty smoke and chilli pepper warmth lingers.
Nose: Paprika and chilli spice, with barbecue sauce and smoky black pepper. Dark chocolate and lime peel in support.

Name: Kilchoman Loch Gorm 2022 Release
Palate: Oily walnut, freshly cut grass, more summer berries, milk chocolate, clove.
Finish: Cinnamon, candied ginger, and earthy malt.
Nose: Juicy orange and strawberry, with touches of cigar box and salted toffee.

Name: Glenglassaugh Octaves Classic Batch 2
Palate: Chocolate, salted caramel and hints of red chilli flakes. A backbone of barley helps it along.
Finish: Damson jam and toasted teacakes (with butter).
Nose: Earthy vanilla arrives first, but soon enough you'll find notes of dried cranberries and thick treacle.

Name: Kilchoman Loch Gorm 2020 Release
Palate: Red berries and chocolate orange arrive first, followed by a slow build of toasted cinnamon, soft smoke and sugary shortbread.
Finish: Roasted oak staves, caraway, stroopwafel and fruity coffee.
Nose: Gingersnaps, raspberry jam, coastal air and baked earth.

Name: Hazelburn 10 Year Old
Palate: Good mouthfeel paired with bright notes of vanilla and Crunchie bars. More lively fruit notes underneath.
Finish: Oily and sweet on the finish.
Nose: Toffee apples, fresh honey and fragrant pears. Hints of vanilla.

Name: Teaninich 12 Year Old - Chorlton Whisky
Palate: Fresh orchard fruit, orange blossom, and milk chocolate, with nutty flapjack beneath.
Finish: Caramel latte and tangy orange.
Nose: Dried apricot, pencil shaving, Digestive biscuits, and some creamy nuttiness.

Name: Wolfburn Single Cask Selection (cask 87)
Palate: Peppery and honeyed. Soft hints of peat develop, alongside rich red berry sweetness and sugary coffee.
Finish: Beeswax, more honey, sultana and cinnamon.
Nose: Dates and walnuts, with a good hint of earthy vanilla pod in the background.

Name: The GlenDronach Cask Strength Batch 8
Palate: Dusty cocoa, dates and cherry jam, with a drizzle of caramel and praline.
Finish: Fresh espresso, with gooey chocolate pudding and cigar box.
Nose: Earthy oak and vanilla pod, with sandalwood, mocha and golden syrup.

Name: Bell's Princess Eugenie Decanter
Palate: Quite smooth, medium body. Barley and cereals with nut oils, hints of wood and spice.
Finish: Short with notes of fruitcake and smoke.
Nose: Quite soft and gentle. Malted barley and hints of cut herbs and a fresh floral note. Cereal and grist with a little honey.

Name: Kilkerran Heavily Peated (Batch 3)
Palate: Opens up with salted caramel sweetness, before smoke and oatcakes develop. There's a bit of flaky pastry dipped in coffee, and another helping of cooked orchard fruit.
Finish: Drying smoke remains on the finish.
Nose: Roasted apples and poached pears, dusty oak furniture, a hint of espresso and some dried peels.

Name: Tomintoul 14 Year Old (Chorlton Whisky)
Palate: Creamy lemon curd alongside pear crumble, oak spice, sweet malt and sherry fruits.
Finish: Toasty malt, milk chocolate praline and a mix of sultana and raisin.
Nose: Dried fruit alongside fresh, jammy berries, honeyed toast and caramelised nuts.

Name: Forest Whisky Blend Number Four
Palate: Lightly smoky, with chocolatey notes taking the lead on the palate.
Finish: Milky coffee and brown sugar, with a hint of dried earth to it.
Nose: Nutella on rye toast, caramel and orange peels.

Name: Aberlour Casg Annamh Batch 2
Palate: Golden Grahams, nectarines, cinnamon and strawberry jam.
Finish: Cooking spices, sugary biscuits and red apples.
Nose: Milky coffee, flame raisins and plenty of honeyed malt.

Name: Cl10 - Elements of Islay (Caol Ila)
Palate: Marmalade, slightly burnt rye bread, a touch of butterscotch.
Finish: Black pepper and strawberry.
Nose: Smoked barley, honey and brown sugar.

Name: Old Perth Number 6 Release
Palate: Caramelised nuts, melted chocolate, slightly leafy.
Finish: A few hints of peat smoke linger behind butterscotch and apple.
Nose: Pancakes with maple syrup and blueberries. Earthy at points.

Name: Amrut Spectrum 004 (2018 Bottling)
Palate: Liquorice, chilli chocolate, caramelised banana, cedar and nutmeg.
Finish: Raisins, dried pear and a hint of hibiscus.
Nose: Marzipan, Christmas biscuits, a hint of sharp red fruit, cigar box.

Name: Benromach Organic 2010 (bottled 2018)
Palate: Malt is still present, coffee bean and dark chocolate. Citrus peels.
Finish: Clean and quite refreshing.
Nose: Rounded vanilla, pineapple and barley sugar sweets.

Name: Mars Komagatake Kohiganzakura - Nature of Shinshu
Palate: Subtle wafts of tobacco drift between notes of strawberry, mint and yet more nectarine.
Finish: Quite short and smoke-driven.
Nose: Marzipan, apricot and nectarine, a hint of oat cake salinity.

Name: Knockando 15 Year Old 2003
Palate: Runny caramel, milk chocolate, solid malt and oak underpinning it.
Finish: Slightly oily, with enough grape and apple notes for balance.
Nose: Mocha, nectarine, banana fritters and barley.

Name: Balvenie Tun 1509 - Batch 5
Palate: Vanilla ice cream with raspberry sauce and topped with crushed nuts. Juicy apple and apricot, put a slow build of sweet spices.
Finish: Red berries, a smidge of toasted oak, stem ginger.
Nose: Sherried peels, acacia honey, a touch of new leather, raspberry eau de vie, earthy malt and brown sugar.

Name: Linkwood 11 Year Old (Chorlton Whisky)
Palate: Spearmint leaf and fresh lemon, with a whiff of barley sugar.
Finish: Drying cumin and pepper spiciness.
Nose: Nutella on toast, cut grass and sherbet lemons.

Name: Glengoyne Cask Strength (Batch 5)
Palate: Sultanas, pear drops, chocolate peanuts and orange oil.
Finish: Long and well-spiced with pepper and cinnamon.
Nose: Fig, peppery oak, lemon zest and bourbon biscuits.

Name: Timorous Beastie 25 Year Old
Palate: Cornflakes with milk again, alongside buttered bread, raisins, sultanas, sea salt and peppercorn.
Finish: Soft hints of clove and chocolate appear on the finish.
Nose: Orange, honey, soft hints of earthy vanilla pod, peppery malt and cornflakes.

Name: Kilchoman 9 Year Old 2010
Palate: Earthier notes of peat and dried oak appear on the palate, though still featuring plenty of vanilla. A few flashes of Christmas spice too.
Finish: Baked apple, cola cubes, spicy smoke and cherry.
Nose: Creamy and sweet with milky coffee, toasted crumpets with butter and lemon meringue pie.

Name: Paul John Christmas Edition 2019
Palate: Floral honey and sherried dried fruit, cooked plum and slightly burnt toast supported by milky coffee.
Finish: Chai spiced dark chocolate and oily nuts, with a whisper of smoke lingering.
Nose: CrÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e, milk chocolate praline and apple pie, with maple syrup and candied orange.

Name: Amrut Double Cask (2017 Edition)
Palate: Enjoyably creamy, with notes of toffee, cinnamon bun and menthol.
Finish: Papaya, apple and another waft of hot peat.
Nose: Brown sugar and smoky bonfire embers. Sugared orange peels, white wine and raisins.

Name: Glen Grant 50 Year Old
Palate: Wonderful mouth-feel with sweet sherry notes, combined with hints of orange and baked apples.
Finish: Rich, robust and full yet smooth with soft lingering aftertaste.
Nose: Soft and delectable with alluring aroma of toffee, caramel and subtle hints of dried fruits.

Name: Glen Garioch 1997 (bottled 2012)
Palate: A kick of cinnamon and pepper, but this remains firmly in 'caramel and orchard fruit' country.
Finish: Apple turnovers dusted with brown sugar.
Nose: Creamy and sweet, with notes of vanilla ice cream and banana fritters.

Name: Big Peat - Drinks by the Dram Edition
Palate: Black pepper, tarry ropes, liquorice, a whiff of menthol and earthy smoke.
Finish: Maritime notes rush in on the finish, with a sweet hint of salted caramel brownie.
Nose: Bacon, thyme and a good helping of vanilla-y barley.

Name: Connemara Peated Gift Pack with Glass
Palate: Full and smooth with notes of malt and peat, honeyed smoke and barley sweetness.
Finish: Long and pungent with honey and peat smoke.
Nose: Well-smoked and peated, heather freshness and floral notes with a honeyed sweetness and a little wood.

Name: 963 Malt & Grain (59%)
Palate: Layers of icing sugar, hay and orange peel.
Finish: Medium length. Just a whisper of smoked paprika spiciness.
Nose: Laid-back notes of honey'd barley and white chocolate, with a touch of lemon drizzle cake.

Name: Glengoyne The Legacy Series Chapter Two
Palate: Pear drops, sweet vanilla pod and a kick of cinnamon, with buttery lemon shortbread, dried herbs, red apples and a little lime marmalade in support.
Finish: Exceptionally long and mellow with a pleasant prickle of spice.
Nose: Buttery pastry filled with cooked apple and a dash of baking spice with notes of tinned peaches, papaya and toffee in support. Thereâs a hint of white chocolate and raspberry blondies in the backdrop with earthy vanilla, autumnal leaves and candied lemon peel.

Name: Langatun Jacobâs Dram 2015
Palate: Bolder malt and punchy oak, dark cherries and berries, dark chocolate raisins, vanilla and clove spice.
Finish: Ginger and pepper spice come through, toasty charred heather and lingering oak.
Nose: Jam tarts and black forest gateaux, roasted nuts and sweet, mellow malt.

Name: Glengoyne The Legacy Series Chapter One
Palate: A thick mouthfeel, where prominent sherry notes take over gentle oak with more of those dried fruits and sweet vanilla pod, with a hint of stewed pear and cinnamon spice.
Finish: A lengthy finish, dried fruits and sherried notes remain.
Nose: Think luxurious sticky toffee pudding, packed to the brim with dried fruit and Christmas spices, and drowned in vanilla custard.

Name: Ardnamurchan AD/01.21:01
Palate: Oily citrus and stone fruit sweetness, with an intriguing teriyaki sauce note, alongside briney coastal smoke and smouldering embers.
Finish: Chilli heat on a smoky, savoury finish, with a burst of strawberry jam.
Nose: Honeyed baking spices, melted brown sugar, and orange marmalade, all backed up by waves of woody smoke and sea-washed pebbles.

Name: Fettercairn 16 Year Old (1L)
Palate: Fruity coffee, hickory, chocolate again, just a touch of grassy malt, Golden Syrup Cake.
Finish: Toasted oak, plump raisins and candied ginger.
Nose: Boozy red berries, toasted teacakes and melted chocolate, with underlying baked earth spiciness.

Name: Glentauchers 20 Year Old (Chorlton Whisky)
Palate: Butterscotch, bitter orange, roasted almond and flaky pastry.
Finish: Slightly chocolatey, orchard fruit sweetness continues.
Nose: Apricot and pear, followed by a hint of hay.

Name: Old Perth Number 5 Release
Palate: There's a peppery sensation that eagerly rushes through the malty palate, that's then calmed with some subtle sweetness.
Finish: Satisfying length that resists becoming indulgent, with some spice.
Nose: Barley malt is apparent, with hints of spice and caramel.

Name: Hibiki Japanese Harmony - Limited Edition
Palate: Melted butter and caramelised dates. A hint of fragrant sandalwood develops into warming, oak-y spice.
Finish: Brown sugar, citrus peels, white grape and black pepper.
Nose: Red berries, green apple and layers of rich honey.

Name: Mars Komagatake Tsunuki Aging
Palate: More vanilla on the palate, with earthy peat ever present.
Finish: A light hint of new oak adds heat to the finish.
Nose: Oily peat, with leafy cooking herb and vanilla pod notes backing it up.

Name: Tomintoul 45 Year Old 1973
Palate: Richly mouth-filling as notes of nuts, chocolate, mocha coffee bean and spicy oak tannins vie for supremacy.
Finish: Dry and spicy with a rich and enduring finalÃ©.
Nose: Clean Sherry influence on a sweet malty layer. Intense waxy aromas merge with hints of orange citrus and Christmas pudding.

Name: Strathclyde 30 Year Old - Derestricted
Palate: Toast with a thick layer of honey, mint imperials, juicy passion fruit and lychee, yet more vanilla, nutmeg.
Finish: Salted butter, toffee pennies, spearmint, sponge cake, a drop of maraschino.
Nose: Vanilla ice cream with caramel sauce, stroopwafel, milk chocolate, a hint of buttered corn, sandalwood, candle wax, peanut brittle.

Name: Glengoyne 17 Year Old
Palate: More honeyed on the palate, with oaky spices building. Never strays far from the rich dried fruit sweetness, though.
Finish: Dates, almonds, nutmeg, peppercorn, sultanas.
Nose: Poached pear, stem ginger, Christmas pudding, sherry-soaked raisins.

Name: Hazelburn 13 Year Old
Palate: Homemade strawberry jam, sugary and filled with cream, orange zest, brandy snaps and a white chocolate creme brÃ»lÃ©e.
Finish: Chocolate orange, crazy coffee liqueur, buttered popcorn, cocoa beans and mocha coffee with a delicate finish of sweet orange marmalade.
Nose: Initially raisins, marzipan, Demerara sugar followed by treacle, sticky toffee and wood shavings.

Name: Kilkerran Heavily Peated (Batch 1)
Palate: More orchard fruit - now with a citrus hint developing. Green olive, biscuit dough, salted butter and cinnamon sweeties.
Finish: Meaty malt and honey. Lingering peat smoke dryness.
Nose: Cooked apples, campfire embers and a whiff of oat cakes.

Name: Ardbeg Kelpie - Committee Release 2017
Palate: A peppery mouthfeel is followed by a crescendo of rich flavours.  Treacle toffee, Turkish coffee, smoky bacon and lots of dark, dark chocolate.  A curious burst of peachy, estery fruit, hickory wood, clove oil and a suggestion of black olives on the aftertaste.
Finish: Seemingly lasting forever, with deep, deep, almost subterranean flavours of clove, tar and rich toffee.
Nose:
A wonderful, intense, âdancingâ nose, with lots of different, intertwined aromas â powerful, oily peat, dark chocolate, smoked fish, hints of seaweed, and a curious, sharp herbal note.  Waves of spicy, black pepper.

A splash of water brings forth some classic Ardbeg notes, such as creamy coffee, smoked fudge and pine resin. Even some hints of smoked coconut.

Name: Longmorn 18 Year Old - Chorlton Whisky
Palate: Peach crumble, milky coffee, lemonade, biscuit dough, allspice, and black pepper.
Finish: Lingering coffee warmth, as well as vanilla pod and buttered bread.
Nose: A balanced nose of citrus and earthy barley, plus a kick of ginger.

Name: Forest Whisky Blend Number Ten
Palate: Malty on the palate with lots of vanilla and honey, supported by flashes of stem ginger and dates.
Finish: Spicy cassia and toasted teacake.
Nose: Melted butter, caramel popcorn, sultanas, dried apricots.

Name: Miyagikyo Apple Brandy Cask Finish
Palate: Creamy and lively with freshness. Aromas of pineapple, lychee, and kiwi alongside notes of acacia honey.
Finish: Long, alluring. With just a hint of salt, herbal tea, with rosemary, mint, and linden tree flowers adding a floral dimension overall. The empty glass evokes notes of toasted wood such as oak, cypress and pine.
Nose: Rounded with notes of apple, vanilla, honey, sage and verbena. This then evolves in notes of stewed or baked apples, woodiness and spicy notes of ginger and cinnamon.

Name: Teeling 2004 (cask 8833) - Single Cask
Palate: Fruity as it opens, with apricot, orange peel and blueberry. Subtly drying as it develops.
Finish: Slightly spicy, with a subtle sweetness of milk chocolate.
Nose: Corinth raisins, dried barley, a hint of mint leaf.

Name: Benriach 10 Year Old Curiositas
Palate: Still packing a handsome combination of fresh apple and soft smoke, now with a hint of heather in the background.
Finish: Waxy peels, coriander and pepper, wrapped up in cinder toffee.
Nose: Grassy malt and honeyed apple, with a good whack of oak-rich smoke developing underneath.

Name: Forest Whisky Blend Number Fifteen
Palate: Sweet, gloopy toffee and creamy vanilla, nutty, floral wafts of bright oak and caramel malt.
Finish: A touch of shortbread and popcorn with toasted nuts, hints of coconut, and nutmeg.
Nose: Vanilla fudge and syrupy flapjack with dried orange zest and spices.

Name: Old Perth 22 Year Old 1996
Palate: Nutty chocolate, heaps of raisins, a good hint of vibrant green apple, fizzy oak.
Finish: Cinnamon and clove.
Nose: Heavy sherry influence, joined by touches of ground nutmeg and mint leaf.

Name: Scallywag The Green Welly Stop Edition
Palate: Dried fruit from the outset, joined by winter spice and a slight touch of baked earth.
Finish: Cooked summer berries and dark chocolate.
Nose: Gingersnaps and orange peel, with hazelnut, toffee apple and blackcurrant underneath.

Name: Glengoyne Cask Strength (Batch 6)
Palate: Baked apple and pear, doused in honey and baking spices. Intense ground almond notes, and a rich, thick malt core.
Finish: Oaky, spiced finish. Cracking barley malt and zesty orange peel on the tail.
Nose: Malty, barley-led nose with hints of cracked black peppercorns and pimento. Stewed fruit â particularly apple and pear, and candy floss. Buttery too, with notes of butterscotch and caramel.

Name: OC6 - Elements of Islay (Octomore)
Palate: Smoked meats in a rye bread sandwich, a generous helping of black pepper with a hint of sage, apricot and pineapple.
Finish: Black pepper heat on a smoky finish.
Nose: A smoky bonfire caught on a sea breeze, with a metallic note balanced by candied ginger heat and damp grass.

Name: Oc5 - Elements of Islay (Octomore)
Palate: Mineral-rich smoke with a touch of sea salt. Fresh orchard fruit sweetness underneath.
Finish: Burnt oak, oatcakes and white grape.
Nose: BBQ roasted pineapple, honeyed cereal and a whole heap of earthy peat.

Name: Ardmore 20 Year Old 1996
Palate: Peppery peat develops more, not drying, but heating and softening the palate to reveal a robust vanilla that maintains among flares of flamed orange peel. Crushed summer berries and Scottish alfresco notes of freshly Scots pine and thick, meadow grass join with aplomb.
Finish: A light, honey'd finish, elegant peat carries throughout that lets a needed sweetness permeate, with the gentle presence of a sprig of rosemary.
Nose: Earthy peat is present from the start, with clean citrus notes of melon and lemon underneath. Chocolate digestives, honey, red apple and old oak round off an impressive nose.

Name: Aberlour Casg Annamh Batch 5
Palate: Chocolatey at first, before the dried fruit picks up again from the nose. Subtle woody spices develop underneath â think cinnamon and cassia.
Finish: Dense toffee and treacle, with the final hints of festive spices.
Nose: Caramelised nuts and maple syrup on pancakes, with a slow build of raisin and dried tropical fruit.

Name: Old Perth 13 Year Old 2004
Palate: Intensely well-sherried, with dried fruit and chocolate notes by the bucket-load. A lingering smokiness sits in the background, with hints of balsamic vinegar.
Finish: Stem ginger, treacle and mince pie.
Nose: Demerara sugar, rum-raisin ice cream, bonfire smoke.

Name: SÃ©quoia Whisky Single Malt Bio
Palate: Floral barley with a nicely rounded balance of vanilla, toasted oak, and juicy fruit.
Finish: Honeyed fruits, malt loaf, macadamia nuts, woody spice.
Nose: Bright apples and pears, with a touch of apricot and peach too, creamy vanilla, and a hint of cut grass.

Name: Uncle Duke's Single Grain Whisky
Palate: Through more vanilla comes runny caramel, sweet cereals and a prickle of fizzy oak spices. Bounty bar and a little candied peel are present too.
Finish: A good length, with a little honey among the lingering vanilla.
Nose: BBQ charcoal and thick vanilla licks lead over soft oak and a little coconut.

Name: Highland Park Ragnvald (Warrior Series)
Palate: Flaky pastries ahoy! Lots of almond croissant and lemon danish notes up front, soon joined by more old Sherry, leather and ground cinnamon.
Finish: Dark chocolate, coastal smoke and dried fruit. Very long.
Nose: Waxy orange and vanilla, red apple slices, brown sugar and old oak. There's a hint of long-aged Sherry in there too...

Name: Yoichi 20 Year Old 1990
Palate: Cinnamon, sticky toffee pudding, soft peat, soy sauce, turmeric and stewed fruit. A touch of dried banana, parsley.
Finish: Long and peppery with crisp, tangy, gripping oak.
Nose: Buttery, dry old sherry, hints of oak, smoke, a little soya milk, a touch of stem ginger in syrup. Peat smoke, green oak, pine resin and forest floors.

Name: Kilchoman 7 Year Old 2008
Palate: Sweet vanilla and cocoa butter with wisps of smoke give way to greater fruitiness than has perhaps often been seen from Kilchoman, blueberries and apricot pieces.
Finish: Creamy and fruity, with soft peat too, naturally.
Nose: We're in familiar territory here, golden barley, integrated peat, toffees and lemon peel.

Name: Super Nikka Revival Limited Edition
Palate: A touch of golden syrup and honey, lemongrass, nougat and fragrant oak alongside hints of redcurrant and pot pourri.
Finish: More fragrant oak, ginger and clove.
Nose: Complex spices, dried herbs, nuts and citrus.

Name: The Big Smoke 40 (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Charcoal, caramel, smoked meat, peat smoke and dry oak. Hints of malty sweetness, with spice.
Finish: Long finish, notes of the coast, and wood ash.
Nose: Hints of cool wood smoke, wet leaves and oak. Some sugared peels, almond, and salty notes. Peat, and vanilla.

Name: Glengoyne 35 Year Old In Decanter
Palate: Cherry, honey and plenty of oak. More spice than the nose. Classic old leather notes and apple peels. Dried fruits and vanilla.
Finish: Brown sugar and rich oak - quite long.
Nose: Apple pies, sponge cake, big wafts of caramel and chocolate. Spice and crushed almonds.

Name: Wemyss Red Berry Cream 1990
Palate: The tangy flavours calm down, but the fruit doesn't at all. Currants and blackberries join in the mix, a veritable fruit salad.
Finish: A woody after taste slides into view just as the fruit fades away, rounding out the experience nicely.
Nose: The fruit is the star of the show here, tangy and rich cherries and a a tempting strawberry.

Name: Scallywag Cask Strength No.2
Palate: Honey, coffee beans, milk chocolate and a chewy raisins.
Finish: Vanilla, pear drops, ground clove.
Nose: Cookie dough, rhubarb and fruity custard.

Name: Glen Garioch 1995 - Batch 10
Palate: The palate boasts chocolatey mocha notes with golden syrup drizzled on top; with a buttery mouth-feel.
Finish: The finish is sweet with syrup pudding and a burst of minty peat smoke.
Nose: Mocha and muscavado to begin with, leading to menthol peat notes, dried banana and toffee.

Name: Knockando 12 Year Old 2002
Palate: Develops nutty notes on the palate, leaning towards chewy cereal hints.
Finish: Caramel popcorn with a sprinkle of black pepper.
Nose: Creamy malt and summer fruits, with a juicy hint of blackcurrant. A little suggestion of smoke.

Name: The Glendronach Cask Strength - Batch 5
Palate: Malt and gingerbread, flamed orange peel, lemon peel too, orchard fruit and brandy cream.
Finish: Coffee cake, sultanas and oak.
Nose: Straight in with dried fruits, ripe plums, warming spice, cocoa, walnut and Amaretti.

Name: Spirit of Hven Urania Single Malt Whisky
Palate: An oily delivery, with ginger continuing on the palate, joined by thyme honey, liquorice and herbal hints.
Finish: Citrus, apple skin and pepper last on the finish.
Nose: A core of fragrant cereal, surrounded by notes cracked black pepper, chopped ginger root, fresh peach and vanilla.

Name: Reference Series I.1
Palate: Retaining that slightly effervescent mouthfeel, but not so much of the bready Champagne notes from I, it's a subtle palate with hints of white raisins, cedar, Pinot Grigio and just a hint of nuttiness.
Finish: Dry with hazelnut notes coming into their own before leaving you with more notes from the palate.
Nose: Straight into fruity teacake on a richer nose than the Reference Series I, lemon curd, sultanas, dried apricot, a bundle of oats and a touch of menthol.

Name: Kilkerran Work In Progress 4th Release
Palate: Zesty and fruity palate with notes of Seville orange marmalade, gooey toffee, vanilla custard, cinnamon whirls, candy floss and nutmeg.
Finish: Honey, Demerara sugar, rum spices and star anise.
Nose: Buttery toffee and bitter orange peel. Hints of cooked citrus, apple crumble, baked apples with honey and cinnamon.

Name: The Big Smoke 60
Palate: Big, very big in fact, with intense spices, peach, apple, and big hit of oily, salty smoke.
Finish: Good length, it remains oily, with hints of Lapsang Souchong tea on the tea, and some burnt wood.
Nose: Sweet and creamy notes with notes of oily smoke, warm slabs of peat, and grist.

Name: Glen Garioch 1994 - Batch 32
Palate: Oily and slightly smoky, lots of floral notes, as well as vanilla, peach melba, citrus and Nutella!
Finish: Good length, very spicy and floral, hints of peat on the tail.
Nose: Quite a sweet, biscuity nose with notes of custard, winter spices and oak. A touch of manuka honey, gingernut, and just a smidgen of smoke.

Name: The Norfolk - Parched
Palate: Melted white chocolate, spearmint, vanilla and melon again.
Finish: Juicy white grapes and lemon meringue.
Nose: Melon and honey. Brown sugar, nutmeg and stewed pears.

Name: Glenglassaugh Octaves Peated Batch 1
Palate: A good balance of fresh fruit and smoke. Subtle spicy ember notes.
Finish: Plum sweetness and cinnamon warmth.
Nose: Rich with aromatic smoke. Vanilla and apricot gathers along the way.

Name: The GlenDronach Cask Strength - Batch 2
Palate: Thick chocolate raisins, ginger, mixed peels, allspice and nutmeg.
Finish: Lingering baking spices, fruit and nut, crushed almond.
Nose: Delicious, crumbling milk chocolate and Werther's Originals, stewed apples and cinnamon sticks.

Name: Mackmyra Moment - MalstrÃ¶m
Palate: More citrus, though this soon is paired with caramel and double cream. Hints of wood smoke start to pick up pace later on.
Finish: Cedar wood and fresh apples.
Nose: A rush of cinnamon passes initially, before juicy oranges and limes bring sweetness to the table.

Name: Knockando 15 Year Old 1997
Palate: Very malty. Suggestions of almond butter and milk chocolate.
Finish: A whack of Sherried malt barges in on the long finish.
Nose: Good core of golden malt, a slight hint of sweet apple flesh and cinnamon.

Name: Lark Single Malt Cask Strength
Palate: Big and oily. More than a hint of ginger, with apples, vanilla cream, pears and pastry. It's a very big whisky, and whilst not massively complex, more than compensates with a huge intensity of flavour.
Finish: Lasts for a long, long time. Big on dry spices and clove-studded oranges.
Nose: A sweet, rich, spicy nose with a good touch of nutmeg, gives way to vanilla, honey and spices. A little turmeric too perhaps.

Name: Benromach Organic 2010 (bottled 2016)
Palate: Malt is still present, coffee bean and dark chocolate. Citrus peels.
Finish: Clean and quite refreshing.
Nose: Rounded vanilla, pineapple and barley sugar sweets.

Name: The Big Smoke 46
Palate: Charcoal, caramel, smoked meat, peat smoke and dry oak. Hints of malty sweetness, with spice.
Finish: Long finish, notes of the coast, and wood ash.
Nose: Hints of cool wood smoke, wet leaves and oak. Some sugared peels, almond, and salty notes. Peat, and vanilla.

Name: SPEY 18 Year Old
Palate: Bittersweet dark chocolate, followed by sweeter warming notes of caramelised almonds, dried fruit, milk chocolate praline and honeyed toast with a pinch of cinnamon.
Finish: Orange blossom intertwined with subtle smoke, with sherry lingering on the finish.
Nose: Rich, oily walnut, with fresh, fruity and creamy aromas of Eton Mess alongside rich caramel, vanilla fudge drizzled with chocolate.

Name: BenRiach 12 Year Old Horizons
Palate: Hazelnuts, walnuts, Brazil nuts and almonds with a sensually light body.
Finish: Creamy and silky, honey and a few more hazelnuts.
Nose: Big and creamy with marzipan, Brazil nuts and a waft of melting Toblerone chocolate bars.

Name: Tullibardine 44 Year Old 1970
Palate: Sherry-cask influence comes through more on the palate. Juicy sultanas and clove-studded orange. Hints of baking spices linger.
Finish: Cracked black pepper, strawberries and a touch of chewy tobacco.
Nose: Elegant oak and soft toffee, followed by rich, floral rancio. A scoop of rum-raisin ice-cream and a sprinkle of dried herbs.

Name: Glen Garioch 1986 - Batch 11
Palate: A floral parma violet flavour with a punnet of fresh fruit and a herbal quality to boot.
Finish: The finish gives way to an earthiness and some peatiness as well.
Nose: Fleshy stone fruit notably peach and a little nectarine with ginger spice and menthol peat notes.

Name: Kilchoman 8 Year Old 2009
Palate: Soft sweetness first and peat smoke and ripe fruit notes following.
Finish: Long, clean and sweet with peat smoke and soft fruits at the end.
Nose: Lemon, citrus and butterscotch notes are prominent with soft peaty aromas in the background.

Name: Highland Park Thorfinn (Warriors Series)
Palate: Dark chocolate, old oak and camphor. Bruised mint leaf, gingerbread and smoked meats.
Finish: Honey-drenched dates and spicy oak. Lingering smoke.
Nose: Earthy smoke, with a hint of forest floor developing. Sherried orange peels and freshly brewed coffee.

Name: Glenfiddich Excellence 26 Year Old
Palate: Soft and plush on the palate. Liquorice, vanilla, toffee with cooked spices ânutmeg and cinnamon. Soft old leather and charred pineapple.
Finish: Medium to long. Pleasing warmth with some spice from the tannins.
Nose: Very fruit driven nose. Green fruits with touches of passion fruit backed up with very well judged vanilla. There are floral overtones â jasmine?

Name: Balcones True Blue Cask Strength
Palate: Rich mouth-feel. Black coffee, juicy raisins and spicy cinnamon.
Finish: Loads of honey, demerara sugar and cedar spice. A little hint of cardamom, too.
Nose: French toast dusted with cinnamon. Heavy corn influence, with some salted butter and cracked black pepper.

Name: Fettercairn 24 Year Old 1984
Palate: Malty and spicy with notes of berry fruits, star anise, a little orange zest, cocoa and coffee beans.
Finish: Long and fruity with notes of buttery toffee and malt.
Nose: Nutty, spicy nose with notes of caramel, toffee popcorn, calves leather, beeswax, granary toast and hints of walnut cake.

Name: The Girvan Patent Still Proof Strength
Palate: As with the nose, the added abv provides a similar, but more intense experience to the 42% edition. More candied citrus peels, pineapple sweets, icing sugar, vanilla and cinnamon.
Finish: Sweet, peppery and light.
Nose: Lots of vanilla, boiled sweets, foam bananas, candied peels and cherry lips with hints of honey.

Name: Benromach Traditional + 2 Blenders Glasses
Palate: Floral, grassy. Heather and hedgerow berries. Buttery, spicy.
Finish: Quite sweet, tannic. Citrus notes, a tad more stem ginger, zesty.
Nose: Pine oils, fresh. Sweetness, nutty, smoky. Stem ginger, bog myrtle, acacia honey.

Name: Kilkerran Work In Progress 3rd Release
Palate: Spicy and rich with notes of cedar, ginger, sweet pipe tobacco and malt, with more than a hint of oily, medicinal smoke.
Finish: Good length with tart citrus, pepper and pine resin.
Nose: Fruity with notes of apples, pears and rich briny peat smoke, alongside sticking plasters and barley malt.

Name: Ardbeg Supernova - Advance Committee Release
Palate: Massive, this is just a crescendo of intense, fiery peat, like biting into a chipotle chilli, with a-whole-nother dimension of sweetness and fruit too. Fabulous stuff, with hints of top quality mezcal, apples, lime juice and lemon curd.
Finish: Coal tar, citrus, salty butter, sticking plasters, cocoa and big, warming peat that tingles the tongue for minutes.
Nose: Peaty and spicy, this is pungent with tar, pipe tobacco, smoked paprika, hints of parma ham, chili, burning turmeric, toffee apple sweetness, citrus and malt.

Name: Aberlour A'Bunadh Batch 26
Palate: Full, sherried. Mixed peels, pastries, berry fruits, buttery crumble.
Finish: Long, spicy, sweet honey and fruit.
Nose: Rich, fruity. So much character, buttery biscuits, Sherry, mince pies, marmalade.

Name: Glenfarclas 46 Year Old 1954
Palate: Rich, sublime balance. Rum spice, dark sugar, buttery, fudge, pastries, digestive biscuit.
Finish: Long, oaky, bitter espresso, malt, biscuity.
Nose: Lush sherry, sultanas, peels, beautifully tannic oak. Barley, malt. Just a touch of peat. Fresh herbs.

Name: Johnnie Walker Black Triple Cask
Palate: Nutty malt and soft vanilla, just a whisper of mango and persimmon underneath.
Finish: Toasted bread again, now with honey and cinnamon in support.
Nose: Brown sugar, buttered toast and a touch of apricot jam fruitiness.

Name: Glen Grant 2002 (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Green grass, spices and marmalade. Hints of ginger.
Finish: Honeyed, faintly spicy finish.
Nose: Mint leaves and hints of strawberry jam. Allspice, soft malt and honey.

Name: Girvan 1964 1st Batch Distillation
Palate: Raisins and mounds of vanilla followed by cinnamon, cloves and nutmeg.
Finish: Long with notes of almonds, mixed spice and orangey bourbon.
Nose: Vanilla and hazel nuts followed by green apple and supple oak notes.

Name: Bells 1996 Christmas Decanter
Palate: ?Quite smooth, medium body. Barley and cereals with nut oils, hints of wood and spice.?
Finish: ?Short with notes of fruitcake and smoke.  <
Nose: ?Quite soft and gentle. Malted barley and hints of cut herbs and a fresh floral note. Cereal and grist with a little honey.?

Name: Jura Red Wine Cask Finish
Palate: Sultanas and soft summer fruits with raspberry tang and juicy strawberry and gentle vanilla chai spice.
Finish: Cinnamon and red fruits continue with spicy oak, roasted malt, and a creamy finish.
Nose: Dark berries and forest fruits, gently floral wafts of vanilla and crÃ¨me caramel.

Name: Glenfarclas 19 Year Old 1972
Palate: Chewy, dark oak with winter spice. Custard, mochaccino, caramelised fruits.
Finish: Long, drying, very fruity.
Nose: Balanced, sherry, fruity. Barley. Sultanas, manuka honey.

Name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label - Year of the Rat Limited Edition
Palate: Supple and balanced. Good toffee and hints of very wistful smoke. Chocolate, hints of grass and a good hit of malt.
Finish: Floral, oaky, good length, urged on by a plume of very well-kept, highland style smoke. Dried fruit, spice, honey.
Nose: Fragrant with good body. Notes of oak, crisp spice, dried fruit, pastries. Berry fruits, aniseed, hints of cedar, a touch of spice and citrus.

Name: Edradour 2002 Tokaji Cask Matured
Palate: Wonderful texture with the Tokaji rich in the mouth. Cut hay, barley. Firm. Salty butter.
Finish: Sweet, citric acidity.
Nose: Peels, spice. Sherry. Grapey.

Name: Hakushu 18 Year Old 43.50%
Palate: Oaky with notes of custard, syrup, stem ginger, bramble leaves, watermelon, hints of cut hay and pine resin.
Finish: Good length with notes of sour lemon sweets, dry oak and caramel.
Nose: Very thick with notes of cut grass, orange blossom, manuka honey, apple peel, calves leather and almond.

Name: Ardbeg Rollercoaster - Committee Reserve
Palate: Quite big with a peat tingle, though it doesn't quite take off as expected. Instead, it rests on its laurels in a sea of spices, tangy starburst sweets (we often find these in Ardbeg) and oily smoke. Light new make character remains.
Finish: More coastal at the finish, sweetness, cool smoke, medium to short.
Nose: A mix of malt, cold wood smoke and a hint of new make. Has a very young feel - similar to Talisker 10 in this respect. Balanced, striking sweetness.

Name: Glengoyne Cask Strength (Batch 9)
Palate: Caramelised apple with a touch of green apple brightness, cassia, black pepper, dates, toffee pennies.
Finish: Lasting sweetness of brown sugar and prune.
Nose: Ripe plum and juicy red grapes, with hefty helpings of malt and honey alongside.

Name: Rock Island Mezcal Cask Edition
Palate: Barbeque smokiness, with layers of peppercorn, barley, and a zesty hint of gooseberry.
Finish: Rich honey and juicy blackberry, with lasting toasty smoke.
Nose: Sea salt and cracked black pepper, with earthy smoke lingering.

Name: Royal Brackla 10 Year Old
Palate: Medium bodied with notes of cut grass, spices, malt and fruit. Creamy.
Finish: Balanced and barley driven, spiced.
Nose: Gentle and crisp, leafy, spices.

Name: Glen Moray 16 Year Old
Palate: Smooth, stewed apples, vanilla cream. Pecan pie, scones, dark chocolate.
Finish: Medium. Creamy, warming and nutty.
Nose: Thick toffee, chocolate digestive and Demerara sugar. A slight hint of stewed berries comes through a little later.

Name: Glenfarclas 1973 (cask 2578) - Family Cask
Palate: Rich, warming, sherry. Warm marmalade, toffee, zesty.
Finish: Long, herbal, oak, fruity.
Nose: Supple, fragrant, grenadine, sherry. Something phenolic. Gran Marnier.

Name: Glen Garioch 15 Year Old
Palate: Full, malty, supple peat. Peppery. Oak.
Finish: Good length, oak, spice builds, soft peat, balancing barley sweetness.
Nose: Perfumed. Floral. smoky heather. Cereals, malt. Spicy, herbal.

Name: Glentauchers 11 Year Old - Battlehill (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Plump sultanas, apple pie, gentle spice, and vanilla custard, with hints of honey and cinnamon appearing.
Finish: Silky barley and crumbly vanilla fudge finish things off, with soft apricot, lime peel, and a sprinkle of pepper.
Nose: Milky tea, creamy malt, and zesty fruit salad, with buttery oak beneath.

Name: The GlenDronach Cask Strength - Batch 1
Palate: Rich, oily palate entry with mouth-coating notes of juicy sultanas, baked apple and nutmeg. A little aniseed develops late palate with notes of orange rind and chocolate.
Finish: Long, spiced. Ground walnut and melted rum and raisin ice-cream.
Nose: Huge notes of butterscotch, milk chocolate and Christmas spices. Hints of cooked fruit, stem ginger and manuka honey.

Name: Glenmorangie A Tale of the Forest (No Presentation Box)
Palate: An array of zesty menthol and orange peels, hints of hibiscus, and vanilla pod with a backdrop of fennel, anise, and smoked toffee.
Finish: Candied citrus fruits finish things off, with more pine and robust barley tangling with delicate oak char.
Nose: Forest floor notes lead the way with oily pine and juniper, nutty malt, and woody spice, with murmurs of smoke in the distance.

Name: Mannochmore 12 Year Old 2008 (cask 11128469)  - The Octave (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Nutty malt, cinnamon, almond pastries, zesty citrus, and drying notes of peppery cedar.
Finish: Softly herbal with nutmeg, candied almonds, and a hint of baked apple.
Nose: Green apples and pears, vegetal oak, and spicy clove

Name: Caol Ila 9 Year Old 2012 (casks 322141 & 322155) Un-Chillfiltered Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Drizzles of caramel, oaky vanilla, stewing orchard fruits, a touch of green wood, and smoky cinder toffee.
Finish: Smouldering ashes, lingering spice, and baked apples.
Nose: Buttery Danish pastries, with a touch of waxy lemon zest and earthy smoke.

Name: Auchroisk 19 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Punchy peppercorn crackles through oily nutty malt and fresh floral notes. Caramel and orchard fruit form in the backdrop.
Finish: More brown apples and a hint of polished wood remains.
Nose: Summer berries, dried grass and waxy orange peels, with a little vanilla and sponge cake.

Name: Jack and Victor Blended Whisky - Festive Edition
Palate: Cakey vanilla and cooked apricot, the subtle smoke still sticking around.
Finish: Walnut, freshly sawn oak, orange zest.
Nose: Rounded barley notes, dotted with whiffs of peat smoke and honey.

Name: Starward Two-Fold
Palate: Soft vanilla fudge, coffee and walnut cake, summer berries and stewed stone fruit.
Finish: Brown sugar, cinnamon and peppercorn.
Nose: Plum, banana bread, caramelised dates and a hint of nutty malt.

Name: Forest Whisky Blend Number Sixteen Gift Set with Glass
Palate: Sweet, gloopy toffee and creamy vanilla, nutty, wafts of spicy oak, and caramel malt.
Finish: A touch of shortbread and popcorn with spiced nuts.
Nose: Vanilla fudge, fresh croissant, dried orange zest, and sultana.

Name: Lagg Inaugural Release Batch 1
Palate: Oily with silky caramel, charred sugar, and biscuity malt balancing rich, vegetal peat smoke. Some pebbly grist arrives beneath, joined by herbaceous spice.
Finish: Chewy peat lingers with a touch of iodine, while butterscotch and vanilla pod remain in play.
Nose: Earthy peat and crumbly vanilla fudge tangle, with a touch of menthol creeping beneath.

Name: Old Perth Number 1 Release
Palate: Peppery, malty palate with gingerbread and stewed fruit.
Finish: Spiced finish. Medium-long.
Nose: Barley malt and hints of spice. Candy floss and toffee apples.

Name: Benromach 2000 Madeira Wood Finish
Palate: Spicy, dessert wine, fruitcake. Winter berry compote.
Finish: Oaky, berries.
Nose: in both dried and juicy form. Honey. Stewed fruits, mulled wine perhaps.

Name: Benromach Peat Smoke Batch 2
Palate: Perfumed, fruity and oily. More peaty than expected. Damp ash.
Finish: Wood shavings, dry and smoky, some fruit.
Nose: Fresh, balanced. Wet sand on a beach, earthy. Citrus. The "peat smoke" is, as of yet, very gentle.

Name: The Macallan Sir Peter Blake 1967 Anecdotes of Ages Collection: Down to Work
Palate: Warm chocolate with light nutmeg and ginger, oak spices and sweet oak opening into pineapple and coconut with an unexpected strawberry and hazelnut burst.
Finish: Complex with a medium to long finish of chocolate, sweet oak and lightly spiced peach.
Nose: Classic antique oak, dried fruit and fig combined with hints of pineapple and mango layered with a decadent chocolate strawberry note.

Name: Arran 21 Year Old
Palate: Dark chocolate-dipped almond, candied orange, nutmeg and more warming ginger.
Finish: Apricot jam, bitter orange marmalade, chocolate meringue and allspice.
Nose: Fresh fruit sweetness, toasted nuts, and crystallised ginger coated in dark chocolate,

Name: BenRiach 9 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Orange peel, almond and barrel char. A few touches of burnt sugar, too.
Finish: Subtly drying and smoky.
Nose: Polished oak, caramelised sultanas and hazelnuts.

Name: Glengoyne Cask Strength (Batch 1)
Palate: Zest and spice, with notes of baked pear and gooey, unctuous malt. Charred wood, apple peel and marzipan.
Finish: Dry, oak-led finish with just a hint of banana loaf.
Nose: Biscuity, malty nose with hints of black pepper and allspice. Cooked apple, candy canes, buttery toffee apple and zest.

Name: Benriach 16 Year Old 1988
Palate: Oily, honey, floral. Fresh barley. Becomes drier.
Finish: A tad winy with some spice and ash.
Nose: Gentle, aromatic. Sherry, grapey acidity.

Name: Kilchoman Loch Gorm 2021 Release
Palate: Enjoyably chocolatey at first, though soon enough the dry, earthy smoke builds and comes to the fore.
Finish: Cherry, roast chestnuts, a smidge of medicinal peat.
Nose: Smoky clove and a hint of cumin, balanced by sultana and prune, plus a touch of roasted almond.

Name: SPEY 10 Year Old
Palate: Sliced pear, roast hazelnuts, more raspberries and a hint of rose petal.
Finish: Oaky cinnamon and clove, balanced by red wine sweetness.
Nose: Green apple sweeties, fresh raspberries and a hint of earthy barley.

Name: Glentauchers 21 Year Old (Chorlton Whisky)
Palate: Sultanas and raisins dusted with nutmeg. Liquorice root, caramel and some bright citrus freshness.
Finish: A balanced finish of brown sugar and cinnamon.
Nose: Sponge cake topped with chocolate frosting, strawberry jam, roast chestnuts.

Name: Annandale Man OâWords 2014
Palate: Tropical fruits including pineapple and papaya, red cherry, apple pie and custard, unsalted peanuts, a maltiness, caramel, strawberry laces, nutmeg, honeycomb, earthy rhubarb and some more of that smoke.
Finish: Dominated by that nuttiness that we think will form an Annandale character. Sweet spices, too.
Nose: Cream soda, strawberries and cream, pecan nuts, dessert wafers, cashew nuts, pencil sharpenings, a hint of menthol and a whisper of smoke.

Name: Port Charlotte Islay Barley 2011
Palate: White grape, BBQ char, baked earth, subtly medicinal at points.
Finish: Salted caramel, Nice biscuits, lingering wafts of coastal smoke.
Nose: Toasted coconut flakes, lemon peel, sweet smoke and apricot.

Name: Kirin Fuji-Sanroku
Palate: Chocolate-coated biscuits, pink lemonade, a touch of brown sugar.
Finish: Grassy notes appear on the finish, alongside continued caramel-y sweetness.
Nose: Cherry and almond cake, oak-y peat smoke, thyme honey.

Name: Mackmyra GrÃ¶nt Te
Palate: Layers of fresh apple, stewed berries, fragrant florals and a soft hint of clove spiciness.
Finish: Heather honey, grape, white chocolate and baked earth.
Nose: Buttery biscuits, lemongrass, vanilla and honeydew melon.

Name: Kilchoman Loch Gorm 2018 Release
Palate: Peaches in syrup and fresh raspberries, earthy peat and a touch of tobacco.
Finish: Rum-soaked raisins and prunes. Ginger root, clove and marmalade.
Nose: Cinnamon-dusted banana, maple syrup, a whiff of bonfire smoke.

Name: Balvenie Tun 1509 - Batch 1
Palate: Superb mouthfeel, it's effortlessly mouth-coating with candied orange peels, crumbly shortbread, cinnamon and oak notes.
Finish: Raisins, citrus and cracked black pepper.
Nose: Floral honey, apple drops, fresh vanilla and a little bit of thick treacle.

Name: Daftmill 2009 - Summer Batch Release
Palate: Caramelised nuts, cinnamon and cardamom spiciness, shortbread, subtly earthy barley leading into a touch of flinty mineral notes.
Finish: Pear drops, stem ginger, another helping of cinnamon and vanilla.
Nose: Soft dried fruit sweetness, balanced by hints of lemon meringue pie, cigar box and cereal.

Name: Mackmyra Moment - FjÃ¤llmark
Palate: Warming oak arrives first, before notes of vanilla and salted fudge.
Finish: Lingering dried fruit and stem ginger.
Nose: Poached pear and hot chocolate, with a hint of nutmeg hiding underneath.

Name: Stauning Rye - Rum Cask Finish
Palate: Warm and spiced, with chocolate sauce, dried apricot, orange chocolate, fig, and waxy honey.
Finish: Buttered rye toast, oily orange peel, and dried pear.
Nose: Cigar box, vanilla blossom, cinnamon, praline, chocolate-dipped banana, and oak char.

Name: Langatun 10 Year Old
Palate: Enjoyably herbaceous with mint, lemon verbena and basil leaf salinity. Apricot and buttery pastry notes sit in the background.
Finish: Sugared almond, more vanilla and apricot.
Nose: Crisp lemon and oak, with caramelised nuts giving it a refined sweetness.

Name: Forest Whisky Blend Number Two
Palate: Chocolate butter icing, toffee apple and sweet tropical fruits alongside herbaceous undertones and a crack of black pepper, with malt cereal notes in support.
Finish: Freshly cut grass and melted dark chocolate intertwine on the finish.
Nose: Chocolate covered almonds, toffee and lemon curd.

Name: Loch Lomond The Open Special Edition
Palate: Creamy vanilla oak and delicate florals provide pleasant company for plenty of apricot, pear and crisp green apple.
Finish: Subtle peat smoke lingers.
Nose: Ripe orchard fruits and a hint of dried mango are drenched in sumptuous maple syrup and sprinkles of brown sugar. A little spice provides some kick in the backdrop.

Name: Suntory Toki Gift Pack with Glass
Palate: More green apple on the palate leads along bright citrus notes from pink grapefruit. Bitter herbs, toasted almonds and vanilla oak linger underneath.
Finish: White pepper and ginger add spice to the finish.
Nose: Soft orchard fruits and thyme honey are joined by a helping of peppermint in the backdrop.

Name: Benromach Contrasts Cara Gold Malt
Palate: Creamy butterscotch, grapefruit, orange, delicate oaky smoke, a touch of peppercorn.
Finish: Sweet smoke and runny caramel.
Nose: Lychee, Biscoff biscuits, melted butter, a smidge of perfumed barley.

Name: Glen Scotia 46 Year Old
Palate: Velvet mouthfeel with layers of melted brown sugar and golden caramel, baked apple, and poached pear in vanilla syrup with orange citrus notes
Finish: Long maritime finish with sea salt and waves of warming cinnamon and nutmeg spice
Nose: Rich dried fruit and citrus peel, sweet thick toffee balanced with bracing ocean sea spray and fresh vanilla

Name: Paul John Christmas Edition 2018
Palate: Creamy nuttiness, dried fruit and winter spice combine in a rich and rewarding palate.
Finish: A long and drying finish with plenty of remaining baking spice.
Nose: Through Christmas cake, plum compote and floral honey there's delicate smoke.

Name: Lower East Side Blended Malt
Palate: More vanilla and soft spices cut through orchard fruit and blackberries.
Finish: Rich malt and a touch of banana.
Nose: Thyme honey, vanilla-rich barley and toasty oak.

Name: Bimber Oloroso Cask Batch No. 2
Palate: Sherried red fruit and chocolate-coated nuts, along with runny honey, banana pancakes and more cinnamon spice.
Finish: Pineapple upside-down cake, with lingering toasted baking spices.
Nose: Toasted tea cake packed with dried fruit, crystallised ginger and cinnamon buns along with a dash of lemon curd.

Name: Forest Whisky Blend Number Three
Palate: Richly decadent and smooth, loads of chocolate, juicy ripe fruits, namely plum and apple, with banana sweeties and caramelised brown sugar.
Finish: Sherry notes really shine on the finish, with gentle fruity notes lingering alongside dark chocolate.
Nose: Chocolate covered marzipan, rich cocoa powder, caramel and lemon cheesecake.

Name: Ardbeg 10 Year Old (1L)
Palate: Sweet vanilla counterbalanced with lemon and lime followed by that surging Ardbeg smoke that we all know and love.
Finish: Long and glorious; sea salted caramel and beach bonfire smoke.
Nose: A ridge of vanilla leads to mountain of peat capped with citrus fruits and circled by clouds of sea spray.

Name: Tobermory 24 Year Old (Chorlton Whisky)
Palate: Coats the mouth, with brown sugar sweetness, cherry liqueur, orange peel and a pinch of salt.
Finish: Lengthy and rich, with dark chocolate covered stem ginger.
Nose: Walnut and coffee cake, berry jam and distinct coastal aromas with just a whisper of peat.

Name: The Singleton Of Glendullan 15 Year Old
Palate: Caramelised fruit, floral barley, vanilla pod and spicy cedar.
Finish: Slightly earthy malt notes, with continuing vanilla sweetness.
Nose: Waxy orange and lemon zest, with slowly developing notes of mocha.

Name: Wolfburn Kylver Series - Release 4
Palate: Fresh and sweet orange chocolate with more green apple, balanced by slightly sour notes of citrus zest and a whisper of peat smoke.
Finish: Chocolate returns, with a lingering freshness of green apple.
Nose: Both smoky and floral, with chocolate, green apple, freshly cut grass and a subtle sugary sweetness.

Name: Cotswolds Founder's Choice Whisky 2018
Palate: Peaches in syrup, drying oak warmth, gingerbread with sugary icing, a kick of Christmassy spice on the mid-palate.
Finish: Strawberry jam and clotted cream, toasted rye bread, a touch of citrus.
Nose: Almond butter, redcurrant, damson, black pepper, croissants and coffee.

Name: Fettercairn Warehouse 2 Batch No. 001
Palate: Festive spices, buttery biscuits, a splash of fresh greengages and pear.
Finish: Cinnamon and nutmeg last on the long finish, with more honeyed sweetness too.
Nose: Grilled peached, honeycomb, earthy coffee with some chocolatey sweetness underneath.

Name: Ben Nevis 10 Year Old
Palate: Gentle dryness. Toffee. Looming omnipresent are solid peat notes with a bitter sweetness.
Finish: Silken, toffee and caramel notes balanced with a touch of mochaccino and dark chocolate on the tail.
Nose: Fresh and quite dry. A supple greenness with soft leafy notes with a rich fruitiness. Hints of orange and Seville marmalade with a light vinous character and nutty undertones.

Name: East London Liquor Company London Rye
Palate: Earthy rye and soft smoke, balanced by chocolate raisins and honey.
Finish: Oak char, with root ginger, blackberry jam and treacle.
Nose: Peppery at first, apple and blackcurrant pie, toasted sesame seeds and a hint of red chilli.

Name: Bimber Oloroso Cask Batch No. 4
Palate: All the sherry! Deep, dark, rich dried fruit flavours, caramelised nuts and gentle cakey spice.
Finish: Syrup and honey poured over tropical fruit, gentle cinnamon, and allspice.
Nose: Fruit loaf and raisins, toast and fresh pastry with sweet wafts of apple.

Name: Knockando 15 Year Old 1999
Palate: Spicier than the nose suggests, with cinnamon and black pepper arriving on the palate first. Soon enough, this is soothed by waves of runny honey and blackberry jam.
Finish: A touch of oily malt lingers.
Nose: Vanilla pod, citrus blossom and plenty of barley.

Name: Fujimi The 7 Virtues of the Samurai
Palate: The fruit continues with cooked apple and a touch of honey sweetness balanced by a kick of ginger and peppery spice.
Finish: Buttercream, sugared fruit salad, and soft oaken spice.
Nose: Gentle fruits with a touch of green apple and banana and soft spice.

Name: Forest Whisky Blend Number Eight
Palate: Rounded malt, with cakey sweetness to it. A subtle whiff of cinnamon and toasted cedar builds.
Finish: Very slightly floral, though dried fruit remains core.
Nose: Chocolatey, with plenty of vanilla and red berries behind it.

Name: Big Peat 10 Year Old
Palate: Meaty malt and BBQ char, balanced by toffee and pineapple. A touch of new leather and tobacco.
