Finish: Honey on toast, slightly leafy, plenty of peat smoke.
Nose: Roasted peanuts, petrichor, a hint of fresh pear cutting through the savoury elements.

Name: Benriach 21 Year Old Temporis
Palate: Rum-soaked dried fruit, more orange peel, new leather and oak-y smoke. A touch of blueberry tucked away, too.
Finish: Five-spice, slightly floral peat, pear and prune.
Nose: Meaty malt with a touch of BBQ char, joined by spiced currant buns and waxy orange peel.

Name: Inchgower 8 Year Old - Premier Barrel (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Dense fruitcake leads to demerara sugar and dried herbs.
Finish: Lingers with notes of raisins and ginger.
Nose: Chocolatey at first, with citrus peel, toasted almonds, and cardamom.

Name: Lochlea Sowing Edition First Crop
Palate: Vibrant and slightly zesty with green apple and citrus, balanced by buttery malt and a touch of toasted nut.
Finish: Lingering honeyed sweetness.
Nose: Lots of vanilla pod and biscuity notes as it opens, leading into peach and white grape.

Name: Jura 19 Year Old The Paps
Palate: Subtle green apple sharpness, swiftly balance by layers of thick caramel and chocolate chip cookie dough.
Finish: Savoury hints of sea salt and rye spice develop on the finish, though it remains chocolatey.
Nose: Quince jam, a light waft of toasted oak smokiness, juicy prune and oily walnut.

Name: Forest Whisky Blend Number Five
Palate: Fresh brown toast and dark chocolate spread, with red fruits coming to the fore. Cooked orchard fruit and baking spices appear.
Finish: Brown sugar sprinkled over malt cereal, with plum skin and chocolate-covered coffee bean.
Nose: Cut grass leads into dusty cocoa and caramelised almonds, citrus curd and smooth praline.

Name: Glenfiddich Select Cask
Palate: Peppery at first, before waves of warming sherry and melted butter temper the spice.
Finish: Fresh cream, brown sugar and blueberries.
Nose: Vanilla pod, orange zest and rock cakes.

Name: Tullibardine 2007 - The Murray Cask Strength
Palate: Lemon tart, vanilla cream, and Scottish tablet, with peppery oak bringing balance.
Finish: Buttery oak and more lively citrus.
Nose: Vanilla orchid, buttery pastry, lemon curd.

Name: Lochlea Single Malt - First Release
Palate: Rich and sweet, with burnt caramel and hazelnuts. Still plenty of stewed fruit and now some toasted oats, cinnamon and clove coming through.
Finish: Medium mouth coating, holding on to that fresh fruit, cereal sweetness and gentle spice.
Nose: Bursting with fresh orchard fruit, apple, zesty orange and pear drops. Some brown sugar, toffee and vanilla fudge in the background.

Name: Glenfarclas 12 Year Old 1l
Palate: Medium-bodied, with notes of date and walnut cake, Oloroso sherry and hints of earthy forest floor. A beautiful note of malt, with toffee apple and a touch of smoke.
Finish: Spicy and long, notes of allspice, cinnamon and cloves, with orange zest and sherry.
Nose: Light and creamy with a mix of supple, soft sherry and Manuka honey. Gentle and well-balanced, there are hints of smoke, rich oak, and a little pine resin.

Name: Angelsâ Nectar  - Cairngorms Edition
Palate: Toffee popcorn, dried banana and vanilla pod.
Finish: A good dose of wood spice and pineapple cake with a zing of citrus.
Nose: Tropical fruit, crystallised ginger, honey and brown sugar, with a touch of red grape.

Name: The Glenlivet Triple Cask Matured Rare Cask
Palate: Orange marmalade (with the peel), anise, macaroons and more hot ginger.
Finish: Warming baking spice alongside a hint of cocoa.
Nose: Nectarine, apple sweeties, honey and gingersnap biscuits.

Name: Kilkerran Heavily Peated (Batch 2)
Palate: Roasted apples, thyme, oily barley, waves of peppery smoke.
Finish: Softly spicy on the finish, with a touch of ginger.
Nose: Toasty malt with hints of baked earth and crispy bacon. Fresh citrus cuts through the richness.

Name: SPEY Trutina - Batch 1
Palate: Green apple, hazelnut, barley and another hint of butter. Spicy black pepper builds.
Finish: Lingering vanilla and cedar.
Nose: Buttery malt and fresh apricots, with a hint of citrus blossom bringing some earthy yet floral elements.

Name: Glengoyne Cask Strength (Batch 7)
Palate: Plenty of dried fruit and walnut notes as it opens, followed by coffee bean, cedar and hints of floral barley.
Finish: It goes on and on, with notes of honey and clove lingering.
Nose: Caramel and chocolate, with a hearty kick of spicy oak and cinnamon.

Name: Port Askaig 14 Year Old
Palate: Rye bread, salted butter, a hint of oatcake and toasted cinnamon.
Finish: Light smoke and fresh apricot.
Nose: Brown sugar, pancakes with fried bananas, a whiff of charred oak.

Name: Old Perth 12 Year Old 2004
Palate: Waves of Sherried raisins and prunes, followed by smoke and mint.
Finish: Slightly savoury on the finish, though Sherried sweetness remains intact.
Nose: Waxy fruit, Demerara sugar, black pepper and a whisper of heather.

Name: Cl8 - Elements of Islay (Caol Ila)
Palate: More green apples?! Oh yes! The fresh fruit notes of are joined by salted crackers, barley sugar sweeties and some exotic, smoky spices.
Finish: Fresh and fragrant.
Nose: Zesty citrus peels and a sweet burst of green apple followed by classic peaty embers.

Name: anCnoc Peatheart - Batch 1
Palate: Chocolate malt, a touch of BBQ meat, cinder toffee and cardamom seed.
Finish: Surprisingly refreshing on the finish - smoke still persists, but notes of green apple and orange blossom develop alongside it.
Nose: Shortbread, oakcakes, pipe tobacco leading towards earthy peat smoke. Lighter notes of citrus peels and vanilla ice cream.

Name: High Coast Sixty Three
Palate: Oak char, baking spice and burnt caramel initially, then milk chocolate, orchard fruits, honeyed sultanas and walnuts.
Finish: Spicy, a little drying and still sweet.
Nose: Through apple blossom, peanut butter and sponge cake drenched in honey thereâs some strawberry sweetness, zesty orange marmalade and ginger snaps.

Name: Glenglassaugh Octaves Peated Batch 2
Palate: Smoke begins to come to the fore on the palate, though the sherried sweetness keeps in from becoming outrageous.
Finish: Red chilli chocolate and flamed orange peel.
Nose: Fizzy oak and red grape, with a touch of chocolate. Hints of burnt wood develop in the background.

Name: The Glendronach 11 Year Old 2008
Palate: Heather honey, milk chocolate and berry jam, with grated nutmeg and fresh malt.
Finish: Caramelised nuts and baking spices.
Nose: Flamed orange peel, hot chocolate and praline, along with a dash of wood spice and red fruits peeking through.

Name: The GlenDronach Cask Strength - Batch 7
Palate: Melted chocolate, coffee beans, heavy brown sugar and roasted nuts.
Finish: Lingering richness of mature oak and chocolate truffle.
Nose: Gingerbread, cinnamon, blackcurrant, vanilla pod earthiness.

Name: Cl12 - Elements of Islay (Caol Ila)
Palate: Fresh and salty sea air, with green herbaceous notes, super earthy peat and freshly cut grass, with some dried fruit sweetness.
Finish: Some rich, jammy berries linger alongside delicate smoke.
Nose: Lots of orange citrus, with candied orange and orange peel, with bitter dark chocolate and earthy smoky notes.

Name: Glengoyne Cask Strength (Batch 4)
Palate: Pear, apple and white peach. A touch of tart berries. Thyme honey. Peppery oak.
Finish: Lasting Sherry cask influence - particularly dark chocolate bitterness.
Nose: Brown bread, summer berry tart with thick, crumbly pastry, a touch of floral malt.

Name: Old Perth 24 Year Old 1994
Palate: Floral honey and fragrant smoke, with polished wood and sherried fruit.
Finish: Chocolate orange and mint chocolate.
Nose: Smooth hazelnut praline, with caramelised nuts and chocolate digestives.

Name: Box 2nd Step Collection 03
Palate: Peat continues to play a key role on the palate, though now peppery oak and grassy malt stick around further.
Finish: Drying and spicy.
Nose: Earthy smoke and rounded vanilla, with sharp green apple cutting through.

Name: Beinn Dubh Flying Scotsman
Palate: Almost like cold coffee with dark brown sugar, vanilla and dried fruit.
Finish: Toffee and chocolate malt.
Nose: Caramel, toasty, soy, walnut and burnt raisins.

Name: Forest Whisky Blend Number One
Palate: A sweet delight, think banana split pudding and meringue, more decadent chocolate and toffee, with buttery apricot tarts in support. Sweetness is balanced by black pepper and baking spices with a touch of fresh rosemary.
Finish: An earthy finish, notes of petrichor and malty cornflake notes, with chocolate returning once again.
Nose: Bucketfuls of chocolate, marzipan, rich fudge and sweet lemon.

Name: Big Peat 33 Year Old
Palate: Orchard fruit, salted butter on rye toast, grilled pineapple, ash and barrel char.
Finish: Return of the rock pool notes, while smoke lingers and a whiff of plum pudding develops.
Nose: Candle wax, rock pools, chocolate cake (with frosting), peaches and cream sweeties, green olive.

Name: Chichibu The Peated 2010 (bottled 2013)
Palate: A little citrus as it opens, before developing big, meaty wafts of smoke. Tobacco, more barley and a hint of heather honey.
Finish: Continued meatiness and touches of oak spice.
Nose: Light barley and berry notes, balanced with robust helpings of peat - both earthy and coastal peat come through clearly.

Name: Ma3 - Elements of Islay (Margadale)
Palate: Roasted and salted nuts, loads of peat smoke and mineral-heavy seaweed, balanced by banana and vanilla custard, lemon juice and sugar on pancakes.
Finish: Seaside smoky notes linger alongside peppery spice and liquorice.
Nose: Dried apple, Crunchy Nut cereal, lemon curd and a mineral, maritime backbone.

Name: The Hive Batch Strength (Wemyss Malts)
Palate: Intense waves of brown sugar, cinnamon and honeycomb. Slightly chocolatey, too.
Finish: A very subtle touch of smoke underneath yet more warming honey.
Nose: Cooked fruit and Sherried orange peels, with a layer of honey covering it all.

Name: Springbank 13 Year Old 2003
Palate: Smoky peanut shells, chocolate cornflake cakes, a whisper of vegetal oak.
Finish: Cinder toffee and thick Oloroso finish off this one.
Nose: Rum-drizzled raisins and sultanas, with some crystallised ginger thrown in for good measure. Brandy butter, oatcake and grilled fruit.

Name: Speyside 22 Year Old (Chorlton Whisky)
Palate: Buttery at first, before another wave of fresh fruit and sweet cereals. A hint of smoke developing in there, too.
Finish: Long and honeyed.
Nose: Peaches, pears and plums, with freshly-ground spices and warming oak.

Name: Glengoyne Teapot Dram - Batch 7
Palate: Zingy citrus peels, hefty cinnamon and ginger, crunchy brown sugar.
Finish: Continued orange and lemon, plus some toasted teacake warmth.
Nose: Big helpings of chocolate digestive biscuit and rum-soaked raisins, with a kick of nutmeg hiding in there too.

Name: Old Perth 21 Year Old 1996
Palate: Subtle smoke drifts out from behind layers of chewy raisin and almond sweetness.
Finish: Ka-pow! A hearty whack of nutmeg and black pepper finishes off this whisky.
Nose: Chocolate digestives and Jammie Dodgers, with a hint of tobacco developing the longer it's in the glass.

Name: Compass Box Peat Monster Arcana
Palate: Fragrant ginger and cinnamon, continued coastal peat, a dollop of extra-thick double cream and some biscuity malt.
Finish: Ash, pear skin, milk chocolate and another hint of cinnamon.
Nose: Nectarine, peach and caramel, alongside waves of ocean air and tarry ropes.

Name: Cambus 25 Year Old - Chorlton Whisky
Palate: Morello cherries, thick-cut marmalade, toasty oak, vanilla cream, white pepper spice and cinnamon sugar.
Finish: Milk chocolate and a clean, nutty oak.
Nose: Ripe peaches, warm gingerbread, black forest honey, polished oak and a little rye spice.

Name: The Deveron 18 Year Old
Palate: Caramelised peaches, dark chocolates, orange zest and malt aplenty.
Finish: Whispers of raisin and crushed nuts. A bit short.
Nose: Creamy malt with hints of hazelnut cream, fresh summer berries and a drizzle of maple syrup.

Name: The Macallan Rare Cask (2020 Release)
Palate: Oak resonates, timeless, polished and rich. Vanilla and chocolate lead the finale along with a light citrus zest.
Finish: Full and warming.
Nose: Soft notes of opulent vanilla and raisin pique the nose, giving way to a sweet ensemble of apple, lemon and orange.

Name: Old Perth 14 Year Old 2004
Palate: On the palate there's drying Christmas-y spices, toasted barley and stewed fruits, with sweet vanilla, marmalade and golden syrup after some time.
Finish: A sweet and long finish is percolated by a distinct forest floor richness.
Nose: Floral smoke, brown sugar and fresh apple blossom are followed by black cherry, plump raisins and fruitcake notes.

Name: The Glover 4 Year Old
Palate: Tinned pineapple and orange loaf cake, with barley sugar.
Finish: Lemon curd shrouded by subtle peat smoke.
Nose: Orange curd, nougat and sour orange sweeties, with fresh tropical fruit in support.

Name: Wolfburn Kylver Series - Release 2
Palate: Earthy notes once again, this time more pronounced though balanced by milk chocolate and buttery sultana. A touch of charred oak.
Finish: Pine resin, cinnamon, cumin, orange sweeties.
Nose: Bright notes of fresh fruit salad (with mango, melon, peach and pear). Ginger snaps, whispers of earthy peat and a touch of caramelised brown sugar.

Name: Teaninich 1984 (bottled 1996) - Lombard
Palate: Peaches and honey, earthy oak, bananas and ice cream, pine nut, orange oil and a mineral backbone.
Finish: Floral peony, even more banana, cinnamon bun and orchard fruit.
Nose: Fresh pancakes with lemon juice and a sprinkle of sugar, floral honey, clove, forest aromas and ripe pear.

Name: Angelsâ Nectar -  Islay Edition
Palate: Digestive biscuits and waxy lemon peel, with floral honey and a medicinal iodine note.
Finish: Sea air and vanilla, with bonfire smoke and mineral maritime notes lingering.
Nose: Charred lemon peel, with barley sugar and peat smoke alongside cured meats.

Name: Glen Moray Madeira Cask Project
Palate: Coconut ice and banoffee pie, followed by fresh juicy pear and tangy lemon. Chewy malt leading to milk chocolate and hickory warmth.
Finish: A very long finish, with orchard fruit in syrup, fudge and black pepper.
Nose: Pear drops, dried fruit, biscuit dough, peaches and cream, cinnamon and caramelised apples.

Name: Balvenie Tun 1509 - Batch 4
Palate: Oat biscuits with a drizzle of melted dark chocolate, black pepper, herbaceous oak and buttery shortcrust pastry.
Finish: Ginger snaps, Maltesers, fried dough and new leather.
Nose: Spiced fruit chutney, caramelised apple, sponge cake with honey.

Name: Smokey Peated Blended Malt - Sansibar
Palate: BBQ pineapple, barrel char and a kick of red chilli.
Finish: Lasting burnt oak notes.
Nose: Sweet peat smoke drifts up from the glass, paired with honey, hops and green apple.

Name: Excalibur 45 Year Old 1972
Palate: A wonderful layered whisky with lots of tropical fruit, papaya, guava, passion fruit and mango. A touch of fresh mint makes way for some subtle cinnamon spice and pear drops.
Finish: Nutty, with some ample syrup and cream. Lovely texture, long with great warmth.
Nose: Sweet malted barley, very fruity, cherries and peaches.

Name: Benromach Organic 2010 (bottled 2015)
Palate: Peppery oak, light chocolate and a touch of coffee.
Finish: Lemon zest freshness.
Nose: Vanilla cream, golden malt and a touch of tropical fruit.

Name: The GlenDronach Cask Strength - Batch 6
Palate: Christmas pudding, peppered oak and juicy raisins once again.
Finish: Sweet and long, with a touch of hot spices.
Nose: Sherried peels and thick-cut marmalade. Almonds and handfuls of dried fruit.

Name: Langatun Jacobâs Dram 2013
Palate: A viscous mouthfeel supported by notes of various berry jams, dark chocolate-covered almonds, floral honey and lots of dried fruit.
Finish: A slightly syrupy finish with a trace of nutty bitterness.
Nose: Fresh toast with oodles of strawberry jam, with nougat and Danish pastries.

Name: Daftmill 2007 - Winter Batch Release
Palate: Honey and peanut butter on brown bread, with hints of apricot and pear giving it some fruity lightness. A few hints of chicory and peppery oak.
Finish: Custard Cream biscuits with milky tea, plus cut grass and lemon peels.
Nose: Sultana, candied ginger, greengages, cedar and some autumnal leaf earthiness.

Name: Benromach Organic 2011 (bottled 2019)
Palate: Banana bread and coffee, with continued ginger heat. Layers of runny caramel as it develops.
Finish: Subtly peppery, with just a whisper of floral smoke lingering.
Nose: Toasty oak with warming hints of cinnamon and ginger, balanced by juicy apricot and white grape.

Name: Glen Scotia 30 Year Old
Palate: Soft silky entry with honeyed pear and candied lemon peel. The intensity ramps up with cinnamon and ground ginger spice leading into dark chocolate and espresso.
Finish: Long with roasted sugar sweetness and waves of warming cinnamon spice.
Nose: Thick perfumed floral notes of violet and lavender mix with bracing seaspray. There is freshly sliced green apple before a gentle spiciness of nutmeg and allspice.

Name: Spicily Sweet Blended Malt - Sansibar
Palate: Cinnamon and mango, joined by melted chocolate too.
Finish: Medium length, with notes of nutmeg and allspice.
Nose: Butter malt and fig jam. Slightly hint of resinous pine.

Name: Kilchoman Loch Gorm 2017 Release
Palate: Rich chocolate, cinnamon and cloves combined with peat smoke.
Finish: Long and full bodied with a balance of sweet smoke.
Nose: Orange and lemon notes, rich smoky peat and cooked fruit.

Name: Highland Park 15 Year Old
Palate: Smoke begins light and coastal, develops throughout with a hint of well-toasted malt. Sultanas and redcurrants sit beneath it.
Finish: Long-lasting smoky elements.
Nose: Orange and lemon peels, joined by sea breeze and vanilla custard.

Name: anCnoc Peatheart - Batch 2
Palate: The peat is a touch more subdued on the palate (though definitely still integral tot he flavour profile), making a little room for pineapple and runny caramel.
Finish: Bonfire embers and a hint of straw.
Nose: Mango and mint leaf, swiftly followed by waft after waft of roasted meat and charred oak.

Name: Starward 10th Anniversary
Palate: Sultana, more plum, dark chocolate, honey, clove and black pepper.
Finish: Strawberry and raspberry jam, malt loaf, lemon.
Nose: Bitter orange, cinder toffee, Black Forest gateau, stewed plum.

Name: Glen Moray Cider Cask Project
Palate: Incredibly light and fresh. Summer fruits accompanied by vanilla ice cream sprinkled with toasted oats.
Finish: Smooth and satisfying. Caramelized apple laced with spice mixed perfectly with vanilla fudge, slowly melting on the tongue.
Nose: Reminiscent of a fairground. Toffee apple and candy floss.

Name: Bladnoch Adela 15 Year Old
Palate: Chocolatey and rich, with notes of strawberry, liquoirce and clove in tow.
Finish: Quite long and packed with Oloroso sweetness.
Nose: Walnut and coffee cake, juicy cherries and a hint of lemongrass.

Name: Aberlour Casg Annamh Batch 4
Palate: Flapjack with chocolate chips, honeyed cereals, ground nutmeg and cinnamon, a hint of red wine booziness.
Finish: Banana fritters, pancakes, sultanas and coffee.
Nose: Honey on toast, red liquorice, melted butter, dates and Brazil nuts.

Name: The Koshi-No Shinobu Pure Malt
Palate: Lemon curd and citrus peel lead into oak char, chai spices and floral oak.
Finish: Toasty oak and underripe red fruit linger.
Nose: Stewed stone fruit and red berries, with creamy oak and mint white chocolate.

Name: Reference Series II.1
Palate: Thick and heavier than II; less nimble. It's also as if the finish and palate have swapped during the Sherry finish too, with the full Black Forest gÃ¢teau notes developing on the palate with dark cocoa.
Finish: More chocolate alongside dark cherries and a slightly herbal edge.
Nose: Instantly darker than II, more dried fruits and cocoa than those juicy fruits whilst golden syrup takes the place of some of the honey. More classic meaty Sherry character and less ethereal notes. Green wood and double cream are in support.

Name: Balblair 1989 3rd Release
Palate: Soft and sweet, yet full and voluptuous towards the middle. There are cereal notes here and more vanilla oak.
Finish: Good length, with a creamy quality beneath the sweet, bourbon oak.
Nose: Vanilla and spicy oak abound with some intriguing spice and citrus notes.

Name: Glen Grant 170th Anniversary Edition
Palate: The palate has rich Christmas cake notes with heaps of fruit and a little smoke.
Finish: The finish is strong and intense with notes of spice and raisins.
Nose: Raisins, demerara sugar and a hint of peat smoke.

Name: Benromach 2000 Marsala Wood Finish
Palate: Juicy texture, spicy cooked fruit. Malty.
Finish: Smoky, chewy toffee. Spicy, grapey. Whirls of smoke on the tail.
Nose: Full, peppery. Herbal and slightly earthen. Damp leaves?

Name: Amrut Two Continents 2nd Edition
Palate: Vibrant and fruity, rich with malt, leather, cedar and toasted barley, a little almond and fruit.
Finish: Good length with notes of spice, nutmeg and cedar wood.
Nose: Fried banana, pine forest floor, butter toffee, rich oak, sultanas, fruit scones, over-ripe fruit and pepper.

Name: The Big Smoke 60 (Duncan Taylor)
Palate: Big, very big in fact, with intense spices, peach, apple, and big hit of oily, salty smoke.
Finish: Good length, it remains oily, with hints of Lapsang Souchong tea on the tea, and some burnt wood.
Nose: Sweet and creamy notes with notes of oily smoke, warm slabs of peat, and grist.

Name: Glenglassaugh 45 Year Old 1966
Palate: Zesty and spicy with oodles of deep, dark sherry, toasted oak, potpourri and musty old oranges. Hints of port wine, a little cedar and nutmeg.
Finish: Very thick and fruity, with gripping oak and Oloroso, and black pepper on the tail.
Nose: Spicy and rich with notes of rancio, marmalade, granary toast, calves leather, cigar leaves, cedar, pine forest, truffle oil and rich, tangy prunes.

Name: Royal Brackla 12 Year Old
Palate: Pain au raisin. Pain au chocolat. Baking spices and gateau.
Finish: Milk chocolate dusting (not cocoa) and a hint of fizzy apple sweets.
Nose: Florentines, Coco Pop cakes, slightly leafy, more ginger. A drop of water brings out more green apple and toasted almond.

Name: Royal Brackla 16 Year Old
Palate: Spicy, caramelised apples and orchard fruit, vanilla and fresh black cherries.
Finish: Rich cocoa and baking spices.
Nose: Ripe red apple at first before thick crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e takes charge with apricot, custard and a little Buttercup cough syrup.

Name: Karuizawa 1985 Single Cask 7017
Palate: Big on the deep, earthy savoury notes. Pine, heather roots, truffles, mushrooms, big sherry character. Peppermint.
Finish: Slightly short, chewy and tannic.
Nose: From the big, bold school of Japanese whisky, heavy on the sherry influence. Hint of the sulphur, though it really works here. Mixed nuts and dried dark fruits.

Name: Ardbeg Lord Robertson of Port Ellen
Palate: Sooty and dark palate entry, with cocoa, marzipan, cedarwood and potpourri, a little cocoa butter and espresso with grappa.
Finish: Long, smoked and really intenseâ¦
Nose: Sweet and creamy nose with smoked almonds and butterscotch, sweet Normandy cider, a touch of nutmeg, clove and burnt sticking plasters, alongside a development of creosote that comes with time in the glass.

Name: Aberlour A'Bunadh Batch 45
Palate: More raisins, ginger, prunes, macchiato and rich oak.
Finish: Allspice, cocoa, Corinth raisins, all lingering.
Nose: Terrific spicy sherry notes, orange rind, toasted raisins and cocoa.

Name: The GlenDronach Cask Strength - Batch 3
Palate: Fresh barley notes, followed by sultanas, plums and citrus. Chocolatey at times too.
Finish: A lasting finish, influenced very well by the sherry casks.
Nose: Dried fruits, glazed with rich syrup and a sprinkle of cocoa. If that's not already a pudding, someone should make it because it smells amazing.

Name: Benromach 10 Year Old (Old Bottling)
Palate: Barley, slightly herbal, a little fruit, grassy. Big on malt, ground ginger.
Finish: Mouthwateringly bittersweet. Ginger, dry sherry, almost hoppy after a while.
Nose: Dry, barley, big on malt and oak. Dry pine, fruity. A tad spirity. Sweet spices after a time and a hint of puckering prune from the sherry cask and maple fudge.

Name: Port Askaig 30 Year Old
Palate: Salted caramel brownie and brandy butter. Slowly reveals drying, spicy smoke, with a touch of roasting corn-on-the-cob smothered in butter much later on.
Finish: Sweet peat, black tea and chilli-coated peanuts.
Nose: Iodine, black pepper and aniseed up front. Sweet, fruitier notes of banana fritter, mango chutney and lemongrass are tucked away behind the peat.

Name: Glengoyne Cask Strength (Batch 2)
Palate: Treacle-like, sweet and thick. Sharp fruits with sugar syrup and more oaty biscuits.
Finish: A long, lasting finish.
Nose: Fresh strawberries and cream, crumbled digestive biscuits and a hint of oak spice.

Name: Glen Grant 16 Year Old
Palate: Pear drops, vanilla ice cream and a subtle but sharp hint of kiwi.
Finish: Medium length, fresh but dry.
Nose: Warm pears and apples with a soft, creamy centre. Grassy notes too.

Name: anCnoc Black Hill Reserve
Palate: Apple and orange stay at the fore, backed up by continued bourbon-cask vanillas and a touch of cooking spice.
Finish: Quite long and chocolatey.
Nose: Lots of orchard fruit on the nose (something of a signature for anCnoc). Soon joined by sweet, creamy vanilla.

Name: Ardbeg 1998 Single Cask 1275
Palate: Intense and rich, notes of bonfire toffee, smoked kippers, rhubarb and custard sweets, pine oil, orange blossom and lime zest.
Finish: A long, thick finish with foam banana sweets, hickory smoke and malt.
Nose: Aromatic and heavenly with notes of vanilla cream, cocoa butter, coffee, cloves, cigar humidors, candy floss and buttery toffee. A development of rich wood smoke and iodine appears after time in the glass.

Name: Auld Reekie 10 Year Old
Palate: Peaty, cold wood ash, iodine, coastal,  black forest honey.
Finish: Long, oily and rich, lovely punchiness, winter spices.
Nose: Peat, custard, orchard fruits, limes, spices, coastal, iodine.

Name: Campbeltown Loch 30 Year Old
Palate: Exceptionally put together. Rich and thick with buttery toffee, spices, apple peels and creamy vanilla.
Finish: Long, tingling, rich, creamy, malty.
Nose: A rich and warming nose. Plenty of caramel, butterscotch, orchard fruit, oak, vanilla, and blossom.

Name: Reference Series III.2
Palate: Huge, fruity, slightly drying. Chocolate-covered raisins, dried apricot, meaty and slightly nutty with a mess of smoky dark cocoa.
Finish: Thick, smoky, oaky, chocolatey maltiness with subtle touches of fruit.
Nose: Ooh, hello. Chocolate and roasted malt (chocolate malt?), sweet, oily malt loaf and balancing salinity. Toffee brittle and creamy coffee beans.

Name: Ginger Treacle 1991 (Wemyss Malts)
Palate: The palate suggests dried fruit including prunes, raisins and sultanas. There are more spices here too, including cardamom.
Finish: Fairly short and sweet with lasting jammy spice.
Nose: Great toffee flavour, balanced by leather and shot through with spicy cloves. It fills out with jammy notes.

Name: Glen Scotia 10 Year Old
Palate: The vanilla develops on the palate with lemon zest and hints of thick, sweet honey.
Finish: Quite a nutty finish.
Nose: Golden barley, crunchy apples (can apples smell crunchy? I think they can) and soft vanilla.

Name: Tomatin CÃ¹ BÃ²can
Palate: Smoke starts to seep through slowly, growing ever so slightly the longer it's on the tongue. Subtle sweet chillies pop up, as well as a nutty note or two.
Finish: Medium, with a final flash of the spectral smoke.
Nose: A springy citrus blend of oranges and grapefruits which leads into a fresh, floral bloom.

Name: Benromach 2000 Port Wood Finish
Palate: Thick palate entry with banana chips and aniseed. Cigar smoke and spice.
Finish: Long finish with toffee apples and cinnamon.
Nose: Rich, sweet, spicy nose with peaches in syrup and tropical fruit. Hints of rum spice and a little smoke.

Name: Nikka Taketsuru 12 Year Old
Palate: Sweet and oily, apple cider, cinnamon sticks, buttery toffee, almond, salty butter, custard.
Finish: Good length, creamy, notes of digestive biscuit and rhubarb crumble.
Nose: Floral and balanced, with notes of plum jam, cut herbs, rhubarb pie, vanilla ice cream and cold coffee.

Name: Benriach 34 Year Old 1970
Palate: Rich toffee. Deep, dark and quiet peat lurks in the murky depths. Winter spice and rum.
Finish: Dark, rich, gently peated.
Nose: . Sublime winter spices; cinnamon and cloves, rising with fruit and stem ginger. Hints of smoke.

Name: Glen Albyn 1976 (Gordon & MacPhail)
Palate: Warm nutmeg and cinnamon spice to begin with followed by sweet honey glazed nuts.
Finish: The finish is soft with delicate notes of spice and elegant fresh fruit woven in.
Nose: Rum-soaked raisins with notes of Seville orange zest and gooseberries.

Name: Glenfarclas 1987 Single Oloroso Cask
Palate: Toasty, barley, dark brown sugar, vanilla, buttery, apple crumble.
Finish: Long, spices, fruity, deep.
Nose: Musty, woody. Blossom, floral, honey. Fruit salad, sherry.

Name: Filey Bay Double Oak #1
Palate: Soft, creamy malt with smooth vanilla, buttery oak, and notes of ripe banana. Delicate oaken spice develops, with toasty sawdust and grilled pineapple.
Finish: Things wrap up with yet more soft, creamy vanilla with hints of crumbly fudge, toffee popcorn, and fruit salad.
Nose: Buttered scones with jam and cream, a touch of grassy barley, pouring caramel.

Name: Wemyss Winter Spice 1982 (Teaninich)
Palate: The palate is fresh and vibrant, which belies its age. A grassy, herbal note fades to reveal mint, sweet spice and cloved oranges.
Finish: Spiced marmalade notes fade slowly on the tongue.
Nose: Very spicy, bursting with cinnamon, ginger and cloves, followed by revealing notes of sweet candied fruits and demerara sugar.

Name: Hakushu 12 Year Old 43.5%
Palate: Clean with notes of cut fruits, gentle barley malt and smoke. A floral character with citrus zest.
Finish: Sweet and spicy.
Nose: Light and crisp with fresh notes of cut hay and sweet mixed peels, a little hazelnut and barley malt.

Name: Glencadam 15 Year Old (Old Bottle)
Palate: Rounded, fruity, smoke, soft wood, chewy tannins, dark toffee.
Finish: Long, rich, gently sweet, oak and spice.
Nose: Light, subtle. Balanced. Citrus, zest, hints of vanilla, spice. Caramel, creamy, fruit salad.

Name: Edradour 10 Year Old 2012 (cask 462) - Straight From The Cask
Palate: More raisins, spiced tea loaf, with a touch of toasted walnuts, and sticky dates.
Finish: Allspice and clove linger, along with dried currants.
Nose: Layers of dried raisins and figs, with allspice, and tawny marmalade.

Name: Port Askaig 19 Year Old
Palate: Thick, fruity palate, with notes of peat smoke, a touch of dried banana, biscuity malt and cocoa butter. Very interesting indeed, with an oily mouth-feel.
Finish: Sweet, peaty finish. Dusty and oily.
Nose: Fresh, coastal nose. A little oily, and faintly smoky. The smoke develops over time and becomes rather peaty, with a touch of cranberry too.

Name: The Cashly (Sons of Scotland) (Second Release)
Palate: Hefty peat smoke and chocolatey malt mingle, with gingersnap biscuits and just a touch of treacle, before peppery heat joins.
Finish: Warming layers of ashen oak and earthy peat linger, alongside crackles of candied ginger and smoked almonds.
Nose: Burnt embers and smouldering woodfire, spiced, baked goods, and distant cooked orchard fruits.

Name: Kilchoman 100% Islay 12th Edition
Palate: Orange chocolate, toasted nuts, and burnt banana bread, alongside aromatic smoke and sweet figs.
Finish: Bittersweet cocoa, woody smoke, and cinnamon sticks.
Nose: Sweet peat smoke leads, followed by homemade jam, lemon blossom, fudge, and kitchen spices.

Name: Bladnoch 11 Year Old (2022 Release)
Palate: Still delicately floral, with layers of caramel and oak appearing.
Finish: Cooked apple, peppercorn, and violet sweeties.
Nose: Fragrant honey with a smidge of floral breeze to it.

Name: Dalmore 19 Year Old 1990 - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Huge delivery, sublime with notes of cut grass, walnut, honey, toffee and cinnamon.
Finish: Sweet, very long and spicy.
Nose: Big sweet honeyed spices with musty toffee, sherry, dried grass and caramel. Maybe even a hint of lemon.

Name: Caol Ila 25 Year Old
Palate: Retains gentle peat, hints of dry oaked spice. Smoky, zesty.
Finish: Long, dry, subtle peat smoke, dry driftwood washed in from the sea.
Nose: Subtle, coastal, cereals, malty barley sweetness, soft fruit.

Name: Togouchi Sake Cask Finish
Palate: Toasted barley and flapjack, with sweet grist, buttery pastry, and woody vanilla.
Finish: Butter biscuits and soft spices linger, with a hint of herbaceous malt and murmurs of sweet sake.
Nose: Elegant stone fruits and orchard fruits tangle, with apricot and nectarine, crisp apple, and juicy pears.

Name: Glen Garioch 8 Year Old
Palate: Rich, winter spice, malt. Wood smoke, walnut.
Finish: Quite long, coffee, honey on buttered toast, touch of bitter dark chocolate on the tail.
Nose: Quite green and grassy. Fresh peat. Soft hay, cereals, tangy zest.

Name: The Glenturret Triple Wood (2020 Maiden Release)
Palate: Cigar box and ripe berries, leading into crystallised ginger and caramel digestives.
Finish: Plum skin and toasty oak linger.
Nose: Oaky vanilla and Lotus biscuits, with cinnamon sugar and a pinch of tobacco.

Name: Glengoyne English Merchants' Choice
Palate: Huge, syrupy and rich. Thereâs a note that if stronger might be sulphur, but is just muted enough to add a fantastic dimension of Porcini mushrooms alongside the sterling barrage of  rum spice, freshly cracked black pepper, Tiramisu and banana cake.
Finish: Long and increasingly tangy with puckering fruit, hints of dried chili and various barks.
Nose: Deep dark sherry as expected, with a ripe selection of prune juice, varnished oak and molasses. Develops on tangy hints of gooseberry and a little orange liqueur. Actually reminds us very much of Pyrat XO! Some vanilla and Peychaudâs bitters appear after a few minutes in the glass.

Name: Benriach 29 Year Old 1975
Palate: Full. Chocolate, chewy oak and espresso beans. Nutty, creamy and malty.
Finish: Oaked, peppery warmth.
Nose: Dark. Mochaccino, exotic fruit perhaps? Floral, hint of smoke.

Name: anCnoc 30 Year Old 1975
Palate: Barley, oak, tannins. Spice, buttery, dark sugar, fruity, rum.
Finish: Long, oaked, rum.
Nose: Rich, full, oaky. Spices, buttey pastry. Vanilla, barley. Slightly rubbery.

Name: Killyloch 36 Year Old 1967
Palate: Medium. Crisp barley. Toasted oak. Spice.
Finish: Peppery, spices, oak. Drying.
Nose: Medium. Tangy citrus. Lemon marmalade. Pink grapefruit, verbena freshness.

Name: Caol Ila Creosote & Candied Fruits (cask 310123) - The Cooper's Choice (The Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Palate: Peppery spice joins the earthy peat, with grilled peaches, and oaky vanilla.
Finish: Tar and scorched sugar, with some candied citrus peels.
Nose: Waves of smouldering bonfires, with raisins, and some tawny marmalade.

Name: Nikka Whisky From the Barrel Cocktail Set
Palate: Rich, creamy notes of Autumnal fruit, oak, cinnamon and crÃ¨me caramel. A touch of smoke, notes of apple strudel and malt.
Finish: Long and spicy, notes of luscious stewed fruit.
Nose: Floral and fresh with notes of cinnamon and allspice, hints of light oak, punchy notes of pepper with a creamy caramel sweetness.

Name: Dumbarton 55 Year Old 1964 (cask 13767) - Xtra Old Particular (Douglas Laing)
Palate: The palate is gentle yet lively with spice (ginger and nutmeg) and a milk chocolate richness.
Finish: The finish is lengthy with poached pears, pistachios, marmalade on toast and crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e.
Nose: The nose opens gloriously with Scottish honey, maple syrup, candied apples and a polished wood style.

Name: BenRiach 33 Year Old 1972
Palate: Medium bodied. Oaky, green, fresh. Stone fruits, guava.
Finish: Good length, tannins develop.
Nose: Poised and nicely perfumed. Peppery freshness, hints of menthol. Estery.

Name: Ledaig 32 Year Old 1972
Palate: Quite smooth and well-balanced. There is a fullness and depth with notes of exotic fruit salad; guava and pineapple with hints of lemon marmalade and winter spice, ground ginger and cinnamon.
Finish: Of good length with winter spice.
Nose: Full and rich. There is a gentle peat note with dry wood smoke and boiled sweets. Hints of estery fruits and menthol and iodine.

Name: Glenmorangie 15 Year Old - The Cadboll Estate Batch No. 2
Palate: Cereal sweetness, with drizzles of caramel, baked apples, warm oak, and baking spices.
Finish: The spices build, with oak lingering.
Nose: Oaky vanilla, fresh hay, a backing of gentle spice, and waxy orange peel.

Name: Braeval 13 Year Old 2009 (cask 804907) - Infrequent Flyers (Alistair Walker)
Palate: Ripe cherries, plum crumble, dark chocolate, and a touch of spicy tobacco.
Finish: Peppery spice builds, with juicy berry notes lingering.
Nose: Blackberry jam, hawthorn tea, cacao nibs, and a touch of roasted almond.

Name: Ardbeg 22 Year Old - Twenty Something
Palate: There's plenty of dark and orchard fruits among golden syrup, dark chocolate and black peppercorn. Cured meat and a little salinity emerge.
Finish: Long and sweet, with a touch of bittersweet smoke.
Nose: Lime cordial, orange marmalade and buttery pastry, with some TCP elements and refined smoke. Hints of vanilla and clove develop.

Name: Benriach 26 Year Old 1978
Palate: Thick. Well-restrained sweetness. Exotic fruit. A touch of grenadine develops. Boiled sweets.
Finish: Creamy. Oily, nutty and punchy.
Nose: Sweetness. Manuka honey, comfiture dâabricot.

Name: Sheep Dip Amoroso Oloroso 1999
Palate: CrÃ¨me anglais, vanilla pods in caster sugar, mild, rounded sherry spice and more toffee. In case you hadn't noticed, this is a sweet whisky.
Finish: More sweetness, but the finish is a touch peppery with some cinnamon.
Nose: Caramel, vanilla, hot caramel popcorn covered in butter, some maraschino cherry, light brown sugar and toffee brittle.

Name: Glenturret The Hosh (cask 106/2007)
Palate: Ginger snaps, crushed cinnamon sticks, a touch of earthy oak richness, rounded out by sweet chocolate notes.
Finish: Hints of dried fruit and earthy spice remain.
Nose: Pancakes with maple syrup, rum-raisin ice cream, slightly savoury barley and some freshly-chopped kitchen herbs.

Name: Highland Park 40 Year Old
Palate: Full and a little oily. Notes of leafy greenness and marzipan with hints of sherry. Seville marmalade and a little spice.
Finish: The finish is long with perfumed notes and zesty bitter oak.
Nose: Rich and full. Notes of pine and eucalyptus oil with hints of manuka honey. Some fruit notes, grassy heather and mixed peels developing with gentle smoke.

Name: Macduff 18 Year Old 1997 (cask 5852) - Ancient Mariner
Palate: Honeyed orchard fruits and a good crack of black pepper, malty cereal and vanilla syrup.
Finish: Sugary peach tart, tobacco and underlying wood spice.
Nose: Charred strawberries, freshly baked nut loaf, peppermint sweeties and a floral bouquet.

Name: Balmenach 8 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Millionaire's shortbread, honeyed sultanas, a hint of coffee bean and cardamom spiciness.
Finish: Sweet tropical fruit brightness.
Nose: Orange zest, buttery malt, greengages, and a smidge of woody spice.

Name: Adelphi's Liddesdale 18 Year Old
Palate: Sweet, oily and orangey, truly mouth-coating.
Finish: Reasonably long with orange zest, caramel and dried date notes.
Nose: Mince-pies, brandy sauce, spent firework.

Name: Ballechin 12 Year Old 2009 (cask 345) - Straight From The Cask
Palate: Charred raisin, oily malt, cocoa, and fragrant, savoury smoke.
Finish: Salted caramel, treacle, and bittersweet dark chocolate.
Nose: Honey-glazed ham, roasted (and burnt) nuts, and melted chocolate.

Name: Hazelburn 13 Year Old 2007
Palate: Sultana and malt loaf as it opens up, before a big wave of honey and juicy peach notes appear. Anise once again, plus a touch of cut grass.
Finish: Vanilla pod, softly toasted teacakes with butter, green apple.
Nose: Chocolate digestives, orange zest, honeydew melon. Soon enough, creamy vanilla builds on the nose, with a hint of anise.

Name: Caol Ila 15 Year Old 2007 (cask 204) - Cask Strength Collection (Signatory)
Palate: Sherry character bringing a barbecue smoke quality to the coastal peat, with drizzles of caramel, raisin-studded fruit compote, and shavings of chocolate.
Finish: Sweet sherry and smoke linger, with some drying oak.
Nose: Smoked streaky bacon, with dried figs, some toasted almonds, vanilla, and spice.

Name: The Dalmore 15 Year Old Luminary No. 1 - 2022 Edition
Palate: Citrus, chocolate, cherries, figs, brioche, and moist ginger cake.
Finish: Dried fruits and honey entwine with balanced wood spice and cacao.
Nose: Rich fruits, panna cotta, honey roasted almonds, and citrus oils.

Name: Dalmore 10 Year Old - Vintage 2008
Palate: A creamy nuttiness, with honey roasted walnut, stewed berries and plump raisin, butterscotch, floral malt and salted chocolate.
Finish: Cigar box, a hint of creamy vanilla, juicy pear and rich, drying oak.
Nose: Fresh hay, dates, stewed pear, cinnamon and liquorice with a drizzle of honey.

Name: Pl5 - Elements of Islay (Port Charlotte)
Palate: Green apple, savoury peat, sea salt and lemon peel.
Finish: New leather and sea salt once again.
Nose: Smoked meats and bonfire embers, with a hint of vanilla sweetness tucked away.

Name: 963 Malt & Grain Black Label
Palate: Eucalyptus, earthy spices, still has a hint of fresh fruit sweetness to it.
Finish: Delicate lemon and dry smoke.
Nose: Pear and floral vanilla, shortly joined by grassy peat.

Name: High Coast Berg - Pedro XimÃ©nez
Palate: Dried fruit and vanilla sweetness, stewed apple, chocolate raisins, and espresso.
Finish: Apricot jam, more dried fruit, and gentle spice.
Nose: Buttery fudge, nutmeg, frangipane, cocoa, and sultana.

Name: Glenfarclas 1995 (bottled 2018) Premium Edition
Palate: Cinnamon and clove once again, now with orange oil adding a freshness to the dense dark fruit. A solid core of oak richness.
Finish: Hot chocolate, treacle tart and walnut.
Nose: Prune, Christmas spices, chocolate cake and a good helping of honey.

Name: Miyagikyo Rum Wood Finish (bottled 2017)
Palate: Heavy oak influence, maple syrup, pepper spice, creamy vanilla, lemon zest, herbaceous notes and a scattering of tobacco.
Finish: Oak spice, bergamot and fresh tropical fruits return.
Nose: Lemon peel, new leather, mineral notes, a drizzle of floral honey, sugared almonds and fresh tropical fruit.

Name: The English - Smokey Oak
Palate: More rich peat, paprika, smoke meat, warming root ginger and candied lemon.
Finish: The smoke continues into a lengthy, dry finish.
Nose: Cured meat surrounded by thick peat smoke, with a dash of lemon juice livening it up.

Name: Ardnamurchan AD/07.21:05
Palate: Caramelised nuts, whispers of fruity sherry and macadamia nuts, a core of savoury peat building.
Finish: Subtle sea breeze salinity, juxtaposed by dried fruit and orange zest.
Nose: Toasted brown sugar and earthy barley, with a good hint of charred oak underneath.

Name: Glenfarclas 1997 (bottled 2018) Premium Edition
Palate: Christmas cake, hazelnut spread, dates and clove.
Finish: more clove, now paired with ginger and green apple.
Nose: Biscotti, melted chocolate and some toasty oak warmth.

Name: Linkwood 2008 (bottled 2018) - Malts of Scotland
Palate: Oak spice, chocolate covered nuts, sweet malt, freshly baked bread and lemon meringue pie.
Finish: Treacle tart with a dash of citrus.
Nose: Dried apricot, orange marmalade, cookie dough and oodles of dried berries.

Name: Springbank 21 Year Old (2022 Release)
Palate: Jammy red berry sweetness mingles with dark salted chocolate and runny caramel, with softly spiced gingerbread joining later on.
Finish: Vanilla, maple, and orange zest arrive towards the end, while the coastal salinity comes to the fore.
Nose: Sticky ginger cake and dark forest fruits lead the way, with leathery oak and toffee in tow.

Name: Peerless 5 Year Old Single Barrel Rye
Palate: The fruity core continues with baked apples and toasted nuts. Charred oak and peppery rye bring notes of stem ginger with earthy undertones and hints of zesty herbs.
Finish: Floral honey notes and toffee popcorn are followed by zesty orange, clove, and bold oak spice.
Nose: Sweet orchard fruits, crisp green apples, and crushed peanuts welcome the way for an array of rich baking spice, with wafts of vanilla and toffee.

Name: Brackla 7 Year Old 2011 - Whisky Galore
Palate: Spiced milk chocolate, with candied citrus, vanilla custard and lots of ripe orchard fruit.
Finish: Grassy oak and a drizzle of caramel.
Nose: Nougat and spiced, stewed apple, with almond croissant and a good helping of honey.

Name: Yoichi Rum Wood Finish (bottled 2017)
Palate: Delicate peat smoke, aromatic spices out in force with cinnamon, cardamom and clove, toasted coconut and coconut cream, candied ginger and malt notes.
Finish: A lengthy finish of slightly bitter mustard seeds and a dusting of cocoa.
Nose: Tropical fruits galore, notably pineapple and banana, with menthol, lemon sweeties and a kick of fresh ginger.

Name: Johnnie Walker 18 Year Old Gift Pack with 2x Glasses
Palate: Peanut brittle, candied peels, plump sultana, a whisper of floral malt gives it an aromatic mid-palate, before giving way to a whisper of dry, earthy smoke.
Finish: Another wave of honey, with a soft hint of cinnamon spiciness.
Nose: Honeyed cereals, Cadbury's Fruit and Nut, distant bonfire smoke, clementine and spring blossom.

Name: Nc'nean Quiet Rebels - Annabel
Palate: Fragrant vanilla, with a floral touch to it, balanced by barley sugar, coconut, and ginger.
Finish: Softly fruity on the finish, plus hints of vanilla remain.
Nose: Cherry Bakewells, honeycomb, and a flash of papaya.

Name: The English - Lest We Forget 2022
Palate: Butterscotch, lemon peel, smoked honey, and dark chocolate.
Finish: A little marzipan and nutmeg.
Nose: Old leather, bonfire smoke, marmalade, and vanilla.

Name: The Glenturret 15 Year Old (2022 Release)
Palate: Woody vanilla and lemon drizzle cake open the way, with sultanas and prunes in tow. Roasted malt and hearty oak bring notes of cacao and pepper.
Finish: Cinnamon, clove, and warming layers of charred oak are joined by poached apple and vanilla custard.
Nose: Honeyed flapjack packed with raisins, zesty citrus peels, and a touch of charred pineapple, followed by whispers of oak spice.

Name: Glenfarclas 2007 (bottled 2018) Premium Edition
Palate: Big old fashioned Sherry matured character with fruitcake, ginger root and nutty Oloroso.
Finish: Cocoa, vanilla and subtle charred oak.
Nose: Rich dried fruits, finely chopped nuts and grated nutmeg, then flamed orange peel and brown sugar underneath.

Name: Imperial 24 Year Old 1995 - Single & Single
Palate: Oily walnut and anise, with chocolate-coated peanuts and green oak.
Finish: Waxy peels and a hint of honey.
Nose: Ginger cake and oat and raisin cookies, supported by cooked apple.

Name: Benromach Cask Strength 2008 (bottled 2019)
Palate: Black pepper and fresh strawberries intertwine, with creamy fruit and nut milk chocolate, banana bread, smoked orange peel and waxy citrus.
Finish: More of that milk chocolate lingers with salted caramel and bonfire smoke.
Nose: Loads of sherry aromas alongside toasty oak, sweet vanilla custard and stewed orchard fruit, with a balanced light herbaceous undertone.

Name: The One Port Cask Finished
Palate: Warming and spicy, with a crack of black pepper alongside nutmeg and cinnamon, with orange oil, roasted nuts and berries.
Finish: Tangy sour cherry returns, with clove and a hint of pepper.
Nose: Rich and smoky, with honey, dried sour cherries, raisin and plum, with an oily nuttiness.

Name: Tomatin 12 Year Old  â 125th Anniversary
Palate: Nutty barley and creamy butter, plus more dried fruit. A smidge of ginger later on.
Finish: Sweet red fruit notes and balancing touches of dry oak.
Nose: Sultana, caramel, a fresh hint of juicy pear and apple.

Name: SmÃ¶gen 8 Year Old 2011
Palate: Wonderfully creamy, earthy vanilla pod and more of that fruit returning. Grassy, earthy, smokey richness develops.
Finish: A very long finish, sweet tropical fruit appearing alongside vanilla and more peat.
Nose: Juicy and fruity, with ripe plum, nectarine and peach, buttery vanilla pastry and delicate florals, with a refreshing menthol note.

Name: The GlenDronach 26 Year 1992 (cask 8316)
Palate: The refreshing attack on the palate is also bright and sunny. Mango, date and apricot appear alongside floral notes (rose).
Finish: Precise and enveloped in a veil of smoke, the finish is vegetal (bay leaf) and candied (lemon).
Nose: The silky initial nose is characterized by notes of fig and acacia honey. Allowed to breathe, it becomes herbaceous (verbena), spicy and floral (lavender), even flirting with peat.

Name: Benriach 22 Year Old Albariza - Peated
Palate: Sweet Mirabella peppers, black cherry and ripe figs rise but don't dominate, as licks of vanilla, campfire peat and a pricks of white pepper fill out a deep palate.
Finish: Long, with some menthol, honey and dark chocolate.
Nose: Sherry sweetness breaks through light leather, chicory and smoky oak. Some red meat and sweet barley lingers.

Name: The GlenDronach 10 Year Old Port Wood
Palate: Brandied cherries, blackcurrant and chocolate digestive biscuits.
Finish: Honey, biscotti, raisin and orange zest.
Nose: Huge helpings of dried fruit, mixed with aromatic oak and strawberry jam.

Name: Supersonic Mach 2 - North Star Spirits
Palate: Apple, pear, and blackcurrant, with a drizzle of coffee.
Finish: Lasting hints of orange peel and jammy sultanas.
Nose: Almonds, dates, a good chunk of chocolate, and malty bread.

Name: Bunnahabhain 17 Year Old 2002 - Single & Single
Palate: Notes of white and milk chocolate, with banana pancakes and a crack of black pepper.
Finish: A whiff of sea breeze lingers alongside a pinch of tobacco and ginger cake.
Nose: Set honey and barrel spice, with buttery croissant and marmalade.

Name: 963 Malt & Grain (58%)
Palate: More sugary notes, with sugared almond, candied orange and vanilla fudge.
Finish: Gentle oak spice appears on the finish alongside vanilla pod.
Nose: Barley sugar and vanilla icing, with floral honey and key lime pie.

Name: Benromach Cask Strength 2009 (bottled 2019)
Palate: Set honey, waxy peels and stewed orchard fruit, with a delicate suggestion of peat smoke throughout.
Finish: Chocolate-coated raisin lingers alongside a smouldering bonfire.
Nose: Lots of sherry influence alongside creamy vanilla, cooked apple and a hint of candle wax.

Name: Yoichi Bourbon Wood Finish (bottled 2018)
Palate: Oaky, with rather salty notes of liquorice, distinct notes of clove with handfuls of candied fruits, namely banana, date, lemon, and honey coated walnuts.
Finish: Long, malted barley and mineral chalky notes, with tobacco, walnut, fresh mint and lasting notes of peat.
Nose: Sweet and fresh plum and pear intertwined with salty peat, light swirls of smoke, candied ginger, gentle vanilla, freshly picked daffodils and lemon sweeties.

Name: GlenAllachie 21 Year Old Batch Three
Palate: Plenty of sherry character, with sun dried raisins, spiced and toasted fruitcake, twists of waxy orange peel, and muscovado sugar.
Finish: Baking spices linger, along with toasted almonds.
Nose: Dried figs, panforte, cocoa nibs, crumbly fudge, and a touch of star anise.

Name: Clynelish 21 Year Old - Forgotten Gems
Palate: Plenty more citrus notes, alongside a tropical touch of pineapple, with a prickle of oaky spice later on.
Finish: Lasting hints of savoury cedar and oily barley.
Nose: Chestnuts, treacle, a familiar hint of waxy citrus peels.

Name: Macallan 28 Year Old (That Boutique-y Whisky Company)
Palate: Delicate and smooth, oily mouthfeel, milk chocolate and a hint of forest fruits with kitchen spices in support.
Finish: Short, full of malt and caramel notes.
Nose: Floral elderflower, green apple and sweet nectarine, with just a hint of honeyed and buttered toast.

Name: Yoichi Sherry Wood Finish (bottled 2018)
Palate: Berry syrup, fresh strawberry, sweet malt, indulgent praline and notes of leather.
Finish: Distinct medicinal notes of tiger balm, and a hint of chocolate returns.
Nose: Buttered toast, smoked bacon and salted caramel, dried fruit, dark chocolate and potent nutmeg with a whisper of peat.

Name: Springbank 10 Year Old Local Barley
Palate: Soft smoke introduces cooking spice and a hint of meat richness to the palate, while tropical fruits give it some sweet lightness.
Finish: Sea salt, dried mango, vanilla and toffee.
Nose: Sugared peels, honeydew, roasted barley and a hint of charred oak.

Name: The Glenlivet NÃ durra Oloroso Batch OL1117
Palate: Mince pie filling, stem ginger, chocolate orange.
Finish: Drying cinnamon and nutmeg spiciness on the finish.
Nose: Treacle, blackberry, a hint of charred oak, old Port.

Name: Talisker Bodega Series 40 Year Old
Palate: At natural strength, the texture is very fine; oil-smooth and lightly coating.  The taste starts sweetly fruity - white grapes, more sultanas - then becomes sea-salty and savoury, before finishing hot and peppery. As the sweet waves of flavour roll out across the palate, they break over a hint of that Talisker trademark, hot chilli spice, and some scented smoke. There's great balance and vigour throughout. Adding water may tame the fire a little, but the lion remains wild at heart.
Finish: Long and warming, with a late, great tongue-tingling nuttiness in the embers as the fire slips down, and a last smoky trace of snuffed candle
Nose: Mild and rich, with light nose prickle. The sweet fruitiness of sultanas and pears in syrup, then orange peel, framed in oiled sandalwood, with a salty suggestion of seaweed or sea air in the middle, on a base of faintly smoky raw sugar. Water brings up a buttery note of short crust pastry and a waxy hint.

Name: Amrut Peated Port Pipe (cask 2713)
Palate: Roasted apricot, juicy peach, cut grass, dry earthy smoke and cinnamon.
Finish: Tobacco, meaty malt and raspberries.
Nose: Blackcurrant, liquorice, cigar box, burnt oak and a touch of chocolate.

Name: Bladnoch 26 Year Old 1990 - Sansibar
Palate: Lighter than the nose suggests, with plenty of tropical fruit notes showing up alongside vanilla and mint.
Finish: A touch of black pepper and caraway.
Nose: Flamed orange peel and toasted brioche. A whiff of olive oil, too.

Name: The King of Scots Blend (Douglas Laing) (1L)
Palate: Orange boiled sweeties, melon and brown sugar.
Finish: Cracked black pepper, toffee and lemon.
Nose: Vanilla latte, chewy caramels and a hint of fruity malt.

Name: Kilkerran Heavily Peated Batch No.4
Palate: Sea spray salinity runs all the way through it, joined by waves of brown sugar, caraway, and oak.
Finish: Lots of dry smoke notes stick around on the finish.
Nose: Scorched malt, heather honey, bonfire smoke with accompanying toasted marshmallow.

Name: Glen Moray 27 Year Old (Chorlton Whisky)
Palate: Fresh malt, cherry pie and candied ginger, toasted nuts and stone fruit.
Finish: Clean, zesty citrus and peppery oak.
Nose: Super zesty, with grapefruit peel, orange blossom, cut grass and earthy malt.

Name: Lindores Abbey MCDXCIV Commemorative First Release
Palate: The delivery is viscous, arriving somewhere pleasant between creamy and oily. The 46% ABV gives this an enjoyable heft and presence. Aromatic spice from nutmeg and clove, as well as some freshly cracked black pepper, cuts through some of that creamy caramel and vanilla combinations that carry over from the nose and balance nicely with darker fruits and some cooked apple. Youth and wine casks bring some occasional spikiness that needs some development, but thereâs enough personality and composure here for them to give way for notes of marzipan, pears poached in red wine, chocolate digestives, burnt orange rind, and jam.
Finish: Medium in length with a pang of drying bitter oak, some syrupy anise, peppermint, and a lingering reminder of the plump orchard fruits and dairy cream that comprises the new makeâs character.
Nose: A malty and crisp nose opens with sherried spice, soft toffee pennies, hazelnut, and condensed milk. As it develops aromas appear that make me think I was standing by a bakery door in an orchard, with puff pastry, vanilla, Granny Smith apples, Conference pears, fresh dough, and buttercream. Figs, plums, and blueberries bring more fruitiness to the core of the nose with some orange rind, foam bananas, and dried cranberries also present for good measure. Light floral and herbal notes waft away throughout alongside a helping of posh dark chocolate, salty porridge, and pipe tobacco adding some intriguing depth.

Name: Yoichi Apple Brandy Cask Finish
Palate: Fine, complex. It is remarkably fruity (candied apple and pear) with a slight peatiness. Mid-palate, aromatic herbs (lemon balm and chervil), lamb's lettuce, and watercress. Walnuts and apples bring home the oily and luscious character.
Finish: Long, well-rounded and balanced with notes of liquorice and vanilla, grapefruit and hints of twigs and straw. Dried fruits (almond, hazelnut and date) and toasted bread flavours. The empty glass is a subtle blend of ripe apple, peat and hay.
Nose: Rich, deep. First, notes of apples that have just been taken out of the oven. The peatiness then takes over, alternating between dry and oily.

Name: The Macallan 15 Year Old Triple Cask
Palate: Quince, salted butter, poached pear, a hint of cigar box.
Finish: Lasting cinnamon and raisin, with a touch of lemon.
Nose: Citrus blossom, hot chocolate, cardamom seed, treacle.

Name: Kilchoman Madeira Cask Matured 2021 Release
Palate: A burst of juicy orange notes, paired with savoury peat and a dusting of dark chocolate shavings.
Finish: Fruitcake, raspberry jam, toasted oak.
Nose: Cinnamon, fresh ginger, cooked apple, earthy smoke with a crackle of bonfire ember.

Name: Benromach Contrasts Peat Smoke Sherry Cask
Palate: Honeycomb and cocoa, laced with stewed red berries and sweet vanilla, leading to spice notes of black pepper and toasted almonds.
Finish: Full and rich with a smoky sweetness and morello cherry finish.
Nose: Cinnamon and ginger aromas with rich dark chocolate and brown sugar, balanced by notes of orange peel and smoke.

Name: Balvenie 50 Year Old - Marriage 0614
Palate: Rich and lush with some bitter chocolate. Intensely spicy, there is a maple syrup sweetness, hints of honey and well integrated oak tannins.
Finish: Rich and mouth coating with those sweet and oaky spiced notes.
Nose: Deep dark spices, rich fruit cake, lots of elegant oak notes, followed by sweeter aromas of dried fruits, raisins and sultanas ending on a ginger spiciness.

Name: Four Roses Elliott's Select 2016
Palate: Elegantly-balanced flavours of spiced vanilla, fresh nutmeg and delicate, ripe fruits greet the palate.
Finish: Sweet flavours of honey and light apricot linger in the finish.
Nose: Introduces subtle aromas of peach jam, magnolia blossoms and light oak.

Name: Benromach 2011 (bottled 2019) - UK Exclusive
Palate: Dates and Pink Lady apple, with aromatic bonfire smoke surrounding cinnamon and fresh grassy notes.
Finish: Barley sugar and white pepper, with cooked red fruit.
Nose: Toffee apple and autumn fruit crumble, with lots of baking spice mixed in there too.

Name: Springbank 25 Year Old (2019 Release)
Palate: Maturity and complexity at its best. A perfect balance of sherry and rum casks married in harmony. As it breathes; cured meat notes with a presence of tropical fruits and muscat wine.
Finish: Oh, yes, itâs definitely a true Springbank with coastal and earthy/musty dunnage warehouse notes, with sugary molasses in the finish.
Nose: Initially parma violets and rhubarb. Barbecued meats and sugar cane molasses follow alongside tropical fruits and oloroso sherry notes.

Name: Bladnoch 19 Year Old (2021 Release)
Palate: Raisin, liquorice, more citrus, mature oak, nutmeg, and roasted almonds.
Finish: Cassia and cinnamon, with a hint of dried fruit.
Nose: Anise, candied pineapple, ginger snaps, orange peel, dates.

Name: Glen Elgin 12 Year Old - Chorlton Whisky
Palate: Waxy peels and crunchy biscuits, with a dusting of brown sugar and nutmeg.
Finish: Oily nuts and butterscotch lasts.
Nose: Soft caramel and sponge cake, with some pear and apple sneaking in underneath.

Name: Linkwood 10 Year Old (House of Glenroy)
Palate: Zesty citrus hits the palate, with underlying hints of cut grass to balance sweet honey and candied nuts.
Finish: Vegetal undertones still linger, with plenty of sweet caramel and creamy oak to keep things balanced.
Nose: Vanilla caramel, stewed apple, and rich oak start things off, with hints of juicy sultanas and buttery fudge.

Name: Mannochmore 12 Year Old 2007 (Chorlton Whisky)
Palate: Cinnamon and oak spice, milk chocolate and more vanilla, alongside a peppery hint.
Finish: Old leather and buttery pastry, with more spice coming through.
Nose: Spiced apple crumble with custard, buttery oak and lemon curd.

Name: Balmenach 16 Year Old - Forgotten Gems
Palate: More bright citrus, now in the shape of lime and grapefruit. Oaky spices begin to develop later on, with a kick of peppery rye too.
Finish: Juicy barley, another crackle of peppercorn heat, a final touch of citrus peels.
Nose: Brilliantly fragrant and floral, with vanilla blossom, grassy meadows in spring, and zesty citrus oils all waft up from the glass.

Name: Crabbie 15 Year Old
Palate: Charred citrus, salted dark chocolate and savoury peat smoke.
Finish: Pain au chocolat and a flinty note, wrapped up with an aromatic smokiness.
Nose: Pink grapefruit and a sea breeze, with burnt caramel and a wisp of smoke.

Name: Glenlossie 27 Year Old 1992 - Chorlton Whisky
Palate: Honeyed cereals, toasted cinnamon, crunchy brown sugar and a slowly building hint of hickory.
Finish: Almond, cherry and the return of the fresh orange notes from the nose.
Nose: Fragrant citrus peels and dried petals, balanced by nutty brown bread with butter.

Name: GlenAllachie 21 Year Old - Batch 1
Palate: Classic sherried notes of Christmas cake, leading into more chocolate, spiced autumn fruit and candied peels.
Finish: Butterscotch lingers with gingersnap biscuits.
Nose: Spiced dark chocolate, with roasted coffee bean, flamed orange peel and cinnamon sugar.

Name: Glen Moray 10 Year Old (Chorlton Whisky)
Palate: More fresh orchard fruits, gently sweet with a touch of dried apple and baking spices, ripe banana, cornflakes and vanilla custard.
Finish: A touch of butterscotch appears, with lemon sweeties and oak spice.
Nose: Oodles of apples, pears, green melon and peaches, with fresh spring-like aromas and buttery shortbread biscuits.

Name: Springbank 21 Year Old (2019 Release)
Palate: Salted caramel, dark chocolate, honey-glazed ham, stem ginger, a hint of orange peel and another helping of jammy red berries.
Finish: Green olive, fresh citrus, vanilla pod and caraway.
Nose: The Port cask notes really come to the fore on the nose - you've got raspberry, blackberry and plum, with a hint of savoury oak developing in the background.

Name: Talisker 44 Year Old - Forests of the Deep
Palate: A big, wonderfully oil-smooth texture and a mouth-watering umami-rich taste, as waves of smoky-sweet rich intensity meet the full force of the sea mid-palate. The effect becomes savoury and lightly drying as a delicious peppery warmth surges forward to embrace these smooth, rich flavours of the deep. A drop of water softens the feel and brings a sweeter taste, with only a pinch of salt, but with the spice still, now as Szechuan pepper.
Finish: Really long, as a sweet chilli-pepper warmth suffuses the palate. Fragrant smoke and sweetness linger in the aftertaste.
Nose: Mellow overall, with a light peppery prickle at first. Deep, dense and complex. The top notes speak of wood wreathed in fragrant smoke and rich maritime hints of ships and the sea, as enticing traces of seaweed, salt crystals and warm sand mingle with sweeter hints of rich toffee. Beneath these scents lie intriguing deeper layers of aroma; hints of canvas, iodine-rich sea air and a distant beach bonfire, the smokiness emphasised by a dash of water.

Name: The XL Blend - Batch 1
Palate: Viscous, yet delicate, the palate is filled a litany of jammy black fruits, heathery smoke, caramel and oily nuttiness. Rose water adds a floral dimension before a darker, earthier depth reveals dried fruit, bitter chocolate, liquefied liquorice and subtle woody tannins.
Finish: Drying and bittersweet with sugary espresso, tart blackberries and aromatic nutmeg.
Nose: A gentle and complex nose begins with green apples, medium-cut marmalade and peach and raspberry cobbler. Earthy vanilla pod, thick white bloomer bread and fragrant smoke develop among a little dusty oak and damp old library books. Spiced honey and dark berry fruits emerge with time.

Name: Springbank 22 Year Old - Forgotten Gems
Palate: Thick toffee and fresh tropical fruit juiciness, with a hint of rubber in the background.
Finish: Full-bodied malt notes stick around, plus cinnamon and cocoa.
Nose: Dark chocolate mousse, brandied cherries, creamy vanilla and a touch of toasted oat.

Name: Tomatin 36 Year Old - Batch 6
Palate: Once on the palate, however, it is noticeably less sweet with more wood and malt influences coming through. You may pick up on some hints of clove and cardamom.
Finish: The finish is elegantly smooth and creamy, with just a touch of spice.
Nose: Charmingly sweet on the nose, with aromas of butterscotch, pear drops and rich notes from the Oloroso sherry butts.

Name: Loch Lomond The Open 2021 Special Edition
Palate: Woody vanilla pod, nectarine, and bursts of white grape, bolstered by fragrant smokiness.
Finish: A smoky, oaky finish, with a drizzle of golden syrup alongside green apple.
Nose: Crisp pear, honey, and building wood spice, with a suggestion of smoke.

Name: The Glenturret 15 Year Old (2021 Release)
Palate: Light notes of tinned peaches and vanilla cream cakes ride upon deeper diced, spiced fruit, and dark chocolate.
Finish: Warming oak spice, peppery with a touch of cinnamon, baked apple and crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e.
Nose: Sweet caramelised apples, wafts of tinned pineapple, and banana bread.

Name: Littlemill 40 Year Old Celestial Edition
Palate: Opens with mouth-watering fruits, crisp green apple and fresh pineapple with grapefruit and lime citrus then richer dried fruits of sultana and raisins before vanilla toffee gives sweetness to the mid-palate.
Finish: Long with layers of fruit and spice. Green fruits continue into the finish with gooseberry and kiwi before waves of warming cinnamon and clove spice.
Nose: Floral bursts of honeysuckle and elderflower, early summer hedgerow, with delicate honey sweetness and elegant oak spice of cinnamon and nutmeg.

Name: Port Charlotte Islay Barley 2012
Palate: Cedar, vanilla tablet, a juicy hint of raspberry again, slowly building peat smoke and black pepper.
Finish: Subtle salty sea breeze lingers.
Nose: Toasted coconut, baked earth, a little seaweed, raspberry ice cream.

Name: The SÃ¤ndebud 6 Year Old
Palate: Melted butter, rye bread, peanut brittle.
Finish: Subtly earthy and spicy, mellowed by fruity elements...
Nose: Raisins, meaty smoke, a whiff of caramel simmering in a pan.

Name: Langatun 10 Year Old - 2nd Edition
Palate: A crackle of oaky spice develops on the palate, mellowed by more dried fruit and chocolatey sweetness.
Finish: Cinnamon, sherry-soaked fruit cake, walnut, and waxy peels.
Nose: Fig and sultana, subtly chocolatey at points, plus helpings of earthy barley for balance.

Name: Strathmill 12 Year Old - Forgotten Gems
Palate: Apricot and peach sweetness arrive, joined by more vanilla and a touch of liquorice root.
Finish: Very subtly savoury with thyme and cedar.
Nose: Wonderfully malty, with drizzled of caramel and chocolate sauce.

Name: Orkney & Speyside - Double Barrel (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Dry oak, crumbly fudge, blueberry pancakes slathered in salted butter.
Finish: Continued buttery richness.
Nose: Salt and pepper crisps, treacle tart and a little whiff of orange blossom.

Name: Springbank 25 Year Old - Forgotten Gems
Palate: Charred oak and burnt ends, balanced by more dark fruits and a hint of coffee.
Finish: Slightly earthy on the finish, with sweet smoke lingering.
Nose: Honey-glazed ham, blackberry compote, chocolate digestives.

Name: Highland Park 17 Year Old - The Light
Palate: Tangy mango, pear drops, vanilla-rich malt, a subtle hint of smoke (but not much!), pink peppercorn.
Finish: Resinous oak and waxy peels, with a touch of forest floor earthiness.
Nose: Vibrant citrus notes up front, before a wave of green apple and sawdust notes arrive.

Name: Nectar Grove Batch Strength (Wemyss Malts)
Palate: Golden syrup, citrus peels and brown sugar, with oily nuts and strawberry.
Finish: A jammy finish with more of that brown sugar.
Nose: Peaches and cream, runny honey and cigar box, with sweet cinnamon and red fruits.

Name: Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old 2002 - Chorlton Whisky
Palate: Toasted brioche, tangy clementine, dried fruit and pink peppercorn.
Finish: Peanut brittle, shortbread and chocolate.
Nose: Orange peel and nougat, with a little whiff of mocha in there for good measure.

Name: The Glenlivet 12 Year Old First Fill
Palate: Peach and apricot continue with buttery vanilla fudge and vibrant fruit alongside a touch of citrus and tangy oak char.
Finish: Gently spicy malt builds with toasted oak spice, but the fruit lingers with a light caramel sweetness.
Nose: Heaps of fresh orchard fruits, floral apples, apricots, blossom, and vanilla.

Name: Bladnoch 10 Year Old
Palate: Waxy orange and chocolate chip cookie, with hints of clove and pepper underneath.
Finish: Ginger snaps and cinnamon rolls.
Nose: Toasted barley, honey, a hint of fennel.

Name: Ardbeg & Inchgower - Double Barrel (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Continued smoke and sea air, though coking spices start to come through more on the mid-palate.
Finish: Smoky and rich.
Nose: BBQ char takes centre stage here (you can easily tell there's Islay malts in here), with a touch of creamy vanilla.

Name: Benromach Peat Smoke 2008 (bottled 2018)
Palate: Citrus rinds bring a tart sharpness to smoked cheeses and ham, as a little red berry sweetness tames the thick ashy backdrop.
Finish: A little menthol thyme grows with confidence.
Nose: Rainwater on a bonfire begins an elegant but powerful nose. Rich peaty notes waft throughout as perfumed fruits and wood shavings linger.

Name: Dalmore 25 Year Old (2015 Release)
Palate: Citrus, sherry soaked raisins and luxury chocolate truffles.
Finish: Demerara sugar and bitter dark chocolate.
Nose: Vanilla pods and soft fig cake and orange peel.

Name: Old Perth Sherry Cask Blended Malt
Palate: Buttery. Brown sugar and chewy raisin, chocolate notes grow enjoyably bitter.
Finish: Medium length, with a spicy kick of ground clove. Hint of fresh berries give a sweet balance.
Nose: Brandy-soaked Christmas cake, milk chocolate and a touch of toasted barley.

Name: Dalmore 15 Year Old - Vintage 2001
Palate: Caramelised peaches, freshly baked bread and morello cherries.
Finish: Turkish delight, figs and coffee.
Nose: Exotic spices, cinnamon, raisins and tangerines dipped in chocolate.

Name: Mannochmore 28 Year Old 1988 (The Whisky Agency)
Palate: Gooseberry and green apple. Almost peppery at points with cedar and ginger.
Finish: Quite long and juicy with more fresh fruit.
Nose: Waxy orange and tart grapes, with a touch of spun sugar-topped profiteroles.

Name: The Glenlivet NÃ durra Peated Whisky Cask Finish
Palate: Peat & Pear Drops!
Finish: Creaminess and earthy peat combine for a chocolatey finish, both pleasantly bitter cocoa and creamy Cadbury's hot chocolate with hints of fruitiness still.
Nose: Tangy and 'fizzy', old fashioned lemonade and hints of Orangina or Buck's Fizz even. There's gooseberry and a touch of coconut and foam banana. Raspberry and rhubarb develop. The peat comes through as nutty malted barley.

Name: Longmorn 2002 (bottled 2016) - Gordon & MacPhail
Palate: Spicy at first with notes of white pepper and chilli powder, before the sweetness of Oloroso starts to pick up speed once again.
Finish: Lingering waxy orange peels and poached pear.
Nose: Creamy vanilla leading into milk chocolate and juicy sultanas.

Name: Yula 20 Year Old (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Thick with treacle and Werther's Originals by the fireplace. Soot, but also notes of sweet spice and some from the harbour too.
Finish: Sweet smoke, brisket, a touch of heather.
Nose: A barley field on the coast, light, fragrant, salinity in the air. Hints of richer and smokier things to come. Inviting.

Name: The Glenlivet NÃ durra Oloroso Batch OL0615
Palate: Red apples and dark chocolate in equal measures, with a hint of citrus and herbaceous liquorice.
Finish: Sherried spices become more pronounced on the finish.
Nose: Chocolate chips, crushed nuts and a generous handful of raisins (sounds a bit like a recipe for cookies). A very subtle whiff of smoke...

Name: The Glenlivet NÃ durra Oloroso Batch OL0816
Palate: Liquorice root, oodles of dried fruit and another touch of oak-y smoke. Sherried orange peels.
Finish: Clove and Christmas cake.
Nose: Chocolate ice cream, oily malt, warming spice and touches of charred oak. Apple and blackcurrant juice.

Name: Strathisla 2006 (bottled 2017) - Gordon & MacPhail
Palate: A prickle of spicy ginger as it opens, but waves of soft Sherry and sweet orange soon balance it.
Finish: Quite nutty and sweet.
Nose: Milk chocolate digestives, rose and green apple.

Name: Glenfarclas 1996 (bottled 2017) Premium Edition
Palate: Fruitcake topped with diced almonds, thick caramel and treacle, some rum-like spices, chocolate ice cream.
Finish: Brown sugar and shortbread with raisins.
Nose: Toast with chocolate spread, blackberry jam, a whisper of clove.

Name: Dalmore 20 Year Old - Vintage 1996
Palate: Gingerbread, damson plums and passion fruit.
Finish: Caramelised pineapple, Sanguinello blood oranges and marzipan.
Nose: Blackcurrants, rich coffee beans and praline chocolate.

Name: Strathisla 2005 (bottled 2015) - Gordon & MacPhail
Palate: More vanilla (think extra thick double cream with a dusting of sugar), and orchard fruit.
Finish: Oranges and apples.
Nose: Creamy and slightly floral vanilla. A touch of lemon zest.

Name: Balvenie 25 Year Old Triple Cask
Palate: Thick and spicy with vanilla custard, mixed peels, dates, thyme honey, orchard fruit and cocoa on the tail.
Finish: Sweet and spicy.
Nose: Honeyed malt, flamed orange peel, cinnamon, tobacco leaf, papaya and dried fruit.

Name: Kavalan Solist Pedro XimÃ©nez Cask
Palate: Juicy sultanas and plums, brown sugar, pineapple and another helping of chocolate-coated nuts.
Finish: Slightly herbaceous on the finish, though raisin sweetness persists.
Nose: Chocolate covered pecans, sugared orange peels and a subtle hint of oak spice.

Name: Dalmore 18 Year Old - Vintage 1998
Palate: Honeyed bananas, blueberries and grape.
Finish: Damson plums, dark treacle and Christstollen cake.
Nose: English marmalade, Satsuma plums, vanilla and blackcurrants.

Name: The Glenlivet NÃ durra Oloroso Batch OL0317
Palate: Chocolatey at first, though soon enough waves of oily malt and dried fruit take over.
Finish: Lingering warmth of Christmas spice.
Nose: Cinnamon, raisins and a touch of sawdust. Lighter notes of flaky pastry develop.

Name: Paul John Single Cask (cask #1906)
Palate: Sweet Nice biscuits, barley sugar and cocoa.
Finish: More sweet, crisp barley sugar, followed by drying chocolatey oak.
Nose: Lime peel, orange blossom, oak and barley.

Name: Tomatin Cask Strength Edition (Old Bottling)
Palate: Crystallised ginger, green apple and a touch of salty sea air. Sweet chocolate and cooking spices, growing intense on the mid-palate.
Finish: Lasting notes of vanilla pod and crumbly fudge.
Nose: Opens with home-made ice-cream drizzled with caramel and crushed walnuts, then moves on to Seville orange, red berries and black pepper.

Name: Johnnie Walker XR 21 Year Old
Palate: Herbal as it opens. This gives way to orange and lemon peels by the bucket-load, followed by another kick of smoky malt.
Finish: Wafts of Sherry-soaked raisins last and last.
Nose: Spiced apple, smoky oak and a little toasted brioche.

Name: The GlenDronach 8 Year Old The Hielan'
Palate: More spice comes through on the palate, but the vanilla-rich buttery elements remain up front. Freshly baked biscuits topped with almonds and plump sultanas.
Finish: Quite long, with Sherried fruit and ginger lasting.
Nose: Honey'd malt, vanilla fudge and citrus peels. Slightly chocolate-y raisin notes and a little cinnamon.

Name: Benriach 22 Year Old Dunder - Peated
Palate: A rich delivery brings notes of barbecued pineapple and dried apricots, which blend with caramel shortbread, vanilla marzipan and rum spices. Grassy wood smoke lingers throughout.
Finish: Crystallised brown sugar and a surprising note of light coconut fade.
Nose: Sweet barley and earthy peat marry with banoffee pie, sweet cereals and sprinkles of ginger for a delightfully full nose.

Name: Yula 22 Year Old (Douglas Laing)
Palate: Palatewise, anticipate a complex mix of sweet peat, pepper, coal dust, oak wood smoke and a late-on-the-palate chocolatey sweetness.
Finish: The long subtle finish initially reflects that dulcet, barley quality but still shows a warmingly spiced, tarred and sooted style.
Nose: Catch a gentle oceanic salt and ozone clean zephyr as the nose opens â with its later tobacco and leather style.

Name: Arran Machrie Moor Peated - Batch 8
Palate: Spun sugar, earthy malt with a hint of oat, recognisable Arran fruitiness.
Finish: Lingering hints of smoke and guava.
Nose: Toasted vanilla pod, petrichor, lightly fried banana.

Name: Scapa 2005 (bottled 2017) - Gordon & MacPhail
Palate: Juicy mango and clementine, a prickle of black pepper spice, barrel char.
Finish: Soft and chocolatey on the finish.
Nose: New leather and a whiff of smoke. Freshly cut grass and sweet vanilla pod.

Name: Benromach 10 Year Old Gift Set
Palate: Barley, slightly herbal, a little fruit, grassy. Big on malt, ground ginger.
Finish: Mouthwateringly bittersweet. Ginger, dry sherry, almost hoppy after a while.
Nose: Dry, barley, big on malt and oak. Dry pine, fruity. A tad spirity. Sweet spices after a time and a hint of puckering prune from the sherry cask and maple fudge.

Name: Balblair 2004 Bourbon Matured - 1st Release
Palate: Quite nutty and sweet, though creamy vanilla and oak keep it grounded.
Finish: Citrus and waxy oak.
Nose: Juicy blood orange, crushed almonds, brown sugar.

Name: Glenfarclas 2000 (bottled 2015) Premium Edition
Palate: Juicy raisins and dates, Toffee Crisp bars, a pinch of tobacco leaf.
Finish: Lingering orange oil freshness.
Nose: Brandied cherries, oatcakes with mango chutney, a scoop of raspberry ripple ice cream.

Name: Kilchoman 100% Islay - 7th Edition
Palate: Honey'd and sweet at first, though notes of smoked barley blossoms soon after. A kick of cooking spice on the mid-palate.
Finish: Drying cacao joined by salted butter melting on crumpets.
Nose: Banana fritters with floral notes developing underneath. Toasted sugar and a hint of malty chocolate.

Name: Rock Oyster 18 Year Old
Palate: A good balance of peat richness and vanilla-forward sweetness. Subtle minerality.
Finish: A burst of heather honey appears late on the finish.
Nose: Full-bodied coastal smoke, with hints of sugared peels and peppery oak underneath.

Name: Langatun Old Bear Smoky (40%)
Palate: Peat becomes earthy/leafy on the palate, and is joined by red wine juiciness and a hint of white pepper.
Finish: A long finish of sweet smoke.
Nose: Robust malt arrives first on the nose, followed by a light whiff of medicinal peat.

Name: The Girvan Patent Still No.4 Apps
Palate: Candied citrus peels, icing sugar, vanilla and a hint of oak spice. Foam bananas and a little honey.
Finish: Short and sweet with a peppery hint near the end.
Nose: Vanilla, light orchard fruits, bubblegum and cherry lips.

Name: Hellyers Road 12 Year Old 2004
Palate: Cedar spices right at the fore, with yellow plum and apricot giving it some sweetness.
Finish: A hint of white wine sharpness, mellowed by rich vanilla and toasty peat.
Nose: Big notes of fresh orchard fruits arrive first, shortly followed by just a whisper of earthy smoke.

Name: Mortlach 1954 - Rare Vintage (Gordon and MacPhail)
Palate: Pineapple cubes, pear drops, raisins and some peppery oak notes.
Finish: A drying, medium length finish.
Nose: Sweet sherry notes appear right at the start, followed by peppermint and a subtle beeswax aroma.

Name: Glenallachie 8 Year Old 2008 (Whisky Galore)
Palate: Brown sugar begins to take shape on the palate. A good whack of cinnamon, too. Still packed with bright fruit notes.
Finish: Pear drops and sherbet lemons.
Nose: Fizzy lemon and vibrant gooseberry, with a hint of grist in the background.
